description:
Amazing Mexican tacos is what you will find here. I highly recommend the fish tacos. Those were hands down my favorites. The chips tasted great with the green salsa and avocado. 

One thing I noticed about the Golden City was the little amount of space a restaurant have. I really liked the huge amount of space they have here, which means no wait time or waiting list. A bonus in my book.
author: Sheila P.

description:
Went here with some friends.

Ambiance -- it's a tiny place, way too dark, and can get very loud. C-

Service -- excellent! Absolutely A+. Then again, we had to pay a surcharge for their wages/health care, so it better be! A+

Food -- average at best. In fact, I'd say slightly below par. Across the board. And all 6 of us agreed. Even worse, it was tremendously overpriced. An average of $85/couple for an ok amount of food and a couple of drinks? Awful. Diabla Shrimp was meh. Carne Asada tacos were barely ok -- the same as the typical $2 tacos you get at any decent taqueria -- literally a bunch of carne asada, onions and cilantro on a street taco size tortilla. Chips were blah. Salsa was awful (never had a more flavorless salsa). Guac was good though. F (factoring in crazy prices for what you get)

While I almost always give places that have great service a second chance, I don't think I would ever come back to this place. It came highly recommended, and I was highly disappointed (as were the rest of us).
author: Benny L.

description:
This place is a bit hard to find in the dark - there really isn't that much signage at all.  I was meandering up and down the street a bit, being a tourist and all, and finally found it.  The inside smells wonderful.  It made me so hungry as I walked in.

Whatever you do, you must order the 22oz pork chop.  It was tender and smokey and juicy and everything you could ever imagine in a pork chop.  I'm not usually a pork chop fan but I think I may have been able to eat that whole thing on my own.  

The mussels were perfect.  I could've drank that broth like soup.  I wanted more pieces of bread to absorb all the deliciousness that was in the broth.  

The mexican fried chicken was okay.  It's hard to follow the pork chop and mussels.  The pork tamales were a bit of a disappointment to me, but the rest of my party enjoyed it.  I also tried the pesado, carnitas and carne asada tacos.  The pesado were my favourite but almost too spicy for me.

The sangria was pretty good but fairly light - it was like drinking juice.

I need to go back for the pork chop and mussels.  YUM.
author: Bernice L.

description:
Bottomless mimosas at $21 to start you day! The staff are friendly and will always be there for you when your drink runs out.

Visiting sf for the weekend and had a great time with friends over brunch. Don Pistos is lively with family, friends and even birthdays going on at this hour.

I also had the chorizo and baked eggs, which was good and went well with the mimosas. Overall, really enjoyed the vibe and time with friends!
author: Ashley L.

description: Excellent food and service. This restaurant offers hipster style atmosphere with California-Mexican food. Be aware that it's noisy but would be good for groups of people. Not recommended for families with small children. The salsa was delicious, fresh with hint of spice. You gotta try the seafood ceviche- full of shrimp with fresh slices of oranges and lime! It's not on the menu so you have to ask them for their daily specials in order to get it. I ordered carne asada tacos which was perfectly seasoned and cooked but the salsa on top was a bit spicy just be aware.. we also got carne asada taco Sonora which is basically a deliciously cheesy open faced burrito. The tortilla was fresh and beans and potatoes were delicious. They also offer a nice selection of breakfast burritos and bottomless drink brunch that I'll definitely have to check out next time I'm in town.
author: Parisa M.

description:
Friend was visiting and decided to book couple of brunches to hang out and have some good bottomless drinks. After a few recommendations from friends, decided to go with this place.

Made a reservation for 11am, but after having a long night the day before, called that morning of the reservation to change it to 12pm and they were very nice about it and changed it without many questions.

Brunch was amazing, the menu is small so it's easier to choose from. We all got bottomless drinks, which the mimosa of the day was Strawberry. Our cups were never empty. The mimosa was so good, we never got to try the Sangria, and not really huge into beer.

The fresh salsa was really refreshing, and tasted very fresh and well made. We got a few Guacamoles to start with. Chips are crisp and thick, which is good, and also good amount of salt.

I decided on the Taco Sonora with Carne Asada. The carne asada was so tender and good. The flour tortillas was also very good. Good plate to absorb some of the sugar from the mimosas.

Highly recommend this place if you're looking for a good bottomless brunch in SF.
author: Carlos P.

description:
Food here is amazing and the atmosphere is super cute. It's a great spot for brunch on the weekends and while the space isnt huge it can accommodate groups i would just make a reservation!

Came on a Sunday at 11 and beat the crowd, it started filling up shortly after. Staff is super friendly however not super attentive. We all ordered bottomless but saw the bottoms of our glasses after almost every drink and sometimes had to flag down the servers after 10 minutes or so. That being said, they were more lenient with the time restraint ($21 for 90mins) because of this so not too upsetting.

Again food was great and no one was disappointed with the food. I highly recommended the taco Sonora with is a huge open face taco! Again it's very big so dont be put off by the fact it's just one, I could only eat half. They are very accommodating and let me sub scrambled eggs for meat.

Also the squash quesadilla was great but it is also served open with little cheese so definitely not your typical quesadilla as an FYI.

Overall I would definitely return!
author: Rachel K.

description: One of the best bottomless brunch places in the city with quality drinks and quality food. Don Pistos mixes it up with strawberry mimosas as opposed to the standard orange. I got the tamale and it tasted very good. The portion was perfect for me, but I could see it being small for others. Staff was attentive and did not rush us out of the restaurant. Looking forward to coming back!
author: Sara S.

description: Update- so sad! They don't have the spicy tuna tacos anymore. They replaced it with Hamachi but I had it tonight and it tasted rotten! it was so dark in the restaurant so I couldn't see, ate it and hope i don't get food poisoning! The carne asada tacos are still good but sad for my fav item on the menu being gone. Probably will visit less often now.
author: Mariam P.

description:
Seriously one of my absolute favorite brunches in the city, I don't know if its the Bottomless Mimosas or the phenomenal spicy serrano salsa that they bring out upon getting seated.  The menu is just remarkable as well.

Sometimes if you are lucky, you can get the special which they only have on occasion for dinner and it is sooo good and an amazing value.  It comes with meat in a crock pot type thing with veggies and toppings etc and tortillas. If this is being offered, it is a must order and can be easily shared with 2-3 people or enjoyed alone. 

I also recommend the sashimi and the soup, they are both fantastic. The ambiance cannot be beat, and it is great for large events as they have private seating downstaris.
author: Ellie J.

description: I was very pleased with the quality of the food. Although it isn't technically "authentic" these fellows have managed to to deliver some quality very tasty food and drinks. We had the huevos rancheros dish; very good, fresh and the potatoes were crunchy and very tasty. We also had tacos al pastor. Man, they were good! We also had micheladas and a margarita. This last classical margarita, was very tasty and well balanced; not tart at all. The service was on point. The server was courteous and attentive despite having to serve a table of about 20 people. Definitely  coming back.
author: Moy V.

description:
I casually wandered into this place in North Beach thinking I was going to get tacos. However, once I sat down, my server Luis, was nice enough to point out the house specialties and make some enticing recommendations of his own.   

With no wait and no reservations, I was set up at the only window seat in the restaurant. It had plenty of natural light and a great view of the street to people watch during my meal.

I ordered an Agave Margarita after Luis explained they didn't have a full liquor license, which meant it was made with wine. It was refreshing, but I would have much preferred Tequila or Mezcal. Hopefully this will change in the future.

I also ordered chips and guac- which was LEGIT. It had real chunks of avocado and was seasoned well. It was pretty filling.

Per Luis' recommendation, I got the house specialty- a 19oz Coleman Ranch Pork Chop. It was ON FLEEK! First of all, it was big enough to feed two people. It was cooked to perfection- just a little charred flavor on the outside, then super juicy and tender from the orange chile marinade. 
It was served over a bed of crunchy, spicy cucumber salad- which made it "lighter". Traditionally, I would have liked buttery, garlic mashed potatoes as my side... but then I wouldn't have been able to stand up or walk out of that place on my own. 

I didn't finish my pork chop or my guac so I asked Luis for a box to go. 
Then he not only boxed up my food in individual packages and an easy to carry bag, but he also thought to include a fresh bag of chips. So sweet!  
He also mentioned there was a second location, which has a slightly different menu, but has a full liquor license. It's actually Don Pisto's TEQUILA BAR! Needless to say, I will be paying them a visit soon!  

Buen Provecho!
author: Mitzi G.

description: We came here for the first time last night. I had the chicken dish and my husband had the carnitas tacos. We devoured the delicious guacamole. Both our dishes were very very good. It is not heavy Mexican cuisine. It's fresh and light and so flavorful. I can't wait to go back and try more dishes. Our waitress last night was pretty great too. Very cool vibe inside but cozy at the same time.
author: Lori R.

description:
My friends and I decided to hit Don Pisto's for dinner because we had tickets for a comedy club in walking distance, and what a great choice. First and foremost, I have to mention the amazingly fresh and crispy, homemade tortilla chips. I think they were the highlight of the visit for me. I feel like a lot of places skimp out on their chips, but it is very clear that these are house made (I could see them being fried in the kitchen) and to top things off, the service was amazing and they were generous with refilling our bowl of chips. The salsa served with the chips also seemed fresh and was slightly spicy. 

It seemed as though tacos were one of the most popular items to order, so my friend and I decided to share pescado and carne asada tacos. This worked out perfectly because the tacos come in orders of two. The fish was slightly underwhelming to me because I felt as though the batter had gotten soggy, but I could still tell the ingredients were high quality. The carne asada meat was tender and well seasoned. I would recommend the place to friends in the area! And probably order some guac to pair with their great chips next time.
author: Tara N.

description:
Somehow got roped into a food eating contest between my coworker's here, which was convenient because we ended up sampling half the menu or so. The service was really good (waiter was pretty funny and kept a light, conversational tone) and even told us he thought we were ordering way too much food for three people). I'd caveat my review with the fact that I'm not really a Mexican food fan, and this was pretty alright.

Mexican sashimi: 3/5.

Coleman ranch pork chop: 4/5. I don't like pork chops normally bc they're overcooked and tough, but I would get this again.

Tacos: Decent. 3.5/5.

Guac: I remember this as being pretty tasty when I got it at the restaurant (chips were good too!) but when I got it through takeout another time it was really quite spicy. 4.5/5 at the restaurant, but just a 3/5 for takeout.
author: Nicole H.

description:
We were there with a group of 15.  Birthday party... they had a room downstairs that was kind of cool, reminded me of a big cave.
We had a preset menu that included guacamole, Ceviche mexicano, pollo 
Asado, carne asada and al pastor.
Everything was quite tasty.  (The vegetarians in the group weren't too happy though). A different option was to be offered that evening but it was more rice and beans on a tortilla. 
We did no host cocktails.....The bartender was busy upstairs but he did an awesome job!  This way it made it a lot easier for us to figure out the bill.
author: Anita V.

description:
You mean Don Pisto(ff!)

Four of us came here for a Sunday afternoon meal.  My hard wooden seat was sticky from the last party goer who sat in it. 

The guac was kinda the only amazing thing about this place!  The salsa was pretty good too.

You have to keep asking for tortilla chips all the time cause they give one tiny bowl for a table of four.  They should give an extra bowl for every additional two people.

I had the prawns.  The were slathered in so much arbol chile you couldn't taste anything but that.  You could have swapped out the prawns for anything else and it would have tasted the exact same.  

Had two sangria pitchers and for $28 each, it's not worth it.  I felt that its alcoholic content potential was held waaaaaay back.

The service was erratic and poor.  They even charged us for an extra pitcher accidentally.  

I am not coming back here ever, but I'm glad I tried it so I can cross this place off my list.  

If you decide to go here you may actually like it, and if you don't, you're not missing anything special imo.
author: John M.

description:
Taco Sonora:  THIS WAS SO GOOD.  If you like shrimp and you like creamy food items this is the entree for you.  The buttery oil from the sauteed shrimp made a nice glaze on the grilled tortilla and and the crema on top was the literal icing on the cake.  If I could give it 6/5 I would but that would ruin the scale - however I will venture that this is kind of a MUST ORDER.  Everyone in my group liked this dish the best.  5/5

Fish tacos:  A typical fish taco - I had a bite of my friend's dish and it was good, just not super inspired and a smaller serving/less flavorful than the taco sonora - so I would go with that if you are torn. 3.5/5

Guacamole:  Decent guacamole, a medium sized portion for the price and the avocado quality was excellent.  The complimentary chips and salsa were really good too - I just adore a good fresh salsa!  5/5

Bloody Mary:  Made with mezcal which is my FAVORITE.  It was good it adds a nice smoky addition to this favorite of my drinks.  However, as is often the case, it was a little watered down and not as thick or spicy as my favorite bloody marys. 4/5

We went here for brunch straight from hoppping off the boat after the Alcatraz boat tour.  It's an easy walk from the docks (like 10-15 min stroll) and we arrived at 2 pm on a Sunday.  The atmosphere was young and loud music was blaring (maybe just a teeny tiny bit too loud - since we had to shout at each other).  You sit at wooden benches alongside other eaters.  They pride themselves on their Bottomless Brunch cocktails - see below for their menu description (which came off a little douchey to me... especially since it begins by nagging then ends with "DRINK NOW")

BOTTOMLESS $21per person  Mix & Match mimosa, sangria, modelo, dos equis.  Your table & bottomless drinks are yours for 90 minutes -  Bottomless ends at 3pm (no matter what time or where you start)
chugging = ELSEWHERE
double fisting = NOPE
ordering food = A MUST
WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO SLOW YOUR ROLL
DRINK NOW. 

Didn't end up getting the bottomless - just a bucket of beers and cocktails to order. 

Overall it was the typical Mexican-American restaurant geared more toward the 20s and 30s crowd but it delivered what we expected so we were happy and full at the end.  That shrimp taco sonora... I can still taste it.  Would recommend as a good place to go after the Alcatraz tour since we waltzed in on a Sunday with no reservation and didn't have to wait.  Would come again :)
author: Ariana N.

description:
Do not opt for the Prefix Menu.  It's not worth your money.  The Prefix Menu is where you choose a menu for your group to share family style and most of the people in my group was pretty disappointed because there wasn't enough food.  The Prefix menu we chose was $40/pp and each person get chips with ceviche, a piece of wing, two tacos and a quarter of an hamburger.  And $40/pp with tax and the mandatory added gratuity became $55/pp because we had more than 12 people and this was just for the food alone, so it was expensive with the amount of little food each person received.  It was a horrible choice I chose, but it's not like I had an option because, "For groups of 12 or more, we do require you to pre order from our prefix menu to be served family style" :( 

Perhaps it'd be better if each person had ordered their own separate item off the regular menu

Service was up to par, staff was attentive, helpful and nice.  

Two bathrooms, 1 for male and the other 1 for female.  

I'd recommend their hamburger which is marinated in bacon and their Mexican ceviche.
author: Joy L.

description:
First and foremost thank you to their event coordinator Bailey Hill. I made last minute reservations for a party of 15 and they did a fantastic job. We had the Camarones and carnitas tacos and also their delicious french toast. I definitely love their sangria and mimosa option. 

Pricing was great and definitely coming back to this location or the one on Lombard street.

Thanks again guys!
author: Alex A.

description: Great mexican spot in North Beach! I have eaten here many times over the years. I also just did a catering order for an office event (about 60 people) and the food was jut as good as eating in the restaurant. Highly recommend for catered office lunches or even social events! Very affordable catering and everyone loved them.
author: Sarah R.

description:
I love Don Pisto's! I've tried just about everything on the menu and it is all very good. Fish tacos are my fav. They make them just right..very lightly fried fresh fish with just a hint of batter, piled high with cabbage salad, salsa, and crema. Their green salsa is so good I could drink it. And they have special, unique sauces, salsas, and accompaniments for each dish, so everything is properly thought out. 
The restaurant itself is loud with great music, and lively conversation which I happen to like. I don't feel like I'm on display and I can go out with friends AND our kids and we can have fun and it's no problem.
author: Gina F.

description: Amazing restaurant!! Fish tacos are heavenly. Margaritas are huge. Ceviche is delicious. Everything tastes fresh. Great neighborhood spot, fun vibes for dinner. Feels like a hidden gem.
author: Brigid M.

description: I have been there a handful of times.  Everything is wonderful especially the chips and guacamole and salsa.  Fast, helpful service in a great atmosphere.  Definitely recommend it.
author: Tim E.

description:
Don Pistos is my favorite restaurant in SF for fancy Mexican food. 

My friend told me that they have the best burger ($13 marinated in bacon and onion and topped with guacamole) in San Francisco but I havent tried it yet . . . because tacos. 

I like to visit a restaurant at least twice before I review it so I can get a better sense of the menu, service and overall vibe. My first visit was for dinner and second for brunch. 

Everything at Don Pistos is fresh. . . nothing ever frozen. There are two kitchens, one small one upstairs that is clearly visible from the bar and dining room. And one hidden downstairs where the prep work is done. Salsas and all sauces are made from scratch. Tortillas made in house. And the best local meat and fish. . . YOU CAN TASTE IT.

DINNER:

Guacamole ($8) As fresh as it gets

Tortilla Soup for 2 ($14) This was a meal in itself, delicious, hearty and had HUGE pieces of avocado. Will definitely revisit. 

Carne Asada Tacos ($12) The angus steak and arbol salsa was perfectly balanced and huge portion of meat. 

Pescado Tacos ($13) Market fish baja style with cabbage and white sauce (too much sour cream). 

Enchiladas ($16 + $4 for meat) Beans, wild mushrooms, cheese, and added chicken SO MUCH FOOD. . . why did I order this?!?!  The complimentary chips and salsa, soup and tacos are more than enough. 

BRUNCH:

Fresh Young Coconut ($6) Our bartender struggled to poke a hole into the coconut for the straw. . . it was quite entertaining and delicious. WAAAAAY better than the prepackaged carton coconut water. 

Pineapple Agua Fresca ($4) Fancy juice, not too sweet or acidic at all, I noticed the staff using this juice for the mimosas. 

Huevos Rancheros ($13) Crispy tortillas, beans, eggs (I requested poached instead of sunny side up), pico de gallo, pappas (potatoes), queso fresco.  The dish was perfect when I slathered the dish with the green table salsa. . . spicy and acidic. I ordered this because I saw it plated and it was beautiful . . + potatoes! 

My mom ordered Camarones Tacos ($13) Two sauteed shrimp tacos with garlic, red onion, and avocado salsa. . . I was so satisfied with my dish, I didnt even bother trying hers (and she didnt offer). 

We decided to pass on the $21 BOTTOMLESS BRUNCH BEVERAGE option. Heres how it works. . .

* You are required to order food with this option
* You can mix and match between sangria, margaritas, and mimosas.
* Your table and bottomless drinks are yours for 90 minutes (and service ends at 3 pm)

In my opinion, sitting at the bar would be your best bet for getting the best service. . . At brunch we sat at the bar and our bartender was super attentive. During my last visit when I sat in the regular dining room, I was flagging down the staff for waters, chips, etc. . . Don't be in a rush and come here. 

Two dudes sat next to us at the bar. . . one ordered the breakfast burrito (HUGE) and the other the open faced taco sonora with steak (TONS OF MEAT). . . they inhaled their food. Both dishes looked amazing. Im definitely going back for brunch. 

The restaurant is unmarked, is two levels and is on the smaller side. However, they do have a large dining room downstairs across from the bathrooms for private parties. 

We walked from the restaurant to Coit Tower which is right up the street. It was the perfect way to burn some calories after a delicious brunch.
author: Leah E.

description:
Always good I've never been disappointed here! This may be my favorite restaurant anywhere! We've been coming here for about 5 years every time we visits SF this is what I think of! Chips are the best! I think everything is very well priced for the quality and the portion size! 

The pork chop is massive and very well seasoned 
Tacos flavorful
Ribs have a lot of flavor and just enough spice
Al pastor is very good 
Tortilla soup is filling and good flavor! 

I've had everything here and everything has good flavor. We are very picky about our food and Don Pisto's is the winner!
author: Nick N Parker S.

description:
The pescado taco is the best here. carne asada is also decent. Don't expect super authentic TJ style street tacos but for SF, these will do.

The drinks are decently priced but some dishes are quite pricey. ($3 oysters! what?)

One huge negative: I made a phone reservation for my group of 8, but when I went exactly on-time to the restaurant, the reservation wasn't there. The manager did accommodate us as much as possible which was nice, but we still had to wait 30 mins extra.

They should just use an online reservation system to avoid a mistake like this from happening again.
author: Sang P.

description:
We were craving Mexican during our trip in San Fran and San Fran is known for its amazing Mexican cuisine. We had some pretty high expectations based off of the reviews here. We ordered some tacos, calamari, and pork chop. The tacos were very average at best and wasn't really a game changer in terms of Mexican food. 

However, the pork chop was PHENOMENAL. The reason I gave Don Pisto's 3 stars was based off of its pork chop since it was cooked to perfection. This was no ordinary dry and overlooked pork chop. This was cooked to perfection and was super juicy and tender, I've never had such an amazing pork chop before. This will definitely feed 2 people comfortably if you're planning on sharing.
author: Chris K.

description:
Don Pisto's is probably my favorite place for boozy brunch in San Francisco! It has delicious food and a fun atmosphere. They offer bottomless mimosas/margaritas/sangria for $21 which is a steal! Your time limit is 1.5 hours for bottomless, and they end at 3, so I would definitely recommend getting started on that right away. The margaritas tend to be inconsistent in strength- I have had some that tasted like water and some that tasted like a glass of tequila! I would definitely recommend the mimosas and sangria over the margaritas. 

The food is also good. My personal favorite is the ceviche- it's super flavorful and also very fresh. The huevos rancheros are pretty standard, but a good option. The guacamole is good to snack on. If you have dietary restrictions, I have found them to be very accommodating and they can make something that you can have. One downside is that the food often takes a while to come out- once I got my food but my friend who had ordered at the same time had to wait another 30 minutes! Also, it can be a long long wait on weekend mornings. 

The atmosphere at Don Pisto's is definitely the best part. They blast music and it feels lively. It's probably not a good place to have a conversation though- you might find yourself having to shout!
author: Ayushi A.

description:
My bf and I got here right after 5 on a Saturday evening and there was plenty of seating to go around. Didn't miss the storefront thankfully because Yelp helped us out. ;) The server was super friendly and brought out our chips and salsa. The salsa is TO DIE FOR. I definitely got more salsa than chip every bite I had. So good we had to order another thing of salsa. 

We ordered the diablo shrimp (appetizer special of the day), the carne asada and al pastor tacos, and a sangria and a margarita. Shrimp pricing was a little steep but the flavor was on point. They were spicy but had many levels of flavors. Tacos - dynamite. I liked the al pastor (pork shoulder) tacos better but they were both amazing. Drinks were strong and they didn't skimp on amount!

They had some old school rap music in the restaurant which was surprising at first but I enjoyed it. Inside was dimly lit but fit the mood. I fell in LOVE with this place and they will be seeing a lot more of me!
author: Katherine Z.

description:
I was not expecting to have such good tacos al pastor here, but man were they good. The perfect balance of fatty and flavorful, with some of the meat juices soaking into the tortilla... Mmmm. The complimentary chips are addicting!

We also ordered the sangria and got around 8 pours out of that thing, so definitely go for the pitcher instead of the cup. This is the place to go for classy Mexican food. At around 6pm on a Sunday it wasn't too full. The seating is a bit awkward, with a large communal table and several other smaller tables for groups of ~4. 

The food was surprisingly good, but it is expensive, especially when you can get some pretty quality Mexican food in the Mission.
author: Sophie W.

description: Food is good but staff are a bit rushed to turn your table. It's super loud downstairs, like uncomfortably loud for a meal. I would recommend going to the bar for drinks and their delicious chicken wings.
author: Cianne L.

description: Cool spot located in north beach where it's mostly Italian restaurants. I only tried the tacos To go cause I came here to drink and they only make wine margaritas here and it was a 45 min wait for a table. so I got two Carne Asada tacos to go. The tacos where good and the Homemade chili they put on them was nice and spicy. I would came back here for a nice dinner when I'm in drinking Mode. If I'm going to get a Margarita I want tequila in it. I will be back for a nice dinner.
author: Dennis T.

description:
We went to exploratorium for a fun day today and were starving when we were done with it!! So we looked up on yelp some yummy Mexican restaurant, since that is kinda what we were feeling to eat. The yummy Mexican feeeeels. 

So we came across Don Pisto's and were totally for it! We trekked it by foot and was not hard to find. 

First off. The music is poppin!! My kind of music. Drake, Kendrick Lamar, the weekend, big Sean. All songs that I have on my playlist and I listen to!! 

We were greeted right away. Very polite. The place is good in size. Clean and comfy, and everyone who worked seemed really nice!! The food was awesome. The only thing I disliked was they said they are transitioning from brunch to dinner so not all of the items on the menu were available. 

But my husband ordered the carne Asada tacos and he loved them! Then the waiter, really nice lady. Recommend ed I get the veggie plate which had. Rice. Beans. Cheese. Guac and corn tortillas. And it was delicousssssss!! It hit the spot!! The guac is so good and the Salas and chips they give are delicious!!

Overall loved the place. It really hit the spot. Was what I was looking for!
author: Jasmit D.

description: GREAT mexican food! Best salsa I've had! Homemade tortilla chip, proper corn tacos, great guacamole. Check it out!
author: Haukur H.

description:
This is some authentic Mexican food!! You can totally tell the tortillas, chips and salsas are homemade.. and they are BOMBBBB.

Playlist was all Drake, Weeknd, and Lil Wayne - and they had specials on bottomless mimosas and sangria - sooooo I'm pretty confident the food wasn't the only way to my heart!

See attached pictures if you're ready to drool!
author: Kelsey W.

description:
No reservations on a busy Saturday night! Luckily, we got on the wait list and got seats at the communal table. Good luck trying to have an intimate conversation here since it's LOUD. 

What I really like about getting the margarita pitcher is that they give you full margaritas AND the full pitcher. So you already start off on a boozy note ;).

Started with the chorizo/mussels appetizer. My mind was blown at this dish. MIND. BLOWN. First off, what an incredible mix. Never in a million years would I have thought of this pair and they complemented each other so well. So, so well. The pork chop was also super juicy. Definitely share this one.

Will be back for more of that chorizo/mussel appetizer. Yum!
author: Vee B.

description:
After walking the morning away, we came here about 1:15pm. The place was very full but all 5 seats at the bar were open, so, we sat there. There are about 11 tables upstairs ranging in size from 2 to 6 seats with one large table that has about 18 seats. There was a birthday party there. The bathrooms are downstairs and there is another room down there for larger groups. 

We perused the menu and talked with Luke the bartender about the menu. We placed our orders. I ordered the carne asada tacos (mesquite grilled steak, arbol salsa, onions and cilantro) and my wife ordered the taco sonora (handmade flour tortilla, queso oaxaca, beans, pico de gallo, and crema). 

My wife really liked the green salsa that came with the tortilla chips. Our meals were brought to us in a very short time. Both were fabulous. The arbol salsa was a little spicy but very good.

Luke, the bartender and our server was awesome! The food was very good as well. The only negative is how noisy it was when it was full and they also play the music rather loud.
author: Mike B.

description:
This is one of my neighborhood favorites. There usually isn't a wait to get a seat which is the best. I like to call ahead of time to see what the situation is like. From the brunch menu to their dinner menu, I haven't had a bad meal here, ever!! House chips and salsa is crispy and delicious - made fresh!

The staff is extremely nice and helpful as well!

LOVE DON PISTOS!
author: Inci A.

description:
This place is hidden away in a brick building with no sign at all. We walk by a lot without really realizing it is there. However, I was looking for a brunch place one day and we dropped in here. It's a little loud with loud music playing, but the wait wasn't awful on a Sunday morning at least.
The food is really good plus the chips and salsa were so great. The food took ages to come so we ate like 3 baskets of chips and salsa before the food arrived. Still, at least the food was delicious. The service was friendly. The atmosphere is friendly. I have to say it's great. I highly recommend this place for a Mexican brunch!
author: Jenn T.

description: Another definite must when in SF! Amazing food, ambiance, & service!  Try the sashimi, fish tacos,  diablo shrimp & ceviche! I highly recommend this place. Don't miss! And on Sunday come for bottomless mimosas.  One of my absolute favs!
author: Nomnom N.

description:
Swung by this place for dinner on a Friday night and enjoyed thoroughly what the place had to offer. I came with 3 other friends and luckily we were seated immediately. In typical Mexican fashion, we were given chips and salsa, with the salsa being of the tomatillo style. This was delicious! We decided to order the following:

* pork tamales - these were delicious, and soft 
*enchiladas - these were surprisingly really good too. My friend ordered them vegetarian and finished the entire plate as it was so good
* pollo asado - this was my order and I loved it thoroughly. The chicken had a toasty taste to it and was soft and melted in your mouth. The dish came with another salsa which was spicy and an avocado sauce as well as tortillas. I would recommend others to try this as well!!
* chicken fajitas - this was a special and my friends had great things to say about it :) would order again!

Overall great experience and amazing service and would highly recommend!
author: Prasiddha H.

description: Visiting from NY and had dinner with my daughter here. Great food. Wonderful waitress.   Had the fish tacos, delish the salsa for the chips were yummy and good sangria. Will be back to try the enchiladas.
author: Mari A.

description:
Came here on a Friday night with in a group of 4, and we had a wait time of about 40 minutes, which I feel isn't too much for a popular spot on a Friday night. Place was pretty packed, and we were seated at the community table.

We got the margarita pitcher to share, which was pretty strong and flavored evenly, so it was really enjoyable. For the table we got the chicken wings, which were spicy and really delicious, the guacamole with chips which were good. For entrees we had a bunch of stuff including the enchilada, tacos and the house special shrimp for that night. 

Food was good, but the place is a bit loud. If you aren't looking for a loud place where you will have to be shout to be heard, I recommend this is not the place for you.
author: Nisarga M.

description:
Very good food and awesome ambiance! THERE IS ALWAYS ALWAYS ALWAYS A WAIT. 

The things i don't love are that the amount of food you get for the price doesn't match up. Each person could easily spend $50+ on food and still be hungry which is a bummer. Also, their drinks may be possibly watered down or it's the batch i got. We drank for two hours and i felt nothing. I'll try this place again because the food was good and i like the music.
author: Natalie I.

description: A small and lively place with some real friendly folk and a great vibe! We ordered a couple of plates of tacos. The fish tacos were great and they made us a plate of simple veggie tacos (it isn't in the menu but just ask for it!) We weren't there for long and couldn't really try the other stuff but I would definitely go back!
author: Anand R.

description:
First off, bottomless was $21!!! You'll end up getting a good buzz during your brunch with that steal. Mimosas & sangria are offered and both delicious. 

Their breakfast burrito was huge. Absolutely huge for a breakfast burrito. Both halves could have been almost two full burritos!!! Ended up saving the second for lunch, but was fully stuffed from only one. 

Service was great and super fast, so be ready to order if you need to leave quickly. I got my burrito within 5 or 10 minutes. Literally no complaints about Don Pisto's
author: Matthew L.

description:
The complimentary chips and salsa were a nice start to the meal. Chips are the thick kind and the salsa they serve is chunky and green. 

We ordered the carnitas tacos and the mushroom enchiladas to share. The carnitas were cooked perfectly!! (And they better be at $6/taco lol) The enchiladas were better than I thought they would be for sure, there was a slightly sweet aftertaste to them that I enjoyed. The rice on the side of the dish was sad though. Dry and bland.

Food was about a 4/5, but overall 3 stars -- for the price I expected more in terms of quality and quantity. Servers were also goofing off the whole time and didn't seem to take their job seriously.
author: Selena S.

description:
Came here for brunch for a friends birthday and had pretty good food but truly some of the weirdest/worst service I've ever experienced at a restaurant. 

We had a 2pm reservation for a group of 10. We got there and waited by the door, and at probably 2:20 they finally seated us at a table upstairs. They took drink orders, and then told us they were going to move us all downstairs for some reason, even though we were already seated at a fine table, and that they couldn't bring us chips or take our food orders until we were downstairs. So at 2:35, we still dont have drinks chips or orders in, and we all move downstairs, and they finally take our orders. 15 minutes later the waiter comes back and apologizes and tells us that he made a mistake and didn't get the orders in to the kitchen fast enough, so all the people who ordered off the brunch menu will have to re-order, and that he'll be right back with menus. 15 minutes later, half of our food comes out, but the waiter had disappeared and never brought menus for the other half of our table to re-order. So we start to eat, and try to flag someone down. Finally, we flag someone down and ask for menus so that the rest of our party can order. So at this point we've been here an hour and a half, half of us are done eating and the other half haven't even ordered. We also couldn't get anyone to bring us chips or more drinks, even though we were paying for bottomless. Eventually the manager came out and apologized and brought us free guacamole and two pitchers of mimosas for bottomless, which was very nice of him. The food was good. The margaritas were fine, but quite weak. 

By the end everyone was just frustrated and wanted to leave. I suggest coming here with a small group at a less busy time, because they pretty clearly cant handle groups.
author: Davita P.

description:
To start, this place is four stars if you're into hip-hop/rap played at a louder decibel for your dining experience. My personal preference is to save that for the after dinner drink spot so I wasn't in love with the atmosphere. That said, the service here is awesome and the food comes out wicked fast! 

Chips are the perfect thickness and the green salsa served to start is super fresh with a great kick. The carnitas tacos are incredible, however, extremely extremely spicy. The kind of mouth-on-fire where you aren't sure if you can talk, nor do you want to. Highly recommend if that's your thing! The carne asada tacos were nothing to write home about, good not great.

Also, the margaritas are made with agave wine and not tequila. Not bad but..... it didn't quench my hankering for a margarita! They don't have a liquor license :)
author: Rachel P.

description:
Excellent staff and service. Welcoming to large groups, families and pets. 

The taco pescados were delicious, however the tequila-less margaritas were different. Not a fan of the margaritas.
author: Henry F.

description: We were visiting from Los Angeles where 5-star tacos are everywhere to be found.  My dad wanted Mexican and I had low hopes.  Where it's hard to beat $2 deliciousness you can find down south, this restaurant puts the value in its $6.50 tacos.  I had the carnitas tacos and the meat was cooked perfectly and there was great clean not overdone flavor.  While I'm used to eating 3-4 street tacos back home, the two on my plate were stuffed with meat and left me just enough room to stuff some chips, salsa, guacamole.  The chips were perfectly crispy.  The tomatillo salsa was very tasty.  The guacamole was very good. Well done San Francisco.  Still wouldn't live here though
author: James A.

description:
This is one of those places where at the end of your meal you HAVE TO write something. It's so good. No, no, no it's soooooooo good!

Ever been to one of those restaurants where the food is late, staff is rude, everything is overpriced or food not tasty? Well, Don Pisto's has none of them. None! After sitting down we had our delicious strawberry mimosas within 8 minutes and we were enjoying a superb Huevos Rancheros and magnificent Breakfast Burrito. 

I won't lie, even the chips and mole was enough to feed ourselves.

If you are by North Beach and looking for an excellent restaurant experience (not just the food, the whole thing!), I'd highly advise you to come to here. You'll LOVE it!
author: Ali O.

description:
It's rare that you like everything during a meal top to bottom but that was the case here. Felt right at home at Don Pisto's and thoroughly enjoyed every part of the meal. The freshly made tortilla chips with the green salsa were a great start to the meal. The salsa is full of flavor and doesnt just focus on overwhelming heat, its meant to be enjoyed. Next, the shrimp tacos were out of this world, they were just about perfect. The roasted lamb with fresh corn tortillas was so tender and the broth it came in was so good I slurped it right up forgetting about everyone else at the table that may have wanted more - it was All Mine! My friends enjoyed the pollo tacos but I think their shrimp tacos are better. 
The only thing I would improve upon was our Sangria, we ordered a pitcher for the table and we were disappointed - it seemed to be a bit watered down and bland. Oh well, we plan to come back here real soon.
author: Matt D.

description:
Came here on a Friday night at 7:30pm and were seated with NO wait at all. Food gets served super fast as well. We were some by 8:15. Crazy! The service was very good as well. 

This was amazing Mexican food. We ordered their enchilada special, the tamales, the enchiladas, and the pollo asado. So amazing and was sad I was too full to finish.
author: Neda B.

description: Bottomless brunch here was fine, but definitely not as exciting as I expected.  Music was good: they played hip-hop mostly.  Service was okay - I felt like the waitstaff filled our glasses when needed and didn't make us wait excessively.  It did take a while for them to take our initial orders, but after that, service was fine.  Food was okay (I got the Huevos Rancheros), nothing special, and the bottomless drinks were just okay.  One gripe I have is that they don't do bottomless margaritas, as previously advertised, and all their drinks are made with wine, not liquor.  I think the regular drinks were also tastier than the bottomless.  I have to imagine there are better places for brunch and don't know what it so special about this place...it was just okay.
author: Arthi N.

description: Awesome margaritas, chips and guac! Loved the communal table and lowkey vibe. No TVs  if you like horchata, don't miss the spiked version here.
author: Donna S.

description: This place was delicious. It is upscale Mexican with an emphasis on seafood. They recommend family style eating so be prepared to share! We had the salmon sashimi, al pastor tacos, pork chop, and mussels with chorizo. They use a lot of cilantro which is not my favorite (but obviously not their fault) but you might be able to remove it (i didn't ask because I was sharing food). They only serve wine and beer so their margaritas are not made with tequila. They only accept reservations for parties of 6 and they will not sit incomplete parties which was a little frustrating because we had a friend that just wanted to drop by for a drink midway through dinner. I understand because it is a small place. Overall, amazing food and lively ambiance just be prepared to have to wait a bit for a table and and have your entire party there to sit down when the table is ready.
author: Christine A.

description:
Came here after a night out of drinking.  We were seated fairly quickly on a longer table with another party.  I don't mind that type of seating at all.  As long as we have our own space. 

We ordered the whole lobster with the taco fixings to make lobster tacos.  MAN WAS IT AMAZING!  the lobster itself was juicy and delicious.  Then add everything together to make it into a taco and it worked all so well with each other.  

The service was great, very friendly.  i didnt feel rushed even though there was a reservation coming in after us (they let us know before getting seated....I hate when they tell you while you're already seated to make you feel like GTFO).

GET THE LOBSTER.  WORTH IT!
author: Dayneen M.

description:
I think anyone would walk right past Don Pisto's without any knowledge it's there. There is no obvious sign or indication it's a restaurant! This is the new, hip way to be trendy in SF :P 

Don Pistos is an intimate little fancy mexican restaurant on Union st. It has a bar that seats about 4, and a small dining area. 

The menu is pretty straight forward and covers your basics for fancy mexican plus more! They have irresistible chips and green salsa, and from what I keep hearing...the Guac is supposed to be out of this world. My party had the oysters for appetizers, carnitas tacos and a delicious chicken platter. Every dish was fresh, ingredients were prime and the presentation was wonderful. 

Now drinks. You gotta try the "Bad Bitch" drink. Just so you can say it. But seriously, it is a $5 shot with a slew of ingredients that is quite enjoyable. Wish I could remember all the ingredients...but the drink had a nice spicy "zing" to it. Most of Don Pisto's drink menu consists of beer and margaritas. 

Service was great! Hostess, bartender and server were all very polite and friendly. I will definitely be back!!! :)

Bottom Line: Fancy mexican; perfect date night atmosphere.
author: Jaime W.

description: Always a "go to" when visitors are in town. Location is perfect in North Beach and menu is delicious. Love the atmosphere. Can get loud and rowdy so I prefer a slow night or brunch. They are always super helpful with reservations and service is great.
author: Katie S.

description: Stopped in this unmarked storefront with a friend who'd been here before and recommended we stop in. Glad we did. Service was friendly, we were seated quickly and given menus. We grabbed a couple appetizers to split (carne asada and pescado tacos) and the Nolan Ranch pork chop. Everything was excellent. The flavors were great, the pork chop was perfectly cooked. Thoroughly enjoyed the food here. Will definitely come back.
author: J W.

description: I was visiting from Seattle and was recommended by a San Fran native to go here for brunch. I loved it here! I had the huevos rancheros and bottomless mimosas and it was really great. I called in about an hour before arriving and was able to make a reservation. Once we got there, we waited for about 10 minutes and were then seated. The service was quick and my party and I always had refills on our mimosas. The brunch choices were great as well. I love this place and would 100% recommend coming here while visiting!!!!
author: Julie C.

description:
Just left this restaurant and I'm really reallly REALLY SAD to leave a poor review like this. After waiting an hour for a table and going down the street for a drink we get sat downstairs at a communal table? Didn't know these exist here. (Wait, they don't? Table for two please??) so much for an intimate date night. 

I've come here before with friends and my mother have had excellent food, service, etc. regardless of the loud and trendy environment. This time the food was blah over priced and I could've gotten better at a Mission street cart. They don't serve real margaritas ONLY agave wine because they don't have a liquor license??? My guacamole was taking from my table before we even finished it ($8). And the bus boy asked every table if our food was theirs before it made its way in front of us. 

I understand the environment of this restaurant but I'm disappointed at the service we received after spending about $100 for two and waited for an hour when other two person parties were seated at regular tables upstairs. I've come here in the past but I can't say I'll come in the future.
author: Casey P.

description: If you are in sf and you are a foodie you must try Don Pisto's, we ordered 4 plates and all 4 were pretty damn good plus service was excellent.
author: Sergio S.

description: Decent food.  Good (but too loud music)... 6% SF Mandate is unacceptable.   Just change your menu prices to reflect reality.
author: William V.

description:
Favorite fancy little Mexican Restaurant in SF, hands down! The location is, as others have mentioned, a bit tucked away in North Beach with no signs outside. Space is intimate and demure with exposed brick and low lights/candlelight on the interior. I've visited for both brunch and dinner many times and am NEVER disappointed with the food. Tacos and guac are a must, duh! Sangria is strong and there's about 6 drinks per pitcher. I love love love the salsa. Al pastor is a must if you're into that. They keep the menu simple and the ingredients fresh!

Great date spot or for a large group/special occasion. Big community table in the center, which is an interesting feature. Will undoubtedly be back again and again.
author: Ashley C.

description:
The four of us came here on a Monday night to join a few other table of diners. 

Service was amazing and the food quality was excellent. It's definitely not your typical taco spot as we quickly evaluated with $7 tacos, but definitley thought it was a worthwhile dining experience.

We ordered the ceviche, hamburgesa, enchiladas, shrimp tacos, beef tacos and the pitcher of sangria it was a lot of food. Everything tasted really good but the sangria was lacking fruit and tasted a bit strong, which was unexpected. Favorite was definitely the hamburger,which says a lot since I normally don't like burgers. 

Ambiance was nice, slightly romantic. The place is pretty small and parking is difficult, but I'd rec if you are looking for a clean, mildly fancy mex
author: Juliana P.

description:
Fun atmosphere! great place for a group dinner or brunch, maybe not for a first date though because it'll be hard to hear the person. 

They hard beer & wine - their sangria is delicious. & they have Mexican coke 

For food, I've had a lot of the menu items. Their complementary chips & green salsa are Heaven - add a side of guac and OMG you'll instantly be happy. The citrusy ceviche is a great starter too 
      Brunch: the chorizo burrito  is exactly what a hangover calls for... kinda messy and oh so filling & they have coconuts. Who doesn't love a fresh coco the next morning? For large groups they have a variety of preset menus and they just bring food out til you can't eat anymore + they do bottomless drinks - great value & keeps it easy! Their huevos rancheros are bomb too on the crispy tortillas 
      Dinner: tacos! All of them are great, but the fish & carne Asada are my faves.  The white sauce & salsa on the fish tacos is so so good and spicy, I wish I could make it. The pollo asado is Mary's chicken - so fresh & cooked to perfection

Also, look for their daily specials - they're always SO GOOD
author: danielle a.

description:
Random tangent disclosure:It's almost 7AM on a Sunday, I've been awake for an hour and I'm 36 weeks pregnant, so I'm just feeling like keeping this fairly short & sweet before I either am able to KO for a bit or literally roll myself out of bed.  

My office has had Don Pisto's catered several times, and I know people call me bougie, but I've preferred their tacos and chips to other bougie and "legit" taco vendors we've had.  Their meats are well seasoned and moist (chicken and steak), green sauce is plenty spicy, and the chips are fresh fried, golden, crisp and perfectly salted.  And let's not forgot about the dreamy guac!  

There's a handful of awesome places in the North Beach area, and one wouldn't necessarily think of bougie Mexican food, but hey if I happened to be around I wouldn't mind stopping in for some tacos here, or their brunch.  Don Pisto's can you DoorDash to the in law's in Sunset please?  I'm so limited when I visit them and need to get food delivered.  #outersunsetproblems #firstworldproblems
author: Cat C.

description:
Guacamole: YUM
Fish tacos: EPIC
Fish Burrito: solid

Vibes: dope
author: Cynthia G.

description: My boyfriend and I came in here when I had a sudden taco craving on a Saturday night. Seemed like a little hole in the wall looking for it at night but I ended up loving the atmosphere which consisted of dim lighting, wood, brick, and loud yet enjoyable music that made it feel like a good Saturday night out without actually "going out". Was still able to talk to and hear my boyfriend lol we had some great micheladas, tacos al pastor, and enchiladas. I was also a huge fan of the chips and salsa & our server was super sweet enough to give us a bunch extra to take home since it just gets tossed out at the end of the night anyway. My review sounds pretty basic and boring but I'm actually super satisfied with this place lol definitely go!!!!
author: Cecilia L.

description: MEhhhh.... I'm sorry but this place was so overrated. I mean the guac was good. For $8, it should be though! The corn (elotes), burgers, and tacos especially were very average. I came here with my coworkers so I tried almost everything and overall it was pretty underwhelming, especially for the price.
author: Jane H.

description:
As a Texan spending a few days in the city, I hesitated at my fiancé's suggestion that we grab lunch at a Mexican place after a long day of walking around. I wanted an outstanding and unique meal that I couldn't get in Austin, but I also wanted to go to a place laid-back enough not to side-eye the casual attire I was wearing that day.

Don Pisto's delivered on all counts. When we walked in on a Sunday afternoon, we were seated immediately and had prompt and pleasant service. To start, we had the ceviche and guacamole, which was very satisfying-- they make the heartier, fresh tortilla chips that I love. We split lobster dinner. The lobster, slow cooked in pork-fat, served with warm tortillas, rice, beans, mole sauce and a garlic-butter-cilantro concoction, was an outstanding way to cap off our day trip. The vibe there was really cool too, industrial without trying too hard, playing some 00's hip hop in the background.
author: Lin Z.

description:
Don Pisto's is such a fun spot! When you need a break from all the Italian food. Everything I've sample over my visits, from the tacos to the pork chop to the burger, is super fresh, flavorful and delicious. I've also been for brunch a couple of times and have found it equally as tasty.

Beyond the food, they also offer a nice and streamlined beverage list. While they don't have a license for hard alcohol, they do make fun margaritas with agave wine that taste like the real thing!

Look for the red lights, and enjoy the fun atmosphere. And if it doesn't feel like 90s r&b I don't want it!
author: Holly L.

description: Gread food. Great drinks. Excellent customer. Would definitely come back here when visiting.
author: Mel K.

description: Really good food but If you go here, don't go for the tacos. There tacos are fine but I find there are much better things on the menu and you can get better tacos elsewhere for cheaper. There chips and salsa are the best in town. The atmosphere is great but they don't have their liquor license which is a big eh for a Mexican resultant. Plenty of pacific tho!
author: Garrett S.

description: The food was delicious! We had never been before and decided to take a friend here for dinner. Very little wait for a Sat night. The ambiance was great, and the food was delicious! We ordered the classic margarita and hibiscus margarita. Both delicious. The guacamole is a must. We also ordered three different taco dishes: pescado (fabulous), carne asado (amazing) and carnitas (yum!). The hostess/server was especially nice. All in all, wonderful experience. Will definitely be back!
author: Megan R.

description:
Everything was delicious and very high quality. I loved the rib special. The tortilla soup was very flavorful. The house chips and green salsa were great. Simply put, perfect. Good wine selection. 

We sat immediately at the bar and our waitress was literally the most efficient and attentive I've ever experienced IN MY LIFE. She was awesome and quite amazing. Constantly checking on us, know not to interrupt when we are  in the middle of a conversation, all while she had to make drinks for what appears to be the entire restaurant...besides serving all of us at her bar. 

I just ate the rib leftovers for dinner and it was still delicious. Oh she also packed me with extra tortilla and chips with my leftovers...so attentive. Quite unbelievable!
author: Xiu L.

description: The food was overrated for the price. El Norteno Taco truck has better food. The burger was said to be good, but it was very plain.
author: David Y.

description:
This place has been bookmarked forever!  I have been wanting that Hamburgesa since I first read about it. (sadly it did not live up to my crazy expectations - it was a bit dry.

It was sort of a Pork-a-palooza for us on the night we went with my stepson. The other things we ordered were fantastic. Off the specials - 2 pork dishes, one ribs and another a kind of pork stew. Also two of the tacos al pastor - which was one of my favorites of the night.

The salsa really blew me away - a green one with just the right amount of heat.

TIP - We ordered a couple extra tortillas to eat the final parts of what was left, we had to wait for them...when they came out they were different from the ones that came with the stews (corn, and seemed manufactured) - these new ones were nicely grilled (homemade?) flours ones - and VERY VERY good! (so see if you can order those)
author: Amy W.

description:
We came here on a Saturday for brunch and bottomless mimosas Sept 2016. Upon arrival, the loud hip hop/ rap music caught us off guard but it gave the place a good energy so we didn't mind. It is definitely a younger crowd for brunch. 
The bottomless mimosas are $21 for 90 minutes and the waiter stayed right on top of the refills. Our food order consisted of their hot wings, chips and salsa, and their tacos. The chips are thick and salsa nice and spicy 4.5/5. The wings were really tasty and the pescado taco was my favorite. Overall great food and atmosphere.
author: Becca T.

description:
Was really looking forward to trying this place after reading all the glowing reviews. Especially was interested in trying their pork chop which had many great comments and delicious photos.

Cool space and when we arrived, was kind of strange that the host was wearing t shirt, shorts and soccer sandals. But hey this is SF right? Host was very friendly though and offered us free drinks for waiting, which was great.

Unfortunately everything went downhill from there very fast. We immediately ordered the pork chops and a couple of sides. At first our female server seemed a little harried and rushed, but was willing to give her the benefit of the doubt considering how busy the restaurant was.

We placed our order for two pork chops which she detailed about how they are prepped, marinated all day, delicious, etc plus a couple of sides. A few minutes she comes back to tell us they are out of the pork chop.  She recommends a couple of other dishes and we settle on their rib eye. Strike one.

Their rib eye comes with creamed corn as a side and one of the original sides we ordered was corn on the cob (the pork chops come with a cucumber salad). Not wanting a meal with nothing with corn as both sides we cancel the cob order and she seems visibly irritated and makes a rude comment "well they are prepared differently" which was totally unnecessary. 

Why make any comment when you already messed up with the pork chop order, lady? Do I really want a dinner with two sides of corn and nothing else? Strike two.

Then they bring out one rib eye and forget to bring 2nd rib eye for my dining companion. Very awkward to eat steak in front of my starving guest. We finally receive 2nd steak but by then I'm finished. Strike three.

At this point our horrible server finally starts to realize she has seriously messed up our evening and offers to remove an appetizer from the bill. Too little, too late.

This woman needs to get a better attitude, more training and learn how to be more gracious if they want return business, because I won't be back. You don't snap at customers about sending stuff back due to your own incompetence. Ever.

As for the food, it was just OK Mexican and definitely overhyped. Chips were decent but their salsa verde had a strong off-taste of unripe and undercooked chile. 

The rib eye was cooked well but average steak quality, mussels were tiny and shriveled with three sad pieces of disgusting soggy bread, and the creamed corn was very Campbell's-like. 

Hard pass.
author: D C.

description: Came here for birthday bottomless brunch and it was soo good. It's popular for a reason so it's probably best to make a reservation. You get a choice of mimosa, margarita, or sangria so change it up as much as you'd like! Bottomless drinks are $21 and regular price is $8, so drink 3 to make it worth it. (If it's your birthday, tell someone there and they'll bring you a birthday shot!) The waiters also make sure that everyone orders some kind of food while they drink, even if it's just a side, and chips come complimentary at the table. I ordered the ceviche- exactly what I was craving!
author: Alaina P.

description:
A truly awful experience. I went to Don Pisto's for weekend brunch on the recommendation of a friend. The menu looked appetizing and there seemed to be a strong buzz. After making a reservation early in the week as well as calling to confirm two hours prior, I showed up to hear "We don't have a reservation under that name". I pointed out my name on the reservation sheet with no contact information and a line through it. After indignantly explaining to the slouched, jean wearing host that I had called two hours ago, I asked to speak to the manager. Amazingly, I learned this kid was the manager!

After being told there was an extended wait, I asked them to call me when a table was ready and left. By the time they called, the brunch menu was nearly closed. I asked if he was willing to extend the menu on account of the wait, to which he said no.

My final verdict: If the rest of San Francisco somehow ceases to exist, Don Pistos may be a suitable alternative to starvation. Otherwise, steer well clear of this mess of a restaurant.
author: Matene A.

description: Stopped in late with my girlfriend and a friend of hers that lives in the area. We had a great time consuming the complimentary awesome chips and salsa as well as some apps and a few adult beverages! Wait staff was friendly and attentive.
author: Kevin F.

description:
My chicken tortilla sup was good , vert good atmosphere and great service!!! 
And the guacamole was really good
author: Ben G.

description:
Don Pisto's is one of our go-to places whenever I'm in San Francisco for work. And it's always the same meal: Pork Chops.
There is nothing quite like them, I haven't been disappointed once. Worth the trip every time. 
They're huge, they're juicy, they're super tasty, they're everything you want to get that bad feeling from your horrible business meetings out of your stomach, and replace it with grilled perfection. Just do it.

Niman Ranch Pork Chop
author: Simon S.

description:
Visited this 2.5yrs later and this is still one of the best restaurants I have been to in/around Bay area.

I ordered Pollo Asado, chicken cooked so perfectly that it was tender as well as yummy. My fellow dinner mates aka friends ordered their meal and they quoted "this just hit their spot right". 

Verde sauce and chips freshly made. Next time I visit SFO I'm sure to visit this place again.
author: Yogesh M.

description:
I came here for my birthday dinner a couple weeks ago and wasn't exactly impressed. While they can accommodate groups, it is not a good setting if you want to have an enjoyable meal..

Why, you ask? Because it is SO SO SO LOUD. INTENSELY LOUD.. on a Saturday night, at least. People scream-talk over each other while a very random mix of music blasts overhead. It's just a *lot* of noise pollution for a place that does not have a full bar. Also the waiter was perpetually MIA and impossible to track down. Menu is tiny; food was ok but nothing amazing or super authentic. 

In my opinion none of it is worth the time you are likely to spend waiting for a table. I was especially unimpressed since it was my birthday. It felt like a waste of time and money.
author: Melissa T.

description:
You wouldn't think it, tucked away in North Beach (you've probably walked by and never noticed) but Don Pisto's sources some great Oysters n seafood!!

Great food (brunch is awesome!!), great drinks and wonderful service!!

I've been coming here for several years, and they continue to deliver a tastey experience!

Happy Dining.....
author: Nader A.

description: Had the Chicken Alhambre.  It was amazing.  Others at my table had the Carne Asada tacos and Carnitas tacos which were also fantastic.  We also tried the small plate of tamales.  They were delicious and very light for tamales.  The fresh guacamole was also delicious. Definitely worth a visit when in San Francisco.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Holy cow!   After wasting time at the warf...found this place.  Greeted warmly at the door...great music...squeaky clean...and then the food...

Chips and salsa...mmm...tomatillo base with really fresh chips

Wild mushroom enchilada in a savory red chili sauce...the carnitas tacos were superb...portion siZe was spot on.

Wish we had found this spot on day 1.

Highly recommended!
author: Robert G.

description: Hands down the best meal I had in San Francisco. Not only that some of the best service I ever had. Thomas our waiter was fantastic. The cops and salsa that were served complimentary kept coming. The sangeria I ordered was tangy and refreshing. We ordered the mussels with chorizo to start. It was super tasty. There were a couple mussels that We rent opened so they gave us another portion free of charge. We also ordered the fish tacos and the pork tacos. Both were fantastic but the pork tacos were super tender and the pinaple salsa on top was the best combo. The music in this place was also great. I highly recommend this place. The vibe was Great, the food and drinks were amazing but the servers were next level. Please check it out.
author: Julie C.

description:
I have no idea why this place has such high ratings. Just visiting SF from Socal and was craving good Mexican food. This place has amazing reviews so we decided to lunch here. They serve complementary fresh chips and spicy salsa. We never had an empty bowl! I ordered a side of guac ($8). It's fairly large and delicious. No tomatoes in it, just seasoning, onions, lime and a little kick of something spicy. I loved it! 

What I didn't love was the price of the tacos. We ordered 2 taco entrees (should really be called a la carte) which do not come with ANYTHING. Just four tacos on a mini corn tortilla with a sliver of fish, cabbage, and sauce for $26. I thought the tacos tasted great, but overall the loud atmosphere, stuffy hot room (no AC or fans) and over- priced tacos made this place a 3 star. The issue here is not about flavor but more of value. Try some other Mexican place.
author: Nathalie M.

description:
Went for an early (5:30) dinner with a part of 3 and we were seated immediately. When we were leaving around 7 the place was packed, but they don't accept rezzies, so just an FYI. 

There was only 1 vegetarian option on the menu which was surprising for SF (esp for Mexican food which is usually very veg friendly). It was an enchilada made with mushroom bean filling. It was very good, would have liked it to be more spicy, but it was definitely filling and enough for dinner. $16 which I thought was kind of pricey given that it wasn't thaat much different than a run of the mill enchilada that's like $10 with rice and beans and a salad etc at chains. 

My friends got the shrimp tacos and loved them. 

We also got 'bad bitch' shots which were sooo good! Only $5 recommend! And the pitcher of sangria for $32 is definitely a good price and good flavor.
author: Aria S.

description:
We had brunch reservations somewhere else and decided tacos and bottomless drinks were more our flavor. A Google search led us to Don Pistos and we walked in to what would be the best brunch of our SF vacation. 

The atmosphere was fun and full of energy, and everyone from the patrons to the back of house staff was having a great time and had beaming smiles on their faces! 

The minute we were seated, we had water, chips, and salsa (the best salsa in SF) in front of us, and it was refilled often. The server was polite, attentive, and even sent us a free shot after we'd finished our food. The vibe was open and friendly, and the food was delicious. 

We highly recommend this place, it's certainly a hidden gem in the North Beach neighborhood of the city!
author: Cici P.

description:
So, if you're looking for Don Pisto's you might miss it if you're not paying attention since it's in an unmarked building. But then, there's a big window and you can't miss all the fun going on inside so it's not too hard to spot, really.

I came for a few tacos and they were pretty good but I wasn't blown away. They don't have tequila or anything but the alcoholic drinks they did have were essentially Mexican candy in liquid form - heaven. We didn't spend our whole night here but next time I wouldn't make the trek all the way out here. It's a solid choice if you're already in the neighborhood but it's not extraordinary.
author: Abby M.

description: A's across the board! Great atmosphere, music, service, and oh yeah, food! Reccommend to those looking for some great authentic Mexican food. Parking is a bit of a struggle, but not unusual for SF. Come and enjoy the same awesome experience :)
author: Matthew M.

description:
Ok Don Pisto's where do I start.. 3.5 STARS - Sorry couldn't round it up to 4. I wanted to but I couldn't.

It was a Saturday night and this place was packed. You put your name on the list and they call you when its ready. Ok so we did just that, went around the corner and grabbed some beers at a bar.  I got a call in about 35 minutes and I was promptly seated.

The food was hit and miss as far as the price point goes..

Ok, so I don't know how the Bay Area is when it comes to Mexican food but i'm from SoCal.. I live like 15 minutes away from LA and 15 minutes away from Santa Ana. and as a Mexican food lover I have had some of the best when it comes to the cuisine. So let me give you my 2 cents on the food..

Tuna Tacos.. $14.00 - Literally 2 small tacos, a little bit smaller than the ones you get at Del Taco or Taco Bell. $7.00 a piece I just couldn't and wouldn't ever order this again. Yeah it tasted fresh, it was filled with sashimi tuna, but really? There wasn't enough flavor here, it tasted like regular tuna sashimi you would get at a poke bowl place inside a taco.. No way ever I would ever pay $14.00 for two taco's especially these ones.

19oz Pork Chop - $35-$40? - Amazing. The flavors were complex, the chop was juicy, the meat was tender.. so good. It comes on a bed of cabbage that's also seasoned. Squeeze the lime all over the chop and lettuce and man you got something special here. This was a standout dish for me.

Overall this place is super pricey and I cannot see myself being a regular here, a once in a blue moon type of place? Sure. Its overpriced mexican cuisine and the tacos aren't that special to be $7.00 each. NO TACO IS, EVER. Yelpers disappointed me and let me down on this one.
author: Andrew J.

description: I enjoy Mexican restaurants that serve fresh chips to start and the ones here were thick and not too greasy and perfect with their very fresh green salsa!  While the margarita was on the salty side for my taste, the standout taco was the al pastor especially with the charred pineapple inside!
author: Jenny L.

description: LOVE! This is by far one of my favorite higher end Mexican restaurants! I'd recommend this place for first dates to make a lasting impression!
author: Felipe S.

description: I love this place. The food is delicious, the staff is friendly and attentive and the environment is fantastic. Fun chill place on the weekdays, and brunch on the weekends are so much fun. I love the muscles and ceviche. They were cooked perfectly and that's really hard to find good seafood that is cooked perfectly. Highly recommend this place.
author: David P.

description:
I really like this spot. My beaner oldman thinks it's too fancy. I think they just care about the cuisine they prepare. 

The chips with salsa is WONDERFUL. I could drink that salsa verde. And, whatever you order... Make sure you ask for a side of their addictive flour tortillas. I'm still thinking about them. 

This was the second time we dined here, and I'm pretty sure the oldman has changed his tune. Heard no complaints about FANCY Mexican food this time. Yeah... we ordered him a regular, beer tasting beer this time. Although the michelada seems to be THEE drink to order.

Yeah, I'll be dragging him here next week... I hear that I need to try the shrimp tacos. Meanwhile, I'll just dream of their salsa and lovely flour tortillas.
author: Kara B.

description: Came back to try something, not tacos. Friendly service, a++. Guacamole was very good. I had some chicken dish which was a special. The tortillas were not fresh at all, and the dish was just so-so.
author: Jonah K.

description:
Worth the hour wait. We're vegetarian and had veggie enchiladas and a veggie bowl with soft tacos on the side. Definitely one of the top few Mexican restaurants I've been to in SF so far. Expect about $15-$20 per person and $8 per drink. 

DO YOU SEE THIS ENCHILADA?!
author: Alexander C.

description:
Great server, cozy ambience, and decent food.

Best thing I ate: Mexican salmon sashimi
Solid: Pork shoulder taco, tortilla chips
Pretty good: The burger
Not so great: Elote, guac, salsas

Glad I checked this place out, though not so sure I'd go back.
author: Britt M.

description: Such a cute, out of the way restaurant! The food was excellent; sangria on point and a very unusual Michie but I liked it! We will definitely be back!
author: Cheryl T.

description: Such amazing Mexican food with incredible service.  The beef tacos and fish tacos were impeccable and done perfectly. I love the chill vibe of this spot and could see myself as a regular if I lived in the area. Excellent excellent place... go check them out!
author: J L.

description: Holy Shit!  Bring your appetite.  The food is fresh and amazing.  Obsessed with the Tomatillo Salsa and Carnita Tacos.  The pop and hip hop playlist is a plus.  Would recommend to anyone who loves flavorful, fresh food with A+ service and good vibes.
author: Darrah J.

description: Can't say enough about the place.  Came here on a whim and didn't disappoint.  Had fish tacos, chorizo and eggs, and tamale fish for brunch and all were fantastic.  Service was good and seamless, had 4 different people help us unsolicited. The best is the fresh verde salsa they bring with complimentary chips, nobody does green salsa to start!  If I didn't live in San diego, we'd be back.
author: Brandon B.

description:
Clearly this is a popular yelp restaurant and it's easy to see why! We drove 30minutes to get here and it was worth every minute. We had to wait about 30 minutes for a table but while this would normally be a turnoff it was handled with ease by the staff who readily warn you it could be up-to a 45minute wait and provide you with a glass of local sparkling (which is hardly drinkable) but feels welcoming. 
You can stand on the street and mingle with other guests waiting for their tables and the turnover is managed smoothly and in a very professional manner. 
The wine list is extensive with lots of great local choices and of course the beef is what you come for. 
We are both big eaters but could easily have shared one dish between us. 
The meat dishes were good, but not amazing, but the desserts were spectacular! Overall the whole experience was fantastic and highly recommended to other tourists visiting Buenos Aires and looks my for a quality traditional experience.
author: Chrid G.

description:
AWESOME! We came by with my wife and two kids. After walking in and realizing there were no kids in here we were a bit worried. After being greeted and welcomed by the employees and them being very nice to our kids we felt good. We sat right down and ordered some tacos, tamales, and breakfast burrito. Also ordered bottomless watermelon mimosas. Everything was DELICIOUS! the waiter was so nice, and helpful. We celebrated the wife's birthday and hooked her up with a shot on the house! 

We will definitely be going back next time in town. Everyone had a great time and loved the food! 

Thank you guys!
author: Eddie H.

description: Delicious and authentic Mexican food. We were sat immediately band served very quickly. The guacamole was chunky - just like it should be, and the the corn on the cob was mouth watering. Also has the Carne Asada tacos which were so good!
author: Run.It.Off V.

description:
My mom and I thought the lobster was very good. For me, having lobster with lime, butter, and rice and beans was a nice twist from what I'm used to. It was a good 2 pounds with plenty of good meat. 

I love their homemade chips, salsa, guacamole, and margaritas as well. 

My mom's friend's only complaint was that she wasn't prepared for how spicy the carne asada tacos were.
author: Lisa M.

description:
Come for the bottomless brunch not just the food. The 3 stars is for the food. Service is great - it's always packed for brunch but you don't end up waiting very long even if you're a big group (impressive, unlike most brunch places in SF).
