Chorizo & baked eggs: gooey sunnyside up eggs & sour cream done right but no chorizo to be found. I think they put in chorizo bits, similar to bacon bits...but I thought I'd get actual chorizo :( 

Guac - relatively bland by itself but add a generous dash of tapatio and it's good. 

Camarones shrimp tacos - my favorite dish of the ones we had. Juicy shrimp and all the right toppings. 

Carnitas tacos - meh, nothing special. Shrimp tacos were much better! 

Note: this place is rated highly for its bottomless brunch experience and great service, not for having the best Mexican food! If you're searching for the best Mexican food go to the Mission.
author: Inga C.

description: Love ya'll! Fun music, great food, awesome staff. Never disappointed.
author: Julia D.

description: Delicious and great location! I hadn't been back in a couple of years, and just took two friends over in town from Europe. Great drinks, and amazing flavors  - all the food was great. If you're looking for a nice spot for mexican food, this is the spot. Location is awesome as well - will be back again soon!
author: Sandra L.

description:
Don Pistos has the best guacamole in the city.

The Best.

Don Pistos' guacamole is rich, thick, and packed with flavor. 

Don Pistos' entire menu is beautifully curated and organic. You can taste it. Their Al Pastor is fantastic. Their fish tacos are dreamy. Their chips are seasoned perfectly - and that guacamole is something else.

I've only ever had catering and take-out from Don Pistos, but each experience has been phenomenal. Their catering manager Michelle is a dream to work with and she goes above and beyond to make sure her customers are satisfied and well prepared with their orders.

I'm looking forward to checking out Don Pistos for brunch or dinner in the future - but until then - I'll be chowing down on take-our orders of their unbelievable guacamole. 

Like last night. Right now in the morning. And most likely tonight as well. And probably tomorrow morning as well, possibly lunch, and...

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Went in for a quick bit3. Food and service were great! Their green salsa is excellent!
author: Humberto B.

description: Delicious! We had the shrimp tacos and tortilla soup. The restaurant is quaint and a great place to have a date. Service was impeccable
author: Beth K.

description:
Visited this place with some friends when I visited San Francisco on Friday. We all got different dishes to share and everything was great.

I highly recommend the daily cevhice, and I had the pollo asada. It was amazing, and also the worst thing I ate. Highly recommended!
author: Dennis P.

description: All time favorite. I love coming here with friends. Cool environment and food tastes awesome. Love it
author: Chris H.

description:
We have been wanting to try Don Pistos on Union and we were so pleased from the moment we got to the door.  We were greeted by the Host/Waitress Bailey and she immediately got us a beautiful table for two right by the Window. (It was such a beautiful warm night so this was an extra treat!). We asked Bailey what her favorite items on the menu  and what she would recommend.  She informed us the Mexican Sashimi(Salmon) was outstanding, we ordered it and it was Melt in your mouth incredible.  We also ordered the Spicy Tuna Tacos (incredible), Calamari (yummy) & the Carnitas.  The food was exceptional.  I want to mention the Teamwork at this restaurant, if any restaurant wants to watch this teamwork they would be so surprised on how each person within the restaurant continuously helps one another, every guest in the restaurant was never left without water, food,chips, cleaning of the plates etc. etc. I highly recommend Don Pistos!  You will want to visit on a regular basis.
We felt the prices were incredibly fair and worth every dollar.
Take an Uber or Lift to get there parking maybe abbot tough since North Beach is so popular.
author: Julieann D.

description: Phenomenal place to get your Mexican food fix! This place has outdone themselves to the tee. I can't even explain all the goodness they delivered, from customer service, waiting time, dining time, and beyond! It was a super busy night but they never failed to forget about our large party, which a lot of places lack. Very pleased with this establishment and this will forever be a place to dine at when visiting.
author: Ashley P.

description: Amazing food and service. The tacos al pastor were divine. Everything we ordered was exceptional, every course came in perfect succession. I've been thinking about this meal for the last 3 months since we visited SF. My wife and I both agree We'd fly back in just to have dinner here.
author: Sam G.

description:
Tacos that will rock your face off. 
The Al Pastor pork taco... yes yes yes. 

Loud ambience, good luck having a real conversation. But the place is sexy, dark and delicious. 

No sign on the door, just three seductive red lights.
author: Jimmy D.

description: Al pastor tacos are the beat north of Mexico. The asada and carnitas were good but al pastor took the prize. Very good service when we were there.
author: Brett W.

description: Stumbled across this place around lunch time while walking around SF.  I loved the decor in the place.  It was pretty busy with a lunch crowd but we were able to get a seat near a window and was impressed by how good the food was.  The guacamole and chips were well above average.  Seems like there are lots of mexican restuaraunts in SF, but this one really stands out.
author: Mike B.

description: I came across this place on Yelp. Best Mexican food hands down!. My husband and I came to San Francisco to celebrate the new year and my bday along with my two children ages 3 and 8. We were greeted at the door by the hostess and was surprised to not see any kids here so I was a bit concerned and asked if it was okay she was super nice and said yes of course they seated us right away and we're soo nice to my children and I. My husband and I ordered the endless mimosaas which were amazing . The food is literally the best tamales I've ever had. The meat in the tacos was so tender. Then I got a bday shot which was also delicious!!!! I got a little turnt and my children enjoyed there time here. Everyone was soo nice to us . I will definitely come back here !!!! Thank you guys for making us feel so welcomed . Soo good
author: Evelyn L.

description: If I could I would give this establishment 3.5. I love the ambience. The service was friendly and attentive. The food was good. The salsa was unique and fresh. The chips were o.k. we were given mostly slivers. The enchiladas were gorgeous but the flavor didn't own up to their presentation. But they were good. The prices are a bit high. And apparently when you order the tuna tacos you never know what spice level you will get. My friend who comes here a lot always asks about the spice level and the response is it varies. Aka hotter then hell or relatively spicey. There should be no excuse, I get that peppers vary on their heat but it is the chef's duty to try the pepper and determine how much to add. The service was acceptional, even gave us a complimentary shot. But the dish I ordered simply did not blow me away. I would come back to delve more into the menu. I have a feeling they might have some amazing dishes, just the one I ordered wasn't up to snuff.
author: Allie P.

description:
My wife and I live in telegraph hill and go to Don Pisto's nearly every week. It is our after work place, our before going out place, our  weekend lunch place, Sunday before work place. Lol. We love Don Pisto's. The chips, the tacos, the mussels... so good. Their salsa and guac is addicting AF. Sunday sangria, wine Wednesday and Monday michelada!

For real though. This place is awesome. The staff are very friendly and fun. The chips and salsa flow in an endless stream to your table.

Go to Don Pisto's. Go to Don Pisto's.
author: Taylor M.

description: Great tacos! The ambience is really good and is a great place to have dinner with your friends. Kind of bummed that they have limited vegetarian options and cocktails on the menu.
author: Hemant J.

description: Hipster joint.  Usually that means a bunch of small plates with many vegetarian options and lack of traditional soda (coke) in favor of alternative sodas (Jones=yuck). Despite the whole hipster thing, they must have an abuela hidden in the back making fresh tortillas without absolutely yummy meat fillings. They serve oysters there, which I thought was odd, but they were rather good. A bit pricey for a frat house decor, and hence one star deducted. But a solid choice.
author: David N.

description: Spent my birthday dinner here a while back. The crowd and ambience is pretty loud - which kind of makes it hard to chat with your table, but the food and drinks made it worth it
author: J B.

description: This place has a great atmosphere. Young crowd and good music. We were there for brunch and had the special of the day which was chilaquines.
author: JRolando M.

description: Second time here and great experience again. Even the limited menu is delicious. Staff is very friendly and food is on point. No license for hard liquor but that's no dealbreaker.
author: Frank M.

description: When I called on short notice for a nice table, they accommodated. When I arrived, they made special mention remembering my request..., and genuinely welcoming with a personal touch by Summer.  When the drinks and dinner were brought, there was a slight error, and Summer pointed out the error and requested she be allowed to replace the incorrect dish, and said the dinner was on them...mistakes happen often, this level of service, seldom... Thank you Summer :)
author: Rajiv K.

description:
Seated right away as it is super early for dinner in SF.  Great table right by the window.

Ordered the Ceviche Mexicano.  Really fresh salsa verde, awesome with tomatillos and a bit of jalapeño.

The ceviche was excellent as well with avocado, orange, poco de gallo and chile.

Reservations for six or more.  Uber it here, parking can be non existent.
author: Susan C.

description: I've been here a couple of times...mostly for brunch. Their $21 dollars 90 mins unlimited drinks are awesome! You get unlimited sangria, Margarita, and mimosa...you'll get wasted here for sure.  Tacos are overpriced. I always get the Carne asada tacos..14 bucks for 2 tacos. Make sure your whole party is there otherwise they would not seat you.
author: Caitlin P.

description: Sucks if you're a vegetarian. The enchilada I got was one of the worst I've ever had and there were only 1-2 other vegetarian options on the menu. Really no flavor. I love Mexican food and usually there is a floor on good/bad something will taste that is higher than most other cuisines. This went below it. The enchilada sauce just had no flavor and they drenched it dish in it.  Very little cheese. My friend's who are meat were mostly happy, though my friend who got the burger was pretty disappointed.
author: Umesh J.

description: Great food and great service. We got the squash quesadilla, I can highly recommend it! I didn't enjoy their ice tea that much, but that might just be because I'm used to them being so sweet. Overall a great experience.
author: Emil R.

description:
Five stars. Plus another TWO stars. If I could give them more stars, I would.

I LOVE this place.

Amazingly fresh, flavored, authentic, delicious food.

Fresh tortilla chips. Fresh green salsa. Perfectly seasoned food. Simple yet incredible dishes.

Great little place without a sign on the outside so you enter at your own risk... of having a great meal! I came here for dinner with my boyfriend and was greeted promptly and happily by the host (he was great!). We ordered margaritas (very good) and were served the complimentary chips (again, made fresh and were hot) and spicy green salsa. 

Our host explained that the menu is small since they have a small kitchen and that most items are on the menu to share. Well, OK!

We ordered the Spicy Tuna Tacos, Cheviche Mexicano, Carnitas pork tacos to share and was just enough food. Each dish was unique and mouth-watering. Again, so simple but some of the most flavorful. Prices were absolutely reasonable, too. Especially for the quality of the food.

It's a small little quaint place and then you go down the stairs to the restroom and it opens up to a large space perfect for private events- with a DJ set up and playing music.

I will be back. YUM!
author: Lori T.

description: Good god. This spot is the real place to eat great mex. music was great. Good beer. Fun place to go. It's hidden so you may walk past it. But go and grub here. Wow
author: Cliff C.

description:
This is my second time as Don Pisto's and I have to say- it was MUCH better than I remember.  The chips, salsa & guac are mucho Bueno! I LOVE their green salsa! Seriously, some of the best I've had. It's so fresh and delicious. The tacos while small, have great flavor!  We came with a larger group and ordered family style  so with that said - Each taco comes in an order of 2 tacos with two little tortillas per taco - I would recommend splitting each taco so you really get 4 outta your 2. That way you can order more variety and seem like you're getting more bang for your buck!  :).  The fish tacos were my favorite! The chorizo mussels are spicy but really yummy! They are also small mussels but there is a good amount. 

Service was great - at the end of our meal our waitress brought a round of little samples of their blended jalapeño cucumber margaritas. The table loved them. Thought that was such a nice touch!
author: Michelle S.

description:
The food lived up to the high reviews! My sis and I were in the mood for mexican and found Don Pisto's on Yelp. We walked in on a Tuesday night but because there was a crowd and loud hip hip music playing, it felt much more like a Saturday night out. There was a 20 minute wait for a table for two so we took a couple seats that'd just freed up at the bar.

We ordered fish tacos, pork tamales, and the pollo asado. The food was great! Even the complimentary green salsa and chips were excellent. I also tried the wine Margarita, as this place only serves beer/wine... something my sis informed was common in SF. They did their best with the margarita but I was definitely missing real tequila. 

The service was good and everything came out in a timely manor. I recommend making a reservation since this place was bustling even on a Tuesday night. 

**Make reservations 
**Probably too loud for kids
author: Brandi H.

description: I've never had a better chips salsa, it has an amazing taste with a hint of sourness in the right way, wow. Also I loved the oysters, spicy tuna tacos are so fresh, spicy and enjoyable. Finally the chicken plate we ordered was juicy, I highly recommend this spot! The staff is super friendly too
author: Sarah H.

description:
Been to DP's a handful of times, most recently with a group of 10 for my wife's birthday.  Their servers were on point and never made us wait too long for a refill on drinks, bottomless or otherwise.  Food was bomb dot com (it always is) if a bit expensive, as I'm sure is widely documented on Yelp.  Only hiccup wasn't their fault-the kitchen didn't get our table's 3 orders of tamales out with the rest of the food.

REALLY wish they had REAL Margaritas, it's the only thing this "Mexican" place lacks.

Give Don Pisto's a shot, even if you can't take one... It is the place to go for a birthday party or anything involving a larger group. They really do take great care of you.
author: Kyle C.

description: I was able to make a reservation for 8 people for NYE. We ordered just about one of everything on the menu. I'd recommend the Chorizo and mussels and fish tacos. I'd skip the spicy tuna tacos, but everything else was great.
author: Megan Q.

description:
We initially drove by this restaurant by accident because it wasn't well marked with a sign but after close inspection of the address we realized it was the place we were looking for.

Ambiance is nice. Exposed brick walls, dark wood tables and chairs, and low lighting. We were in the corner and it was a bit too dark and the music was on the louder side but it didn't diminish our experience.  

The chips and salsa were delicious! Chips tasted fresh and were the perfect amount of crispiness. Salsa was a bit spicy but it wasn't overpowering. My party enjoyed it - as well as the guacamole we ordered.  We ordered a pitcher of margaritas (made with Agave wine not tequila). I wouldn't recommend the margaritas; very salty even when drinking with a straw to avoid the rim.   The consensus was that it wasn't worth the $32. 

Not many entree options for a vegetarian. I ordered the enchiladas without meat and it was delicious.  The food did not disappoint anyone in our group. 

The service was good but we did tell the waitress ahead of time that we would like 3 separate checks. She said we could just tell her what we want on each check when she brings the full check. We divided up the meals and drinks and she said we actually needed to do the math and tell her the amount we wanted charged to each card. This annoyed our party when we asked in advance and it seemed like she could have split the check much faster.
author: Christy W.

description: Great food. Try the micheladas and the mussels with chorizo. Good service as well. Best Mexican in the city.
author: Sanjay R.

description:
Order and share as you go - Don Pisto's is the perfect place to catch up with some friends and try a bunch of dishes (as long as you don't mind having to talk loudly). The servers are super friendly and happy to give recommendations. I ended up coming here on a weekday evening with a friend and between the two of us, we shared guac, carnitas tacos, spicy tuna tacos, and calamari. 

Chips/Salsa: salsa is spicy. Chips are a bit thicker than I'm used to, but very fresh and crispy!
Guac: nothing special, would have liked more lime and less onion. 
Carnitas tacos: double wrapped with a corn tortilla. The pork is amazingly tender and you get a decent amount of it. I do wish the meat had more flavor - I ended up adding some green salsa for an extra kick.
Spicy tuna tacos: crunchy taco shells filled to the brim with spicy raw tuna. My second favorite dish of the night
Calamari: outstanding. Comes served on three skewers atop a bed of vinegary coleslaw. The citrus tenderizes the grilled squid and gives it a great taste. Definitely a must order!

In total, we spent about $50 plus tip on the meal. A bit pricey for Mexican food, but still not too bad for SF!
author: Helen Z.

description:
This place was awesome. We saw Uber after Uber dropping patrons off. 
We both got the "mimosas" which was bubbly with watermelon agua fresca. I didn't love it, but I also couldn't stop drinking it.
The chips and salsa were ridiculous. That salsa. So spicy!
I got the pork tamale with poached eggs and my hubs got the breakfast burrito.
Both were awesome.
Only con, no dessert! Our very friendly server recommended a great italian bakery down the street though, so all was not lost.
We'd definitely go back.
author: Lauren J.

description: Been to this restaurant Twice in the last two weeks - it's LOUD - I asked the hostess and waitress if they could please turn down the music just a smudge and they said "NO the owner won't let us." They also acknowledged they get this complaint all the time. If you are playing the music for your "paying" customers enjoyment and the customer asks you to lower the music to relieve their headache - doesn't make sense to say no. We all left with a headache from having to literally yell our conversation and then we decided to just eat silently because it hurt to talk. LOUD ass music definitely ruined the experience I don't remember what the food was like. Was busy worrying about whether my eardrums would bust.
author: Phantom Of Yel P.

description:
Went here on a Saturday night with my boyfriend while on a trip to San Francisco. This was recommended to us by a local and we felt like locals during our experience - exactly what we were looking for! 

We were seated right away and had great service all throughout the night. The food was excellent and we were not rushed through the meal. We were very satisif with the decision to have dinner here.
author: Jessica S.

description:
I really wanted to like this place.

Pluses - my fish tacos were great, they use real lemon juice in their drinks and the food came fast.

Cons - it was LOUD, and I definitely didn't feel valued as a customer.  The food quantity was tiny for the price as well.

We came as a group of 4.  They don't seat people until all parties are present.  Not a big deal.  We placed our order and the food came almost immediately.

And just as immediately we felt like they were trying to shoo us out. We'd barely started eating our appetizer (guacamole) before they started asking us on the minute if they could retract our appetizer plates.

We'd barely finished our main courses before they took our plates and our forks, before we'd finished eating the shared appetizers.

This all happened so fast we hadn't even finished our first round of drinks.  And then they gave us our bill.

Feeling unsettled by this experience, my dining companion asked to speak to the waitress.  We meant well, just wanting to say this was how we felt expecting to just pass on the feedback.  What took us aback was how defensive she sounded.  She basically confirmed that they wanted us out because patrons were waiting (we didn't see anyone outside), said they were supposed to turn us over quickly, then followed up by asking if she could take our remaining plate.

Talk about making us feel unwelcome!  I will not be returning.
author: Pokin Y.

description: Service was great, especially for San Francisco. The guacamole was delicious. The sashimi had so much flavor! Reasonably priced. Very filling. The ribs were delicious. Literally falling off the bone. I left my phone there and as we walked down the street we hear STEPHANNNNIEEE. Thanks so much to my sever for catching us.
author: Stephanie K.

description: The music is so loud and we sat under the speaker and was very uncomfortable so we asked them to turn down a bit and they rejected. We made a reservation and they still put us in basement event there was no one in the main floor. Even we made the reservation, they didn't open the door on time. Food was good but I feel the store doesn't care customers anymore after they got good reviews nowadays
author: Anya C.

description:
I went there with a couple of friends for brunch on Sunday. Be prepared to wait for a bit. Not sure how long the wait usually is but when I went there, we waited for about 30mins-ish. 

FOOD!
I had carnitas tacos and they were really delicious. Some of the pieces were crispy just the way I like it. I could taste some fat too. It was just enough fat to bring out the taste of meat. I heard they had secret spicy sauce but they didn't offer and I didn't know it then. I had my tacos with some lime and tapatio. It was divine. The chips were also very delicious. The sauce for the chips was very unique. It has lots of minced onion and a little sour and spicy. 

I will definitely go back for more.
author: Fong C.

description: Super cozy with good food and reasonable prices! Drinks are on the expensive side but other than that I enjoyed my experience
author: Rana K.

description: Everything here is delicious! Granted, I've only tried the guacamole and fish tacos (spectacular), along with the Sangria and Bad B%#^$ shot, but everything else I've seen looks delicious too. Love this place!!! They only serve beer and wine so their margaritas are made from agave wine and both my friends who ordered this loved it!!! Get the guac, get the fish tacos!!! Also, they gave me a shot and a glass of sangria on the house for my birthday so thanks a million!!!! Will definitely be back!!!
author: Molly B.

description: Guacamole is so good! It's fresh and tasty, I kept eating the chips and guac and not the other food.. And the tacos and the lobster are amazing. Bottomless mimosas for brunch for $21 so that's always great.
author: Jeana Y.

description: The food was great--the grilled calamari and salmon sashimi was outstanding. I also loved the tomatillo salsa and fresh chips. Skip the margaritas--they aren't made with tequila and they lacked flavor. They sat us in a dark corner and refused to split the check when we asked at the beginning--we did not appreciate calculating the amounts with tax after dinner.
author: Finley A.

description: Drinks: AWFUL, Service: AMAZING, Food: TASTY and to top it off my sever was hot AF, wish he could top me off
author: Alex M.

description:
We came here for a later lunch, though from all these awesome reviews it seems like we missed out on an awesome brunch party! 
I could have made an entire meal out of the chips and salsa here...I could have married that salsa and started an entirely new life with it by my side forever. Seriously the best salsa ever, I think we got 2 refills and I was thiiiiis close to asking for some to-go. 
As other people have also mentioned, this place isn't the best value, but it's in a trendy area so I wasn't shocked by the prices. Two small tacos (with a good amount of meat, but still) was $9. I was pretty satisfied but my boyfriend was on the hunt for some street pizza less than an hour later. 
Other PSA: the margaritas are made with wine here, not tequila. I would definitely recommend the sangria instead! The Bad Bitch shots were also spicy and delicious, and necessary to order if only for the name. I can't wait to come back here for brunch!
author: Delaynie K.

description: Amazing staff here. Service was good and so was the food. Lobster was very unique. Will definitely be back!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Environment is a little dark, they don't have a full bar.  Drinks were wine based as they don't have a full bar.  We ordered the pollo asado which was fair.  The carne asada was excellent.  Service was good.
author: Sahar A.

description:
Even though they will accommodate big groups, I would never, ever recommend gathering one here. Went about two weeks ago for a surprise birthday party (which they held in the basement room). We'd been told that they would only provide a set menu for a group our size. Since I'm pregnant, I requested vegetarian options because ceviche and calamari are inedible. But when we got there, there was no provision made for the pregnant ladies or vegetarians, despite the fact we'd asked especially. I was told that I could order an extra dish from their regular menu, but would still be liable to pay $60 for the set menu, even though I couldn't really eat it. In other words, I'd still pay at least $70 for a basic dish.

I pleaded with the waitress and in the end she bought a few bean tacos and didn't charge us extra. But even the people who could eat anything on the set menu were left hungry! There was hardly any food for 30 people; way, way under what you would expect to receive. Also the beef tacos were insanely spicy which is surprising when you're catering for a large group.

I still can't believe I had to shell out $60+ for some nachos and tacos and a glass of lemonade, and left the dinner with gnawing hunger. Also the ambience in the basement sucks. Not coming back.
author: Rebecca B.

description: I can't add much more to 1535 reviews besides corroborating what most folks have already noted. The food here is reasonably good - whether the tacos, guacamole, or salsas (beware, some of them pack quite a punch) - or heavier, meatier specials. The drinks are also on point, as is the service. In a neighborhood that can be a bit touristy and a bit lacking in food options that are truly in with the times, Don Pisto's is a simply a decent, solid bet.
author: Vincent L.

description: Their calamari was excellent slaw was perfection cute quiet of the beaten path of busy San Fran and I must go guacamole was great too and I'm from so cal I know good Mexican food when I see it!
author: Janay P.

description: Amazing place for brunch! Definitely on the pricey side but worth it if you're looking for a good brunch spot. The margaritas were a big size and strong. The huevos rancheros were amazing and the potatoes they came with were so good.
author: Samantha A.

description: Great salsa. They only do like margaritas. They didn't have chicken tacos which I thought was really odd because they do tacos just not chicken ones but they do serve chicken in a different dish. Overall it was good. We went New Year's Eve night.
author: Vanita N.

description:
Went back over the weekend for my pal's birthday brunch and experienced some truly poor service from the host Herman. This guy was rude from the get go. He acted like seating my party without everyone being there was a huge favor to us, but it turned out to be helpful for him since he had another party right behind us (he told us that). It's like, bro, you're not pulling any strings you're just doing your job. 

Our waitress was great, very sweet and accommodating. We actually offered to move since some of our friends bailed last minute, but she said we were fine where we were, so we enjoyed our food and drinks, wished our girl a happy birthday, everyone was in high spirits. 

Cut to the end of the meal where our BFF Herman comes back CONTINUOUSLY telling us we had to move. We were a little taken aback since it had only been an hour m, but we asked to just pay our bill and finish our drinks. Herman got super sassy, told us he was the manager and, to my surprise, became even more rude. He came back a third time to really lay down the law and tell us we had to leave to make room for another party. 

Sorry DP, I will not be back anytime soon. People like your host should not be in a customer facing position. He was rude and pissy anytime he came around and I really don't appreciate that.
author: Crystal C.

description:
First time visiting Don Pisto's.

4 stars overall for the food. It was tasty and well-prepared, albeit a bit over-priced. The complimentary house-made chips and salsa are delicious (5/5). I ordered the shrimp tacos which were excellent but $13 for two small tacos is a bit too much even if they were quite filling (though I do have a dainty appetite). My partner ordered a chicken dish that was delicious but also over-priced at $18. 

FWIW, I always favor quality over quantity, but I felt that the value wasn't quite there at Don Pisto's. The portion sizes were fine. I didn't want more food for the price but rather the same amounts of food at slightly lower price points.  

1 star because it was overwhelmingly noisy. I had to all but shout to be heard by my partner. Not a good place for an intimate conversation, that's for sure. 

3.5 stars for the service. It was friendly enough but it took a long time before we were able to place our orders even though we were ready to order as soon as we sat down and it also took a long time before we received them (our table could've been turned over much more quickly if our orders were taken when we were ready). 

Also, my order was served long after my partner's (about 10 minutes later based on photographic date-stamping). In fairness, there was a very large group present when we were there (~15 people or so) and perhaps they were slammed. Since this was our first visit, I don't know if the delays were typical or not.

5 stars because our waitress proactively offered me a margarita "on her" as an apology for the delay in bringing out my order even though I hadn't complained about it. That was a very nice gesture on her part and much appreciated :D. 

2.5 stars for the drinks. I had a sangria and a "margarita" (in quotation marks because it was made with agave wine and not tequila and so not what I'd call a true margarita). They were just a-okay. The sangria at Limon Rotisserie is my sangria benchmark; it's $2 less and much tastier (more nuanced in terms of spicing and -- I'll admit it -- a boozier bang for the buck). 

Would we go back to Don Pisto's again? Honestly, probably not. I live in the Mission, my partner lives in North Beach and we each spend quite a bit of time in our respective 'hoods. We were in North Beach today and I wanted to try something new as we'd been to our favorite spot in that area (Fior d'Italia) just last Friday and I'd had Don Pisto's bookmarked for awhile. 

I'm a taco fan so Don Pisto's was a decent choice for me, but my partner is a burrito nut so the Mission is naturally going to have a lot more places that will please both of us when one of us is craving Mexican food. 

No regrets -- the food really was very good and I'm glad I finally tried Don Pisto's. I would recommend it if you happen to be in that part of the city and are willing to pay just a bit too much for for very tasty food, but I wouldn't go out of the way to go there. I liked the food a lot but I can't honestly say that it's craveable enough to be worthy of a repeat visit.
author: Maya B.

description: Came here for brunch with a large group. The place doesn't have a sign outside, so you kind of have to just notice the doorway to find it. The ambiance of the place is cool and chill. They have salsa and guac for the tables, and both were actually pretty good. Their menu is Mexican food, and it actually seemed mostly authentic with a twist, and I loved that. Their agua fresca mimosa's were really delicious - that day they were serving Pineapple. So refreshing and light tasting. I had the ham and poblano scramble and it was not disappointing at all. Others had the chilequile's (which were the special) and tacos, and everyone said their food was really good. No one looked like they had a bad plate. My food was forgotten about. For some reason they didn't make my food when they submitted our table's order. But they made up for the lateness of my food with giving me another mimosa, which I was not mad about. All in all, it's a cool place, with good food, and good service.
author: Carina R.

description:
I'd really give this place 3.5 stars. I bumped it down because it was super loud (due to loud music being played. We came here after checking out Coit Tower and it was a decent meal. Catching the tail end of weekend brunch, we got some tacos which were great! The salsa and chips are awesome, too, and they just keep bringing you refills until you ask them to stop! That's my jam!

The atmosphere is laid back and comfortable, reminiscent of a dive bar or your corner pub. I could definitely get down with coming back if we're in the area.
author: Jess A.

description:
This place is worst in terms of reservations. I placed a reservation for 13 people for Sunday on a Friday evening. But on Sunday morning instead of confirming my reservation, they say that they dont have me down and moreover I have come over to the restaurant to do the booking and decide the food menu beforehand. Nowhere I have seen such a reservation policy which compels me to visit the restaurant and then reserve the table. 

Absolutely NOT recommnedable to others.

NEVER coming here for their attitud.
author: Vaibhav A.

description:
If you're ever looking for a boozy bottomless brunch in the city that takes reservations during the weekends (which is very rare in SF), Don Pistos is the spot! You do have to have at least 6 guests or more though. My girls and I sadly didn't reach the minimum number to make resis, so we did end up having to wait about an hour for a table on a Sunday around noon. The plus side of it was we were able to get a head start on the $19 bottomless drinks while waiting at the bar. Their bottomless allows you to switch between their housemade sangria, margaritas and/or aqua fresco mimosas...talk about Sunday funday!

The bar area was small and seats were already taken, so two of my friends and I stood at the end with our drinks. I felt like we were in the way with the servers and other workers, but they were polite about getting by and didn't seem bothered. The bartender kept an eye on our drinks and would refill our glasses even before we were half empty lol it was truly bottomless and I probably lost count of how many I had, so it is really worth the $19.

Once we were finally seated, we decided to order a bunch of plates to share among the 4 of us. We went with the chorizo and baked eggs, diabla wings, fish, shrimp and carne asada tacos (two per order). Our server also gave us a side of chips and a green salsa that was pretty spicy, but too good to not eat! The serving portions were on the smaller side, so even if we got to try each of the dishes we didn't necessarily get stuffed but full enough to hold our bottomless drinks down lol. 

The food was good, but not the best. You can obviously find better tacos in SF at even cheaper prices. The diabla wings could've been passed on cus they were super tiny. The spiciness sure was there but each wing barely had meat on it and was probably the size of my pinky.

The service was pretty fast and attentive esp since it started to slow down after the brunch rush was over. I applaud them for never letting our mimosas and sangrias get empty haha. The food isn't really memorable, but that $19 bottomless deal can't be beat!
author: Georgina G.

description: For starters- I have never given a bad review or bad tip to anyone. But this server was the worst, the food was decent no doubt but our mood was entirely spoiled by the servers behavior. To start with we ordered our food and she said " I don't think so you have any idea that it is a sharing place" with a super mean tone. I mean isn't that what she is here for to tell us that!! And then she literally snatched the menus from our hands, without even letting us finish our sentences! And after that she did not ask us even once if we needed anything! Like the entire experience was just the worst and the server had the meanest behavior! It just spoilt our entire evening. I don't know she was just stupid or racist! But whatever it was I will not go there again!
author: Noor A.

description: I loved this place, great service & great food. We had the enchiladas and the spicy prawns. Over all it was fantastic, definitely will come back here again.
author: Berlin M.

description:
Came here on a random Monday night with a party of 6 and we were seated right away. The atmosphere in the restaurant is fun, high energy with dim lighting and great music (hip hop) cranking in the background. This is the perfect spot for a date night or group dinner. 

We started with drinks - Bad Bitch shots and pitchers of margaritas. Both were great, margaritas were really good and not overly sweet, with a good amount of tequila. We decided to order a ton of different items and just share. The carniatas tacos were by far the best tacos I've ever eaten! I have no idea how they marinate their meat, but it's perfection wrapped in an AMAZING tortilla. All of the sides are full of flavor as well (beans, rice, guac). Oh and the green salsa is an absolute must! This is my new favorite Mexican joint! Can't wait to check out the bottomless mimosa Sunday brunch.
author: Krystal C.

description:
This is by far my favorite restaurant in San Francisco.  

Just a heads up, if you haven't been before it's a little hard to find. There isn't much signage - only a big door.  The area around Don Pistos is really nice as well. We typically will hit up one of the bars on the block for a pre-dinner drink if there is a wait.

Favorites here are the ribs [a special], their guacamole, the al pastor tacos and, of course, the sangria. I've tried at least half the menu and everything has been great. 

Highly recommend this place. You will not be disappointed!
author: Katie R.

description:
Five for the tacos, three for the burger, one for the volume of the music downstairs. Having to line up for the one single bathroom just because three drunk post mimosa brunch sorority girls stumbled in together is already bad enough. Them screaming at you to apologize over the music is even worse. 

I got the fish tacos, which I highly recommend. They were buttery, soft and melted in my mouth. Really fresh fish and cooked to a tender perfection! A generous fish:everything else ratio which I always appreciate. 

The burger, which was listed on the 7x7 list was a disappointment. The patty was deliciously marinated and the guacamole was solid but there didn't seem to be any real effort trying to marry those flavors together. If we're supposed to be wowed just because there's guac on a burger, then Don Pisto's needs more imagination - maybe some inspiration from Bob's Burgers? Cause Don's burger just isn't what I'd imagine Bob's "Sweet Home Avocado" like.
author: Celestine A.

description:
Ugh. I was really disappointed when I came on a beautiful Sunday with some of my friends (9 people). The week of I made reservations for 9 people for 12pm. We got there at 12pm and were not seated until 12:35pm. Okay...fine I can handle that; a lot of people really like Don Pistos. 

We were seated downstairs - not a problem. Don't get me wrong, I'm a loud person but it was very loud downstairs to the point that within our table, we had to scream to hear each other. The service was somewhat spotty - our drinks took 30 minutes and we had to refill our own water. Sigh. Oh! And for bottomless mimosas...they didn't have mimosas. Another big sigh,

The food was alright - nothing to write home about.

I'm really sad I didn't have a great time at Don Pistos because I've heard such rave reviews about their brunch. I've been here for dinner and the food is good but I'm not sure if I'll ever come back for brunch. :(
author: Stephanie W.

description: If you are in North Beach, you must, I repeat, YOU MUST not miss this place.  Chips...amazing! Guacamole...divine! Asada Tacos...tasty beefy goodness that will rival any asada out there! Al Pastor...INCREDIBLE deliciousness in every bite!
author: Will K.

description:
Great guacamole.
Great tacos.
Great specials...like lobster.
You should get the lobster whenever it's available.  Trust.

Then there's the great drinks, which includes their own sangria.  

Yes, it gets crowded & loud.  Without a reservation you will have to wait for perhaps a very long time.  Make a reservation!  Or, if it's a last minute decision, keep your sense of humor & be patient.  

Over the years I've gone for dinner & I've gone for brunch.
I've gone with a reservation & without a reservation.
I've gone for date night & I've gone w a group.  
And you know what?  Every time I've gone to DP's, I've had great food & a great time.  

Every aspect, from the first sip of your drink, & the first dip of your chip, is a win.  

My last visit was totally impromptu.  The hostess was just a sweetheart.  She took my name & number, said it would be about an hour & a half, & she would call me when our table was ready.  We went to get drinks down the street.  Eventually my man & I decided to eat elsewhere, but she was just a rockstar about it.  Apologetic, positive, & professional, she told me she was sorry we wouldn't be making it, & that she hopes to see me again really soon.  Simple & sweet.  It's the little things.  

Pete, the owner, is also a sweetheart.  Uber personable & generous to maybe a fault.  He has since opened another, smaller joint down the street on Grant, (Pisto's), as well as the Chubby Noodle chain (one is a pop up inside Amante's about 2 blocks away, the other's on Lombard).  The guy clearly knows what he's doing.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Visited Don Pistos on a trip to San Francisco. Heads up, its super busy so plan your night accordingly. We waited for about half an hour and were offered a seat in the basement. I thought the basement would be nice and quiet for a visit, holy I was wrong. It's like a night club down there, no exaggeration. We ate our food as quick as possible because we actually could not sit and visit with the rest of our party. 

Would return and sit upstairs next time. Otherwise the food was great, tacos are my favourite, the fish taco was a highlight.
author: M S.

description:
First time visiting this place. Don't expect to ser a sign with the name of the restaurant like the other 1,000 restaurants in the area. It's weird, but they only have the building number, so use a GPS to find this place. Although the wait was a bit longer than I thought, the generally positive reviews granted a visit. I was initially told that a spot by the bar will be opened in 15 minutes, however I was given a table after a 35-minute wait.

I ordered a Corona, which was served very cold in a super large bottle. They serve complementary chips and salsa, however I also ordered the steak tacos (2 per order) and two sides; Mexican rice and beans. 

The Good:
The beer was simply great, extremely cold. A bit pricey at $11 per bottle, but it was cold and fresh, so I didn't mind the price. Phenomenal chips and salsa. The green salsa is beyond good, it is heaven on earth. The steak tacos were tasty, juicy and the meet fresh and very tender. The tacos ($12) were really small, however they were super tasty. About my two sides; the beans were the best I have ever tried!! The Mexican rice; oh Lord, read the bad section for details. The service was outstanding. The hostess was friendly to all waiting customers and those calling on the phone. She had a smile and seemed genuine happy. My waitress (Gabriela) was also happy, very informative, stopping by regularly without becoming a distraction. I sensed just a bit of a rush to order initially, but the restaurant is really busy. The minute a table is empty, other staff members jump on it to get it ready for the next customer. The cohesiveness among staff members was noticeable; teamwork was second to none with one goal in mind, provide an outstanding customer service experience. Nice job Gabriela and teammates!!

The Bad:
The Mexican rice was the most horrible thing I have ever tried in my life. Kind of odd, but my two sides were served right after the beer & before the tacos. I immediately noticed an odd odor coming from the Mexican rice, but decided to give it a shot. I honestly thought it was rotten...it was something beyond description. Just to make sure I wasn't confused, I scooped another sample from the bottom of the cup, again, horrible smell and even worse taste. So I put it aside and asked my waitress Gabriela. She smiled at first and explained they use Yukatan rice, which is prepare by backing it first...definitely not your normal or standard Mexican "yellow" rice. Why they choose to serve a rice that requires an acquired taste, is beyond me. Bottom line; don't order it if you don't want to ruin your dinning experience. I had to drink lots of corona to get that awful taste out of my mouth. Ok enough of that; the last area for improvement will be the music, great music though, but too loud. The place is extremely loud, in fact, you'll have a very hard time having a normal conversation without having to yell at each other.

Overall:
Great dining experience, could have been outstanding had it not been for the Mexican (Yukatan) rice they serve. Great decor and ambience, except for the noise level. The common areas and bathrooms are kept very clean. Outstanding customer service!!!
author: Cesar L.

description: Terrific food, great drinks and exceptional service. I will visit here every time I come to San Francisco.
author: Owen G.

description: Had a great dinner in a cool little spot. Would not change a thing. Each of our dinners tasted great and loved the quirky staff.
author: Keith G.

description:
**3.5 STARS**

TLDR - good but overpriced 'upscale' Mexican food - but good drinks which are fairly priced.
The restaurant is also just a bit too cramped and noisy for me to fully enjoy the experience.
I think this place is popular mainly because folks living in the North Beach probably just need an outlet to drink margaritas and sangrias.. not many options around here to do so. So pricey! If I'm going to over-pay for a taco, I'll go to Tacolicious a few blocks down.

Food notes -- 

My favorites were:
The complementary chips (salsa was meh)
Chicken tortilla soup ($14) - feeds about 3-4 
Al pastor tacos ($12) - for TWO.. good and fresh (nice touch with the pineapple!) but just expensive, WHY?!
Hamburguesa ($13) - slightly bigger than a slider, and again, a delicious and a bit different with the guac and a spritz of lime but just expensive for what it is...
Sangria ($8 per glass) - one of the better sangrias I've had in the city
Margarita ($8 per glass) - tall and strong! 

Skip:
Mexican sashimi ($14) - 4-5 pieces =_= -- ripoff and bland
author: Emily C.

description:
Any type of Mexican cuisine is automatically a star in my book. However good Mexican food is something else. This spot hits it! From the cool vibe with the music and hidden entrance and the great service it's all amazing! 

First off right when you sit down they give you chips with salsa verde. The chips are legit addicting so watch out. I went through two bowls almost by myself. They are fried and salted to perfection. 

The menu itself is simple and to the point. On the night we went they had a whole lobster for two with tortillas and a corn on the cob for special. We didn't order it, but it looked delicious. The tacos are a must! The cameronoes and carne asada are super yummy. The guacomole is also a must. We didn't have a chance to everything, but from the looks of the tables around is it looked amazing. 

The service is on point. Our sever was super sweet and the staff was attentive. Always had water and asked if we needed anything. 

Music was popping, the decor is real simple and chill and overall it's a cool place to go.
author: Krizia C.

description: Batting 1.000!!! Came here for an early dinner before the Super Bowl game.  Decided to try a few more different dishes and as expected the food was amazing! Got the special which was fall off the bone ribs, porkchop (a must), carnitas and camarones tacos, ceviche (the best I've ever tasted), and chicken wing diabla.  If you haven't been here you are missing the best in north beach! Ditch the Italian and go Mexican!
author: Bernie H.

description:
I would rate Don Pisto's ten stars if I could. The location is great, staff was awesome and polite, and it was absolutely the best Mexican food I've ever had. Red Iguana in SLC doesn't compare.

We had the lobster which was a seasonal special. The pork tomatoes were also amazing.

GO HERE NOW!
author: Brian O.

description:
I visited this place based on my friend's recommendation. There are certainly some good things about this restaurant. First, the quality of the food is fine, for instance, the calamari appetizer and the meat are all well cooked. (However, I would say the taste of most of the stuff I tried are a little heavier than I expected). Second, the decoration is nice, the minimalistic design helps you to focus on the meal and whoever you are eating with. There is no unnecessary distraction at all. However, if you come in the evening, beware that the light is very dim, which can make it a little hard to read the menu... but don't be hesitated to ask for help as the servers are all highly attentive and are always ready to describe the menu. 

Having said that, I just feel the menu is quite overpriced. I mean, by downtown SF standard, maybe it is norm, but consider the quality and portion of the food, it just makes you feel that you are not spending your money wisely. That is, unless you live or work in the neighborhood, can't drive and must stick in the area for whatever legit reason, there is really no other reason for you to drive all the way from out of town to visit. You can get similar or even better Mexican food in a lot of places.
author: Ki L.

description:
Bottomless sangria, margaritas, and mimosas? You can interchange them you say? Ummm...sure! haha

From the three, my favorites were the margs and the sangria. The waitress was really nice and kept filling up the cups! The food was great for lunch. Went on a Saturday and the wait wasn't long at all but the place does fill up.

Had a pork tamale with poached eggs and we tried the chorizo scramble. The chips and salsa were delicious! The pork tamale was done right, but may have used more pork. Th texture of the masa was good and the eggs were poached perfectly.

Good service, fun atmosphere, and awesome drinks. Go here for brunch!
author: Natalie M.

description:
Location: in the beautiful and busy North Beach; I've never driven here (nor do I want to with those hills!) but it's probably a 5-7$ uber ride from Montgomery Bart. I've gone twice - once on a weekday lunch and it was dead silent. Once on a weekend brunch and I'm pretty sure I almost went deaf. It is SO loud and rowdy and most people around you are on their 6th cup of bottomless sangrias.. 

Service: pretty good at checking in and giving recommendations; you can leave your name and walk around, they will call you so you can show up within 5(i think) minutes to claim your table! 

Food: I think they recently changed their hours to no longer serve weekday lunches (really sad because their elote GAVE ME LIFE). Shrimp + carnitas tacos are both freaking out of this freaking universe. Chips and salsa are amazing too. I love you don pistos. I'll be back.
author: Shelley K.

description:
Ive heard so many good things about Don Pistos. Honestly not sure what the hype is all about. The food is average in flavor, creativity, freshness and value. 3stars. 

The place is packed, which I don't mind, but the servers rush you to finish. Our plates were repeatedly cleared abruptly upon finishing a dish and on one occasion while there was still a bite left. 2stars because I like to finish chewing before my plate is removed. 

It wasn't great value for money. Will be looking elsewhere next time taco fever hits.
author: Matt R.

description:
I was tasked with finding a restaurant for 6 colleagues who had various eating habits/preferences. It needed to be reasonably priced near our hotels. And for me at least, it needed to be non-touristy and actually good.

MISSION IMPOSSIBLE?!

Ok, it took me like 6 hours to narrow it down to this place. BUT it took like 1 minute to ask for a reservation online and they accomodated our party a week out. OK now we're talking! They confirm the day of, we show up, easy peasy! We order drinks, eat some salsa (very good) and guac (not my favorite but not bad) and then order our dishes. And, what a miracle, everyone in my party had raves for everything! Two folks got the chicken special which they loved, another got the pollo asado which he devoured, my al pastor tacos were probably the best I've ever had, another liked her shrimp tacos.

WIN!
author: Emily V.

description:
YUM. Everything I ate here was spectacular. The salsa verde was spicyyyy and I'm good with spice. 

Everything else:
Guac - good
Ceviche - better than expected (I don't really like ceviche)
Calamari - I prefer it fried but it had good flavor
Carnitas taco - YES
Carne asad taco - YES
Chicken- oh yes

All the meats were flavorful, tender, and overall superb.
author: Kelly G.

description: Stopped in here for dinner while in town for a conference...so glad we did!! Everything was so good! We ordered a pitcher of margaritas and started off with the awesome diabla wings...delicious! Perfect amount of hot and spicy.  For dinner, we ordered an assortment of tacos. All were delicious! Try the unique Al Pastor tacos..grilled pork ribs and pineapple.  Chips and green salsa were also great.
author: Larry L.

description:
We met up with friends from out of town who were staying in the neighborhood. This was a really disappointing experience, which is a real shame because the food was actually pretty good.

So they don't take reservations, that's fine, I can deal with that. We checked in with our party of five and were quoted 45 minutes - 1 hour so we decided to go to a bar and grab a drink, since the host will call you when your table is ready.

At the 30 minute mark, we had just ordered our drinks and the phone rang to let us know our table was almost ready. So we chugged our drinks as rushed back only to be told our table had been given to somebody else, yep, she actually told us we took too long and gave our table away. We were also told that a table was paying and we would be seated there shortly. At this point we were at the 45 minute mark, so we had gone from having a table early, to no table at all to now at the quote we were given.

20 minutes later, we were still standing outside in the cold, waiting for our table. The host, kindly offered to buy a round of drinks for our party which was great. We were able to step inside and take a seat at the bar... Until, a server asked my friends if we were waiting for a table and if we were could we move so people could sit at the bar to eat. WHAT?! So we are now over our quote, invited into the place to enjoy a drink at the bar but we then get told to move!?!!

Then, the part that really got my blood boiling. We were (sitting until we got told to move) standing by the bar, having finished our drinks, yep getting close to and hour and a half of waiting, we were shown to our table, a table for four, with a place setting on the corner to accommodate the fifth person. While right next to us and table for six sits empty. I asked the host, if we could sit there instead. Her response was, "No..." followed by something along the lines of: we can use that for a two-top and a three-top, so it makes sense for us to seat you here and use that for two parties. HANG ON A MINUTE, there are two empty tables of four there, one you are trying to squeeze five people at and the one next to it that sat empty the ENTIRE TIME we ate dinner.

So, when I questioned the reason she gave for not seating us at the bigger table, she kept saying no and that it was the table for four or nothing. Whatever, at this point we probably should have just left but I shut up and sat down. The server went over the menu, oysters of the day, ceviche of the day, family/tapas style dining, we ordered our next drinks, and appetizers. After our food comes to the table and we are eating. The host offers us the chance to move to a different table, a table for 8/10 (not sure) that had a party seated at the other end. By this point over 50% of the restaurants tables were empty, what it is with this place and seating small groups at "communal" tables when there are other tables open? We had food and were in the middle of eating so chose to stay where we were.

I have 10 years of hospitality experience and so many things were terrible here. Being made to move from the bar, being sat at a table too small for our party, being table our table had been given away, being told they need a bigger table to seat two parties when we have waiting 90 minutes, and no sign of a manager to stop by and apologize. There was some blonde haired lady walking around and socializing with various employees but not once did you talk to our party.

I will NEVER come back here, which is a shame because I liked the ambience and the food was pretty good but this service was painful!
author: Sarah S.

description: Great sangria, great portions and great tasting mexican fare. A cool, hip, non descript building houses this small mexican beauty. Wait staff and bar tender were really cool and nice. Food was top notch and tasty. If you're  looking for good Mexican outside the Mission district, head over here, you won't be disapponted.
author: Lawrence G.

description:
$19 bottomless Sangria, mimosa, and margaritas. They make their mimosas a little differently with some type of Aqua fresco, which makes them distinguishable. One of my friends didn't really care for the mimosas, so I guess it depends what you are into. Be careful, they are on the more sugary end of the spectrum . We didn't try the margaritas, but the sangria was decent. The great thing is that you can interchange your beverage choices throughout your 90 minutes, allowing you to intensify your day by mixing and matching different types of alcohol. 

For our group of six, our average rating for brunch is as follows:

Quality of food/drinks: 5. As one of my friends said, "I wish I could give 5 and a half stars if I could!" Coming from a bit of a snob, that's for sure a compliment!

Hostess service: 2.5. Seemed like she hated life and couldn't crack a smile. We had a reservation at noon and the seating logistics were super disorganized so we stood there for 15 minutes waiting while drop ins were let in. Uhmmmm not okay.

Waitress service: 4.5. The thin brunette woman was very attentive and friendly, helping us choose the best items on the menu. Thanks a lot! It would have been nice if the tables were set with knives so we didn't have to wait for 5 minutes after asking twice AFTER the meals came out, but I'll let that slide.
author: Meaghan H.

description:
We found this restaurant on Yelp and went there for my nephew's birthday. We tried to make reservations but they do not take reservations for parties that are less than six people. It was ok as it all worked out.

I thought the waitstaff was really friendly and helpful. They recommended we order family style as their kitchen is small which means all of the dishes will not come out together. They show up as they are ready. That didn't bother us though.

The inside is nice; brick walls with pictures hanging and dimly illuminated by small picture lights. The whole restaurant is dimly lit but I liked it. The tables are wood and rustic looking. They have two and four tops and communal tables. However, the tables are tiny! They serve the food on these huge plates but the tables are so small you are constantly having to jostle your plates and drinks around to fit everything. Also, the music was really way too loud. Yes, they play good tunes but it is so loud it makes having a nice conversation difficult.

My least favorite thing about this place was the choices for alcoholic beverages. They have a very tiny wine and beer list, one type of shot, and margaritas, and sangrias. I didn't like the Sangria. It was tart, bland, and hardly had any fruit in it. The shot was meh. I wouldn't try either again.

The food was pretty yummy but it isn't authentic Mexican food. I grew up with a Hispanic step family who cooked authentic, made from scratch Mexican food and this stuff is nowhere near what I grew up on. Despite that it is pretty tasty. I thought everything was very fresh. The salsa is really yummy and has a good kick to it. I liked the chips but they were a bit overly hard. 

We had the calamari appetizer and that was excellent. The calamari was grilled on metal skewers and served on top of some sort of coleslaw like dish and a really light sauce. The sauce was very flavorful and had a good kick to it. The calamari was super fresh and tender and had that perfect grilled flavor.

My nephew had the cheese enchiladas which I didn't try but he said he really liked them. 

My mom had the pork chop which is $37.00. However, the serving is HUGE! Typically I hate pork chops but this one was really tasty, tender, and moist. This is worth trying.

My sister and I tried each other's meals. She had the (2) tacos al Pastor for $12.00. These were by far my favorite. The corn tortillas were soft and tasty and they had them overly stuff with meat and salsa.The pork was perfectly tender and flavorful and the salsa was amazing. I did the special of the pork ribs for $19.00. I couldn't hear what they called it or what they called the sauce. Although the ribs were fall off the bone tender the sauce was really bland. They served it with the yummy corn tortillas but that was it. Just slap some saucy meat on a tortilla and your done. It would have been better if they gave you cilantro or pico or something. It was a huge serving though. 

The other thing I didn't like is that EVERY dish had a hint of sweetness to it. I like sweet and savory from time to time but I feel like it is being over done these days. What is wrong with just savory or just sweet??

All in all, I did enjoy the experience. I would go back for some tacos or calamari or I would go back to try the lobster (that sounds really yummy). Plus the people
were friendly. And I didn't feel like it drew in an overly pretentious crowd.
author: Nat S.

description:
I do love me some Don Pisto! 

I recommend going on a Sunday, brunch at Don Pisto is spectacular! But the bottom less mimosa/sangria is the main attraction. 

They have a great variety of taco's fish, shrimp, steak, love the chorizo and eggs! Fabulous. 

Best part! You ready, brunch and bottomless ends at 3!!!! 
Most brunch and mimosa ends at 2. 

I never expected to much from such a tiny whole in the wall. 

Must try!
author: Lisa Ann R.

description: This charming Mexican joint has a laid back "keeping it real" vine with a fun tapas oriented menu. I found the staff to be engaging, helpful and pleasant. It's a great Neal that won't break the bank in a festive environment. The long table in the main room makes this an obvious consideration for larger parties. I'll definitely be back.
author: Chad R.

description: We where seated downstairs and it was too loud and the food was great , the burger was so juicy and the tacos so tasty, Just sit up stairs so you can hear your self.
author: P C.

description: Don Pisto's is this small intimate restaurant with a soundtrack like no other.  The food is amazing.  I love everything I have tried, from the guac, to the enchiladas, to the wide variety of tacos they offer, to my favorite, the chicken tortilla soup.  If i were to have any complaints about the place, it's too small.  This place is always jammed packed.  There are 2 locations and I have been there several times were someone made a reservation, but for the other location and you have people waiting, but you have these folks who made a reservation...it's all kind of a mess.  Also, IF you do make reservations, make them the day before.  They do not make same day reservations.  Service is usually great, but last time i went it was a table of 4, and our waitress forgot 2 of our menu items.  Although it's chaotic inside, it's well worth it.
author: Adrianna P.

description: Great service- tacos were excellent.   Overall- very pleased with this Mexican restaurant.
author: Milton S.

description: The place has a great atmosphere. It's also a fairly small restaurant. The food is good. I ordered tacos. My friends ordered drinks and enjoyed them. I remember having a reservation, which is helpful.
author: Ashley P.

description:
The burrito was good but over priced, came
With nothing in addition (no fruit, hashbrowns, etc) and they were not great at refilling drinks for bottomless brunch. I had to specifically ask for refills for bottomless and they did not check in with us often!
author: Merrill W.

description:
The tacos (shrimp and al pastor) were amazing and probably one of the best ones I've had. The al pastor tacos blew my mind with their lil pineapple cubes that fit perfectly well with the meat. Not sure if I'm just a pro at eating tacos or they portioned it so well that the meat wasn't flowing out as I was eating and there's no excessive tortilla either. The shrimp was extremely fresh. Love everything about those two kinds of tacos. 

Their chips were amazing as well. We also ordered calamari and Mexican sashimi, they were average, nothing to brag about. 

Service was decent - they took care of us, made sure our drinks get refilled just as we finished them, one of the dishes arrived late/they forgot about it so the waitress took it off our bill.
author: ChingWa C.

description:
Visited last night.  Very good food, but a few shortcomings.  Our small table was in the dark, the light in the ceiling for the table was burned out and no one replaced it, so ate with flashlights. Service was pleasant and attentive though very informal.  The sound system had "music" going but it was a heavily based piece on so loud you could not carry on a conversation, and it was the same beat the whole time we were there. It was not Mexican music, kind of a heavy metal and loud, loud, loud.  Maybe the chefs liked it because it overwhelmed everything. The kitchen is small, small, no more than 10 by 14 feet, and they do a great job considering no plant to work with.  Otherwise the meal was fine. The ingredients were outstanding, but for instance my two tomales, were laid flat on a plate with nothing accompanying, and they were pretty one dimensional, with the obligatory sour cream design on top from a squeeze bottle.  Really, do they have to use those damn bottles?  
It would not take much to tweak this place and start getting full houses.
author: Bill L.

description:
Ordered the pork chop this evening and it was rare - Was told by the server and manager "that's how we cook pork here" and that's the way the chief cooks it..
Was not given to option to have it cooked to liking when ordered.
Was a disappointment after 40 minutes wait.
author: Eliza R.

description:
Don Pisto's is welcoming, young hearted and fresh to death! Great spot. We ordered a dozen "west coast" fresh oysters & I ate them with a squirt of lime, dash a salt and a few pumps of tapatio! Take it down!!! I also ordered the calamari which is so delicious. Yelpers, it so good! Texture is perfect, the chew from start to finish is tasteful. Wow. 
The salsa for the chips is unique, citrus chopped pepper salsa which is great on everything! 
I really enjoyed dinner here and would recommend to all my family and friends! 
check it out!

Great music!!!
author: Flora S.

description:
Don Pisto's is probably one of my favorite restaurants in SF. Definitely top 10.

I've been here a handful of times in the last 3 years or so. It never ceases to disappoint. From what I remember, they've had nice lamb, delicious tacos, and interesting dishes with corn. The pitcher of margarita may be a bit too much, but if you have a large group, definitely worth it.

Lighting is dark and romantic too :)
author: Mingmei N.

description: The music was cranked to 11, so it was a little tough to have a conversation! That being said, the wait staff was attentive, and the food delicious!
author: Aaron A.

description:
Mexican food isn't usually on the top of my list when I look for places to check out when I'm out of town, but I'm glad I stumbled upon this place on Yelp.

The food here was solid.  Like what other folks said, even the complimentary salsa here is great.  I ordered the mussels and they were excellent.  That alone made my visit here worth it.  I also enjoyed the shrimp tacos which were really tasty and a nice compliment to the mussels.  

The margaritas here were also pretty decent.  All in all the entire experience was solid and I can see why this place is pretty popular.  It's definitely place I'd hit up again the next time I'm in SF
author: Kevin W.

description: Don Pistos is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco. It is such a fun restaurant to head to with some friends, it is a casual place but with a fun vibe and atmosphere. They always have great music playing and their staff is as friendly as it gets. Most importantly, their food is outstanding. I describe it as an upscale version of classic mexican food, their food is traditional yet very clean cut and updated but also is not too pricey. My personal favorites are the mexican sashimi (a must try, I get it every time) and the pork chop (perfect to split for two, ask for flour tortillas on the side). Such a fun place with amazing food, if you haven't been here yet would definitely get here for your next night out. Go follow @cass.eats on instagram to see more similar reviews.
author: Cass.eats ..

description: Great food and a great place to watch the marina crowd. I got a burrito here Nd they grilled it, which turned out great. Also, drinks were good and cheap.
author: Nick Y.

description:
What an awesome spot for brunch!

Good breakfast burrito ($9), awesome complimentary chips and salsa, a refreshing beer and a fun little shot = perfect Sunday meal.  Cool staff and a great vibe.  Be patient with the timing of your food and you'll be good to go.
author: Alena W.

description: Best pork chop I've had in my life!! Cooked to perfection great flavor place is a little small pairings not the best but the food! The food is definitely worth it!!!
author: Joshua M.

description:
Mexican food in the heart of North Beach? Sign me up. I'll be the first to admit that Mexican food is not my favorite... Mexican food at Don Pisto's however, bomb.com. Their tacos are so perfectly spiced and it goes great with a pitcher of their house Margaritas! Their chips and green salsa are my absolute favorite! 

The staff is fun and quick, atmosphere is super cool, they always have great music!
author: Maria Francesca A.

description:
A place with character in the heart of a touristy area. I was apprehensive about going to a Taco restaurant off of Columbus, where of the most tourists hang out. However, Don Pisto's was great - filled with happy, loud locals. Yes, it was really really loud but it has a great vibe. The food is served fast and hot. 

My recommendation: tacos, specifically the Al Pastor! 

The staff is slightly overbearing, approaching the table about ever 5 minutes to check in, but hey, it's better than never!
author: Aletta B.

description:
There's a reason this place was crammed full of people at only 6pm - it's really bloody good. We booked a table well in advance for this popular Mexican eatery and I highly recommend you do so as well. 

Here's what you do:

+ Order a pitcher of margarita (I don't care if there's only two of you, order the damn pitcher)
+ Chips and salsa are complimentary - keep eating them and they will bring you more
+ The fish tacos are SUBLIME (you get two in an order) so definitely get them
+ Don't be stuipid, order the mussels and chorizo... I dream of that bowl of sloppy deliciousness
+ Also get the ceviche because JUST DO IT.

Then eat until you hurt, rub your belly and then order another pitcher.
author: Jackie D.

description: Went to dinner with friends and was pleasantly surprised. Restaurant is small and loud so you may have to wait, but it's well worth it. Three of us started with ceviche and the chorizo mussels. Both excellent. We then split the brined pork chop that was perfectly cooked. Then to top if off we split the lobster special that was incredible. I made a small lobster taco with the homemade corn tortillas and added their salsa verde on top. Heavenly. I love the small simple menu but job well done.
author: James U.

description: Came here for a birthday, and it is pretty over priced. We racked up a healthy tab, and didn't get huge portions or really anything to justify the huge check. It is pretty loud inside, and feels like you are yelling to the people you are sitting with. They do have a decent bottomless brunch deal, and that would probably be the only reason I would come back honestly.
author: Ross S.

description: Out of tamales, really? What Mex restaurant  runs out of tamale ingredients.  Tacos pastor we're great, fish tacos not so much. Fajitas excellent   Tasty corn, flour tortillas, salsa and tortillas.   Agave margaritas fabulous.
author: Al R.

description:
Looking for a place to eat and followed the Yelp reviews. I think it's important for people to know that this is more of a tapas style restaurant. If you are pushing 50, you won't see our age group in here. 
Our total bill was 78.00 for appetizers and 2 drinks. Crazy. We work hard and at least like to have a meal. 
The portions are small. We had the Tuna and Shrimp tacos. For $14.00 you get tuna tacos that are maybe 2 inches long, and when filled maybe 1/2 inch wide. They serve 2 of these little things. They were good, just very small. The shrimp tacos also were at $14.00 served on 2 taco truck sized tortillas. These are like appetizers. 

The waitress mentioned these are all to share. Oh ok. It's certainly not an entree. 
We ordered rice and beans to share. It was $6.00. The Yucatan rice was dry and flavorless. Nothing to write home about. The beans are similar to the whole beans I make.  If you are starving this is not the place. If you want a good honest meal for your money...also not the place. The food was ok, but it's not out of this world. Perhaps the music and atmosphere is the big appeal.

Suggestion: advertise you are a Tapas Mexican restaurant. Be honest.
author: Polska K.

description:
SUPER great fish tacos. I've only ordered to-go so I don't know how the dining experience is, but the fish tacos are clearly a fan favorite. I'll have to try some other items soon. My only gripe and the reason this isn't a 5 star review is that of course the pricing is too expensive. $13 for 2 street-taco-sized tacos??? So basically you're easily dropping over $50 for 2 people here. SF really ain't all THAT fancy, and neither is this place to have such expensive tacos. Don Pisto himself be lucky they are so good.  I also got the guacamole, which apparently only comes in one size (medium-ish tub-sized) so at least that was worth the $8 lol. The guac is flavorful and has some spiciness so be prepared to make your tastebuds jump for joy. Dare I say this guac is ALMOST as good as Chipotle's guacamole(I DON'T CARE WHAT ANYONE SAYS, CHIPOTLE STILL HAS THE BEST GUACAMOLE. FIGHT ME ON IT, I DARE YOU. lol.)??? The chips aren't all that great so I paired the guac with some doritos instead LOL. 

The Yelp menu pricing and the actual restaurant website pricing doesn't seem to match BTW so only order from their website if you're checking out the menu. My other gripe is that they close too early. I work late nights in the city and I would love for them to be open past midnight since they don't open until 530pm anyway...smh.
author: Marquis A.

description:
After going to school in San Diego I feel like I'm somewhat of a Mexican food expert (maybe in my own head). I make Mexican all the time at home and would eat it every single day if I could. 

I've been to Don Pistos twice over the past year and have yet to write a review. My college roommate was in town and craving Mexican food, what else. So I recommended we hit up Don Pistos. It was busy as usual but we got a seat at the bar pretty quickly. They gave us complimentary chips and salsa and we ordered guacamole. Now you can always tell a good place by their guac game and it was pretty creamy and delicious. I personally like a little more lime but that didn't stop us from finishing the whole thing. 

We also ordered the al pastor and carne asada tacos. Both were pretty delicious but the al pastor with pineapple were standouts. The carne asada was spicyyyy and I like me some spice. Service was great, food was great, atmosphere was great. Always a good time
author: Shannon H.

description: Great food!  Incredible service.  I would recommend this place to anyone.  Great vibe.  Warning no sign outside so if you are trying to find it by looking for sign you might miss it.  We almost walked right by it!
author: Charles S.

description:
This place gets LOUD but man are the tacos good. The menu is relatively simple: some brunch dishes, tacos with your choice of meat (carne asada/steak, carnitas, chicken, shrimp), and other small dishes. Service was great, no complaints.
