The complimentary chips and salsa were delicious on their own. The salsa had a great kick to it and the chips are thick and crispy, not just some flimsy tortilla crisps. We got guac for the table - it wasn't the best guac I've ever had, but it was still pretty darn tasty. 

For my entree, I ordered the shrimp tacos with avocado salsa. The shrimp was seasoned SO well - I couldn't believe I got so much flavor from some tiny tacos. The portion size was a little small but you definitely get more food if you order the steak or carnitas tacos. The salsa on those is VERY spicy though, so beware or maybe even ask for it on the side. 

We did have a bit of a wait but were seated much more quickly than our quoted time of 20-30 minutes. Worth a visit if you are in the area and craving authentic Mexican eats!
author: Margaret Z.

description:
Great place. Guacamole and chips are amazing. Came on a Sunday and seated within 5 minutes. Just beat the rush. Sangria is a must. Bottomless and quality is the five stars it deserves. Had the bfast  burrito here. Still craving it. Will be back again next week! Portions for entrees are small but very filling, especially when u get a good 4-5 rounds of sangria in you

Andddd they play music while you're buzzed :)))
author: Shellie H.

description:
DON PISTO'S was one of the most unique and delicious Mexican meals I've ever had in my life. DP's doesn't serve your "standard" Mexican food menu. There are no quesadillas or chimichangas or three item combos we have become accustomed to seeing at restaurants. It is much more creative, authentic and unique. 

We had a couple of pitchers of their delicious sangria. A-

We shared the chips and guac. The best guac I've ever tasted. A+

We shared three orders of carnitas tacos. The tastiest and juiciest carnitas I've ever had. So bomb. A+

I ordered the braised short ribs, which came with onions and peppers and a red sauce served in a Calderon of sorts. They were soft, tasty and fell right off the bone. A-

I also had a couple of bites of a co-workers pork chop.  It was the best bite of chop I've ever tasted. A+

That's an awful lot of A's. Five stars! Can't wait to go back!
author: Joel V.

description:
While on vacation, my family and I chose to come here after extensive yelp researching. Only being here once I can say I had a great experience. Drinks were yummy, music was great, service was attentive. The over all atmosphere screamed hipster. Although the menu was quite expensive, especially for the portions, it was a nice treat.

I recommend the ceviche and fish tacos. They were glorious.
author: Samira F.

description: We were on other side of telegraph hill when we yelped it....totally worth the trek up and over the hill.   Food great...service great...music loud.   Try it...you won't be sorry.
author: Steve H.

description: Make it a point to find your way to Don Pisto's. It was hard to select something from the menu, it all looked good. Our group ordered a number of items and we shared. Everything was well prepared and tasted great. Fun server who took the time to explain the menu and offer suggestions.
author: John M.

description: We had the chips (with guac and ceviche), calamari, burgers, and tacos for an event. And they were all amazing! The margarita was strong. 5/5 Food. 5/5 Service.
author: Jon H.

description:
Loved this place! Best Mexican food I have tried. But beware of the chips... they're really hard to stay away from! :) 

The service was excellent and all the food was fresh and home made. We had guacamole, Seared Tuna Tacos, Fish Tacos, Enchiladas, Ceviche and Hamburger. All without an exception was delicious! This place is a must in San Francisco. :)
author: Mayelyn B.

description: It was super busy when a group of friends and I came for dinner. Service was outstanding and so was the food! This place has the best sangria I've ever had in my life! Highly recommend!
author: K S.

description:
Did someone say Mexican Food!? I recently visited San Fran and wanted some good ol' Mexican Food. Don Pisto's not only satisfied my cravings, they exceeded many expectations. Such a wonderful--cool vibe--restaurant that offers a mouth watering menu! I had the carne asada tacos and my girlfriend had the fresh ceviche. The tacos were very tasty; right amount of lime and meat that was grilled to perfection. Pisto's ceviche was one of the freshest ceviche's I have had; quality taste in each bite. Great people and a great experience! 

P.S. Order yourself a brewski while you are eating the complimentary chips and green salsa!
author: Michael C.

description:
Way.too.loud. Don't go here if you actually like talking to the people you're going to eat with.
When my gf asked them to turn the club-level volume down they said, "We can't. The owner says this is, 'the vibe.'"

The food: tortilla soup was mediocre- not spicy, barely any cheese, and the chicken was weird, sliced instead of pulled and flavorless. In a city with thousands of Mexican grandmothers, it is a CRIME to have taco soup like this. Tuna tacos had lots of guac (good) but were bland (bad).

I just couldn't relax in this place. Food coming out constantly as it was ready- ok. But then like give me a minute to eat before you ask if you can clear my plate... please! Staff was very nice, though.
Also, agave wine for margaritas is all they have. Also not cool. Food is normal range expensive for sf. But for 2 tacos for $12-14, I really wanted more food.
author: Breena K.

description:
Seriously one of the best meals I've ever had outside of home-cooking. Not only was the staff absolutely wonderful to work with our large party, we never had to ask for anything.

We ate tacos family style, and shared everything across the table of 10. Every single plate went back clean, we scraped every last piece off all dishes. We loved everything we tried. EVEN THE GUAC WAS AMAZING! 

Highlights: The charcoal grilled calamari was so good,I could have had about 3 more and been amazing. The shrimp tacos were also delicious, and had amazing flavor. Big ups on all the salsas, especially the fiery one on the steak tacos. 

Please go, please eat family style, and have some cold brews. You will not be disappointed- we'll be making this a part of our annual trip.
author: Ky V.

description:
Short Story:  
A good place for food and drinks.  A bit pricey though!

Long Story:
I came here on a Saturday night with 5 other friends to catch up and eat great food!  We made a reservation for 6:30PM and we were promptly seated.  The ambiance there was a feel of being part of the "in crowd" as the place with popping with people and great music.  It felt as if you were at a club but instead of dancing you were sitting down and eating.

The menu was really short, half small plates (tapas) and the other half entrees.  All in all, about 10 dishes.  The menu is a bit tricky as some of the entrees are really small and some of the tapas are quite large.  So, portion sizes doesn't match what you generally think.  It would be helpful to have pictures.

We ordered the salmon tacos, pork chops, yellowtail, and others.  These three dishes were phenomenal and I would highly recommend getting them.  The other dishes we got were only okay.  The pork was tender and cooked to perfection.  The yellowtail was fresh!

Verdict:
I would go back again!  Now that I know what the portions are :)
author: Michael W.

description: Delicious all around and nice friendly service! Sauces were delicious as were the chips and salsa
author: Mark R.

description:
Ambiance is nice. 

Employees are nice. 

The food is delicious! 

The only drawback is too expensive for too little food.   I don't like eating my meal and feeling like I didn't anything at all.  While it was good, it was just to small of a portion for me. 

If you're the person who gets full after a few bites and love eating good food, you'll love this place. 

Enjoy!!!
author: Joshua R.

description: Some of the best Mexican food I've ever had. Maybe just some of the best food period. Great service. Nice ambiance.
author: Kimi M.

description:
Don Pisto's Mexican food is not bad at all! Great selections of tacos and gives you a complimentary chips and salsa. I came here with a friend and we just sat at the bar. The server asked us to move a seat to fit three other people there - and they gave us a complimentary shots and guacamole! Great service and quality of food! 

I've ordered the red sangria which was pretty on point. The fish tacos and carne asada tacos were really good (street tacos). We also ordered ceviche!! So good.
author: Jenn L.

description:
My friend setup a surprise birthday party for her boyfriend here a few days ago, and the food was nothing short of awesome! They set out bowls of guacamole & homemade tortilla chips, with spicy green salsa, there were calamari skewers that tasted like marinated BBQ flavor, the fish tacos were awesome with large pieces of fish inside, there were also really big lobsters that were very sweet & tender. There was also some kind of tri tip looking steak that came out, everyone loved it (I didn't have any), and there were small dishes of rice & beans scattered around the table as well. 

The whole dinner was "family style" so you just take a bit of what ever you want, and you're not committed to anything if you try a tiny piece of something! The drinks were good, we had some kind of spicy shots with onions on the bottom, and then huge pitchers of Margheritas came out of nowhere!

The place was hot downstairs where the large tables are, but it was worth it, the staff & servers were great & kept all drinks filled, and kept our guacamole/salsa/chips filled the entire night!

The bill was kind of expensive, I didn't see the total, but it was $44/person..and one guy picked up the rest of the tab for our party of 20 to upgrade everyone to getting lobster.

The food was really good though, and it was an awesome surprise party!!
author: Denise F.

description:
Very inventive Mexican inspired food. We enjoyed the citrus focus of the guacamole, the Al Pastor grilled pork tacos and a off-menu cochinita pork ribs cooked in a cast iron pot with onions, red sauce, cinnamon and cloves. Delicious. Perfect for sharing. 

Be ready for hip hop blaring and very loud conversation  but the food is a hit and service is great and friendly.
author: Richard L.

description: The food here is delicious, and the service is even better. You also get complimentary chips and salsa. My favorite part: the music! Such a lively and fun place. I'm giving it four instead of five stars because it's expensive and some of the entrees (like tacos, for example) don't give you very much food (only two tacos). I had the enchiladas and a margarita and both were fantastic. I would probably not return only because it's out of my price range, but I enjoyed this somewhat boujee experience.
author: Tony A.

description:
Hands down the best burger i've had in a really long time, everything else was just ok.

After putting this place off for over a year, i finally got to try it! their burger was actually listed on the 7x7 list and i usually don't trust that list because it's a hit or miss, but this time i was not disappointed!

We were lucky because they only have the burger on their menu a few times a week. When it came out, the bun was perfectly toasted, the patty was big and juicy and flavorful and the guacamole was delicious.

We also ordered chips and guac for appetizer (which was just ok) and tacos to share. the tacos were good, but the burger is what really took the cake.
author: Andy H.

description:
Since I live near by I'm legit getting takeout once a week or so. The food is legit. It's so delicious, reasonably priced and I'm sorry bottomless margs? What's a mimosa if a margarita is an option. When my parents visit this is on the list of their must haves regardless of how noisy it is inside. You can't go wrong with food, drinks are solid. I will give you on occasion service sucks but it's rare and it's typically not a problem.

Heard some reviews gettin sassy about wanting to turnover tables at brunch. The restaurant isn't huge and they always have a line for brunch, so sure they need the table. The *one* time we were politely asked if they could have the table we were offered spots at the bar and free shots as a thank you.
author: Erin H.

description:
Second time around and it's just as good as I remembered. Some may think, "What is all the hype about? It's just Mexican food." True but there is just so much more to it than that. 

On weekends this place is nearly impossible. Unless you want to stop off around the corner to Tony's and grab a slice while you wait 90 minutes for a table (which I highly suggest!! but thats another review)...but on weekdays come around 6 pm and you'll be able to nab a table. 

Why should you come here? For 2 dishes - the pork chop (marinated to perfection) and the chorizo and muscles (holy moly good). All the other stuff is just as good but the above mentioned is "knock your socks off" good. You'll thank me later....
author: Caye Q.

description: Went on a weekend with a huge group of friends for brunch. The food was actually delicious and they had the option to do bottomless mimosas, sangrias AND margaritas... really doesn't get better than that. Super cute spot, great ambiance, and great location. It's a fun crowd, loud during brunch which I didn't mind one bit. Definitely a fun weekend brunch spot to hit!
author: Gia T.

description: Pork chop is stellar and worth coming back for. Carnitas and al pastor tacos are excellent.  Chicken wings are just ok to me.
author: Bryan V.

description:
Jeff is a great server. Outgoing, funny and on top of it. 

Food Is great. Mimosas are amazing.
author: Victoria H.

description: Amazing food! Great margaritas. Will definitely be back again. The tacos and wings are great for sharing.
author: Stella S.

description:
I'm looking at some of the reviews on here and I'm astounded at the straight fanboy status I'm seeing about this place.  Yeah, I think the food here is good.  I've also had better Mexican food in at least 10 places in San Diego.  Bottom line is this: if you're coming to Don Pisto's, you're paying for the atmosphere as much as you are for the food.

I can't complain about the food itself because it's pretty fresh with good ingredients.  The chips are pretty good, although a tad bit salty in my opinion.  I appreciate that when you order chips, it's an endless supply.  Kinda wish guacamole was like that too though, not $6 a pop.  Diablo prawns were as expected - really spicy.  Not that I can't handle it.  Al pastor tacos and pescado tacos (choice fish of day was rock cod) were well-made and had high quality ingredients.  I just can't justify paying $9 and $10 for two tacos when I've had better and bigger tacos for half that price.

Again, when you come here, you're paying for the atmosphere.  It's a fairly intimate atmosphere with plenty of ambiance.  It does get fairly loud in here because the brick walls just allow sound to bounce off the walls and reflect back into the room.  If you're young and got money to burn, this is your spot!

For me?  A bit overrated and definitely overpriced.
author: Alexander Y.

description:
This place is delicious!!! I've been here twice and both time the food has been excellent.

Atmosphere: Really cute restaurant in the heart of north beach. You can make a reservation if you have a large party (but not day of), or you can put your name in and grab a drink at a nearby bar if there is a long wait.

Drinks: I've only had the margerita's, but they are awesome. I don't usually like margs, but I think they are made with agave nector instead of tequila (don't quote me on that) but they are so delicious. 

Food: Guac (5/5). So fresh and delicious. Enchiladas (5/5). I like them with no meat, because they are pretty hearty, and come with beans and rice. Al Pastor Tacos (5/5) Super flavorful meat. One girl I was with got the steak tacos and they were so spicy so she had to get a new order with sauce on the side.

Overall: So delicious, I love coming here! Great spot.
author: Jenna G.

description: A bit on the spendy side for Mexican fare, but the quality justifies the price. We came at peak dinner rush (around 8pm) and had to face nearly an hour wait, but grabbed a drink in the neighborhood, and were glad we stuck it out. We got the calamari skewers, chorizo mussels, one order of each kind of taco, and a side of guacamole, and everything was really tasty. We saved the best for last, though...the pork chop! The host claimed it was the "best pork chop he'd ever had" and I can't say I disagree (although Zuni's similarly brined chop gives them a run for their money.) Definitely get that pork chop! It's huge, and could be easily shared by three or more people if dining family-style. Shout out to our awesome bartender Erin who took great care of us! Will certainly be back. :)
author: Greg B.

description: Really great food lived the tacos! The tortillas were amazing as well definitely recommend this place . Very friendly as well
author: Pablo G.

description:
Tucked away on a busy street on North Beach, Don Pisto's boasts of modern Mexican inspired dishes that will leave you wanting more. 

To no surprise, chips and a tangy tomatillo salsa are complimentary (star).  We also opted for:

The fish tacos which consisted of market fresh fish, baja style, white sauce, onion, and cilantro (really good); ceviche with avocado, orange, pico de gallo, chile (really really good), charcoal grilled calamari with a citrus dressing and radish salad (no words, this was my favorite) and rice and beans.  Their sangria is also light and refreshing.  

Aside from the food, I was impressed with the austere terse simplicity of the wooden tables, concrete floors, brick walls and small kitchen-- reminiscent of a neighborhood tapas bar somewhere in Europe (maybe Seville or Barcelona). The crowd varies, the staff and service are exceptional and honest-- giving you a familiar comfort that you only feel when you're with friends or family.  Their music selection is pretty freaking awesome.  I don't know about you, but I only eat Mexican food with as side of Trap music. Enjoy!
author: Luarnie B.

description: Parking sucks but it's SF, if you can find parking and get in this place it is to die for. The lobster was fantastic along with the mussels and taco's. If you like great food this is the place but if you want conversation save it for after the food, the music is loud.
author: Katie N.

description:
Of all the times I've been to Don Pisto's (and I have been A LOT) I have never once been disappointed. You hear me?! NOT ONCE, I SAID!

I don't just give out five star ratings like candy, ya know. A place has to earn dat perfect score. DP's definitely does.

Why, you may ask yourself, does a restaurant without a sign out front deserve a perfect score? Have a seat over there on the ground and I'll tell you a story. A story of mouth-watering Mexican food...

It all started in the shadow of a great Coit Tower where some dudes (maybe dudettes too?) decided to get together and make some of the cleanest and most flavorful dishes to ever pass through my experienced lips. They have a lot of seafood at DP's, I especially enjoy the spicy tuna tacos and ceviche. They make some legit house salsa to go with your perfectly crisp chips as well. Heat builds off the spicier dishes and salsa quickly so get yourself a margarita, STAT!

Even going to the bathroom is fun at Mr. Pisto's. It's like a spelunking trip past the kitchen, down the dark stairs, by the party room (that never has a party in it...) and around the corner to guess which door is a bathroom. Fret not, it's not that scary and the bathrooms are usually pretty clean.

Once you've filled your belly to capacity and beyond you'll find a nice surprise. Señor Pisto does not charge very much. Pricier than your typical cheap Mexican place for sure. But not bad considering the exemplary service and astounding food quality and preparation.

A++++++ WOULD BUY AGAIN.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Wow, we had the al pastor and fish tacos, the best we've had in California. I grew up in Mexico City and it rivals the very best there. I don't know how everything else is, but the tacos were great.

it has most of the common Mexican beers and even offers the 'cawama' coronas - 32oz. We also had a great margarita, and sangria but I went mostly for the food.
author: Luis M.

description:
I really love this place. We went on a Sunday for brunch. The food was excellent. Perfect sized servings and excellent taste. Everything was great from the service to the atmosphere. I had the French toast and my son ordered a ham scramble.

I originally wanted the hamburger but they had sold out which I was bummed about but, it gives me a great reason to go back again soon! Place has been around about six years according to our server but this is the first time in all my years in San Francisco that I stumbled upon it and I have to say it is quite a gym. I will be back.

(My only teeny criticism is it was super fucking loud but that was a very small flea on a the back of a very large dog) still ... 5 stars.
author: Jason P.

description:
How did I not know this was here? I was super hungry upon arrival, so my hunger may have unduly influenced my experience. With that said, Don Pisto's blew my mind. 

Guac and chips were perfect. 

Whole lobster was fun for the table and garlic butter dipping sauce was on point. 

Pork chop was the star of my meal and I wish I'd one all to myself. Extremely flavorful and meaty, the chop had been grilled and seasoned to perfection. It was really a one-of-a-kind pork chop that I'll be thinking about for some time. Definitely enough to split, or good for one hungry person. 

A bit loud, so not sure I'd want to bring a date here or with anyone I didn't know well already. You kind of have to yell to get heard.
author: Jeff M.

description:
I came here for an early Sunday dinner with my girlfriend and her family. All the reviews and ratings for Don Pisto's are well deserved.

Everything was delicious from the main dishes to the tortilla chips, which were served warm, crispy, and lightly salted. They paired perfectly with the ceviche which was quite refreshing and had a unique twist with added orange slices. We also ordered the juicy al pastor and camarones tacos which were both tasty and filling.

But the crown easily goes to the pork chop and lobster entrees. The pork chop was large and juicy. The lobster was big enough for my girlfriend and I to split (though we did also order tacos and appetizers). It was well-worth the $50 market price. And what more, it was served with pretty much everything you could ask for--rice, beans, fluffy flour tortillas, and of course butter (spiced up with garlic and cilantro).

It was a delicious experience which was also   unexpectedly accompanied by the latest hip-hop/R&B hits playing in the background.  We will definitely be returning to Don Pisto's again to get our fix.
author: Ryan M.

description: I actually came here back in March so this review is a bit old but still worth writing. I got the mushroom enchiladas and they were delicious! I wasn't expecting much from the place but everything was delicious and so were the drinks. Will return for those num num enchiladas! yum!
author: Monica J.

description:
Great food that is noticeably made with fresh ingredients. Their chips and green salsa is amazing! 

The four star rating goes to the fact that all of our food was incredibly salty (and I generally like salty foods). Also the noise level was insane on a Saturday at lunch time. Our table of three was tiny and we were yelling the entire time!
author: Mita O.

description:
By far the best pork chop I've ever eaten! My hubby and I split it with a side of rice and beans. Plenty for two. 

Tiny place. Great for date night but not so much big groups. Make a reservation ahead of time. 

Staff was friendly and professional. Very casual atmosphere. Music playing. Great vibe. Great drinks! 

We were lucky enough to have been here for a wedding reception and tried nearly everything on the menu. Nothing disappointed. Loved it all. Will definitely return!!
author: Mellissa B.

description:
Nom nom nom.... I ate my taco Sonora (carnita) in 5 minutes cause it was perfect! These are almost like an open face quesadilla with a flour tortilla and tender but roasty flavored pork. 

Wow that salsa they serve with their free chips and salsa was GOOD. So fresh and clean tasting, yet super flavorful. Went really well with the taco.

I'd come here again any time I'm near by!
author: Nika T.

description:
Came here for brunch once. I got the huevos rancheros which were really good. My friend got the breakfast burrito and she really liked it. We got a side of guac and chips and it was awesome!! The bottomless mimosas were really good too. You get bottomless mimosas for like 1.5 hours, but they have different flavors and they come by very frequently to top you off. I've heard great things about dinner here. I'll have to come back and try that out. 

If you go a little too hard on the mimosas, there is a coconut water stand  right outside . They serve it to you in a young coconut and theres even an umbrella #tropical.
author: Thielson D.

description:
The food was amazing. I would highly recommend the Al Pastor tacos, game changer. There guacamole salsa is also just wonderful.

It's is a small and very loud restaurant but it's with dealing with the noise for the food.

Would make an excellent spot for pregaming a night out.
author: Sam M.

description:
On yelp, I rate strictly for food quality when it comes to restaurants. Don Pisto's food ..... Even their complimentary salsa is fabulous. Today we tried the el pastor tacos and chorizo & mussels. Perfection.

It is however very loud up in there haha which works depending on the mood you are looking for.

Service is great. Seriously lovely and super attentive.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Do not come here for a group brunch and get their prix fixe menu! A complete ripoff. 
I rarely leave a bad review unless its warranted and Don gone Pist-me-O!
My sister hosted a brunch for about 25 people after the day of her wedding downstairs and we couldn't believe what were served, the quantity and for the price. For $30 a head without drinks, we each got some guacamole/chips, one (seriously 1) small fried tortilla with beans and a fried egg on top, one (again 1) small carne asada soft taco, bowls of potato to share and small French toast (1 each) with a side of 8 bacons to share among 25 people....let me take a quarter of a strip please. Really?!? 

Also not sure if this is a tactic but they kept coming out with drinks that no one ordered hoping someone would feel bad and take them since they go around and ask like...only 3 times or more. It works by the way! The bill ended up being $1500!!! I would have rather suggested my sister let everyone order their own dish so at least we can get a full meal, a taste of the restaurant and why people are raving about this place. 

I think the owner should call the new bride to thank her for her business, apologize to the newly wed couple and comp them to a full meal so at least they didn't waste $1500 on food they didn't even eat bc they were too worried there wasn't enough for their guests. About 20 of us ended up going to a noodle house right after to fill our bellies. Big regret we didn't do that before!
author: Hanah P.

description:
These tacos are great. The pork is super succulent. The Carne asada was soft and cooked just to the point that it was super juicy and totally packed with smokey flavors.  And the flavors were SICK! I wanted to try the chicken, but they only have it in the evenings. 

My review is based on the flavor not the value.
No value here. 

2 tacos = $9
So a "man" will need 4 tacos and a beer. 
4 tacos = $18 and a beer (corona 32oz) $11 = $29 is a bit questionable even for some great tacos. Just a heads up. 


Exposed brick gives the dinning area a nice vibe. It has a huge party room down stairs.


Could use a better beer selection. They have a poor beer selection.
author: Ben M.

description: Definitely exceeded my expectations!!! I went with a couple of girlfriends and we shared a pitcher of margarita, chips and guacamole, Mexican Sashimi, Chirizo & Mussels, Hamburgesa, Carne Asada and Al Pastor Tacos. All the food was AMAZING. The guacamole was fresh and very tasty, their ceviche or Mexican sashimi was bomb with the chips, the mussels and the sauce and bread it came in..omg. This was my all-time favorite. SOOO good!! I could have eaten every drop of that sauce if they provided me with more bread. MUST HAVE!! Their burger was also reaaally tasty. The patty is "marinated in bacon & onion".. delicious!! And I LOVE that they provide the extra service and offered us three tacos each order instead of the normal two because we are a party of three and sharing a taco isn't the easiest thing to do. More servers need to learn and be on top of things like ours was!! More money for them, and no one has to fight over tacos--and the tacos were worth fighting for!! I loved the Al Pastor tacos and the Carne Asada was so tender and juicy... Some of the best tacos I've had!!! Definitely coming back soon!
author: Athena L.

description: This place rocks! Thank you Nick for taking your time & going over the whole menu. You literally describe it  the way it was! Will definitely be coming back.
author: Samuel C.

description:
This place is really popular for the weekend brunch! Bottomless Mimosa & Sangria make it a hot spot for sure.  We got there right as the doors opened and there were a handful of groups waiting to be seated.  Again, we are seated downstairs and away from the service. We are 7 people with 1 bowl of tortilla chips to share among us. When we asked for a second bowl we were given a refill on our first bowl. The food also came out at all different times and the waitress brought two mimosas down for us and left 5 of us empty handed.  Our friend who ordered the beer (the easiest to grab) got his drink last and after two reminders. 

The food is really good though, the tacos, the egg breakfasts all good with fresh ingredients.  They also play music! They do have a time limit on bottomless drinks, so start the festivities at Don Pisto's an move on to continue the fun!
author: Shalizeh D.

description:
If I could give zero stars I would...which is unfortunate as it has nothing to do with the food. Last night a group of friends and I came to dinner here and we're refused to be served for being too intoxicated. While I understand restaurants can refuse service and should at times this was unwarranted. 

Upon asking the manager and waitress why, we were told it was because we didn't want to listen to the specials so she thought we were being rude. The fact of the matter was that our friend has celiac, we had been there before and so we already knew what we wanted, asked a couple questions to ensure she didn't have an allergic reaction, and that's all. 

We spent over $200 and were treated like fools, I have actually never been treated in this fashion at a restaurant and was appalled. 

The service was absolutely awful and because of this I will never come back.
author: Mehea G.

description: Very friendly waiters, excellent food! The lobster and mussels with chorizo are extraordinary. No reservations. Great for couples or 4-6 friends. Highly recommended!
author: Rob W.

description:
I have now eaten here 3 times and have appreciated the variety and changes to the menu each time.  The tacos and tamales are very flavorful and authentic, and I really enjoyed the chips and salsa at the start of the meal.  They also have several delicious appetizers, one of my favorites being the Mexican salmon sashimi.  

Now, for my one grievance about this place.  I would say the food is a solid 4.5-5 stars, but I'm taking away a star for ambiance. This restaurant is wayyyy too loud.  Not only is it a small space, but they play loud club-esque music on top of the already loud conversations.  This just does not make sense to me!  My boyfriend and I could not hear each other across a petite two person table.  I will likely be back because the food is honestly quite tasty, but may bring along a pair of earplugs.
author: Jennifer S.

description: You cannot beat a whole lobster for USD$48. It came with a whole host of sides as well. Margaritas were also awesome. It was spiked with agave and not tequila. The staff were friendly and helpful. Would totally go again.
author: Penny L.

description:
We like the vibe and the food  at Don Pistos. It's a lively space with very accommodating staff.
Our favorite is the  calamari which is grilled and served on skewers.
Most of the food is small plates but there are some entrées as well.
We find that the small plates are very satisfying and give us a lot of variety.
author: Karen S.

description: A generous serving of salsa straddled by two seemingly bottomless bowls of chips. My friend claims to have had the best taco he has ever had, which means A LOT! The server was a mind reader and the pitcher of margarita was abundant. Bathrooms are downstairs.
author: leo b.

description:
So it's my first evening on a business trip to San Francisco last month and I need to eat some bad ass food. What do I do in this situation? I go straight to my trusted Yelp app and look at what is near by.

After looking through several pages I came across Don Pisto's. Yelper's seemed to love it here so I knew I had to check it out.

The restaurant does not have signage. There is a menu in the window. There are two ways to find it. The first way is pay attention to the numbers of the buildings lol. The second way is to look for a large crowd and music playing. I found it using the latter method cause I'm cool like that on rare occasions lol.

It was a total zoo which is usually a great sign. After a few minutes I was able to make it to the host stand. I was quoted a wait time of an hour but told that it would probably be sooner. I put my name down on the list and went to get a drink at another bar with my father.

We returned about an hour later and were told that it was going to be a slightly longer wait. To make a long story short chaos ensued at the host stand. The owner Pete had to come over as the host couldn't handle the crowd lmfao. Pete offered free drinks to everyone that was waiting. Thanks Pete that was awesome of you!!!

We were seated after about two hours. Normally I'd go somewhere else but we were digging the scene and the food looked amazing. The restaurant is also on the small side.

Chips and green salsa were immediately brought to the table. Oh my god the salsa was one of the best that I've ever had. It was spicy which I loved. The chips were crisp and salted just right.

My father ordered the pork chop. I went with al pastor tacos and carne asada tacos as well.

The server checked back in to make sure we were good with drinks while waiting for the food.

When I saw the pork chop placed down on the table I had severe ordering remorse. This happens so rarely to me that I should've bought a powerball ticket in hindsight!!!! Thankfully I was offered a piece of the pork chop to try. Wow it was fucking amazing. My father went quite nuts over it.

I enjoyed the carne asada tacos. They were extremely generous with the meat portion which always sits well with me. The steak was juicy and well seasoned. The tortillas were soft and warm. The al pastor tacos were just OK. The pork was too dry in my opinion and was somewhat bland.

Now fast forward two days later. The President of my company wanted to take company executives, some colleagues and myself out to dinner. His wife was in the mood for Mexican and he heard me talking about Don Pisto's to everyone so he decided to make a reservation here.

We were seated at the lower level in the restaurant this time which I didn't know existed. We were at a long table with a bench on each side. It ended up becoming an intimate dinner and not in a good way. It was also quite hot down there as well. I was sweating as were others. 

I ordered the pork chop this time!!! Sigh unfortunately this time when I get the whole damn thing just for me it was just OK. It was too dry for me personally.

Everyone loved their meal and I looked like a hero to the President, his wife and a few of my colleagues. Thank you Yelpers and Yelp this wouldn't have been possible without you!!!! 

I deducted a star due to the pork chop on my second visit as well as for having dinner that was "Too close for comfort."

Next time I'm in San Francisco I'll definitely make it a point to stop by here.
author: Will G.

description: My boyfriend and I came here for dinner on our last night in San Francisco. I knew we were going to have a good time once we came in and 90's music was blasting in the background. Perfect for a fun date night! I would definitely recommend getting a reservation if you can because they seem to get very busy on weekends. We had the sashimi for an appetizer and it did not disappoint! Super fresh! My al pastor tacos were delicious as well, and the service was good. The only thing I'd suggest is that they try and get a bigger kitchen staff.. the wait for our tacos was longer than expected.
author: Gaby S.

description:
way too loud!

Pros:
+ good food

Cons:
- too loud to have any conversation

Came here for a birthday party. while the food was good, i found the music so ridiculously loud it was like a club in there: I couldn't hear what my friend was saying, and neither could they hear what I was saying (yelling). What's the point really of going out together if you can't have a conversation?
author: Marius K.

description:
Wowowow!

This place is incredible!! Literally EVERY SINGLE THING I tried was beyond delicious!!

The seven of us were seated in a room with two other groups. The atmosphere was loud and fun. The calamari was so flavorful! We also ordered enchiladas, al pastor tacos, asade tacos, and a pitcher of margaritas. I'm literally running out of adjectives because I can't even explain how good everything was! We were also given free fish tacos! 

Anyway, all-in-all go here, go here, go here!
author: Lesina G.

description:
I had a 19 person birthday party for my best friend. With that large of a table, you need to order from the Pre fixe menu ranging from $32/person to $60/person. From the time we got there, I have to say, everything went off without a single issue! 

I really appreciated the menus with his the birthday boy's on it (great touch). The wait staff was very attentive to our needs (despite having other tables to wait on). All the food was delicious (ceviche, skewered calamari, carne asada & carnitas tacos, & hamburgesas. 

Everything came out in a good timing cadence including drinks. I brought a birthday cake was a brought out with plates which was a great top to the night. I was very impressed with the entire night. The birthday boy kept saying he was blown away ecstatic with the entire night.

Many people in my group have never been to Don Pistos and I can tell you they will be returning back many times!
author: Ryan R.

description:
Yum!! I loved almost everything we ordered for dinner tonight and the service by our male waiter was excellent. I really enjoyed his energy and enthusiasm. For 2 people (with an appetite for 3-4), we ordered the following: 

Mexican sashimi platter - basically raw salmon topped with a pepper and some other stuff. My friend's fave of the night!

Calamari - YUM! This was my favorite dish of the night. Grilled octopus with a hint of lime. So good!

Steak tacos - soft tacos topped with steak. The spiciness takes a few minutes to hit....

Shrimp tacos - the shrimp here was better than in the ceviche. Not bad, but id prefer the steak tacos over this. 

Shrimp ceviche - this was the only dish i didnt like. The flavors of the salsa with the orange was great, but the shrimp itself did not taste fresh. For this dish alone, i wouldve given it 1 star. 

Would definitely come again, just skip the shrimp ceviche!
author: Claire W.

description:
Go to this place! 
Everything that i tried was great but i will tell you about the fish tacos. The fish was light & fluffy with a crisp but light crunch. The tortillas were to die for and sauce was tangy light lime goodness 
I do not do to many reviews but I really liked this place & would go back in a heartbeat.
author: Robert K.

description: Nothing but good things to say about this place. Best pork chop I've ever eaten, and solid brunch food as well. The owner, Pete, even offered to have the cooks make a pork chop during brunch hours for me. Atmosphere is pretty lively, during brunch hours they blast music, definitely an aggressive start to any Saturday morning, but not a bad thing. If you choose to do bottomless, the wait staff are constantly on top of refills too!
author: Nick K.

description:
Such a gem in the city!

The food is amazing and I love the fact that they play hiphop! Staff is friendly and food is phenomenal!

Must haves:

Chips & Salsa
Tacos (all kinds)
Porkchops

I'll definitely be back soon!
author: Tina G.

description: I asked the guy to give me super spicy salsa and took took the challenge to the chef  they made amazing but unbelievably hot salsa - i literally coughed after each bite - The chef won  food were great and they even gave me a glass of milk at the end when I asked for it. Great place and great service.
author: The Food L.

description: It was unfortunate that we had booked brunch on "SantaCon" day.  The noise level in the restaurant was unbearable.  The servers did their best in a chaotic situation.  I had read so many great reviews of Don Pisto's and our party of 9 were very excited to try it.  Overall, the food was OK.  My carnitas tacos were fine, but not something I would re-order.  The guacamole tasted of over ripe avocados.  The chips and green salsa were excellent. Glad we tried it but it isn't a place that we would go back to.
author: Lilikoikitchen M.

description:
Location: 5/5 - Love where is located 


Food: 5/5 I was able to have the ceviche, tacos de carnitas and Micheladas. I highly suggest all these dishes! 

Ambiance: 5/5 - We were seated at the communal table, which was still nice. We were able to take our time eating and really enjoying our stay at the table.
author: Diana C.

description:
So why does this place have such great reviews?  Heck if I know.

This isn't Mexican food.  It's far from it...so don't expect if anything authentic.

We ordered a few taco plates, fish and carne asada.  Terrible.  Super dry and flavorless.  Bad picks.

The house specialties were ridiculous.  What Mexican entree does not come with rice and beans?  Ugh.  I get that upscale steakhouses make you order extra sides...but this isn't a steakhouse.  

I ordered the pollo asado which was served with guac, salsa, and tortillas. The chicken was tender...but it was just missing everything that made it a real Mexican dish.  

We also ordered the ribeye.  Cooked well and flavorful...no sides.  I asked for some flour tortillas when we ordered as my parents don't like corn.  They gave us one.  One stinkin flour tortilla.  Seriously?  So I asked for more.  By the time my dad was almost done with the steak, the tortillas came.  Really terrible. 

Never again and I feel like I wasted a night at this place.  2 stars.
author: Jen W.

description:
Food is good
Service was nice and friendly
Food is just way too expensive to ever recommend this place or go there again. 
Sorry!
author: Allen P.

description: Food was good, but not above average. The service was good and the staff was attentive to refilling drinks and the chip bowl. The atmosphere wasn't my favorite and it was difficult to have a conversation. Definitely more bar-like than restaurant.
author: Ashley G.

description:
Came here for a a triple birthday brunch today - the overall experience was fun since we had a great group of friends there but the service was truly abysmal. So, unfortunately, this bad review is primarily directed at the wait staff (although, not the bus boys who were very kind). 

First off - I arrived at 10:55 AM (5 minutes before they open, although I wasn't aware of this) and walked in to let them know which party I was with. The manager told me they don't open until 11 AM and that I should wait outside. I asked her whether I could wait right inside and she said "no, we aren't ready for you yet..." I then proceeded to ask whether she was aware that it was pouring rain out and she simply said "yes." So, great start, waited outside in the rain...

Once our party was seated, the waitress was rude and impatient with our group (yes, we were a group of 12 but there were many large groups in the restaurant so they should be used to this). She impatiently took our order, rolled her eyes when people weren't ready, and wasn't very helpful with questions about the menu. 

Our food orders all arrived at very different times so most of the food was cold by the time we started - also, we found a couple hairs in their tacos (which they said couldn't possible be their fault since they don't have any chefs with long hair; note: they have wait staff with long hair). The food was otherwise delicious though - so props to the chef.

As for the drinks - apparently the "90 minute bottomless mimosas" start at the time of your reservation - so if you order 20 minutes later, make sure you are aware of that. Other thing to note - the margaritas aren't the best and are pretty watered down. Go with the mimosas instead if you are choosing to do bottomless (did not try the sangria).

As we were a large party, tip was included. If I had had the option, I would have chosen to give them far less for service... Wouldn't come here again - there are WAY better brunch places in town with far friendlier service. Check out Zazie or MyMy next time, long wait times but they both have amazing food and very kind wait staff.
author: Saba M.

description:
Great late night mexican food.

Small but interesting menu.

Loved both types of the pork tacos.

The fish taco was ok, but a little bland for my taste.

Good guac and tortilla soup.
author: David T.

description: This place was quite different from the impression I got from reading the yelp reviews. To me it doesn't have much of an atmosphere - and that's it's biggest downside, or maybe it's just because we came early on a sunday. I would have trouble saying whether it's a good date place, place to meet friends, a place to have a drink with coworkers... It's not clear. The food is good, it all tasted very fresh and I particularly liked the mexican ceviche with the interesting mix of orange and shrimp. I also liked that they kept refilling our tortilla chips even when we had still a few left. The service overall was great. I think it's a good neighborhood spot, but might not be worth going out of your way for it.
author: Helene P.

description:
When I stood in line to use the restroom, two girls casually asked if I would use the boys loo which was free and when I shook my head no way Jose, they walked into the boys restroom together. 

That's the kind of place this is. It's young, it's hip, it's f****ing loud and it's SO San Francisco. 

The food is very very good. An above average Mexican place outside of Mission? YUP. 

Perfect place for lunch after a long trek to Coit. 

Ceviche is perfection. The Diablo wings are super spicy but if you can handle the heat, GET THEM. The fish tacos are fresh and flavors are incredible. 

Will come back.
author: Neesh Q.

description:
Food was good, but this place just has a very confused staff/ service. 
Came here for brunch and first of all they don't have coffee(??????), then they are out of juice too so I had to drink Coke for my breakfast which is kinda ridiculous. 
They were out of a ton of stuff on the menu as well, so that's disappointing. 
They also served the food all at different times and missing silverware, and some people at my table was just waiting forever to eat, while others were almost done. 
This place is just a mess. The impression is that it had just opened or something which isn't the case, given the complete lack of organization and amateur service.
Don't think I'll be back.
author: Paula C.

description: By far one of the best dining experiences I've had in San Francisco. The atmosphere is lively, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the house-made chips are perfect. I loved the margaritas, guacamole, and salsa verde we enjoyed before our meal. I had the carne asada tacos and my fiancé had the carnitas enchiladas. The spices blend so well together and the portions are perfect for sharing. We will definitely be back soon!
author: Natalie H.

description:
Someone was ballsy when they decided to open up the only Mexican restaurant in the sea of Italian restaurants that is North Beach! But we decided to try this place out for their $17 "Bottomless Brunch," which is a little misleading because its actually only Bottomless Mimosas or Sangrias...still a good deal and the drinks were awesome!

The food is completely different, but oh so good. I ordered the Taco Sonora with Carnitas, which was amazing! It was more like a burrito but the carnitas were cooked perfectly, the handmade tortilla was perfectly crunchy, and it all just melted in my mouth. I also ordered the hamburgesa, which is a burger "marinated in bacon and onions," which intrigued me. I am allergic to avocados, so I asked for the burger with no guac and the server says the cooks won't do that. I asked why and he said no substitutions...I understand no substitutions, but to be so pretentious that you can't take something off the burger is a little silly to me...they were nice enough to take it off but the whole exchange annoyed me a little bit.

Overall, we got there a little early (around 11:15am), which I'm glad we did, because after 12, there was a crazy long wait apparently. Would I be back? If I didn't have to wait...yes, but they certainly aren't worth more than a 10-15 minute wait...
author: JD G.

description: The service was so fast and our waiter was one of the best. The fish tacos are to die for. Plus they played 2000s rap and we were singing to every song. I loved this dining experience!
author: Ashley W.

description: Don Pisto's has some extremely tasty food and provides a very low lit setting for a fantastic meal. The menu is not the most authentic, but they are doing amazing things in the kitchen. The street corn is a delightful seasonal appetizer, keep your eye out for that one! My go to entree is the Tortilla Soup. The broth is delicious, the chicken is tender and the chunks of avocado really tie it all together. It would be great if this place had draft beer, or a liquor permit that would allow them to use tequila in their margaritas. That said, the Sangria is always refreshing and awesome. As a trendy place in North Beach, the music is always bumping, so don't expect a quiet meal. This place is always buzzing with business so plan ahead!
author: Alex E.

description:
I'm about to keep it real. Allow my Latin self to break it down.

Reminded me of a marina bar when we walked in....up to you whether you wanna celebrate that or barf out. Your call.

The lemonade was weak. Don't do it. My husband ordered a margarita. They don't have a liquor license, so it's made with some kinda wine. Again, don't do it. There's wine, so take yourself in that direction.

The green salsa and warm home style chips were uh-may-zing! I could've had just that, over and over:)

The guacamole was aight. Fresh, that's good, but missing more lime juice, salt, serrano, and jalapeño.

I ordered the one seemingly veggie thing they have on the menu, the enchilada. It was great, until I got home and felt a little sick to my stomach:/ I think the beans the enchilada is filled with must've refried in lard. I've made that mistake before. My bad, shoulda asked. My husband loved it.

Great service.
author: Gabriela W.

description: This place is a piece of Mexico! The tacos are incomparable to anything you can get in SF! Our server Renata was wonderful, so on top of everything! Filling our glasses and being so patient with our many questions! Rilmy was amazing too! And Jessica pure hostess was great as well! We'll be back for our annual trip next year! Thank you don pistos!
author: Erin H.

description:
My family and I are visiting San Francisco for the week and have been using yelp to identify some good spots to eat. Don Pisto's got great reviews and was reasonably close so we made the walk. It was interesting trying to locate the place because there was no signage whatsoever. The address will get you to where you need to be, though. This is where you need to be. 

We entered and were greeted at the door by the woman who eventually ended up being our server. She was friendly and helpful throughout the entire experience. They were also playing The Notorious BIG over the speakers when we arrived, which may not be a plus for certain people but is a huge plus for me. 

We ordered the guacamole right away and I can't recommend that enough. It was tremendous. The verde salsa was also excellent. It had a good level of heat but was nicely balanced.

We ordered the fish tacos, pork tacos, ribs, and chorizo and mussels. Everything was over-the-top excellent. The tacos were probably the best I've had. The tortillas are great and really make a huge difference. Also the tortilla chips are truly addictive. 

Cool ambiance, excellent service, and incredible food. Don Pisto's checks all the boxes. Highly recommended!
author: Nick L.

description: Brunch is great for a college crowd. They play loud mainstream hiphop. The wait is pretty long so if ur antsy reconsider. The service was great and our food came out within 5 min of us ordering. It was good but I wasn't wooed. The fish taco was huge and a bit difficult to eat, chorizo hash was good and a good size
author: Stephanie C.

description:
There are some joints that nail the BFSBWP thing, Don Pisto's is not one of them. 

The entire experience was underwhelming.  

We started with a significant wait for our table. With a reservation already made and it being a weeknight, we hoped the wait would be worth it.  It wasn't.

Instead of chips and salsa, we got salsa and chip crumbs.  The tiny little bits made it hard for dipping.  FAIL.

The guacamole needed a bit more salt and a lot more lime.  Still nothing comes close to my wife's.  Another FAIL.

The margarita I ordered tasted something akin to honey wine + lime-aid.  Discovered they didn't have a liquor license and made these margaritas with soju.  Gross.  Third  FAIL.

The tacos I sampled (an al pastor and chicken) were OK, fairly amateurish but not a failure. Just so-so.

The enchilada (beans, wild mushrooms, enchilada sauce, cheese) my wife ordered was the best thing I had.  It made her a bit sick but I fared fine.  

All in all, I'd say pass.  Not worth giving another chance, too many things were amiss.
author: Saminda W.

description:
Came here Sunday night with a crew of 5 name was put on the list half hour later we we're told our table was being setup false!
They made us lollygag around the bar for another 20 minutes when we asked one of the staff member he blew us off with a bs excuse saying he couldn't control when would be seated. We ordered food which came out very scattered and some people at our table ate cold food waiting for other peoples food to come out!  To me the staff acted like a bunch of confused children in a math class not knowing how to properly tack care of their customers. Food was decent but I will not be coming back unless they get their act together.
author: Duke Of Frisco X.

description:
I don't know what it is exactly about SF, but in comparison to other metropolitan areas its $$$ and above establishments have been absolute, thorough failures,  while its's hole in the wall-s and Gastropubs shine brilliantly. 

Mescal selection galore + a kitchen truly worthy of adoration.  Add this place alongside Garaje if you're visiting SF for a weekend.
author: Pat C.

description:
Reservations are not allowed for groups under six people, so be prepared for a wait if you've got a smaller party. An hour and a half wait is nothing compared to the lifetime I've wasted not eating Don Pisto's Chorizo and Baked Eggs though. I'd like to have all the time I've lost eating other crap and give it back to the world in the form of waiting in line for this brunch. That actually seems fair.

They have also changed the bottomless mimosa game to be a fun, drunken challenge. You've got 90 minutes to significantly alter the rest of your day with the freedom to switch between three different kinds of mimosas. It's like a timed drinking contest interrupted only by slap-ya-mama deliciousness, and everyone wins!
author: Alexis H.

description: We split a couple of entrees, appetizers and tacos and everything was delicious. Very authentic and very fresh. Probably our best meal in San Francisco!
author: Jen V.

description:
My buddy Bob-o and I spent all day researching the best Mexican place in SF. We walked a very long while and arrived at Don Pisto's exactly at 5:30. We were the first ones there and by 6PM the place was packed.

I ordered the lobster tacos special, which turned out to be intended for two people. It was one of the best meals I've had in my brief time on this Earth. Bob-o enjoyed his meal too.
author: Tim O.

description: My friends took me here for my birthday dinner! The restaurant is situated on an uphill street in north beach, and can go un-noticed since they do not have a big sign. So you have to be attentive while looking for it, Once you enter, the space is not too big - which doesn't mean it is small or cramped up. On the interiors it is a little dimly lit, with popolar music playing. They have spacious restrooms too. Over the weekend, I'd recommend getting reservations because they do get quite busy. Both the drinks that I tried were great - margharita and michilada. We tried a lot of things on their menu, by favs were the bean enchiladas - soft and delicious loaded with gooey cheese, the vegetarian tacos served with very flavorful rice. They have different varieties of salsa that they serve with chips- all delish. Not to mention the guac was perfect - well, what good is a mexican restaurant that has okayish guac, right? I would love to go back here :D
author: Reema B.

description:
Came here on a saturday night with reservations at 6pm. Showed up late but they kept our table. the place was PACKED. 

The two of us ordered guacamole and chips, spicy tuna tacos, shrimp tacos, and the rib eye. The Guac was delicious but I wish they had mashed up the avocado a bit more. They left some huge pieces in there. spicy tuna tacos had a big kick; nice crunchy shell. Shrimp taco is fresh; but a bit small. ribeye IS BOMB. came with a salsa and green sauce. Overall; food is legit; and the service is fast but they want to get you in and out quick so don't expect to spend 2 hours here!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Love this place for brunch. Dinner is good too. Vibe is lively. Everything about this place is spot on.

Go for the spicy salsa verde and grilled Monterey squid. 

Parking is a nightmare obviously so take a lyft.
author: Stine H.

description: Came here for bottomless on a Sunday and was seated fairly quickly! You can choose from sangria or their mimosa of the day which was pineapple when I was there. I ordered the ham and egg poblano scramble thinking it would be worth the 14$ but it was your basic ham and egg scramble with chives on top. Not worth it so get something else! The huevos rancheros are good. Okay spot!
author: Mariana L.

description: So good! Fish tacos & ceviche were delicious. The service was fast, our waitress was awesome and did a great job. Salsa was fresh and chips amazing and refilled always. Worth the money. Defiently a small place so get here early or make a reservation. Tasty tasty!
author: Tasha B.

description:
We ordered a pitcher of margarita with 3 glasses. Instead of bringing empty glasses and filling them from the pitcher, they brought us a full pitcher and three full glasses. 

Sure the food was great, too, but I was sold at the abundance of tequila and agave.
author: Jordyn M.

description:
Some of the best, albeit upscale/expensive, Mexican food I've ever had. The calamari was amazing and the waitress was great.

BE ADVISED: this place is ridiculously loud. It was registering around 100 decibels on the sound meter app. It's probably the only restaurant I know of where you could go deaf if you eat there enough times.
author: Mike P.

description:
Love the hip hop they play here. It's a bit loud but you can still carry on conversations.

The food is pretty darn good.

Definitely need to get the pork chop...its marinated very well and has awesome flavors. I personally dont like med rare pork but it tasted really good. The grilled chicken was by far my favorite dish. I would definitely order this next time. Fish tacos were good too.

Only thing that turns me off here is that the food is slightly overpriced. 2 fish tacos for $12+ is a bit much. The pork chop ran $37 which was also is too expensive imo.
author: Guess W.

description: I stopped in here for a drink and some chips, ended up ordering the tamales as well- so delicious! They were fresh, hot and full of flavor. I shared the order with a friend and we both loved it, the Sangria was also refreshing and strong. Can't wait to revisit next time I'm in SF.
author: Sarita P.

description:
It seemed like every twentysomething in the city was at Don Pisto's on Sat night.  Our group of 14 (all of whom definitely past the twentysomething stage) was bribed with free shots of tequila so we could mosey on outside of the restaurant after we had finished our meal and our pitchers of margaritas.  There was quite a crowd outside waiting for tables. I  didn't realize just how popular this place is!

If you're gonna eat here and want to be able to talk to your friends next to you or across from you, either bring a bullhorn or have a fully charged phone so you can communicate with them via text. It is way too too loud inside (thanks to the music and din of the crowd) for any kind of meaningful conversation. I can see my friends' mouths move as they shout something at me, but understanding what they're saying is another matter!  My throat got really hoarse after a couple hours of shouting across the table. 

The tacos were great. I tried the beef, shrimp and al pastor tacos and they were all tasty.  The shrimp dish was also good. I didn't get to try the meatballs dish, but my friend said it was just okay. I would definitely stick with tacos. The chips and green salsa are both really good. The salsa had a little heat to it. The guacamole could use more lime and cilantro though! I ate lots of chips at the beginning as we were waiting for the rest of our party that I got full real fast. Hard to resist those chips! 

The margarita was good. One side of our table was enjoying it a little too much. Haha But that's cool! The birthday boy must enjoy his and his wife's night out without the kids! 

Service was good.  Our server made sure everyone had a drink and everyone had food!  The free shots of tequila was a brilliant tactic to get us out of there after paying for our bill. We toasted, took a picture,  and went on our merry way to Amante for more toasting, pictures and merriment!
author: Hazel C.

description:
We hit this place in March of 2015 and enjoyed it so much that we had to return. The menu range is nothing special but the food (Mexican street-style) is so delicious. You can't go wrong with any of the tacos; fish, shrimp and carnitas are all delicious. Decent margarita too. 

On the most recent visit some patrons were taking advantage of the $20 bottomless margarita/sangria deal that runs from 1:30-3:00 so it was very loud and the kitchen was a bit off sync. My tacos came much later than everyone else's meals and the waiter comped them. 

Recommended!
author: Tim B.

description:
What's the best word to describe Don Pisto's?

W-H-A-C-K-E-D.

Let me count the ways:

(1) Brunch menu for dinner? I'm sorry but we didn't just wait 1.5 hours to "eat a f*cking omelette" as my friend put it. 

(2) Out of Salsa? What the heezy? Have you ever heard of McDonald's running out of ketchup?

(3) Out of Lobster, Ceviche, and Carne Asada (limited dinner menu with just 3 entrees). They must have ran out of salt too because everything we ate was ridiculously bland. 

(4) Flavorless Guacamole ($6) that makes Chipotle's seem authentic. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/voFE8DTKsTFi1Vzm_zzd0Q?select=rz8P6fmmReZyJkObNhdLag#lmRX6fjCWarKG3FSkNiGhQ

(5) Bland and watery Chicken Tortilla Soup ($12). http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/voFE8DTKsTFi1Vzm_zzd0Q?select=rz8P6fmmReZyJkObNhdLag#9p5VdUBHtzZ5fwnkUJPBCQ

(6) 7x7's Hamburguesa ($11) that was well-done and tasted like a meatloaf. As whacked as the 7x7 list itself. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/voFE8DTKsTFi1Vzm_zzd0Q?select=rz8P6fmmReZyJkObNhdLag#y9DbC7QcCwQTKlSfZplTwA  

(7) Weak, fruitless Sangria. 

Perhaps they forgot to go grocery shopping that day and the kitchen was having an "off" day but the icing on the whacked cake was the service. After waiting for 1.5 hours, we wanted to enjoy our dinner. Instead, we were rushed in and out the door in 31 minutes (yes, I timed it). As we sat down, our waiter hurriedly said, "you guys are my last table....are you ready to order?" Slow your roll, Mr. Testaverde, we didn't even get a chance to breathe much less look at the menu. 

$38 later, I wished we went to The Mission for AUTHENTIC Mexican food instead. 

W-H-A-C-K-E-D.

OTHER NOTES:
*To my dear Yelpy friends who gave Don Pisto's 4-5 Stars, please don't hate me. 
*I'm a fan of their sister restaurant, Chubby Noodle (my review: http://www.yelp.com/biz/chubby-noodle-san-francisco-2#hrid:xM00NZ1lOYfL-Zqpu0093w).
*Reservations only taken for party of 6 or more.
*Expect 1-1.5 hour wait on weekends.
*Small bar area with 5 seats. No hard liquor available that night. 
*Tight and cramped seating for about 30 people in dining room and 5 communal tables in lower dining area.
*Street parking is atrocious.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Al Pastor tacos were amazing. Ordered a few oysters that were super tasty. If you get a margarita ask them to make it spicy, makes it even better. Loved the atmosphere, very dim and intimate with great music. It was fun here and the food was awesome. Definitely will be back.
author: Andrew M.

description:
We came in for a Sunday brunch. We had bottomless mimosas (some sort of watermelon juice- different + refreshing!), margaritas and sangria! I started with the margarita but then switched to the mimosa. So great. 
We all ordered the guacamole and chips, huevos rancheros, the scramble, steak tacos, fish tacos, hamburgesa and French toast. We had a wide variety and everything was amazing. I would recommend the tacos of the hamburgesa though, very flavorful and well executed. 
The service was great too! Everyone was laid back. We met the managers, Sina and Irvin when they helped bring out our food and kept checking on us. Our server was Gabby, she deserves an award for being so sweet, helpful and patient! Rilmy and Luis helped her out :) I made sure to write down everyone's names so I could give them a shoutout- they truly deserved it! Thanks guys! 

 Everyone was amazing!! The owner even came over and asked how everything was. 
The ambiance is cool, really chill, good music. It was pretty crowded and a little loud but that's what made it fun! It's not that snobby ass restaurant that makes you feel uncomfortable. Don Pisto's is definitely that chill place with good people and even better food and drinks that you can go with your friends and just chill out!
We will all definitely be coming back to this restaurant. Cheers to a fantastic establishment!
author: Danielle G.

description:
I like Don Pisto's, but to me it isn't super traditional Mexican food, which I am a sucker for. 

Brunch

This place is a great spot to go with a group of friends and get a little roughty. They have bottomless sangria, margarita, and mimosas. They also bump music, so it is loud, but fun if that is what you are trying to do. I always get the Huevos Rancheros. They're pretty good. Don Pisto's also takes brunch reservations, which is so nice because very few places in the city do. 

Dinner

The tacos are okay. 
Chorizo and mussels are tasty. The sauce is really delicious.
My favorite thing to get are the Lobster tacos. I believe they only serve them on a specific night, but they're fantastic. 

If you go on lobster taco night, get them!
author: Gabrielle C.

description:
MUSSEELLLLLSSSSS!!!!!!

Seriously, get the chorizo & mussels.  It's the shiznit.  SO delicious.

Ok fine, we also tried the mexican sashimi (salmon) and the Pork Chop. 

Both were absolutely delicious as well, but the mussels stole the show.

Let me get to the review.

We walked in this past Saturday around 7:30 and had to wait about 30-40 minutes.  We sat at the bar and grabbed a drink.  The bartender or whatever the guy was, was friendly, and entertaining. 

We got sat and ordered.  Everything came out timely and was delicious, including complimentary chips and salsa verde.

The sashimi had a sauce and a small jalepeno slice.  The very last sashimi piece had an extremely spicy jalepeno and i was burning up for a good 10 minutes.  

Next was the chorizo & mussels.  This was super hyped up by a friend and it did not disappoint.  

Finally, the pork chop came out.  I was astonished.  It was 2 huge pieces!  I was thinking to myself, this is unfair for the poor pig... it has the tall feat of topping the mussels.  Guess what, the pork chop was AWESOME.  Super juicy/tender/delicious.  It was served on a cucumber salsa type thing which added a great refreshing crunch. 

I had some awesome food in SF this past weekend but Don Pistos takes the cake.  A++++++++++++++++++++++

seriously... ++++++++++++++++++
author: Sennett L.

description: BEST TACOS IVE EVER EATEN. We ordered the chicken fajita, al pastor, spicy ahi tuna, and market fish tacos and had trouble picking a favorite. Their guacamole and ceviche is amazing too! The service is super efficient and you do not wait very long to get your food. Definitely will go back every time I am in San Francisco.
author: Mackynzie P.

description: Food was great like all yelpers have said but not greatest for vegitarians . Not much choice so gave it 4 stars. One would think san francisco's highly rated mexican restaurant would have more vegitarian choices. went there mainly cause of good yelp!
author: Louisa B.

description:
Love love love. Came here on a Sunday morning with another couple and we were lucky to be seated within 15 minutes. The restaurant looks like a bright cave and the decor was very funky and "hipster".

We ordered the breakfast burrito which I found to be extremely flavourful but the star of the brunch is definitely their bottomless drinks 

You don't have to stick with one type and you can choose a variety of flavour: sangria, mimosas, spritzers - they have a lot to offer! I also think they were pretty strong for a bottomless spot. 

Definitely a fun place to hang out and get boozy fun on a Sunday morning!
author: Sherina Y.

description: Fun hidden gem in North Beach. I would go here just for the guac (and have). It's to die for! The service is also really great. Good all you can drink selections for brunch. Brunch food is okay- but nothing too spectacular.
author: Christina M.

description: That margrita pitcher is well worth the money but don't go with just one other person (like I did) or you will leave very very drunk! The food was okay, not too impressed but I do love the exposed brick look!
author: Brittini S.

description:
Amazing brunch. They were way understaffed and still good service. Unlimited homemade Chios and green chilli salsa. 

Huevos rancheros was served uniquely but delicious. Huge margaritas. Bottomless for ,17 bucks. Great atmosphere. Mostly twenty something. Older couples and families avoid . great spot
author: Adam G.

description:
This place is everything you would ask for in the optimal brunch experience. Here's why:

1. BOTTOMLESS mimosas, sangria, and margaritas...and here's the kicker-- it's inter-changeable, meaning you can try one OR, which I personally recommend, try them all.

2. Super simple menu with things that you will definitely want to order. You can't go wrong with anything. I had bites of the breakfast burrito (OMG), the huevos rancheros, and the daily ceviche. All were delicious, flavorful, and fairly priced.

3. Free chips and salsa-- come on, everyone loves free chips and salsa. And the salsa is REALLY good and fresh, not out of a jar.

4. The service-- amazing staff who put off that hipster vibe, but are actually super friendly and hospitable. Our waitress bought us shots.

5. They also take reservations for parties of 6 or more. Or if you show up right at 11 when they open, you'll get a table no problem.

I will be taking all of my friends and even family here. It's a gem. What an awesome experience.
author: Hanna H.

description:
Delicious tacos, chips and salsa! The wait is a bit long and uncomfortable depending on the time you arrive - we went Thursday evening around 8ish. We waited around 30 mins but were able to order drinks and got some chips and salsa. We ordered guacamole as well, but it didn't get to us until we got to the table. Unfortunately there's not a lot of standing room so the group of us were shoulder to shoulder and having to move around to get out of the way. 

The tacos and salsa were worth the wait - we ordered two different types of tacos, and got two each. All was delicious and filling. During the service, we got warm chips which were amazing. The guacamole needed some heat, so we ended pouring some salsa into the guac. The salsa, btw, is relatively hot, so be wary. 

The acoustics of the restaurant were kind of terrible, so you'll definitely be able to have private conversations, only the person you're talking to may not be able to hear you.
author: Erica O.

description: My mom and I tried the tamales, ceviche, carne asada tacos, and the special ribs. All of it was ABSOLUTELY delicious. The waitresses were also very sweet. Definitely a little hole in the wall that is worth trying!!! All my mom and I can say is FABULOUS.
author: Sabrina S.

description: Was here for a friends bday. We sat in the lower level, which was hot, humid, and really loud. Everyone had trouble hearing each other and were sweating. The free chips and salsa were good. I got the fish tacos and steak tacos. Both of my fish tacos were soggy and not good. The steak tacos were good, the meat was very tender. Guacamole was ok. The tacos were freakin expensive though. $11-12 for two kinda small tacos. They weren't even that good. I've paid $8 for two similar sized tacos before, but they were really good so the price was justified. Here its not
author: Tim H.

description:
This was the dinner leg of a friend's bachelorette party. Our menu was pre-decided and the restaurant provided cute personalized menus. They also seemed to accommodate dietary restrictions (vegetarian, dairy-free, etc.) well. 

Overall, I thought the food and drinks were all very good:
-- Margaritas and Sangria by the pitcher: I only had the margarita, which I thought was just fine. 
-- Chips, Tomatillo Salsa and Guacamole: Delicious! The tomatillo salsa has a kick. 
-- Ceviche: Fresh and flavorful bit big chunks of shrimp, tomato, avocado...
-- Calamari: Grilled, not fried!
-- Fish Tacos: This was my favorite dish. A nice chunk of fish atop corn tortilla and topped with a cabbage slaw and some sort of dairy sauce. 
-- Chicken Tostadas: Crispy tortilla topped with moist, chopped chicken. Tasty. 
-- Carnitas Tacos: I didn't try one of these but it looked good. I was just too full at that point.

Aside from the food, the music was our JAM (90s hip hop/rap/dance hits). The downstairs room, where our group of 10 was seated, along with a few other large groups, was WARM. They had lots of fans and such but it was still uncomfortable. Service was good but seemed to stall at times, without good pacing between courses and we had to request additional drinks and wait a while for those refills.
author: Emily J.

description:
Don Pistos I must say, coming from a Mexican family in Los Angeles, you have made me LOVE salsa once more! You know it's good when your nose is running! 

The ambiance is so cool...club meets lounge meets restaurant. The music is Rap...way cool!. The overall vibe is very happening with making ANYONE feel good in here. 

The food:

Iced Tea= Thumbs up!  Guacamole=Great seasoning and taste!
Chicken Tacos=Great spice!! Awesome appetizer! 
Al Pastor Tacos=Really good especially on flour tortillas!
Enchiladas=2 THUMBS UP!

Service=You really made me feel at home and waited on us hand and foot! BRAVO!!! Thank you for a great experience!
author: Busy L.

description:
Been here twice and I've had a good food experience both times. Their house made chips amd salsa are great. Love their Enchiladas as well. 
Limited options for vegetarians but all the veggie options are awesome and drinks are pretty good.
It's really loud inside so don't expect to have a nice conversation over dinner. And they will only seat you once the entire party has arrived!
author: Bhavya K.

description: Place is quick to pass by with no signs, but don't let that fool you this place gets packed quick with the great food and nice people that work here.  Tacos you can't go wrong and the mimosas are bomb!! Fresh homemade chips and guacamole ... So good!!
author: David E.

description: GREAT brunch spot!  Came here with some local regulars when I was in town and I had one of the best sangrias ever!  We ordered the oysters and the shrimp tacos and they were both very delicious.  I highly recommend both of them.  The service was great too.  You just cannot be seated if your complete party is not there.  Not even if 1 person is missing..... so ridiculous.
author: Ariana J.

description:
Came here while out of town visiting a friend. Another one of our friends gave us the recommendation for Don Pisto's stating it was his 'must go to' place for SF. It could not have been a better recommendation. It's a great combination of divey, but amazing food, amazing drinks, amazing service and music (early 2000's throwbacks- it's just great, trust me). Definitely on the casual side but so fun for before a night out.

Must get: chips, guac, diablo wings, tacos...
author: Alison C.

description:
My coworkers have mentioned this place a handful of times, raving about Don Pisto's Coleman Ranch Pork Chops. After a long while and countless times of trying to hit up DP's, my boyfriend, Abby. A, and MIL (mother in law) enjoyed a nice dinner out. We came right when they opened on a weekday, and good thing because they filled up fairly quickly after opening. 

The vibe of the restaurant is pretty cool - I could tell they were trying to reel in folks in their 20's-30's from the music to the overall vibe. 
We went ahead and ordered the guacamole and chips ($7) - this was okay. It was definitely fresh, but way too simple. The chips were fresh and crunchy though-  I just think I make a better guacamole ;) (thanks Food Network!).
