We also ordered the shrimp and scallop ceviche ($13) - I would pass on this next time, unless its made with a different protein, because the scallop tasted a little too gamey and there wasn't enough citrus to cook the scallops through, it's also a little sweet because of the mandarin.

For the main courses we ordered two orders of Camarones [shrimp tacos ($11)]  - these were delicious! The shrimp were plump and juicy, and the bell peppers and onions were sauteed really well to pair the shrimp. The sauce was also delicious and made for a good extra to sop up with your extra tortilla. 

My boyfriend ordered the hamburgesa ($13) - this was pretty good. It looked really simple, literally just a bun, with a pretty thick patty and guacamole on top - but it was seasoned REALLY well and very soft and tender. 

Once we scarfed down the tacos and burgers, we felt we needed an extra something, so we went ahead and ordered the enchiladas ($15) - although meatless, the sauce, beans and cheese definitely made up for it.

The winner of the night in my opinion, other than a close call with the enchiladas was the Coleman ranch pork chops, just as my coworker had mentioned. It was the most tender, juicy, delicious, flavorful pork chop that had ever graced my taste buds. The cucumber salad was PERFECT to go with it - very refreshing and had a nice crunch!

To wash it all down, we ordered a pitcher of sangria ($32). My only gripe about the sangria was that there was only limes inside, I would've like to see oranges and apples or more fruit than just lime!

Tips: 
-If you have a party of 6 or more, I would definitely call and make a reservation. Smaller parties unfortunately have to do walk-ins.
-Take an UBER there, because parking is a pain in the A$$
-Get the pork chop, you'll thank me later.
author: Kathleene E.

description: This place was okay, not the best Mexican food I have had. The waitress and staff were very nice and friendly, so great service. The food was just not as amazing as what is depicted here.
author: Melissa C.

description:
Food (tacos, 4 different types) - 4 stars.
Service (sat at the bar) - 5 stars.
Decor (trendy, dark, very open) - 5 stars.
Prices (about norm for SF) - 4 stars.
Experience (the fact that no dirty stares or negative thoughts were sensed about the fact that I rolled up at 8:30 P.M. in basketball attire) - 10000 stars.

This is absolutely my go-to taco joint in the north beach area. Keep on Keepin on dudes.
author: Eric W.

description:
Decided to venture out to the city again and ended up here for some Mexican food. Now I wouldn't call it authentic but it was definitely tasty! 

Started off with the ceviche - so delicious! Fresh ingredients and just the right portion for 2 to share. 

I had the chorizo & mussels, once again,  extremely good! They give you a good amount of mussels and chorizo bits. Sauce was really good with just the perfect kick of spicy. Not sure if I can call this an entree as I don't really see anyone getting full off of only this plate. 

Friend had the pork chops which was good, super moist, and huge portion. 

I tried the sangria and it was meh, I've had better. 

Super friendly employees and I love the music but I think they can turn it down a notch as its so hard to have a conversation here. 

With just a few changes, this place can easily turn a 5 star from me!
author: Molly M.

description:
There's not much to really update on this one, except that Don Pisto's was my SF destination, and many times that's a set up for disappointment. In this case, I feel like it was even more awesome than last time. the carne asada tacos and the special with ribs were insanely good. 

Staff is very friendly. Some of the best Mexican I've ever had.
author: Scott S.

description:
Underwhelmed after hearing so many positive things about this place.  It almost feels like anytime you said "Don Pistos" the response you get is "OMG i LOVE that place".

After drinks we walked over here on a Thurs night around 9:30pm and were seated immediately downstairs (group of 7 of us).

 I ordered the shrimp and carnitas tacos (2 for $9-$11).. even being relatively drunk neither of the tacos stuck out to be very flavorful or delicious. Just whatever, probably not even as good as tacolicious. 

I wanted to try the hamburguesa that everyone RAVES about but apparently they only make it on Wed nights. WHY?

I was not impressed, but would be willing to give this place another try on a Wed and try the sangria and chips as well to see if it helps.
author: Melody T.

description: The food was pretty good. The service was pretty terrible. Our entrees were brought out before our appetizers (and we only ordered guac and soup - so why did that happen?) so they were rather cold by the time we got around to eating them. They also left the front door open on a really cold night and we were sitting at the bar (we were told those were the only spots available despite at least 50% of the restaurant being empty during the entirety of our meal). The food is the ONLY reason to go back...but we'll have to see if it is really worth it.
author: Emily K.

description:
We came here after visiting Coit Tower with a friend from out-of-town. 

The food is fresh and delicious. The chips are made in house and are served warm with spicy salsa. The guacamole is simple and fresh. The ceviche had great flavor and fresh ingredients. The Diablo wings were spicy, but nothing amazing. 

Aside from the food being great the overall atmosphere was great too. They played 90s and 00s hip hop. Everyone's drinking, socializing, and having a great time. 

The only reason I didn't give Don Pisto's 5 stars is because I thought it was a little overpriced for the portions served. The waitress suggested sharing the items on the menu, but when the portions arrived they were a little small.
author: Emily W.

description:
So my first time at Don Pisto's was with a group a friends for a birthday dinner. We all had a great time- the service was great (especially since we were probably an annoying group of 6-8 people), the food was delicious (I got the mushroom enchiladas- delicious!), and the atmosphere was great. 

Fast forward a few months and I am trying to do something for my parent's anniversary. Where better to send them then to Don Pistos'? They don't usually do reservations for less than 6 but I was able to talk to their Event Manager, Stephanie, and explain that I wanted to give them a surprise dinner for this celebration. She was amazing! She helped me get the reservation and the credit card set up so the meal would be on me, and in the end it turned out great. My parents loved it and even sent me a play by play of their meal while they were there. 

Definitely worth coming to!
author: Mared H.

description: This place is great!!!  The food, service, price and ambiance were all really good. It's gourmet Mexican and they are doing it right. The only 2 dings, it smelled of trash near the bathroom and they need a few more cocktail choices on the menu. I will go back soon!
author: Sarah S.

description:
I've been to Don Pisto's for both brunch and dinner and have only had delicious food. Their plates are made for sharing - they typically bring one dish out and then the other. For dinner, I had their carnitas tacos and enchiladas. Both were great, but I would highly recommend everyone try the enchiladas. They are served on a very hot skillet with an amazing sauce. 

The ambiance is very upbeat. The lights are dimmed, the music is on, and the people are ready for a night out on the town.
author: Emmy Q.

description: The pork chop is the best I've ever had. Just a fantastic, juicy, flavorful cut of meat perfectly charred on the grill. The tacos, burger etc looked okay. Clearly the pork chop is the star of the show and you should go here just for that. Staff was very friendly and service attentive. Top notch.
author: Marc P.

description: Hard to find, as there is no sign, but very good.  I had the Mexican Sashimi and my husband had an Niman Ranch Pork Chop.  Good Guacamole and Salsa Verde.
author: Mia M.

description:
One of the best places we've eaten at in SF. Food was exceptional - ceviche, carnitas, pescado. Be prepared to wait tho. 

The four stars is because of obnoxious music. The only lowlight is they play blaring music that takes away from atmosphere. It is a young crowd hangout. 

Try all you can drink pitchers for 90 minutes!!!!
author: Tri H.

description: Absolutely amazing!! Would go everyday if I could! All the food was amazing! The service was excellent! Great knowledge of food allergies! Stop reading and just go now, experience it for yourself!
author: Jenna G.

description: The food was delicious and margaritas were awesome! We came here for a reunion of cousins. There were ten of us. Definitely not a place to talk in a big group! It was very noisy and the music was loud.  Not a bad thing if there were just a few of you. Based on this experience, four stars!
author: Cathy D.

description: If you're considering it, do it! Close your eyes, point your finger, and just order it. I'm not kidding. Everything is so delicious, fresh and made to order. Service was wonderful! We had about an hour wait, but wondered down the street to Savory Tivoli for a drink and so worth it!
author: Christine B.

description:
My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this place after playing tennis and we were so glad that we did. Fun atmosphere. Great food. Friendly and fast service. 

And.... bottomless mimosas and margaritas until 3! Amazing. Can't wait to come back
author: K M.

description:
Really great sort of hidden gem (if that's possible with 1k+ reviews) in North Beach. One of our go to spots for tacos or if we have people staying downtown since it's an easy cab ride and they get a kick of the hole in the wall style of the place.

That said, they make some fantastic Mexican. Love: all tacos especially carnitas, diablo chicken wings, and gauc. You really can't go wrong in general here.
author: Brian H.

description:
My friend billed this as the "best place to get tacos in the Bay," and while I don't agree with him, it was good.

I had the fish tacos and those were really tasty. So was the guacamole--our table of four gobbled it up. 

The rest of the table had the ribs and the...I wanna say ox tail soup? I could be way off.

Our waitress was also awesome--she took our order and came back 15 minutes later and said, "Guys, I'm going to be honest. I completely lost your order ticket. What can I get you?" Five minutes later she came back with some shots on the house. To be real, could've cared less about the shots--she was honest and really genuine and I loved it. 

We had a great time--great service, good food. However, I contest there are other tacos in the Bay that have my heart. But, would definitely come back!

The good: good ambiance, good food.
The bad: we ate at 10 PM and we got the last table. Woah.
author: Amanda B.

description:
we almost walked right past this place.  we don't get mexiCAN in boston- not like this place.  i am a bit skeptical of this slow acceptance from californians to pay more than $2-3 for a taco.
this place is worth it.  well, maybe not for the price of a pacifico (yikes) but considering i haven't had one in a very long while... it was okay with me. 
they serve up quality tacos that are full of meat, heat and flavor.  i paused for a moment at the lovely perfection looking down at my pastor taco in one hand next to my pacifico.  i would have taken a picture, but i'm not that coordinated and it would be damn shame if i dropped my taco.  the carnitas and asada tacos are just as awesome as the pastor.  they deconstructed one taco plate for my son who can't do heat or green things touching his asada.

service was friendly and efficient. they were constantly making sure we got what we needed.
author: Karen Y.

description: My girlfriend and I both really liked the cozy atmosphere. It doesn't even really have a sign so you have to look out for it. We ended up totally filling up on three taco dishes and it was PLENTY. Carne asana, fish tacos and carnitas were all just great and the waiter was good too. Could have used a few dollars off per plate but otherwise well done :)
author: David N.

description:
Great service and even better food. What more can you ask for. Really good prices.  Lobster was delicious.  So was the ceviche and humburguesa. I will be coming back next time in I'm north beach.  

Came in on a Friday night and had to wait a couple minutes so keep that in mind. Chips and ceviche or guacamole is a perfect appetizer for the lobster.
author: T G.

description: Ambience was chill, great brunch. Got the Huevos racheros and was very satisfied. Have had better guac/chips elsewhere but still happy. Wait staff was very friendly, even when it got busy!
author: Sahil A.

description: My besties favorite place the food and service is always good. Get there early if you don't have a reservation because they get really crowded.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Came here for a friends birthday with a large group so we had a preset menu.  There was some confusion about the number of people we had reserved and whether or not we were doing preset.  We got it straightened out with the host rather quickly though.  

The food here is done well and has great flavor. I really like the squid skewer, but I could have been really hungry at that point.  The next two rounds were standard street tacos, frist chicken then beef, nothing special.  However, the next course kinda blew me away.  It was build your own lobster tacos (you are given a whole lobster for every four people).  You really can't hate on this cause the combo of sweet sweet lobster, soft fluffy flour tortillas, and drawn butter is amazing!  The finale was a grilled ribeye, again to share.   Accompanied with grilled green onions and guacamole.  The Ribeye is and will alaways be my favorite cut of steak!  

The chips, salsa, and guacamole for the table were also really good. The margaritas were a bit of a let down. The atmosphere is very casual and can get loud, although the 90's hip hop in the background was great!
author: Veasna H.

description:
Very friendly and attentive staff. The food was excellent. The ambiance is comfortable and relaxing. We'll definitely be back! 

Great date night spot.
author: Amanda M.

description:
SF, slow your roll !
4.5 star avg from over 1,400 reviews??
No way!
NO WAY!!!

This was perhaps the loudest restaurant I've ever been in. My daughter and I had to shout "What?!" so many times, we gave up communicating. 
No way a 5 star, no way a 4. 

There was only one vegetarian item on the menu!
Yeah, you read that right.
We quite often select Mexican joints for they are generally the most accommodating of the vegetarians in my family. 
Star count dropping. 

They do not have a proper liquor license and had the audacity to list items on the menu called "Margaritas" that were prepared with ... wine. 
Shame on you. 
Star count dropping. 

My carnitas tacos entree came with two tacos, and, wait for it,....nothing else!
Yup. 
No beans, no rice, no salad. 
Oh, and there wasn't even a salad of any type anywhere on the menu. Seriously. (Remember that veggie conundrum I mentioned)
So, two mediocre pork tacos, one mostly fat, for $12.
NO WAY!

Sure, the servers were attentive, and we got seated somewhat quickly at a communal table, and, I liked the salsa verde that accompanied the chips. 

This 4.5 star score is hype and/or hysteria. 
Don't buy into it. 
I won't be back.
author: Darrin D.

description: Incredible food! I trusted yelp to guide me one my one night in San Fran and she didn't disappoint. The food came fast and fresh and the staff was incredibly polite. As many mentioned, there is no clear signage.....  but that adds to the vibe for sure.
author: Lucas I.

description:
Found this highly rated spot and decided to give it a shot. Beer & wine only, decent selection of Mexican and craft beers. they also have piscos (margaritas) and the staff was friendly and provided very good service. 
Guacamole was above average and I also asked for habanero salsa(I am a chili head). They didn't have any but did there best to spice up the salsa. Extra star for that effort. 
Carne Asada tacos were TERRIFIC!!  They have this crazy wood burning grill and you could taste the char in the tacos.
author: Alex L.

description:
Sometimes you want eggs and booze, and you need a place that is close to your booty call- enter Don Pistos. 

I was out all night drinking Sculpins with a Siete Leguas chaser, when bae was all like "come OVER!! I need that D!!" I parked the BMdoubletrouble on Larkin near Broadway and gave up the batter, but next morning I'm like "Bisch better have my eggs 'n Margs" - he was out of organic free-range agave, so we decided to head down to Don P's.  I don't like to day drink around anyone over 40, so Don Pistos is perfect- the music and backwards turned baseball caps are a clear indicator to all "seniors" - move on!! we're still partying too loud for your taste!!  

The baked eggs and chorizo soaked up my booze perfectly and left me ready to conquer the mid-day.  The bottomless Margs took away the guilt of sleeping with the guy I swore I would leave after Afghanistan- Problem solved in North Beach, ya'll!!
author: Brendan W.

description: This is a happening place. Great ambiance but just a bit noisy for my taste. I'd recommend making reservations. I had the grilled calamari which was excellent!
author: Jerome O.

description:
Ok... Right off the bat you have to accept that this is trendy, Mexican-inspired food and not a corner taqueria. That being said, the food is delicious.

We walked in on a gorgeous Sunday morning with no reservations and we were sat right away (party of 6). Considering it was prime brunch hour we expected some kind of wait, but there was none. The free salsa verde that comes with the table chips is absolutely delicious; it really is. I wish it was spicier, but that's nothing some Tapatio can't fix. We also ordered some guac. At $8 it seemed pretty pricey, but it was pretty sizable and came in a stone mortar; we were happy. Tip: Mix some of the salsa into the guac to give it a more citrus-y flavor.

I had the breakfast burrito. In keeping with the disclaimer that began this review, do not expect a soft flour tortilla enveloping a massive load of everything a burrito should be and then wrapped in foil. This was a more elegant take on a breakfast burrito. Despite it not seeming huge, it was still quite filling. The burrito itself was pressed on the griddle giving the tortilla a toasted texture. Think of the grilled burritos from Taco Bell (but way better, of course) and you got the idea. We had a side of the potatoes and I have to say they are doing the burrito a great disservice my not putting the potatoes inside. The potatoes have a great garlic flavor to them and would have gone perfectly inside the burrito. 

The service was good; no complaints there. The one thing stood out was that they do not serve coffee. Instead we were told to go next door to a local coffee shop and bring it back. A little strange for a place that serves breakfast, but it wasn't a huge deal.

I wouldn't travel far to come here, but if it's easily accessible I would give it a shot.
author: Luciano C.

description:
I can't believe I haven't yelped this place sooner! Literally everything is amazing from the authentic street tacos to the chips guac and salsa that is completely addicting! 

It's like a modern lounge/taqueria that plays top 40 hits but tacos taste like authentic taco truck tacos. You have to try it to believe it. :-) I can eat here everyday. 

Oh and also, I threw our office holiday party here in their back room, everyone was just as in love with the food as I was. They have a group menu of your choice that you coordinate in advance with Margeux I believe is her name. Highly recommend!!
author: Charlene B.

description:
Food was amazing! Went for brunch and the Huevos rancheros and guacamole was delicious. 
Tiffany our waitress was so great, amazing service and great ambiance.
author: Cadey Lee E.

description:
This is really one of my favorite Mexican restaurants and judging by the other 5 star reviews everyone else agrees (which they should, because I'm right).

The margaritas are reliably alcoholic, the sangria is excellent. Everything else I've had here is off-the-charts good - ceviche, street-food-sized tacos - I esp like the fish ones, like scallops that they sometimes have. Even the guacamole tastes fresher, more flavorful and less mashed than what you get elsewhere.

Coming from Seattle it's basically impossible to find any Mexican food that's this good.

Note: They'll take reservations if your party is 6 or more, although that almost always means you get seated down in the dungeon (er, basement). Still delicious food, even if you do feel like you're well underground. Also it's in Little Italy, which I find an odd choice location wise, but it's worth the trip.

Go now, but be prepared to wait.
author: Joshua B.

description:
Hamburguesa. Enough said.

This little burger might be one of the best burgers I've ever had. Seriously. It was that good. The bread was perfection, and the patty was fluffy and filled with bacon. The layer of guac between the bread and patty was the perfect consistency and went amazingly with the patty. YUM.

The chips and salsa are bomb dot com as well. However, they will ruin your appetite, because you will eat  ton of them, and be extremely happy about it.

Also, for $17 you can get bottomless mimosas, sangria, margaritas. Unfortunately, my stomach was unable to handle liquor that morning, but my friends loved their drinks.

Finally the venue is adorable, and the service is IMPECCABLE. Though there is a slight wait, if you have a party of 6 or more you can make reservations! Score!
author: Michelle L.

description:
Good deal for 1.5 hours of bottomless mimosas (or margaritas or sangria) for $17. They refill you quickly and generously! Food is solid too. I had poached eggs over chorizo and potatoes. Atmosphere is loud but fun and open with windows all around unless you sit downstairs.

Takes reservations for 6+, otherwise get there by 11:30/11:45 and it's not too busy yet!
author: MaryKate M.

description:
Don Pisto's is a festive, trendy little joint. It feels 'very SF' and delivers on authentic Mexican flavors. It can be tough to get a table, but there are great drinks to be had while you wait. 

The price tag feels a little high for Mexican food, but the plates are filling and flavor-packed -worth the money. I thoroughly enjoyed their chorizo and mussels. House-made chorizo?? Yes, please! Their carnitas and tamales are excellent. I recommend a side of beans - so good. They always have great, seasonal specials. The enchiladas leave something to be desired. Overall, a great restaurant.
author: Shania T.

description:
We went to Don Pistos for a work related team dinner. It was on a Wednesday night. The restaurant itself had a nice cool vibe to it. Loved the background 90s hip hop music playing in the background. 

The service was not bad. Pretty quick. Felt a little rushed though. 

The good was actually pretty good. It took a while for it to come and because of that, we filled ourselves up on chips and salsa. The tacos were good but the fish tacos were way too spicy. I love spicy food. Trust me. But there is a line between spicy good that has flavor or just spicy. The cabbage on top was good but the spice on the fish way overpowering. Not as enjoyable. Would've been really good if they toned it down a bit. 

The rest of the good was ok. Not phenomenal but also not bad.
author: Steve J.

description: What a great night we had here!  They accommodated our group of 15 and it was perfect!  Service was great and the food delicious!  You can't go wrong with this little gem!
author: Molly F.

description:
Great go to for good food and a fun, lively atmosphere on the weekends. If you are looking for a boozy, bottomless brunch then you've met your match. 

I really loved their watermelon mimosas, it might just be a seasonal thing but I was in love. Only downfall is the service, it was pretty slow and aloof. It may be bottomless but my glass was only refilled 3 times, which isn't a lot over a 90 minute period (IMO).

They do not take reservations unless you are a party of 6 or more, but if you arrive between 11 - 11:30AM you should be fine getting a table. 

Also super strict on IDs. We are all later 20s/early 30s and one of our friends forgot their ID- he had to go all the way home to get it. A bummer but again, totally understand it's the law (duh!). :)

Overall, great spot- their dinner is good too. I'd give 5 stars for the event team because I once threw my boyfriend a birthday party downstairs in their private space and it was AWESOME. Super unique space and they were very easy to work with.
author: Meredith M.

description:
No bueno. Margaritas are extremely sweet -- like sipping a glass of syrup. Chips are very dense and overly done, not light or crunchy. Their frier must be on the fritz. Tacos were mediocre -- we tried the fish of the day (flounder) and the shrimp. Not much flavor, very oily and forgettable.

Restaurant layout amplifies all conversation so that the roar of tables around you makes chatting in a normal voice impossible. Be prepared for cheesy people and screaming at your date to be heard.
author: Madison S.

description: This place doesn't take reservations for tables with fewer than 6 people. Our party of 5 did not have trouble getting seated on a Friday night, despite a busy crowd. Food was simple, but good. The margarita here was good. The ambience is nice, but it's pretty loud. Our waiter was nice and friendly. We would all return.
author: Gary R.

description: Let's start with the positive. The service is great here. On the downside, the drinks and food are both sub-standard. This place has a lot of promise but the execution just isn't there yet. The drinks all taste a bit off. Some of this is because they lack a full alcohol license but also because they flavors and balance is off. As for food, there wasn't a single item that stood out. I've tried over half the menu now...Even the carnitas tacos were dry and un-flavorful and they are even made by Mexicans. Simple items should be perfect in a place like this. Overall, this place is disappointing
author: Michael B.

description:
Like this place! This is my second visit and I was craving Mexican food. I lived in Long Beach for over 6 years, so I am very critical of the bay areas Mexican food. However, this restaurant didn't disappoint. It's definitely gringo Mexican food, but it was delicious. My friends and i shared the fish tacos, guacamole, polls asado, calamari, and hamerguesa. The menu is designed so that you order several different dishes and share them.

The calamari was amazing, I was expecting it to fried but it was seasoning really well and came on skewers. It was the best not fried squid I've ever had! The guacamole was really good along with the chips and salsa they provided on the tables. I didn't eat the hamburger because I'm trying to avoid eating pork and beef as much as possible, but my friend said it was pretty good. 

I really enjoyed the ambience! Anytime you play hip-hop from the mid to late 2000's I'm a fan. I told my friends I would stay for the music, chips, and guacamole alone. The restaurant has the exposed brick wall loft look and it mad me feel like I was in a club that just happened to serve mexican food.  

The first time I came to the restaurant I really enjoyed the margaritas as well. When I'm craving fancy Mexican food, this will definitely be my go to place. It reminds me of several restaurants in southern California.
author: Ebonie M.

description:
Wow, where did this place come from?  I frequent SF fairly often for work and have been told about a lot of Mexican restaurants but this one was new to me.  I was told they don't take reservations so we arrived early and had no problem getting a table. The service was prompt and friendly, and we were given a lot of suggestions since it was my first time.

I really love ceviche so that was one of my choices. It was extremely fresh with good chunks of seafood (delicious scallop!) and avocado. The street tacos were huge and very flavourful. For these type of street tacos, I prefer Por Que No in Portland, but these still hit the spot for me.  As a main, we shared the chorizo and mussels. The portion was generous and there was a good heat in the flavour of the dish, but I wasn't a fan of the little bits of chorizo sprinkled throughout the dish. 

I saved room for dessert so I was pretty disappointed and surprised to learn they don't serve any!  Oh well, North Beach has plentiful places for dessert so we went elsewhere. All in all, great experience and worth a repeat if only for the ceviche alone.
author: Colene C.

description: Eh, It just wasn't our scene. Hipsters seem to like it and a whole bunch of other people but I cannot rationalize paying $12.00 for 2 tacos that are the length of my middle finger. We aren't cheap and will pay a lot for a good food but this wasn't it, we felt like the chips were the best part. Will we be back? No. It's just not that special
author: Susan S.

description: Hard to find with no sign that we could see.  Gets crowded quickly.  But got a table since we showed up early.  Food and beer choices were good.  Tables a little cramped but fun atmosphere. Service was friendly.
author: Mike B.

description:
I got delivery yesterday via Postmates and the food ROCKED. Postmates, not so much, but that's another topic! 

Onto the food... prices listed are to-go prices as listed on Don Pisto's receipt: 

Guacamole and chips - $8 ($7 on Don website) - AWESOME. Big serving, about 1.5 cups, with 2 paper bags of chips. Guac had plenty of fresh flavor, topped with crisp chopped white onions, accented with lime juice and cilantro. Chips were fresh, crunchy and salty deliciousness. 

Ham & Poblano Scramble - $11 ($10 on Don website) - Duroc ham, poblano, cheddar cheese, green onion. Monster serving and very good! Seriously looked like 6 eggs scrambled up with solid chunks of ham. Comes with side of really tasty potatoes too, or maybe those came with the Huevos Rancheros, but I think the scramble. 

Huevos Rancheros - $11 ($9 on Don website) - crispy tortillas, refritos, eggs sunny side up and pico de gallo. More normal serving size, still healthy portion, perfect eggs, super-fresh everything. Pico de gallo fantastic!

Pinto Beans - $3 (same on Don website) - Again, big 1.5 cup serving, packing good heat, pulled out a couple long red peppers from mix. Very good value!

Conclusion: Excellent food, big portions, GREAT flavor. Get it! :)

For my opinion on Postmates, see my other post here:
http://www.yelp.com/biz/postmates-san-francisco?hrid=y10cfVaKCQxWrz65T4urcw
author: Sarah J.

description:
Pisto's gets a solid 3.5 stars from me.

Don Pisto's is a fun brunch spot in North Beach. My favorite item on the brunch menu is the huevos rancheros. Poached eggs on top of crispy tortillas, topped with cheese & avocados. They come with a side of crispy potatoes. I also recommend the chips and guac.

It can get a bit loud and rowdy in there, but you can drown it out with bottomless mimosas or sangria.  

Pro tip: You can make reservations if you have six or more people in your party.
author: Grace C.

description:
The chips and guacamole were amazing- tasted super fresh and were addictive. =]

The shrimp ceviche was flavorful and delicious but tasted mostly like salted tomatoes and not much else.

The fish tacos were really delicious and my favorite dish here. The fish was flavorful, and the amount of filling per taco was generous. I would highly recommend this dish!

I was not too impressed with the hamburguesas. The meat was a bit salty, and I couldn't quite pinpoint the flavor but I would not recommend ordering this dish.

Overall the ambiance was good, the service was great, and the food was pretty good, but there are other Mexican restaurants that I would rather go to.
author: Aimee Z.

description: My husband had to order his beer THREE times to get it.  He then ordered me a Corona and they dropped off a 32oz saying this is all we have ... um hey, you maybe wanna mention that when we order it?  So, I considered not making a fuss about it then realized, fuck that.  I took A sip of it and sent it back to watch the manager hold it up to see how much I drank and scoff ... the manager who took the beer order and didn't mention that it was 32 fucking ounces.  Mind you, I have a 3 month old in my lap.  Anyway, cute place for a younger crowd.  Not too pricey, but service sucked and I was completely insulted that they were offended by me returning the beer.
author: Rebekah C.

description:
Great food, great drinks, great service. I've gone here 4 times now and never been disappointed. 

The only caveat is that I've always gotten the margaritas, tacos, ceviche, and guac so I can't comment on the plates.
author: Andy V.

description:
I went here for Sunday brunch around 11 AM, no reservation needed. Pretty cool place playing hip-hop music through brunch (though a little loud and hard to have a conversation). I ordered the pork tamale with poached egg - great tamale but eggs weren't okay, not memorable. Also ordered their mimosa (watermelon! so good) and a sangria (so-so.)

Overall pretty good spot to check-out if you're looking for Mexican brunch.
author: Leher P.

description:
One the best Mexican places I have tried. The guac is fresh and tasty, try it with an Anchor Steam beer. My table split the beef , pork, and shrimp tacos (each is an order of two). All three were excellent but try the pork if you are only going to try one. All had lots of flavor without being too spicy and each had a unique flavor. 

This place is a walk from the Wharf but worth the wait.
author: David H.

description:
It was my birthday and my pals wanted to take me out to a fun dinner.  Not knowing where to go, we decided to wander around downtown and found ourselves in North Beach.  My buddy had heard of a swanky spot for some hip Mexican food, which seemed out of place for North Beach, but after checking it out online and seeing it's amazing reviews, absolutely had to check it out.  It was really tricky to find since there's no signs and located on an otherwise quiet street but we eventually found it after walking by several times.

They started us off with house chips and salsa, which had really fresh and had a nice bite to it.  We ordered some oysters on the half shell, which were fresh and delicious, and bargain at $2 each.  I decided to get their special burger, which is marinated in bacon and onions, and cooked to a beautiful medium rare and topped with guacamole.  WOW!  It may look like a simple burger but it was full of flavor.  My girlfriend's ordered the tortilla soup, which was exactly what one would want on a cold night and cleared the sinuses right up.  Everything was executed flawlessly and was awesome.

Service is flawless, perhaps one of the best experiences I've had in SF.  The restaurant itself has a speakeasyish kind of vibe and it's really hard to find if you don't know it's there and had exposed brick walls inside.  Despite being hard to find, the place gets busy pretty quick so I recommend arriving early.  It was a super fun experience and I can't wait to go back!

Food: 9/10

Service: 10/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 10/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Came here for Sunday brunch during its prime time of bottomless mimosas,sangria,margarita, and fortunately got seated right away for 2 people. 

The complimentary chips & spicy green salsa were very good, thick&crunchy, and addicting! They were very generous in giving us more whenever we ran out. I decided to get the Shrimp Taco Sonora (handmade flour tortilla, queso oaxaca, pica de gallo), w/ no beans&crema but a side of over easy egg for me to put on top of the sonora. I ate it like a pizza cutting the tortilla in small triangles. I would get a slice of the soft crunchy tortilla & then scoop up some shrimp,queso,pico & yolk which was delicious! The yolk from the egg added that nice touch, which I'm really happy to have gotten based on my bf's suggestion. 

Overall, pretty good first experience, but the food didn't amaze me enough to give them a 4star. Maybe I'll try out their guac & tacos nxt time. Cool atmosphere, but it is really loud be aware.
author: Trina N.

description: Great service, yummy food! Wish it had been more clear that the bottomless cocktail fee was per person.  Went with a gf and our gal suggested that "it would be to our benefit" to it. We did, barely had 2 drinks each, at $21 per person (which it wasn't clear) wasn't the best deal! We spent more on the drinks we didn't have, than the food we actually ate!!
author: Erin S.

description:
I stopped in here with my Dad after listening to a blues band around the corner. It seems almost blasphemous not to eat Italian while in North Beach but that just wasn't going to work for us that night. I Yelped this place out, and glad that I did. Despite being a bit off the main drag, and definitely non-descript from the outside, this place is obviously a hit with the locals. 

We walked in at 6pm and could only be seated at a couple of awkwardly placed seats at the end of the bar.  It worked fine, though, thanks to the very friendly and attentive bartender. I also appreciated that she wasn't put off that we weren't drinking (the responsible choice before a drive back to the East Bay).

We each ordered tacos (el pastor for me, chicken for my dad). While not a huge portion for $9, they were nicely spiced and well prepared. The chips and salsa were a nice accompaniment. The balance of the menu also looked interesting.  I'd be inclined to come back some time and explore further, if I ever found myself back in this part of town.
author: Shawn W.

description:
I have eaten a lot in my live , a lot of pork and pork chops but I can say with all confidence that I have eaten the best pork chop in my 36 year old live.
CONGRATULATIONS CHEF! ! Wow yum yum
author: Jesus F.

description:
The pollo asado, the guacamole and the street corn are delicious! The chicken was also delicious!
I would definitely eat here again.
author: adrienne g.

description: One of the best brunches I've had in a while! Amazing service thank you Kate and thanks Sofia for sitting us so fast during a busy brunch hour. Jeff also checked up on us during our whole bunch, so kind and had a wonderful chat afterwards. Food was amazing and drinks for unlimited was phenomenal! A must repeat :))
author: Alexa F.

description:
When Yelp suggested to write a review  about Don Pisto's because I checked in, I struggled for solid 5 seconds to remember what this place was. Located in the fancy Telegraph Hill neighborhood, the restaurant was filled with a bunch of show-off wannabes. The decor was cool and hip, the hostess was very friendly and constantly updated us on how long it was going to take to get a table. 

The complimentary tomatillo salsa was very bland. The fried in the house chips were a hit. I ordered Ceviche Mexicano.  The seafood was marinated in orange juice, served with avocado and pico de gallo.  Once again very bland, boring, too sweet.  My fiancee ordered some tacos. I can't even remember what they tasted like. The food portions were on a stingy side. Definitely not the place were you get a lot of bang for your buck, not even any flavor for your buck to justify the price tag.
author: Lana S.

description: SF's best Mexican spot!! Delicious guac and tacos, great atmosphere. The servers are always extremely helpful with the food. Definitely order the chips and guacamole (and salsa). My favourite was the fish and carnitas tacos. The margaritas are also fantastic!
author: Sandy T.

description: My wife and I were looking for some great San Francisco tacos and we found them (with a little from Yelp). This place is hopping and the food is awesome! So much flavor! The tamales were super!
author: Erik R.

description: Thank You Yelp! Decided to make be extra trek to Don Pisto's on New Year's Day and was not disappointed. Love the 90's and 00's hip hop and rap. Great atmosphere. Got a bucket of beers and a wine margarita for the Mrs. Guacamole was hands down the best I have had from a restaurant. Ceviche was excellent. We ordered the fish and shrimp tacos. Both were high quality and delicious.
author: Justin P.

description:
Move over Don Julio! It's time for some Don Pisto's! They were super crowded, but one of the girls in our group worked her charm and managed to get our party of 5 on the list. We waited at a cafe down the street and the nice gentleman called us within 15 minutes when our table was ready. The first thing I saw on the menu was Puerto Nuevo lobster! NO! Really? Because I plan on going to Puerto Nuevo to try the lobster, but I need to hire security to combat the drug cartels. Or maybe I'll just wing it one day when I'm feeling dangerous! I really would do anything for a great meal! Anyway, when I saw the Puerto Nuevo lobster on the menu, I was like diga me! Is this for real!? And it was :) This other random girl vouched for its authenticity! 

So we ordered the lobster, the pork chop, the tortilla soup, and the micheladas. 

Lobster: So delicious! Luckily, I've been to my fair share of lobster fests so I know what to do with a pair of those lobster cracker things [insert actual title of tool here]. I dipped the lobster in the luscious garlic and butter sauce and just let it sit there for a little bit. I then made my "Leena-Style Tacos" ohhh...the tacos! The corn tortillas were warm, fresh, and I think they were made directly from my Mexican grandmother (if I were to have a Mexican grandmother). They were lightly oiled and cooked just enough to melt in your mouth. I added the beans and rice, the spicy salsa, and of course, the lobster. Damn...that was a great taco. 

Tortilla Soup: Because of this soup, my people will now have to travel all the way to Don Pisto's to get me this tortilla soup when I'm sick. If they try to hand me Campbell's or Progresso, that's just not gonna fly...the tortilla soup here is SO DELICIOUS! The flavors mesh so well together. 

Pork chop: I was expecting it to be a little more tender, but the flavoring was delicious. It was a bit tough to cut but once you got that savory little piece of meat on a fork, MmMmM! Delicious! 

aaaaand the micheladas were awesome and spicy! I was able to convince my table to get a round! They definitely come at you with a bang! :) 

I can't wait to come back to this place!! :)
author: Leena B.

description:
I ordered something from Don Pisto's for delivery a few years ago and I remember being blown away by how good it was. I've been wanting to try it since, but the wife is vegetarian and there doesn't seem to be anything for her on their limited menu and other places nearby like Tony's and Park Tavern usually win out in any decisions on where to dine in North Beach.
I tried DP last night with a friend. We both love going to the Mission and getting the real deal in taquerias so we were both stoked to try this place.
We got seated at the tiny bar quickly which was a plus, otherwise we'd be looking at a 45 min. wait. The bar seats only 3 or 4 people. I ordered a margarita and wasn't impressed. After reading some reviews today I can see they may not have a liquor license to use tequila so they use wine. It tasted pretty odd to me and did pass as a margarita, but it was pretty dull and now I know why. Downgrade one star.
We had carne asada and carnitas tacos, tamales and an enchilada. The food was good to excellent, I won't lie, but it wasn't mind blowing and it seemed to lack a touch of something that you only get in taquerias. 
As others have also noted, the place is LOUD as hell. Also, prices are pretty through the roof. 2 simple street style tacos with nothing else should not go for $12, but they do here. 
All in all, I would probably give this place another try if the timing was right (meaning I could actually get a table and there weren't too many people making it so loud) although I won't be rushing back anytime soon.
author: Matt H.

description:
As an LA native, I've grown up with Mexican food as a staple part of my diet. So from the moment the server handed me my plate to the moment I walked out the joint, my appetite only grew and my satisfaction shrank. 

The biggest issue I have with this place is the value they place on their food. Two pastor tacos are priced at $11. Now these tacos aren't particularly big - no larger than your dollar street tacos. These overpriced tacos don't have handmade tortillas - a key distinguishing feature that I typically see from artisanal and street tacos. The tacos themselves tasted rather mediocre - not bad, not great. 

To be frank, this place just isn't worth it. Right after, my friends and I went to the pizza parlor around the corner because we were starving. Next time your craving Mexican food, know that Don Pisto's is an extra $, but half the food.
author: Kenneth S.

description:
If you are looking for delicious food but not so much intamacy this is the place. My husband and I visited on a Friday night around 7 pm. It was busy to say the least. The service was exceptional. From the server bringing the chips and salsa to our waitress we were never waiting and always taken care of.  We enjoyed watching the chefs in the kitchen working together. 

In order to be seated without waiting 30 minutes we chose to sit at a "communal" table which means sitting at a table for 6 with another group of people you don't know.

The only reason this is a four star and not a five is we did not care for the margaritas. To us a margarita is not a margarita without tequila. Fish tacos were exceptional. The carnitas tacos were average.
author: Tracy B.

description:
A party in your mouth!

On a girls trip up to San Francisco my foodie friend suggested we go here.  We met up with another friend that had recently moved up to San Francisco and we all had dinner.

This food is slap yo momma in the face good!

You have to get the tortillas.  They are fired in pork fat.  So not healthy for you but WHO CARES!

We also ordered some sort of beef but it was more like a baby cow it was so huge.  There were 3 of us and we ate off of it and still had plenty to take home.  I don't know what they marinated it in but it was delicious!  It was perfectly cooked, tender and juicy.  I am certain I heard the angels singing while I was eating.

Then we also ordered some lobster thing.  OMG!  I almost started to cry it was so good.  I think my eyes are starting to water just remembering how GREAT the food was here!

A must go place!  They don't take reservations and tend to fill up quickly so get there early.  They are only open for dinner.  I love North Beach anyway this just made it even better.

Did I mention how good everything was? I am soooo NOT EVER becoming a vegetarian with meat this good!
author: Ryan P.

description:
Been here several times and have never been disappointed. It's a popular place so expect to wait to be seated. Honestly, I wouldn't wait more than 20 mins for this place considering there are so many great options within 5 minutes walking distance.

Service could improve a little bit they are always packed so I get it.
author: Jonah M.

description:
Fun restaurant to come to for some higher end Mexican dining experience. The place has a rustic look and feel inside and is a little on the smaller end.  

They provide you with unlimited chips and homemade salsa. Their tacos were good, but I'm not too sure if it was really worth the price. I think i would be just as happy eating $2 tacos from a taco truck, but then again like i said, it's more for the experience here. 

Don Pisto's is right next to all of the north beach bars so if you're craving some Mexican food before you begin the night this would be a great place to start.
author: Angela K.

description:
I would give this place 3.5 stars, if I could. 

I enjoyed my meal, don't get me wrong. But I only ate, did not drink - and this may be why I'm not obsessed with this place. In summary: if you want solid mexican food with a twist, and a cool atmosphere this is your place!

We tried the ahi tuna tacos as well as the fish tacos. Ahi tuna look super scary but taste fresh and good. The fish tacos were fine, but nothing amazing. Overall, this was my feeling about the dining here - solid but I've had better.
author: Zahra K.

description: Fantastic food, great vibe! Definitely a great brunch spot! I had the pork tamales with poached eggs. The chipotle sauce is the right level of smokey. Really good and well portioned dish. Diners are served a small bowl of chips and salsa when seated. The chips are clearly house made and awesome. Perfectly salted and crisped. The salsa is a green salsa with just enough spice. The mimosas are on point. Delish. Recommend!
author: Sarahanne C.

description:
Listo for Pistos...
To North Beach on a mission. 
Mexi-can party.
author: Nish N.

description: The food are really good.  Small place but always full house.  We order the shrimp tacos, pork chop and the ribs for two of us. The entrees portion was really generous. Three dishes can feed us really well.  I special love the pork chop. Perfectly cook, slightly pink in the middle and very juicy! Will come back and try something else!
author: Kristine L.

description: Overpriced mexican, tiny tacos, but man their bottomless sangrias - YUM! (I've only been here for brunch.)  Loud, slow service.
author: Pam L.

description:
Came here on a whim cause the bf saw it on Yelp after me telling him I was craving Mexican. Had to get the tacos here. We shared Al Pastor and Carnitas. I really liked the Al Pastor, but the carnitas seemed a bit dry and not as flavorful. We also had their ceviche which was really good. Had lots of large chunks of scallops and shrimp. The guacamole was fresh, but could use a bit more salt and lime.

Overall this was a good meal. Our waitress was pretty nice though we didn't need her assistance much. The restaurant ambiance is cool, laid-back and kind of modern. Walked in and definitely wasn't expecting to see this place, I was thinking we would go to some hole-in-the-wall place for Mexican food.

I like that this place is open late. Great for the late night snack.
author: Katherine L.

description:
Don Pisto's tries to be incognito with the no signage outside, but savvy people KNOW about this place because of the:

Bottomless mimosas.

Bottomless sangrias.

Bottomless margaritas.

Only a couple more reasons to look forward to the weekend, right?

For those of you with a bottomless pit (sorry, I just had to go there), they have a short brunch menu filled with delicious items from the huge french toast with bacon, savory chorizo and eggs, hearty breakfast burrito and even a juicy burger topped with avocado. Just watch out for the HOT chile, it left my mouth numb for a couple of minutes, which I fortunately had to un-numb with their agua fresca mimosa. Aaahhh....

We had a group of 15 here last Saturday for a birthday brunch, service was nothing short of FANTASTIC! Chips and salsa constantly refilled, drinks never empty, dishes came out hot and fast.  At some point, the owner had to move our party to a different table because there was another rezzie after us, but in exchange he ended up giving us a discount AND handing out more free booze. AY CARUMBA! All I can say is, it was indeed a birthday brunch to remember! 

Make Don Pisto's your choice for a birthday event or any other celebration and for sure you'll have a lot of bottomless fun!

But please, don't come bottom less.  =P
author: Janice C.

description: This place was really a disappointment. I'd heard great things and so a friend and I went on a Tuesday night around 9, well before closing. Not only did the place look closed, but it was near empty despite 1 other party that looked absolutely miserable and yet the service was super slow. The waiters were really nice once we were being served, but the service took way too long given the fact there were 4 (visible) waiters doing nothing.  As for the food, the ceviche was tasteless and soggy as if it'd been sitting in its own watered down broth all day and the tacos were incredibly spicy. Both myself and my friend have decently high tolerances (often, medium spicy is not spicy enough for us) and yet, we were both actually in tears/pain when we ate the carne asadas tacos- which we did not ask to be spicy and the menu nor the waiter gave no warning. When my friend was practically in tears, one of the waiters came by and laughed as he filled our water. It was quite obviously an uncomfortable experience at the VERY least. Would MAYBEEE try again, but would need a good reason.
author: Quinn Li O.

description: Authentic and simple tacos with extraordinary flavor, excellent guacamole, and really superb service. Highly recommend.
author: Andy C.

description:
Things to order:
- Ceviche
- Hamburgesa
- Carne Asana tacos
- Pescado tacos

Can't go wrong with this one place either way
author: Mahmud D.

description:
What an amazing place to go!!!!
We go there with 3 friends and yelp doesn't lied.
The food is awesome, that remembered my vacation in mexico.

All the services are very good, the bohemia beer is very good. 
We order 2 times guacamole because that the best we eat in san francisco.
We order chicken and mussel. What a Wonderfull idea.

The atmosphere is a little loud and good music. 
I hope to go there once again quickly.
author: Thomas M.

description:
As Don Pisto's only takes reservations for parties of 6 or more, our party of 4 had to wait for an hour and a half (Saturday at around 8 pm)--understandable, but just be ready. And of course the North Beach parking was atrocious as usual.

Once we got in, it was quite noisy, with a posh crowd, loud talking, & techno bass beats. We asked our pleasant waitress what the "must try" items on menu were--she recommended the following 

- Wild Monterey Calamari - charcoal grilled, orange, lime, radish salad
- Diablo Prawns - wild mexican prawns, spicy diabla sauce
- Puerto Nuevo Lobster - whole maine lobster, homemade flour tortillas, rice, beans, arbol salsa, cilantro butter
- House-made Chorizo Mussels - mexican country sausage, white wine, and cilantro
- Poc Chuc - grilled pork rib chop, orange chili marinade, spicy cucumber salad

We ordered the calamari, prawns, and poc chuc, but replaced the lobster and mussels with this item, which would later haunt us:

- Pescado Tacos - market fresh fish, arbol & avocado salsa, cabbage & onion slaw

My take on the Calamari:

Maybe the best calamari I've ever had. It wasn't really rubbery at all--more meaty. Served on skewers. Wonderful grilled flavor. And the fresh citrus provided a refreshing accompaniment.

My take on the Diablo Prawns:

Big and fresh. As with the calamari, absolutely no fishy flavor. The diabla sauce was essentially chipotle sauce--strong smoked chili flavor. Not bad at all.

My take on the Pescado Tacos:

What was the "market fresh fish"? Who knows--they didn't tell us. It wasn't fishy I guess. The description had me at "avocado salsa", but I was distraught that there was barely any avocado flavor at all. The cabbage & onion slaw was boring. And the corn tortilla wasn't hard, and it wasn't soft, which means that...it wasn't good.

My take on the Poc Chuc:

This was executed quite marvelously--the meat was extremely juicy, and the orange chili marinade provided a brilliant overtone. The meat surrounding the bone was superiorly marbled. I was indifferent about the cucumber salad.

All in all:

It was a lovely meal, not holy enough for 5 stars, but fancy enough to kick it above a standard 4 star.
author: Elliott D.

description:
It's hard not to love this spot. Guacamole is fire, tacos equally bomb. I got carne asada and carnitas, both cooked just right. I had some salsa verde and it was really awesome went well with my food. 

Best date night I ever went on. Atmosphere was legit, with the lighting on point. It wasn't very busy so I was hella happy about that.  

Our server was sweet and on point. :)!
author: Faith C.

description:
Ive been to don pisto's a few times. Great for brunch with mimosas and margaritas flowing.

Food is always good.

Its a very small restaurant, staff was great and the manager really went above and beyond to accommodate 14 of us for my cousins birthday dinner.

I definitely recommend don pistos.

The fresh made guac is delicious.

Its also in a great area, good bars around and a block away from washington square park
author: Doug H.

description:
I haven't stopped raving (aka annoying the shit out of my friends) about how amazeballz don pisto's is after coming here last week.  Before reviewing, I will preface with this:

1) I don't typically like paying more than $10 for Mexican food
2) I had high expectations for this place because everyone else had hyped it up
3) I was drunk when I ate here (but I'm awfully truthful when I'm inebriated, so THE FEELINGS I FELT WHILE EATING HERE WERE REAL I PROMISE)

I ate here with 2 guy friends, which ultimately made the whole experience wonderful.  I didn't have to sit around with my girls listening to them figure out how they could split 2 tacos between 5 people because they're sooo full from half the salad they had for lunch.  

Anyway, we ordered the fish tacos and carnitas, both of which were yumz.  (If you're wondering how you can split the 2 tacos per order between 4 people however, the tacos come with two layers of corn tortilla, so... you can just make 2 more tacos with less meat.)

We also split the wild Monterey calamari, which was my favourite because it was grilled rather than fried.  If you have an issue with weird textures, I wouldn't order this, though.

The boys' favourite was the poc chuc, which was a huge grilled pork rib.  I don't usually eat pork, but this was worth trying.  The meat was tender, juicy, and probably not all that healthy for you... but I'm not sure what you're doing at a place like this if you're trying to be healthy.

Anyway, we topped it off by splitting a 32oz corona, and it came out to $73 in total for 3 people or $24 a person.  Pretty awesome.

Word on the street is that they also don't like groups bigger than 4.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Came here for chips and Guac. The Guac was very good and service was quick. Waitress wasn't very nice, but in general, we had a nice time
author: Courtney B.

description: My mouth is watering just thinking about the meal I had. I got the chicken tacos, rice and beans, and sangria. It comes with a side of unlimited and amazingly delicious chips and salsa. It is spicy though! The chicken was tender, moist, and flavorful and the corn tortillas were grilled and yummy. Rice and beans were a perfect compliment. And the sangria was amazing, not too sweet but fruity and mixed with red and white wine. Ambiance was dim lighting, good music, great service, and romantic setting. Also great for groups!
author: Jacqui C.

description:
Greg and I have had a hankering for tacos for awhile, and decided to head out to Don Pisto's on a Friday night.  The last time we were here, it was crowded, loud, and dimly lit.  Well, that much of it hasn't changed either.  We thankfully didn't wait long for a table, and were quick to pull the trigger on ordering when we sat down.  We opted for the following tacos: Carne Asada, Carnitas, and Al Pastor.  I shamelessly asked for the $6 guacamole, and had a very large glass of sangria to go with the unlimited helping of tortilla chips.

All in all, the tacos were solid and the guac was fresh.  Needless to say, we made it easy on the dishwasher when we were done.  It's definitely a little pricey considering you only get two tacos per order, but they are most definitely delicious.  I get why people don't like here, but whether you end up at Don Pisto's or the new Tacolicious joint down the street, you'll be paying a pretty penny anyway.  I definitely enjoyed our meal and would definitely come back for another round.
author: Lisa I.

description:
the tacos, the guacomole and civeche were all great. this is a good place with a fun and live vibe, nice and loud , with people talking, music in the back etc.
only bad part is that there is no hard liquor so heads up, but i wont take that against their score.

they have beer etc, and the employees were are cool and nice. they didnt mind i waited in the front and i blocked them many times, and they never told me to move or to stand outside. so good job on that.
author: Saman K.

description:
YUM YUM TAPAS and hipster ambience!

The AWESOME:

AL PASTOR TACOS ARE LIKE HEAVEN!!
- let me just say that these were likely one of the best tacos i have ever eaten!  it was so juicy and full of flavor, without all the lard dripping down my arm (taco enthusiasts, you know what i mean!)  the added veggies have the right amount of flavor and crunch.  

Prawns
- OMG SPICY SALSA was so delicious, i almost cried!  maybe it was the heat, maybe it was the depth of the salsa and pepper flavor, whatever it was, i licked that plate clean! prawns were large, juicy, and on point as well!

The MEH...:

Calamari 
good flavor with the use of different dry spices, but it was a very light flavor, you may want to eat it as an appetizer because the rest of the dishes we had were certainly more flavorful

Salmon Sashimi
- a good cut of marbled fatty salmon, unfortunately it was just a little frosty, however the ponzu sauce was as good as it is in every other restaurant

Oh NO:

Pescado tacos 
- salty, salty, salty.  unfortunately these tacos has nothing more to offer.

Service was excellent, i went on Halloween night and the young gentleman dressed in a cowboy  (?) costume was super friendly and helpful!  his service alone was enough to make up for the high priced tapas and long wait for the food

would i come again?  maybe just for the prawns and al pastor tacos on a cold day.
author: Tina A.

description:
Saw this restaurant on thrillist and decided to check it out. My boyfriend and I came here yesterday for a late brunch on a beautiful day. We got there around 1:20 and put our name on the list after being told there was an hour wait. We walked around the area for about 25 minutes before deciding to check back in. We were seated when we came back. 

Environment: The restaurant itself is really cute. It's a small, trendy building with a small bar and even smaller kitchen. Regardless, the place was packed. We saw this as a good sign as we sat. Over the course of our visit it seemed like the music and the noise level in general increased rapidly. At one point we literally felt like we had to yell to talk to each other. It was just uncomfortable and irritating at some times.

Drinks: We each ordered the $6 micheladas which we have had at numerous places although have never had one that is served with bud light as the beer. The drinks took a good amount of time to make it to our table...Nevertheless, we drank that one drink and stuck to water afterwards. 

Food: We started with the guacamole which was really good and thank god we decided to order a small appetizer to hold us over for the hour that we then had to wait for our 2 breakfast burritos to arrive. We asked our waitress several times how much longer they would take and she just kept apologizing for the wait and saying they were busy. I get that but it's a freaking burrito for crying out loud. So an hour later we got our burritos expecting it to be the best thing we've ever eaten at a brunch. It was good, but nothing special at all. We scarfed them down (because we were starving by this time) and immediately paid and left.

We spend over $40 on a mediocre meal, the worst (and slowest) service we have ever had at a restaurant, and some weak drinks. Overall an unsatisfactory visit to this hip spot. I can see how it can be fun for a young, inexperienced dining crowd but as an adult with plenty of satisfying and well-trained dining experiences, this place just doesn't cut it.

Needless to say we won't be back.
author: Kim C.

description:
Second thoughts.

First impression: Pork chop that lives up to the hype. Incredible shrimp tacos. Good if not as noteworthy pollo asado with tortillas but surprisingly no beans.

Energetic food for an energetic atmosphere. $8 glasses of sangria no doubt field the loud, yet surprisingly intimate, scene. $90/two.

Second impression: Mediocre French toast with a side of bacon but no fruit. Both needed for $12. Fortunately brunch was saved by the excellent pork tamale and eggs.

It was just so loud. Almost required yelling. Also required $20. Not sure it was worth it.

Four stars for dinner. Two for breakfast.

Which makes three.
author: Jason B.

description: I think that serving a completely uncooked fish meat in a fish taco does not just look bad, but is also risky from a health perspective. Having said that, I feel bad because the food from this restaurant is generally good.
author: Carlo P.

description: Could be MUCH better with proper supervision/management. Food was good. Extraordinarily loud...no ridiculously loud. So close to being a great restaurant. Dining room downstairs reeked heavily of decay.
author: Joe D.

description: I usually come to Don Pisto's for 2 things - guacamole and pork chop. The guac is creamy with the perfect amount of lime. The pork chop never disappoints! Thick, tender and juicy. (Big enough to share between 2 people.) The waiter who served us was awesome! Check out my photos!
author: Lancelot W.

description:
Came here a few weeks ago for the first time with two of my girlfriends in tow. 

The place was packed. If you're a single chick reading this, I think it's important to mention that the place was packed with hot dudes. Straight hot dudes. Not sure what was going on (hot guys of America meeting?) but I was pretty into it. I'm sure there were hot girls there too, (hello? We were there) but I don't swing that way so I wasn't paying attention. 

The layout of the place is cool. It's pretty spacious. There's an entire back room where more hot guys could be hiding. 

We were seated quickly and the staff was awesome. We loved our server, Nick. Apart from being very accommodating- we had great chemistry. 

I'm assuming Nick probably would have proposed, but I had to keep the flirting light because it was a "girls night." Nick, if you're reading this, keep an eye out for my missed connections post. 


The food was to die for. I am normally not a fan of sharing because I have only child syndrome- but I couldn't help trying EVERYTHING on everyone's plate around me. It was all really good. 

At one point I even saw a puppy. Like, during my meal. I just don't know if there could be a more perfect situation. 

The only thing that could possibly be counted as a snafu was when Nick (our waiter) accidentally brought my friend the wrong (but similar to what she had ordered) dish. He let us keep the wrong dish (I ate it, obviously) and brought us the correct dish at no charge. So the snafu actually turned out to be awesome. 

If after reading this entire review you don't feel the need to try Don Pisto's, I will just have to assume that you've been pretending your whole life and you can't really read at all. It's time to face facts, get a tutor, and go eat at Don Pisto's.
author: Renee R.

description:
After reading the reviews they had me at "old school rap playing in the background" who doesn't want to hear Tupac and Biggie Smalls while enjoying street tacos. The ambiance made me feel so gangster I decided on the managers recommendation for the diablo prawns.

If you're not feeling as manly as you know you can be these spicy as fuck crustaceans will get you that Movember beard in a hot minute. The salsa was amazing, def roasted the ingredients and the heat was just perfect. Disclaimer: if you were raised on spicy like me then this will take you back to the days your mom would run you out of the kitchen with all the pepper roasting happening in the casa. 

I had a couple sangrias that were way too easy going down. The carnitas tacos were amazeballs. As an appetizer I had the Mexican sashimi, melt in my mouth salmon! Sarah was my bartender and I give 5 stars on the service. For my entree I had the mussels with chorizo. These flavorful bad boys will get you to foodgasm heaven. 

No dessert offered here but the manager was enough eye candy for me.

I'll def be back!
author: Leslie P.

description: Service was awesome. Food was amazing. The entire brunch menu looked so good, I wanted to order one of everything. Their playlist was also on point! Wasn't a huge fan of their mimosa, but that's about my only complaint. Will definitely be back
author: miss l.

description:
4 out of five just because the place is very loud, and you're probably gonna smell by the time your dinner is over. 

Apart from this, pork, calamari and guacamole are absolutely fabulous!
author: Federico F.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised by don pisto's given North Beach is often filled with tourist traps serving overpriced store bought pasta. 

Located on a cute hill, I really liked the decor and the ambiance. I tried their tortilla soup which was excellent, and the chips and guac were also delicious. Tacos were good, but not amazing. I was told I need to try the lobster tacos so maybe next time. 

After dinner you can walk a block down for a cup of gelato.
author: Michelle K.

description: Great tacos and cheviche! It was a little bit too loud and dark in the restaurant, but food and the service were excellent.
author: Heli H.

description: Best Mexican not only in San Francisco, but anywhere we have experienced in a very long time!
author: Jesse W.

description: This is my go-to spot for tacos!!! I cannot rave enough about this place.  I literally drive 1.5 hours just to get my hands on their Al Pastor tacos and homemade salsa and chips. Hands down, the best place for tacos in the entire city, IMHO. And the ambiance, WOW. Talk about ULTRA trendy and hip. Eating tacos to 90s hip hop and rnb. Such a great vibe and atmosphere. I definitely recommend coming here on a date, with friends, with family, or even by yourself! You won't be disappointed, I can guarantee!
author: Ashlei K.

description: Okay, so this place is awesome. Really great margheritas, AMAZING green salsa, awesome carnitas, and really friendly service. The only reason it doesn't get a 5 star review is the noise, music and seating arrangements.
author: Joanna K.

description:
Went here at 5 on a Saturday afternoon. Seated quickly, got chips and salsa served up right away  (really good btw). Decided to order lots and share, so here is the run down:
Oysters- $2 each, fresh and clean. Very good. 
Ceviche- $13, shrimp on this trip. Nicely balanced. A little sweet with shrimp and orange, little sour with lime and tomato, freshened up with onion and cilantro I think.
Fish tacos- $11, really tasty, crunchy batter, nice slaw, definitely worth an order.
Spicy Tuna Tacos- $12, the only low point. Tasted like plain sushi in a crispy taco shell...pass.
Carne Asada tacos, $10, tender and well spiced.
Carnitas tacos, $10, oooooooh baby...succulent, nummynummynummy 
Pork Tamales,  $11, yum. Not always a tamale fan, but these were tasty.

We ended up ordering another round of the carnitas and tamales,  and eating sooo many chips with that delicious salsa...washed down with a michelada...a really really good meal...highly recommended
author: Giles B.

description:
How can you go wrong with a pace that barns a shot, "baby what happened"

Oh and bottomless margaritas are a must!
author: JOSH W.

description:
Overall: 3/5--overpriced Mexican food, but the meat quality is superb

1) Guacamole: 2/5: It was bland and tasted weird. We asked them what else was added into the guacamole, and they said nothing. They use a mixer to blend the avocado together, so I guess the texture tastes somewhat like whipped cream (creamy and thick). I personally wasn't a fan of the newfound texture. 

2) House chips and salsa were delicious: 5/5 Also b/c it was free!

3) Chicken Tortilla soup: 2.5/5: eh, not great; I would pass

4) Carne asada taco: 3/5 Why not four stars? b/c i felt the tacos were overpriced for what they are

Btw, super busy on a Wednesday night around 7pm.
author: Jen H.

description: We were turned away because we had children, one in a stroller. After I walked all the way from pier 33 pushing that damn stroller, I was looking forward to a good meal. We were visiting from the East Coast. Not impressed! Horrible customer service! I would not attempt to eat here again despite the good reviews. Too many other great choices. Don't waste your time.
author: JoAnn M.

description:
Thought this would be the perfect place to bring my sister when she was in town visiting. I made a reservation for 6 (they only take reservations for parties of 6 or more). One friend couldn't make it and the other was running a bit late. When we had checked in, and let our hostess know that it would only be a party of 5, she was extremely rude, had an air of annoyance, and frankly was a B****.

When we were seated, our waitress was also very annoying. She came across as overly confident, a bit aggressive,  (to the point of coming across as a know-it-all rather than a helpful server) and kept calling us all 'hun' (sorry but females should know that no other female appreciates being called hun by women their own age). Definitely rubbed me the wrong way. 

The table for 6 was so big and the place so loud that we could barely hear each other speak. 

The main reason I wanted to come here was for the food -- however, several of the options that I had enjoyed the most were no longer on the menu. When I asked our waitress why, she said because it wasn't in season -- the items I had specifically asked about were the sliders and the corn. How is beef not in season? 

The girls at the table (my sisters and I) also noted that our waitress wore a low cut tank to flash around her cleavage (Sorry but this isn't pleasant for female patrons).

When the bill came, I insisted that we not give a good tip as it would be the most appropriate way to let her know that the service was not good, and the entire dining experience very annoying ... but everyone ended up tipping 20% despite my protests.

Overall, it was a HORRIBLE experience and I would never come back. Not only would I not recommend it, but I would advise against it. It could potentially ruin your night, especially since SF is filled with tons of great eateries staffed with less pretentious females.
author: Siv L.

description:
I think it's hard to do fancy versions of Mexican street food like fish tacos. 

But this place does it really well. 

The interior of the restaurant is "quaint". Very plain, simple  wooden tables and chairs. The dining area has brick walls which I think makes a restaurant much louder and is about the size of a large family den, so basically the size of every single restaurant in the city. Be prepared with snacks so you avoid getting hangry before you are seated.

I have to mention that the tables also sport  glass Fanta bottles turned salt shakers.  THAT IS HOW WE DO IT IN MEXICO, CABRONES.

Here's what we got:
-Tacos de pescado ($10)
-Tacos de camaron ($11)
-Chips and guac ($6)
-Sangria ($7)

The tacos were both delicious. The tortilla was smeared with what I think is roasted arbol chile; each bite was heavenly! The flavors of fish, corn and spice were perfectly balanced in every bite!

Chips and guac: this is what chips and guac are supposed to be! Just PERFECT. 

I like that the sangria was slighly carbonated and not too fruity. Highly recommended. I also saw Corona Familiar at other tables which is a 40oz bottle of Corona, but not the watery Coronas you are used to, my friends. This is a heartier, better version of the Corona we all know and love. 

Don't ask me how or why, just enjoy it.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
We chose to eat here after reading great reviews and hankering for Mexican food.
First up, the spice level was a bit more than we're used to but that's not a fault for the establishment. Just note if you're not into heat in your food, think twice about this choice of venue.
The site is dark, the ambience is nice but if you have sight problems you may struggle. The space is also quite echoey, we went 8pm on Monday and it got very busy and LOUD so we didn't want to linger.
Just trying to be informative!
Food wise, chips and a salsa are served promptly, complimentary and delicious. We chose beer to drink. Shared plates are the go here. Our selections were the calamari, prawn tacos, and chicken (wings? We call them nibbles at home).
The calamari was great, the slaw with it especially so. Some warmth to it but not extreme, delicate tasters might struggle though.
The prawn tacos were BLOODY GREAT. The prawns were perfectly cooked and delightful. Their accompaniments were ideal and they were mild on the heat scale. I'd come here for these alone!
The wings/chicken was far too spicy for me personally, I couldn't handle the sauce at all. Dining partner managed all but one.
The service was attentive but not overbearing. We were happy to leave though as the noise was a bit bothersome but that might not always be true. Overall we enjoyed the experience but will likely go elsewhere in future.
author: Anthea W.

description:
Nice little hole in the wall type place, good vibe, loud, obviously a socializing spot (hang out).  

The staff is very professional and polite, my server took the time to explain the menu and give me her recommendation.  I didn't like the way they couldn't keep my glass full and I found myself flagging someone down for water.  Other than that the service was decent.

I ordered the steak tacos, they weren't bad but I probably wouldn't order them again (meh).  I than ordered their fish tacos, they were decent.  The fish was cooked perfectly, nice and juicy, not heavily fried and oily liked most places prepare them.  Very fresh and tasty, good flavor.  They know what they're doing in the kitchen.   Even the steak in their steak tacos was nice and juicy, tender.  They weren't all gamy and dried out overcooked.   They're cooks are knowledgeable to say the least.   All in all (being how is so hard to find good tasting food in San Francisco) I could see myself going back. 

Prices are steep, being your checkbook... about $6.50 per taco (small taco)
author: Tommy M.

description: The food and service is awesome! I would definitely recommend this place. We had the beef, pork, and baja tacos.
author: Jamie G.

description: They only have one vegetarian option, and it's nothing to write home about. In general, I find their food to be overpriced and over salted. I took another star off for mediocre guacamole.
author: Rachel G.

description: Food was good, but not too much flavor or many options. The couple of bad things are that it's really dark inside and the music is really loud which makes it hard to hear the people talking to you.
author: Silvia C.

description:
I was really excited to go here based on the great yelp reviews.  I have to say that I was a bit disappointed.  

Let me preface this by saying that we went here for someone's birthday so we had the $30 fixed menu.  (It came out to $45/person because we were charged for an extra person, plus tax and tip).
