The servers were nice.  We started out with the chips and salsa.  The salsa was probably the best part of the meal.  It was tasty.  We then had guacamole.  The guacamole was fresh, but was lacking in flavor.  It was a bit bland.  We had some ceviche and then tacos.  The tacos were good, not great.  I thought that it was way too pricey based on the amount of food shared by the table (enough food for about 2 scoops of guac, one scoop of ceviche, and one of each taco).  Their tacos are on average about $9.00 (for 2 tacos).  I'd rather go buy some authentic tacos for a couple bucks - better tasting and a lot cheaper.  

I don't think the food was worth the price and parking in north beach is terrible.
author: Lisa G.

description: Sangria was some of the best I've had! Food is not too spicy for those who can't handle spice either. Awesome vibes and good atmosphere. Not too loud and very attentive wait staff.
author: May N.

description:
Hooray for late night eats. After seeing a show at Cobbs down the way, we were pretty hungry. After 10pm on a wed things get dire. So we saw they were open till 12 and headed over. This place used to be El Raigon an Argentine steak joint back in the day. Still exposed brick walls and dimly lit, theyve kept the same vibe. Friendly bartender-server sat us by the window. After looking at the fairly concise menu we went with:

-Grilled Monterey calamari
-Carne asada tacos
-House made chorizo and mussels
-Poc chuc

Id say the tacos were somewhat average and for the price many taquerias and trucks will do you morejustice however the other dishes were very well executed. Seafood perfectly cooked and the pork for the Poc Chuc had a great crust and still juicy internally. Te application of citrus and chili was also well done. 

The patrons seemed to be twenty somethings in large groups for this night. Service is solid and obviously the line can produce great food. 4.3 stars
author: Kim N.

description:
I came here for Valentine's day brunch with some friends and had the worst possible brunch experience. 

First off, the music was way too loud and it was almost impossible to have a conversation with the other 5 people in my party.

We all ordered food, but I wasn't too hungry so I only got the beef tacos. I actually wanted the carnitas tacos but I have a dairy allergy and these guys marinate their carnitas in milk--who does that?! It's pork, it doesn't need to get softer!

Anyhow, everyone else ordered at least 2 dishes and 20 minutes later everyone had their food... Except for me. I waited another 10 minutes and asked the waitress about it and she told me they were still working on it and it'd take another 15 minutes. Ummm... I literally ordered 2 beef tacos, how long does it take to make tacos? At this point it was pretty clear that they forgot about my order and tried to cover their asses. 

When I finally got my tacos, they were so spicy I could only eat one. Mind you, I have a really high tolerance for spicy food, but this was so spicy that it made me choke. I even had my friends try it and they were tearing up and desperately reaching for water. I've had more than a fair share of tacos and NEVER have I encountered something this spicy. If you're going to make something painfully spicy, at least put a note for it in the menu.

Needless to say my meal was ruined at this point.

There were also a couple of other issues, including a weird policy about not being able to split the check in 6 (max 5).

Overall this place sucked. Never coming here again--for brunch, lunch, dinner or anything else they might offer. Avoid at all costs.
author: Rafaella S.

description: Love the tacos, Margs are fire, the service is great, and atmosphere is fun! If your on a date and need to chat it's pretty loud so not sure that's the move. Otherwise 10/10
author: Gina G.

description:
Stopping here for brunch might have been the food highlight of our weekend in San Francisco. The bottomless mimosas were delicious, my huevos rancheros were awesome, and I tried the pork tamales which were very good as well. Both are fairly standard dishes but were executed properly. The green salsa served with complementary chips was also delicious.  

It was the morning of the fourth and everyone in the place seemed to be having a good time so it was a great start to the day. Definitely would recommend checking this place out.
author: Troy C.

description:
Yes it totally trips me out that this place doesn't have a sign but you'll notice it because there are tons of people surrounding it. 

We came at 6pm- half an hour after it opened on a Thursday evening and was able to get seated right away but the place was getting packed quick!

Wasn't looking for anything heavy so ordered 2 sets of tacos- 1 fish and 1 pork and a pitch of sangria.

The tacos came in 2 and they were so flavorful! 

This was the perfect amount of 2 people. Can't wait to come back and tr different things. Yum!
author: Anya R.

description: There was hispter yet modern vibe to this place when I stepped in. Welcoming and friendly staff, check !  I went in for brunch ordered tamales and poached eggs...the best combo ever!  Wish there was a little something to compliment it though.  Only tequila bar, aguas frescas and sangria
author: Jose G.

description:
Only an uncultured buffoon would go into a Mexican restaurant and order a hamburger. That's why when go to Don Pisto's, I always get the hamburguesa. I'm not sure what that word means exactly, but it sounds Mexican, and it is without a doubt a pile of deliciously juicy meat marinated in onions and bacon. 

It's so tasty that my companions should count themselves lucky that I was able to curb my violent urges when they so selfishly and presumptuously assumed we were sharing. I suppose we DID agree to share when we placed our order, but once it was clear how amazing this hamburguesa actually is, I feel as though they should have known better.

Having eaten quite literally everything on the menu, I can also report that Don Pisto's 
excellence extends to their service, their al pastor tacos, the chorizo mussels and especially the poc choc. The latter dish is a fantastically flavorful pork chop (orange chili marinade!) that I'm quite certain was named after the sound you make when someone asks you what was so delicious that you so rudely crammed the entire thing into your mouth, and you try and say "pork chop."

Don Pisto's is currently near the top of my favorite SF eateries, and I don't see that changing any time soon. I love this place. Bring me here, and keep your hands away from my mouth.
author: Peter D.

description: Wait! What happened?! There's no sign for this place so go by address alone. It's tiny but powerful so go prepared to fall in love. The menu is small but there is plenty of variety and everything is incredible. And if that wasn't enough the service kicks ass too. Do yourself a favor and eat here. It won't disappoint.
author: Dajsa F.

description:
THIS PLACE IS HORRIBLE!!!
They called me to let me know my table is ready and I'm waiting for 20 minutes still
The place is dirty. 
They took for ever to bring me my food and it wasn't filling at all. 
Im still hungry , mistreated with extremely bad service and I'm out 70$. 
Avoid coming here.
author: Octavio M.

description: what's the one thing that any Mexican restaurant has to be able to do, and do really well? fish tacos!!! Don Pisto's fish taco would have been really good if it weren't for the fact that it doesn't have much texture, which is really half the fun of a fish taco. the fish tacos here are BURSTING with ingredients, which unfortunately means that your taco shell absorbs all the liquid and gets too mushy. the fish and veggies in my taco were falling / sliding out each time i took a bite. despite that, the taco did have flavor, so i can't knock it too much. i also liked that Don Pisto's gives you complimentary guac, along with the complimentary salsa + tortilla chips that most places give. and, their homemade hot sauce is pretty great (definitely more of a nose burn spicey). the ambiance is perfect for dinner, a mostly wood interior lit up with yellow lights, so i will be back, despite the fact that the Little Italy neighborhood is a bit removed from the rest of SF.
author: Meryam B.

description: Lovely atmosphere though it was a bit loud for us, good food and attentive service! Be wary about ordering anything with spice - we found our meals to be way spicier than we expected or could handle! The enchilada is a delicious bang for your buck.
author: Shelby M.

description:
Absolutely excellent food and service. From the hints of citrus in the salsa verde to the spicy kick of the shrimp tacos nobody in our large group had anything negative to say about the meal. 

Called ahead on a Monday evening for a party of 10 and the super nice hostess stated she could hold our table for the next 20-30 minutes so we walked over. 

Upon arrival our table was set. It is a super loud restaurant with brick walls so do not expect any intimate conversations. 

We were warned plates come out of the kitchen as ready (tapas style) but 9/10 of our entrees came out at the same time for us. 

Be careful of the shrimp tacos if you don't like spicy foods but it was perfect for my taste! 

Will definitely return.
author: Jenn K.

description: The food was just OK. I feel like there are better Mexican restaurants in San Francisco to go to.
author: Norm J.

description:
Nestled along the quiet corner of Union and Grant, Don Pisto's is the unsung hero of contemporary Mexican cuisine of North Beach. The interior from two dining rooms front and back are fairly small in all its brick lined glory, solidifying a guaranteed intimate experience just perfect for dates and small groups. I've partaken in the Don Pisto's journey before in small doses and encounters, but never to organizing a large dinner for coworkers and friends for what was an incredible experience from start to finish.

I owe it all to their incredible host Christine. She was the glue, kept the gears moving and was so professional and efficient throughout the process. After an initial call to setup, along with a barrage of back and forth emails customizing a menu with our logo and inserting various items with respect to dietary habits; everything was done within an hour. Upon learning that this was no ordinary group dining event (going away party as well), she took it upon herself to also pick up and store a cake that we had waiting in the wings. If that's not top notch service, I don't know what it is. Above all, she made me look damn good to the group and all I did was make a quick phone call.

When we had arrived, it was clear which table was ours - we were dead center and 16 seats deep in almost communal fashion. The main dining area was already small to begin with, considerably scaled back with our large group absorbing much of the scene. We weren't the classiest bunch of individuals, just the ones everyone wanted to sit with. And in the corner, smiling from afar, was Christina - plotting every little bit of our meal and getting us everything that we needed without even having to ask. It was a symphony of service and she was the leader of the orchestra.

Meanwhile our table was an endless river of sangria and giggles. The company was good it almost seemed as nothing else mattered. Our meal table was full of hits too numerous to mention, highlights include:

* Delectable shrimp taco, cooked perfectly and wonderfully juicy on a soft corn tortilla.
* Mexican sashimi, with a twist of lime and cilantro and we're off to the races
* Oysters, as fresh as they get from the bay.
* Lobster is succulent and tasty, but very different to share.
* Al Pastor was as good as advertised. Tender bits of rib chop, with the zest of pineapple.

The evening was a success. We ordered extra pitchers of sangria as the night went on, and before we knew it, it had been over 3 hours. Throughout the time we never rushed and service was stellar to the very end. Christine thanked us on the way out and even sent a follow up email the next day to offer her token of appreciation. After some cake, more sangria, a group photo, more sangria, and feeling stuffed beyond galore, we still managed to rock the rest of the night.

Don Pisto's gets nothing less than 5 stars for service alone. Throw everything else in the mix (ambiance, food, price,etc.) and you've got yourself a spectacular spot for just about anything.
author: Jando S.

description: Best group bunch ever!! Bottomless mimosa, margaritas, & sangria mix and match!! Start wiith mimosas and work up to sangria and bottomless margarita. So worth it! Also the scramble is delicious. Absolutely the best way to start the birthday weekend!
author: Monika Y.

description: Best mexican food, service, and ambience I've had in a while! Jeff was our server and he was the perfect amount of attentive, knowledgable of the menu, ready with recommendations, and overall amazing at servicing our table! We thoroughly enjoyed our Bad Ass shot, margarita, guacamole, fish tacos, and Diablo Shrimp (very spicy beware!). I'd highly recommend this to my friends and I'm defffinitely coming back!
author: Cortney K.

description:
One of the best Mexican meals of my life. The restaurant itself is adorable and provides wonderful, personable service. We had to wait an hour before getting a table due to not making a reservation ahead of time, but it was well worth the wait. It's easy to understand why people are lining up to eat here after you try the food. Every single dish we got was amazing - chips&guac, ceviche, mussels&chorizo, tacos, etc. The restaurant also serves up some killer cocktails and sangria to complement the amazing food.

Pro Tip: definitely get the mussels&chorizo. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.
author: Ran C.

description: Hands down the best Mexican food I've ever had. The green tomatillo salsa was out of the world. And we had endless chips and tomatillo salsa until and after our food arrived. Guacamole was extremely fresh. We ordered enchiladas, veggie plate and carnitas. It's not a place to sit down and have quiet conversation though. The place was extremely noisy.
author: Ruchika I.

description: Bottomless margaritas. Don't think you can get that anywhere else in the world so here's a pic
author: Alex B.

description: I had Don Pisto's cater my wedding rehearsal dinner, which we hosted at the bar my husband and I met at. Michelle made everything very easy, even when I needed to add to the order last minute. The food was delicious and the price was reasonable for what you are getting. I highly recommend Don Pisto's catering whenever you are hosting a party.
author: Katie T.

description: So my chicken enchiladas with mole were delicious, as well as the corn and rice side dish.  I thought the entire menu was a bit overpriced, considering the portion sizes.  I've heard that they have the best guacamole in the area, but didn't try it firsthand.  It's definitely a cool place, but I probably wouldn't make it my go-to Mexican restaurant.
author: Jenna F.

description: I loved everything about this place! Started out with a very friendly and helpful server. She made great recommendations and instructed us on best way to order. All her recommendations were perfect. Two pork tamales. Two carnita tacos. Special cast iron chicken (like fajitas--good, but not my favorite as I never order fajitas). It was loud, but I feel like most popular and good restaurants are. Would definitely come back!
author: Raiza A.

description: Great food tacos, oyster ,the prawns a la diabla everything  is exelent Enrique The bartender is really nice and funny the margaritas are great and the sangrita too ,all the time I get there I have a great time
author: Jair S.

description: Awesome!  Great Mexican food restaurant in North Beach.  Wonderful staff and ambiance.
author: Rafael R.

description:
We arrived at 5:30 but the clock on their register was completely wrong.  She thought it was 5.  With a lazy, uninterested look, the waitress basically shooed us away and said they weren't open till 5:30.  After I notified her of the error on her machine, she told us to sit where ever.  It was rude but I was too focused on eating and drinking so I got over it.

Chips, Salsa & Guacamole to get started and a pitcher of Acai Berry Sangria to quench and refresh after a long day in the office.  

BIG UPS to Jane L. not only for being awesome and recommending this place but also for knowing the chef... cause he sent over a complimentary Ceviche De Camarones, which was a nice start to our meal.  Fresh tasting, light, and great flavors.

HOLD UP Cast Iron Summer Stew ... bring yo fine self over to OUR TABLE!!  At first, I wasn't sure if I wanted anything soup-y but this was a spicy piece of heaven in a hot, steamy pot.  Can I get a bowl of rice??  If you like spicy and want something soothing and homey, this is perfs.  

Carne Asada & Carnitas were yummy but we were all pretty full and didn't really finish them.  Eh... I guess that means they weren't amazing.  CAUTION: Those peppers on the side are SP-EYE-CEY ... avoid the seeds if you're sensitive ...

Overall, the food was great and the waitress eventually warmed up to us (after realizing someone in our party knew the chef).  Good times.
author: Kat C.

description: Really fun boozy brunch! Waitress just kept the pitcher on the table. Food is tasty and good for sharing with a big group. Great prices as well
author: Tanya N.

description:
Wow. The service is great, the food is fantastic,the atmosphere is happy ("any place we are drinking before noon is a happy place"). The sangria and mimosas are amazing (fyi The margaritas are made with agave wine, so they have a very different taste from tequila and are NOT what you are expecting). I will def come back. 

We had miyagi oysters (sweet and delicious and super fresh), bottomless margarita/sangria/margarita, and chorizo with baked eggs and red potatoes with crema. Couldn't get enough of the oysters and they were only served with lime. So sweet. The chorizo was not greasy at all and very flavorful. I'd only ask for more depth - maybe cinnamon, chipotle, or cumin to add a "whoa" factor. The green salsa blew my mind. It was spicy enough for an appetizer, and the chips were as good as las golondrinas. That says a lot. 

Also, the servers and staff were incredibly knowledgeable and friendly and attentive (and beautiful), and Jillian's explanation of the different kinds of oysters was spot on and gave me exactly what I was looking for. She's a great server. 

Can't wait to come back.
author: Stephen C.

description:
The good thing about this restaurant is they are able to host large parties which I guess can be a challenge in sf.

The food here is ok.  We had several different things and none were bad.

The service was also ok, not bad but pretty normal.  You could expect the same level of service at Applebee's.

However, I will continue to blast restaurants that over charge and sell the same food I can get from a food truck, the frozen food section of a grocery store, or a TGI Fridays.  I realize everything is expensive in San Francisco, but I have higher expectations with the premium prices they charge.

I'm not sure if they ever built this restaurant out.  They keep it very dark with loud ghetto music.  When you look around you realize you're pretty much eating in the equivalent of a gymnasium with the lights off.

It's not bad, I just don't see why you'd ever go here twice.
author: Chris F.

description: I said couple of month ago i was going to retire from writing reviews , but don Pisto's happened ,it's to the point that even if the service was bad would still give 5 stars but of course it wasn't , but yes that 's how good the food was , Spicy tuna tacos were definitely the winner, el pastor tacos . diabla wings , pollo asado , shrimp tacos , everything was great , highly recommend this place for a group of friends as food is made for sharing , yes even better than mamacita. .
author: NAEL K.

description:
I came in last minute on a Sunday night with a group of 8 and had the stupid amazing luck that a party of 7 never showed up for their reservation and we were seated within 5 minutes of arriving.   The feel of the restaurant is great, very inviting and pretty authentic!  We ordered: 

Chips & Guac: really good chips & the salsa verde that came with it was also delicious! 

Raw oysters: on the smaller size unfortunately, but sooo good with a dash of Cholula. 

Tortilla Soup for 2: Split into two bowls and huuuuge portions!  The broth was amazing & the chunks of avocado made for a really really good soup overall.  Could have had some more chicken though! 

Red Snapper Tacos: the slaw on top was tangy and refreshing & i loooove fish tacos so this was a win! 

Carnitas Tacos: deeeeeeelish! Just enough heat but not overwhelming & awesome with a little extra guacamole. 

Sangria: Don't love sangria in general, but my friends wanted to split a pitcher and I joined.  It was ok, but not my thing. 

Tips: 

HUGEEE 32 OZ Coronas for $8 I think.  Great deal! The boys were happy :) 

Our friends got the Carne Asada and one thought it was wayyyy too spicy for her, but others at the table thought they were manageable.  So, if you have a low spice tolerance ask for a side of sour cream with it!  

Been on my to-do list for a while and did not disappoint!
author: Raina D.

description:
Best mexican food in SF!
a bit noisy and long waiting time. food and drinks are great
author: Aaditya D.

description:
this is the best Mexican restaurant. hands. down. 

I've gotta warn you, this place is always packed and there's always a wait.. but that's a testament of how good this place is. and the place is alive and loud! 

food is just too good for words. I recommend the pork chop. so soft, tender, almost melts in your mouth. I mean, how can you not?! 

can't go wrong with this place.
author: C C.

description:
Delicious everything. Loved the bottomless margaritas & sangria. Didn't have to wait for our reservation. ALL the food was delicious - especially the carnitas tacos!

Highly recommended :)
author: Rachel E.

description:
Great food!  
Enrique was the best bartender
Good sangria too!
They made me a custom Veggie plate because they ran out of enchiladas
Super nice staff all around
author: Azzi S.

description: Stay a way from this place service is sick , food was not that great as I was expecting. Save yourself time and money , and go somewhere else to have good food .
author: Ray A.

description:
Don Pisto's brunch is my favorite brunch in the city. The food, amazing! They have the best huevos rancheros I've ever had. We also got the guacamole, fish tacos, french toast, and scramble (all really good). The drinks? Bottomless with your choice of sangria, mimosas, or margaritas. Amazing! It gets loud downstairs, but if you're upstairs it's not too bad. 

Normally, I rave about Don Pistos. This past brunch I went to was a little more frustrating. We sat down to a fixed menu. After asking the waiter why we were only given a fixed menu he told us that they had gotten our reservation mixed up and we weren't the other party so then we could have regular menus. He warned us some food would come out after others so that we were aware before ordering (annoying that it has to happen anyways, but at least he told us). Our french toast came out about 10 minutes after everyone else order.

After we finished, he told us we had to go upstairs because they needed that table for their next party. We were under the assumption it was because they needed the table for a larger party and that we had a smaller table upstairs. Not the case. We walk upstairs and turns out they just wanted us to leave so they could use the larger table since we were sat at the wrong table initially. So then we were upstairs with no table with drinks still in our hands (water glasses and all). We basically had to chug our drinks, chug our waters, and then leave to get out of the way. 

The usually delicious mimosas were strawberry flavor this time and VERY sweet. I couldn't take more than a couple sips. But the margaritas were great!

Regardless, I still love Don Pistos and will continue to brunch there!
author: Maggie S.

description:
I came in here this past week with a group of 16. I'm not generally blown away by most Mexican food, but Don Pisto's is incredible. Chips and guac are addictive to a fault - you will easily ruin your meal. We ran through the better part of the menu - Hamburguesa, Salmon Sashimi (exceptional), Chicken and Carne Asada tacos (enjoyed the latter). The most ridiculous part of the meal without question were the Chile Verde Chicken Tostadas.

Get here - ASAP.
author: Jeff F.

description:
It takes a great hamburguesa to make putting ketchup on it unnecessary.  And so it was as 3 of us ordered this savory take on Mexican street food. The bacon and onion accented marinade was spot on as was the topping of guacamole and a perfectly toasted bun. It was also more than enough food despite its presence on the small plates part of the menu. To round out our 4 person table, we also ordered a delicious and spicy grilled Wild Monterey Calamari and a couple of fish tacos. Water was plentiful for the spice, while a some Lagunitas IPAs and a couple glasses of Rose kept the meal and the conversation flowing. 

This place is popular and luckily we had the flexibility to wait over an hour for our Table. That was made easier by the professional touch of the greeter and his willingness to call Gayle's cell when our table was ready. The other thing is that this place is loud and hard to carry on a conversation. Perhaps this is the new generational normal, but I would have preferred something a little bit more casually intimate to match the cool rustic dining room that was nicely accented by the brick walls and heavy wooden furniture.  There's also a downstairs that could double as a room for larger groups. 

Don Pisto's was a great choice and I thank Gayle's hip young professional Nephew for suggesting it.  As there's no sign on the outside, I would have walked past this place on my own, with no clue of what Nuevo Yucatan (and other Baja locales) wonders lied within. Maybe Gayle and I will do Brunch next time.
author: Eric B.

description:
Don Pistos....

Please keep in mind that I'm really good at cooking Mexican food and have grown up enjoying amazing Mexican food my whole life. I'm biased. 

I love that this place is in my neighborhood. I love knowing that if I absolutely need to have some Mexican food and I don't feel like cooking or heading to the Mission or to Zorro I can go here. 

This is definitely a place to go to for a special event. This is where you go when you're feeling fun and fancy, but not too fancy. This is where to go when you got a slight pay raise or your tax return. This isn't the place to go when you want delicious or authentic Mexican food. 

Servings are small, prices are high, the drinks aren't strong. My favorite item was grilled calamari. The ceviche was good too but way too overpriced. 

Your best option is to go here for brunch and get the bottomless margarita/sangria/agua fresca option.
author: Daisy S.

description:
Pretty good spot! I came one Wednesday, because I was told about this bacon marinated burger they had. Except my friend built up the hype and told me this sucker was 1/2 a pound of meat...which, I don't think it was. But it was a pretty decent burger.  They can split it in half or quarters for sharing. Between our 3 people...it was harder. ha.

Burger - quite delicious. I'd like it a little more medium (or at least have SOME pink). I'd guess its not possible, since they have bacon inside it, and that needs to be well cooked. The burger has a huge layer of guac on it, and it just adds to the fatty drool-worthy ness of the dish.

The mussels in chorizo broth was so delicious. It comes with some buttered and grilled bread, which they can refill for you. It's so delicious. The shellfish is cooked perfectly, and the sauce is a little spicy, but to a level that just makes you keep going for more. We kept trying to sop up more sauce while also digging around the bottom to find chunks of chorizo. I wish I had a spoon.

The salmon sashimi....was amazing. Like, amazing. They had the freshest slices of salmon, sitting on a bed of sauce (white wine vinegar and soy sauce), with thin slices of jalapenos, cilantro, and I'm sure something else. It was just...delicious. I'd say its a must-order.

We also had a pitcher of their margaritas, which was good...but not for that price. There was a little too much ice put in there, and unless you're drinking it all in 10 minutes, it gets diluted pretty quickly.

Service was very good - our waitress was great about being attentive without being too pushy. Environment is a little intimate, but it seems good for larger parties as well. The bathroom...is in an awkward location around the corner from the kitchen, down some stairs. But is fine. Overall, a pretty good experience!
author: Lily W.

description: Amazing salsa verde, amazing guac, and amaaaazing tacos. Nice atmosphere also. If you're looking for simple tasty Mexican food, look no further.
author: Cory D.

description:
Came here with some girlfriends for a weekend brunch and loved it! Absolutely adore the young, casual hip ambiance here! They had a bouncer outside checking ids and it was really loud inside. I felt like I was at a day club. 

We all started with the bottomless mimosas ($17), which are made with fresh pineapple juice. Super yummy! They have servers making their rounds to make sure your glass is always filled to the brim :) 

My friend's Huevos Rancheros ($9) was my favorite. Great flavor and perfectly cooked eggs.

My friend's Chorizo and Poached Eggs ($10) was pretty good. Great flavor and I'm usually not a fan of chorizo.

My Mushroom Omlette ($10) was really nothing special. It had a ton of oaxaca but wasn't really memorable.

We were all really obsessed with their side of potatoes. Perfectly crisp and well seasoned! Mmmm

If I was going to come back for bottomless mimosas though, I'd definitely choose the Radish. The mimosas aren't as good but the food is so much better.
author: Carolyn L.

description: I really do love this place. The service is always great and the food is on point. I went for dinner with a group of 5 on Saturday night and they were able to get us in without waiting for hours on end. We all shared a bunch of snacks and boy were they tasty. We got the lobster (amazingly amazing), tamales, enchiladas, tortilla soup, and some tacos, and everything, I mean everything, was comforting and delicious. Dinging off one star because it is a bit pricier than one expect for (even) fancy Mexican food ($6 Mexican beer seems steep to me), but don't let that stop you from going with friends and taking a few bites each.
author: Jane F.

description:
Usually I don't like to visit a same joint several times, but to always explore new experiences. In San Francisco there are two restaurants so far for me where I repeatedly see myself going. This is one, the other I won't tell so ya'll yelpers don't ruin it with all those crazy lines you stand in for a breakfast waffle.

Pretty much everything I have had here is fresh, delicious, tasty and well prepared.
author: Arttu N.

description:
3.5/5. Came here after my meal at the House to see what all the fuss was about. At $9 a pair, these were certainly not cheap. Had to go with the al pastor, which the server strongly recommended. But the pork was much drier than I expected and the taco quite sloppy overall.

The dining area upstairs is dimly lit and quite modern/classy, but go downstairs where the restrooms and tables for large groups are and it's altogether different story. The place is dingy and loud, and right next to washers/kitchen. Kind of disappointing to see that they have a health score of 67/100.
author: Pierre B.

description: Me and my fiancé had a friend in town for the weekend. She wanted to see Coit Tower and we ended up at Don Pistos after. The food was good, environment was awesome, and music was on point. We started with the Guac. It was outstanding. We then had the Ceviche which was fresh and had just enough spice. Last but certainly not least we had the Diabla Wings and they were very spicy! But very good! ( I love spicy food) more importantly they have $4 Tecate beers.  give this place a shot if you find yourself in the area.
author: Anthony M.

description: Great food! I have been here several times but all times have been for brunch. The food is always great and the salsa is delicious. Always one of my top recommendations to friends. Last time my wife and relatives had the breakfast burrito and they were all extremely happy with it. I had the chorizo, potatos, and eggs and it was delicious!
author: Cliff S.

description:
We had just finished a trip to Alcatraz, and were wondering where we could eat without getting sucked into a tourist trap. 

Not that I have anything against that sort of thing. 

Mr C did a Google map search while I opened yelp, and at almost the same time we landed on Don Pistorius. I am always in the mood for excellent Mexican food, so we pointed in that general direction. 

Mr C let me out so he could find a parking space and I could grab a table. While I waited I had great chips and green Chile salsa. 

And then guacamole. 

Eventually he showed up. 

We shared carnitas tacos, fish tacos, rice and beans, and it was everything I imagined and more. 

Service was good, and friendly, and the food was to die for. (If you like that sort of thing. )

I can't wait to go back!
author: M C.

description: Could be the best tacos I've ever had. The margaritas were great, but a bit thin. But man, the tacos. Go here now.
author: Kevin W.

description:
This is one of the best restaurants I have ever eaten at. The setting isn't even really my bag (club-ish music playing and a disproportionate percentage of 30-something yuppies that are Chestnut Street dwellers).  Nevertheless, the establishment itself is cool inside with its exposed brick and intimate layout. Most importantly though, the food is just knock your socks off bursting with flavor.  

It begins with the salsa that is likely the best I've ever had. The chips are also well above average. As for appetizers, I have never been disappointed with the specials (last time was chorizo mussels). All the tacos are great--in particular, the carnitas and al pastor. But the creme de la crop is the pollo asado: phenomenally flavored and perfectly cooked chicken with a wonderful salsa (not really different in taste from the table salsa), excellent guacamole, and perfect tortillas. Best of the best with this dish.  

Honorable mentions: excellent margaritas and sangria, and friendly staff--including the owner--who graciously offered me and my date [big] free drinks for having to wait for a table to clear.

I've been here five times now and have no intention of not dramatically increasing this number.
author: Jared C.

description:
The last place most people would think of eating at in North Beach is a Mexican place.  I love Mexican food and dislike run of the mill places so I tend to be pretty hard to please. Since I've found out about this place been here twice when I was in the city so I guess I'm a fan. 

In all I've had:

Chips & guac - Great chips - really great chips, on the thick side & salted properly.  The guac rocks too.  Just the right amount of salt and citric - makes all the difference.    

Puerto Nuevo Lobster 
I've actually been to Puerto Nuevo and had lobster before so I knew what to expect.  (This is a science project so if you're not a lobster person you may not dig the inner workings of the bug) - verdict - ROCKS! hands & face covered with the bug and the sides!  The dish really feeds two and with the sides its plenty of food for two people

Al Pastor tacos
Like others have commented these are small tacos and two of them come with the order.   It takes a gentle touch to get pineapple into a savory dish and not overwhelm it.  Don Pisto's gets it right.  These tacos are two pieces of heaven!  Wanted to re-order another but with the chips & guac I was stuffed.

Interior wise, very laid back  pretty loud.  Latin music playing and its a partial open kitchen.  I'm sure there is lines at prime time but both times I've been there around 5-6ish we never had to wait.
author: R P.

description: It's not Mexican Cheap Eats.... But if you don't get the ceviche, guacamole, and pork chop... Ur missing out on a REDIC amazing dinner night out.
author: James W.
Brooke W.

description:
Very very good guacamole.  The green salsa they bring to the table is also great. We went on a Sunday and had the special: Tacos Sonora.  It came as one big homemade flour tortilla loaded with meat and toppings.  We had our choice of carne asada, carnitas or al pastor.  I had the al pastor on the recommendation of the manager and it was excellent.  I would have liked two smaller tortillas rather than one giant one, which was delicious but a little unmanageable as a taco.  

They have an assortment of Mexican (and Mexican sounding) beers. I had a Pacifico which went well with the tacos.  

We went with kids.  My two youngest shared the french toast and bacon, which, although not Mexican, was very good.  It was plenty of food for both of them.  

The place was LOUD. We waited about 15 minutes and sat at two tables of five because they didn't really have a 10 person table and it was crowded.  The wait was worth it and I'd go again.
author: Ryan K.

description: Food was of good quality. However we had a party of 12 and they charged us 25% for service. That is pretty outrageous. We had "bottomless" and I was left without a drink for long periods of time. Fun vibes though!
author: Audrey S.

description:
Violently ill after eating the overrated food there last night.  Sweet waitress for our large party, but trust me - you don't want to eat the sashimi here. 

Thanks for the horrible memories, Don Pisto.
author: Lee A.

description:
Hurried steps. A petite woman rushing through the door in a leopard skin string dress wearing white sunglasses. A man sitting by the bar, nursing an IPA, stood up to greet her. "I'm so sorry I'm running late." She said. He stood up as she took her coat off, and as she hopped onto the barstool. It was a very crowded bar. 

"This was a very popular restaurant with no signage on the door. Like the French Laundry." She commented. The restaurant had two parts. One part was the communal table and bar area, the other part was a sit down dining area in a sunken  part of the space.

"This reminds me of Ratskeller in Munich, by Marienplatz. The restaurant was built directly under the city hall, all sunken in." She continued.

Don Pisto was of course not a German nor Italian restaurant, it's Mexican street food located in the heart of North Beach. "Does it look like where you just returned from?" She asked. He was in Mexico vacationing with his son. "No, but it felt like it should have been a very guy oriented restaurant. But there were quite a lot of women here." He responded. The decor was very masculine, no doubt, with open exposed bricks and fireplace for cooking. Surrounded by Italian restaurants in the heart of North Beach, this place felt like a welcoming home in Mexico, occupied by working class people, and you had just crashed their Saturday night supper party.

"The restaurant did not take reservations." He said. He'd been here before once.  He struck her as someone who dined out a lot, alone or otherwise. Just then the host interrupted them and informed them that the communal table was ready.  The man asked to see if they could sit next to each other, rather than across from each other. Why wouldn't more restaurants insist on that? How could two people have a conversation over dinner if you were sitting across from each other at a noisy place where the only way to talk was to shout out from the top of your lungs? She thought to herself. The host immediately agreed and two new table settings were made for the two of them.

"What's good here?" She asked.  He studied menu and ordered her a glass of Sangria as if he could read her mind. It was very plum red, and very sweet. He took care of her as if he was the protagonist straight out of a Jane Austin novel, very old school. Even though they had only been friends for nearly two decades, even though she never needed anyone to take care of her, even though, she suspected, this was how he was with all of his female friends. The wait staff was very attentive and caught the dynamic very early on, so she directed her questions to this man. "What would you guys like to eat?" She asked. He said, "Well, I suppose we should get the ceviche and the spicy tuna tacos. And pollo and posole." He decided for her. The restaurant served street food, therefore portion was well adjusted for that, a perfect way to share a meal with people without getting too stuffed and feeling guilty after.

When the posole was served, two bowls appeared with a separate plate for the herbs and spices. It was a stew dish, delightful and hearty, unpretentious and delicious. He used the ladle to scoop soup into her bowl first. She added spice and cilantro. Over that dish she learned that he was still in love with the woman he's been with for nearly three years. "I am into her. I love her. I like her. She's perfect for me." "No one's ever met 'her", you know." She said. "They know about her. The general stuff." He protested. This man who had never been married, was now in love and had been for sometime. Perhaps there was hope after all. But for whom she was not sure.

Turned out that all four things on the menu were exceptional.  The waitstaff brought the bill to the man. He opened his wallet to pay and she saw an older driver license picture of him. In the picture he had a broad smile, strikingly blond hair sans glasses. He had a carefree look about him, like a child. Not this man who's now sitting next to her, more reserved and a lot more serious.

A meal was ending. Simplistic street food in surprisingly non Hispanic neighborhood but completely out of this world delicious. Full bar menu, filled with Mexican and Californian beer to boot.  It was one of the best meals she's had recently.

"Friday, I'm on Lufthansa to Frankfurt then Munich." She said.
"I'm on KLM to Amsterdam." He said.
"Perhaps we'd meet at the airport then." She said absent-mindedly.
"That would be neat." He replied.

They got up to leave, a half glass of sweet sangria left sitting unfinished on the table. It was a typical summer evening in San Francisco: fog was setting in, wind had picked up, and young people were out and about. At an atypical Mexican restaurant in North Beach: food, surprisingly authentic; goodbyes, reluctantly said; and a new journey, to be commenced.
author: Victoria E.

description:
Came here for brunch on a Sunday. I am from out of town but our friends are locals and love this place! They told us we should get there early, because it opens at 11 am but people already stand outside and wait to get in. 

The ambiance inside is nothing special but you would come here for the food. 

I got the bottomless sangria which could have used a bit more alcohol, but the food was great! The chips, salsa and guacamole were also really good. I got a large flour taco with carnitas which was amazing! The flour tortilla tasted homemade which was what made it extra good. 

I highly recommend this place!
author: Maddie F.

description:
Excellent food - came in with three other people and ordered everything tapas style, which works perfectly for this place. 

Everything we had was good - the house salsa was great, guacamole (solid, but didn't blow me away), spicy tuna tacos (not that spicy), diabla prawns (drool worthy), fish tacos (fish was only so-so), pollo asado (great flavor, though the chicken was on the fatty side), carnitas (perfect). We had a couple other items, though I can't remember what they were - everything was good, and we left stuffed, happy and slightly buzzed from the margarita pitchers. 

Not extremely expensive by SF standards - $50/person or so. 

I will definitely be back, next time to try their brunch, which I hear is awesome.
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
14.10.11           First Visit

Food ---------------------------- 4 Stars
Noise --------------------------- Too Loud
Temp --------------------------- Low ceiling, 
                                               hot on hot day even 
                                                   when windows open

All the dishes had nice strong marinade and/or nice thick glaze

Chips and salsa
     Personal taste ... too thick
     not too watery salsa


Diablo Prawns
      wild mexican prawns, 
      spicy diabla sauce
      presented on 3 skewers crossed over
           nice presentation
    

Wild Monterey Calamari 
      charcoal grilled, 
      orange, 
      lime, 
      radish salad

Tacos - Al Pastor
      grilled pork rib chop, 
      charred pineapple, 
      avocado salsa

Tamale
      pork
      very tasty (I have yet taste a bad tamale)
      good sauce


Good solid bold taste ... just a bit loud
author: S.K. Y.

description: Kind of over priced,  but you're paying for the experience. Cool vibe. Nice ambiance. Good attentive  service.  Went on a Wednesday night before the dinner rush so not sure how to assess the service based on a packed house, as it was pretty empty when we were there. We had the shrimp tacos, asada tacos, and the tortilla soup. They warn you upfront that these are mainly appetizer - type plates. If you're looking for El Torito/Acapulco sized "lumber jack platters", this ain't your place.   But everything was delicious! They also served us chips and a tomatillo salsa that was spicy and tangy. We left satisfied but not stuffed ( which is a good thing).
author: Tere P.

description:
5 Stars Plus for food +++++
3.5 for customer service
A bit Pricey for what you get

Here's what we ordered:
Chips with salsa and Guac $6 (only thing not pricey for amount of what you get)
Caraf of Sangria $28
Mexican Sashimi- $16-$18 can't remember 
Tacos de Asada- $9
Tacos de Camaron- $10

Arrived at 5:30 promptly. Seated immediately. waitress took our drink order but never offered chips and salsa or Guac.. Felt that she didn't really care to service us... Since she was taking more care of other tables that came in after us. Got our delicious Sangria and glanced over to entrance door and there were people already waiting to be seated. Place filled up Fast!!! Food was delicious! Mexican that we are, it is hard to get moms approval on Mexican food and she was Super happy with the salsa and Guac! The Guac is simple and delicious and the salsa is Amazing!!! Put that sh** on everything!!! Told the chefs that their food was great and were super happy. 

Overall- bit pricey but def worth it!!! Will be returning!
author: Ana B.

description: Honestly this is the best Mexican meal I've ever had. This place came highly recommended and we had a hard time finding it. Once we did, we were told there was a 30 min wait. 15 min later we were seated with drinks. I had two orders of tacos and my wife had the pollo. I couldn't stop eating their homemade chips and the tacos were to die for. The salsa was mild but flavorful and my wife's chicken came with salsa that had just enough kick (just like the margaritas). If you're in the North Beach area this is a place you'd be crazy if you didn't try!
author: Sam J.

description: Great Mexican food experience, either for meat and fish. The service is great and kind as well, give them a try! ;)
author: Domenico G.

description: The tacos and pork chop were wonderful and deserve a 4.5, but it was claustrophobically crowded and loud (not bad music, if you like 90's rap music, but really loud) which took away from the evening for sure.
author: Megan I.

description: I liked my breakfast burrito but it is just way too loud in this restaurant to have a conversation, way too loud.
author: Jeff S.

description: The guacamole and salsas were delicious!! My husband said it was the best, juiciest chicken he's ever had. The pastor had a great flavor that I haven't had in a while. Fish tacos were also some of the best I've tried. Will definitely come back here.
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
I was one of the lucky few that got to try the new location (Pistos Tacos Marina), 2030 Lombard Street as part of their family and friends soft opening on Saturday, July 16th.  My group of 4 basically tried everything on the menu.  To start I am a huge Sangria (touch of ginger) fan and theirs was by far one of the best I have had.  For appetizers we had the mexican corn, guacamole and green salsa as dips (all tasty and guac was chunky with pieces of avocado).  Then the mexican sashimi (salmon) and raw oysters.  For the main courses the al pastor alambre was the table's favorite.  Chicken tostada held its shape as we all had a bite, camarone taco and carnitas taco were both all shrimp or pork no fillers, carnitas was more flavorable. Street stand burger was very good if you are looking for a burger but the mexican fare was better, even the mexican baked potato which was fun and unexpected, Beef tamale was small.  Marinated fruit for dessert (spicy - chili) but oh so good.
Overall the food presentation was excellent, I held off on the one star as it is pretty noisy (even at our table of 4 - hard to talk) and hear the server.  The wait staff was probably a little too   attentive, took two sips of water and they filled again and was whisking dishes away a little too quickly.  Beautiful teak tables and chairs, bar on top level of split level down to the dining room.
author: Carolyn T.

description:
Calamari will kill you its so good
Shrimp, Fish, Carne tacos in that order.
Diablo wings...so good. Yummies.
Enchiladas, Would definitely find the bottom off belly again.
Pour a margarita over them all and you've made a great decision.
author: Rob L.

description: Tiffany was AMAZING! The food was great, the service was outstanding, and they kept our bottomless drinks on FULL! Well worth the $$, although the wait was kinda long. But obviously worth it. I ordered the French toast. It did not disappoint. I will definitely be back with my friends for brunch.
author: Cory N.

description:
Very good.

The Mexican Sashimi was excellent.
The Diablo prawns were good. They were so ducking spicy! I had to eat them with tortillas which were hot and fresh.
author: Ahmed A.

description: 5 stars is reserved for the wow factor. This place is excellent, you should go if you're in the area. Authentic food and a classy atmosphere in my opinion
author: Anthony S.

description: This place is over priced! The flavors on the meat and seafood was good but the portion was way too small for the priced. Each order of taco comes with 2 tacos with no sides not anything else with it.  The tacos size is equivalent to street tacos at a taqueria. They make their own tortillas but it was soaked in oil/butter.  The tortillas were very greasy. It is a cute place but the musician too loud. It's hard to have a conversation here without screaming at each other. The staff are nice and prompt.
author: LZ T.

description:
Delicious. Friend and I were in SF for a few days (New Yorker here) and yes, all the hype about Mexican food in California is definitely true. I got myself three different types of tacos, they were smaller than I anticipated but absolutely mouth-watering: crispy, fresh and full of flavour. Big plus was that it was open later than most restaurants (given that everything is open super late in NY, we were shocked to see many restos closed at around 8 pm in SF!) 

I'd definitely go back if I'm ever in SF!
author: Prativa B.

description:
So I did end up getting to try the burger, and it is top notch. It has cooked bacon and grilled onions ground right into the beef, and it comes together perfectly. It is too bad that they only do it on Wednesdays.

  In this update, I am still giving them only 4 stars, because the last time I went, I had been told that they discontinued the chorizo-braised mussels as a regular item, and it was now only a special. Honestly, without those mussels or the burger, it is just an average (and somewhat overpriced) Mexican restaurant.

 I have not been there since, and will not unless I call ahead of time and am told that they have the mussels.
author: J R.

description: I don't see the fuss about this place. It's ok food and very cheap. The affordability attracts certain immature people, which made our experience terrible. There was a party of about 10 people for Sunday brunch. They were very excited, screaming and squealing. Lots of patrons were disturbed, but the restaurant staff did not make any attempt to calm them down. When I finally made a complaint to a dark hair waitress, she gave me the attitude that indicated this was normal.  I'm not used to dine at a frat house. This is not a place for me nor any of my friends for sure.
author: Danielle W.

description: Get server Mayra! Amazing server. Know her menu w/ingredients. Food was amazing. The salsa  alone is worth finding a parking spot. I asked Mayra for a straw to drink it (jokingly). Hint valet around the corner like we did. It's easier. Parking is had to find but searching is worth it!
author: Nichole C.

description:
The food here is absolutely delicious. It's truly outstanding and this would be a five-star review based on the food alone. However, the service and atmosphere were so unfavorable, they far outweigh the quality of the food itself.

The restaurant's first floor is very appealing. However, we were seated in an expansion space in the basement. It is a dark, cramped, characterless cement box that has none of the character of the space upstairs. And, it is LOUD. SO loud that conversation was limited to the people immediately beside us (we had a party of 7), and even then it was extremely difficult. I cannot overstate how loud it was. The server was literally shouting to convey the specials, etc., and we still had a hard time hearing him. 

Beyond the space, the service itself was unacceptable. I'm sure this had everything to do with our server specifically. He lacked basic skills in meeting the needs of our party. Five of us received our food; it took more than 10 minutes for the sixth member of the party to receive his plate, and the seventh member of our party never did receive his meal. We were able to get one order of drinks and had to practically wring a second order out of the server at the very end of the meal. He didn't check in on us to see how things were, to ensure our drinks were full, etc.  Just bad.

Don Pisto's needs to more effectively screen its servers -- and it needs to shut down that basement until they figure out how to mitigate the sound and approximate the environment upstairs.

Until then, why not serve the food out of a food truck? It's so delicious! We had hoped this would be a regular neighborhood spot for us.
author: Marc F.

description: This is probably one of my girlfriend and I's favorite places to eat in San Francisco. It is simple and delicious. We always get the pork tamales and their tacos. I was kind of disapointed they changed their menu and removed the Diablo Shrimp because that was our favorite thing on their menu. Oh well it is still an awesome place.
author: Darius A.

description:
Great brunch. $26 for huevos rancheros, and bottomless mimosa/sangria/ Margs AND chips and salsa! 

Mimosas delicious and strong

Chips and salsa amazing!

Sangria "ok" 

A little loud for my taste- but still great!
author: Callie B.

description:
Never have I ever... Don Pisto's edish

Never have I ever had a better group-dining experience.

Never have I ever had customized VIP menus for said group

Never have I ever seen one person eat so much guacamole so fast

Never have I ever drank so much sangria

Never have I ever been heard of lobster cooked in pork fat

Never have I ever had such exceptional casual dining service

All in all, a shining dining experience. The service was exceptional and the servers were some of the most pleasant I've ever encountered. If I had to semi-dig at anything, it's that I wish there were at least one veggie option that wasn't just tacos consisting of a tortilla, rice, beans, cheese and guac. A little more for the veggies, por favor?

If you ever have a location for a fun group dining experience, a rezo at Don Pisto's will have your menage a multiples covered.
author: Candice G.

description: Great place to go I found wile traveling on business w my gf.  Perfect food, great staff,  can't miss with this one
author: Samuel N.

description:
Hmm, I am a little stumped by all the Yelpie love for this joint. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't bad, it just wasn't all that amazing. 

The place was small but the vibe was cool. Nice mixture of people all looking like they were enjoying themselves. I also liked the fact that you can see the (very very very) tiny kitchen and see the chefs working hard. 

We were seated at a small table for two and immediately ordered a pitcher of margaritas. I was super pleased with the price but not so pleased with the quality. I thought I was going to be blown away because I asked for "salt on my rim and sugar on his" and was told by our waiter that the bartender wouldn't do a sugar rim because it undermined the integrity of the drink. WHOA, I figured I was about to be served the best margarita of my life. Unfortunately, it was completely non-remarkable. I have had a better drink from Chili's. 

The guacamole was on par with the margs. It was in some serious need of flavor...lime, salt, cilantro...anything??

Entrees were fine. Had the tamale special, enchiladas, and fish tacos. All were in need of some salt. For a Mexican restaurant, this place was missing the pizazz that makes this type of cuisine stand out.
author: Paige C.

description:
DON PISTO IS THE BAOSS!

After some evening debotury with friends, my girlfriend and I landed in Don Pistos just in time to cast in the last orders of the night (12:30AM weekdays). 

Carne Asada Tacos $9 - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/voFE8DTKsTFi1Vzm_zzd0Q?select=OJx6Ehk6qHIjhJJt78BHEQ
You know me, and if you don't, I'll tell you how much I hate overpaying for Mexican food, especially for something as simple as a taco. I've done it, and you've probably have yourself, and sometimes, it ends up in disappointment. However, the Carne Asada tacos at Don Pisto's is well worth it! 

A warm tortilla topped with nicely seasoned beef, chili verde salsa, and pico de gio. Simplicity at it's finest (and deliciousness!) Grilled jalapenos do come with the tacos, and more can be requested upon, but one set back is that the peppers have already been de-seeded.. bummer.

Lobster M/P ($36 at the time) - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/voFE8DTKsTFi1Vzm_zzd0Q?select=nF2xM7qc0C0tOiKLYRdNPQ
Lobster after midnight? That's how I cure my midnight munchies! 

A whole 2-pound Maine Lobster (see picture!), bathed and poached in pig lard, with homemade tortillas, beans, rice, arbol salsa, and delicious cilantro butter. My only regret is that I ate dinner already so I couldn't gorge on ALL THIS FOOD! (This serves 2 btw!) The homemade tortillas were amazing; very light and fluffy, you could really taste the time and effort put in them. The Lobster dipped in the arbol salsa and the cilantro butter was the true meaning of calorie careless glutton!

The complimentary chips and salsa were also bomb! The chili verde salsa was incredibly addicting. Best of all, it's made fresh! That's what I like to see from other restaurants. Keep in mind that it was almost 1AM and the Don still delivered!

With so much win, do I even need to write about the service? Hell ya! Our server, Daniel, was the man! Hospitality skills off the roof. Our chips and salsa were replenished 3x without having to ask (that's how good the salsa was!), our drinks were never half empty, and was simply just a great friendly host that wasn't trying to rush our meal. Much kudos to him!

It's tough finding a good eatery pass midnight that doesn't invoke more alcohol consumption (even though the Don Pisto's does is also a small bar), but also serves damn good food. The menu is small but wild with many interesting and mouthwatering Latino fusions, like their signature Guacamole Hamburger, Raw Oysters, or even Mexican Sashimi (you heard right). 

The hype is TRUE, and hands down, my new favorite Mexican joint. They also serve Brunch too!
author: Albert L.

description: Not sure why this place gets a lot of good reviews, maybe I just ordered wrong thing. Regular fish tacos should be pretty good at the Mexican place, right? They were ok. In addition to this, it felt that service were in a rush. Again, could be just wrong timing.
author: Svetlanko I.

description: amazing customer service, the most amazing food I've had in a long long time. diablo sauce and prawns is a must have. not to mention there al pastor tacos.
author: michael m.

description:
Ah, Don Pisto's...you did us right, sir. You did us right. 

For a group dining experience in San Francisco, I've had none finer. This is the honest to God fearing truth, my friends. I've dined with many large groups in SF as it turns out, so though I am not an expert in all things Bay Area, I've probably taken out more ravenous people in large quantities than the average Joe. 

But we aren't talking about Joe. We're talking about Don. Stay focused, Colleen!

My illustrious colleague booked our group of 14 for the large communal table running down the middle and it was comfortable. Elbow room. Not crammed. Perfect. The restaurant is lively and tables turned over quickly, but our wonderful server didn't seem to care that we all wanted to sit and chat for a bit over multiple pitchers of MORE sangria. 

Oh, the service. Please, let me tell you. By far some of the best I've had this year, maybe covering back to 2011. Sweet, sane, accommodating. Awesome. I wish I remembered her name! She was so great. Petite brunette with glasses. Also the hosts, owners, bussers, food runners...everyone we met was just so kind, really what you want to feel when you're dining and having a good time. I can' say enough things about it, but I think you get my point. 

THE FOOD! Great down home Mexican with a bit of an upscale twist, but no so far so that you feel like "WTF, I came to eat Mexican!" This is Mexican. Tons of taco options (I really enjoyed the fish tacos the best), up to a Mexican-inspired burger (which was excellent), seafood, lobster, I saw a pork chop arrive, a burrito bowl option. I mean really...something for everyone, including our two veggie diners who were quite satisfied with the options as well. 

SANGRIA. enough said. I liked it. 

And the icing on the cake? They let my sweller then hell team bring a cake for my last dinner with them. How sweet is this!? How many puns can I cram into this paragraph? Through the grapevine I also heard that not only did they accommodate said cake (they do NOT currently offer dessert), but they arranged to pick up the cake for my co-workers, light the candles, bring it out at exactly the right time, take it back to cut it all up and serve everyone slices. I mean really? This is above and beyond, even for a place that doesn't serve dessert. Magical. It really was so nice. 

So, cheers to Don Pisto's...I'd add you to my team any day sir, any day. Bring me another burger someone! 

*def make a reservation, this place was swingin' on a Wednesday night!
author: Colleen C.

description:
Don Pisto's is my new go-to for brunch with friends or family visiting in town. Great atmosphere, good food, good drinks, appropriate price-point. 

On the brunch menu the Pork Tamale with Poached Eggs is tasty, I would likely order again. The tamale could use some additional bread-item to mop up egg-yolk however. Not enough tamale to do the job. 

Pork Tacos are a bit lacking. They could use a little more citris, or possibly simmer in its juices a bit longer. Something was lacking flavor-wise, would most likely branch out and try other items on the menu next time around. 

I'd like to reiterate the food is good. I'm going for the constructive criticism here. :)
author: David G.

description:
I'm really sad to have to write this. This used to be one of my favorite restaurants in my neighborhood. I keep trying to give them more chances; but things have gone so far down hill in this establishment.

It all started about a year ago when bottomless brunch became a limited 2 hour deal. Fine, I get it, you don't want people sitting at your tables all day, not a huge deal. 

A little after that, they started charging for chips. I'm sorry, is this not a Mexican restaurant, I find that a tad chintzy. 

On another visit, I find out that they have converted that lovely bar (see past review) into seats for dinner guests. This would be fine, but now their is NO where for anyone to wait to be seated. I realize theirs always a wait here, but at least let me visit your bar while I wait the 45 minutes to eat.

If this wasn't bad enough, on what will sadly be my final visit for a while; I see they have taken about 50% of their taco's off the menu. They have also switched that already limited bottomless brunch to 1.5 hours.

I miss the old Don Pistos.
author: Tara T.

description:
I walked into Don Pisto's a sniveling little noob, a whiny young whelp ignorant to the ways of the world and hyperbolic Mexican food.

I walked out transformed. I was a foot taller, with bronzed skin, broad shoulders and a jaw like a bloody lantern. My teeth were whiter, my brain was bigger and my sexual prowess had increased a hundredfold.

Such tacos I have never before encountered. The real holy grail here, though, is the Mussels With Home-Made Chorizo, a powerful scarlet sausage skinned and crumbled over a steaming broth brimming with what I can only assume is testosterone. 

Don Pisto made me into a colossus. The earth trembles with my passage. 
I am Andre the Giant. 
I am Charles Atlas. 
I am Galactus, Devourer of Worlds.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Don pisto's fish tacos made me rethink fish tacos. Every time I go to Don pisto's I order fish tacos, ceviche, and something else. Add in a pitcher of margaritas and you're in for a great (albeit expensive) night.

I will note that the margaritas are made with agave wine and not tequila, so they're a little different than normal bars. I think they're great but a few one my friends have been less enthusiastic. Our server has been super chill about it both times and given them a different drink and left the original, free of charge. Classy move, Don Pisto's, classy.
author: Jon D.

description:
No coffee
No vegetables
No conversation (too loud)
No alcohol (carded 35 year old)
No pay (can't use multiple credit cards)

No come again
author: Joris P.

description:
5 stars for the quality of food combined with the bottomless mimosa/sangria/margaritas!

This place has surprisingly one of the best burgers I have EVER had. It is cooked in bacon and tastes amazing with nothing on it. 
Whole brunch menu is great and the tacos are good too. 
Overall it is a fun atmosphere for a big group!
author: Daniela J.

description: Greatest fish tacos I've ever had. I'm sad that this place is only open for dinners now. We used to go once a week for lunch. Definitely expensive but so worth it.
author: Ron B.

description:
Pork chops! They were great (and huge) as pork chops and in the al pastor tacos too. Sashimi was yummy as were the oysters. We also had albondigas. It came with crostini & marinara.  Yum!

It is loud. It might ruin the night for some so you should know. It didn't bother us though.

To find it...No sign on the street just the address. Look for the brick building with the good smells coming from it. Be prepared to wait for a table; it's worth it.

The bartender tonight was a sweetheart and our waiter was entertaining & efficient.
author: Suzanne W.

description:
Bumping rating down from 4 stars to 3.

Came back for a group dinner, and the food was just okay. Service was really lacking.
author: David L.

description:
Every year I visit San Francisco for a week and every year I come to Don Pisto's for a margarita fuelled meal. It's always fun, flavoursome and the service is terrific with that great mix of friendliness and authority (ie. "how about I just order you two serves of the octopus and a jug of margarita to get you started?"). With more than a few people in your dining group, having a waiter who can tell you what to do means you eat quickly and there's none of those stupid conversations about what to order.

Start with chips and salsa and a side of guac. Then move on to ceviche, octopus and the must oder mussels with chorizo. Trust me, you'll want to stab your dining partners for the last slurp of the rich broth in the bottom of the bowl. I've tried replicating this dish at home and it never lives up to the deliciousness that is served here.

Finish with some tacos to fill out any gaps in your stomach before you shuffle out the door. The special fish taco of the day is always a winner.
author: Tresna L.

description:
We came here on Monday and it was pretty busy. The atmosphere is loud, they have music playing and the restaurant itself is noisy. The service here was great.  For how busy thy were, the wait staff brought us our food fairly quickly. 

We had the Mexican sashimi and it was good. We ordered the carnitas and there were excellent. I had the fish tacos and I thought Rey were great. 

I would definitely come back here.
author: Kyle S.

description:
Sorry peeps, I just wasn't impressed. The food is just ok. 

1. This place is cute and very small, so be prepared to wait at least an hr to be seated
2. Pricey Mexican food - I can get better tacos at the roach truck around the corner from my house. $9 for 2 tacos? meh. 
3. Mexican sashimi $13 - fish was not a quality cut, I'm a sushi Connoisseur so maybe my standards are too high. 
4. Parking is a B-I-T-C-H

Things I did really like about this place:
- really friendly service
- great ambience
- good-looking patrons - always important in my books
- awesome bartender - Nick, you rock!
- open kitchen that is very clean

I'd probably go back for drinks but definitely not for the food.
author: Dani S.

description: Delish! Try the salmon sashimi and the guacamole. Great pairing for $20. :D
author: Tim W.

description:
Food is bland and way overpriced.  The drinks seem really weak to me and the others I've dined with here.

The service is terrible.  Horrible.  Especially the "manager" we spoke with after a particularly bad experience here. 
The last 2 times I've been, they've had to comp multiple items off our bill because either they ran out of what we ordered, they brought the wrong thing, or they brought something waaaaay too late after everything else had been eaten and one poor person was left waiting to eat on their own.

The music situation here is so obnoxious too.  Too much bass!  You can't even hear your waitress telling you the specials!  Come to think of it, that's probably why they always seem to get something in our order wrong--they can't even hear what we're saying!

I've tried many times, but I've had it and will never return to Don Pisto's.  With so many other great restaurants in North Beach, go spend your hard earned money elsewhere!
author: Lindsey S.

description:
Meh. I came here for bottomless brunch and had high hopes. Unfortunately those were ruined when I realized we were sitting downstairs, in what is essentially a basement. The acoustics in there are terrible, so if you plan on having a conversation with someone who is not directly next to you, good luck. It's loud, dim and generally depressing, essentially its a dungeon. So a brunch-dungeon is what we have here.

The food portions were small and unremarkable for brunch fare. I was expecting some kind of Mexican-brunch amazingness but was disappointed. The one upside was that they have bottomless margaritas, which are strong,the other two bottomless options, sangria & mimosas were weak. Our waitress was cool and tried her best to keep our glasses full, but alas my friends and I noticed the bottoms of our bottomless glasses one too many times for it to be a truly seamless experience.
author: Tania Z.

description:
If we're talking about hospitality, accompanied by exquisite food you would certainly not imagine I was talking to a chef. I say this because I put myself through school bar tending and waiting tables and never knew a chef that was not a complete A-Hole. 

However, Miguel Leon of Don Pisto's does not only pay meticulous detail to the cuisine he creates and manages, but he is a hell of a nice guy.

If I were to make pros to describe Miguel's extraordinary professionalism, I would say, "Emancipating, Prioclomating, Miguel Leon, you are the bomb. -Kaboom!!!!

Or I'm Spanish, "Gracias, Adios, Por Dicha Miguel Leon!!!!"
author: Hunter L.

description: I was visiting San Francisco back in March 2016 and my friend took me here.  It was highly enjoyable due to the sleek and trendy atmosphere, as well as the drink and food selection. The portions were pretty small but besides that everything else was amazing. I ate here for dinner at around 5:00 PM and I was tremendously impressed with the hip-hop background music. Definitely an enjoyable place to go to and I look forward to going back next time I am in the Bay.
author: Zane C.

description:
After walking by many times and noticing the good vibes and smells emanating from Don Pistos, my wife and I finally decided to give it a try. The space has nice ambience with with dim mood lighting, great music, and big windows allowing you to take in the North Beach night-life. I've heard the wait can be long, but we went on a Friday evening and were seated fairly quickly with some of their delicious Chips & Salsa. 

The service was excellent; friendly and attentive, and I always appreciate it when staff take the time to explain the menu and specials. Don Pistos seems like a great place for picking a few things to try and share, and we split the Carne Asada Tacos and a house specialty, the Pollo Asado. Both were fantastic, served with warm tortillas, and fresh toppings. I would definitely get either again if I were't so excited to try other things on the menu! Overall, a great experience and looking forward to returning soon.
author: Joe M.

description:
How have I not written a review for this place??

Granted, I've only been here for brunch (3 times, and counting), but the food is seriously good.

The food here is greasy, spicy, flavorful, and just all around satisfying. I recommend the breakfast burrito, taco sonora (al pastor style), and the hamburgesa. You won't be disappointed!
author: Sherry L.

description: Great for boozy brunches but boozy brunches only - they don't serve coffee.  I recommend getting there early for brunch to avoid a wait. It's delicious but probably not worth anything longer than a 15 minute wait time.
author: drew n.

description:
Don Pistos, this was one of my very first restaurants that I visited when I first moved to SF and I must say it's DELICIOUS. 

I went with some friends and had:
Right off the bat they give you tostadas and this yummy green salsa- the salsa is SPICYYY but OH SO GOOD! I could have had just that and would have left happy. 
Guacamole- 5 stars, really yummy. We had to order two. 
Pitcher of margaritas.....Not my favorite......I will order the Sangria next time...
Diablo Shrimp- Super spicy but also good. Nothing crazy amazing about them, but the shrimp were a good size. 
Asada Tacos, comes with two. They are small, but by the time I had margaritas, chips, guac and shrimp, these tacos sealed the deal. They are very well seasoned and the corn tortillas were the perfect texture and very tasty. 

The Venue:
The environment is very small, if you have to wait, you wait outside because there is ZERO standing room on the inside and in SF it can get pretty chilly so I would recommend for call ahead seating if possible & a jacket. 

Music in there is a total hit and the staff couldn't be friendlier. 
This place gets Four stars in my book.
author: Britt S.

description:
What an amazing little hole in the wall discovery. Late night after going to the exploratorium and yelping around, we discovered this little gem. As packed as it was, we got seated right away and our server was awesome! She was well-knowledge in the food.

We ordered chips and salsa, ceviche, tacos, the asado dish and the tamales. Everything was flavorful and tasty and they definitely do not skimp on the chips and salsa! LOVE everything about this place and at the end, our waitress came and gave our table a round of tequila shots on the house!! How awesome is that?! 

Must go here if you are ever in the area. You will not regret it.
author: Jenn L.
Andrea L.

description:
I wish I stayed close by, I would have a meal here almost everyday :)

It's smallish, service is personable and the food rocks!!! Love their veggie options and cheers to their Michelada's!!! 

Hic hic hooray ;)
author: Harsha G.

description: We made reservations at Don Pistos not more than two weeks ago for a party of 16 for our wedding reception. We had the option 3. Included shrimp tacos, tacos al pastor, calamari, guacamole, salsas, chips, beans, rice and finally delicious pork chops. However those were our personal choices. The food was delicious from chips to chops. I can't express how happy I am that the service was phenomenal. My fiance and family were absolutely blown away. The food and drinks kept coming, no awkward pauses. Thank You so much Don Pistos! Ok now for the only con. PARKING! Omg people, seriously expect to be annoyed finding a spot close by. HINT, there is a parking garage just across the little park on the north side corner. Not more than 2 blocks from the restaurant. Once you finally make it, it'll all be worth it.
author: Mario J.

description:
Went for dinner on a Wednesday night - got there at 6:30 and it was relatively empty. By the time we left at 7:30pm it was so loud in the restaurant it was kind of hard to hear the people I was with. If you're looking for a quiet dinner, get there early!
We shared the guac (delish) and I had the fish tacos. They had a great kick to them. 
The sangria was delicious.
author: Ariana L.

description:
Oh, Don Pisto's, I will return.

I'm not shy about spicy food, but the carnitas had me literally sweating and I found myself actually scraping off the excess hot sauce from my carnitas.  This NEVER happens to me.  I mean, I'm a spicy food champ.  And even behind all that spice the carnitas tacos still had amazing flavor, and the amount of food was just right--not oversized portions like they try to feed you at so many places.

The ambiance is nice.  I added this place to my San Fran bucket list because of the Yelp reviews, and you all did not disappoint me.  I have now happily checked it off, but I'm thinking of adding it again.
author: Kristin W.

description: The Camarones tacos are out of this world!  I would come back for those alone but the guacamole was delicious as well.  I would order the bottomless margaritas again as they are a little watered down for my taste - go for the individual glass or the sangria instead.
author: Landon C.

description:
