First time here and everything was awesome. We were having a super late dinner around 10:45 so the place was emptying out. The service was quick. 
We had el pastor, chicken, and shrimp tacos with the rib eye and the lobster. 
Everything was amazing and super delicious, the chicken tacos stood out the most because it was super tender and marinated. 
I definitely look forward to going back and it's perfect for late night eating when everyone else is closed.
author: Blake R.

description:
Five Stars
Came early with a group of 6 and we were seated right away. Great place to catch up with friends! The music is laid back, the lighting is just right, the menu items are exciting and the waitress is super friendly! I live a block away, so will definitely frequent this place.

Tips and Fun Facts
Okay I'll admit it, it helped that the table next to us had a couple of very good looking guys that caught our eye. But even besides that, Don Pisto's is very deserving of a 5 star!
author: Linda X.

description: Came here for brunch and thoroughly enjoyed the food, service and environment. The service was on point, we immediately had chips and salsa at our table and our waitress was so attentive and helpful. The environment was cool and relaxing, the music playing was nothing but good vibes. The food was a hit, everything was fresh and well prepared. I had the huevos rancheros and a mimosa and it was excellent! I can't wait to go back and bring my friends!
author: Ian V.

description: Amazing service. Amazing food. Amazing music and atmosphere. Everything about this place is da bomb.
author: Catherine J.

description: Visiting the city and had to try out a bottomless mimosa spot for Sunday brunch. I got the huevos rancheros and aqua Fresca mimosas. Drinks were on point and I took advantage of the bottomless (I had 5) food was decent, it wasn't amazing but the drinks were definitely worth coming back again. Oh the chips and salsa are BOMB
author: Nima F.

description:
No wait on a Sunday afternoon for brunch? Why not!

We had the chorizo with poached egg, fish tacos, and torta.

Chorizo: Potatoes were cooked to perfection, well-seasoned and crispy. Chorizo added a nice salty touch as well. And the egg just glued everything together. Yum.

Fish tacos: Finally, fish that isn't dry and tough in a fish taco! Fish was perfectly flaky and not bland at all.

Torta: The bun was crispy enough so that it had a nice crunch, but just soft enough so it doesn't scrape the roof of your mouth. The meat inside wasn't rubbery like it usually is in tortas (not that I'm complaining). And the cheese was just mild enough with an interesting texture that tied everything together.

Will definitely come back here to try breakfast burritos next time :)
author: Tiffany W.

description: This place was absolutely amazing from the service to the food.  Get the lobster...it will be the best thing you've ever had. We made a 6:30 reservation and it was about half full, but the place fills up, so reservations are probably a good idea. My sister had the enchiladas which were also delicious, but I just can't say enough about the lobster!
author: Stayce C.

description: Using my precious vacation time leaving a review for this restaurant cause it's worth it. The ambience is great -suitable for couples or a group of friends. Service was beyond expectation. We went in with four people and they brought extra tortillas for our tacos (two pieces each) and extra toast with the mussels when asked. Food was great - you got to try the shrimp tacos and rib tortilla. We had a great time there.
author: Chulin G.

description:
What a beautiful cure for the day after New Years Eve! 

My girlies from Miami, my BFF Jess H., and I were desperately seeking last minute dinner reservations somewhere that my East Coast gals could actually get a taste of West Coast style Mexican...

My favorite Mission spots= too informal

Colibri= booked!

Orale, Orale= not quite in the mood. 

Tommy's Tequila Bar= too far!

Don Pistos= JUST RIGHT! 

I called ahead and was excited to hear there was only a 45 minute wait for a party of 6 so we rushed over and put our name in. Sadly we were greeted by no no sign on the door and a 2 hour wait and no space to drink at the bar, sigh. We had a flight to catch so the possibility of getting my gals something other than Mission burritos on the way to the airport was looking pretty dismal. 

I went and explained my predicament to our hostess and ten minutes later we were summoned to our table. It was perfect. We headed to the basement/banquet style room that had more than enough seating. Yay!

We were greeted by our darling server Kate and amazing tortilla chips and salsa that tasted just like my Mom's. They were even served in the wooden bowls, just like at Mom's! Then we heard "bottomless margaritas and sangrias" and we were all in.

We ordered an assortment of tacos: carne asada, fish of the day, carnitas, and al pastor. The highlight was definitely the carne asada, it was a little dry but somehow managed to make me order a second round. I liked that the tacos were served street style: 2 small tortillas, onions, cilantro, pickled jalapenos and carrots, radishes, and limes. 

The bottomless pitchers were flowing. At one point Pete the owner of the joint, came and professed his love to the ladies at the table and proceeded to give the men shoulder rubs. You get the picture, it was a great meal!

I'm not gonna lie to you folks, some places on mission have better tacos but this place is all about the entire package, the vibe. Good service, great ambiance, fabulous music, stiff booze, and yummy food. 

Side Bar-I love the name, anyone who has been to Mexico should get a giggle out of picturing the real Don Pisto.
author: Caro S.

description:
WOW. This place is AHHMAZING. I was here with co-workers last night and it was packed -- rightly so.

Our table ordered a bunch of different items of the menu and everything was insanely delicious. I only had a few items but they were so yummy I am actually deeply sad I am only in San Francisco for work and that I will be leaving this wonderful restaurant behind. 

Lobster -- CHECK. ***This is a MUST*** Perfectly cooked with such a unique, light flavor. 

Carne Asada Tacos -- Yes. Just the perfect amount of spicy. 

Fantastic chips and guacamole.  

A must go.
author: Kat R.

description: Great spot to eat great Mexican food. Brunch is amazing, tacos are amazing, and drinks are good. The place has open windows which can be good and bad. It can get warm in there but you also get a nice outdoor breeze too.
author: Oscar P.

description:
I ate here a couple weeks ago. We ordered the tamale and egg, carnitas tacos and the shrimp and citrus ceviche. Everything was phenomenal! The tamale and egg is a must try, the carnitas was fall-apart tender and full of flavor and the ceviche was so fresh! Even though the chips and salsa were complimentary, they don't skimp on the flavor and quality.
From the hostess to the bar tender, customer service was wonderful. 
My only complaint is that we don't have a Don Pisto's in southern California!
author: Meredith E.

description: DELICIOSO! We went with a group of 8 (this place is always busy because its delicious... make a reservation!) We had a pork chop, spare ribs, rib eye, ahi tacos, normal fish tacos, etc... EVERYTHING WAS DELICIOUS!! I would not normally a pork chop or ribeye at a mexican restaurant... but dont miss out on these!
author: Jess K.

description:
Can't say enough about this great place.  Unique, gourmet Mexican food with the best margaritas to go with it.  It is small and busy, but worth the wait.  My only complaint is the noise level.  Concrete floors and brick walls - it is super loud.  There was a guy sitting across the room and every other word was the "f" bomb, which the entire room could hear.  They could solve the noise issue with acoustical wall treatments.  

Nonetheless, I keep going back when I am in town.  Walked a mile in the rain to eat there last week. That says something!
author: Steven L.

description:
Great brunch spot for a group. I loved the omlette and cocktails!

I would avoid coming here during busy times and expecting to be able to have a conversation though - accoustics are terrible and the brunch crowd is usually, well, very drunk.
author: Aubrey O.

description: As I said to our wonderful waitress, "I wish all restaurant experiences were like this".  GREAT FOOD!  Everything from the most delicious homemade green salsa I have ever tasted, to the cool brick and wood decor made this a wonderful dining experience!  We had Tortilla Soup, Fish Tacos, Chorizo and Mussels, Roasted Corn, Margaritas....everything top notch. You can tell that they take great care to use specific ingredients and make sure all their items are seasoned flawlessly resulting in great flavors.
author: Gary S.

description:
First the bad... still noisy as all heck.  Now the good and the reason for the update.  The pork chop ($25) was just so juicy and tender that it kicked ass over the place I just ate at down the block (Original Joe's).  I will be reviewing OJ when I have time.  

But again, the pork was excellent and the tostada was great tasting. Chips/salsa was salty, just the way I like them (had three "yelpings")  Normally at Don Pisto, they push their lime afficionado mentality but I think with lime at $100 a case vs $20 last year, they've toned it done. (hah) ....  

Also noticed that there was three families there... so I guess if you have crying or loud kids; in this noisy place, no one will notice. There were four obnoxious twenty odd old guys louder than heck while we were there.  Did I say that the pork chop was greatttt??

Time I arrived was on a Friday at 5:30pm .. found a parking space, was immediately seated and had a great blonde cute server who went extra mile.  (btw, I am a girl making a statement and my guy was not THAT cute to warrant the extra service, so I think it was either me or she's just good at her job : ). I tipped 25%

Oh I forgot... they just opened a new place  called Pisto's Taco around the corner on 1310 Grant near my favorite burger place Mo's .... and I walked by it .. seems more bar and bar food place  (cheaper menu) and will review that one soon too.
author: Andrea K.

description:
Solid, solid spot.  Got a recommendation from a few friends to try Don Pisto's when the SO and I were in SF so we did - and so glad we did.

First, huge props for the music: Naughty by Nature, Snoop, Warren G., etc. - not for everyone, but I definitely enjoyed it.

It's a small, loud place, but the food is great, prices are pretty reasonable and it can be a quick in and out spot if you want it to be or you can relax for a while.  We had the Pork Tacos and Tuna Tacos, we weren't extremely hungry and had a red-eye out of SF so wanted to have just enough to put us to sleep.  Two tacos to each dish, they're small tacos, but those dishes coupled with the chips/salsa were perfect.

My only complaint harkens back to the music, but more about the patrons, the young, obnoxious, I'm killing it in SF folks who think it's fine to get bombed and have a table of 8 start loudly singing Gangsta's Paradise was just super annoying for our table and pretty much everyone else.
author: Lowell P.

description:
Stopped by here for dinner with some friends one night. We ordered the guacamole to share, I ordered the carne asada tacos and a margarita.

The guacamole was some of the best I have ever had. It was very simply and had a strong citrus flavor but was perfectly balanced with salt. 

The margarita was also quite delicious. You could tell there was tequilla in it, but it wasn't strong tasting. 

The tacos were incredible. Very simply, just meat and tortillas, served with a wedge of lime and some radishes. 

I would highly recommend this place to anyone who loves guacamole! Also, I would recommend coming early, they get very busy and the wait can be long.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Delicious food! Visiting from Colorado where Mexican food is good too. This place is small, which isnt a bad thing.after walking up to coit towet we were hungry and devided to stop here. It was very noisy, thats my only complaint.
author: Jen D.

description:
If you're looking for a "mom and pop" type Mexican food joint, then this isn't the place for you.

This Mexican restaurant is trendy, modern, fun, and of course, tasty! I love that they don't have a large, overwhelming menu. The ambiance is great too! Their servers are super nice and attentive.

Their ceviche is DELICIOUS (and I don't even like raw fish), their tacos are tasty, and their guacamole is fresh and amazing! To the girl who said it needed more lime and salt, that's easily fixed by adding those ingredients yourself! I like the fact that they don't add too much salt because salt can be easily added but not removed.

Which brings me back to their tacos. The only reason why I don't give them a 5 is because their carnitas and al pastor are a little too salty for my taste, but still very flavorful. I have yet to try their other dishes but I'm looking forward to going back. I've already been there multiple times since I live in North Beach myself.

This place is definitely worth a try if you're in the neighborhood!
author: Eva D.

description: Tacos Sonora with the Carne is out of this world! Atmosphere bumping! Staff amazing and quick! Great brunch/lunch spot in San Francisco!
author: Kenneth K.

description: Don Pisto's was pretty great. I went there with my girlfriend for some grub and ended up getting the hot wings and carne asada tacos. The meat was cooked perfectly and the sauce for both dishes was delicious. The complementary chips and salsa were on point too. The place is kinda small and the music is on he verge of the being a bit loud but the furniture was cool. The meals are a bit on the pricey side for the portions but like I said, the food was great so it was definitely worth it. I'll be coming back for sure.
author: Titus W.

description:
CHORIZO. MUSSELS.

This combination was amazing and something I would have never thought of. The best part of the dish is not only the pork and seafood marinaded together in chorizo sauce, but also that you can use the shells of the mussels as tiny spoons to scoop chorizo! Definitely order this anytime you come with a group as it is great to share.

I thought the tacos were decent, but nothing close to tacos in the Mission. Also, almost $10 for two tacos? Hefty price tag for ridiculously small portions! I've also heard good things about the burger, but haven't tried it myself.
author: Brian L.

description: Great atmosphere,great sangria, perfect salsa, tender and tasty food. Otherwise it sucked
author: Mitch H.

description: The BEST Mexican food I've had in a while! The Tuna tacos were to die for, so we ordered them again after we finished eating the first round. Only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because I didn't really like the chicken wings. My boyfriend did though. All in all, coming back here as often as I can!
author: Katrice S.

description: That hamburguesa, man... you don't need much else. Well, maybe the excellent margarita, too.
author: Maximillian M.

description: A little pricey, but really worth it. Tons of flavor, crispy-yet-tender carnitas, home made tortillas. And attentive wait staff!
author: Stephanie L.

description: Great spot! We loved everything we ate and drank! The service was great and our server answered all of our questions, even giving us a sample of a sauce. I definitely recommend the sangria and guacamole! We found this great taco spot and we couldn't have been happier!
author: Nicole S.

description:
THE BEST GUACAMOLE EVERRRR!! I also tried all their tacos and I thought it was good, but not mind blowing...well, almost.

SUPER loud and have long waitlist, I think for weekends. Service was not very noticeable because our attention was more caught by the loud crowd
author: Elaine N.

description: Enjoyed  the atmosphere the wait staff the food was delicious and plentiful.  Shared the lobster and chicken fajitas, rice beans!  Loved the crisp tortillas.  Will return to explore more of the menu.
author: Kathy W.

description:
I'm a fan of Don Pisto's. Who would've thought the best restaurant in North Beach, aka Little Italy, is a Mexican restaurant? But it's true.

The ambiance is cool - low lit lighting, brick walls - but not TOO cool or romantic.

They seriously must do something to their chips.  They are amazing. I generally fill myself up on those amazing homemade fried tortillas.  Then I eat even more, willingly, and enjoy it even more.  

My go-to here is the hamberguesa - a VERY simply burger made of quality meat, with a spread of simple but delicious guacamole on the top.  Nothing more.  And nothing more is necessary, that's for sure.  It just packs so much flavor.  I also have enjoyed all the different types of tacos, and the calamari in particular is great.

I have yet to go for brunch, but that's surely at the top of my list.

My tip to newcomers: the sangria isn't very strong - try something else. Don't miss this unassuming (sign-less) North Beach spot.
author: Will A.

description:
I think this place is a bit over-rated. What I really liked about it was the ambiance (young and hip), rustic decoration, and its fun environment (good music always ads to the pleasure of dinning). 

However, I was quite disappointed with the quality of food. I went here with my fiancé mid week. We didn't have a reservation and walked in. Luckily, they had an empty table for two (pretty much most other tables were taken though, so definitely this place is in high demand, and I would recommend that you make a reservation before you go). 

I should say their margaritas was quite delicious! We ordered chips and salsa with guacamole, carne asada, and diablo prawns, and pollo asado. They first brought us chips and salsa with guacamole. It took them good 20 minutes to take us the next dish. By then, we were already quite full digging into the chips and salsa. Then they brought the diablo prawns. My eyes sparked (I love prawns), but shortly after, I had tears dropping from my eyes and nose for the rest of the dinner! Damn! Speaking of HOT?! The sauce on top of the prawns was super "hot & spicy" and made me burn throughout the dinner! The food was actually delicious, but they poured way too much of that burning sauce on top, so it was even hard to see the prawns anymore. 

Not until we finished the last piece of the initial dish that they cared to bring us other dishes. So the tacos finally came after I swallowed all the hot and spicy diablo prawns and dropped tears as I ate (I'm sure my fiancé had a good laughter though because he doesn't like prawns and just watched me finishing that dish alone)! ;)  

The tacos were average (but also quite spicy)! Nothing too fancy about them though...The chicken however frustrated us....It was greasy and didn't taste great. So overall we were not too impressed with the food here, but the ambiance and vibe inside the restaurant get high scores.   

I would suggest that you go to this place if you want to have a great ambiance and care less about the quality of the food, or if is one of those days that you are feeling hot and spicy! ;)

Was this review...?
author: Yasi B.

description:
-Our Order-

2 margaritas, diablo prawns, white rice, pinto beans, carne asada and al pastor tacos

-The Short-

Ambiance: Laid back
Crowd: Young & privileged
Food: Perfect for late night grub with minimal expectations
Price: Absurdly over-priced
Service: Ok, with a slight hint of ambivalence
Wait: None

-The Long-

This restuarant's biggest asset is the ambiance.  The minimal modern decor, friendly low key vibe of the staff and abundance of young hip patrons lends Don Pisto's an air of greatness.  It is unfortunate that the food and drinks do not measure up to the hype. 
Don Pisto's biggest misstep for me was in pricing.  The $8 Margaritas are a house-fermented mostly sour concoction that probably would not move the blood alcohol level of my bichon frise.
author: Jen W.

description:
3.5 stars but rounding down since they don't serve dessert and it gets way too loud in there! We came here for a work dinner since I was able to make reservations for a party of 9. They wouldn't seat us until we all arrived, and the table but a little squishy but we made it work. We ordered a bunch of different dishes to share:

-Tacos (2/Order, Topped w/Onions & Cilantro). My favorite was the Al Pastor (Grilled Pork Rib Chop, Charred Pineapple, Avocado Salsa, $9), then the Carnitas (Slow Braised Pork, Arbol Salsa, $9), Camarones (Sauteed Shrimp, Garlic, Red Onion, $10), Pescado (Market Fresh Fish, Arbol/Avocado Salsa, Cabbage, Onion slaw, $10), then the Carne Asada (Mesquite Grilled Steak, Arbol Salsa, $9).
-Mexican Sashimi (Lime, Cilantro, Chile): This was awesome since the hamachi was really fresh and flavorful. Highly recommended!
-Wild Monterey Calamari (Charcoal Grilled, Orange, Lime, Radish Salad, $15): Just ok. The calamari tasted fresh, but it was a little bland- Skip.
-Ceviche: Pretty good, and I normally don't like ceviche. The fish was really fresh, and the flavors worked really well together. Recommended.
-Chips & Salsa ($3) & Guacamole ($6): The salsa had a good level of spicyness, and the guacamole was also good, but needed a little more salt. However, the chips were really good, and salted perfectly.
-Hamburguesa (Marinated in Bacon, Onions, Served w/Guacamole, $11): I've had the hamburguesa before and really enjoyed it, but thought it was just ok this time around. The patty was a bit overcooked/on the dry side. 

Our server was really good, and was able to make some recommendations to help us with our order. I thought the food was good, but not amazing. However, prices are reasonable and all their ingredients seem really fresh. It would be nice if they had at least 1-2 desserts available on the menu, since I've never been to a restaurant that doesn't at least have fruit or cookies or something. Overall, I would recommend checking out Don Pisto's once if you haven't been, but there are other really good restaurants in this area to dine at also. Parking can be a nightmare in this area, but there is a lot a few blocks away that is available, as well as street parking. No valet though.
author: Amy D.

description:
First introduced by my coworkers and brought my girlfriends here the next time. The bottomless agua fresca mimosas are delicious! You can alternate your choices between agua fresca mimosas, sangrias, and margaritas. I'd recommend the mimosas as it's most fresh.They say they switch between oranges, pineapples, blackberries, watermelon, etc...based on season. Nick was our server the first time and he remembered me the next, awesome memory! He's the one that looks like Ferris Bueller. He SAYS he gets Keana Reeves, but that could be from the ladies he's been pooring too many refills to. JK, he's a sweetheart and a very attentive waiter. Daniel also kindly gave me and my girls jello shots to make sure they were perfect for cinco de mayo, they were REALLY GOOD, so go get some! (I obviously had this in drafts for way too long..since it's mid May now, sorry Daniel) 

Brunch food isn't phenomenal but still delicious. I've tried the chorizo scramble, comes with 2 poached eggs, chorizo, and potatoes. YUM! Also had the tacos and ranchos huervos, also highly recommend.

Definitely coming back in the summer,  someone please tell me when they have watermelon mimosas available, PLEASE!
author: Lisa F.

description:
Came here with a friend on Thursday around 7pm.  I did not give a lot of hope to have a table because this place always packs.

Surprisingly, there was no wait and even a lot of empty tables.  The service was good and attentive.  

We ordered: 

Fish Tacos (two per order) - It was pretty good.  Flavorful but the portion was kinda small and kinda pricey.

Slow Braised Pork Taco - It was good but I like the fish taco more.  

Ceviche - Very good.  It was so fresh and flavorful.  I love the sauce.

Chips & Guacamole - The best dish of the night.  The sauce was full of big chunk of avocado.  

Overall, this is just an OK restaurant.  Good that I did not need to wait at all for the table.  I don't think this place is worth for the long wait.
author: Liza T.

description:
I have been to Don Pisto's several times now. With their trendy tacos, south of the border-inspired sashimi, and drink specials, this seems like a promising spot. But I have come away each time feeling like it was a disappointingly lackluster experience, especially given their prices. The waits are long, service is decent, and food is just... alright.

If you are looking for authentic Mexican food, I advise you instead to head down to one of the many taquerias on 24th Street -- you and your wallet will be much more satisfied.
author: Brita B.

description:
This is a solid restaurant, with tasty food, good drinks and fun music. It's a great spot for a weeknight pick me up dinner with some friends. 

The menu gets switched up every so often, but they've consistently had great tacos. I'm not sure if they still have the pork chop, but it was absolutely delicious.

Just a heads up, the wait can be very long. Because we live in the neighborhood, on busy nights, we call to see how long the wait is, go and put our name down about 30-45 minutes before we want to eat, and then go back home to wait it out.
author: Yishian Y.

description:
Owner of Don Pistos, bring back the mussels! that was my favorite item and now it's gone! Even with the missing item though, I have come back for the grilled calamari, guacamole and chips and great vibe you have goin' on. 

Again, please bring back the mussels. Pretty, pretty please!

P.S. I must try your brunch. Heard good things.
author: Joanna G.

description:
I'll gladly pay you Tuesday for a Don Pisto hamburger today.

The food is good and definitely shareable. You get free chips and salsa for the table and the taco plates come in numbers. I recommend the hamburguesa, which is apparently marinated in bacon and onions, whatever that means. After the first bite you will realize that it's actually marinated in heaven juice.

The drinks are okay but reasonably priced. They have pitchers, enough said.

My only qualm is that the kitchen is basically within the same room as the dining area, so it gets uncomfortably hot and steamy while you feast.

Other than that, it's a great spot with a lot of energy. Check it out but be prepared to wait to be seated.
author: Nick K.

description: I stopped here based on the reviews on yelp.  I was not disappointed. To start, the chips and salsa were tasty yet a little spicy.  I also had the wings and steak tacos, more spice. The music and atmosphere were great.   I had the red sangria, it was nothing specia, just average.
author: Brandi W.

description:
Don Pistol was on my list of places to eat at and am glad I went there. The service is very good, staff is attentive. The ambience was a little loud which you might or might not like. We started with a pitcher of margaritas which was good - not too sweet and not too tarty, and the guacamole had the right amount of chunkiness and creaminess. 
As for of the rest of the food it was OK. Ceviche had a sweet twist which I liked but it didn't have much fish in it, the fish in the spicy fish tacos didn't taste very fresh. The al pastor was pretty good but carnitas was a little dry. 
Overall the experience was good and I would come back once more.
author: Harshal V.

description: Our daughter brought us here late last Saturday night, and who knew we would get some of the best Mexican food ever in North Beach. Since it was late we weren't chowing down, but three of us split the pork chop which is incredibly tender and flavorful, a plate of carnitas tacos that came with a wonderful crunchy texture on the meat, and the tiny and spicy in the right way diablo wings. Mmmm. All of it. And the margaritas were done just right, too.
author: Rick H.

description: Had a fantastic birthday brunch with a group of 17 people in the downstairs area. Excellent service. Can't beat bottomless mimosas/sangria/margaritas and way too much food for $35/person. They kept the drinks coming so we got more than enough in the hour and a half. We ate the breakfast burrito, chorizo and poached eggs, huevos rancheros, omelette and French toast. They served it all family style and every plate was delicious. I've come here for dinner plenty of times and there food is on point. I was happy to find a place to accommodate such a large group for my birthday. Will definitely have to come back here for brunch. And I will be going back for dinner shortly I am sure.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Get the mussels and the chorizo! My favorite dish of the night, the mussels tasted fresh and the chorizo gave a lot of flavor to the white wine soup. My boyfriend and I licked the bowl clean. We also enjoyed the guacamole and the green salsa. First time having green salsa and it came with a spicy kick, which I enjoyed. We also got the ceviche, but this dish we could've done without.
author: Stefanie K.

description: Loved this place.  I had lunch here with my good friend, Linda the Great. How great is she?  She's so great, she makes Alexander the Great, look like Alexander the Wuss!  The chips were homemade and we both agreed, the best chips we eva had!  The guacamole was wonderful.  I had the fish tacos and her Greatness had the carne asada tacos, and we were not disappointed.  The service was great, but the menu is a little limited.  The music was outrageous.  They played oldies the whole time we were there, and her Greatness and I love oldies.  "Sherry Sherry baby. Sherry Sherry baby.  Sheeeeeeeeeery can you come out tonight?  Come come, come out toniiiiiiiight."
author: Blondie R.

description: Had a birthday party of over 20 people and the staff decided to disclose that the u only take 4 credit cards at a time. Service was slow and we took a $38 pre-fix menu where the food wasn't even enough to feed everyone. It took 3 staff members to bring back the check after the payment was provided. Just to let you know i highly do not reccomend this location for the lack of communication and quality. Maybe a 2 person table is doable but do not bring a large party to the restaurant. The only good thing was the beer (not the margarita!). The only reason why they deserve a single star, otherwise 0.
author: Oreo B.

description:
My heart was broken when we weren't able to get a table with Mama.  Mama had better things to do than to take 6 yelpers under her wings. But thanks to Don Pisto, he came to the rescue.

He brought us so much joy from the bottomless pit to the....

bottomless mimosas....
bottomless margaritas....
and of course....

bottomless sangarias....

oh joy joy joy joy... need I say more...

Actually I do!  Their chorizo, to their breakfast burritos along with their omelettes are just amazing.  This is one brunch that is unforgettable for its food, hospitality and the bottomless cocktails and company.

Although it was pretty loud, it is such a great place for a get together to enjoy Don Pisto's ever amazingly brunch menu along with the cocktails.

He has made my day and I want more and more and more....
author: Angela L.

description: Came here for a friend's low key bachelorette.   There were 10 of us and the waitress was amazing. She was helpful and friendly.  They kept our drinks (including water) filled and overall just attentive.   The food was really good.  I dropped a star bc I didn't think the alcoholic drinks were anything special (wine beer sangria and margaritas were the options)  we had pitchers of margaritas - and I don't think these are from scratch.
author: Madhuri K.

description: Love this place! Food is delicious and environment is super fun. They are ALWAYS packed so be sure to get there before the rush (especially on the weekends). If you do get there and have to wait, try to score a seat at the bar order a pitcher of margaritas and have some chips and salsa (which is on point) and then the wait won't feel so long and it is totally worth it. One of my favorite things I get every time I have gone is the Mexican Sashimi, it is amazing! I have also had the enchiladas and mussels & chorizo and those are great too.
author: Samantha J.

description: Went to a birthday gathering during the evening of November 15th. We had a group of 12 that ate downstairs it was super hot, no circulation whatsoever! . Food was okay nothing to rave about, but nothing to run from either.  Service was not the greatest. I was glad to have  had great company with me  to distract me
author: Stephanie M.

description: Everything about my experience here was great! The food was delicious - me and my group ordered family style so we got to try a little bit of everything. And the red sangria was really good! The best part about this experience was how they treated us for my birthday. They gave everyone at our table a shot, a coconut cupcake with a lit candle, and gave me an extra red sangria - all on the house. Can't wait to be back :)
author: Samantha H.

description:
Delicioussss.

Tortilla soup might have been the best bowl of soup of my live.  Torilla, avocado and chicken in it.  I'm sure a ton of other spices but it was just incredibly flavourful.  

Tacos (Carne Pollo) I had were excellent too.  Even the tortilla chips were great.
author: Mike W.

description:
I'll be honest, this restaurant's health score (67 out of 100) worries me. I've been to grimy Chinese restaurants in the past with higher health scores than this. It's especially alarming given how nice and clean Don Pisto's looks in person.

I'll give 'em credit for their margaritas, which were perfect and not too sweet. Their burger (which I heard they only serve on Wednesdays) was also incredible, and absolutely worth coming here for. The bun in particular was bready yet light -- a great complement to the tender meat patty smeared with avocado and cheese.

Unfortunately, the one taco I tried (with pineapple and pork) was very mediocre, especially for the price. 

The restaurant is charming, but not anything special. Exposed brick walls, moody art, friendly staff -- all the ingredients are there, but for some reason, I wasn't that impressed. I have high standards for expensive Mexican restaurants, and Don Pisto's just barely made the cut.
author: Tiffany W.

description: With lobster cooked in bacon fat melted like butter in my mouth tickling my taste buds. I did my happy dance with every bite while eating the pork chop. Great service that topped off my night with friends.
author: Daisy R.

description:
Came here at 5:45pm on Saturday evening and it was packed! We put our names down for a 30 minute wait. Walked over to find a full bar (there were only 4 seats). My friend had the sangria. I've had better at other places but this is the only one I know that offers bottomless sangria for $15 - awesome deal!

It's a pretty small space and we were seated once a table had finished and got the best seat in the house (mind you, this place doesn't open until 5:30pm.) We ordered the:

Mexican sashimi - salmon in a tangy ponzu like sauce w/jalapenos. Although decent, I've had the same type of dish at sushi restaurants so it was nothing new or inventive.
Ceviche - lots of seafood w/squid but a little too hot for my liking
Guacamole - couldn't stop eating it - delish!
Hamburguesa - meat patty cooked in bacon fat?! Mmmm.. :q I enjoyed the flavors but felt like it was missing an acidic element, for example instead of having plain radishes on the side - maybe pickle them/
Al pastor tacos - sweet, spicy and tender. Pretty good

All in all, a solid meal in the NB area - reservations highly recommended!
author: Cheryl P.

description: Thank you Yelp reviews because of you, we were able to try this gem! The chips and guacamole were terrific as well as the green salsa they brought before we ordered. Our party of four ordered shrimp tacos, fish tacos, Carnitas tacos, and the Huevos Rancheros! Everyone loved their meals! The waitress was great and very helpful. And the environment was super cool. Thoroughly enjoyed the entire experience!
author: Patricia T.

description:
Offensive service. Bad mimosas. Good food.

Our server possessed all the opposite traits of what someone in the service industry should be like. She was so rude. We were a group of 6 who all provided our credit cards at the end of our terribly serviced brunch - to which she returned to the table with 3 credit cards run and 3 credit cards in hand and said, "we have a 4 card maximum, which of these 3 cards do you want to use for the last card." - when we asked her to void all the transactions and run one card (to make paying one-another simpler), she said she wouldn't and just walked away. 

The music was so loud we could hardly hear one another. 

The food was pretty good but the service was SO bad that I can't give them more than 1 star.
author: Tiffany F.

description: I love coming to Don Pistos and I think it's a neighborhood gem. Everything on their menu is fresh and delicious, but my favorite dishes are the ceviche, carnitas and al pastor tacos, and the chorizo mussels. Oh, and don't forget their guacamole; it's one of the best guacs in town! I like their vibe and their service. Their food is worth every penny.
author: Regina L.

description:
I liked the atmosphere a lot - it felt like everyone inside was your friend...or lived in the same village or something. Ya know, old timey stuff. It's kind of dark inside though. Don Pisto's was like the "unicorn" for my roommates and I, since we've wanted to eat here zillion of times, but were always deterred by the wait time. Well, this time we beat the system by having a large group and therefore being able to make reservations! Yay!

We got free chips and green salsa to start with, which was super fresh and hot (well, the chips were. The salsa temperature was normal). The chips were those fatty kinds that have a double layer with air in between. They were also extremely accommodating and kept refilling our chips and salsa whenever we asked, and also provided multiple plates for our large table. Waitress was really friendly and joked around with us.

I got the Hamburguesa, as well as the Sangria. I like white Sangria better, so this one was kind of strong flavored for me. I liked the flavors of the Hamburguesa, but couldn't really get over how...soft the patty was. I've never had a hamburger where there wasn't some part that was hard. The Hamburguesa is like biting into a mushy meat and guac cloud. My friend said that that was how you could tell the patty was freshly made and homemade, since it was soft (he also mentioned that it's cooked in bacon grease), but I'm still not into the texture.

I was surprised that a restaurant with so many patrons and so well known for their bottomless drinks only has 1 bathroom per gender.
author: Melody L.

description:
HORRIBLE customer service.

I've been trying to call this place for a reservation change and yesterday they hung up on me. Then I emailed them, did not hear back. I called back today and they hung up on me again. Beware of going here for a party or large reservation. They are extremely rude.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: The carne asada Tacos were Good.  The meat tasted great but the tortillas were greasier than they should be.  A bit expensive at $9 a pair but everything tasted fresh
author: Alex F.

description: Don Ps! Is the place to be, after work with my girls sippin sangria. I love tacos, guac and a chill vibe. This place has it all-and so much more.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Food here is great! Came here and had:

calamari
carnitas tacos
pescado tacos 

The calamari was by far the best dish. It's not fried, it's grilled, but come on cool skewers :) The chips and salsa is also suppper tasty. What can I say? I'm simple. Sangria was yummo too. 

It's pricy though.... for the above, our bill came out to about $70 before tip.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Great food. Great service. Everything was awesome. Highly recommend. The spicy tuna taco was super spicy and super good. Also highly recommend the calamari.
author: Tim T.

description: Excellent food here.  I had the "special," which was basically like chicken fajitas topped with cheese in a huge wok-like pot.  I took half home for the next day.  I also had a margarita, but thought it was so-so.  I will definitely go back!
author: Matt T.

description:
Spot on service. Maybe because it wasn't as busy at 11pm on a Tuesday, but everything was delivered or refilled super fast.

Food itself was pretty damn good too. Guacamole was awesome and surprisingly the salsa was my favorite thing here and FREE. Tacos were pretty spicy for a white gurl like me. Pork chop is a huge portion, so share :) 

Ambience is pretty hipster but the music makes it chill.
author: Stephanie R.

description: Petes a Crazy SOB and I love him, can't say enough about that pork chop. They are always busy and packed so make sure to call ahead
author: Alex F.

description: Yum.  Came here on a Sunday night, didn't have to wait for a table, but the line got pretty long right after we were seated.  We shared the calamari starter and fish/asada tacos.  The food arrives lightning fast!  Which was perfect, since we were starving.  Flavors were really good and portions are appropriate.  We'll definitely be back again.
author: Michelle C.

description: I've never had lobster cooked liked this. It melted in your mouth and the butter sauce it came with is something I dreamed about last night. The sashimi was something that just lingered in my thoughts. Pork chops and tacos were off the cuff too. Don Pisto whoever you are I wish I could Kissto you!
author: Dan P.

description:
I worked with Michelle Cavaco on a catering order and have nothing but the best to say about her. She was exceedingly professional and helpful, and suggested the use of a third-party app to coordinate delivery of the order (as it was below Don Pisto's minimum). 

Michelle and the catering team accommodated a narrow delivery window seamlessly and the food and presentation were outstanding, as Don Pisto's always is - thank you, Michelle!
author: B A.

description:
Mexican food in North Beach?  I was a bit skeptical at first so I Yelp'd Don Pisto's when I found out my fiancé and I would be dining here.  I was so excited after reading everyone's reviews.  We were a group of 12 and luckily someone knew the owner so a large table was waiting for us upon arrival.  The bar area is very tight and gets packed quickly.  I noticed other patrons who arrived around the same time as we did and they waited over 30 mins to be seated.  Our party gathered at the bar to drink and waited for more people before we took our seat.  

I started with their Acai Berry Sangria and it was quite refreshing.  It did not include any fruits so it was a nice full glass of alcohol.  I moved to their Margarita halfway through dinner.  I wouldn't say their alcohol is strong since I had several glasses and only had a slight buzz when we left.  We had 2 pitchers of Sangria, 4 or 5 pitchers of Margaritas, and several buckets of beer.  

We ordered family style and shared everything. My faves were Al Pastor tacos, Carne Asada tacos, Shrimp tacos, and Fatty Lamb Ribs.  The Hamburguesa was huge in size and had a nice twist to the typical hamburger but I probably won't order again because there are better options.  The sashimi was fresh but the portion was a bit small.  Guac was tasty though I enjoyed the free green salsa much more. 

Do not sleep on Don Pisto's.  The food & drinks are nothing short of amazing.  We'll definitely return... hopefully for brunch.

NOTE: there's no signage out front so look for the address instead of the name.
author: Nikki C.

description:
I went to Don Pisto's on a Sunday morning at 10:30am. Still quite open (though right before Christmas, so that could be why), I had several tasty items. The salsa verde and tortilla chips were very yummy and the guacamole was fresh and simple.

I had the Heuvos Rancheros for brunch and asked for the sunny side up eggs to be made over medium (not a fan of runny whites). It was two eggs on top of a crunchy road tortilla and I liked the twist. The taste was simple and good, but enhanced with a little salsa verde and hot sauce on top. The breakfast potatoes are crispy and delicious. My friend had the Poached Eggs and Chorizo and the bite I was allowed was much more flavorful than my dish.

For a drink I enjoyed a Bloody Mary, which was spicy and salty and awesome.

Definitely give this place a try for brunch!  The price point is perfectly reasonable, the service was friendly, the restaurant clean and overall it was a worthwhile experience.
author: Abby G.

description:
My favorite taco place in San Francisco!!! 
My family from Asia are not big fans of having foreign food. 
I was praying that they would like this place.
I order almost all the dishes for 8 of us to share and they love it all. 
The tacos were delicious with the cozy environment!
Groups of party is allow at the downstairs, great for parties!
author: Tiger L.

description:
I f*cking love this place. Am I allowed to say that? Great drinks, great food, in a chill setting. We had a huge party, so they put us in the semi-private room in the back, with big picnic style tables with benches. Our server was pretty attentive and checked in with us often.

The chips here are really really good. The salsa might be a bit too spicy for my taste, but the guac is fantastic. Even though I knew I would be stuffed, I still couldn't stop. I was expecting a lot of fancy Mexican food, but was pleasantly surprised by the spread. There was sashimi, tacos, and mussels, and all were fantastic. The star, though, was the last dish we got. I'm just gonna come out and say it. Favorite pork chop ever. Yes, better than Nopa's. It sounds like blasphemy, but it's true. Super moist and flavorful...I'm drooling just thinking about it.

I hear they have a really great burger as well, so I will need to come back and check that out.
author: jon y.

description:
My beloved has been driving past this place for a long time, but had no idea what it was. Our date night consisted of a spontaneous moment where i jumped out of the car in the pouring rain to put our name on the wait list of this unknown location. The signage was very limited so, up until they called to tell me our table was ready, we had no idea the name or what to expect!

We were seated within 45 minutes of putting our name down. The table we were at was COLD. They had the door open (it got very smoky in the dining room and they opened the door to vent the place out) if you are coming on a cold night be SURE to wear something that can keep you warm if needed.

The Sangria was unfortunate, very watery, no fruit and had what I think might be soda water in it. If you are looking for a bold tasting sangria, this isn't the place for that. We switched over to a margarita and that my friends, was well worth it.

We shared the Chirizo and Mussels, what a brilliant combination! I'm a huge huge fan of mussels these were wonderful, the meat adds a good spicy to the mussel without overpowering it which impressed me, I thought for sure I wouldn't be able to taste the delicate sweetness through the intense heavy flavor but boy was I wrong.. thank goodness!

J and I also shared the pork chop and when they say pork chop, I think they mean a whole side of pork.. it was HUGE, I had never seen a pork chop that large before.. It was easily enough for two of us and then for a decent meal taken home with us as leftovers. The chop was served with a very light lime/cucumber/chili salad and in my opinion that was the best compliment to the meal as a whole. it added this soft refreshing bit that cleansed the palate. 

The menu is small, so be aware of that.

Music was strange, we walked in enjoying salsa music and it switched to pop/rap and all sorts of other things, an eclectic mix that is for sure

Minus two starts for the seating/ smoke/cold and sangria.
author: Meghan L.

description:
There are only a handful of restaurants where I tend to be a regular at, and Don Pistos is definitely on the shortlist. 

The food here is awesome. And I mean that not in a "well...it's pretty good for North Beach" kind of way, but in an "I know we just ate here last night, but tonight would be great too!" kind of way. If this was a Mexican restaurant in the Mission, it'd still be just as delicious.

I'm addicted to the salsa verde that comes with the tortilla chips. Love it, could make a meal out it, but then I'd miss out on everything else. Their fish tacos are consistently wonderful (actually spicy without even having to ask!), and tortilla soup very good too. The only thing I keep missing out on is the lobster or whole grilled fish specials, both of which I do want to try someday. 

On my very first visit, our server forgot about us...but this was completely made up for with a round of sangria on the house and a plate of churros for dessert. Loved the wacky idea to serve breakfast all day on New Year's Day-- and the food was delicious too, especially the breakfast burritos. 

One caveat, on my last visit, everything we had was just a bit too salty...I'm really hoping this was just a one-off.  We'll see.
author: Joanne G.

description:
Dear Don Pistos (you sexy hot thing you),

You got me wet off your:

*chips & salsa (free): perfectly thick tortilla chips paired with refreshingly fresh, clean green salsa w/just the right amount of heat.

*elote (special $4): slathered in butter and cotija cheese.. c'mon now, what else do you need?

*fresh catch of the day pescado tacos: slaw resting atop grilled flaky smoky fish on a bed of dbbl-layer tortilla.. juices running wild.

*porky chop ($16): tastes like some damn good pork: tender, juicy, and melt in your mouth. it's a nice hunky size, but gimme some more!! served with refreshing, crunchy coleslaw.

*hamburguesa ($9): marinatined in B-A-C-O-N. tastes like smoky bacon, reeks of porky bacon, looks like a burger. o, how do they do it? best burger contender: next to nopa. 

*sangria: tastes like cranberry juice.

*margarita: tastes like lemonade.

*grungy/cute servers-odd mix. 

*you're economical, but you know how to please like a million bucks and hit all the right spots.

thank you, can't wait for our next rendezvous. same place, same time?? maybe next time, we'll add a lil lobster to our *four play. ;)

XOXO.
author: Angela W.

description: I Came here for my birthday brunch. I did not plan this, my friends were kind enough to plan it for me, but when I arrived, instead of being given a friendly welcome, the first question I was asked was; "is my entire party here?" We are a party of 7, of course not, that would be a miracle. His response was "ok, well I'll seat you because we have other reservations we need to attend to." I instantly did not feel welcome and it was my own birthday. The waitress was so kind and very friendly. I really liked her. The food was amazing, but at the end of my brunch the same guy that "welcomed" me came up to our table to inform us that he had another reservation waiting for our table. Of the  27 years I've been alive, and granted I don't remember 3 of those years, I have never been asked to leave a table nor have been informed a reservation is waiting for our table. I will not be returning here, not because of the food, nor for the waitress, but because the host was so rude, his name is Herman. Thanks for an amazing birthday!!!
author: Rebecca M.

description:
5 stars, this is not your regular latin restaurant

If you order anything a definite must try is the Poc Chuc!!! slab of pork cooked and seared like a steak but better then any pork chop that I have ever had. I also got to sample there bacon infused burger. The burger was finely ground meat that slightly fell apart when biting into the burger it was good the bread was slightly dense not flaky decent size and delicious on every bite.

I would definitely go back for the Poc Chuc, we also sampled there shrimp taco, definitely also a must try they didn't give you the standard 3-4 smaller anorexic shrimp you get at other places they give you 6 full size shrimp on crack, the kind of shrimp you get at the fancy restaurants where they are litely seasoned and on a square white plate with a green circled line with a mint in the middle hahhaha. they offer you 2 soft tacos each containing 6 full size shrimp or prawn.

food ***** wow, definite 5 stars on the POC CHUC
price $$
service **** very helpful staff
ambiance ***** definite good spot for first time daters, small couple groups, or you can just kick it by the bar with the bartender named Kate, due to our long wait on getting a table they offered us a second Sangria on the house just for being patient. I guess the would be romantic setting, really dark inside, the kitchen is lively, flashes of fire from the stove 3 man crew in there. bar is about a 4 seater so you are up close and personal with the bartender.

I will be back for there POC CHUC!!! and possibly sample there lobster meal for 2
author: Clarence A.

description:
Fantastic place! There was a packed house when we walked in, but the host gave us the DL on who would be leaving from the bar next. We scored a seat right away, grabbed a drink from the SUPER friendly bartenders and ordered some al pastor and fish tacos, guac, and margaritas. 

Everything was the right temperature, full of flavor and excellent. I do not have a single complaint EXCEPT that I left rediculously full without eating a lot of food. I will have to return to order another small batch of awesome.
author: Trace D.

description: This was a great find while on a trip to SF! The ambiance is really cool inside- low lights, early 2000s hip hop blasting, and fairly crowded for Sunday night. The al pastor tacos were definitely a hit, but we also had the Mexican ceviche, oysters, and fish tacos which were all delicious. A few other commenters have complained about the margaritas being made with wine, but it's actually agave wine. A little Wikipedia research showed that it's pretty similar to tequila and a more authentic way to make margaritas. Overall, we loved it here and would come back if we lived closer!
author: Rachel T.

description:
Just stopped in for drinks at the bar. The bar area is small and crowded, but it cleared out later as parties were seated.

This place is one of the few I've found with white sangria, and it was great.

Next time I'll have to stop in for food.
author: James T.

description:
Stopped in with the Mrs while we were in town for our honeymoon and walking around the area. It was around 1:30, so we ate off the brunch menu. We ordered chips and guac as an appetizer, and the guacamole did not disappoint.

They have bottomless margaritas/sangria/mimosas for $17 a person (for 1.5 hours) and it was well worth the price. All three were excellent, and the servers were constantly refilling our glasses.

We both ordered the carne asada tacos, and they were unbelievable. Some might be put off by the two tacos for $9, but the quality was off the charts. Not to mention the endless chips and salsa to go with it.

I would recommend this place to anyone. The service is second-to-none, the food is excellent, and the drinks are aces.
author: Ken E.

description:
Overall this place is pretty good. The food is tasty and fresh, service is good. My only complaint really is that when we ordered the ceviche it did not come with chips. I had to order a basket of chips for $3. I live in San Diego & we have our share of Mexican restaurants here.  I have never in my life had to buy chips at a mexican restaurant, and I can get over that, but if I order ceviche it should come with chips.

Other than that the place was cool, pretty hip & trendy so its busy but good for them. It really bothers me that I had to buy chips with my ceviche though, thats pretty lame. If it weren't for that I would have given 4 stars
author: Adam M.

description: Had a great dinner ! The guacamole was so amazing we ordered two and the enchiladas were really good. We had the grilled calamari which was cooked to perfection and very tender. All this with a pitcher of margaritas for under $100.00. Great food and good value. Service was great had 3 plus servers asking how the food was and if we needed anything several times.  We will be back for sure.
author: James P.

description: We came here on a Sunday evening and were seated immediately. Our waitress recommended a few dishes and they did not disappoint. We decided to mix it up and ended up trying the fish tacos, tacos al pastor, enchiladas, and the pork chop. Definitely recommend this place!
author: Erika R.

description:
My wife and I went to SF on our honeymoon (woohoo!) and had Friday brunch at Don Pisto's while we were there. It was the best decision of our married life thus far. 

Our food was delicious, our server was incredibly attentive - not once allowing us to run out of bottomless mimosas or sangria, and there was no wait to be seated. The chips, salsa, and guac were particularly delicious. We literally scraped the bowl clean. Did we spend well over $100? Yes. Was it worth it? Definitely!

Bonus points for our waitress scooping up the little lizard that had snuck in and escorting him outside in a napkin. Too cute!
author: Alaina C.

description:
We tried Don Pisto's once before and the hostess told us that it wasn't likely that we could get a table. This time around, we came on a double date and didn't actually expect any openings on a Thursday night, but miraculously, we were seated right away.

The four of us shared the shrimp, fish and carnitas tacos and an order of their pork chops. We also got some guac to start. I liked that the tortilla chips were freshly fried and unsalted. The green salsa was very fresh tasting.

The food arrived in quick succession. In terms of the tacos, my favorite was the shrimp and (surprisingly) the carnitas, I liked the least. I thought overall, the tacos were nothing special nor innovating. I'll take a taco from a taco truck over these any day of the week. The pork chop was well seasoned, but just slightly overcooked. 

The sangrias were pretty tasty. I liked the rustic decor and open kitchen, but the food was very average, at least in my humble opinion. I don't quite understand what all the fuss was all about. The ingredients were higher in quality than most Mexican places but I don't think it was cooked with heart and without that, the food simply don't have that homey feel to it.
author: Alice W.

description: This place lived up to the reviews. The fish tacos were awesome and the guacamole was great. The micheladas were really spicy.   He sat down in the lower area for bigger groups they got us right in and the service quickly and our waiter was very knowledgeable on the menu.
author: Scott L.

description: I go here probably once every 2-3 weeks. Always a good meal and fine service.  A bit noisy, but still a great spot.
author: Brian K.

description: Awesome Mexican spot! It's quite small and worth the minor wait I had. It was about 20 min but we were able to sit at the bar and start appetizer and margaritas. The bar isn't big but it's definitely cute and the bartender was so nice. We basically started with guac and chips which were super tasty! I had the shrimp tacos which were so delicious. The tacos are small street-style but most of the menu looked great. I liked the location and overall ambiance, as well. A place I would go back for sure!!! Margs were also pretty satisfying.
author: Priya S.

description:
I'm baffled that this restaurant has 4.5 stars. Service and cleanliness was great. Food was average at best. I consumed almost all their taco offerings and kept asking myself why are there so many people at this restaurant. I was underwhelmed and frustrated that Yelpers gave it 4.5 stars. 

Summary: If you want good food, go elsewhere. If you only seek a clean place to eat, then go to Don Pistos.
author: Raymond R.

description: So I'm gonna keep this review short, mainly cause my iPhone battery is under 10% (hashtag sadface) Anyways... the food was really good, 4 stars minimum, possibly 4.5. Here's the problem, SO OVER PRICED. 6 mini tacos for $38?! No thx. Then I ordered a bottle of beer for $5, ok that's reasonable, but she brought me out a can, ummmm... is this a frat party? Won't be back.
author: Brian S.

description:
Don Pisto's deserves its near-5-star rating.  The food is incredible and the service is great. The only downside is a function of its popularity: expect a wait if you come during a busy period. We went during senior citizen hour, ~6pm on a Sunday, and by the time we left the place was packed and people were spilling into the street waiting.

I highly recommend the tuna tacos, the enchiladas, the ceviche and the meatballs. The plates are pretty small, so we ordered 5 dishes for 3 people to split. All were amazing, and the drinks are pretty awesome too. Whether you are a tourist or a local, you should definitely check this place out.
author: K C.

description: Ok so I was curious how a Mexican food place got 4.5 stars and now I know why. Flavors bustling in your mouth like a volcano erupting for the Senora Taco with Shrimp, the carnitas tacos were juicy and the fish taco was lightly and I mean lightly battered and tender. The guacamola needed no extra salt or pepper, it came out perfect.  The chips, well their chips and darn good. The sangria was not too sweet and perfect amount of sparkle. I would recommend this place to everyone and will definitely be back. Not to mention the atmosphere was a perfect Sunday Funday and the staff was friendly and service was excellent
author: candice c.

description:
I really don't understand the hype.  I had a birthday brunch here in the private room downstairs.  The event coordinator was awesome!  The positives end there.

The negatives:
-WEAK bottomless mimosas and sangria
-BEYOND TINY food portions.  When they brought out a serving of tacos, I thought it was for one.  But it was for FOUR!  Ridiculous
-The price per person for a preset menu is only $30.  Sounds cheap right?  But you get no food at all.  So in reality, it is a major rip off.

I don't get the glowing reviews.  Maybe the service is not the same for a private party.  But nevertheless, I would not recommend this place and I most definitely won't be back.
author: K V.

description:
Don Pisto's MIGHT be my favorite restaurant in San Francisco, and I've been to A LOT. But the simplicity of their fresh food has never disappointed me. I've had a variety of things here now. Oysters, chicken tacos, pork chop, lobster burrito for two (OH MY GOD holy best thing I ever ate), and even their chips and guac are delish.

Don Pisto's is one of those places I take all of my out of town friends to impress them. People think you can't be blown away by Mexican food (myself included), but this place is a sure winner every time. If the lobster burrito is ever on the menu, you HAVE to order it. Just shut up and give them all your money.

Cons: Stronger/cheaper margs plz. Then you'll never be able to get rid of me.
author: Michelle N.

description:
Don Pisto's is my answer to Big Star in Chicago. Minus the patio I guess. For those of you not getting the analogy, Big Star is amazing. Hence I'm telling you Don Pisto's ain't too shabby either.

The Don's top 4 accomplishments, in order:
1. Delicious Tacos
2. Bottomless Mimosas/Sangria/Margaritas
3. Great brunch items for around $10 each
4. A scene that's cool without having to tell you so

Only downside: this place is every bit as popular as it should be, so on the weekend expect to wait a while.
author: Alex H.

description:
Brunch here is bueno! Came here on a weekend about thirty minutes after they opened and got seated immediately. I have to say, I almost walked right by the restaurant because there was no clear signage in front, only a little sign on the door but something told me to stop and walk in. The restaurant had low lighting but it really set the tone of laid-back atmosphere of the place.  

I had to try the hamburguesa and of course, the bottomless mimosas. They were serving pineapple mimosas that day which were balanced perfectly with fresh bits of pineapple. The hamburguesa was actually not that appealing upon its arrival to the table as it was just topped with guacamole. However, I bit into it and the patty was moist, juicy and had pure bacon flavor goodness. My friend ordered the huevos rancheros and although I didn't get to try her dish, it looked really fresh and tasty.

Our waitress was really sweet and stopped by our table to re-fill our glasses every time she saw our mimosas running low. I hope to return soon to try their watermelon mimosas which I hear are just as good as their pineapple ones.
author: Maya S.

description: This place was the loudest restaurant I have ever been to!!! Lots of 20-30 somethings on a Sunday morning during brunch hours. My husband and I literally had to yell across the table to hear each other. Really great quality Mexican food, but I thought it was overpriced for the portion size. I ordered the Pork Tamale and Egg for $11. It was tiny (a little smaller than my hand) but tasty and their chips and salsa were yummy too! I also ordered a Michelada but it was so salty that I only managed to drink 1/4 of it. Our waitress noticed  that most of my drink was left and comped it -- which was really nice of her (we didn't even ask her to). So I would say if you are looking for a fun, lively atmosphere you'll like this place, but if you are expecting a relaxing brunch + conversation go somewhere else.
author: Brittany L.

description:
My friend told us we were going to this "little taco place down the street" and I totally thought we were going to some hole in the wall taqueria. This is definitely not that. 

This place was pretty hopping for a Saturday night at midnight. It is EXTREMELY loud inside but I loved the ambiance. Its really dark inside and while there were candle things on every table, none of them were lit. 

We had waters and chips and salsa set on our table immediately. The chips looked like they were made in house and the salsa was just okay. It tasted too much like lime for my liking. I got the red snapper tacos even though I wasn't the least bit hungry. My friends ordered the carnitas and another ordered the ceviche. The waitress explained how the kitchen was extremely small and the food doesn't come out at the same time or something. It was hard to hear her but I don't think it was a big deal. Haha. The ceviche ended up coming out last which my friend said was really spicy. 

The fish was cooked perfectly and it might just be because I wasn't hungry but I thought the tacos were just okay. The portions look small but the tacos are extremely filling. They all came with radishes and a pepper on the side. Neither of which I tried. 

Service was fantastic. We had a great waitress. I think it ended up being around $60 for 4 entrees and two beers. 

Oh and right after this we ended up chasing a hobo into Chinatown after he stole money out of an ATM after my friend left her card in the machine. Haha ohhhh North Beach =D
author: Tiffany V.

description: Wow. I think I would move to San Francisco just so I can order the Pollo Alambre every night. Yah, it was that good.
author: Chance T.

description: Found this gem on the recommendation of a waiter from another Resturant.  We arrived about 615 so no waiting.  Awesome sangria and lobster tacos!!!!  Don't expect typical or texmex!  Trendy and hipster!
author: Terrie F.

description:
Service
- 5/5 for the entire staff. The hostess was friendly, bartender super accommodating and fast, and the waitress attentive, polite, and knowledgeable about the menu.

- Water service is excellent

Food
- TACOS: I had the snapper, al pastor, and beef tacos. Besides the presentation on the dish, the tacos are OK IMO (especially when they're priced at $8 - $9). The al pastor was the most flavorful out of the three, but in all honesty, I mostly tasted the corn tortillas with every bite.

- CHICKEN TORTILLA SOUP: This was delicious and I would highly recommend it if you enjoy soups.

Atmosphere
- Excellent spot for a date, but the Mexican style club music can get a little old.

Overall
- I would really rate them as 3.5, but seeing how we have an abundance of tacos in the Mission, Don Pisto's are really just OK. If I were to go back again, I would definitely order one of their specials like the lobster dish.
author: Alfonzo J.

description: I was on the hunt for good hearty Mexican food with my friend Jess and found this amazing local hangout. We got tortilla soup, which feeds 2 and Carne Asada tacos. Great combination of flavor and spice and accommodating service! #Moosh
author: Olga K.

description:
Tried the lobster ... this dish, they say, is good for two.  Wish though that given it is marketed towards two, they'd give you an even number of tortillas.  Was a good serving though and we were sated.

We also had the salmon sashimi - yum!  Will be back...fun spot to drop by after work.  Attire is casual, we easily got seats at 6:15 and by the time we finished there were about 3 couples standing outside waiting for a table the place had filled up nicely, even the bar area. Service was great, not too overbearing yet very available anytime we needed anything they just happened to come by to ask.
author: Janelle C.

description:
bottomless. brunch. cocktails. 

need i say more? for like $17 bucks, you could choose to get either a mimosa, sangria or margarita and find it magically replete throughout your meal. they even lets us choose any of the 3 for our refills, cause they're awesome. the food is alright, everything is around $10 bucks but the portions aren't that big. got the chorizo and poached eggs but found it a little too oily. my friend's mushroom and serrano chile omelette was better and more substantial. doesn't matter, though. the food still tasted GREAT by the end.
author: Rhea N.

description:
Small, small tacos. 

I was so excited to try Don Pistos but I left disappointed. I knew there would be a wait and was told 45 mins for 4 people by the man host yet there were several empty tables. They dont take reservations and they dont seat incomplete parties and it seemed like they didnt want to seat anyone. There were literally 5 open tables and a bunch of people waiting yet nobody could sit. Lame set up.

Onto the food: the portions are TINY. The calamari app was good, the tacos were great and the guacamole was fantastic. But for $9 for 2 tacos (carnitas or carne asada), they need to be worth it and they weren't. They had 2 tablespoons of meat on a small corn tortilla. I also tried the fish tacos which were awesome (they're grilled!) but again, a really small piece of cod.

Don't think that I can afford to be jipped here again when there are other Mexican spots that can stretch the dollar! (T-lish, Tropisueno and Tacko it is!)
author: Joy A.

description: No way this place shouldn't be a 5 star, EVERYTHING is delicious. Tamales are amazing, tacos are amazing, and the pork chop....oh. my. God! Simply great authentic Mexican food.
author: Juan G.

description: Great burrito, and mango margarita. A tad pricy for Mexican food, and the tacos are pretty tiny, but the food is definitely quality! Friendly service and they are willing to give recommendations for first-timers on the popular items. Great stop if in North Beach!
author: Carissa W.

description:
I have been looking for a good sit down Mexican restaurant in SF since the only one I like thus far is Tropisueno. Don Pisto's is now another favorite of mine. 

I went without a reservation on a Sunday and was seated within 10 minutes. I was pleased to find out they had Sunday Drink Specials and ordered Sangria for $3. I normally don't like Sangria because it's too sweet but this Sangria was tasty and cheap! Hard to pass up.

My table ordered the chicken enchiladas, steak and eggs, and shrimp tacos. I would recommend ordering a few things for the table and sharing. The tacos are definitely a lighter choice than the main dishes. Next time, I want to get the tortilla soup because it looked awesome.

Overall, the food is great and it's inexpensive. The ambiance is great for a young group - it's dark and sexy. The only downside is it's extremely hard to find parking in North Beach.
author: Jenna Q.

description: Loved it. Split fish tacos (flounder) and shrimp taco, both awesome!!!  Great ambiance, kind of loud, but lots of fun and awesome service and food!!!
author: Grant P.

description:
Let me start off by saying that I am not really into Mexican cuisine. I don't typically mind it, but I rarely find myself craving it and never seek out restaurants on my own. This restaurant has changed all that... 

A co-worker recommended it, saying it was his favorite restaurant in the city -  which is quite the claim! I decided to try it out one night while not feeling in the mode for anything specifically. Now I feel like an addict, eagerly inviting any & all friends just to have an excuse to go back to Don's more often!

Food Highlights:
- Mexican sushi
- Mussels
- Shrimp tacos

Prices are what one should expect for the city and offer a bit of a flexibility. On a more lavish night you can share entrees, or if you're feeling like a cheaper bite you can easily fill up on tacos (and chips & salsa!).

The wait can be a bit long - typically around dinner the waits are 45+ minutes, but they'll take down your phone # so you can take a leisurely stroll in Washington Square park or go get a drink at one of the dozens of nearby bars.

Lastly, the seating is optimized for larger groups with a few big family-style tables and mostly four-tops. This means big groups come in and it GETS LOUD! If you're in a twosome / on a date, you may be seated at a family-style table with another twosome or small group - by no means a bad thing but  can make it a bit difficult to hear your conversation over all the chatter.
author: daria f.

description:
Flavorful and light yet fulfilling, Nick is an additional bonus to the entire experience.
ThAnk you Pete&Nico;D
Totes Faves!
author: yvette c.

description: Solid experience (more of a 3.5) expected a bit better.  They no longer have the ribeye on the menu which is what i was planning to order.  Sangria was good; chips and salsa also good; pork chop was ok (far from excellent).  No desert which is an annoyance.
author: RM J.

description: Great tacos, great sangria, great service, great prices! The ambiance was fun, exclusive, dark, romantic and delicious. The wait wasn't terrible for a Saturday night, which was great. We put our names/numbers down and went to a nearby bar for drinks first. The guac is smooth and flavorful.
author: Mary Walker B.

description: Great find in North Beach, with truly amazing food and drinks!  The menu includes the usual soft tacos, but also includes dishes such as pork chops which have been marinated and grilled...fantastic place for sharing a wonderful meal with friends.
author: Erik B.

description: Had the Pork Tamale and eggs and it was amazing, the tamale was soft and steamy 100 % percent lovely done.
author: Fredy S.

description:
I only review my favorite places and this is defintely one of them! When you walk up to the brick exterior with three little red lights, you know you're in for one delicious dinner! 

As soon as this place opened in the neighborhood (a few years back, I think), my dad and I checked it out and we were hooked! I probably come here at leastt 6 times a month when I'm home :). 

Quick overview:
-intimate ambiance 
-quick and friendly service
-some darn tasty food
-can't go wrong with the camarones diablas, the fish tacos, or really ANY of the choices!
author: Maya A.

description: Great food! Stumbled upon this place while traveling on business in San Francisco and couldn't have been happier with a Monday night restaurant.  Chips are homemade and their salsa is on point.
author: Theresa P.

description: Took 30 minutes to sit down then another 20 to get a water down margarita (Im 36 never before had tasted something so gross) the food was par ... the other 1100 people that made a review must haven't had a lot of experience eating Mexican food
author: Reid R.

description:
I'm honestly not too sure what the fuss is about this place. I tried to call ahead for my group of four and thankfully talked to a nice guy that said he would "take care of me". That was great and all, except I noticed when we arrived, that he was running the restaurant more like a night club. I'm pretty sure we got seated anyway in the order that we arrived in, so nothing that fancy or special there. I did hear him mention to another couple that it was an hour and a half wait...at 9 pm on a Saturday. I couldn't believe people were still eating that late!

When we got inside it smelled delicious, albeit, was super hot! We really enjoyed the margaritas but were pretty surprised to see the less then extensive menu. For a Mexican place, I have seen hole in the wall places with more food than this place offered. 

The waitress was very nice and attended to us rather quickly. She answered all of our questions and I would definitely give them a thumbs up on service.

Everyone in the group got tacos of some sort. Usually when people order a taco "meal" there are three small ones. This place only delivered two, and they were tiiiinnnyyy! Seriously, my boyfriend took his down in two bites, but probably could have managed one. They were also super greasy which is not my preference. I thought $11 for two tacos was pretty expensive, but I also do recognize the area and apparently the hype.

All in all, I don't think I'd visit again having had the "experience". The food was good, but it was tiny portions, and it's not really worth the wait, especially in SFO where you can find just as great of places that are cheaper and you don't have to "know somebody" to get in!
author: Rebecca R.

description: place is kinda hidden but once you find it its worth it. they have bottomless mimosas and margaritas. menu inst huge but it has enough of a variety for everyone to chose something on. we found the place online from good reviews and it was everything we expected. customer service was good as well. 9 drinks  and 3 food orders for $150bucks not too bad. i will deff come back one day.
author: Alonzo T.

description: Food's good, service is okay but I wish I can just give them soundproofing panels. I've never had to yell out to people over brunch.
author: Sarah E.

description:
My girls and I begin our semi monthly all day drinking binge here at the Bottomless Mimosa, Margarita, and Sangri Brunch.  The drinks special is reasonably priced and they are not weak drinks at all. The waitress keeps em coming too, I've never had to motion to her for another drink. (I feel like such an alchy lol) 

I usually get the Chorizo Breakfast Burrito and it is YUMMY. I also LOVE their guacamole, I find myself just shoveling it in.

I give this place 5 stars because I love the waiters and waitresses, the bartenders are cool, the owner is cool, the cooks smile from their little area as they work hard to get us our food fast, and the random music that plays is also COOL!
author: De La Sol S.
