description: Awesome vibe with the 90s hip hop and R&B. Food was delicious and can't get over their guacamole. I want to jar that stuff forever and eat it everyday. One of my favorite Mexican restaurants...and I am from southern ca.
author: Alexa N.

description:
We had never eaten at Don Pistos, but had heard great things from so many people that we decided to give their catering a shot for my husbands birthday party. 

I worked with Michelle on our order and while It wasn't the biggest order, we were treated as a priority from the beginning throughout the day of the party. Michelle always made time to answer (or call me back in a timely manner) and explain any questions or help me decide what would be best for our event.

All of our guests LOVED the food, most went back for seconds and thirds and we STILL have food leftover. My husband had a great time and we can't wait to use them again for our next party!
Also...I'm a BIG TIME guacamole lover and their guacamole is seriously the best I've ever had. 

Also, I have Celiac Disease and can't eat Gluten...EVERYTHING we ordered was Gluten Free, and none of our guests were the wiser...Yum Yum Yum...Win all around! :)
author: Evelyn D.

description: Bottomless mimosas is great but other items are a bit expensive.  Very good service tho.
author: Mason W.

description: SO good. i had every taco on the menu and their guacamole, and i was in heaven...and full!
author: Michele A.

description:
Free margs while waiting for a table? I don't hate it. People often ask where to bring friends who are in town for a "fun, delicious dinner with good drinks". I don't hesitate and recommend Don Pistos. Everything is amazing-- the guac is unparalleled, margs are delicious, etc etc. Standouts in my mind are the fish tacos, mexican sashimi, and the hamburguesa (grilled in bacon grease, simple bun and only Guac on the burger-- trust me, it's all you need).

Love you Pete, keep up the delicious work.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
Liked the atmosphere! And it opens late. A good spot to grab a late night dinner.

Sangria is awesome here. Tacos are delicious. Also had Sunday brunch here once, and it was delicious as well. Quite interesting brunch menu, simple but tasty.
author: Olivia H.

description: This place used the be my go to place whenever I had people that wanted to explore SF. Came to this place 2 hours ago and I am so angry that I had to go on Yelp right away. Put my name down and the host told me it would be 30mns until we are seated. This is a Wednesday night and the place is not even busy. After over an hour, we see people who put their names down after us being seated. I don't say anything. My boyfriend ( who was really eager to try this place) walks up to the host and asks him how long until we are seated, he says we are next. A table clears and we wait, and wait. Then I walk up to him and ask him if we could have that table since it is empty and he says " im sorry it's for a bigger group". The table is for 4 and I've seen them make 2 groups share a table like that before. So we decided to walk out. I am never coming back to this place again. And thank you Don Pisto's for treating me like shit.
author: Olivia S.

description: Great, cozy and very friendly place. Loved the sangria and tacos. Perfect place for special occasions, get together or just to chill.
author: Ekaterina V.

description: Very good. I would make it a bit less spicy because the flavor is already there. AND ITS DELICIOUS!
author: Maen M.

description: My husband & I flew in late last night for the weekend and were starving! We like to be non-touristy tourists but we're staying in Fishermans where where the food options are less than stellar and definelty meant for tourists. Luckily Yelp led us to this cozy restaurant with exposed brink and ambient lighting that was an easy 15 minute walk out of FW and into a nearby SF neighborhood crawling with locals. EVERYTHING WE ORDERED WAS AMAZING!! The mussels were huge and a meal all their own even though we ordered it as an appetizer. The special was a Chicken Alamadar which was delicious! Note: They DO NOT serve tequila so don't come here expecting a margarita, but the sangria was an excellent alternative. We will definelty seek this place out again the next time we are in the Bay Area.
author: Michelle M.

description:
I don't have much to add to the discussion but I do love this place.  I'd stick to the pork chop, squid, ceviche and the mussels.

The tacos are great as well, but I think the pork chop is the reason I keep coming back and the mussels with the red sauce are extremely flavorful.

Getting a reservation can be a bit difficult and if you arrive on the early side on certain evenings the pork chop may not be on the menu because it needs to brine for 48 hours.
author: E L.

description:
Really good. For sure a cut above your normal Mexican place. Their green salsa is really nice. Just enough heat to get your attention but also tons of fresh flavor. Nice house made chips, almost pita-ish. The guacamole is super creamy and delish. I had the pork chop. It's a) huge and b) fantastic. Great char on the outside but just still pink on the inside. So, safe but super juicy. The cucumber salad was a nice surprise. I expected it to be a waste of space. But it really had a lot of flavor.

Interesting music when we were there. Old school gangster rap. But it was made it a little extra fun.

Great helpful wait staff. 

Definitely recommend.
author: Jon T.

description:
Rating: 3.5.  Visited on a Thursday night.  Our tab was the following:

1 sangria
1 michelada
1 guacamole and chips
1 order of two tacos al pastor
1 pork chop

Total: $53.29.

Sangria was weak, full of ice, and lacked any fruit.  Michelada lacked spices and peppers to give it a rounded flavor.   Chips were good though guacamole needed salt, some pepper, and a kick (throw some diced jalapenos in there).  Yes, the two al pastor tacos were on the smaller side but they were the best items we ordered that night.  The al pastor is also good when compared to traditional Mexican restaurants of high quality.  Pork chop was unevenly cooked, a little too much of the glaze on the side that was undercooked but it was a huge piece of meat. Don Pisto's is not a place I'm going to go out of my way to eat at but may give it another chance if a friend wants to go to it.
author: F.D. R.

description:
Been here a few times and keep forgetting to review it!

It is always great to find a late night spot! Came here a few weeks back when my cousin was in town and stopped by Don Pisto's at 11:30pm to get some dinner. He had a late work event and I was actually at an awesome Yelp event until pretty late. 

The place was relatively empty except for a few people at the bar and a couple tables so the service was friendly and fast. Unfortunately, they had ran out of a few of the dishes since we came so late which was a bummer, but still had enough options for us to order.

Personally, I had the fish tacos which were REALLY good. The fish was not fried (which is key!) and the slaw provided the perfect tartness. Even after a 5 course meal, I happily ate both of these. :) We also had the guacamole appetizer and may I say, the guac is solid. Super fresh and clear that they had just made it for us moments after ordering. 

I'll definitely be back to Don Pisto's for all my late night needs. I haven't tried their brunch yet but given the reviews, I think I'll be going pretty soon!
author: Raina B.

description:
I expected more from Don. He seems to have amazing reviews; afterall, you don't come by an average 4.5 stars with that many reviews often. I don't know, though...I.don't.know. 

The ceviche was good. A-ok worthy. The tacos were also good. A-ok worthy. The service was good. The ambiance was good. You catch my drift. Everything was fine... good, even. Four and a half stars, worthy, though?! An average two hour wait? Are they slipping crack in other people's food and we just missed that batch? 

I don't know.
author: Julia N.

description: I loved this place and their chicken tortilla soup was outstanding .
author: Chahat S.

description: My girlfriend and i checked this place out on our vacation in san francisco cause the other nearby areas had lines out their doors that we didn't care to wait for. We still had to wait 30 min for a table but they will take your phone number and call you when you have a table ready. This let us go visit the nearby park and cathedral while we waited. The location is pretty loud which for breakfast was a bit to much for us but in the end the food was amazingly good. I had the breakfast burrito which i would recommend to everyone. The service was good and quick. The ascetics were mediocre. Price was decent.
author: Brandon S.

description: What an amazing flavor, super fresh, friendly staff. I got the fish tacos and the flavor I can't describe, but I'm telling you, my mouth is watering just to think about our last dining experience there, definitively will be back there on our next SF visit. I wanted to eat try them all, but the portions are just perfect, so I'll have to do it one visit at a time.
author: Jairo B.

description: This place is the bomb! Good eats, good music, good vibes. Best guac in the city and a great brunch spot offering bottomless.
author: Tristan d.

description: The food here is good, but the ambience on a Sunday is very noisy. It seems like a college hotspot full of 21 to 23 year-olds, no doubt thanks to a good deal on Bottomless Margaritas. My husband and I are a little old for the scene, but enjoyed our shrimp tacos and breakfast burrito. Service was good, but a little distracted as could be expected for how busy it was. They do have an excellent michelada.
author: Gab M.

description:
It's a shame that I haven't reviewed this place yet, because truly, I'm a Don Pisto's fan fo sho.  It's one of my top-ranking go-to spots in my hood, and I make sure I eat here at least once a week.

Like many have said already, I never would have noticed the place if I hadn't walked past it tens of times before leaning my head in.  The best sounds always come out from the doors -- the kinds of sounds that lead one to believe that everyone's having a good time!  So, one day, I bit.

And I've continued to bite for months, through most of the menu.  My new favorite is the chorizo and mussels -- very delectable and satisfying!  The tortilla soup is crazy good (especially with the large chunks of avocado).  When I'm feeling like tacos, I go straight for the al pastor (and all that roasted pineapple!).  When I'm lucky enough to make it for brunch, I always order the tacos sonora -- hey Pete, are you going to offer this on the normal menu anytime soon?  I'd order it!  I wash it down with either a great Mexican beer or a Mexican Coke with lime and I'm easily on the road to Extreme Dinner Contentment.

Great food, excellent service, unique setting and local flavor... win, win, win and win.  And I'm heading there for dinner right now...  you should too.
author: Adam E.

description:
Bottomless mimosas that you can swap out with sangria or margaritas? Ay caramba! I'm always on the lookout for bottomless alcohol options on Sunday mornings and this place did not disappoint. They have food too:-) I especially like the Chorizo & Poached Eggs and the Huevos Rancheros.

The place is small and they don't take reservations, so be prepared to wait a bit. Totally worth it!
author: Julie T.

description:
Ok so I went here last night with a group of friends that live in the city -- it came highly recommended.

I really loved the ambiance, except our food took FOREVER to come out and didn't even come out at the same time because of a big party that came in downstairs. To ease our anger, our waitress brought us free shooters that were on the house, also they did end up taking off all of the tacos on our bill, so that was really nice. That's how customer service should be done.

Anyway, I really loved the inside and the margaritas were very yummy. The only thing is is the plates they serve are on the tiny side but packed with flavor and the guac was simply to die for.

Overall, I really enjoyed and was very impressed with the way they handled their mistake. 

If you're looking for a hip place to eat on a Friday or Saturday night, I would go here.
author: Lilly F.

description:
Some of the best tacos I've ever eaten. Ever. 

The only complaint I have about this place is that they don't take reservations. However, I do recommend that you come here for an earlier dinner to avoid waiting. My boyfriend and I arrived at Don Pisto's at around 7pm, and only had to wait about 20 minutes to be seated. Not bad at all! Especially since we had sangria and margaritas at the bar while waiting.

Chips and guac are to die for. Best taco: Al Pastor. Hands down. The camarones tacos are amazing as well.

Cool vibe, good music (90s rap, what more could you ask for?), all around amazing place to dine. Must go!
author: Chloe G.

description: Amazing Mexican place! It was a bit hard to find as a tourist because it didn't really have a sign outside but we were persistent and it paid off. Small place but the atmosphere is awesome. We ended up sitting at the bar and sharing drinks and food with the other patrons while chatting with the bartender who introduced us to all the kitchen staff and made recommendations. Everything we tried was phenomenal I will return next time I am in the area and I highly recommend anyone else to give it a try too.
author: Miranda R.

description:
If you greet me with sangria and margarita, the odds are high that I'll like you. I like you, Don Pisto's. First of all, the main dining room isn't that large. For the people who just dropped in and expect to be seated in a reasonable amount of time... on the weekend... in San Francisco... just... no. Think, people. Think. It's not going to happen to and to fault the restaurant when reservations are possible... well, that just doesn't make a lot of sense. Chastising out of the way...

What impressed me the most about DP's (heh) wasn't the food, although it ranged from decent to pretty good (I didn't partake in the lobster taco extravaganza; I was trying to be cost-conscious). What left such a positive impression on me was the service. You know that study that says that service is the crucial element in a dining experience and that people will come back and recommend a resto with okay food and excellent service over one with stellar food and crappy service? It's true. It's 100% true. I came here with an unwieldy group of loud eaters and drinkers. Not only did our waitress handle us with a smile, she was on top of orders, drinks, plates, and silverware the entire time. I was impressed. Whereas I, likely, would have been chain-smoking out back if faced with our motley crew, she smiled, joked and navigated our table with the ease of a consummate professional. For her alone, I would come back and recommend (with reservations for a definite seating) it to others. However, since man can't live on service alone (heh), I've gotta tell you to try the shrimp tacos and al pastor tacos. The pollo asado is pretty tasty, as well -- even for those folks who recoil at the thought of ordering a chicken dish when going out to/for dinner. But, truthfully, everything tastes better with a belly full of sangria AND margarita, so be sure not to skimp on the libations. Don Pisto's is a terrific party if you do it the right way.
author: Johnny T.

description:
We were suppose to go for a Italian for late lunch in North Beach.
Well, what else do we want to have in NB?
There are few pseudo Japo in NB, but I've never interested in.

It was an accident.
We just saw a place has no sign.
My gf said that this is a new Mexican place on NB.
So, we went.

I got the Tortas.
Hamburguesa / 10.00
marinated in bacon and onions, guacamole w/ Grilled jalapenos and radish.
It was a dripping juicy hot burger!
Awesome! 
1st time ever for me eating a burger without ketchup.

I don't even remember what my gf was having. I was totally gone to heaven when I was having the burger.
I think she got a some shit like pork tacos. I didn't care about the tacos because I am a die-hard taco truck fan, and I do not like a high-end-taco-places like upper Fillmore and Marina Cow Hollow. Well, whole thing in the MCH is very slutty. 

We were eating tortilla chips like crazy hen and rooster because the chili verde salsa was incredibly addicting.
This is such a nice change and very unique idea for NB.
We'll be back.
author: Nobu K.

description: Amazed we were able to get in on a busy Thursday night but were promptly seated.  The shrimp tacos and enchiladas were excellent.  We had a nice pitcher of house margarita and the chips and salsa verde tasted home made.  We will go back!
author: Rick R.

description: Best salmon tostadas ever!! And the al pastor tacos are to die for.. I will definitely be making the trip back to San Francisco from LA for these babies again
author: Natalie G.

description:
Loved the food and service. Sit at the bar.. Nick the bartender was a great guy.  Made our experience

Mexican ceviche.  Calamari. Pollo asado. Done. So happy
author: Joseph G.

description:
Still amazing. Every time.

 The 2 people who said the guacamole is bland... its purely avocado. Most places cut theirs with white beans, tomatoes etc. I can't believe someone would be upset by this. That blows my mind. They give you an amazing salsa with it ( ....maybe mix them?! lol)
author: Jennie S.

description:
My new favorite spot?

Why you ask?
1. You can order lobster tacos...yes full lobster. 
2. You can order 32 oz. coronas. 
3. They have great margaritas and drinks. 
4. if you know what to order, you won't have to spend that much. 
                                     Yes, even with the lobster tacos..
5. Great tacos!
6. Spicy salsa!
7. Chips and salsa
8. great service

Why is may not be my favorite spot
9. long wait - but they can't help that they are that good!
10. no parking in North Beach - SF is somewhat over-populated. 

My recommendation: Make a rezzy and enjoy! :D
author: Heather H.

description:
Don Pisto's is a Monet. 
From afar, this restaurant was promising. High ratings on Yelp (I should've known better to be more skeptical) , it was packed , long wait time (should've eaten elsewhere) and when we finally get up close and personal inside, it's just a disappointing mess. 

After a 1 1/2 hour wait (we only had a party of 5 so they wouldn't take a reservation) we were finally seated in a strange, stuffy downstairs area of the restaurant that smelled like dirty dishes and restroom. Why did it smell like that? Oh , because it's next to both those areas. 
By the way, Don Pisto's used to be an Argentinian steakhouse (which wasn't so great either) and the inside is almost completely the same. 

The menu is not that big so if you come here and it's busy, don't expect to actually be able to get what you want. They will probably be sold out of many things. 
Our server informed us that they were out of the following things:

No more salsa
No more ceviche 
No more steak 
No more lobster 

Hold the fuq up. I said HOLD DA FUQ UP! Mexican restaurant without salsa?!? What kind of blasphemy is this?! It's like a Chinese restaurant with no soy sauce - UNHEARD OF. 

Sorely disappointed because 1) my friend and i had our hearts set on the lobster and 2) this left our group with just brunch items and a couple of tacos to choose from. I didn't wait 1 1/2 hours for some damn huevos ranchero as my dinner so I had al pastor tacos. Not impressed. Oily and all, but no heat  no spice. Man these are not al pastor tacos ok.  Estas son chingaderas!!! 
Oh. We also had a pitcher of sangria. It wasn't very good. As a matter of fact it was pretty weak, there no were chopped up fruits (was it strained out?) and only a lime in it. 
I don't get why Yelpers rave about the $6 guacamole and chips. Really people? It wasn't worth the $6 nor was it that tasty. It reminded me of Chevy's guacamole!! Just for the record, I never eat at Chevy's by choice. Had to put that out there. I was just soooo hungry that I kept noshing on the chips before my tacos arrived. Starting to suspect that those who love Don Pisto's are also Chipotle fans *gag*

Many of us felt that the food fell short and really needed that salsa. How sad. I love al pastor too so I really wanted this to work. 
Tasted the chicken tortilla soup. It was pretty bland. 

Honestly, Don Pisto's is for people who are in the area, want to eat somewhere hip/trendy and don't know any better that they should probably visit a taqueria in the Mission. 

Let it be known that this was the 2nd longest I have ever waited for a meal (the first was for overrated hipster Outerlands) and it was totally not worth it. The food just fell so short for me that I don't care to find out of their salsa, ceviche, steak or lobster is any good. I mean come on, it's like finding a hot guy with a tiny lil one. Once you see that you're like, wtf am I supposed to do with that lil Vienna sausage? You dont go back to him , that's what! Sorry Don Pisto's, I'm dumping you.
author: Susy C.

description: Having lived in Texas, this is definitely not Mexican food. But it's ridiculously good!!:)
author: Rogier d.

description:
This place rules! Fresh, quality ingredients, bold flavors, great service, and in a cool space. It's in North Beach, though, so parking is miserable. And the menu is somewhat limited. That said, what they do offer they really pull off well.

I'm a big fan!
author: Don W.

description: Let me first say that I love this restaurant! However, we just had the worst service I've experienced in a long time. Our waitress, Gabriela, was not only slow and inattentive, but she also had a horrible attitude and was straight up rude. We even had to ask 3 times for our check!! After 2 hours of bad service where we had to take our drinks directly to the bartender, on the way out she says 'have a nice day'... when our response was underwhelming, she then said 'Or not!' SOO rude! I'm pretty sure she didn't mean for me to hear her, but still... Quintessential piss poor customer service.
author: Lauren C.

description:
I came here to catch up with middle school classmates. We made the mistake of choosing to come here on St. Patty's Day and the wait was an hour long. The food was good but the portions were small. 
The noise level was unbelievably loud, definitely not the right place for a middle school reunion. But I would recommend it if you are looking for some good Mexican food in the area.
author: Joan W.

description:
Please note this is an update. Our opinion on the food has not changed---its a solid 5. Our opinion on the servers has not changed---a solid 5. Pete is a great man----great owner---really cares. 

So why the update? 

Demographics. 

When we first found this gem it was quiet and offered a mixed age crowd. 

Not anymore. 

The whole place is packed with 21-30 year olds. They are LOUD and really (in our humble opinion) annoying. 

We feel really bummed because we love this place---but we just can't stand the noise or the encroachment of the Marina set. 

We wish Pete continued success but if you are older than 30 and like to be able to have a conversation without screaming----pass this by.
author: Chris O.

description:
Came here for a friends birthday brunch. I called in to make a reservation and the staff was really accommodating to squeeze us in at a time that they seemed to already have a lot of reservations! 

When we got there the wait staff was always very attentive and since most of us got bottomless mimosas it was great! I would say their food is good, I've had better brunch food but for the price it is pretty good! I would definitely recommend this place for a bottomless + brunch place to go with friends and have a great time. The staff is really pleasant too!
author: Ranna K.

description:
Based on the "Hot on Yelp" on my iPhone we went to Don Pisto's while in San Fran. Really enjoyed everything, the bartender was awesome, the drinks and food were great. Will go back someday. Family style Mexican menu is also very cool.  There will be a wait not sure on reservations.

Food- 5 Stars
Amazing tortilla soup, HUGE portion (seriously, a meal in itself for 2 people) 

Good tacos and great tostadas

Drinks- 4 Stars
Great Acai Sangria and good beers. Very small bar they do the most they can with it.

Atmosphere- 4 Stars
Loud but fun. Seems like a good date place although there was one loud ass party of 8 or so there when we were there that occasionally made it too loud to talk comfortably.

Value- 5 Stars. 
Cheap as hell considering the amount of food, the quality, and the location.

Service- 4 Stars.
Very good and timely. Cute never hurts either.
author: Alexi A.

description:
If quality, simple, delicious Mexican food is something you enjoy Don Pistos is a great option.  I only spend a couple of weeks in SF a year, but this is a guaranteed stop for me every time!  The lobster poached in pork fat was a great special this week, and the Poc Chuc is a go to for anyone that enjoys bone in pork treats!

Nestle up to the little bar or grab a table with friends this place never disappoints.  Don't forget to order some chorizo mussels and guacamole to share with the lucky ones you invited along.

F yeah Don Pistos!!!!
author: G M.

description:
Out of all the places I hit up on my 10 day recent adventure to SF, Don Pisto's would have to be the most memorable. Our lovely waitress (Kim) definitely had something to do with it; my friend and I showed up parched and ravenous after a long day..and even more so from hiking up ridiculously steep/sketchy/neverending stairs to get to Telegraph Hill (thanks google maps). Kim kept us hydrated, and seeing that we were from out of town, kept coming back to chat with us as well as offer some great recommendations of things to do. 

Onto the food and beverages...the red sangria was perfectly tasty and strong, but the agave/pineapple shots were to die for. After annihilating the yummy chips & salsa, we got a little sampling of the sashimi (great!), and tried the steak and fish tacos. I preferred the steak, but it may have been a bit too spicy for me (and I like spicy). 

Great atmosphere, trendy crowd, and great vibes all around though!  Must come back when I'm in better shape...thanks again Kim!
author: Kamila P.

description:
This is the best mexican restaurant in the city. 

The service is awesome and super chill considering people stop by to drop off their numbers to make a reservation every five seconds after 7pm. 
The guacamole is just so perfect- chunky avocado, perfectly salted and simple.
The lobster tacos are life-changing. Three components that make it so: cilantro butter, bacon black beans and lobster. 
The Poc Chuc is juicy and delicious. Can be shared between two (split some tacos too)
The Hamburguesa is a great choice if you want a mexican burger.
The Civiche is so refreshing. Never ever tastes fishy- and is always chilled.
Also- Chorizo Mussels are neck and neck with the Lobster tacos. They are perfectly cooked and merry so well with the Chorizo. The toasted bread is like a godsend to the remaining sauce and bits of Chorizo. Orgasmic. 

So that's a portion of the menu for you. Ambiance is young, hip and loud. Expect it to be busy and chaotic, but expect the food to be everything I have said.
author: Colleen F.

description:
Small, dimly lit place that was packed on a Wednesday night. The hostess was friendly and said the wait would be short. After 10 minutes we were seated. Started off with some margaritas which were average. 

We ordered the chips/salsa verde/guac. The guac and salsa were fresh and flavorful. We also ordered the carne asada tacos. They were so good...the meat was very tender. We also ordered the diablo prawns. Again it was excellent. The diablo sauce had a kick to it...very well done. Lastly we finished with the pollo. That was also excellent. We left the place stuffed! Definite must stop for mod mex.
author: Neil P.

description:
Pros:
- Excellent service and great atmosphere.  
- Great tapas sized snacks
- Totally get the Guac (its as fresh as you can get it)
- Prefect chips, in that they are thicker, freshly fried, salty goodness
- Pesacdo Taco is great with the avocado topping
- Al Pastor is good with a salty and sweet with pineapple
- Wild Monterey Calamari- not actually fired so I had to not look at it while I eating.  But still delicious!

Cons:
- More than likely have to wait (but that can be a good thing too.  Just sit at the bar and enjoy a drink)
- Small portions, so either pre-eat, or understand that 1/3 of your meal will most likely be chips
- Kinda expensive.  But be willing to share, and go in with the thought you are enjoying one of SF best places to dine.
author: Tina C.

description:
Don't know what happened to this place. I came here a couple of months ago and had a great time, great menu selection. 

I came back tonight with my girlfriend and there are babies crying and lame music playing. The sangria was not very good and it was just pretty underwhelming. 

Sad.
author: Ramin S.

description:
I've literally attempted to come here multiple times but got deterred by the 1 hour+ wait times. This time, we were determined to wait it out by going to Park Tavern for drinks while we waited for their call. 

Finally seated, we ordered: Guac + chips, carnitas and fish tacos, grilled pork chop, mexican sashima, and ceviche.  Hands down, our absolutely favorite dish was the grilled pork chop. A must try! I'll come back for this dish alone. Everything else we had was delicious, but pricey for pretty standard mexican fare. 

I'll definitely try to come back here for brunch!
author: Vivian D.

description:
The Setting: dinner with coworkers, 830p Tuesday, no reservation, waited 20 minutes. 

Food: 4.5 Stars
Service: 4.5 Stars

The GOOD:
1.  Guacamole - Amazing! Fresh avocado, a lot of it, with much less emphasis on the salsa on top. I always hate when most guacamoles are 3 parts salsa, one part avocado. This was the opposite. 
2. Hamburguesa - I never would have ordered this at a Mexican food restaurant had it not been the server's recommendation. The meat is marinated in bacon and onions, so you get this amazingly flavored patty without the actual ingredients overpowering the meat itself. And instead of cheese on top, they put guacamole (see item 1) on it, which is a great addition. So good!
3. Carne Asada Tacos - melted in our mouths, the table loved 'em. 
4.  Michelada - For those that like their drinks spicy but not tomatoey (like a blood mary), this is very good.  Perfect amount of zing, tastes great, and one will last you the meal!

The OK: 
1.  Puerto Nuevo Lobster - this was actually very good lobster and the "fixins" (rice, beans, cilantro) were great! But for $39, we figured the money was better spent on other items that were equally good for a third the price.  

The BAD:
1.  Everything was pretty darn good!  I guess we could have done without the wait...

The Bottom Line - wonderful food, good cocktails (michelada!) and great service, with a nice yet casual vibe, this is a perfect weeknight dinner spot if you're willing to wait 30 minutes. This place gets 5 stars, not because it's the best meal I've ever had in SF, but because it's the best value I've had in SF.
author: Kevin S.

description: Fantastic!  Friendly, great service and the food was wonderful. If you're looking for a fun environment, this is the place.
author: Larry F.

description: DON'T BELIEVE THE HYPE. If you're looking for a mediocre, generic gringo Mexican food experience, then this place is your jam. Otherwise, you're in San Francisco. There are dozens of other establishments that do Mexican with so much more flavor, authentically, at a better price point and just all around better. NEXT.
author: Anna V.

description:
went there for brunch. cute! We ordered tacos and some omelet for brunch. Tacos were good. Good drinks. But the omelet was WS. 
I'd recommend sticking to order from their regular Mexican menu. guacamole was good. 
They need more bathrooms. there was a long line all the time. 
It's a good size popular restaurant. It'd just make sense to have more bathrooms.
author: Maki N.

description:
This place is real busy however they take down your name and number and call you as soon as a table is free. We were told and hour and half last night yet after going for a short stroll they called within 30 minutes.
The food was wonderful. Good sized serves that didn't leave you feeling over full. My friends were saying best Mexican they'd ever had!
Our server was awesome and friendly and kept a good eye on us.
Love it. Will recommended to all my friends.
author: Trent R.

description:
Hands down best tacos in the city! Love this place! Came here for my birthday this year and sat in the bog room downstairs! Guac is also delicious! 

Will be back for suuuuuuuuuuuuuuure! YUM!
author: Kelly B.

description:
Tacos are superb.... Though a tad bit small in portion, especially two to an order.

A grown man needs 2 orders of tacos hands down.

Tortilla soup is likely underrated. I recommend it.
author: D G.

description: A++ Drinks are good and the food was really good!! I recommend the ribeye steak and sashimi salmon. P.S I'm buzzed margarita are hella good. Oh and the customer service was legit.
author: Judy C.

description:
I miss El Raigon which used to be in this location but Don Pistos is pretty good too. I've been here twice. 

The first time was with my family after Beer & Oyster Festival. I greatly enjoyed the amazing green salsa with fresh chips (the "table bread") and the huge bowl of chicken tortilla soup (about $8).

The second time, my tipsy friend was really craving a burrito. I'd already eaten but still enjoyed a little of the salsa while she devoured lots of it and enjoyed the little tacos that she ordered. 

The service was very nice both times and the food hit the spot for a post-drinking meal. I'm sure I'll be back sometime as this is also probably the closest restaurant to my house!
author: Meghan P.

description:
Had a really fun birthday brunch at Don Pisto's! I had the breakfast burrito, which was good, but a little on the small side and would have loved if it came with a side or two.  Same goes with the dishes my friends tried, everything was tasty but very simple. I'm not mad about it because the prices are more than reasonable. (However we did exit Don Pisto's and walk straight to Golden Boy Pizza :) ) 

I was glad my friend ordered the burger, which is on the7x7 list, for a good reason! The bottomless mimosa/margarita/sangria situation makes me smile.  

Aside from the food, I loved that the waitress did not once rush us.  Our group of 10 was *really* enjoying the bottomless bevs and occupied a larger table for a few hours on a crowded Saturday morning. She even brought my boyfriend and I (both the birthday guests) treats. 

Can't wait to try for dinner, I expect more of the same greatness!
author: Brianna M.

description: Loved it! The pork omg the pork chop! Our first stop in San Francisco and the previous reviews did not let us down. Everything was fantastic. I wish I could give it 5++++. Do not miss this place when you come here.
author: Katrina B.

description:
Expect to wait.  Friday night - we put our names down at 6:30 and got seated around 7:15.  The wait time seemed to only increase as the night got later (around 7pm the host was estimating an hour and a half wait for folks).  Point being, be prepared to hang out a bit.  

Margaritas are not strong, which is disappointing considering the price.  (Pitchers for $32).  I didn't realize it until after we had ordered, but they aren't tequila margs (no hard liquor license here) - you are drinking agave...

In terms of food, we ordered chips and guac to start.   I would definitely do this again.  The chips were warm and nicely salted; the guac was full of flavor and noticeably fresh (though lacking a kick).  We ordered three sets of tacos for the two of us-carnitas, fish, and carne asada; each set comes with two tacos.  The tacos are small, but pretty tasty (the fish was my favorite, though the carnitas came in as a close second).  

As for the space, the place is loud and the lighting dim (I would say a little too dark unless you are seated near the window).   I love the brick walls and casual space (no need to dress up if you don't want to!).  Also, they have a small bar at the entrance, and if you can nab a seat, then you can eat/drink there without having to endure the wait.
author: Kimya P.

description: Everyone should eat here. Always. I split the fish tacos and carne asada tacos with a friend and they were both to die for. I also had an awesome sangria. Despite an amazing meal, the part I loved most was the nachos and dip. So good!
author: Elaine D.

description:
I am not really sure why this place has 4.5 stars. We just went late last night and I thought it was a solid 3 stars but really not exceptional.

Service - really good, friendly, attentive, definitely one of the pluses

Ambiance - cozy but a little too loud. Something about the acoustics of the place makes it really hard to hear your friends. Also I was distracted by the copious amounts of smoke billowing in the open kitchen. It seemed to be ventilated well but I found myself looking in that direction all night and worrying that we were breathing in all that smoke.

Food - I always find "fancy Mexican food" to be something of an oxymoron and this place was no exception. 

In terms of deliciousness and flavor their tacos really can't come close to the way tacos should be consumed: standing huddled next to a softly purring truck, squeezing limes with one hand while clutching greasy paper plates with the other. For that kind of experience try Las Peraltas in San Mateo or La Tonayense in the Mission/SOMA.  The carnitas tacos here at Don Pisto's tasted rather flat and fatty and the pescado tacos were too much on the other end of the spectrum, painfully spicy and absurdly salty.

The tortilla soup, while enormously generous in portion and well balanced in spicy flavors, was frightfully brothy. My gold standard for tortilla soup is the lusciously thick and filling soup served up at the Farmer's Market on Fairfax and 3rd in Los Angeles. Again this one was sure to disappoint when you go in comparing it to a decidedly superior experience.

Add to that that the tacos average about $4-5 APIECE and you begin to feel like it's a completely overrated/overpriced experience.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Yep, 5 star!

The quality and flavor of everything I tasted was perfect.  You need to try this to get an idea of authentic Northern Baja mexican food.

We had some tasty sangria.  Grilled Calamari, and when that dish arrived and i learned over to smell what was going on, I knew I had arrived.

Delicious shrimp tacos and an awesome hamburger!

The food was perfect.

The scene is casual and packed.  Service excellent and friendly, from everyone.  It's in North Beach which means parking crisis, so plan accordingly.  Also with it's popularity minimum 30 minute wait, but they'll take your number and you can stroll the neighborhood while you wait.

You gotta try it!
author: Vincent M.

description:
I lOVE Don Pistos!
We have family from the Yucatan and when we brought them here they were more than impressed. The food is phenomenal and the staff is very attentive. Its a small place and parking is limited but if you arrive early and order everything on the menu (and I mean everything!) you will be very pleased. 
My favs are the choriso mussels, hamburgesa, and cochinita pibil.
author: Nicole V.

description: Good food, but small portions EXCEPT the huevos rancheros which were delicious and filling. Free chips and salsa will fill you up though. Fun atmosphere, VERY loud! Sangria wasn't great
author: Rebecca G.

description:
Something's changed... 
First they got rid of the side peppers... now all the tacos are doused in same sauce.  Service feels more like that of a tourist trap than a locals joint.  Sigh.  I used to love you Don Pisto, but you've changed!
author: Anne M.

description: I love the atmosphere here. The food is really good and just a solid neighborhood spot. The owners are great and know what they are doing.  I could eat their chips all night long.
author: Derek S.

description:
Jettison all of your ideas of what 'Mexican food' is and go to Don Pisto's ready for an entirely new interpretation. I had heard amazing things about this little spot in North Beach and finally tried it out earlier this year. Since then, I've been back twice with totally different groups and tried a few different menu options. The first time, I liked it. The second time, I reallllly liked it. This most recent experience? Exceptional. Like, whoa. It's not the greasy Mexican food that you're probably used to having; it's fresh, clean and puts a whole new twist on Mexican fare. 

The set up of the menu makes it super conducive to sharing, so plan for that! All three times I've been in, I've had the sashimi, which has been exceptional. Most recently, we also tried the grilled calamari which was ahh-mazing! So, so good; very fresh and super healthy. The tacos that I've tried (the grilled fish and the shrimp varieties) have also been great. The tacos are on the smaller side, so make sure you're ordering enough for the group! 

They don't have a full bar, so don't be shocked when you have limited drink options. Still, their margarita and sangria options are really delicious, so you won't be disappointed (I happen to be a big fan of their sangria)!
author: Shannon E.

description: The food was fantastic and the service was wonderful. Great for our group party and a group of foodies. Agave wine is devilishly good.
author: Kelsey H.

description:
I feel like I should explore North Beach more because of this eatery...it's amazing!  

Had a tiny trouble finding it since there's no sign, but during peak hours it's easy to spot since there's always a crowd waiting outside to get in.  I love the interior...spacious and dim.

Apparently all their food is organic here, something I didn't know till after.  Their menu is small, but that's probably a good thing since it allows them to focus on bringing quality instead of quantity which they definitely do!  I wanted to try the tacos, but since their hamburguesa is on the 7x7 list, I was obligated to get that and am happy I did!  I'm not a burger person in general and this one was only bun, patty, and guac but it was easily one of the tastiest burgers I've ever had!  I think there is bacon in their patty?  Bacon makes everything taste better IMO.  The patty was very tender and cooked to perfection while the buns they use is out of this world.  I couldn't pinpoint exactly why I liked it so much but it wins for best buns!  The only problem I had with my meal was that the margaritas were pretty weak.  Not sure if that's a regular thing.

Either way, I'll def be back to try out their tacos next time since I was eyeing my friend's during the entire meal.
author: Jane N.

description:
They have the best bacon burger in the world!!! We have to get one every time we go.  -I've been here a few times and once they had the most amazing grilled calamari skewer served with a refreshing little salad.   
-Pork chop was gigungo, juicy and delicious- a little on the sweet side though
-mussels always good
-any of the street tacos are bomb
-BRUNCH the best- I don't even like breakfast burritos and I'd throw my grandma out of the car for this one!  The bottomless options don't help either or DO however you want to look at it.  
-only bad experience was the elote was inedibly spicy but I think it was just our table, since everyone else's didn't look PINK with chile
author: Monica H.

description: Went here with six other friends for a birthday celebration. Got seated almost immediately and had a fantastic experience and Nick was a very attentive waiter. The group was doing bottomless mimosas/margaritas/sangria for $17 so we went with it and ended up having an amazing experience. The wait staff and waiter were nothing short of outstanding. Would definitely come back here with a big group of friends.
author: Jonah L.

description:
Don't blink, you might miss Don Pistos. We came through an alleyway and didn't see a sign as we headed straight for it (thanks to Yelp).

Walking in, we were welcomed into its dark wood & brick interior. The fresh-made chips and salsa kick started the meal. Our thirst was quenched by the sparkling red sangria. And our appetites were delighted by the fresh tacos, guacamole and Mexican Street corn (gotta have this - it'll knock your socks off, in a good way). Glad we didn't blink.
author: Cathy K.

description: Awesome food and atmosphere!! Chips and salsa are even extra yummy!  Shared a rib dish with my husband and it was fantastic.  Wish there was a Don Pisto's in Orange County!
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
I threw a 30th surprise birthday party for my boyfriend a few days before Christmas.  I worked with Shannon who was AWESOME and so easy to work with.  The entire staff at Don Pistos is accommodating and friendly.  Our waitress (didnt get her name) was super helpful and allowed our crazy party of 30 have some fun.  The private room downstairs (which was free btw) was a perfect setting for a party.  The food is amazing, authentic and savory.  Did i mention their margaritas are strooong too!! 

I HIGHLY recommend Don Pisto's to anyone.  All around 5 stars.  Cant wait to go back ;-)
author: Stephanie L.

description:
The wait can be brutal and this spot gets ridiculously loud.  But hot damn the food is great!  Hamburguesa.  Poc Chuc.  Carnitas tacos.  Brunch is meh, but the 3 previously mentioned dishes are where you want to be.  Generally I don't hit up mexican restaurants for burgers or pork chops, but these guys pack a punch.  I'll let you test the pork chop and carnitas out yourself, but the hamburguesa needs some more love here.

Hamburguesa: no ketchup, just guacamole please.  Sure, I'll cut up this jalapeno looking thing and put it on for an extra kick.  Wow, this thing is now burning my mouth but it tastes too good so I'll just power through.  This thing apparently is marinated in bacon and onion for a day before cooking, does that even make sense?  I probably heard wrong.
author: William B.

description:
I've been wanting to try Don Pisto's for such a long time and the reviews on Yelp are raving about how great the food is.... but when we came I was very underwhelmed here. 

My group came here on a Tuesday night around 6pm for dinner. The restaurant was had a couple tables filled so pretty open in terms of seating. We had 5 people in our group so they put us at a 4 top. Seriously? We kinda sat for a bit making fun of the situation but in the end we did ask for a bigger table. Our server had to get the manager as its "not my decision" and the manager said they had a big party of 11 coming in at 815pm so they couldn't move us. Really? We had already sat down and ordered -- so we explained we will def be out before the large party so the manager agreed and moved two tables together for us so we could be seated comfortably. But how long do they expect people to sit at tables for -- our table would def be turned in about 1.5 hours. Anyways, for the food we wanted to try the tamales and the hamburger - but they weren't making them that night so  I ordered fish tacos. To my surprise when they came they were tiny (i guess some would call it street style tacos) but for $11, they should make them bigger or add a 3rd taco. My friend got the pork chop which was huge and made the rest of our tacos seem teeny tiny in comparison. We also ordered a pitcher of margaritas and boy were those super sweet! I did not like mine at all so I left half of it on the table. Overall the best thing I liked was the chips and salsa..... 

Though i really liked the chips and salsa and my fish tacos were not bad... it would not bring me to come back here again.
author: Julie F.

description: Even on a Monday night, this place was packed. My parents and I managed to get seats at the bar and ordered a little bit of everything. The carnitas tacos had an awesome meat:tortilla ratio. Oddly, of the two tacos on the plate, one was pretty mild and the other was so spicy I started seeing Jesus. The mushroom enchiladas, tamales and fish tacos were all good, but the winner had to be the chips and homemade salsa verde - if you put that stuff on a car tire, I would consider eating it.
author: Allison P.

description:
I'm not going to stop loving Don Pisto's because the food rocks. Unfortunately, it's become so hip and trendy that the crowd is the bummer. The last time I was in there for brunch I felt embarrassed not to be wasted and wearing Banana Republic. Then I realized that's not how I choose my haunts and just wanted to leave... boo. Awesomeness devoured by popularity.

You should still go. Maybe not during prime time, but it's good stuff. I just wish that no one knew :)
author: Amber C.

description:
El Pastor Tacos= try them, you won't be disappointed
The mussels & chorizo were also very tasty and the portion was plentiful.

I noticed that there is no signage above the entrance to the restaurant, so don't go expecting to see a sign or you might be circling around for a bit.
author: Carina T.

description: Great food, loud, funky atmosphere.  Very friendly staff.  No sign on outside on building, so you have to know where you are going.  Awesome chips and salsa.
author: rose g.

description:
LOVE IT!

Walked in on a friday at 5:45, and already 1/5 full! (opens at 5:30)

Chips and salsa placed in front of you when you sit down.  Thick chips, salsa verde, my favorite.  This is going to be a good dinner.

Mexican sashimi was fresh and refreshing.

Fish tacos were so succulent.  The fish were not fried, rather pan fried.  Would be perfect if there was a little bit more seasoning/flavor with the taco. 

The beef & eggs (wagyu) was melt in your mouth (needed a couple sprinkles of salt, which was fine because it was on the table.  holy cow I love having salt on the table! 

Corn tortillas are perfect.  I wanted to get more, take it home and wrap everything I have in my fridge with it.  

Sangria was great, but a bit watered down. 

Fresh food done right, could add in a little more flavor on couple of dishes
author: Hannah W.

description:
A friend recommended this place so I figured I'd check it out. So glad I did!

I went on  a Saturday night, so it was pretty crowded and I took a seat at the bar. Although they were busy, my food came quickly.

First I had the chips and salsa. Both very good. The green salsa is some of the best Salsa Verde I've had. Then they brought out the guacamole I ordered. It was pretty good too. It tasted fresh, but it didn't really have a kick to it. I'm more of a fan of spicy foods.

The next dish to come out was the ceviche. It was amazing! Best ceviche I've had for sure. It was a good portion for two people to share as an appetizer but not too big that it's unreasonable for 1 person to eat as well if followed by something like tacos. Which brings me to...

The tacos! I ordered the Al Pastor tacos and they were very good. They served them on small corn tortillas with radish and lime. Definitely a good set of tacos.

The only downside is that it was a bit pricey, but for a good taco outside of the Mission, it's worth it. Especially if you get the ceviche!
author: Ian F.

description: Great find.  Outstanding food and service.  Spicy, delicious and fresh...cool urban vibe.
author: John K.

description: I had heard that this restaurant was a good place for Mexican food outside of the Mission district but I hadn't had a chance to try it until now. My friend and I came for Sunday brunch. It was packed but the wait wasn't as long as it could have been for Sunday brunch. We waited 40 minutes for a table. The hostess took our name and number, so we wandered around a bit while we waited. When we finally got in, we were super hungry so we ordered right away. We each ordered a breakfast burrito and guacamole to share. They also gave us complementary salsa and chips. The chips were amazing! I've never had such perfect tortilla chips! The salsa was super spicy; my mouth was on fire but it was good. The breakfast burritos were really good as well with eggs chorizo and cheese as the filling. This was also very spicy. The guac thankfully gave us a break from the fire in our mouths. The prices here are very reasonable. The breakfast burritos were each $11 and the guac was ~$6. We also ordered lemonade and multiple refills of tortilla chips. In the end, the bill came to $40 which is standard for SF. The only negative i saw (a very small negative) was the restaurant was really loud so I could barely hear my friend.
author: Rebecca D.

description: Interesting concept, creative combinations but it's not a five star, food is okay, or good, not exceptional... It's nice to have some food in neighborhood that's not just same old Italian. I'd definitely try it again and see if it gets better. Have eaten there a few times and feel the same each time.
author: Traci H.

description:
Really enjoyed that meal! The menu is small and tight, but they do everything right! 

Apps: Mexican sashimi and their fish of the night was salmon. Tasty tasty. 

Mains, tacos with carne asada, carnitas, and al pastor (grilled pork chop)
The carnitas ones were the best I think. They had a little crunch to them as well as a juiciness inside. 

We finished off with a bowl of mussels. The sauce of the mussels was so goof that we got a bowl of rice to suck it all up. 

Thoroughly enjoyed and will return if ever in the area and need a place for bites and sangria
author: Ray J.

description:
Really great pork chop that's super juicy and tangy. You can watch them grill your pork chop thru the see-thru window.The tacos are alright - not too amazing. The guac is really good here so addictive you just want to keep ordering it. 

I hear this place has the best burger as well but they don't serve it during the weekends. No reservations taken unless it's a group. It's really a fun chill place with not too crazy prices. Definitely a nice place and I'd return
author: Jamie T.

description:
We were there for late lunch/brunch on a Friday and walked right in.  The place was still busy, but no wait.

We had the market fish tacos (snapper, if I recall??) and the huevos rancheros.  Both were flavorful, nice amount of spice and piping hot.  The potatoes are crispy and perfectly done as well.  

Had to try the bottomless sangria's.  Liked that you could switch beverages if you wanted.  We had just one mimosa and went back.

Service was good and quick.  I plan to go back for dinner and try some of their small plates.
author: Teri X.

description: I've heard a lot about Don Pisto's but never made my way to north beach to actually try it out...until now. What a pleasant surprise! I went on a week night around 8pm and was able to be seated right away, no reservations. The hostess was super friendly from the get-go. And the service only got better as the night went on. Our server, her helper, the bartender, everyone seemed to really like working there! As well, the food is amazing. Everything from the complimentary chips and salsa to their tacos and pork dish... So yummy! Everything was well seasoned, perfectly cooked, and above and beyond my expectations. Thanks for a great meal!!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I think my new love is ceviche. Tangy pieces of rare fish sounds oddly appealing. The thought of it makes me salivate. 

A failed attempt for dinner at Limon brought us all the way from Mission to North Beach, where we luckily scored a parking space on a Saturday night. Don Pistos was bustling with pretty people, making us feel short and inadequate. We were not dressed in our best Saturday night attire as we had just come back from the suburbs of Sacramento. This place is perfect for pre-clubbing eats or group dinners (they have a separate area for groups). The guy who helped us, who I assume was the manager, was point on with his service. We ordered the sangria with our food and when he noticed the food came out before our drinks, he comped us for the drinks. Unexpected but really nice!

The meal came with complementary freshly made chips and salsa. We opted to add guacamole ($5), which added to the experience. LOTS of guac = happy Tina. The sangria was good, though a bit too much for my sensitive EtOH tolerance. The mango ceviche http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/voFE8DTKsTFi1Vzm_zzd0Q?select=fMFrwqnVqwdPYby8Ijqmpg: AMAZING. Must get for sure. Sweet pieces of juicy mango with tuna drizzled with the perfect amount of lime juice. I would come back again for this.

Our group also had the tacos (carne asada, camarones). Greasier than we would have liked but still good. The Hamburgesa (burger marinated with bacon, onions, guac) was also good.

Overall, very hip Mexican street food joint. Definitely more expensive than your typical taco joint but it's all about the experience. Plus, their ceviche is delish!
author: Tina T.

description:
Let me start by saying, I guess it depends upon what you are looking for. It is small, loud, and if you sit too close to the kitchen you are blasted with a wave of smoke which comes off the grill. Apparently the fan needs an upgrade. The tables are packed in and the ceiling is low, hence the noise. 

The menu is very small and limited for those whom have never been, you have been warned. This is not a place to get a traditional plate. It is "Chic" Mexican. So Chic in fact they do not even have a sign, just a street number on front. You park hoping it is the spot, walk up and say, "OoooooooK, I guess this is the place?" A little presumptuous if you ask me but so be it. Maybe the sign is on order??

1 J. Mandarin:                                                          $2.50
1 Guac & Chips:                                                      $6.00
1 Rice:                                                                       $3.00
1 Pinto Beans:                                                         $3.00
1 Tacos Al Pastor (2) small tacos (Ala carte):   $9.00 (!)
1 Sashimi (Salmon):                                              $13.00
1 Corona Light:                                                        $5.00
Subtotal:                                                                   $41.50
Tax:                                                                             $3.53
Total:                                                                         $45.03

Pros:

* Chips were better than average and fresh. Salsa good.
* Sashimi dish was out of place here but delicious and stole show
* Service initially very friendly, faded quickly as server became overwhelmed.

Cons:

* Environment, way too loud unless you are looking for a clubby dinner spot and we arrived soon after they opened. 
* Parking a serious challenge in this part of North Beach
* $9.00 for 2 small taco truck tacos!!! I have had better from trucks that were larger, as well I prob would get 4 at this price. The difference is what you pay is definitely not evident in the taste.
* Guac boring, weak.
* $45 in Mexican? You shud not walk away hungry. Servings small.

Heard as walking away: Don't believe the hype. This place is not worth the salt of 4.5 stars, unless you are looking for bottomless alcohol. It seems as though alot of reviews place serious value on this alone. Not a problem, I understand, but for this reviewer, no Senor. Will not be back.
author: Rick G.

description: I will absolutely visit this place the next time I visit San Francisco. Food was amazing and the waitress made the visit awesome. The place is casual and laid back and gives you the opportunity to be in an upbeat spot while able to hang with friends.
author: Jamie S.

description:
My search for a great Mexican restaurant are over!  Don Pisto's, where have you been all my life?  First we were told there would be an hour wait, put our name in and made our way to the bar.  Nic, the bar tender is a joy to watch and interact with.  The bar may be small but it is very very busy and you get a great view of the cooking line.  We had so much fun that when two seats opened at the bar we took them to have dinner.  

The guacamole, is divine, it is very simple with a little seasoning, a great texture, and perfectly salted that it tastes like guacamole should taste.  The ceviche was life changing it was so good, the Al Pastor tacos not only changed my life, I believe wars have been started over who gets the last one.  The Pollo Asado was pretty good too, but I was still dreaming of my friend's Al Pastor tacos, and kept wishing he would need to step out so I could help myself to the rest of his dish.

The staff is fun, happy, and shoot, just makes you glad you came.  A great blend of wonderful service and food.  Really an operation that others should model.
author: sean d.

description:
This place is great! For starters, they give you chips and salsa at the table. The salsa is a very rough cut salsa verde with a really fresh ad spicy flavors. All the cilantro and jalapenos are still clearly visible, which is great. No pureed mess here. We also got a guacamole which was very tasty,

We order a few entrees. The tacos were good sized and well flavored. The sangria was tasty, but a little weak/dilute for my taste. Would have liked it to have a bit more punch. They did have some trouble bringing out all the dishes together, but they were apologetic. Overall, great food and good service. 

I'll definitely come back!
author: Vinitha R.

description:
Hard to find if you don't know where you're going. It's literally a hole in the wall so just remember the building number. I really like the atmosphere here: dark, loud, crowded but still intimate and one of the few times I didn't mind having to share a table with two other people. 

Never been a guacamole girl as I like my avocado sweet but Don Pisto's changed my mind! Best guac ever, even my Mexican boyfriend agrees.

Tacos are pretty expensive, to be honest ($9!!). I got the fish taco of the day and my boyfriend got the carnitas. They actually use the same sauce for both meats, and it didn't amaze us whatsoever. Granted, it's not an authentic Mexican restaurant so we will eat our tacos at Super Taq instead.

Service was great, our server was very attentive and kept checking up on us. I was being very reluctant to try the michelada here because I'm VERY picky about it and he actually brought me one on the house when we were about to leave. However, I was right to be reluctant; I would definitely never order it here. There were more tapatio and clamato than lime and salt. I like my mix the other way around.
author: Tram N.

description:
Excellent chips and salsa 
Great tacos carnival and Carne Asada to die for great vibe excellent music love this place
author: Anthony N A.

description:
We came here on a recommendation from a friend who lives in SF and it was not a disappointment. The place is pretty small and nondescript from the outside, but walking in, you see the flames shooting up from the grill, the great mix of people and the lively energy of the place, you know that you're in for a treat. Its mexican street food style, carnitas, street tacos, chips and guac. The grilled calamari was amazing, but a little spicy for me. The salmon sashimi was delectable and our friend ordered the lobster. It was the entire lobster, grilled with rendered bacon fat and served with taco fixings. It was awesome. 
I recommend getting a reservation as it filled up mighty quick, but the wait didn't seem like a long time.
author: Renee R.

description:
Just realized I haven't reviewed my favorite restaurant in the world.

I became a fan of Don Pisto's thanks to its tacos and the wonderful Hamburguesa, burger that tastes just a little bit like bacon with great guacamole on top. I then became a big fan of the poc chuc, that wonderful slab of meat. I am currently obsessed with the Chorizo Mussels, a gorgeous spicy dish that really showcases how the chef is a magician with sauces and spices. I always make a point of asking for some extra toasted bread upfront (dish comes with three slices that you can let soak in the sauce and spread chorizo on...). I typically also have the pitcher of margarita -- not the best margarita I've had, but definitely makes me happy and works well with the dishes here.

Only downside: Yet another great place that's overwhelmed by its own success. These days wait time for a table is one hour even at 8pm on a Wednesday night. I've been here probably around 40-50 times, including one time when I brought in a group of 15, and the staff at the door still look like they don't ever remember me -- I typically get a "nice to see you again" at every establishment that I patronize so frequently. Upside though: kitchen doesn't close until half past midnight, so I usually roll in kind of late (or put my name on the list and go to 15 Romolo for a drink and come back for my table).

If you like this place, definitely also try Chubby noodle inside Amante bar by the same team. Once again, magic with sauces and spices.
author: F K.

description:
I admit, I gave this restaurant a 4 star review 4 years ago, but since then, things have gone wayyyyyyyyyyyyy downhill.  I'm not sure what other people are talking about, but the food is mediocre at best.  We have lunch catered from them about once a month and the tortillas are always too greasy, the meat (beef, pork and chicken ) all bland tasting, the chips over salted, and the beans under cooked--overall unpalatable.  Not to mention the last time we catered, a number of us felt sick the next day.  Stomach issues everywhere!...scary, no?!  We will certainly not be ordering from this or any other of this guy's restaurants again (i.e. Pisto's Tacos, Chubby Noodle, etc.).  Who likes spending a weekend hovering over a toilet?

My guess is that they don't care about the quality of their food any more and that they are only trying to cater to the people who come to drink at their establishment.  Don Pisto's has morphed into a nightclub that has no regard for their neighbors  rather than a restaurant that takes pride in the food that they're serving.  It's so sad when a restaurant has gotten so popular they don't feel the need to keep the quality of their food up because they just expect people to keep coming.
author: Las Y.

description: My favorite neighborhood restaurant. The food is ALWAYS excellent and delicious. Love coming here! Awesome salsa, tortilla soup, breakfast burritos, pollo asada
author: Kelly K.

description: Whooooa ohhh Don Pisto's, you rocked my world with yer pork chop tacos. I will certainly come back and bring a bigger appetite. The fruity salsa combo with the salty, fatty pork chop was friggin' tremendous. Only four stars because I haven't tried a whole lot from the menu but what I did have was on point.
author: Christine R.

description: The food was good, the pork chop and guacamole we to DIE FOR!! our service was great, upbeat and perfectly paced. Great ambiance and decent margaritas. Fair prices too! Loved it!
author: Kati V.

description:
Fourth stop in our quest to try the best food SF has to offer.

We made this our main lunch. At this point, we are not hungry but we manage to scarf down some more food and drinks.

We ordered the hamburgesa, al pastor and carnita senora tacos.

The al pastor had explosions of flavors. The carnita is very tender and flavorful. All tortillas are homemade which is always better than store bought. 

The hamburgesa was good but all so heavy. I heard it was cooked in bacon and onions. Burger was tender but I wish we had an option to cook it medium rare.

We also shared a pitcher of acai sangria. I haven't tried much sangria, but it is one of the best I ever had.
author: Kien M.

description:
Baby wha happen?!?

This is by far, my favorite place to go when I want some good food and great entertainment in North Beach. i have been for both brunch and dinner and it never disappoints! Ladybird getting hungry just yelping about it.
author: Ladybird G.

description:
This place is amazing! I hate having to wait to eat (especially when I'm uber hungry), but I'd have to say it was worth the 45 minute wait on a Wednesday night. 

The prices are cheap so go with a few friends and order everything on the menu (tacos, ceviches, soups, sides...). The guacamole is 2nd to Colibri. The chips are a little thick, but it doesn't really matter once it's covered in guac and salsa. 

They don't take reservations so come early to avoid standing outside in the cold (summer). 

It's loud inside so you can even eat with people you don't want to talk to. How great is that?

The service was slower than average, but at least the servers were very nice and polite.
author: Vickie S.

description:
I was really excited to try this place and was super pumped not to have to wait for a table since my boyfriend and I grabbed an early dinner.

Highlights: guacamole & AL PASTOR TACOS. These were one of the best tacos I've ever had.

Not so great: the sangria & the carnitas tacos. The sangria was kind of bland and the carnitas tacos didn't have much to offer- or maybe I was so amazed by the Al Pastor tacos that I expected greatness from these as well.

Either way, I will definitely be coming back at some point!
author: Reyana F.

description:
We had an enjoyable 1st dinner here despite the wait, rough parking, and loud atmosphere!
Our waitress and the staff was very friendly. Pete the owner knows how to run a business and take care of his customers.  We started with the ceviche which was very good - just watch out for the spiciness - we love spicy food and this was beyond spicy. Maybe we got a pepper that found the wrong plate. The fish tacos were amazing and I enjoyed the tostadas also. Love the fact that they have Sol...thanks again Pete!
author: Nate S.

description: This place is awesome! Our waiter Nick was great, he was just on top of it! Don pisto's should give him a raise. Bottomless mimosas is the way to go! Food was good, but portions are small (probably the only down fall).
author: Yadi L.

description: I thought this food was ok, their pitchers of margaritas were good, and it was a bit pricy and SUPER crowded.
author: Tasha D.

description: Lived up to the hype for me and friend.  Both really loved the Pollo Asado entree.  There is some secret ingredient or something.  Maybe bacon fat?   The calmari on skewers was excellent as well.  I normally prefer my guac to be "pure avocado and this was cut a bit, but in conjunction with the Asado plate, it was fine.  With just chips, it might have been a problem.  Nice service and not a bad wait if you get there around 6:00 on a thurs.  Price is fair for the excellence.  Def will want to go back to try this bacon fat burger.
author: Marc S.

description: Waitress in the yellow shirt was amazing. We did bottomless mimosas and my drink was full for the full 90 minutes due to great service. Food was great, although a bit greasy on the breakfast burrito. Good music, great chips and salsa. Happy to have found this place and would definitely return.
author: Carter L.

description: This place was excellent!! Had great service... The staff is very attentive and nice. Shared the tacos, tamale, and ceviche. Which all of it was very tasty. We're from Dallas and weren't sure how truly Mexican the food was going to be, but the cooks are hispanic so it met the expectations. Would definitely recommend it!!!
author: Tony M.

description: A colleague recommended this place. Have to say the staff were great. Food was good, not great. Ambiance very loud. The clicker for me was a pitcher of margarita. They don't have a full liquor license tho it tasted fine. Just Don't fill it w ice and charge me $32. Guess what? Never coming back.
author: Eric K.

description: Tried to come here on a Thursday night and was turned down as the kitchen closed early. However, I did not give up and came back on the last day of my trip for my birthday dinner. Loved the food. Had the waitress order for us and we sampled a number of very good dishes. I know its minor, but I really enjoyed the chips here as well. Service was excellent. If I could give one negative it would be the beer selection. Ended up drinking a standard lagunitas - nothing special.
author: J R.

description: Loved this place!  Didn't see a sign outside,  but knew where it was from looking up Mexican restaurants.   EVERYONE  was so nice & helpful.  It was very laid back,  but multiple people including our waitress came over to check on us,  even the bar tender to deliver our margaritas as soon as they were done!  Our waitress explained that the kitchen is small, so they bring the food as its ready,  which is no problem with us!  The food was amazing!  We had the fish tacos and carne asada tacos......flavor was incredible.  Wish i lived locally, I'd be a regular!
author: Christina M.

description:
Don Pistos is one of my new favorite restaurants in San Francisco, which is hard because this area has a lot of really good food.

My husband and I have only been there twice but both times the service was great and the food was even better! The Al Pastor and Sangria are my favorite combination but the other food is good as well. They don't have a dessert menu which is a down side, so instead I just have one order of the Al Pastor as my entree, and then order another for dessert!

The pricing is also good, about $9-11/per taco order which includes two medium sized tacos that they give you extra tortilla to make it into four.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this place! When you are in the area just look for a bunch of people inside a restaurant on Union street that has no sign.
author: Angelle S.

description:
Always a fun time, and not to mention good food.

Bottomless mimosas are strong and the tacos are to die for. 

Chips and salsa to start, you cant go wrong.
author: Angela B.

description:
Visited Don Pisto's last Thursday evening with my husband after seeing a lot of great reviews on Yelp. It certainly did not disappoint. 
 
Ordered tortilla soup (delish), tacos al pastor and carnitas which were both very good but wish there was more and the pork which was by far the best pork I've ever had. 
The best part about the visit was our waitress who was super attentive and very sweet. We told her we were visiting the city on our "baby moon" and when we asked for the bill, she came back with a little tub of Ben & Jerry's for me. We found out that she had run over to a store across the street to get it for us. Such a nice gesture that definitely made our night.

Overall we really enjoyed Don Pistos. I don't know what more you could want. Opinions are all subjective so visit and decide for yourself :)
author: Mandi D.

description: Amazing!! They were cranking Biggie and Usher tunes with the bass turned up when we walked in, and then they rocked my face off with the most delicious food I've had in my 5 days in SF. Sangria, fish tacos, and the hamburgesa were the highlights for my group, but - seriously - everything was absolutely delicious.
author: Basia J.

description:
I like it here.
Ceviche is good
Tacos were good
And Margaritas were good!...
I would recommend it definitely.
Only thing that was bugging me was how hot it was in there but, it is a tiny room and the kitchen is right there. But everything else was great!
author: Coraline J.

description:
Hamburguesas marinated in bacon drippings. Whole lobsters, cooked in pork fat, drizzled with cilantro butter and wrapped in fresh tortillas. Poc choc (pork chops) grilled to perfection. Mussels steamed with spicy sausage. This is not your typical Mexican joint.  

And yet, everything tastes fresh and delicious, as if it came straight from a seaside hacienda in Mexico. One where they make excellent, chilled margaritas (served in a pitcher, with salted glasses if you like). 

To top it off, the staff are all muy simpatico, providing excellent service. Our drinks were always full, our vegetarians were aptly tended to, and our large group was encouraged to stay long after the plates had been cleared. Muchos gracias in particular to Christina Alarcon: when we told her we'd be celebrating a special occasion in the restaurant, she suggested a nearby bakery for dessert, and even picked up our cake for us! Muy excellente!
author: Ryan W.

description:
Thursday, 8:00PM.
Waiter: Corey. 

Long line...

Quickie:
+Good food
+Cool decor

Suggestion:
*Expand menu

And then...?
One of our order items took abnormally long...but Corey/management made it up to us by waiving the charge. Couple that with delicious grub and they've made us fans that night!

**********
Stuffed my face in:

1. Burger
     +Toasted bun, moist

2. Steak tacos
     +Zesty salsa

3. Chips and guac
     +Fresh and flavorful guac

4. Pork and pineapple
     +Interesting take on a taco, they pulled off the savory and sweet combo
author: Chuck N.

description:
I've been to Don Pisto's many times and it used to be a favorite of mine. Their burger is fantastic, probably the most delicious burger I have ever had in my life. Not anymore. 

Last night, I attempted to have dinner there and order my favorite burger. I'm anaphylactically allergic to avocados (meaning when I eat them my entire face swells up and I can't breathe). Usually, I just tell the wait staff to not put the guacamole on my burger, they do that, and I'm able to eat the delicious burger and live to tell about it. Worked out for everyone. 

HOWEVER, last night I was made aware of a new policy: They no longer will take guacamole off of food - as it would change the "vision of the burger." Even in cases of food allergy. Chef's orders. Seriously.

Thank you, Don Pisto's, for discriminating against a person with food allergies. You've just lost a customer for life.
author: Meg K.

description:
We had my friend's surprise Birthday party here.  The staff was super accommodating, the waitress was so sweet (and hot might I add), the food was so delicious!!

If I can't get rid of the craving for their salmon sashimi even after a few weeks then I think it warrants a legitimate 5 star review!

Just take my word for it.  It is so damn good!
author: TM O.

description:
GO TO THIS RESTAURANT. Went here with a friend tonight and it was hands-down one of the best meals I've had in years. We shared the guac (with the delicious complementary chips) to start, which was truly incredible. We wiped the bowl clean and both remarked that it was the best guac we had ever had. Tasted so fresh and delicious it was absurd.

Then we both had the Pollo Asada, which was just beyond absurdly amazing. The chicken was SO moist and SO well seasoned, and the complements were all top notch.

Long story short - this place is incredible, the good is remarkably good, service is great, decor/vibe is awesome. GO HERE.
author: Aryeh N.

description:
A must!  If you live in SF, visiting SF, & thinking about SF AND you are warm blooded & not a gluten-free freak, you have to try Don Pisto's.  A solid meal!  Fun atmosphere.  Great Food & Good Drinks.  

We had the Pork Chop (very juicy), Hamburguesa (ridiculously good!), Sangria, and some Canadian Oysters.  Everything was so good.  The tomatillo salsa and guacamole were just as good.
