If you like hispanic flavors, seafood, and/or meat -- you will love this place.  What a wonderful fusion of all of those.  I'll try the lobster next time.  That looked really good, but the only problem with it was that it wasn't on OUR table.

** Get there early and be prepared to wait.  Forget driving!  Parking is awful. **
author: Sequoia S.

description:
When it comes to good Mexican vs. great Mexican, Don Pisto's fits into the latter category. Providing a contemporary take on traditional Mexican street food, Don Pisto's uses quality local ingredients to come up with tasty delights like: mexican sashimi, grilled pork chop, tortilla soup and wild Monterey calamari. There wasn't one disappointing dish amongst the bunch and everything tasted fresh, authentic and stupidly good.

The wine selection is fantastic (with several Californian options), the place is laid back and the chilled ambiance makes your 30 - 60 minute wait worth your while (this place is packed so I'm afraid you will have to settle in at the bar unless you're extremely lucky). The price/quality is also worth the trip as four of us ate (including a bottle of wine) for under $120 USD. Doesn't get better than that: http://fortheintolerants.com/2013/08/20/don-pistos-sf/
author: JoAnna F.

description: Looked for a highly rated taco spot after a Giants game and stumbled upon Don Pistos. I was completely impressed. This place embodies Mexican authenticity. The brick walls and Mexican  Coca Colas made me feel like I was make in grandma's neighborhood. Service was prompt and friendly and the al pastor tacos with charred pineapple were amazing! Great ambience, and great variety. You can go from tacos and a coke to Don Perignon and Lamb...I'm definitely coming back.
author: Chris G.

description:
How was this past Saturday the first time I had ever been to Don Pistos? I'm holding this one against my friends in North Beach because this was a truly amazing food experience that I can't wait to share with other city dwellers...onto the review...

Friday nights always end in two ways for me:

1) I go to a great happy hour with my co-workers and get unintentionally sh*t-faced, then party the night away.

or 2) I go home and lay on the couch with my roommate and down 2 bottles of red.

How did this past Friday night go? Door number 2. My parents gave me these wine glasses that hold an ENTIRE BOTTLE OF WINE. Yes, an entire bottle. How could we not test this one out? Since it was a science experiment of sorts, it didn't feel so shameful. Anyways...

I woke up Saturday morning with a real headache. You know the one...Too much wine, not enough water, and there's never food around, so what can you do? GET BRUNCH! Weeeeee.

The roomie suggested Don Pistos and I needed a longer walk than usual (to air out my purple stained teeth ha!), so off we go. 

What. A. Great. Brunch.

We were seated rather quickly by an adorable hostess who was not only friendly, but super accommodating. She found us a great spot, immediately brought out water, as well as Don Pistos's famous chips and salsa. This stuff was the real deal. It was a great green salsa with a spicy twist. If you have read any of my other reviews, you know I love the spice, so this was a great surprise for me.

Onto the real upside of this place: bottomless mimosas, sangria, or margarita's. And they're interchangeable. Umm, what? That's amazing. I'll have it all! The mimosas are not mixed with your run-of-the-mill OJ either, but this amazing pineapple-OJ juice. So bomb. 

For my main dish, I had their famous burger. This was probably the most juicy, delicious burger I have had in a longggg time. It was topped with guacamole and had a side of radishes, that really made this burger pop. I would definitely recommend this dish, hands down.

Will I be back to Don Pistos? Absolutely.

Cheers!
author: Sean R.

description:
Really great pork chop that's super juicy!
The tacos are alright - nothing special.
The calamari is good also. 

mmm the pork chop :-)
author: Ilya Movshovich M.

description: The diabla shrimp is offf the hoooook and its spicy. I'm not much of a seafood fan so if I like the shrimp, it's gotta be good. Carne asada tacos were good too and so is their complimentary chips and salsa.
author: David S.

description: All we ordered was perfect but the pork chop was worth writing a review over.  should of ordered 2!!  Staff friendly.  Place was busy but got a table okay later on a Saturday night.  I think this is better for an evening meal than a brunch.
author: Graeme U.

description:
I hesitate to believe Yelp reviews but gave this place a try inspite of their good reviews. This time Yelp was right on.
Chips and salsa to start.  The chips were a bit hard but good none the less. The waitress told us that their food was meant to share.  We ordered the lobster.  It came with rice and beans, garlic butter, and a red salas.  I can't remember if the tortillas were included but we did get flour tortillas, and guacamole.  Lobster was not over cooked.  We made burritos.  They were delicious! Guacamole was fresh and tasty. 
We will go back.
author: Alta B.

description:
i call don pisto's "fancy mexican", but i definitely don't mean that in dismissive manner as I would many of the catered for white palates, overpriced places found all over the bay area. 
don pisto's has many of the mexican staples - soft tacos, menudo, ceviche, pozole, etc. it also has some fantastic cuisine you wouldn't traditionally associate. such as the pork chop. oh my, let me tell you about the pork chop. that thing is the most succulent, decadent, piquant pork chop i've ever had (ok, that last adjective was a bit forced... couldn't think of any other appropriate words).
i also enjoyed the grilled calamari, the guacamole (which tastes the way i make it at home, fresh and chunky), and the mussels. 
they used to have these bacon marinated burgers with guac on them, but sadly last time i went it seems they've limited these to wednesdays only. this is my only gripe with this otherwise fantastic establishment (especially for those of us who don't live in SF and would only get to go on the weekends).
author: Xander C.

description: Oh my! This place is SO SO good. I came here on a Friday night and within an hour of opening they were already packed. Luckily, my party and I were seated in the main area without having to wait. The guacamole was great, the pastor tacos with SO GOOD (order comes with two tacos) and the cheese enchiladas entree was . Definitely coming back when I'm in the area! Ambience is wonderful, loud but still enjoyable. They had 90's hip hop and r&b playing which was a plus in my book. I wanted to order more but I was stuffed with the few items we ordered.
author: Jeri M.

description:
I had a wonderful birthday brunch here. The mushroom omelette was extraordinary and the all you can drink Pina Aguas Frescas mimosas didn't hurt my experience either. I'm a big salsa verde fanatic, so the fact that this is their standard salsa kinda blew my mind/gave me a food boner. 

Aside from the food, the service was really really really good. At one point I had to go put more change in my metered spot, I asked for $1 change from my waitress, rather then giving me change she gave me her parking card and told me to use as much as I needed. She was great about refilling my mimosa and making conversation with my whole group about how our respective meals were. 

This place makes group meals easy, and Sunday mornings a hazy euphoric memory of wonderful delicious food. Try it out!
author: Devin A.

description: Taco's and Snoop Dog blasting? I don't think my life could be much better. The fresh sushimi, guacamole, and Al Pastor tacos are my order every time. Blast that 90's hip hop!
author: Danny B.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!! We came on Saturday for the bottomless brunch. You can choose between mimosas, sangria or margarita. We had strawberry mimosas which were amazing! The ceviche was fresh and delicious, chips and guac hit the spot, eggs and bacon were on point, tamales were amazing, and breakfast burrito was perfection. The service was great as well. Can't wait to come back and try all the other stuff.
author: rita m.

description: Amazing!! As a transplant to California from the farm in Iowa I was really skeptical about ordering the pork chops. Most chops are thin and void of flavor. This chop was so big it allowed for left overs. The flavor was simply amazing!!  The chop was cooked to perfection (don't let s little pink in the middle scare you). The service was good nothing outstanding but good. I will be back!!
author: rebecca k.

description:
We came on a busy Saturday night without a reservation and waited about 40 minutes.  Luckily there are several places nearby to enjoy a beer while waiting.

Tried several dishes including the tamales, rib-eye, and tacos.  All were average.  The tamales were great but could have used more flavor (like a red sauce, for example).  Tacos were fine but not as good as Tacolicious and other places nearby.  Standard selection of Mexican beers, although they don't have a liquor license so tequila shots are out (apparently the margaritas are made with an agave-based wine rather than with tequila).

The upstairs has a cool space, although we were seated downstairs (which has bigger tables and is probably better for groups).  It was very loud and somewhat warm, although it was an unseasonably warm day in SF so I can forgive that.  Service was average, although they were very attentive at constantly refilling the chips (maybe to draw our attention away from the small-ish portions).

All in all it was fine but I've had much better Mexican food in SF.  Like so many places in SF this seems to be overhyped and overrated.  Next time I'll go to Tacolicious, Mamacita, or Tropisueno instead.  That said, I've heard great things about the brunch and may give them another try to check that out.
author: Ryan S.

description:
I have been here twice, the first time was great we were with our Mothers and they were very attentive and the food was great. 

The second time I made a reservation for a group of 8 of us to do bottomless drinks and breakfast. We were about 10-15 late and I tried to call and emailed the women we made the reservations through to tell her and there was no answer. She was quite rude when we got there, stating she was about to give up our table. 
They warn you that the food comes out as it is made so not to wait for others to get their food to eat. My friend and I ordered a dish to share and it never came. We were very patient because we were not in a rush but after everyone had eaten about an hour later and they wanted to leave, we still had not received our food so we just cancelled the order. 
They were not apologetic at all. 

I would go here again to give it another chance. They have a great atmosphere and the restaurant is very fun.
author: Sarah K.

description: Great Mexican food. Good ambiance. The ribeye is to die for. Get here before 8:00 as it gets crowded.
author: Mikael L.

description:
BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS / SANGRIA / MARGARITAS. Come for that and brunch, if nothing else. 

Show up early (and I MEAN early), cause the wait can get nasty fast. The food is insane; Best guac I've had in the city. Service is spot-on, ambiance is casual enough that you won't feel awkward getting brunch-wasted by noon, like me. I recommend the Hamburguesa -- It's marinated in bacon; Not really sure how that works, but I'm not questioning that kind of magic. Keep it up, Pisto's.
author: Taylor S.

description: The food is great but this restaurant is LOUD in the evening.  Even with 2 people you're saying 'what' a lot (and I'm 44, not 84!!)  I prefer this restaurant for lunch for this reason.
author: Ana M.

description:
I thought the food was a solid 3*, not the amazing food experience that everyone seemed to have enjoyed. 
The hamburguesa was good. The bottomless sangria was good, albeit pricy at $17. 
The service was spot on. They kept checking on our sangria refills and brought out fresh glasses before we even finished the previous glasses. 
It got really busy after noon on a Sunday, later than most brunch places in SF.
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
OMG. 

Bottomless fresh pineapple mimosas and margaritas.

Don Pisto caused us to go Ghosting at the local park afterwards.

Please refer to:

http://youtu.be/fdTSBalHfOo
author: Spring L.

description:
Not your ordinary taco joint. 

It's understated (is their name anywhere on the outside of the place?), a bit rustic inside, but comfortable and classy. 

Excellent service, very interesting menu and fairly priced. It can get quite crowded and loud, but we enjoyed a quiet meal nestling ourselves in after much of the lunch crowd had departed.
author: Miguel S.

description: I've been here at least a dozen times. The food is awesome and the service is great. The problem is that in the last year THE MUSIC IS SO LOUD. I'm young myself, but man, I avoid this place now and wouldn't consider bringing guests because we have to shout to hear one another. What's the deal?
author: Heather M.

description: Came here for a breakfast burrito. Service was fast and friendly. The chips and salsa were great but the burrito was the smallest burrito I've ever had in the city for $10! I get a bigger burrito from the $1 menu at Taco Bell. Also, way too spicy and greasy to enjoy.
author: Leland L.

description:
Came here on a weekday around 730pm. The wait was 1 hour?!?! Fortunately 3 bar seats just miraculously opened up right when we walked in... BOOM!

Bartender is a SWEETHEART, i wish i got her name so I can give her a shout out here. She's helpful, sweet and attentive. She let us know that the bar table is designed to crash and burn drinks if you are not careful (it can slide off very easily). She gave us great recommendations and kept an eye on our drinks/chips the whole time!

Salsa: verde, spicy, perfecto
Sangria: get a pitcher, cuz you gonna regret not getting it! 
Carne Asada tacos: good, make sure you get the gauc to make it great!
Hamburguesa: guac burger? how can you go wrong with that? 
Poc Chuc: brined to perfection, cooked to perfection, juicy as all hell and the cucumber/cabbage salsa is to die for. My favorite dish here so far.

Can't wait to come back for more!
author: Emily T.

description:
Modern Mexican Street food....

YUMMMM

I always get the fish tacos and ceviche
+ Green salsa tastes incredibly fresh with the best chips to complement them
- No happy hour prices so kind of expensive. Half of the price comes from flare and ambiance---also the fact that it is in North Beach. Bar is small, space is limited
+ Flavors are great, and have not been disappointed with the food yet.

Conclusion: I always recommend tourists to come here, its delicious and def worth trying. Its a good spot where locals go to.
author: Julia D.

description: Don Pistos is a fun a place to go with friends -- the music is bumpin', which makes for an upbeat atmosphere. My group ordered a pitcher of margaritas and an array of tacos, which were delicious.
author: Lauren L.

description: A new SF fave!  Came here a couple of weekends ago for the first time and would definitely come back.  We fell in love with the salsa there, so much that I've tried to recreate it at home.  We ordered the guac, ceviche, pork chop, and fish and carnitas/al pastor (can't remember, the margarita was strong) tacos.  What really made the dinner was the pork chop, WOW!  Super juicy and flavorful, probably the best pork chop I've had to date.  FYI: Expect a long wait and it's pretty loud inside, we had to yell across the table, but it's a fun vibe.  Lots of bars in the area to chill at while you're waiting for your table also.
author: Nancy H.

description:
Hands down, my favorite "upscale" Mexican restaurant in SF.  I used to try going here about once a month and even had my college grad party here.  (They have downstairs reserved for large groups too).  The staff is friendly and accommodating and the food is just delicious.  Only twice have I tried something that I didn't LOVE, and it was the lobster and the carnitas tacos.  Don't get me wrong, I didn't LOVE them but they certainly were not bad.  My favorite dishes are the red snapper tacos., tortilla soup, and shrimp tacos.  

They have the freshest chips and the most amazing salsa to start your meals.  Also, try the pitchers of sangria and margaritas.  Most restaurants offer pitcher drinks that are watered down, but not here.

Very nice indoor design, I feel like it's a place where you could celebrate any sort of occasion or just go out on a date.  Be warned though, it's important to get there early as they do tend to have longer waits and parking in the area is a nightmare.

Love what you're doing Don Pistos!
author: Kash S.

description:
Great experience. We ordered the chips and guac, daily ceviche (shrimp), margarita and Mexican pickles. Turns out they were out of the pickles so they brought us an oyster plate on the house! 

The shrimp wasn't quite as crisp as I would have hoped, but the avocado garnish was excellent. The oysters were fresh and flavorful. I appreciated that the plate included two different varieties to try.

The guac and salsa were perhaps the best dishes on the table, though. Salsa was fresh and green with perfect spice and the guac was super creamy and fresh too. Chips were ok.
author: Nate J.

description:
Had not been back here in years and I simply don't know why.  Don Pisto's does things right.

It feels like an authentic Mexican / South American cantina.  The food looks like what you might find down as well, but with a nice presentation for the SF crowd.

Started off with a marg and I felt it was decent, but nothing more.  My friend had a Mexican Coke.

Then we had to get the guac and chips.  You get some freshly made guac along with the thick cut chips.  Good start.

We ordered the grilled calamari that came with a nice slaw.  Quite good and the calamari didn't feel chewy for having been grilled.

Next up we hit the tacos with the camarones, carne asada, and carnitas.  All were quite good and tasty.  Was definitely impressed

That turned out to be plenty for two and we stopped there, but everything else we saw going by looked darn tempting as well.

Service was excellent and we were promptly helped with the menus and orders.

All in, we came out at about $90.  Not bad all things considered.

I need to come back more often because the overall experience is quite authentic in feel and food / drinks rock.  There's a good mood here and is short of festive actually.

Definitely recommended.
author: Patrick K.

description:
*:::Jenni LOVEs Don Pisto's:::*
 I used to live a block away and came here all the time! Hands down best fish taco in town! 
From girl point of view- this place is a Perfect date place, small portion food, relaxing music and their acid berry sangria just gets u in the mood - light and not too sweet! 
Today's fish taco was red snapper taco for $11, it's perfectly cooked and well seasoned :) so juicy and crispy at the same time! LOVE!
author: Jenni C.

description:
Went there for brunch on a Sunday...
Good things:  bottomless drinks, great server, guacomole was tasty
challenges:  food did not arrive all at once, this was the saltiest meal I have ever eaten!!!  
Salty chips are one thing (OK by me) however the chorizo & eggs, hamburger, and huevos rancheros were extremely over seasoned.  I could not even finish the chorizo...
portions are small

Perhaps based on the reviews, the nightly menu is better
author: amy s.

description: Long wait but worth it. Guacamole amazing. Sangria great. Fish tacos great. Lobster fajita great. Fun for large parties. Kid friendly. Nothing to say negative other than long wait. Service was great too.
author: Marie A.

description: Fancy Mexican food is the perfect way to describe their food. The place has a great vibe and their bottomless sangria/mimosa/Marquita (you can pick what you want each time you refill) is delicious.
author: Ming Y.

description:
I tried this place several times hoping that it would just wow me. But the last time I went was the last straw. After over an hour wait, we finally got a table right by the drafty door surrounded by extremely loud and rowdy tables. I'm okay with noise, but this was to the point of not being able to hear the other two people in our party! Our waiter couldn't hear us order and had to lean in so close it was uncomfortable. We also had a vegetarian in our party who felt very left out of the fun as their only vegetarian option was sides and a few tortillas. It was a rather gross looking pile of beans and rice. So sad. In SF it should be better than this, at least provide some sautéed veggies!

Overall the tacos were not nearly as delicious as several taco trucks I've been to or a similar restaurant, Tacolicious. I probably won't be back. Sad :(
author: Emily S.

description:
Incredible for brunch. 

We get there right at 11 and are always able to sit immediately (of course, they also open at 11 so that might have something to do with it). The breakfast burrito is a great portion, neither too big nor too small. Hamburguesa is bacon-y goodness covered in guacamole. Bottomless mimosas are standard, but great nonetheless.
author: Caroline M.

description:
This restaurant is amazing! The food is so so so good. It's a somewhat smaller menu, and I think we ordered almost everything on the menu. Our favorites included:
tortilla soup, half chicken, the Rib meat tacos (heaven in a taco). I am still drooling over everything there.

The downside to this place: The service. They don't take reservations, so they try and rush you out of there. We wanted to ahve a nice long dinner, but we were pretty much ushered along after only one hour of being there. I get they have long waits, but maybe they should think about reservations in their future, or a bigger place? Oh, and the service was slightly snooty, which wasn't fun either. Otherwise, I'd give these guys 5 stars.

Either way, definitely a treat - just know that you will wait long for a table, and they'll kick you out as soon as they can.
author: Zarpana K.

description:
Mexican sushi? Yup.  Delicious?  Double yup.

I had this place bookmarked to try for a long time but never stumbled by until my last visit to SF.  The place was still crowded late on a Tuesday night.  All of the other reviews talk about the long wait, and I can believe it.  I was able to squeeze in an extra seat at the bar, so not a big deal for me.

I had the Mexican sashimi and the tacos al pastor.  Al pastor is difficult to find on the east coast, and when you do stumble upon it, it's usually just ok.  This place made it and served it perfectly.  The salmon sashimi with lime was an excellent spin on a tried and true favorite.

I might be stopping by here for a snack again soon...
author: Nick G.

description:
Found the restaurant while browsing Yelp for some good Mexican restaurants in San Francisco. Decided on Don Pisto's as the reviews were good, prices were right and the atmosphere was perfect for a casual dinner out.

Took the transit to Union St. Make sure you know the address if you plan on going as their is no signage, which clearly isn't needed since the place was packed.

The restaurant itself is loud and small. Full of people in my age group - mid 20's to 30's. We were told the wait would be about an hour, and after travelling across town and really wanting a Mexican fix we said no problem. We were welcome to stay at the bar; had a Margarita and a Dos Equis. Margarita was excellent - we had at least 2 more each. 

Less than 20 minutes later we were seated. I have a feeling they try to weed people out by saying you won't be seated for a long time. 

We shared the guacamole which also came with green salsa. Both were great. Chips were homemade and not too salty. 

Next we shared the Tortilla soup (sold as 2 bowls); lots of chicken and flavour in the dish. You could tell it was homemade too.

Each of us finished with a different taco. Small, and served with piping hot mini corn tortillas I had the Carne Asada (very spicy) and my wife had the Barbacoa. Hers were not was spicy as mine, but both had a different sauce. Sharing and trading was encouraged!

In the end we had a great meal, ate just enough food not to feel like we rolled out of the place. Our server was pleasant, food came up fast without feeling rushed between courses. If in SF again we would definitely return!
author: Paul M.

description:
I can't begin to say how much I love Don Pisto's! 

This is the one restaurant I don't mind waiting an hour for a table - and it usually takes this long every time we go! 

This is my favorite place to enjoy Sunday Brunch, I mean what's better than Bottomless Mimosas/Sangria/Magaritas?!?!?! I crave their chips and guacamole all week long, soooooo yummy!!!! =)
author: Michelle A.

description: Great place. Excellent food fantastic and friendly service even, on a Saturday night when it's really busy. Tried the ribeye, fish tacos, quesadillas and even the daily oysters. All excellent and the prices are correct. Just be aware that the music is loud.
author: Alvaro R.

description: Worst service we've ever had. First, people who walked in, without a reservation, were seated before us. We waited for 30 minutes. We ordered 4 different plates...all came at different times. 1 came...then 7 minutes later 2 more came....then 15 minutes for the final dish. Food was great, but only had enough for a 4 year old. Extremely disappointed by the service. We read reviews and expected it to be great and we couldn't wait to get the hell out of there.
author: Megan C.

description:
Red snapper in the fish tacos must not have been fresh. I had food poisoning. The staff was friendly though. The atmosphere was fine. Just avoid the fish tacos.

The food is expensive.  You should get at least 3 tacos for $10-11.  You get only 2 tiny tacos with little amount of ingredients. 

I would not go here again.
author: Ozzy ..

description: We wanted to go here for dinner before a comedy show but the place was packed and they don't take reservations for parties less than six people. When we arrived, we were told the wait would be an hour and a half-- we didn't have that much time before the show. Pete (the manager? Owner? Not sure,) was beyond accommodating-- so friendly and offered to walk us over to their other restaurant (Pisto Tacos?) and even bought us a round of drinks. The food there was good, too! It's that kind of service that gets people to come back. Even though we didn't eat at Don Pistos, the food and ambiance seemed to be worth the wait. Pete, you rock-- we will definitely return to both restaurants :)
author: Erica D.

description:
The service was great! Our server had personality and a sense of humor. I ordered the ceviche ($13 at the time, it varies depending on what seafood they are using). This was delicious and pretty spicy (and I can tolerate spicy food very well)! The sangria was delightful, as well! It was so good, I could have had endless glasses of it.

Oh, they serve chips and salsa verde for free. Delicious! We kept asking for more. I believe they are both homemade.

I also had a bite of my friend's hamburguesa. The bacon-cooked patty was to die for. I definitely would come back again. I would love to try their brunch. We went on a Sunday, and they served brunch all day that day. Not sure if it's the same for Saturday.

Tip: definitely make reservations in advance if you have a party of 6 or more. They only take reservations for large groups. Otherwise, you'll be waiting for a while, as they are a very popular venue in North Beach. Who can blame them--great food, great vibe, great service!
author: Vera W.

description:
We had a great meal here. The food was delicious and reasonably priced. The tortilla soup was my favorite!

The only downfall was having to wait an hour and a half to get seated. The restaurant isn't extremely large so be prepared to wait. Luckily, the hostess will jot down your name and phone number and call you when your table is ready. (That way, you can walk around and grab a drink somewhere before!)
author: Jennifer K.

description:
Now I know to make reservations before I come cause last time the wait for a table, which turned out to be a joint table with two others, was 2 hours! 

However, the food was great and we ended up chatting with our neighbors. We got ceviche as a starter, then split an order of camarones tacos and al pastor torta. Food coma was inevitable! 

Can't wait to come back
author: Renata G.

description:
Caro S. seriously is the best SF tour guide... And I live here!

We were trying to find a dinner spot for my FLL gals last night in town- New Years Day. When we called Don Pisto's we were told the wait would be about one hour, so we rushed down there. When we went in to put our names down, we were told the wait had changed to two hours. Devestated, we were asked to wait while the restaurant tried to see how they could accomodate our party of 6. We were seated in about 15 min. Wow!! 

Since it was New Years, there were bottomless margaritas and sangrias. Most of us went with Taco's: Steak, Fish, Carnitas. $9 for two. 

Our server was knowledgable, the owner walked around greeting and chatting with everyone, and the music was AWESOME!
author: Jessica H.

description: If you are looking for a great weekend brunch spot you have to consider Don Pistos: Chips and guacamole to start with and killer tacos!
author: Filippo D.

description:
I'm updating my review and ABSOLUTELY bumping Don Pisto's up to 5 stars. My close friends and I came here for New Year's Eve for dinner before we went to a club to dance the rest of 2011 away. My first experience with Don Pisto's was amazing, but I didn't think they could completely blow me away the second time. Yeah, I was wrong.

We all ordered different dishes, and we each tried a little bit of everyone's food. I had been wanting to try their tortilla soup ever since I saw it on the menu, but the order is big enough to feed TWO people as a full MEAL. Soooo, I talked my 3 dining companions into ordering it as an appetizer for the 4 of us (yenno, along with the chips, salsa, & guacamole we already had on the table...). We did it, and we were all SO glad we did. The tortilla soup is absolutely delectable. Everything about it was cooked perfectly, and the flavor was amazing. The spice sneaks up on you, too. I LOVED it.

I ordered the carnitas tacos, one of my friends ordered the carne asada tacos, and another ordered the camarones tacos. All exceptional, as expected. 

Our 4th dining companion ordered one of the specials for the night, the machaca. It's basically marinated, slow cooked beef in a chile sauce, topped with a sunny side up egg. Eaten with tortillas (and rice and beans, if you like), of course. It was fucking PHENOMENAL. If I had known it was going to be that good, I would've ordered that instead of the carnitas. If that's on the menu when you eat at Don Pisto's, you should definitely order it. Trust me, it's worth it.
author: Jennifer V.

description:
After recently relocating to SF, locals told me to prepare for the amazing food SF has to offer. After eating at Don Pisto's I think I finally got an idea of what they are talking about. Luckily we came late enough one evening where we didn't have to wait long for a table, so that was a huge plus.

If you come here I recommend trying:
the mussels - the sauce they make it in SO good, its a chili like sauce 
the burger was absolute perfection so tender, we ordered a second round 
the tacos were good but a little dry for my taste

Overall, great service, great food, and great atmosphere.
author: Dani A.

description:
I can't say enough good things about Don Pisto's. A friend and I stopped in for a bite on a crowded Thursday evening after being told there was a two-hour wait at Tony's down the street. Though the restaurant was packed to the gills, we were able to snag two seats at the bar. 

The food was all delicious - we split guacamole, to-die-for tacos, and one other entree - but the main highlight of the evening was our bartender. He was entertaining and kept us belly laughing all night long. I'd literally go back just to sit at the bar again. Top it off with some delicious sangria, and I'm sold.
author: Stephanie W.

description: First review ever and i'm happy it's with this place... the service is as good as it gets - specifically Daniel who is the manager there most nights. It's a divine experience eating here from end to end. The chicken is my favorite!
author: Jack D.

description:
The pride and gem of North Beach. I dare anyone else to recommend something else. Mama's? TOURISTY AND DAT LINE. Park Tavern? Yeah, Marlowe's. Anyways. 

TAKE AWAYS: 
- They have the coolest take on the "hamburgeusa." It's a must-try from Don Pistos. 
- There's no restaurant sign, so be cool and see the three red lanterns. 
- The organic consistency of their kitchen is worth a slow clap. 

If you never ate in the Beach, please make sure this is on one of your food stops.
author: Abel L.

description: My boyfriend & I had plans to go to the annual St Patricks day alley party at Taverna Aventine this past Fri, but we both decided to avoid the green-infested cluster of intoxicated people.  So he suggested Mamacitas, but lately I try to avoid the Marina.  It was his first time at Don Pistos, so he was excited when I suggested it.  Although the wait was somewhat painful, we both agreed it was definitely worth it.  Guacomole and the succulent smoky-flavored calamari are my favorites, but seriously anything on the menu is fabulous.  Our server was very attentive and super friendly.  Will definitely come back.
author: Myra M.

description: The carnita tacos, and shrimp tacos  are awesome, loved the margaritas the service is great, very friendly we will be going back.
author: Anthony S.

description:
Came here with a party of 6 and we had an amazing experience at Don Pisto's. The Hamburguesa is juicy and as you take a bite you taste the bacon and onion deliciousness instantly. I also recommend the carne asad and camarones tacos! 

The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because it's in North Beach and parking can take forever (we literally drove for an hour before we found parking). I've only came here during dinner and it can get pretty busy, but our waitress was very attentive.
author: Sarah A.

description:
Good:
- hamburguesa
- tacos
- ceviche
- sangrias
- inexpensive
- lively

Bad:
- pretty loud
- tight
- tends to attract some show off and loud happy hour characters


I haven't had a problem with service, which has always been curt but respectful. But I can imagine sometimes the staff may get stressed out and offer poor service because of the number and attitude of customers.
author: Quarup B.

description:
So worth the wait! (In addition to the wait at the restaurant itself, I've been waiting 3 years to try this place!)

The Highlights:
- Nick the Bartender makes pitchers of fantastic + strong Margaritas!!!
- The Pescado Tacos (marinated in this aMaZiNg sauce with a kick - much much better than the Carne Asada Tacos)
- Bacon-fat-infused Hamburguesa (it's literally the flavor of bacon with the consistency of a juicy burger)
- Dessert Shots! (After two pitchers of margaritas for the table, these tasted like chocolate milk (although composed solely of vodka, I think). They were delicious!)

Would skip next time:
- The Pork-fat-infused lobster (sounds winning, I know, but the portion just didn't make it worth the price) (although if you could order just the garlic butter that accompanies it - I'd highly recommend that)
- The Carne Asada Tacos (although the meat is tender, the flavor just doesn't compare to the Pescado Tacos - put your money where the flavor is) 

But yes sir-ee... there will be a next time!

HOORAY!
author: Helen D.

description: Had a party there for a Thanksgiving reunion. Really great service and good lobsters.
author: Gina O.

description: I went there with a group of girls for a birthday brunch.  My friend chose this place because of the good reviews and so placed a reservation for 12.  When we got there, they realized that they put the wrong name on the menu however they made up for it by offering us all shots to make up for the mistake.  The place was packed so it did take them a little bit of time to get us our drinks and then the food was a little slow as well.  The guac was pretty awesome and the food was not bad though not worth the per person price given it was eggs, potatoes, French toast and 1 carne asada taco each.  The drinks did keep coming and were truly bottomless though again not worth the price .  When the bill came we were shocked to learn that we were charged full price for the one girl that did not show and they also charged over 20% gratuity to include the one person that did not show.  When we questioned the manager he was rude and said that my friend was made to sign a contract and she should have known that they would charge for the no show?  Completely bad customer service, they could have at least taken off the $19 for the bottomless drinks they did not have to serve the missing girl if not the food...definitely will not be back and definitely will not recommend to friends.
author: Claudia H.

description:
Score one for Lauren.  The best tomatillo salsa, best guacamole, best chips, best tacos, best burger...  Have the Burger on a home baked bun, grilled bun, half pound patty marinated in something really tasty and drenched in a huge scoop of guacamole.

The atmosphere is a brick cellar, old woods and hidden side street with no sign outside so best to know a local.

Wait can be up to an hour or more; so, be prepared.  I warned you; but, the wait is Worth it.
author: Gary J.

description: The waiter that served us today checked my ID, saw it wasn't an American name, started making random sounds pretending to pronounce my name. That is never funny, and you should know better. I would give zero stars if I could.
author: Nina Q.

description:
Don Pistos is a hidden gem, by far my favorite Mexican restaurant in the city!! The staff is fantastic - they are all extremely friendly. The food is outstanding! By now, I have tried almost everything on the menu and while everything is excellent, the lobster, and poc chuc (pork chop), both of which I typically would not order, are real game changers.

The ambiance is great - comfortable and fun (can get a little noisy). They also have an awesome brunch, with bottomless drinks. Drink specials Sunday evenings. This is a fantastic restaurant for group dinners, birthdays, etc. They take reservations for parties of 6 or more, but otherwise no resos - so be prepared to wait if you go at a prime time!
author: Romi J.

description:
Somehow Don Pisto's got a hold of my Spotify playlist because the music last night was on point! Give me an MGMT remix over mariachi band music any day..

Guac & chips- delicious
Mussles with house made chorizo- def. enough for 2 people to share
Sangria- not too sweet, hit the spot

Usually there's a decent wait but after 8:30 on a Tuesday there was plenty of seating.
author: Chrissy L.

description: Sangria is DEFINITELY not one of my favorites.  LA prices with nothing to show for it. Waitress was great. 3 star max.
author: Amanda F.

description: Surprised by the high rating for this place. Came here with high expectations only to be disappointed by the food and the service. To start, the place is too loud probably due to the structure and the loud music. As far as food, the chips were stale and way too salty and the salsa was sour and nothing else. We ordered the steak tacos, which were mediocre, and frankly, bland. We also ordered the Pollo Asado, which took way too long to arrive. Once it did, it was a really small portion with skin that slid off when we tried to cut it. It wasn't good to say the least. Also, the service isn't great here. Waitress wasn't friendly, didn't come around enough, and didn't always seem to listen when we asked for things. All in all, avoid this place. Too pricey even if it were to improve a little bit.
author: Gordon Z.

description:
My boyfriend took me here for my birthday and we had a great time.

We went on a sunday, so the drink specials were an awesome way to start our meal--along with the yummy chips & salsa. I am a sucker for fresh chips & salsa verde.

We opted to go with the Paseo Nuevo style lobster dinner for 2--It was a super reasonable $34!  Lobster.Flash Fried.in. Pork Fat.  YUMMMM!!!

It was a very fun and interactive meal--the lobster came split down the middle and we made little tacos with their homemade tortillas, seasoned rice & beans, and amazing herb browned butter.

It was a little bit messy, a lot of fun, the ambiance was dark and romantic, the drink specials were awesome, and it was all so affordable.  I'd come here again in the heartbeat :)
author: Tiffany N.

description:
I would have given this place 4 stars based on the food but the service and hygiene level were SO POOR that I doubt I'll come back anytime soon. 

Food: 
- Hamburguesa was really flavorful. The bun was a bit over toasted so I ate it like an open faced sandwich. 
- Sangria - yummy

Service: HORRIBLE
Our waitress was very un-accommodating and rude. She was utterly confused that we wanted sangria and margarita pitchers because who ever wants TWO different drinks???!  

My friend requested they leave the bun off the hamburguesa as she has gluten allergies and could possibly get sick if the bun touches the meat. The waitress said no and told her to order something else. WHAT???! Not adding the bun is less work for them. 

Then there was a flying cockroach in the restaurant, YES a FLYING COCKROACH, which is just disgusting. The waitress was laughing at us, saying there's a bakery upstairs which can cause cockroaches to come downstairs. That is NOT okay. 

The restaurant has potential if they'd hire better staff.
author: CL S.

description: Fantastic vibe and always hoppin! Best chips and salsa in the city. Ordering the lobster is a must every time.
author: Samantha C.

description: Great time with my buddy at Don Pisto's, unique Mexican food and outstanding service. Shannon, our server, was so helpful and pleasant.  Try the pork chops, you won't be sorry.
author: Tommy L.

description:
Don Pistos is my go-to place for groups in SF.  They have great food; a lively atmosphere; a perfect location for going out afterwards; and can accommodate large groups, which is hard to find in San Francisco. 

As far as menu choices go, I highly recommend the pork chop - its one of the best I've eaten - but you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

Their ONLY issue is the lack of hard alcohol.  They make the wine (agave) margarita's but it's not the same, so you are stuck with those and beer/wine.
author: Tony B.

description:
i cant say enough good things about this place, but here are some highlights:

-ceviche: delicious, fresh, a must try
-sashimi: i know, it's not a mexican restaurant, but its effing great. shut up and take my money!
-bottomless sangria: tasty. UNLIMITED TASTY.
-the chips: i dont know what it is about the tortilla chips here, but however it is they do it, it's magic. every time i tell myself i'm full, i cant help but snack on these things and, whoops, there goes another bowl. refill please.
author: Clayton S.

description:
Delicioso! Great lobster and reasonably priced.  Three of us shared the lobster with the fresh tortillas.  It was just as good as being in Puerto Nuevo without the line around the block.

The margaritas were so-so.  Next time, I'll stick to the real good food and a chilled Pacifico.
author: Don G.

description:
Don Pisto's is an excellent new restaurant, just a block away from Washington Square Park in North Beach.  This neighborhood has been lacking a quality Mexican place until now.

I had the chance to try out the ceviche and the tacos with shrimp, and both were very good, especially for SF standards.  I was impressed by the quality of the fish and shrimps they used.  I heard from others sitting nearby that their torta and carnita tacos were also really good.  

The venue is nice, especially for the neighborhood, filled with mostly locals.  I highly recommend this place as a late-night place to eat,or as a pre-dine place before barhopping in North Beach.
author: Yoonity A.

description: GREAT food, but the margaritas are no good. Stick with beer for drinks.
author: Rachel S.

description:
One of our best dining experiences in San Francisco.  We originally went here because the hamburgesa was on the 7x7 100 must eats.  The burger met my expectations with fresh guac and carmalized onions but the mussels and chorizo topped it off. Served with fresh garlic bread I could have made a meal of just the sauce and bread.

Make sure to show up early as the wait is long and the restaurant small but worth it.
author: Sutton A.

description:
Wow, is this place delish!!! I'll definitely be craving the mussels, served in a crazy  chorizo sauce with big hunks of bread for dipping. Be warned -- it's very rich, and very spicy. But oh, so worth it!

They also his this crazy hamburger with bacon ground into the patty, and, as though that weren't enough, an avocado spread. It was good, but a once-in-lifetime type of deal. Because I'm pretty sure I'll keel over in a heart attack if I ingest any more of that. 

Regardless of what you order, enjoy those incredible tortilla chips with that addictive green salsa, and round things out with a perfect margarita.
author: Eeeeestar T.

description: Ordered the margaritqa, red sangria, Mexican sashimi (most amazing thing I've ever had!!!), shrimp tacos, and guacamole. Amazing hot spot!
author: Angela L.

description: I love this place my go to in north beach. Great shrimp tacos and sangria. Also very tasty brunch menu. I highly recommend.
author: Dr H.

description:
I live for their puerto nuevo lobster meal, hamburguesa cut into 4s just cuz, pitcher or margies and chips and fresh green salsa for days. I crave this joint weekly.

I love the unassuming location and relaxed, almost sexy vibe.  Very chill crowd, fantastic waitstaff, even when you and your friends are last men standing. This is definitely my go-to for (very) late dinner with ridiculously scrumptious Mex food.
author: JoAnn P.

description: One of my favorites in town. I love the sangria, and the Al Pastor tacos are to die for. They have a great soup, and the seasonal corn is really tasty. It's well worth the wait, however it's better to go midweek to dodge the crazy wait that is so popular on Fridays and Saturdays. The ambiance is great, and the food is always consistently good. If you are waiting for a table you can usually sit at the bar with some chips and guac and some sangria until your table is ready. The only reason I'm not making it 5 stars is because sometimes the service isn't as great as it should be. They could be a little more attentive.
author: Juliana O.

description:
I'M NOT TELLING ANYONE ABOUT THIS PLACE.

Daniel is the shit.

Now carry on and don't go.
author: mike j.

description: Bit of a wait around dinner time especially 7, you would probably have to leave your phone number and hit a bar for 30-45 minutes before you have a seat, but the wait is worth it. I love the mussels and chorizo, grilled calamari and their pork chop! They hit the spot everytime I can't wait to come back
author: Vee T.

description:
Best upscale Mexican place I have ever had. And believe me at 5'7" 210. I've had many. My hats off to the chefs. These boys get down. Thanks for the good food and great ambiance. The whole familia wants to come back all week. 
Humbly full,
L.A. Natives
author: Hector P.

description:
This is a go to spot for my girls and I because of the unlimited margaritas/sangria. 

SERVICE: although its always like a 20-30 minute wait...I think its worth it. The host guy was too funny and really perky. Obviously he enjoys working there. He told us to grab a drink at the bar while we wait and he found us right away to seat us right away.Our waitress and bus boys were very prompt. They refilled the water and our chips and salsa right away. I didn't feel like I was hounded with "Is everything okay" every 5 mins. Thank you for that. Our waitress even had a little humor to her. 

FOOD/BEVERAGE: Tried their agave shots. I'm not a fan of shots but this was easy to take. Very smooth. Very sweet. I felt like I was taking a shot of tea to be honest. Next came the meal: Carne Asada tacos. Meat is perfectly tender. A lil bit of spice. Complimented with a dash of onion and cilantro. These tacos were very juicy and tasteful. To wash it down, my friend and I ordered their sangria. It was okay. I think it needs to be a little bit sweeter or stronger. 

PRICING: price is reasonable. Drinks and Food for two came out to be like $45 overall. 

OVERALL: definitely will come back again and bring more of my friends. Although, to those with cars...parking is scarce. Bus it. Cab it. Walk it. Unless you do not mind paying the garage fees. Or if you're like me...pretend your car does "fit" in that spot....haha lol
author: Isabel N.

description: It's super noisy in here! No sound buffer and they are playing music with a very heavy bass. So far the service is great. Hopefully our food will be also.
author: Jen B.

description:
Great food!   Very spicy but delicious.   I had the snapper fish tacos and tortilla soup and the margaritas are wonderful.  I don't like frozen margaritas and they only  make them on the rocks.  Get the guacamole with your chips and skip their house dip. 

My only issue is we had to wait 1.5 hours and since they don't take reservations for parties less than six it was a long wait for four of us.  Get their before seven if you can and it might not be as bad.  My wife and girls thought it was a little too spices so beware if you don't like spicy food.  Maybe order mild if you can't take spicy!   I couldn't eat desert but I don't think they serve it either so not sure what that was about.
author: Mickey B.

description: Lots of fun with a rowdy group of ladies, and just as special for a late-night date night. You're better off hunting the Mission for authentic tacos, but Don Pisto's is a great spot to chat over good drinks.
author: Shaina A.

description:
Honestly, I think this is a good, under-achieving restaurant. The food was solid though pretty small portions. I'm not a fan of stupid-big portions and am a hardcore foodie that will drop $500 for 12 courses of great culinary art. The portions are small for what you pay. The aggravating part was that they grossly underestimate your wait (big pet peeve of mine) - we waited twice the estimate. And then we waited a painfully long and unacceptable time before anyone showed up to wait on us. 
This place has bottomless mimosas on Sunday and that's why the place underachieves. If the food is good and the service is good, you don't need to lure people in with bottomless anything. In fact, bottomless mimosas, margaritas etc yield squatters determined to spend the day getting hammered on the restaurant's dime. This results in the front of the house having no clue how long people will squat and that means people will wait an hour instead of a quoted 30 minutes for a table, which = aggravated customers. It means you don't get tables turning which results in the restaurant AND their wait staff making less money. It's not a formula for sustainable success. Sad but true. The portions need to be a bit more adequate and the service needs to be more attentive...and for heaven's sake sell the mimosas and margaritas, don't give them away.
author: Don R.

description:
I'm so glad I ate here visiting SF because I discovered that this is my new favorite restaurant! The ambiance is so hip and the food is phenomenal. Even the chips are thick and delicious! It comes with a green salsa... I think I'm going to drool just talking about my meal.

A pitcher of the Acai Berry Sangria is $20 and tastes like juice! :) I had the manga tuna cerviche which is the most delicious thing I have ever tasted. Big cubes of tuna and manga with chopped onions and a little bit of tang. TO DIE FOR. I also had the mussels with chorizo which was good and I had the El Pastor Tacos which were basically like street tacos of goodness.  I would check out the website for the menu. There's not a huge selection which I like and dishes range around $12.

You must try or you might die unhappy.
author: Joleen Q.

description:
One of my favorite meals during our home finding trip from Dallas!

The first time we came here, we loved the experience.  We chatted it up with one of the managers (could be Zuckerberg's cousin?) and thoroughly enjoyed the food.  We agreed we'd be back and exchanged some foreign currency with him.  

Now that we are residents here, we lived up to our word, came back and the food was just as good as the first time, but the hostess (I believe another manager) should not be in any service industry dealing with living objects, especially humans.  She was just cold and very short.  We put our name in, she said 45 minutes, we took a hike, came back after 30 minutes to grab a drink at the bar, while waiting - thought we'd just "check-in" on availability and we got a "didn't I tell you 45 minutes?" UH, yeah, you did, just wanted to make sure our watches were in sync.  

All in all: the food is great - would have given them 5 stars, but you know...didn't appreciate the big attitude.
author: Alex T.

description: I've been going to don pistos regularly since I moved to SF  about 2 years ago. I go for the pork chop. It's the best pork chop I've ever had, bar none. It's huge, but that's not the reason why I love it. I love it because it tastes amazing. Well worth the $29
author: Ben G.

description:
Pssssshhh....Please, awesome mexican food in North Beach??!!  Yep, skip the italian spots and head here instead.  I shared some open faced taco with beans and meat galore, while also snacking on some pastor tacos and ceviche.  We also downed a couple of house margaritas and called it dinner.  

Service was quick, music in the background was good, and the overall experience couldn't have been better.  It is a small place so while we were leaving, and the night was getting later, it was starting to get a line out the door to put your name in for a seat.  I would go back time and time again when in the area.  This is probably considered a more "upscale yet inexpensive" (if that even works as a description) blend of mexican food that you can't find elsewhere.
author: Aaron H.

description:
Loved the food! Super cute place but small and the wait was fairly long (a little over an hour).

We were sooo hungry by the time we sat down but I don't think this is why I loved the food so much.

Carne asada tacos were a must order, and so was the mexican sashimi..
author: Julianne B.

description:
My sister loves Mexican food and had never been here.  So 2 months before her birthday, I called and made a reservation for 10 people on a Saturday night.  At the time, we were the only party to have reserved a table.  A few days before, we had a friend come in from out of town, so I called back to let them know we'd be 11 but that we were happy to squeeze.  The manager informed me that they had taken other reservations and so my party of 10 was already going to be squeezed into a table for 8.  We ended up having dinner at a restaurant that could seat us at a table appropriately sized for our party, with no apologies from Don Pistos.

Although I won't go back, their brunch is fantastic.
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
I don't go to Don Pisto's anymore.  I think it got a bit too popular and its ego outweighs its character now.  Very sad.  

[I promoted the place *a lot* and had some really snotty behavior from Pisto peeps the last couple of times I tried to bring some friends in.  I admit that last group of friends was being a bit stupid (drunk) but wasn't loud or obnoxious, just a bit dumb.]
author: Kimberly Q.

description:
Make reservations!

I've been here a handful of times, and each meal was fun and enjoyable, but it's not necessarily a place that I crave.  I have yet to try the burger and tacos though, so that may be a factor.  Here's a rundown of what I remember enjoying on my past visits:

-sangria: deliciously sweet and so easy to drink
-tortilla soup: large portion, fairly tasty, definitely on the light side as I recall
-mussels: very yummy
-breakfast burrito: I wasn't able to discern what was inside but nice presentation
-huevos rancheros: not very filling, but quite tasty
-chips and salsa: I don't care for the chips but the salsa's flavor is good, wish it were thicker though
-agua fresca mimosas (pineapple): a nice change-up to the standard sunday funday drink
author: Krystle S.

description:
At the time of my writing this, this place averages 4.5 stars with 697 reviews.  Need I say more?  ok fine, i will.  COME HERE.  EAT.  EVERYTHING!!!

I've been here more times than I can count on one hand.  What keeps me coming back?  The pork chop.  Don't get me wrong, everything else is fantastic (tortillas soup,  ridiculous sliders marinated in BACON and onion, tacos, etc etc deliciousness), but the pork chop - oh my god the pork chop.  This is the most tender, flavor impacted pork chop you will ever have.    

And, not only is the food good, but they can accomodate large groups (big downstairs group space)! a rarity in SF - i know, i've scrambled last minute many a time to try to set up a birthday party or special gathering.

Not only do you get all of the above, but the prices are incredibly reasonable.  After the number of places I've been to in the city where I can easily spend over $100 for two for mediocre food, the checks here are always refreshingly reasonable.
author: Adam M.

description: Can you say amazing? Not only did they hold our table for us after giving us a reservation the day of, but the food was incredible. We ordered just about every taco (carne asada, fish, al pastor, carnitas), plus the calamari, the rib chop, and the pollo asado. Everything is seasoned really well, and the wait-staff do a fantastic job refilling the chip trays and cups. Their salsa was killer, and the chips tasted house-made (super warm and crispy). The tortillas were also some of the best I've ever had (yes, they can rival La Palma's and La Tapatia's). The vibe is chill, and I would definitely come back whenever possible. I almost got lost the first time around because there was no sign. :P
author: Danny C.

description: This used to be my favorite place to eat in the city, but I am not sure what is going on with the ppl who run the restaurant. The food is great, but the service is absolutely horrible. They make you wait forever for a table and then seat a friend of the owner, the chef, or themselves before you (despite the fact that you have been waiting for over an hour). They will seat a group of three people so they can use half the table for another group (but this never happens and there are just three ppl sitting at a large table), but they will not seat a group of 5 people. Worst the hostess is not even apologetic for the long wait or giving your table away to a friend of the owner, chef, or themselves.
author: Pritika S.

description:
Oh, how we've been wronged in the UK. How so very much. When our American counterparts mock our take on Mexican cuisine, *this* is why. They've not just been unnecessarily harsh. For we have not been eating Mexican food all these years. Nope, we have been eating an attempt at Tex Mex instead.

Real Mexican food doesn't come cosily under a duvet of melted cheese, like it's shy and hiding from the world. Nope, it comes fresh, light and spicy. Tacos aren't crunchy shells, they're miniature pancake-like wraps. Chips and salsa ain't from a bag and a jar, they're freshly fried and that sauce ain't bright red nor could it double up as a base for pasta bolognese. Salsa verde's where it's at, and it comes while you're ordering drinks. Margaritas, to be precise.

What genuises (geniii?) Laura N and Kevin L are. These two London-based Americans took us out for our regional UK and Ireland Yelp dinner and decided to show us exactly the cuisine we'd been missing out on. Fish tacos, shrimp tacos, pork tacos (all with zingy fresh salad, lemon juice and marinated meats), steak and eggs, spicy tuna sashimi... my oh my. Not a spot of grated cheese in sight, nor a dollop of yoghurty sour cream. Don't make us eat this then send us back to our respective cities across the Altantic where we cannot actually get this type of food, pretty please.

So I know they do a pretty mean burrito in Pancho's in Manchester, I have it on good American authority (thanks Anyonita G), but this? This is something new altogether. It's not about the refried beans, the cheese, or any of that. Oh how this carrot was dangled and cruelly taken away. Plus, it's one of those uber cool restaurants that doesn't even have a sign or anything, everyone who's worthy of its treats knows where it is just from being eternally hip. Well Don Pisto, I'll miss you greatly. And I'd happily take that 21 hour trek just to reacquaint myself with those tasty fish tacos. Onwards!
author: Emma Louise M.

description: No vegetarian options.
author: Muhammad U.

description:
My first review must be a 5 star rating for Don Pistos - I cannot say enough good things about this place!

I have been a big fan since I moved to North Beach a year ago, and always make sure to bring any family and friends visiting from out of town here for brunch or dinner. It is a half a block from my house and the prices are totally reasonable, not to mention the food is always amazing!

I think I've tried almost everything on the menu but favorites are the hamburguesa of course, the chorizo mussels, french toast, chorizo + poached eggs, pork chop... the tacos are good when you're not too hungry, always love oysters and sashimi, and I just tried the carnitas torta yesterday (bomb). They have hands down the best bottomless deal in the area (mmm, sangria), even their (free!) chips and verde salsa are delicious.

Yesterday it was my birthday, and the owner Pete was able to fit me and my party of 15 in super last minute, upstairs no less! The service was excellent as usual - I wish I were able to tip our server on top of the 18% auto-gratuity, but alas, getting money from 15 drunk santa clauses is never easy. 

We came here one time and a couple of us ordered the chorizo + poached eggs but our eggs were overdone and cooked through completely. We asked for a few new eggs just to toss on top of the dish, and Pete came by to those of us that got it and comped our plates anyway. Completely unnecessary, and we were not irate by any means, but it does mean a lot for the owner to be attentive and take pride in the food and service - I think it's one of the things that distinguishes a good restaurant from a great one.

I highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone! I will be coming back as long as it's around and so am I.

Thanks Don Pistos!
author: lindsay k.

description: Best Mexican I have had in a long time, the carnitas were great, the guac was money. Simple menu, upbeat environment. Tip: wait is always shorter than they quote especially when you order a drink at the bar while waiting, also there is a big downstairs area you can't see at the entrance
author: S M.

description:
5 mimosas under an hour and all I can say is that champagne is a sneaky bitch. 

My friend suggested Don Pisto's for brunch on Saturday since I was in the city. Knowing they had bottomless mimosas for only $15 per person. It was 2:30 pm when we came in and we knew we only had an hour on the clock to essentially get the party started.

We sat down and we each ordered mimosas (with pineapple juice instead of orange juice) and both had our eye on the Chorizo & Poached Eggs (housemade country sausage, crema, and potatoes). 

We started on our drinks while munching on the complimentary chips and salsa on the table. Honestly, before the food even came to the table, I think we knocked back two or three yummy mimosas on empty stomachs. When we did get food, I was ready to scarf it down. The potatoes tasted great with a little hot sauce and I loved how the chorizo was crispy. Once the poached egg was broken and running down everything else, I was in heaven. For only 10 bucks for the plate, I was more than pleased!

At the end of the meal, we had four mimosas under our belt. We were the last people to leave as we finished our meal. Our waitress came by and gave us our last refill, finishing off what was left of the pitcher. I felt like a lush as I stared at the drink filled to the rim. A fellow employee decided to urge me to finish up and I felt like I was at a frat party. I chugged it down as I proclaimed that I hated the employee, to which he told me he loved me ;) 

Drunk before 4 pm? Gotta love great starts to epic Saturdays. Thanks, Don Pisto's. I'll be back next time to really enjoy your grub sans alcohol!
author: Vinh N.

description:
This place must be top secret..really. No name displayed and we walked by this place twice!!! Thank goodness there was an address listed.

We were in the neighborhood and were hungry. We looked up our location online to find something with at least 4 stars in the area and Don Pistos popped up.

We walked in and there were a couple of tables occupied.  The place is small, as is the menu...and the kitchen/grill area.  They are very limited in options, but what they do make is tasty.  

They make a KILLING...a few simple options, small portions and high prices (for the quantity).  That said....

We liked the chips and salsa (unlimited quantities). It was Sunday, so they had $2 Mexican beers and $3 sangria. Can't beat that! :)

The tacos come in 2's and on small corn tortillas with a pepper and some radishes. We ordered the Alaskan Halibut fish tacos, Carne Asada and Camariscos (I believe that was what the shrimp one was called.) I tried all three and they were all tasty.  

The atmosphere was intimate and simple, while the service and the food was unpretentious and tasty.  No complaints here!
author: ZZ K.

description:
I know my review may stand out as an outlier here... but I had a horrible experience. 
Waited an hour and 10 min for table, when we were told 45min. Not too surprising for a Friday night, but what really bothered me was way the host handled it. 
The Sangria was ok, but not very strong.
The chips were very very salty (to the point where two people in our group wouldn't eat them) and there we no other appetizer options. 
As far as the food, they said the plates were "meant for sharing" and they came out as they were ready. I think they really just couldn't handle the coordination of having everything come out at once. 
And the final icing on the cake- I was horribly sick for 24 hours after eating here. 
We won't be going back.
author: Kristy M.

description:
A hidden gem in the city, they don't even have a sign outside the restaurant! The place has a romantic - ish ambiance, my fave is their big windows and very traditional looking chairs and table! I felt like I was eating at a latin American's house. 

The food is beyond amazing! From the chips, to the salsa, to tacos! I had the shrimp taco which has good guac sauce and plenty of jumbo shrimps! My friend had the carnitas taco and he said the sauce was amazing! We went on a Sunday which they have $2 beer and $3 sangria! The only downside was looking for a parking, it took us 10 mins driving around to look for one. 

It's super worth it though, and I'm def coming back to try their ceviche!
author: Cathy B.

description: Love Don Pistos! Had my birthday party here and the event coordinator did a great job at pulling together a dinner for 25+ people! Will always come back here when I want to eat something delicious :)
author: Vanessa L.

description: Great service and food. Server was vey nice. Salsa was great and fish tacos were amazing.
author: Babylon M.

description: sunday morning brunch...quick cab to north beach...seated and surrounded by bright windows at entrance level...bottomless mimosa $thirteen!...little weak, but tasty...fill 'er up!...few tacos for sharing...carnitas, carne asada, fish and more tacos...tasty and loaded...double tortillas separated and fillings split to make a pair to four tacos...more bite manageable...al pastor always the favorite and guacamole fresh...chips and salsa endless....finding don pisto's relaxing enough for a long bottomless brunch...cheers!
author: Hen A.

description:
Being a mere visitor to SF, I felt guilty eating Mexican food outside of the Mission.  Holy crap, this is a guilt I can live with!!

Being Sunday, they extend their brunch menu all day, meaning there were a lot more huevos, a lot fewer tostadas.  We weren't expecting this, and almost left.  SO glad we stayed! 
I ended up with the taco sonora with carnitas.  It's served on a large, homemade flour tortilla, topped with beans, pico de gallo and crema.  The tortilla was what all other tortillas wish they were: fluffy, chewy, substantial enough to encompass the mass of toppings.  The carnitas also pulled their weight ("pulled"...get it???), being obscenely juicy and crisped a bit for extra flavor.  Eating that burrito/taco was the messiest undertaking I've experienced since letting my students experiment with finger paints.
The only addition was a healthy drizzle of their AMAZING salsa verde.  I would come to Don Pistos to eat only that salsa and their ridiculously tasty chips.  

The busser said their menu was on the smaller side because they get their ingredients fresh.  You can absolutely taste that freshness, which makes Don Pistos a necessary indulgence.
author: Jackie M.

description: Wow was that good. The steak was some of the best I have had in quite a while and the guac is life changing.
author: Greg G.

description:
After spending 5 years in San Diego and Los Angeles, I still can't seem to find that one place to satisfy my late night, Tijuana-style taco cravings.  Don Pisto's doesn't do it but it's still pretty damn delicious.  Everything here from the free chips and salsa to the chicken tortilla soup is fresh and yet so tasty.  It's rare to find a place that serves Mexican food in a nice environment that still tastes authentic, unlike that one very popular favorite amongst the hipsters in the Mission...

They don't have a liquor license but they can serve beer and wine.  They make these awesome margaritas with some type of tequila-like wine - really good!  The chicken tortilla soup here is one of my favorite items to order, especially on a cold winter night.  It's very comforting and filled with fresh avocado and pulled chicken breast meat.  I could have this every other day!

We were speaking with the bartender (I think he's the owner?) and he said he spent some time living in Puerto Nuevo.  This means I definitely need to come back and try the lobster.  My college spring break memories of lobster in Rosarito are coming back to me now...
author: Joanne L.

description:
I absolutely adored this place.  I loved the coziness, trendiness, location, music and the vibe of the restaurant overall.

We ordered the pitcher of sangria, and shared three plates which was more than enough food for two, especially if you're munching on the chips in between!

The place reminds me of a mexican version of suppenkuche if that can be said? Just as busy and even has a fun little bar to grab a drink while you wait for your table. 

Definitely worth checking out.

Only thing that scares me are the reviews mentioning the health dept is investigating?! gross :(
author: Sunny D.

description:
This place was amazing! It was a busy Friday night so we sat at the bar. Friendly barkeeper who explains the bar is slanted so use your napkin under your drink.
We ordered chips and guacamole. Simply amazing.  The green salsa is so good... Very lime-y but I love that. I had the Calamari and my daughter had the shrimp tacos. Huge YUM on both! We shared a side of pinto beans.  We were full but kept eating, it was so good!
author: Deb W.

description:
I've been dying to come try this place out and I was finally able to come here as a celebration of finishing up my last classes I need to qualify for my certification. I had dinner with  two of my old college buddies.  
 
We had that complimentary salsa, the green one. I love lemons/limes, but boy was this over the top too much lime! You know that sour face you make when you eat a lemonhead candy? Yea, super sour.  
  
We ordered two sets of tacos, pitcher of sangria, and the poc chuc. The tacos were spicy. Good, but not great. The pitcher of sangria is a bit watered down tasting nor was it too strong. 
  
On the other hand, the Poc Chuc was amazing. Deserving that 5 stars rating. Wow, the best pork chop that is tender, juicy, full of flavor.  

  
The service is great, they constantly came around to make sure our glass is filled and were checking to see if we needed or wanted anything else. 
 
Coming back for that pork chop!
author: Becky Q.

description:
Te amo Don Pisto's! Not your average mex restaurant! Def has a baja twist! 

Really appreciated that the menu was tastefully simple and tailored for share bears. 

Two of us shared and was perfect amount of food:
Sashimi of the day (salmon):
really fresh, had a small chile on top of each slice, sprinkle of cilantro and a twist of lime. 
Tortilla soup: Very tasty
Pescado tacos: Huge chunk of grilled fish that was perfectly cooked. Not like most fish tacos that are drowned in sauce and cabbage, but left struggling to find the fish. 
Chips and salsa were fantastic! Loved their salsa verde! Perfect combo of cilantro and jalapenos. 

Will be back for the lobster which was cooked Puerto Nuevo style. And probably to try everything else on the menu;-)

Great service! Loud but lively atmosphere!
author: Gina H.

description: Google this restaurant for pictures. We googled it while walking at Pier 41 when one us craved Mexican food. It was a five minute drive from the Pier and we could have walked it too. This is a casual Mexican restaurant with a lively atmosphere. They have the authentic Mexican food as well as other food to keep everyone happy. Our kids enjoyed the chicken wings which was excellent and the sauce was offered on the side. I tried the fish taco and it was very good. There were mini soft tacos. The picture shows 2 tacos but there are 2 more underneath with plenty of fish and garnishing to split it. Everything is priced very reasonable so you do get a great value in a lively atmosphere with excellent service. The nachos are great and they come with spicy and very spicy green sauce to dip in. I tried the very spicy one and it was just right for me. The only not great was the sangria that my wife tried and she ranked it OK. It sure is a good eat. Enjoy.
author: Bud D.

description: This place had good flavors in the food but lacked vegetarian options. The guacamole was very good. The service was average, overall I see why people like this place so much but for me it was just okay.
author: Sara M.

description: Had a great time at Don Pistos last night... There margaritas are delish, not too sweet, and the food was really good... My only complaint was the music, I thought it didn't fit too well with the vibe.  But I would definitely go back some time!
author: Sonia S.

description:
ATMO:  Like the wooden tables BUT, for the love of god... a little sound dampening goes a long way (they have none).  Even with few people there, it's loud.

GUAC:  Not as good as mine, but the best restaurant gauc I have had in Cali.  It's $6 but they do give a good amount (too much for 2 people and a meal).

SALSA:  Verde and chunky!  Tasty!!!  Great to add to the Guac! :)

CHIPS:  Thick, crispy, tasty!

FEEEEEEESH TACOS!:  I loooooooooooove di Spy-Sea Feeeeeeeeesh Tacos!  Plenty of feeeeeeeeeeeeeesh and oh so Spy-Sea!  Comes with a grilled pepper, tasty and spicy as well.

CEVICHE:  Chunky, tasty, (and thank god, they clean their shrimp!  no poop!)

OVERALL:  My favorite "Mexican" spot in the Bay Area!
author: Dan M.

description:
One of my all time favorite spots in the city! 

Margaritas are strong! Chips are crispy and salty! The food is spicy! 

I have never been disappointed with anything I have ordered here. 

Be ready for a long wait before being seated, BUT the hostess is willing to take your cell phone number and call you when your table is ready. 

GO GO GO GO GO....this is an all time, bucket list, must try type of place!
author: Julie J.

description: For a great Mexican brunch in the city- this is THE place to go. Everything, and I mean everything on the menu is amazing! Also, any excuse to have great quality margaritas at noon on a Sunday is worth it to me. I would definitely try and get a reservation though because it can get packed. We were in a group of 8 and got to sit downstairs in the cool lit basement, which was very fun!
author: Sabrina S.

description:
Changed my concept of Mexican food. This is a gem.

Great specials but you can't go wrong with the tacos al pastor or pescado. Their tortilla soup is excellent as well.
author: Nicholas H.

description:
So I have been wanting to try Don Pistos forever.  Yes, forever.  Before it was even a concept.  Before I was even conceived.  Etc.  Forever.

Finally went with a group of friends.  Here is what was put in front of us at one time or another at the throughout dinner.

* Corona Light
* "The Don" Margarita
* Chips and Green Salsa
* Mexican sashimi
* Grilled calamari
* House-made Chorizo Mussels
* Al Pastor Tacos
* Hamburguesa

I wanted to love Don Pistos way more than I did.  I wish Yelp would let me give a 3.39 star review or something.  This isn't a three star rating restaurant, but nor is it a four star rating restaurant, in my opinion.

It just feels like something is missing.  True, they don't have a liquor license and so technically the liquor is missing.  And yes, the kitchen is extremely small and they don't have dessert options.  And maybe there isn't a sign on the outside of the building so you could say that is missing, but I prefer it that way.  But, I don't really hold any of those things against them.  It's something else. 

Maybe it's just that I wasn't blown away by anything that I had to eat here.  Not to say things weren't delicious though.  They were.  Just not all that memorable for me, which I had hoped for.

But let me make myself clear.  I do not dislike this place.  The staff is very friendly and inviting.  I like the simplistic atmosphere.  It's a comfortable place to have a good dinner at.  And I didn't even touch on the Hamburguesa which is outstanding.  It is delicious.  

So...at the end of the day though, I do recommend Don Pistos.  Make your own call.  I trust you will have a good experience.  And honestly, might have a different of opinion and be completely blown away by their food.  It's worth a visit in my book.  I'm sure I'll give it another shot at some point myself.
author: John R.

description:
Don Pistos was pretty good, but definitely not a place for a date. My boyfriend was in town and he's a fan of tacos so I figured Don Pistos would be a good place to go to. I'm giving it four stars because although the tacos were excellent, I couldn't hear jack shit while I was there. It was so loud that I couldn't hear a word my boyfriend was saying.
