I was literally yelling throughout my whole conversation. This place is really meant for groups of 3+ because the ambiance is definitely not intimate and crowded. I think if I was with a group I'd have a better experience but it was hard getting a word in while I was there.

Despite, the noise level the tacos we had were very delicious. We had the Al Pastor and the Carne Asada which was very good. The Carne Asada is a little more spicy if you like spicy food but the Al Pastor was perfectly cooked and blended together with grilled rib chop and pineapple- the Al Pastor was my favorite out of the two. I'll be going back but with a bigger group!
author: Megan D.

description:
Quality is in the house.
Pork Chop- Amazing (fat juicy meat)
Burger - Gives me instant wood
Good service but crowded.
Brunch is ehhh (worth skipping).
author: Kyle K.

description:
Stopped in with family during spring spread to avoid "tourist"crowd. Mission achieved. This place is AWESOME. Our 16 and 13 year old daughters loved it. Food was excellent, sangria was very good. Price was very reasonable. Service was top notch. Would highly recommend.

The tortilla soup is a meal in itself.
author: Mike L.

description:
After climbing up the stairs to Coit Tower my wife and I were tired and hungry.  She knew I wanted Mexican food and found this place on her wonderful Yelp app.  I'm so glad she did.

We actually almost walked right past it.  No big signs to advertise the location, but a delivery truck parked outside clued us in.  

Cutting to the chase:

Chips and salsa:  Fresh homemade chips, and salsa verde served to go with the bottomless margaritas.  Yum.

My wife and I ordered and shared the Fish Tacos and the Taco Al Pastor.  The fish tacos were very good, fresh grilled white fish (I forgot to ask what kind) very moist and tasty.

The star of the show, however, was the Taco Al Pastor.  OMG  Some style of pork with, a sweet/smokey sauce with pineapple, and fresh cooked   beans served on a homemade tortilla and drizzled with creme fraishe (I think).  One of the best thing's I've ever eaten!  The only downside it that we don't live in San Francisco.  I would come here all the time if I did.

Friendly and timely service.  Keep up the good work, Don Pisto's.
author: Doug F.

description: Sangria and taco Sonoras were so good! The guac and green salsa were solid as well. Simple menu and pretty good service. Small space and it can get pretty loud/busy, but this place is a must-go-to in north beach for a modern twist on Mexican!
author: MissM R.

description: Burger marinated in bacon with guacamole. Chorizo mussels. Yummm!! The chips and dip are tangy and it's like that Pringles commercial, you just can't have one. The tortilla soup is good. Even though it's meant for two, I had a bowl to myself. The sashimi is ok and will probably not order this again. Every since I was introduced to this place, I've been here many times. Great place and atmosphere to hang out!
author: Minh H.

description: Had an array of tacos:  snapper, shrimp, & chicken.  All were excellent and authentic.  The complimentary salsa verde was also very good.  Highly recommended place...easy to miss though since it is on a side street and not obviously marked...google maps on the phone is your friend.
author: Matthew L.

description:
Like it! great food, friendly, communal tables, full bar. 
lovely servers and bartenders, very efficient service so you never wait too long. 
Chicken tostadas, Hamburgeusa, tacos, all very good. Mussels excellent. And one of few places that will actually leave off the cilantro if you ask them too.
author: Lily K.

description:
Who would have thought a tasty, unassuming Mexican restaurant was hiding in North Beach??  What a pleasant surprise!  I'm not a big fan of North Beach (mostly due to crowds, tourists, and people who've had a few too many drinks) but Don Pistos is tucked up just past Washington Square which felt perfect! 

The service was great, but the food is why I can't wait to go back!  Fantastic chips and salsa (a unique, green chile salsa!),  and a hamburger at a Mexican restaurant?  That usually breaks every rule I have but at Don Pistos you'll miss out if you don't get this juicy, tender, bacon marinated, guacamole slathered, chewy bun burger! We also shared the shrimp tacos which were great as well.  Not too expensive, and when we got there around 6:30 on a Saturay night there was no wait--well worth it!
author: Katy R.

description:
My affection for Don Pisto's is marred by the fact that I'm a big girl's blouse when it comes to spices and spicy food. I'm building my resistance but it is a slow, and often futile, process. I know, I know. "Why go to a mexican restaurant then, Lani?" I hear you. 

Up for giving most things a try I went along to Don Pisto's and spice wars aside, it is nothing short of amazing. My dining companions confessed pure and unadulterated love for the Mussels and Chorizo. 

While I can't truly tell you about the food what I can tell you is their staff are hands down awesome-sauce. After giving a dish a red-hot go my searing mouth couldn't hack even the mildest of their dishes. At this point I would have fairly copped the staff reminding me where I was and telling me to "suck it up!" 

Instead our lovely waitress went out of her way to have the chef prepare me a shrimp taco without any chilli or spice whatsoever. For this I am eternally grateful. While I didn't get to experience the true Don Pisto's menu, I enjoyed everything about our dinner there.
author: Lani P.

description:
A tucked away, neighborhood restaurant.  Know the address because I don't even think there was a name on the door.  Casual, brick interior with basic wood tables.  Nothing fancy, it just felt good/comfortable.  

Sat down and ordered the chips and guac and a round of margaritas and their speciality shot of tequila.  The guac was excellent.  The salsa had serious kick and was also fabulous.  The tequila shot was a unique tequila and made it go down a little to easy (which led later to another shot).  The menu is simple without a ton of options, but a good range of them.  Two of us ordered their street tacos (one carnitas and one pescado).  The carnitas were amazing!  The pescado was also good, but after the carnitas, I couldn't relate.

Our services was great, friendly, and just right.  We had a great time shooting the breeze there.  Like I said, it was all just comfortable with great food.  Can't wait to go back on my next trip into the City.
author: Carol L.

description:
They don't take reservations for smaller parties, so when i found out that we had a party of 6, I immediately picked up the phone and reserved that table! 

We  got there and were promptly seated. I didn't have drinks, but had a sip or two of the Micheladas and they were delicious! 

The chips and chile verde salsa wasn't too runny, and had the perfect amount of bite to it.--So far so good! and we hadn't even ordered our entrees yet!

For entrees, we decided to try everything out:

1. Carne Asada Tacos--just a regular beef taco, but it was definitely good. If I had to pick my top tacos, I would go with the Al Pastor and the Camarones though

2. Carnitas Tacos--Didn't try it, we had so much food, I physically couldn't fit the in my belly. Sad face

3. Pescado Tacos--Again, Didn't try it, we had so much food. I was so full!

4. Camarones Tacos-The shrimp was SO juicy, flavorful, and had a great kick of spice. Very good! 

5. Al Pastor Tacos--Very spicy (in a good way), with that hint of citrus from the pineapple= perfection. My favorite tacos of the 5 that we ordered. 

6. Mexican Sashimi--this was just ok. Of course, I'm comparing it to the one I had at Nobu. I would skip this entirely. They had a mini jalapeno on top, so I understand the concept, but it doesn't really deliver. 

7. Tortilla Soup--this might be the best soup I have ever had! It definitely serves more than 2. We had a table of 6, and we all had a bowl, and some even had seconds! There was avocado in the hot soup--I don't think I've ever had it, but it was delicious. The perfect amount of salt (tortilla soups tend to be overly salty), and it wasn't creamy. There were huge chunks of chicken in it as well. 

8. Hamburguesa--I can't describe it. Everyone thinks, "what the heck is a hambuger doing on the menu?" Well, TRY IT. There is something about it that is just so good--it has a smoky flavor, kind of like it's been on the bbq just a little longer, but definitely made with love. 

9. Pork Chop--cooked and seasoned perfectly! It was juicy and not dry whatsoever, and the mini cucumber salad on the side was something I wanted to learn how to make. 

10. Chile Verde Chicken Tostadas--this was good, for sure, just after all those tacos, this is the least memorable dish. you can skip this if you are ordering all those tacos. It's basically a crunchy version of those tacos. 

11. 2 servings of rice--it wasn't just plain old rice. It was damn good. They did some seasoning to it, and I'm not usually a rice person, but needless to say, I ate that up like it was my last supper

12. 2 servings of beans--you can definitely tell it wasn't out of a can--or if it was, they really disguised that well! Felt authentic to me! 

Overall, service, company, ambiance, food = GREAT! Will definitely be going back!
author: Victoria B.

description:
Truly over rated...

Let's start wit the positive comments...the owner is extremely nice and accommodating.  He noticed that we barely touched the chicken tortilla soup we ordered so he came over and asked if everything was ok.  So we were honest and told him it was horrible...it was basically an over salted broth with shredded bland chicken and big chunks of avocado.  He was completely apologetic and took the soup back and removed it off our bill.  That was a really nice gesture!

Unfortunately, as nice and friendly as the staff was there, the food was just so so.  The shrimp tacos had a nice sauce but shrimp were small.  The carne asada tacos tasted like ground beef.  The portions were small and tacos were way over priced at $4.50 each for a small street taco.  For similar trendy mexican food, I would go to tacolicious as they are pretty authentic.   But otherwise I would stick to going to the mission...
author: Tina L.

description:
SO GOOD!

Everything I've tried has been delicious!
the  chips and salsa  and margaritas are perfect, delicious fish and shrimp tacos, incredible sashimi (so good my bf poured the remaining liquid in his glass and drank it like a shot) and oysters (I had never liked an oyster before), and the lobster dinner for 2 was amazing!
my boyfriend gets the hamburguesa and said it's the best burger he's ever had! 

There's usually a bit of a wait to get a table, but it's well worth it and you can always get a margarita or a beer at the bar while you wait!
author: Nicole D.

description:
What to say about Don Pisto's? This tiny restaurant, hiding in North Beach is a true gem of the city. A few reasons why:

1. The staff is phenomenal, friendly, and attractive.
2. The Poc Chuc (Pork Chop) will change your life.
3. Mussels with Chorizo - yes please!
4. Amazing tacos.
4. Margaritas and Sangria to die for.
5. Great atmosphere and clientele.

But actually, none of that matters because you know what this place has?
Great Chips.

Tips-
Come with your ID and don't be a pain when the bartender asks for it.
The bar has a pretty steep curve to it, make sure you use your napkin.
Try not to get addicted...
author: Evan K.

description:
Oh Don Pisto's,

Let me count the ways ... (literally)

Your astoundingly friendly and helpful staff have made my experiences with you unforgettable.. whether accommodating for a party of 2 or a party of 15.. (you take reservations!)

You have never rushed me, even when my friends arrived much later than anticipated. 

Your downstairs area (read: decorated basement) is awesome.

You offer AMAZING food at an unbeatable price. I have loved every item I've ordered, and my entire party of 15 did too! (especially the Mexican corn!). 

Oh, just one thing: please improve your margaritas- they're weak (possibly because you don't use hard alcohol) and not up to par with the rest of your menu!

That being said: 

To anyone looking for great service, great food, and a great time- I highly recommend Don Pisto's!!
author: Roxane W.

description: Really hard to find but glad we did. Had our 6 year old with us. Didn't know there was no kid menu. Great staff made up a quesadilla for him. He said he would come back every day if he could. I had the tamales and husband had the Al Pastor tacos. Fabulous all around!!
author: Caity Y.

description: Came here for brunch - the staff was fabulous, but everything was only okay. The music playing in the restaurant was super loud and made it hard to hear the waitress or carry on a conversation. The food was good, but the portions were small and I felt like they just tried to fill you up on chips. Good about gluten allergies.
author: Beth W.

description:
So I went looking for Mexican one evening, and Don Pistos in a dingy basement, with half the crowd pouring out into the street seemed like a viable option.

They've got an interesting setup going, an overpopulated Margarita bar, what seemed like multiple layers to their basement, and a pretty constricted menu - tacos, and a few main courses.

If you're a vegetarian stay away; but if you aren't, dig the hell in- they've got really good stuff. I tried the tacos and the mussels and chorizo, such a great combination. They served the mussels cooked in tomato and chorizo.
author: Rahul J.

description:
Wow, what great food.  Friends from out of town wanted to go to a nice sit down mexican restaurant.  Where do you go for that?  I always go to taquerias, so I looked on yelp and found Don Pistos.  No sign outside, agave margaritas, a simple, but out of the norm menu; I was nervous that I would going to disappoint my friends.  And they were apprehensive about the place.

Then...then we tasted the food.  Muscles with chorizo, tortilla soup, ahi tuna, pork chop.  It was agreed that no one had ever tasted a better pork chop.  The hamburgasa, has bacon in it.  Ok bacon in a hamburger, pretty typical, until you try this juicy compelation of beef, pork and avocado.  Don Pistos has made me think differently about Mexican food.
author: Harry B.

description:
This place gets a lot of hype and it only does because in comparison to other mexican food in the city it's a little better. Or it's one of the few places for mexican food that exist here. 

I came on a Friday night and it took about an hour to get a table. The chips and salsa were good, but it took forever to refill on them. When we finally get a refill it was the leftover chips from another table that the waitress dumped into our bowl. I guess I was too hungry after waiting so long that I just ate it.  Then I ordered a few tacos and was left starving.

I had some shrimp tacos, yes there were real large shrimp in there, but they tasted like nothing flavorful. The tortilla fell apart on me and basically it all exploded. And what's up with NOT being able to get a burito? And no vegetarian friendly options AT ALL? If you're vegetarian, you'll be eating chips and salsa all night. 

If you're LA purist who loves el cholo, olvera street, the holes in the wall,  or venture further down into San Diego for your mexican fixes, then Don PIsto will probably leave you disappointed. If you're here to feast on food then it won't be a good idea. 

I'm giving the place two stars because it has a nice ambiance to it. It's a good place to throw back a few margaritas with your friends and be tipsy enough to not care about how the food tastes.
author: Christine B.

description:
I'm writing mostly to rave about the service I got at brunch this morning. 

I was really excited to try Don Pisto's, especially because I don't eat meat, and read that there was a vegetarian brunch menu. Unfortunately for me, the non-egg eating and usually dairy-avoiding patron, vegetarian here includes eggs and cheese in everything. They made me something egg-less, and it was all good. Everyone at the table LOVED the food, and we got a side of guac that tasted fresh and delicious!

My small table decided not to indulge in the bottomless brunch cocktails (alas, they looked amazing). I was SO impressed with our waitress because a) we did not order drinks, b) she did not ignore us after realizing we would not be a big ticket, c) she was just a freakin awesome waitress! Super friendly and attentive to our table, we had everything we needed without being hounded every minute. 

My only real complaint is that they don't have coffee. That's just weird. However, they did allow us to go get coffee at a nearby shop and bring it in. Just a weird management choice on their part.  The other super-waitress quality our gal had was that she held the food until everyone was back at the table, ensuring no one had cold eggs. How sweet! 

I look forward to returning to Don Pisto's to try out their dinner menu sometime soon! 
Definitely go here.
author: Abby W.

description:
A friend from Spanish class has been buggin' me to go with her to Don Pisto's. Raving. Raving. Raving. "Okay. Okay," I promised. But the weeks went by... I dunno... I'm never in North Beach. But finally tonight, there I am. After the Rhys Darby ("Flight of the Conchords") show at Ccobb's--where my waitress bought me a cocktail and told me I was her favorite customer--grin, I popped over to Don Pisto's for a couple of shrimp tacos. And loads of really good chips--no charge. Tacos were fantastic--holy guacamole. But skip the wine-based marg and go with Pacifico.

My friend texted she was already in bed, so missed my cherry-pop.  But the place was super fun alone, so no harm, no foul.

Great staff. Great food.  Great vibe. Hit it.
author: Scott W.

description: Best Mexican Food Restaurant in San Francisco. The ambiance is perfect. From what I can remember it was kind of hidden but once inside you're tummy will start to rumble. You can full on see the kitchen from which they cook all their food. The bar is a bit small but a great seating spot to wait for an open table. I have this thing for ceviche, and their ceviche was the best! It helped me improve my ceviche skills at home from some of the added ingredients I saw in the bowl. I also had the chicken tacos (to die for). Margarita's are the best after a long day  of walking. I was impressed with the hubby for finding the place. The music was loud which we like. Can't wait to visit again.
author: Vanessa F.

description:
I've been here a couple times and have never been let down. 

They have the freshest, fruitiest sangria and their tacos are hands down THE best I've ever had. My favorites are the shrimp tacos because their shrimp are super juicy and the al pastor tacos cuz they have a little bit of a sweetness to it from the pineapple.

You get 2 small tacos per taco order, but they really load the tortillas up so they are enough to fill you up. Oh and they give you their homemade chips and green salsa while you wait. I could eat those allll day. So good!

They don't take reservations for parties smaller than 6 people, so expect to wait a while on weekend nights. You can always wait for a seat to open up at the bar and order from the full menu there as well if you dont want to wait so long and dont care about where you're sitting.  

Great place for girls night out, guys night out, a birthday party, and even a family night or brunch (if they are hip enough).
author: Ashley M.

description:
This place has great food and pretty reasonable prices.  I was put off by the "brunchers"  who were obviously enjoying the bottomless alcohol and were really noisy, but once I got the first taste of their delicious salsa, I was happy we were there.
They do not have diet drinks which I thought a bit odd and that is the only reason I'm giving them 3 instead of 4 stars.
author: Sue G.

description:
Chips and guac here are definitely on point. The best I have had in the city yet, and I am a self described guacamole maniac.

The tacos were also delicious. I had the snapper tacos which was the fish of the day and it was really good. I tried the carne asada which was really spicy (a huge plus in my book) but maybe a little too salted.

The atmosphere is really cool too. It's a darkly lit brick interior and on the loud side but it somehow oozes class at the same time.

It's a little on the pricey side for how small the tacos are but you can always get back at them by eating a ton of the free chips and salsa.
author: Ryan J.

description:
Love this place! 

Here's why... 

1. Exceptional service! 

2. AMAZING Sangria, get the pitcher for sure. You won't be disappointed.

3. Sharing is caring --  you can definitely go and pick a new dishes and share. The portions are big. One thing that I would have normally not had that was actually pretty great was the Poc Chuc, not sure how they make it, but it was delicious. 

Make sure you make a reservation if it's a busy night, tends to get crowded.
author: Ivannia D.

description:
I have never had better tortilla soup. There, I sad it. Seriously though... this place is so awesome. It's a little rustic, but go with it, you won't be sorry. My friend and I shared the tortilla soup and mussels with chorizo. I usually HATE chorizo. Really, I do. These mussels were so tender, so delicious, so unbelievable. I barely even tasted the taste of chorizo that I don't enjoy! Everything was just wonderful.

Order the sangria to go wash down your meal and be very happy that you did! Don Pisto's is a meal you won't forget, and an affordable one at that. Check this place out if you are in the area, it's a North Beach spot you'll thoroughly enjoy.
author: Jess C.

description:
This place is truly a jem. The service was friendly right from the moment I walked in. After the bartender looked at my ID (I'm 21, not a surprise) and seeing that we both have lived in Missouri, my first drink was on the house. Who doesn't love a free (amazing!) sangria. I just moved into the neighborhood and he assured me that everyone has each others back, which made me feel very welcomed. He made great small talk with me and my mom.

The waitress we had was very friendly and informative on the menu items. She came to the table at the right times while also lettings us take our time and not rushing us. I got some of my food wrapped up to go and she even through in a small free bag of chips. Very appreciated! 

It's no doubt that the food was amazing. I personally got the fish tacos - to die for. We also got the grilled corn, not sure what all was on it but I've never had corn that great before, and I'm from Kansas City. After dinner another waiter/buser came up and talked with us, recommended a few places around town since I'm new to the city.

Overall an A+++ experience and I'll be returning very soon!
author: Ann P.

description:
Why, why, why does the wait have to be so long every time? I've never been here when there wasn't a wait and I'm always starving when we show up. When the hostess says it'll be about an hour for a table for 2, I always smile and say, "Ok, put me down!" but inside I want to throw a fit like a little kid. 

I know that kind of wait isn't atypical in the city, but still. 
I wish they took reservations for tables less than 6. 

But, even with the wait, I still love this place. 

Those chips and green salsa are great.

I should try branching out, but I've always gotten the Carnitas tacos because they are perfect. Perfect. And, like others have said, you can actually get 4 tacos out of the meal.

My boyfriend gets Machaca, which is also pretty perfect. I'd never had it before having it here. Tender beef in a soupy, slightly spicy sauce with an egg on top and tortillas served on the side. Really filling. 

My mouth is watering, but they don't open until 5:30.
author: Jenna R.

description:
I went looking for this restaurant because it looked interesting.  We were staying down  by Fisherman's wharf and walked up Columbus to find it.  I followed my GPS and stood in front of the Don Pisto's for a couple of minutes until I realized we were there.  There was no signage except the small menus in the window with the name on them.  Since it was dark they were hard to see.  You can find it by the address but you really know you are there because of joy and friendliness of the staff and patrons.  My companion and I are around 50 and we were clearly the oldest (by far) of the people in the restaurant.  It was crowded, but they took our name and told us it would be about 30 minutes.  At 7:30 that was a bit longer than we had wanted to wait but he offered to buy us a drink if we would hang out and wait.  We felt instantly welcome and decided to stay.

I am sure glad we did!!!  The food was amazing.  We eventually were seated at a table in the corner and ordered the guacamole.  Now I am an avocado farmer that has become very adept at making great guacamole, but theirs rivaled anything that I have made.  They also brought out a Tomatillo salsa that was outstanding!!!  

We first ordered the Tortilla Soup which was very good with generous portions of chicken and vegetables.  It was well flavored but not real spicy.  An excellent way to get the meal started.

We then ordered the carne asada tacos and the pescado tacos.  The portions are "small plates" and the tacos came out very timely.  The carne asada tacos were outstanding with the meat well marinated in a rich sauce.  My companion and I both loved them.  Then she informed me that the I could have the fish tacos because they were too spicy for her.  OMG - the fish taco's were the best I have EVER had.  The sauce that they were marinated fried and served with was incredible.  While a little spicy, the flavor was amazing.  Now I have had all kinds of fish tacos over the years.  I have never had anything close to these.  

All through the dinner, the staff was enthusiastic, attentive, and incredibly welcoming.  It is definitely a young crowd but the prices are reasonable, the food is outstanding,  The vibe and atmosphere is lively, welcoming, and the kind of place you just want to hang out.  I can't wait till I can come back here again.  Overall a fabulous dining experience!!
author: Rick R.

description: Mighty packed little suckers...enough filling for 4 tacos. The meat is tender and seasoned well. The pineapple got lost in the flavor of the al pastor. The carne asada was the better of the two. The salsa verde was a nice starter. Will come back for carnitas
author: Eve C.

description:
Yes. Yes. Yes. 
Atmosphere - great. 
Food - great (fish tacos best thing on the menu / spicy tuna tacos a little gimmicky).
Service - unexpectedly great. 
Price - great. 
Go here. Order a few tacos + guacamole and a couple Pacificos. Go home happy and glad you live in the city.
author: Carl A.

description:
This place was great. Service was excellent. Food was cooked to perfection and the price was right. I can't say enough about how much I enjoyed this food. I don't think you can go wrong on the menu but I especially like the carne tacos. Delectable!

Only issue is the parking in that area. But hey, you can't win them all.
author: Diego C.

description:
Bottomless Mimosas so sweet and darling.
Guacamole fresh to order.
Fresh salsa. 
MUST HAVE: Al Pastor Taco Sonora

I have no idea how the waitresses are so skinny at this place. The food is amazing.
author: Judy L.

description: One of the best places I like to go on outings with friends. Atmosphere a long with the service are great and friendly. Food are pretty affordable is under your budget.
author: Krystal S.

description: The absolute best hamburger I've ever had. Will come back every trip into San Francisco. LOVE Don Pistos
author: Howard B.

description:
Though I have been to Don Pisto's a number of times for brunch, both in small and medium sized groups, I am basing this review solely on my experience of going in a group of 15+. 

For groups of 15+ Don Pisto's asks that you fill out a reservation form confirming your time, date, and the number of guests in your party. Once they have received your reservation request, they send you a set-menu from which you choose 5 of their ~15 AMAZING options. 

Each member of the party pays $30 (before tax and tip), which includes a family style brunch served with the 5 items on the set menu, chips & guacamole, and BOTTOMLESS mimosas, sangria, and margaritas. I strongly recommend the sangria!! 

Christina was super helpful in organizing this birthday brunch, and the waitstaff was great! I would recommend this spot for a fantastic brunch to anyone who asked!!

ALSO, as the only vegetarian in my party, I still left stuffed with delicious foods :)
author: Sarah P.

description: Amazing food and service! Mimosas were delicious , guacamole and tacos were amazing. Would definitely recommend this place!
author: Lindsey R.

description: Fantastic food.  I found this place on Yelp and the reviews were spot on -- great food, nice atmosphere.  I will come back the next time I'm in the Bay Area.
author: Anup M.

description: Still the best! And now I can say you need to try the Pollo Asado if you venture here. The chicken is prepared to perfection. And if you have to wait for a table, the bartender is cool as hell. As he knows well, I won't come to SF without at least once visiting Don Pistos!
author: Osito S.

description:
Go, just go, go, go. 

The tacos... YUM
The salsa... amazing
The winner? The HAMBURGUESA. SO good!

This place is a must try.
author: Alison M.

description: This place is fantastic. It is currently our 'go-to' place even with the wait. It's so refreshing to have actual non-taqueria Mexican food. While I'm sure the dishes are liberal on the term authentic, everything is great. Mussels in Chorizo broth FTW!
author: Dave W.

description:
Where to start.... food was good, but just to spicy. I would recommend to get the shrimp tacos with a pitcher of margaritas. The waitress was so nice and helpful with the menu. The only bad thing about this place was the host. He was really rude and did not look happy at all. 
Overall if you love spicy food this is the place for you.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Dollar for dollar, Don Pisto's is the best restaurant in the city.  D.P.'s is like one of those upscale NYC Mexican restaurants but better and 1/2 the price.  Fun, lively brunch spot, the best chips and salsa around (thanks for hooking me up with the salsa recipe!) and usually blasting some good old school rap to boot.  No vegetarian options listed for dinner but don't be fooled.  For a measly $7-$8, they will prepare a massive vegetarian platter - beans, rice, guacamole and cheese with fresh tortillas to make your own tacos.  It doesn't sound like anything special but it is.  Trust me.  

Side note:  It used to be a great place to have a party but they've jacked the prices up on groups.
author: Robby W.

description:
Oh yeah!

This place has a nice feeling and I would recommend anyone to go here that's not in a hurry. Went by a weekend night some time between 7 and 8 and asked if they had a table for two. They had but we would have to write down our nr. and was told that we would have to wait for approx. 1 hour.
Went to a nearby bar and 1:30h later the door guy called, our table was ready!
When inside I ordered Chips & Guacamole, Oysters and the Poc Chuc + some mexican beer.

Order a Poc Chuc and you will not be disappointed!
"But Poc Chuc...", you may ask, "...what is that?"
Pork chops with more pork than chops. Little bit spicy, lots of meat(!!!).
On a side note: The guacamole was one of the best I've ever had. Just wanted to make sure no one misses that one.

Like the former governor: "I will be back"
author: Mattias A.

description:
I'm going to provide a proof of my rating. Each category has a possible rating of (0-10) with a rating of 10 beings extremely favorable. 

teh Facts: 
_________

* Hostess says 20-30 min wait, but seats us in under 10] +8

* Bottomless Mimosas @13/person] +6
      I
      ^^^^^ Started out with a pitcher, once that was d'd then it was waiting for the swamped staff to give a shit and refill. Quality was good, alcohol content was "Average". 

* In a party of 3, serve 2 then the third over 20 minutes later] +0 

* Serve a burger of such awesome concept yet horrific prototype that I can only finish half (imafatassandalwaysfinishmymeals)] +1  
_________

sum(x*) = 13, 13/ 4 = 3.25, 3.25/2 (convert to 5 star scale) = 1.625 ~ 2 

In a nutshell, this place blows and I will not go back again. I do have to give thanks though, for it has enabled my fist two star review. Thanks Don!
author: Nick H.

description: This place is great, though a little pricey. It's a little on the loud side, but a great precursor to a night out in North Beach. Also I wish the hamburguesa was always on the menu :(
author: Ash S.

description:
Came here last night with a party of 7... we did have to wait a while, but I thought that the wait was justified considering the size of our party and the fact that it was Saturday night at a popular spot. Also, the wait did not even seem long, we got drinks at the bar (bartender was great) and had a good time sanding around talking. 

The service throughout the meal was friendly, and the food was amazing!! I had to get the Hamburguesa after hearing so many good things about it, and it was worth it. I had expected the food to be really good, and it even exceeded my expectations. One of the best burgers I have ever had. Some others at our table got tacos, and everyone was satisfied with their meal. 

I love the atmosphere and the people here... I can't wait to go back and try more things on their menu!
author: Alison B.

description: Don Pisto's is a fun restaurant that is good for food and drinks. It is an ideal restaurant for groups or dates as it is a very social environment. The menu is pretty limited in items and I was not very impressed with the tacos but I was a big fan of the pork chop. This beast feeds 2 easily and it was grilled perfectly well. Meat was tender, juicy, and well-seasoned with great al pastor like flavors. Cool spot in a fun neighborhood right next to the North Beach bars.
author: Ed L.

description:
If this was a report card, Don Pisto's would get an A. I have so many favorite restaurants in this area already, and Don Pisto's adds yet another reason for me to love North Beach.

What we got: 
- Carne asada tacos and camarones (shrimp) tacos: Much fresher and lighter than the tacos you might be used to. i especally loved the shrimp tacos.
- Ceviche: Theirs is much chunkier than I'm used to, but it worked. It comes in a light dressing which really brings out the flavor.
- Tortilla soup: Simple but delicious. Very comforting.

Drinks: Sangria and Blood Orange Lemon margaritas. Both were strong and delicious. The blood orange margarita is really tangy :)
Ambiance: Industrial brick on stainless steel - dim lighting, reggeton music
Service: A short wait for a table (20 minutes) but great service
Total: $86 (dinner + 4 cocktails)
Verdict: Go! Amazing food and drinks in a hip, trendy atmosphere.
author: Mariela D.

description:
Great food and good sangria! Brought in a small group of friends on a Friday night and although the wait was obviously long we all sat in the bar and had amazing service from the bartender. 
Everything I tried on the menu was awesome but the mussels are incredible! My husband hates all seafood, but even he thought they were great. 
People complaining about the long waits here or anywhere else in NB need to realize that all the good places are packed pretty much Wednesday - Sunday. If you want to avoid crowds try to go early afternoon.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
I'm a total idiot for filling up on the chips! I had to wait 10-15 minutes for my friend to show up so by the time she got there I'd eaten the entire basket. This was a rookie move. I couldn't finish my plate which rarely happens. I recommend the chicken tostadas and carne asada tacos. Plenty of other good stuff on the menu I'm excited to try on a return visit.

Thursday night I showed up at 9 and was seated immediately at the long table up front that was split up into a few parties of 2 and 4. Service was friendly.
author: Jonathan G.

description: Fantastic place to eat. Everything was great. Highly recommend the ceviche, pescado tacos, camarones and diabla shrimp! Rice is delicious. Size proportions are great for sharing. Staff is friendly and atmosphere is lively. Definitely would come again
author: Mike T.

description:
I've made two visits to Don Pisto's and am already anticipating my next visit.  The restaurant is cozy and lively, their service friendly, and their food delicious.

The dining area is small, with ten small tables (2 or 4 people) and one large table.  Additionally, they have a private room in the back for large parties.  Reservations are only accepted for parties of 6 or more.

What would make me happy in life would be a never-ending supply of their thick, creamy guacamole, juicy, tender carnitas tacos, and charred-just-right hamburguesas.  Oh, and their sangria is mighty flavorful, too.

If I could, I would give them 4.5 stars because they are so close, but not quite perfect:
- The guacamole took so long to arrive that we only had 3 minutes with it before our food arrived.  Once I tucked into the food, I was too full to enjoy any more guac and most of it went to waste.
- The tortilla soup I ordered on my first visit was less than satisfying - thin and flavorless - really not up to par with their other food.
- The hamburguesa was a tad too salty on my second visit.

But, overall, really, really great.  Don't let the horrible North Beach parking situation dissuade you - this place is completely worth it.
author: Pei K.

description: This place was freaking delightful. Came out here during ChefConf 2014 and was so happy. Came with a group of 6. We asked the waitress to just bring an assortment of food so we could try everything. The hambergesa was the best out of everything. But that doesn't mean everything else wasn't delightful also, because it was.
author: Jake M.

description: Best Mexican Food I have had north of the border.  Excellent Margaritas, taste like fresh squeezed..sans the sweet and sour, which makes it perfect for me.. Great guac & chips, not that you need anything more than their super tasty complimentary green salsa to go along with their homemade chips.  Amazing Guacamole Hamburger/torta.  Truly surprised, we came here with locals and they recommended the Hamburgers...I wouldn't have ordered it otherwise.  Makes for a great appetizer too, if you ask for it to be cut in fours.  We devoured them.  We were a large party of 10 so we tried a lot of what was on the menu.  Their Shrimp, Fish, Chicken and Steak tacos are good, but the Pork and Pineapple combo (aka el pastor) is amazing...and I don't like sweet...this isn't sweet, it is perfect. Can't wait to go back next time we are up in San Fran.
author: Monica R.

description:
YES! Food, drinks, the scene!

Took my gf here for our 4-year anniversary dinner. We put our name down and they said it would be an hour wait. No problem, we grabbed a drink at Maggie's down the street and came back. This place was packed and the spot to be on a Saturday night. Sangria's are a must.

We finally sat down and ordered the Mexican sashimi, carne and fish tacos, and guac. Everything was spot-on. Guac was fresh and chunky with a little kick. Mexican sashimi was very tasty and the fish was fresh. No stringy-ness at all. 

The tacos were great. Very filling, but the salsa on both were a little too spicy for us. We'll take note of that and ask for it on the side next time. 

Reservations for 6+ people, and I would recommend this route if you're looking to come on a Fri/Sat night. Otherwise, plan ahead and get here early. 

Looking forward to coming back here!
author: Phil L.

description:
I like when menus consist of few items because I feel as though the chef/cooks can really perfect what they have to offer.  There was a  downside I saw with this at Don Pisto's. If you have minimal options, at least make sure what you do have on your menu is ample--2 items on the menu were completely sold out by the time we ordered

The Sangria is pretty mediocre to wash down after the delectable mexican sashimi. The tacos were good, but I'd say short of what'd I'd expect upon paying $11 for two street tacos. 

I'm not sure I understand the hype of this place.
author: Stef H.

description:
My favorite Taqueria! $3 Sangrias are awesome!
Salsas here are very authentic and have very unique tastes.
author: Nick C.

description: This restaurant is amazing. We went here for a late dinner and it was crowded. The environment was so nice and made you feel excited. We ordered salmon, which was covered by Chilly. It was so spicy but delicious. The ribeye  and lamb dishes were very good and went perfect with the corn and avocado. I definitely will go back here, and suggest my friends to come because this restaurant has a huge place for group.
author: Angie N.

description:
It's so easy to miss this spot because it seems hidden on Union, but once you go there, it will always be on your taste radar.  

The hot chips and salsa are amazing.  You won me at chips.
Fish tacos and hamburgesa are sooooo good.

The vegetarian plate of beans rice and guacamole is a great option if you don't eat meat or fish.
author: Nancy M.

description:
I've had Don Pisto's bookmarked forever, but am rarely in North Beach. The other weekend we happened to be starving in North Beach around 5:45 so decided to cross Don Pisto's off the list. Good thing too, because a little after 6 and there starts to be a wait. 

+ Loved the beer list. Pretty much any Mexican beer you could want. 
+ Chips and salsa - yum! The salsa is a green tomatillo and is very tasty. 
+ The tortilla soup was just okay - the one I make is better (thanks to Rick Bayless's Sopa Azteca recipe). 
+ Now, on to the hamburguesa... yum. whatever you've heard about it is probably true. The beef is a different consistency than most burgers (more like a meatloaf? hard to describe), it's cooked all the way through but still very moist. It's topped with creamy guacamole. The bun is soft and a little sweet like a torta bun. We decided that it's a perfect thing to split -- too delicious and rich to eat the whole thing. But definitely a must-order.
+ If you have a large group reservation, there is a huge private room downstairs -- don't worry if the main part of the restaurant looks small! 

There are a lot of delicious options for sharing and the Mexican beer list is great, but what I really like about Don Pisto's though, is that it's a great value. 

After writing this review and thinking about the food, I already want to go back!
author: Emily C.

description:
Easily my favorite Mexican restaurant in SF. The Hamburguesa alone is enough of a reason to try this place. Hamburger marinated in bacon and onions topped with guacamole... you're already making your reservation aren't you? That part is a bit of a drag; they only accept reservations for parties of 6 or more. So if you plan on going solo or with a small group make sure to get there early. The wait can get to be over 2 hours. 

Atmosphere is fun and hip with good music. The service has always been good and prices are very reasonable. Only wish this place was bigger so the wait wasn't so bad.
author: Jace A.

description:
So, I am giving this place four stars partly based on the fact that North Beach is to Mexican food as the Mission is to Italian.  The only two regular Mexican restaurants her, Zorro and Nico's are complete garbage and that sets the bar a little lower.   I am a fan of Mojito's tacos, but it is more of a bar that serves Mexican food than a Mexican restaurant. 

That said, there are some really good items on the menu here.  The crevice is pretty unique and the pastor is some of the best I have had.  Also the service here is really friendly and fast considering how packed the place can get.  The down sides with this place are that it has a rather limited menu and is on the pricy side for Mexican food.
author: Derek n.

description:
I heart this place. First time was last week for my bday. Second time was tonight. I think I'm addicted.

Their chips are amazing, mussels and chorizo are to-die-for, hamburguese is out of this world. Everything here is unique and made with love.
author: Jenny T.

description:
Big fan of Don Pisto's! I've been frequenting this place since I used to live in North Beach and it has consistently left me wanting to come back for more. Perfect for friends visiting from out of town, double dates, birthday parties, Sunday brunch or just to satisfy your taco cravings! 

In summary: tasty food for unbeatable prices in a toasty and trendy dining environment.

Now on to the food. The free salsa & chips are amazingly fresh. The chile verde salsa is a perfect balance of citrusy, spicy and savory.  The chicken tortilla soup is HUGE! I've shared an order of the soup with 4 girl friends before. It's good but nothing special. All the entrees (carne asada tacos, carnitas tacos, fish tacos, hamburger, chile verde chicken tortiallas...) I have ordered have never disappointed me. My favorites though are the chicken tostadas and al pastor tacos. But you can't go wrong with ordering any of their delicious tacos! 

Warning: The place does get pretty crowded on Fridays and Saturdays so expect to wait awhile if you go during the weekend dinner rush. But I promise the wait is totally worth it!
author: Hannah N.

description: Ok, so as I just told the waiter, every time I think the Mexican food is improving in Vermont, all I have to do is come here for the superb carnitas and margaritas, and sorry Vermont, it just WON'T DO!!  Not going home.
author: Nancy S.

description: The tacos here are good, but overpriced...  But you're paying for the ambiance I guess.  Now, the pork chops, delicious!!!  Enough to share (or not).  I also came back a couple of times for the calamari which is excellent as well.  Definitely one of the few good restaurants in north beach.
author: Tiffany H.

description: My husband and I have been going here for a few years, and WE LOVE IT. Every time we visit San Francisco we make a point to eat brunch here. The unique mimosas and high quality Mexican fare are fantastic, and if you go when it opens (10 or 11 am?) there is no wait. LOVE, love, love this place.
author: Christine F.

description:
i live in north beach and this is definitely one of my favorites in this area. forget the italian, come to don pisto's for some fancy mexican food. be prepared to wait since it's always packed. 

here's what i ordered. 
- hamburguesa - 5 STARS!!! delish. i always get this here. 
- pollo asado - SO GOOD
- pork chops - ok if youre limited on items you can order, pick the top two. these are good but not as good as the hamburguesa or the pollo asado 
- al pastor tacos & suadero tacos - you should try at least one taco. i liked the al pastor better 
- guac & chips
author: Jen S.

description: This place is great if you are with a group of friends looking for a few good drinks and some good food. I think if you come here you are more paying for the ambiance more than anything. Don't get me wrong, the food and drinks are really good, but not amazing. If i could give 3.5 stars I would :)
author: Tyler L.

description:
I'm sorry, but all I have to say is this:

GO EAT THERE!

The food was amazing!

The service was amazing!

The atmosphere was upbeat and fun.  The room was loud, but....great fun and well worth having to repeat a few sentences between bites of deliciousness. 

Oh, it was crowded when we got there...we had to wait 30 minutes or so for a table....we thought about leaving and eating at an amazing pizza place nearby.  That would have been a HUGE mistake.

I will definitely be coming here again, as soon as I'm back in the area.
author: Timothy L.

description: Great food - def try the diabla prawn. Enchiladas were good too (not too cheesy). Four stars because margarita was horriblé.
author: Sandeep M.

description: The food is deeeeelicious, the service is good, the music is great. They give you freshly made tortilla chips and salsa verde when you sit down, and they refreshed it for us when we asked. Their Al Pastor tacos were amazing, as was their Pollo Asado, and their flour tortillas are freshly made in house right when you order.  They have Mexican diet cola which was delish.
author: Tara K.

description: The Mushroom & Serrano Chile Omelette was fantastic. The side of potatoes was pretty much equivalent to what I would imagine a crack addiction to be. Everything was fresh, service was quick, and it did not break the bank at all. Fabulous.
author: Alex N.

description: The food was tasty, sashimi and tacos were great. So was the tortilla chicken soup. Service was cold, rushed and not much more than mediocre. The food wasn't worth the bad service.
author: Demitra D.

description: I can't even begin to explain the magic that happens at Don Pistos. From the intimate seating, to the personable & attentive staff, this has got to be one of my favorite places to eat in the city. I have been here about 5 times, and seriously dream about the food when I am not there. I've tried just about everything on the menu and it is all impeccable & full of flavor. The seafood is fresh, the meat is tender, the soup is amazing. It is just one of those places that everything on the menu is to die for.
author: Yasmeen K.

description:
This is by far my favorite Mexican food in the city.  Great location, cool atmosphere, reasonable prices, and first rate food.  
I knew this place was good when I went back down to So Cal to re-visit my favorite spot there and it just couldn't compete with Don Pisto's.  I'm very thankful this spot is close by and is open late.  
By far my favorite Tortilla Soup.  
It is also a great spot for take-out as the food is still warm and delicious when you arrive home.  
The owner is a super cool guy who really cares about his restaurant and his customers.  
Like their green salsa, this place is HOT!
author: Devin C.

description:
Food: Everything was good, but my favorite part was the 32 oz Coronas in the brown bottle. Best Corona I've ever had.

Ambiance: Intimate and hip with a dark Spanish dungeon kind of feel

Service: Good 

Price: A little pricey for Mexican food, but well worth it.

Overall: If you're in the area and don't mind waiting, check it out.
author: Binh D.

description: The House Mussels with Chorizo Sauce could be my last meal on earth and I'd die a happy man. Awesome place to come and grab a bite. Staff is awesome. Overall great place to be.
author: Gustavo C.

description:
Where have you been my whole life?

A limited but delicious menu of inexpensive Latin food, served until just past midnight with an informal but professional style in an ambiance that belongs to a restaurant at least twice its price.

My tuna tartare or ceviche or whatever they call it was first rate, not a huge dish but quite generous for $13, one of the most expensive things on the menu.  The fish itself wasn't anything to rave about, just basic big, somewhat soft white and red tuna slices, but it was assembled and flavored so well, swimming in a special-purpose salsa-like dressing that could be a dish in itself.

The sangria was for sure in the top of the class, robust with a good dose of alcohol, with good bottom notes, not too dry but not especially sweet, and a little fizz.  You could drink four of those at a sitting, especially on Sundays when they're $3 all night.

The chips tonight were a little too thick and chewy for my taste, oil probably wasn't hot enough, but they were homemade and the green salsa was good.

Four stars on the food for tastiness, and an extra star given the price, decor, and total lack of any trouble or fuss.
author: Gil S.

description:
Now, I don't normally like Mexican food, but Don Pisto's was quite a pleasant surprise. However, I don't think it's really Mexican food like what I imagined (taquerias). I mean, they have a burger and it's a damn good one, too. Really good. I tried 3 different tacos and they were all good, especially the fish one. Sangria was light and refreshing. The mussels were spot on as well, especially when you sop up the juices with bread. My sis-in-law said everything she's had there has been good and she was right. 

The waitress was really nice and checked up on us from time to time. The chef didn't like that I wanted the burger w/o avocado (allergic), but he/she did it anyway. However, I was warned that it wouldn't happen next time. So, basically either I don't order it at all or scrape the avocado off and risk a swollen throat. I thought that was kind of mean, but I guess I can understand the chef not wanting to do any special orders. Iono...
author: Freckles H.

description: Cute little hole in the wall. Food and service are both top notch. I highly recommend the poached eggs with chorizo! Best seasoned breakfast potatoes, ever.  The decor is very welcoming and rustic. Went on a Sunday and enjoyed the bottomless mimosa's which were interchangeable with their sangria and margarita's. Our server Nikki, was awesome, I hope you get her!
author: Andrew S.

description:
Must eat: guacamole, their green salsa dip for the chips. Use that on the order of carne asada. 

The steak is too tough even though medium rare. Love the atmosphere. Very lively and busy at night. Like the music. A mixture of classic rock and rap from the 90s -- love it and the updated songs of today. Make sure to check the hours of operation and not go when they are closed.
author: A R.

description:
We had a group of 13 and Don Pistos was able to accommodate us with a large reserved table downstairs. The hostess was patient even though some in my group arrived an hour late. We started with the Acai Berry Sangria (best I've had), Calamari (delicious, came with a sweet dipping sauce), Guacamole (generous portion) 
Entree recommendations:
-Hamburguesa: Flavor of the meat was delicious and came topped with guacamole 
-Shrimp tacos: Two tacos served with a generous portion of shrimp on each. Good flavor
-Pork chop (special): Very moist and had amazing flavor

Our waiter was attentive and cheerful and our chip bowls were never empty. The best service I've had with a large group. They also didn't tack on the automatic 15% tip for a group larger than 10.
author: Claudia H.

description:
It's four-star good.

The food is good, the service is good, the menu is a tad limited, 
and nothing is exactly "outstanding" or "stunning"; which is just fine.

Good, reliable, consistent, tasty. I live nearby, so it's totally worth it.
Would I go more than a mile out of my way to go here? Not really.
author: Max R.

description:
After last night's meal, it is safe to say this may be my favorite restaurant in the city. It's SOOOOOO delicious! I have two very important words: LOBSTER BURRITOS. They brought out a 1.5 lb lobster, fluffy thick tortillas, rice, beans, melted butter with cilantro and some cream sauce, and amazing salsa to allow you to make your own burritos. SO GOOD. I took my boyfriend here for his birthday, and we were both so happy and full after this meal. They also have amazing margaritas and sangria. We also had oysters as well, which were really great too. 

I've also been here for brunch a few times, and their brunch is out of this world as well. I only got the breakfast burrito, but I think they took it off the brunch menu (sad face, but I'm ready to try more items!). I also think this is the only place that i've found to have bottomless mimosas, sangria, AND margaritas during brunch. If you come with a big group that orders a variety of the three bottomless options, they will just start bringing out pitchers of everything. 

Yes, there may be a wait, but it is very, very worth it. They also allow you to give them your number, and you can leave to go to a bar somewhere else until they call to tell you your talbe is ready. After now having had both types of meals here, this restaurant can do no wrong in my book. GO THERE, I promise you will not be disappointed!
author: Dawn O.

description:
its great.
they keep the menu simple with just a handful of choices all of which are excellent.  i have tried every plate except the lobster....i'm not a lobster fan however my friend who has it often says it is really good.
no hard liquor but plenty of mexican cervezas.
author: Alex S.

description: Everything is great here. Get the spicy salmon tacos to start off. Then wash it down with a cool margarita.  I've only tried the chicken and pork chop - they're both amazing. We didn't get desserts but had more margaritas.  I was lucky not to be in the lineup. Get here at a decent time or call ahead. They don't take reservations.
author: Vik M.

description:
We are eating our way through the alphabet and searched on Yelp for an appropriate "D" restaurant to try out.

The restaurant is tucked away in a residential neighborhood, and if one wasn't paying attention the storefront would easily be missed. The ambiance was simple; a dark space with mood lighting, lots of chit chatting, and the smell of food and smoke wafting from the open kitchen.

We ordered the "Hamburgesa" and "Poc Chuc". 

The "Hamburgesa" was different, definitely not the typical version we are used to. It has a slightly smokey flavor to the meat. While it is tasty, I don't think it'd be something I'd particularly crave for. It was lacking something, maybe needed more guacamole, to balance the savoriness of the beef. 

The "Poc Chuc" was much better. It had a bold flavor and cooked perfectly. For $17 (versus $25+ that I've seen at other places), I thought the pork chop was a good value as the chop was quite large. 

Overall I enjoyed my dining experience here at Don Pisto's. I wouldn't go out of my way to visit, but the "Poc Chuc" would definitely be the thing to entice me to do so.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
4.5 Stars! My question is when does a hidden gem cease to become a hidden gem? I think Don P might soon surpass it's statute of limitations on that moniker. 

Walked in with 2 other friends on a Wednesday around 7:45 and had to wait around 15 minutes for  table. Oddly enough aside being tucked away into a side street away from the real hustle and bustle of North Beach the decor lends Don P to really actually feel like a hidden gem. Dark wooden tables accented by the brick walls with some abstract paintings gives this place a very seductive feel. 

Chips: Right away when you sit down a FRESH plate of chips is placed in front of you with salsa. I think we went through 3 plates, it was impossible to stop. I worked hard to restrain myself.

Ordered family style:
Taco #1 (Carne Asada: mesquite grilled steak, arbol salsa, onions, cilantro)- Delectable!
Taco #2 (Camarones: Sauteed shrimp, garlic, red onion, avocado salsa) - my fav of the three. Perfectly blended and I love myself some advocado salsa.
Taco #3 (Al Pastor: grilled rip chop, charred pineapple)- Just my own preference, but not a big fan of pineapple so it was just satisfactory to me. Friends agreed. 

Hamburguesa (marinated in bacon and onions, guacamole)- Coming in my friend provided a lot of hype about the burger. I came here specifically for the burger and it lived up to the billing. It's a very simple burger, there aren't a million toppings inside and you can actually fit it in your mouth. What it may lack in toppings for some people it makes up in flavor. The meat is very juice and marinading it in bacon and onions is a genius move. I had a great appreciation for the flavor. The guacamole was icing on the cake. Simple and impactful... let the meat shine. My kind of burger!

The service was excellent altho the waitress found it bizarre when my friend asked for a different kind of salsa for the chips and tacos. It seemed like they only had one option. I prefer my mexican restaurants to have a full blown selection of salsa!
author: Jack C.

description: Great place for small or large groups.  Wish they were able to offer more than just beer and wine, I can survive on sangria.  The soups, tortas, tacos, ceviches are really good and surprisingly they have one of hte best burgers in the city, ground bacon in the burger, topped with guacamole on a fluffy bun.  Yum!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
the brunch is amazing. bottomless margarita/sangria/mimosas and you can switch between the 3! the breakfast burrito is perfect and not too big of a portion like most. the chips though... that's what gets you. they are so good, so don't eat too much to spoil your meal! i sound like your mom...

and i change my mind. this is better than nicks!
author: Megan F.

description:
This place is excellent! I came here on a Sunday evening when the beers were only 3 bucks. We had  the shrimp tacos, carnitas tacos, mussels & chorizo, and the calamari skewers; each dish being very tasty. The presentation of the food was also very nice, along with the atmosphere/decor of the restaurant. You can tell all of the ingredients are very fresh and well prepared. The service was also very professional. I shoved one of those roasted jalapenos in my mouth and was burning up so bad that I had to have our waitress get me a glass of milk and side of sour cream. I can normally handle spicy food fairly well, but just a warning - don't eat that jalapeno all at once!

This place is a gem, for sure.
author: Anthony L.

description:
Brunch review! Five stars overall not only due to their food, but due to their amazing service and for putting up with so many drunk people all weekend.

Drinks were constantly refilled up until the moment we left and despite the fact that we were there for almost 3 hours, we were never asked to vacate the table. The food was great (huevos rancheros for me, french toast and breakfast burritos were among the other items ordered), the salsa is some of the best I've tasted at a restaurant, and I just really liked the feel of the restaurant.

Great, semi-hidden (mean that literally because pretty much everyone knows about DP's now) spot in NB for brunch.
author: Nicole W.

description:
I had my first Hamburguesa last weekend. Holy. Fucking. Shit.  I only had a half of one because my friend and I were also splitting a lobster, but after my first bite I regretted not just getting 2-3 hamburguesas for myself!

As the guys from Epic Mealtime would say the gratuitous use of bacon is "Fucking SMART"!

But what I'm most impressed by is the bun.  How it's able to stay so dry and crunchy on the outside and the inside be like a Yorkshire pudding supersaturated in bacony-beef au jus is beyond comprehension for my mortal mind!

Cheap awesome sangria is the icing on the cake for a great pre-party meal.
author: Henry L.

description: What a great spot for brunch/lunch.  Superb salsa.  Great tacos and the French toast is pretty good too. The sangria wasn't anything to write about.  Highly recommended overall.
author: Sajid Z.

description:
Cant believe I hadnt been to Don Pistos earlier!  Came here for dinner a few months ago and had to wait about 20 min. for a table, which was perfect; we sat at the bar and had a margarita and just enjoyed watching the kitchen (open kitchen right when you walk in).  Their menu is somewhat small, which I love and the food is absolutely delicious.  
Come here for brunch too!  Their huevos rancheros are a perfect size (two small fried corn tortillas with beans, pico de gallo, eggs, etc.) and you leave not feeling greasy and overly full.
author: Emma A.

description:
Don Pisto's was good, but given the great reviews I expected lifechanging. 

The green salsa and chips are delicious, and the sangria is refreshing. I enjoyed the hamburguesa, but I have had tastier tortilla soup and the fish tacos (snapper the night I went) were not that memorable though tasted like high quality, fresh ingredients.

They'll take reservations for groups of 6 of more, which makes meeting a group there easy though the restaurant was pretty loud for the far sides of the table to hear each other. There was also confusion on the bill - the menu states gratuity is automatically added to parties of 6+ so we assumed that it was in there when we got the check. However, the waitress had to tell us after we'd calculated it out that the gratuity was not included. I don't care which way it's done, but please pick one and be consistent on this. Given all this, I'd probably only go back with a small group.

Ok, last thing that just tipped me to give the 3 stars instead of the 4: the restaurant was almost suffocatingly smoky for the last part of our meal and as we were leaving, to the point it felt unpleasant in your throat. I assume this wasn't the norm and probably due to a kitchen mishap, but it was pretty unpleasant.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
Ok...I thought going into Mexican food in San Francisco?....having lived in LA for the last 8 years my Mexican food standards are pretty high and I must say....Don Pisto's is AWESOME.  

From the get go I was feeling the vibe.  We couldn't find the restaurant right away because they actually don't have a sign out front, but I actually liked that.  And from going inside there is no need for a sign....it was packed.  We made reservations and got a table downstairs in a separate area from the main area.  

We ordered the camarones (shrimp), pescado, and al pastor tacos and all were really good with camarones being the favorite amongst the people I shared it with.  

Another popular thing on the menu seemed to be their Bottomless menu which is bottomless mimosa ($13), margarita ($15), or sangria ($15)...all before 3:30pm daily.  Man...what a deal!!  Leave your car behind and head on down there for some drinks and tacos!  

Will head back and try something off of their breakfast menu next time :) 

Chatted with the waiter for a sec and must say SUPER friendly.  Found out it was his brother who is the chef/owner....and he also cooks for another kitchen right around the corner in some bar....ceviche and stuff...how dare I forget the name of the place!  WIll ask the next time I go back :)

Only complaint....it was so loud in the part of the restaurant we were in that my friends and I had to shout at each other to talk....the big group next to us were also super loud so mixed with the music....hard to talk to the person next to you.  It did get a lot better once that big group did leave but man......talk about loud.
author: Hanna J.

description:
It was a weird Thursday and I was a little off kilter in the afternoon. Assuming it was low blood sugar and the hunger making me cranky I went for some Mexican food.

Anyone else feel like it's the weekend when you eat lunch at like 3 in the afternoon during the week?

This place was really relaxed, which should be a requirement for Mexican food in my opinion. You can't rush eating those chips and sippin a drink can you? I think not!

Someone had told me if I ever went to the Don's that I needed to try this 'Hamburguesa' thing. Having never tried it before, and feeling wildly adventurous even if it meant Montezuma's revenge, I went for it.

Oh I think I might have found a new love! It has this incredible bacon and onion flavor and was so good; like I moaned at least once eating it good. Moaning while eating food always reminds me of this girl I knew in college. She loved good food. Miss you Tara!

So back to Pisto's. It was a wonderful place to eat with friendly people and staff. The chips and guacamole were very good and the hamburguesa is a must try!
author: Nick B.

description: Arguably the best pork chop I've ever bitten into
author: David W.

description:
I've been to Don Pisto's twice while in the city and I would definitely recommend this hip little restaurant. Don Pisto's offers delicious sit down Mexican street food. I have not been disappointed with any of the menu choices that I've made so far. 

It may sound silly, but my friends and I LOVE the free chips and salsa. The chips are unlike any other restaurant and the salsa has just the right amount of hot sauce. 


Some recommendations to order include:
-Carne asada tacos: The portion was small, but this small finger food was delicious. 
-Brioche French toast:  DELICIOUS- Don pisto's offers delicious  thick slices of bread with a topping of sweet  maple syrup.

And of course, you cannot forget the bottomless Aqua fresca mimosas or Sangria's.
author: Lisa H.

description: My BF and I love Don Pisto's. The hamburguesa, guacamole, tacos and mussels are our favorites. Bottomless mimosas on weekends is a nice touch. I like how they use fresh squeezed pineapple juice.  The only thing I hate is the fact that there is ALWAYS a 30 to 45 minute wait to get seated. I also think it is over-priced. We eat here pretty much every week and do not mind paying for pricey Mexican Food because the quality is great.
author: Shirleyanne A.

description:
I have been going to Don Pisto's since it opened in December of 2009.  The food has always been excellent and affordable.  I recently went for my first brunch there and was just as pleased with the meal.  The Chorizo and Eggs were just the right amount of spicy and the eggs were poached perfectly.

However, no meal can be complete at Don Pisto's without the hamburguesa.  I love hamburgers, probably my favorite food.  But, this may be my favorite one.  It doesnt have a ton of bells and whistles, just meat, guacamole and bun.  But, it is AMAZING.  Its always cooked perfectly and with exceptional flavor. I even had one along side my chorizo and eggs.

I also really like the tacos, especially the al pastor and carnitas.  And the Mexican sashimi with a little serrano for some heat. And the chips and salsa, of course.

The service has always been good.  I like that they explain their style to new comers, so everyone knows what to expect.

The only downside is there can be a long wait sometimes, but its well worth it.
author: Neila M.

description:
Love the bottomless sangria 

The French Toast Brioche is amazing and the Huevos rancheros is one of my favs in the city
author: Shivani S.

description: When I got there half the menu was out of stock so I just ordered the tortilla soup. The soup was average, the avocado they used did not go with the flavor at all and I could barely eat it. The salsa they brought in the beginning was good though.
author: Sonia R.

description: Went on Friday night around 7 and was seated immediately. Ordered the fish tacos (2 for $10) and they were cod. Spice level is strong but manageable. Guacamole was ok but wouldn't like obsess over this place. Liked the music/scene - they were playing solid rap - lots of mid-early 20's diners. Kitchen run by 3 line cooks and they bang it out. Service was very good.
author: PK R.

description: We were looking for a taqueria style restaurant & this was number 1 on the list. Food was good, home cooked/grill style Mexican food. Was advertised as food for sharing but portions were very small.  Pollo asado was 2 small chicken pieces, guacamole, slasa, 3 green onions & 4 corn tortillas.  Sangria is good but strained of all fruit.  I wouldn't go again but if someone wanted to meet there I'd be down.
author: Jeffrey B.

description: Service was good and the waitress was friendly and helpful. She recommended a couple of things and I decided to go with the huevos. Food came quickly and it was great. Will definitely come here again.
author: Angus C.

description: Found this place through yelp while walking around near Fisherman's wharf.  All i can say is al pastor taco.  I dreamt of those tacos back in my hotel room and went back to get more the day before I flew out.  The meat was well flavored and accompanied the charred pineapple well.  Best street taco hands down!!  My only complaint is its not your typical street taco price...however, for the flavor explosion that I received, I would pay again and again.  I have this place saved as a must visit on my trips to SFO.  I did eat other things here...but once again, its the al pastor that keeps me coming back.  My other selections were less memorable.  The restaurant itself was small and quaint, and there was quite the wait when i visited.  The sangria was blah, the shrimp taco okay...but al pastor....man. lol
author: Khristina C.

description:
I am so glad a friend recommended Don Pistos for dinner -- it's delicious, fresh, inventive, and the kind of Mexican food that's impossible not to love.  

The sangria was good, but skip it and head straight for the margaritas, which are perfectly-sized to enjoy two rounds... although, really, you might as well have 3 or more. The guacamole is excellent. The entrees are fantastic (I tried the shrimp tacos and loved every little shrimpy piece... but we were all sorely tempted by the bacon marinated hamburger on the menu).

I would recommend getting a seat upstairs so you can enjoy the windows. Also, the place is unmarked from the street -- so yes, that is Don Pistos on the left as you walk up Union.
author: Kelly M.

description:
I cannot find a single reason to give this place fewer stars than what I chose!

Don Pistos... I never would've even known about this place if it weren't for 7x7's delicious list of things to eat in San Francisco for 2011. And who would've expected a delicious Mexican restaurant in North Beach?!

My party of 4 arrived here sometime before 7pm, which was PERFECT because the restaurant started to really fill up between 7 and 7:30. We didn't know what to expect when we read that it was a restaurant mainly specializing in Mexican food. I didn't know to expect if it would be one of those delicious but filthy looking places in the Mission, or something generic like Chevy's.

Don Pistos definitely stands out as its own kind of Mexican restaurant, with a slightly dim classy feel that reminded me of a tavern, but festive enough that it was like other Mexican restaurants.

The servers were very attentive and good about checking up on us through the evening to make sure that we didn't need anything.

They start you off by serving you some chips and salsa. It's not just any kind of salsa though. It's the green chile salsa with a slight bit of spice and bursting with flavor. I know I ate almost all of it and hogged it from my friends. For our meals, we ordered the carnitas tacos (small but delicious) and the hamburguesa, which was the dish listed on the 7x7 food list.

The hamburguesa was AMAZING! It's a meat patty that has been marinated in bacon and onions, topped with house-made guacamole, served on (what I think is) a brioche bun. When I took a bite out of it, I felt like it was just melting in my mouth. I would definitely order it again. And it was only $9!!!

Next time, I want to try other things on the menu because everything smelled so good there. Looking at the other tables, you can see just how delicious the food is. As we left around 8pm, there was a large group of people congregating in the front, waiting for tables to free up.

Get here early! They only make reservations for parties of 6 or more!
author: Melissa D.

description:
I love this place!  First time eating there last night and I am hooked.  The BEST  FISH TACOS in the city- hands down.  You have to try the grilled calamari it is amazing.

I will be back weekly- and I can't wait to try the bottomless sangria brunch with my girlfriends! 

This is my new favorite spot in the city- great food and so fun!
author: Cassandra O.

description: Absolutely amazing! Extremely authentic and tasted like gourmet Mexican food. The staff was bet good as well.
author: Nicholas F.

description:
On a cold hungover sunday...

------$3 Sangria 
------delicious quacamole & the good tortilla chips (not the thin ones, these are actual    corn tortillas they fry:)
------tortilla soup
------grilled jalapenos & hot sauce when asked
------pleasant server
------nice dark warm feeling ambiance
------in my neighborhood.

:) go. now.
author: Sarah F.

description:
I love Don Pisto's!! EXCEPT THE WAIT is very very long... I guess the food (delicious and of great caliber) and the attentive service (once you do get seated) was worth the wait.

Came here post-Oysterfest on Saturday evening at 7pm, with a party of 10... 8 of them being very hungry men! Our wait was 2 hours so we must have been at least 5 pitchers of margaritas + sangrias deep by the time we were seated for dinner. We were in the downstairs dining room. Group favorites were the hamburguesa, the carne asada tacos, tortilla soup, ceviche, and mine - the mussels and chorizo. So amazing, and the broth that it was seasoned with... such a sensational experience! I greatly enjoyed dipping my bread in that. Glad I met the Chef/Owner Pete prior to ordering... that was his favorite dish on the menu, and it's now mine.

I do suggest making resos, and getting there early if you want to covet a prime dinner spot during mealtime! Service was friendly, and attentive. Will certainly come back soon! And did I mention - their brunch features bottomless mimosas for a super affordable price??? Will have to hit that up soon!
author: Tammy H.

description:
Just came here for brunch so while it's fresh in my head, here is a rundown of the food/drinks/service:
-Food (w/o considering the price): 8/10 - had the shrimp tacos and the shrimp was perfectly cooked and seasoned. However, considering I paid $10 for two very small tacos, I probably would give it 5/10, but hey, I was in the nice party of North Beach. The closest place I could get $2 tacos with that flavor would be in San Jose/Mission. The dinner menu looks better and would love to try the soup everyone raves about. 
 
-Drinks: 4/10 - cheap for bottomless, $15 for bottomless mimosas/sangrias, and after we finish our glass, we could continue to get mimosas or switch to sangrias. However, the mimosas were different, they didn't have orange juice but something orange flavor. It tasted a bit water down so if you want to feel something, you may need to have 5+ glasses. Same story for the sangria. I personally didn't finish either of my drinks...should have just got one glass for $8. 

-Service: 10/10 - very friendly and attentive staff. Our waitress came by to check up on us often, refilled our drinks and water, and was very accommodating. 

Overall: May come back, maybe for dinner.
author: Tif L.

description:
3.25/5 mimosa brunchieee

so there were hella (17) of us there, all drizzunk, rowdy, hungry, thirsty. repeat.

our waiter cory was great and kept up with us, making sure our glasses were never empty for long. the food overall though is okay, nothing necessarily to write home to mama about. especially if you're drunk, she'll get jealous. i think it'd be interesting if they came out with more flavors for the mimosas.

oh, and i was oddly fond of the chips. i dunno why, but i'm pretty sure i cleared a (couple) bowls by myself. yes.
author: Alvin D.

description:
I have been hesitant to write a review becuase I am not sure I can be concise about everthing I love at Don Pistos.  We come here pretty much every Sunday for either brunch or dinner.  

Brunch:
Bottomless mimosas for $12 is a must.  They make these with a different fresh fruit juice (was watermelon for a few weeks, then pineapple... my fave!) that puts a nice refreshing spin on the mimosa... or orange juice if you specify.
