I also love the Sonora tacos.  I wish they would serve the Machaca beef and eggs on their brunch menu!  Pretty pleeeeaassseeee?

Dinner:
What don't I love on the menu?  Guac is delish but I love to start by splitting the Tortilla Soup.  It is killer and can be shared by up to 4 people.  Because everything is so good here, I like to come with a group and share many dishes.  Even with free flowing drinks and a group, I rare spend more than $40/person. 

- Chorizo mussels ($14) : perfect for when I have eaten too many chips and salsa.  Don't be fooled by the description of white wine sauce - the chorizo gives it a rich flavor perfect for soaking up with the bread

- Machaca beef & eggs ($17 ish)- tender juicy marinated shredded beef with a perfectly cooked egg on top to be scooped into warm home made tortillas.  Perfection.

- Chili verde chicken tostadas ($11) - light refreshing and crunchy.  Love the side of beans.  

- Carnitas tacos ($8) - just yummmm

They serve beer and wine only but manage to make good margaritas somehow.  But the sangria is even better.
author: Meagan C.

description: Fancy Mexican goodness. The guac is great, the El Pastor taco is killer. The place is tiny so get here early or make a reservation. The staff was friendly, but gave us a dirty look when we asked if we could push two tables together. This is the best Mexican you can get in North Beach.
author: Nicky L.

description: Wow - incredible tacos and pretty good margaritas = awesome dinner. Sad to see some 1 stars posted, we had a great experience. Fish and short rib tacos were our favorites.
author: Tom C.

description:
Not  just a tacos place, even if that's what they might be known for. In fact, I've never ordered tacos here because I'm not really a huge tacos person, and I still love this place. I recommend the chile verde chicken tostadas ... so yummy. 

I've been here in large groups the two times I've been here and the servers are so amazingly accommodating. I usually dislike large group meals but at Don Pisto's it is such a pleasant experience and I feel very well taken care of. I love the chips and they make sure to refill them as much as you'd like....  kind of dangerous but I can't complain! Order some sides of guac, pitchers of margaritas/sangria, and you're on your way to a delicious meal.

One thing to note is that though they offer margaritas, since they have a beer/wine license only, the 'tequila' in them isn't standard tequila... it's some kind of wine. It's really good, but probably not going to get you as drunk as quickly. Prices are very reasonable, so I don't find this to be a negative. 

They have a few additional items on the menu in the restaurant (not listed on the menu on the website), and they have daily specials.
author: Richa A.

description:
Well it is true what they say about Don Pistos - it is pretty amazing! 
We got there around 7:30pm on a Friday and waited at the bar for about 50 minutes.  They said it would take about that long and no big deal for us as the bartender couldn't be more friendly and attentive. We each had 3 of their fabulous margaritas and some chips and guac.  The margs are great and got us all a little drunk before dinner.  It is loud and crowded but fun and not annoying.   We were seated and had the little burgers and the shrimp tacos which were fabulous.  I recommend both.  The service was good and then at the end of your meal they give you a shot of something - by this time I was pretty boracha.  Fun, great place before going out on the town or hanging out with friends.  Enjoy!
author: KJ G.

description:
I think it might be slightly overrated. Don't get me wrong, the food is good and the atmosphere is lively and happening but I just am never blwon away by the food.

Cons - No booze for margaritas
- Poor ventilation, your clothes and hair will remind you of your don pisto visit for days to come
author: Pan P.

description: Had a great group dinner here a couple months back. Good cocktails, simple and delicious menu. I felt like we couldn't go wrong in what we ordered and everything was sharable. Fun to go for more fancy Mexican food.
author: Emma S.

description:
Small gem in north beach. There are no signs outside of the restaurant, so don't be alarmed to walk in. The kitchen is TINY..but it does the trick.

I've been here many times for dinner, once for brunch, and once for a group dinner that was hosted in the basement (they apparently worked out a prix fixe deal for unlimited tacos). 

Highlights:

- Pescado Fish Tacos (2 per plate) - SO good. Crispy fresh fish, served on two soft taco shells with salsa.
- Camarones Shrimp Tacos - good, but the fish tacos are better. Also served on two soft taco shells with salsa.
- Guacamole - its good...not the best i've had, but it's good to order on the side of your tacos. 

- Brunch Menu: Mushroom and Serrano chile omelatte - this was delicious. I wasn't expecting much from their brunch, but was surprised by how good this item was. 

Parking in the area can be tough. This place also stacks up quite a wait, but its really hit or miss. You can put your name down and leave a phone number and theyre pretty good about calling you back when your table is ready. 

I live close by to Don Pistos, and it's become part of my regular neighborhood restaurant rotations. Its fresh, tasty, and well priced.
author: Sabeen c.

description: Always packed, so you know it's good! No sign for the building, just a red light, so you know it's pretentious! I eat here about once a year when I'm in the city for a few days. Love the brick walls and lighting. Food is epic. Tortilla soup, salsa, sangria, tacos, all amazing! Great date spot. Good luck finding parking!! Plan ahead.
author: Bennett H.

description:
I'm from the New York City area so finding excellent Mexican food near home is a challenge.. so while on vacation in San Francisco we asked a friend for a recommendation on her favorite Mexican spot and with no hesitation she said Don Pisto's.  

We were not disappointed.

We got there shortly after it opened so there was no wait.. We started with the tortilla soup and guacamole.  Amazing.  For our main meal we shared an assortment of tacos, which were all delicious.  

We left Don Pistos wanting more, but too stuffed to eat another bite.  If I'm back in San Francisco anytime soon, I will be eating here again.
author: scott p.

description:
I refer to restaurants by the name indicated on the signage.  Since there is no name other than the address I see no reason not to call it 510 Union other than that there are too many restaurants only referred to by their address in SF.  The menu and Yelp claim otherwise but that's not enough evidence for me.  

I'd been curious walking by every day on the way back from work to see an eager line of patrons upon closer menu perusal I was suprised to see well described Mexican and seafood items a departure from my expectation for sure.  For an early dinner we grabbed a few seats at the small bar before the crowd set in.  We were a bit cozily seated with the hostess stand on the right spilling over to the bar but I don't mind.  The bartender was friendly and had great recommendations.  A few glasses of Revolero, some great tacos and the highlight mussels with sausage so good I pretty much ate it like a soup by the end of the meal.  Pondering stopping by every day and claiming a permanent bar seat.
author: Taylor O.

description: Stop reading this and go here. Get anything. Favorite tacos and guac place so far in SF. Just wish I could get a real marg and it would be 5 stars!
author: Sean S.

description: Not worth it. Food's better at at a taco truck in Oakland. Server charged my card twice. Tip $0.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
You must try the cheviche. It is raw fish that is soaked in lime juice, and the lime juice acids "cook' the fish so it is doubly tender. Add the special tomatoes and onions and the cheviche was astounding. 

On other occasions I love the crunchy tacos carnitas. They speak to your more base instincts, what I call your inner carnivore.
author: Betsy W.

description: This place is a great secret spot. There's no sign above the door, but the food, drinks and atmosphere create a reputation where no sign is needed. It's a great spot to meet and catch up with friends. It was a bit loud, but what can you expect from a place that brings so many people together.
author: Jenna C.

description: Man these overpriced tacos. Looks as small as el tonayese tacos but 3 times the price and don't taste as good. Seriously mediocre street tacos for $9 and up. On the street good tacos are $1.50 or less.
author: Ben U.

description:
Wow, what a great surprise.  Don Pisto's wasn't our 1st choice, but I'm glad our 1st choice fell through.  From the outside, Don Pisto's is a little neighborhood mexican restaurant and bar, but inside it's a modern twist on traditional mexican.  The service is excellent, the music a little loud, but adds to the atmosphere, and the food is outstanding.  My husband and I had fabulous fish tacos, my daughter had the chicken tacos, and we shared maybe the best guacamole around.  
While in San Francisco, we ate at several of the top restaurants, but congrats to Don Pisto's for becoming our new favorite.  We'll definitely be back.
author: Susan B.

description:
Muy bueno.

Now this is my kind of place. Pretty discrete location on Union in North Beach, but that adds to the appeal. The decor is nothing crazy, exposed brick walls & great lighting -- it just works.

The menu is small, so go with a group and order everything on the menu & it may just be one of the best meals in San Francisco. Well, I take that back... but it's pretty damn good. You have to go with a big group, order tons of food & the fab drinks and it's unbeatable for that type of night. 

Let's start with the Chips & Salsa - hands down do not compare to any I have ever eaten. I honestly do not know what it is that makes them stand out but they're like crack... so addicting.

Standout menu item #1: Carne Asado Tacos. Steak was marinated and cooked to perfection. Melt in your mouth good. Def get more than one order.

Standout menu item #2: Tortilla Soup. Esssuper spicy but incredible. It was too hot to handle for some of the people in my group, but I live for this delicious-ness. I wonder if they do take out, because I could easily eat this 3 times a week. 

& the drinks.... I am a margarita connoisseur. And the margaritas at Don Pisto's are excellent. Except they're missing one important ingredient: Tequila. That's right - all the cocktails are made with beer & wine. Including the margarita which is made with a 48 proof Chardonnay. The sangria is delish too. Get pitchers & I guarantee you will have no idea you're not drinking liquor. 

Ever been to La Esquina in NYC? It ALMOST reminds me of that. Let's be real: nothing compares to La Esquina but if you drink enough of the Chardonnay margaritas, you might be able to fake yourself into believing you're there.
author: Natalie T.

description:
Let's face it, I'm a Mexican food junky/snob. I love menudo on Sunday mornings and homemade enchiladas, made by mom, of course. So sizzling platters of stringy, over cooked shrimp and tasteless strips of flavorless beef served with mashed beans and orange rice is definitely NOT my bag baby. I dig really good Mexican food and my bar of measure isn't a super burrito down in the Mission at 2am. 

Located in North Beach, typically known for Italian cuisine, Don Pisto's is one of those perfect "stand out's" in a touristy neighborhood geared for out-of-towners. Just a block away from Washington Square on Union Street, parking might be a chore but in that neighborhood the walk is picturesque to say the least, but pay attention! Don Pisto's sports no signage of any kind so aside from a group of folks waiting for seating in front of a mostly plain storefront, it's fairly easy to miss. 

They do not take reservations for parties under 6 so it's not unheard of to wait for up to an hour for a table on the weekends and around 15-25min on average during the week but that's cool, sit down and relax with Pete. The owner/operator and will make with a story or two over a drink. The acai sangria is great but as they have no liquor license the Margarita is wine. 

The feel of the dinning room is rustic and simple-elegant. Brick and mortar walls, heavy, stressed wood beams, cast iron fittings, splashes of red and black make for a warm and comforting experience while dining. Heavy, high backed, wooden chairs accompany candle-lit white clothed table tops with roll-up's.

You are initially greeted with the requisite chip and salsa combo but unlike your typical taquria, the salsa is a tangy green tomotillo sauce that is acidic, mildly spicy and slightly sweet. The tortilla chips are nice and warm, light and crispy and are seemingly made for the singular purpose of scooping. The best usage of this purpose is scooping gobs of guacamole in your mouth. Bright green, creamy and chunky, the guac is a perfect match for the slightly salty, crispy goodness of the chips as you peruse the menu. 

Simple. Thats the best part of this menu. Simple. No confusing combo platters. A Burger cooked in Bacon grease. A steamed lobster dinner. A carnitas plate. Taco's! Taco's, I'm not going to lie. I rarely get past the taco's. The fish taco's are downright vindictive in their tender simplicity. The fish changes frequently but on this trip they were offering Lingcod, pan seared to perfection and lightly dusted in secret spices it's finished off with a light slaw. The al pastor, made with center cut loin, is tangy sweet with a spicy smokiness and delicately tender. I have a hard time ordering anything else.

To be honest, I'm all about brunch. The Mimosas are made with agua fresca, basically just a shot of watermelon juice instead of OJ in champagne. Let me tell you, so much better than the OJ.  They hand make flower tortillas that are as light and flaky as pie crust, perfect with the chorizo and poached eggs. 

Don Pistos is a locals hot spot in a tourists driven Italian neighborhood. They serve excellent food from south of the border with fresh local ingredients, bold flavors in an elegant style, distinguishing themselves from sizzling platter chains and burrito shops. Don Pistos is fun and inviting with excellent service and welcoming ownership. It's a great place for authentic cuisine and a local feel. Be sure to hit brunch on the weekends, try the al pastor -its the best in The City, and ask Pete to do "Thai Mike" it's hysterical.
author: Matthew A.

description:
Hard to find but easy to LOVE. Went here for the first time for a company dinner, and I was finally able to find it again (it's seriously a challenge).

Tacos are delicious, guac is to die for, civiche is...sorry I'm drooling.

Definitely a must-eat North Beach restaurant!
author: Bailey M.

description:
I... Love.. Don... Pisto's!!! Came here for a friend's birthday a couple weeks ago. I had heard good things about it mainly from the 7x7 list, so I was excited we actually got to go here! 

First of all... pitchers and pitchers of delicious margaritas. Need I say more?

The chips were delish and I loved their salsa verde. The guac was also amazing! 

They had a nice taco menu (I got to try one and they were really great), but what really blew me away was their hamburguesa (also, their item that's on the 7x7 list). Oh my goshhhhh this was the best hamburger I've ever had, I think. They cook it perfectly medium rare in bacon grease and onions (or something like that), so it had a slight hot dog-y flavor?? Not sure what it was, but it was so effing good! Served on a toasted bun with guac spread on top.. and that was it! I am salivating right now just thinking about it...

Also had some sort of tequila shooter at the end of the night (something mixed with pineapple something or other? not sure at this point..) but it was delicous nonetheless.

This is an awesome place for a birthday or get-together with a group of friends. It's not super stuffy, but also not dirty/dive-y.. perfect for Friday nights!
author: Rhea K.

description:
Who knew that the best Mexican in SF would be found deep in the red gravy territory of North Beach!

The place hardly has the linoleum feel of your standard neighborhood trattoria like those found in the Mission, rather it's a sleek, nondescript, minimalist, red-brick room with no sign on the outside.  It's best to keep this place secret because the food is simply outstanding- authentic, fresh, and executed perfectly.  I've tried many taco-al-pastors throughout the years and Don Pisto's is the best.  The burger, mussels, seafood items, and tortilla soup are all top-notch.  Every ingredient is fresh and used in just the right amounts and balance.  Combine this food with reasonable prices and a decent alcohol selection and I've officially found my favorite Mexican joint in SF.
author: Mike B.

description:
Don Pisto's attempts to fuse Mexican street food with a high quality , fancy, fine dining remix. Some places do this successfully, others end up charging 3x the price for the same meal you would find out of a food truck.

Don Pisto's does some things great and other things poorly. Thankfully, I am here to help you know what to order:

PRO: 
-Unlimited chips and salsa verde spicy salsa - delish.
-Chorizo & Mussels with White Wine Reduction Sauce - 4 star! Fresh mussels topped with mild chorizo and a delicious broth. Worth the $14. 
-Seafood stew - tons of fish, prawns, squid, calamari etc in a buttery chicken tortilla-like stew. 4.5 star.

CONS:
-I didn't try, but everyone who had the tacos were told to stay away. It's not bad, but not worth $8 for 2 small tacos.
-They decided to no longer offer mango ahi which was supposedly amazing said reviews.
-They were very crowded, but the place had no sign / name decal / logo on it whatsoever. If you didn't have exact GPS or drove by, you'd have no idea what it was called. Who's dumb idea was that?
author: Chuck N.

description:
Bottomless Mimosas for twelve bucks Rocks
The Al Pastor Taco Sonora Rocks
The complimentary chips and salsa Rocks
The music Rocks
The ambiance and decor Rocks
Cory Rocks
Pete Rocks
The Other Lady Waitress (I'm SO sorry I forgot your name- but you know who you are) Rocks
Don Pisto's Rocks
I recommend you go - now
author: Nevine K.

description: Arrived at 11 for brunch on a Saturday with no wait.  Started with guac which was ample and creamy with thick crunchy chips.  My husband had the shrimp tacos which he said were excellent, the shrimp perfectly cooked.  I had the huevos rancheros and the eggs did not come as requested, but they comped the meal unprompted to make up for the delay.  The huevos were worth the wait however, and kudos to them for good food and service.
author: Holly W.

description:
I wanted to try this place based on recommendations from friends and rave reviews on Yelp.  It took us a while to find parking last night being that Don Pisto's is in North Beach.  The host who seemed more like the owner/manager said the wait for 2 was about 20 minutes at 9:30 pm.  We ended up waiting well longer than that.  He nicely offered us free drinks so we chose the sangria.  I don't drink so the hubby got 2 free glasses of sangria.  He said overall it was okay but that his favorite is still from Picaro. 

When we were seated, we got the chips and salsa.  The chips were delicious but the salsa I thought was too limey.  The hubby got the Tortilla Soup and I got the Hamburguesa based on the rave reviews from Yelp.  Both of us thought that the quality of the food was good but the flavors for us was okay.  I am pretty familiar with latin flavors whether it being mexican, cuban, spanish, basque etc.  Personally for me the flavors at this place were a little off for me, but I think it is still worth trying to see if you may like/love it.  The prices for food and drinks are very reasonable and the ambience is pretty hip.  It is a good place to bring a group or a date.
author: C L.

description:
North beach may be considered Little Italy, but Don Pistos reigns king for me.

As you walk through the doors, there is no denying the warm and inviting ambiance.  The decor gives you a taste of a modern Mexican flare with warm tones of beautiful paintings around the brick walls.  The staff is attentive and accommodating with quick service too.

The fresh fish tacos were most amazing and the warm tortillas tasted homemade.  I also had the lobster on another occasion and it was absolutely delectable.  The summer stew had a spicy kick which compliment the sweet calamari so incredibly well.  I am excited to try their brunch soon too.    

Don Pisto's is one of my favorite restaurants in the city and the owner Pete is so passionate and creative about his place.  You can taste it in the food and feel it in the energy of the resturant.  I would absolutely recommend this restaurant to you.. great vibe, food, drinks and ambiance.  You have to try...
author: Melissa E.

description: Wish they had a full bar, but the scene if fun and lively, and the price is rock bottom.  The service is great, as well.
author: Daniel D.

description: Really good food at really reasonable price. Got in and out quick and the service was great. Had the fish tacos and a veggie burrito, both stellar. Chips are made in house and guac and salsa were terrific.
author: Jon B.

description:
Trendy, yet reasonably priced and delicious Mexican food in North Beach.

Chips and salsa was quickly brought out to satisfy our starving stomachs.  The tortilla soup was great and actually spicy, and went very well with the chips as well.  The carne asada tacos I had were some of the best I've had, they were truly delicious.

The service was excellent, our waitress was highly attentive and the food came out very fast.  Prices are solid for the quality of the food and the atmosphere was very cool.
author: Jonathan K.

description: Yummy selection of food. Plates come out at different times, so the waiter recommended ordering plates to share, which worked wonderfully. Our food was served quickly even though the dining room was full of people. Oysters were nice, tacos were great! Perfect place for drinks and sharing small plates. The location was also nice- the street outside made a very nice picture.
author: Holly E.

description:
My visit to Don Pisto's was very solid.  I was killing some time on a Saturday morning in North Beach and wanted to try this place since hearing a great recommendation from a friend.  

The brunch menu is solid and full of tantalizing choices.  I went for the hamburguesa, and asked for it with a sunny side up egg to boot, because that seemed like a brunch thing to do.  My dish and egg arrived and I slid the egg onto the hamburguesa, and cut the whole thing in half, sending dripping yolk cascading down the sandwich.  Making a production of it all without intent drew some casual onlookers who nodded with approval at what I was doing.  The flavor was solid and I couldn't have been more satisfied.  

Service was really good as well.  On my way to the restroom I ran into the owner in the basement prep room, and had a good chat with him.  Apparently he's been working in the restaurant biz since he was 13 and knows what he's doing.  He was very pleasant and offered me a parking card with some leftover credit on it to feed the meter as well!  You can't beat that.

He told me I really ought to get in there and try dinner as well.  I definitely will do that.
author: Kevin M.

description:
My boyfriend suggested this place and now this is our favorite restaurant! In the beginning it was hard to find because somehow my GPS was telling us to go to this one Italian restaurant. But we eventually found it. So far we've tried the pitcher of sangria, tacos (al pastor & carne asada) and the mussels! We especially love the mussel and the meat sauce in that dish! I suggest everyone to try it. The food is great, atmosphere is cool, friendly service, and the bartender is funny and he remembered us! 

I also heard breakfast is good too, so I think I have to try that. The only bad thing about this place is that they don't take reservation, but I think it's worth the wait.
author: Sarah C.

description: One of my favorite places in SF so far. I tried the Mexican Ceviche and the Grilled Calamari, both of which were excellent! Their seafood is fresh,  and their friendly service at the bar and at the tables make it a fantastic place to hang out. While their dishes may not be 100% authentic Mexican, they have a lot of taste and spice and are made with premium ingredients. Minus 1 star because their wait times can be over an hour, especially on Fridays and Saturdays, which can get annoying if you're not the type that plans ahead.
author: Karina L.

description: We came here and tried pretty much one or two things from each section on the menu. For the taco & ceviche, we were a bit disappointed. Small hole in the wall places make better taco and for gourmet ceviche, go to Lamar where they give you whole fish chunks rather than ground up. Now, this may sound like a bad review so far, BUT the Pollo Asado and the Tortilla Soup were kick ass. The tortilla soup had good flavor and depth and the Pollo Asado is what you come back for over and over and over again. Service was good. Only giving 4 stars because didn't like some dishes, but would have been 5 if I just got the latter two.
author: Christopher K.

description: First time I've had food delivered from this place. I can't even express to you how much Mexican food I've eaten in my life time.this is right up there as some of the best from the guacamole,refried beans ,burrito ,and the chips .....I have no complaints whatsoever .....
author: chris c.

description:
Don't remember much

That could be because I sat there for 5 hours drinking bottomless Sangria.  I actually do remember the Tacos Al Pastor I had with crushed pineapple.  Oh my god, soo good.  

Ok, so I just read what I wrote so far & decided there's nothing else to say.  Ummm, Go here?

Answer: Yes
author: josh s.

description:
not your typical Mexican joint!  We had the ceviche, calamari, pork chop, and every kind of taco they had.. also the burger!
amazing guac and verde! love love love!
author: Val S.

description: Everything I've had at Don Pisto's has been tasty. My favorites are as follows: appetizer - salmon sashimi, tacos - fish and carnitas, entrees - the enchiladas, unique but good. Unfortunately, they don't have hard alcohol so the bar side of things is lacking. I'd also love to see more rotation and variety on the menu. Either way, this is a great casual spot for classic/unique Mexican cuisine.
author: Matt D.

description:
Came here last Saturday with 6 of my best girlfriends for a post-Thanksgiving brunch. I have heard wonderful things about their dinner, but their brunch was PHENOMENAL! 

The setting is great with a lovely bar as you walk in and open room with an assortment of tables and chairs to the left. We had a large table in the center of the room but never felt squished or that we were in anyone's way. With $15 of bottomless sangria we definitely got our moneys worth! The chips were great and the green salsa they serve is soo tangy and delicious. 

Our server was great, always kept our glasses filled, asked if we needed anything and checked in on us regularly (Thanks Cory!). We were there for about 3 hours and never felt rushed. They also play great music, old school hip hop which we all loved and added to the great vibe of the place!

Onto the food...everyone's food looked amazing and  tasted great. I ordered Huevos Rancheros which were excellent. Two come on a plate with a crispy tortilla, eggs, beans, chesse, pico etc. and by the end I was pleasantly filled without being over stuffed. 

My friends got Breakfast Burritos, the Hamburguesa, and two types of Tacos. Everything was amazing and it was only about $30 each person.
author: Alissa C.

description: Thinking of an easy-going evening with yummy tacos, mexican sashime and refreshing margaritas, in a fun neighborhood environment? Don Pisto's is the answer! I love their creative dishes too (chorizo and mussels!). One day i will have tried everything on their menu...everything sounded great.
author: minnie l.

description:
Atmosphere: Upstairs = awesome, downstairs = fun for big groups, but can get kind of loud.

Food: Nachos and salsa before you get your food are great. Salsa has the perfect amount of spice. Been there a couple times now and I have to say the best items on the menu are the elote con queso, pretty much all the tacos. Not the biggest fan of the fish, but I think this is just something of preference. The al pastor tacos are a must order.

Drinks: Probably the only reason why I gave this place one less star. I can't remember the name of the drink on the menu, but definitely do not order the spiced beer. Does not quench my thirst at all and doesn't go well with the food at all. The margaritas were also eh.
author: Rahul B.

description: Awesome tortilla soup as other reviews said. Margaritas Limey, strong and drunk too fast. Chicken asada was grilled to the perfect tender point. Smooth and creamy guacamole was flavorful and fresh. Great place. Hard to find with no outdoor sign. Guess you have to be cool to find it.
author: Santo C.

description: Yummy yummy yummy in my tummy. Great nice dark atmosphere beautifully furnished and good service. Recommend the pitcher of Sangria and the tortilla soup and the Ceviche. Love this place :)
author: Alexis G.

description:
The food here is delicious and super reasonably priced. I had carne asada tacos and I think they were only $9, and so good! 
The ambiance is really nice and the homemade chips are another bonus -really yummy. It's quite a small place so be prepared to wait at the weekend. 
They also don't have any vegetarian options; however they made some veggie tacos for my veggie dining chum & she said they were very tasty. 
Bonus for nice staff too!
author: Ciera M.

description: Bf took me here for dinner on a Friday night since he raved about this place to me for nearly a year.  We decided to get there at 6 since they don't take reservations for 2 people and it gets filled fast.  We were seated as we get there, the waitress brought out chips and salsa. The salsa was amazing, but the chips were deathly salty to me.  My bf loves salty and those chips were on the too salty side even for him.  We ordered guacamole and it was also really salty.  So double salt with the chips and guac was just a bit too much.   I ordered the pork chop but the waitress told me that they don't start serving that until 7 or 7:30, which really made me upset.  If you don't want to serve it early, then don't put it on the menu or at least label it on there.  Ended up getting the chicken and it was pretty good, had the calamari and though that was really good too.
author: Jeannie C.

description:
Probably one of the better kept secrets of North Beach :).  Came here for brunch last Saturday...MEXICAN brunch...what a nice change of pace :).  I even appreciated the dim clay-colored walls as it was refreshing compared to my usual sunny brunch spots.  

To be honest, I'm not (and never really will be) a big fan of Mexican food -- but so many great things about this place that I'll get over myself and give well-deserved review.

($0) Complementary tomatillo salsa and chips -- Amazing!! So limey and appetizing. Just be careful not to fill up and miss out on the food.
($2) Mexican Sodas -- I got the mandarin one which tasted like Fanta (meh..), but the non-alcoholic Sangria the bf order was really good.  Wish they sold it at Safeway.
($9) Chorizo and Poached Eggs -- More like a potatoe and chorizo scramble, with two poached eggs on top.  A bit simple and even with the spicy kick of the Chorizo the dish got boring soon after.  I think there are definitely better things on the menu (i.e. the omlette i was eyeing at the next table look mucho tasty).
($8) Breakfast Burrito (chorizo, queso oaxca, eggs, salsa fresca and sliced avocado) - Boyfriend seems to really enjoy it.

No stupid brunch line and great service -- I'll definitely be back to try the omlette next time, along with the bottomless sangria ($15).  Seems like it'd make for a great group dinner spot too!
author: Kendra W.

description: Simple horizontal menu with delicious fresh taco options, fresh Mexican seafood specials, light refreshing margaritas, and tangy balanced guac. Low lights and chill environment but loud and vibrant conversations. Superb bar staff at the 5-seat bar.
author: Bret B.

description:
Taco, taco! Love the ambiance but love the chips and quac even more! 
Tip- each taco can be split into two! The shrimp Tacos are the best! 

Come hungry!
author: Jen E.

description: The food is great, service is great... but it's expensive; WAY too expensive. Same thing in the Mission costs half the price and tastes the same. Not trying to be a jerk here, just stating the obvious.
author: Mike J.

description:
This was one of those dinners that took about 3 hours from start to finish (8pm, no reservations made, 3-person party, Tuesday night). An hour long wait, happily occupied by Micheladas (spicy tomato juice + mexican beer + lime juice + salted rim). We started with the guacamole and chips, the guac was creamy, slightly spicy and topped with cilantro... delish! I ordered the Al Pastor Beef Tacos with Pineapple and a side of the pinto beans. Everything was amazing. My friend ordered the chicken tostadas which were incredibly flavorful but not overpowering, a big hit! 

The service was very friendly but I wish they moved the dinner along a it faster. Overall I loved this place and wouldn't hesistate to come back!
author: tessa l.

description: "Woohoo! As good as it gets!" is right! I want to first start off that being first generation Mexican, I hold mexican fare at a higher standard and I can be brutally harsh with restaurants. When my husband suggested going here, I immediatly thought... mexican? in north beach? what? Since my first visit, I have been back here again. Great food! The ceviche and guacamole are awesome and so is the tortilla soup.
author: Valerie F.

description: Was looking for good Mexican & came across this based on yelp & other food site popularity. They don't take reservations & no signage. Their food was amazing & so fresh. The hostess staff was completely clueless & not really able to manage a waiting list so we had to keep reminding them who we were. Don't take their offer to have them call you when your table is ready because they'll forget! Despite that the rest of experience was great. Waitstaff was so accommodating & food well worth it! Check it out
author: Ann H.

description: Went for brunch, great tacos amazing strawberry mimosas bottomless for $17.  Great service.  Fun time.  Definitely recommend.
author: Jay H.

description:
I absolutely love this place. 
Great inimate ambiance, food is just absolutely perfect. Tacos are great as are the salsas and guacamole. 
And even better is the service. The bartender is really cute - was all smiles which is big plus.
Would go back again just to smile at the bartender before diving into a pool full of salsa.
author: Neil B.

description: After I found it ( no street sign) it was definitely worth the hunt. Food was excellent for both of us and I am a Mexican food snob. Try the fish tacos and pork chops. Nice but small bar
author: Robert B.

description:
After hearing such wonderful reviews from my roommate and reading about the bacon-marinated hamburger on a Hamburger Today blog (http://aht.seriouseats.com/archives/2011/02/don-pistos-bacon-marinated-burger-review-san-francisco-ca.html), I had to try Don Pisto's.

Things that I love about Don Pisto's: hamburgeusa, their corn tortillas, sangria, and margaritas. Now I will go more in depth.

The hamburgeusa was one of the best hamburger patties I've ever tasted. It actually had more of a "smoky" taste than a bacon taste. It was so juicy and the bun was amazing too. Toasted on both sides and just delicious. I only meant to have a couple bites and practically ate half of it. I will admit that the hamburger purist in me was missing the tomato and lettuce. It's already so rich that I don't think it needs cheese and extra sauce. It comes close to one of the best burgers I've ever had except for the fact that I missed my usual garnishes.

We ordered the Al Pastor tacos (grilled rib chop, charred pineapple ), but truthfully I'm not sure if we got those. I didn't see any pineapple in the taco... maybe it was the Al Pastor... maybe it wasn't. It was still delicious and the corn tortillas are amazing. I'm not normally the biggest fan of corn tortillas (I prefer flour) but these were really delicious with a nice consistency. I hate it when the tortilla is slightly dry and starts to break while I try and eat my taco. Not really an issue here. Nice filling to tortilla ratio and they get a little messy while you eat them.

We also ordered the shredded kobe beef with 2 fried eggs on top served with corn tortillas. Think of it as a mixture of carnitas (except beef) and huevos rancheros (except no beans). The eggs are served sunny side up and they recommend you to break the yolks and mix it all together. While not extremely bad, this was my least favorite dish. It was a little too salty for me but the tortillas helped with that balance. I liked the hamburger more.

Sangria and margaritas are both solid and served in cute glasses. Apparently, Don Pistos does not take reservations for less than 6 people. We got there are 6:45pm on Wednesday and got the last 2-seater table. 

I would definitely go back and get the hamburger and try different things on the menu. The soup looked really good!
author: Jackie T.

description: Loved it! Came here with my boyfriend for the first time and it was the best guacamole I've ever had. The Pollo asado was delicious as well!! Definitely going to go here again next time I'm in the area.
author: Glenda G.

description: Great carnitas and tortilla soup! No sign on door and they do not use ads.. it was packed! wait was 30 minutes.. but we sat sooner than that. Service was SO good.. and the food was delicious! I'm a big Mexican food lover.. and I left very happy. Keep it up!!
author: Michelle N.

description:
I came here for my buddies birthday dinner and met up with a large crowd downstairs. It was one of those evenings where you show up somewhere alone only knowing 1-2 people, and end up leaving meeting some great people you would like to keep in touch with.

I realize that has nothing to do with the food here, but if the food was terrible, that may have not been the case. The drinks, the service, the food and the ambiance-- Everything worked together to create a wonderful, warm and memorable evening. Everyone wowed at the food together, clinked their delicious drinks together and enjoyed the wonderful atmosphere here.

The downstairs impressed me for one big reason... There was one table near us, and we were in a big picnic table style set up since we were a large party. And that was it. They could have easily fit in one, maybe two more tables down there. By keeping it emptier, they made it less cramped, more spacious and it seemed less like a busy restaurant and more like a friends house. 

We ate tacos, and lobster was brought down which I was unable to get my hands on... but everyone loved it. The tacos were delicious! We all shared their Margaritas and Sangria which were also great!

That was my first time there, and I will most definitely be coming back! A great place to bring friends, people visiting from out of town, or come here on a date (as long as you don't want intimate settings), but are looking for a more fun atmosphere.

If in the area, come try this. If living 3 hours away, come eat here, its a great spot!
author: Anish B.

description: The Hambuerguesa Torta is overwhelmingly phenomenal. And so simple. I had heard such good things that, as I waited for my food, I started suspecting I would inevitably be disappointed. But I was not, friend. Not even close.
author: Jared M.

description:
Consistently delicious food and drinks. I always get the al pastor tacos with extra pineapple. The salsa is packed with lime and flavor.

The drinks are awesome - the michelada and the sangria are perfect.  Kate is the best bartender in North Beach!!

Go try it. you'll be happy and full of chips and salsa.
author: Eli W.

description:
One of the most unexpected, but best kept secrets of north beach. Don Pistos is a cute little restaurant that I call secretive because it does not have any signs or awnings outside that indicates a restaurant.

The ambiance is very laidback, and restaurant is very airy feeling. Service was also great- we did not wait long and servers were quick without rushing/pressuring us, friendly without being annoying, and attentive without being overbearing. 

The food here was amazing. I ordered the fish tacos, and the fish was perfectly cooked with the best cripsy crust. You only get two, but that was more than enough for me- the portion of fish was very generous and I was definitely satisfied after two. My BF ordered the breakfast burrito which was equally delicious- a little greasy, but that's expected with a breakfast burrito! The watermelon mimosa was delicious as well- they also offer a bottomless option which i wish I had opted for if it hadn't been for the rager I had the night before. 

Will definitely be back!!
author: lauren j.

description: The pollo asado plate was amazing! Some of the best grilled chicken I have ever had. The guacamole is a bit pricey but worth every penny. I recommend it to everyone. Unfortunately, Not a whole lot of beverage options and the margaritas were so-so, nothing too special.
author: Zac C.

description: Very much enjoyed the meal here but will advise that the portions are modest so keep this in mind depending on what you are looking for. Of course, what you do get is very tasty and presented nicely. the staff were friendly and almost bordered on overly-attentive, seemed like every other minute someone was asking how things were or filling our water glasses. Not a bad thing but almost comical by the end. Would definitely return to explore the menu further, the raw tuna tacos were great!
author: Keith H.

description: Having a blast at the bar with Nick!! This guy needs to get discovered. Must add to ur bucket list: Sangria, Shrimp Taco, Hamberguesa, Salmon Sashimi, and Camerones. But must sit at the bar Thur, Fri, Saturday!
author: Z M.

description:
Great hipster Mexican joint in North Beach. Really cool vibe and well worth a visit. 

The free tortilla chips and salsa were fantastic as was the guacamole dip and the carnitas tacos (a bit spicy) I ordered. Awesome margaritas as well.

Excellent and very friendly service---our table was a little bit wobbly and the waitress without being asked came over and put some napkins underneath to stop the wobbling.

Prices are good, most tacos were under $10.
author: Dave S.

description:
For all you Chicagoans, think of this as Big Star's smaller, more down-to-earth cousin without a full bar. Jarritos. Tacos. Bottomless sangria or mimosas at brunch. And, laid back, friendly service. Wait, let me back up: They have delicious tacos. Try the Pastor and Carnitas especially.

This is a must-go for me now anytime I'm in San Fran. It gets a bit crowded on the weekends, and because its tiny plan ahead to avoid the wait.
author: Matthew S.

description: All fish menu? Over priced and pretty drafty by the door. Probably give this place a miss.
author: Sarah A.

description:
Steer clear of this place. We came here on a Saturday night for my bestfriend's birthday. We had a party of 10 and had made the reservations several weeks earlier. 

The service was poor and food was average at best.

I decided to order the "hamberguesa" but because I am severely allergic to gluten, I had asked them to keep the bun off the order. The server responded by saying since this is their signature dish they can make no adjustments. She was extremely rude about it. I understand not wanting to change the items on the menu, but I was merely asking them to keep something off my plate for medical reasons. Additionally, you would think they would make a minor adjustment considering we ordered $750 worth of food!

The rest of the food was very average. I found out later that the owner of this restaurant is not even Mexican. 

I would suggest hitting one of the authentic Mexican restaurants in the city where the actual owner and head chef is Mexican and where they will treat a food allergy seriously.

Sorry Don Pistos. You are lucky to even receive one star.
author: Dirk t.

description:
a perfect place for a date.

Ambiance: romantic. dim lighting with a lit candle on the table.
Parking: hard to find around this area of the city
Wait time: none, only two of us at the time we arrived. However, if you are going in a big group I would suggest, calling and making reservations.
Food: great tacos, chips and salsa
Drinks: only tried the margaritas. bought a whole pitcher. 
Service: great!
author: Aileen F.

description: Love this place! The carne asada tacos, ceviche and guacamole were delicious!!!  All a little spicy which I liked but my sister couldn't handle. The chips were perfect... a lil crunchy and lightly salted. Sangria was really good, but it will sneak up on you. Service was awesome, they frequently checked in to see how we were doing.  Will definitely be back!
author: A R.

description: This was my first visit to Don Pisto's after hearing countless positive reviews. This place did not disappoint! The guacamole competes with Tacolicious - fresh, creamy, melt in my mouth guac. Very yummy! The tortilla soup is pretty fantastic and hits the spot when you're looking for savory and soothing. To quote our favorite ex-governor, I will be back!
author: Liz O.

description:
Had a terrible experience here!
We called early in the day and asked to make a reservation for for 5 adults at 6:30. They told us that they only take reservations for parties of 6 or more. When we asked how early we should get there and if they would be busy at 6:30 they said we should have no problem getting a table. When we arrived at 6:00 just to be safe, they told us it was a 45 minute wait. When they finally did seat our party of FIVE they sat us at a 4 top which meant I had to sit on the corner where there was barley enough room for my plate (while there was an open 6 top right next to us that they wouldn't sit us at). I mean, I have worked in the restaurant business before and when there is a party of 5 you sit them at the 6 top and suck it up! But that is not even the worst of it. One of the people in our party ordered (off of their TINY menu) the mussels and about ten minutes after ordering our waitress came up to us and said they were out of the mussels because they had a bigger party coming in later that they had to save some for in case they ordered them. We were there ordering them NOW and they were saving them for a party larger than 5?? It made no sense! He changed his order to the steak. He asked what came with the steak and the waitress said "nothing, but I can add a side of rice and beans for you if you want." He took that as a consolation prize for not having the mussels and said yes, but when the bill came we were charged for them. Another person in our party ordered the "fried calamari" not realizing that the menu said that they were grilled. The waitress put the order in for calamari and when it came back they were grilled. She could have at least told us that they weren't fried! We would have changed the order! By the time we were getting up to leave, they finally sat people at the 6 top right next to us that was empty during our entire dining experience. 
I will not go back. The food we did eat was average Mexican food and small portions.
author: Fallon R.

description: After having brunch six or so times this past year at Don Pisto's, I just discovered my favorite meal.  The $8 breakfast burrito is a complete deal; it beautifully combines chorizo, eggs, cheese, salsa, and avocado, and it's the perfect size.  And the brioche french toast--though not quite a steal at $12--is big, savory, sweet, and yummalicious with bacon and maple syrup.  This combo was winning!
author: Liz T.

description: Went there on a recent trip to San Francisco.  It was so good that we tried to make excuses to go back to that part of the city the rest of our stay there.  Great young vibe.   Make sure you walk or take the bus so you can enjoy their margaritas appropriately.  Excellent, relatively inexpensive food.  Can be _very_ busy hence the negative comments.  Looking forward to our next visit to SF.  Don Pisto's _will_ be in our "todo" list.
author: Gray W.

description:
Don Pisto's is perfectly hidden in North Beach. No tourists, just locals. 

They have insane chips & salsa, and the tacos are to die. You can't go wrong with the shrimp tacos or chicken tostadas. Chorizo muscles are also incredible. 

Come here for great sangria, even better food and a lovely atmosphere.
author: Nicole S.

description:
I am so happy that I live just a few blocks from this place. Mexican is my favorite and this place does not disappoint. Starting with the chips and guacamole and salse verde -- yum!! Great thick and crunchy chips without seeming too greasy and the salsa verde is so refreshing with a bit of heat (actually, everything has a nice little kick to it, so be careful if you're not a fan of spice!) 

The menu is small but I have not had anything I did not like, and the company I have been with both times I've been here also loved their dishes. Chicken tortilla soup, shrimp tacos, fresh fish tacos, ceviches-- all very good! Cool atmosphere as well.
author: Kristin S.

description:
Bottomless mimosas, margaritas, and sangria on the weekends.

The chips and green salsa would have been enough for me, I couldn't stop eating them!  The guac is MAYBE the best I've ever had, and the food followed suit.
The service was a little choppy, but I was really impressed by how often my 'bottomless' drink was refilled.  It truly felt as if it was bottomless, I never went to drink and didn't have more in my glass.

It is ALWAYS packed. I suggest going at 1050am on the weekends and getting in as it opens at 11am.  I've tried to go at night and never waited the hour or so.
author: Rachel M.

description:
We dined here on a Tuesday night to celebrate the  birthday of one in our party of six.  The food was fantastic! If you are here, try the bone-in pork chop; it's delicious. Plus, it's large enough to feed two people easily.  The chips, too, were superb; some of the best I've ever eaten.  The menu is small but nevertheless has a good variety. 

Be cautious, though, that the upstairs dining room is small, and it is a popular spot with locals.  Reservations are recommended.  I think we'd not have gotten a table if we had not made reservations, even on a week night.

Be aware, too, that the atmosphere is incredibly noisy.  We had a very difficult time hearing each other and our servers.  Overall, it was a good dining experience, but if you're in the mood for long conversation, this is not the best choice for you.
author: Rachel W.

description:
Don't be fooled by the lack of branding on the exterior... this is something worth waiting for (we waited two hours).  Great tacos, the 'make-your-own' chicken taco dish and of course, sangria.

However, for all of those looking for this infamous burger marinated in onion and served with only guacamole, they were sold out and said it would now ONLY be served on Wednesday -- visitor beware.
author: Matt P.

description:
Where are the 6 star reviews?! I keep coming back, and they keep. getting. better.

The Hamburguesa is a CANNOT miss for anyone who loves hamburgers. The Poc Chuc (pork chop) is the best pork chop you'll ever put into your mouth.

NOW SERVING BRUNCH DAILY! They have some of the best Huevos Rancheros in the City, hands down. They also get their Brioche bread from the bakery next door, fresh daily, for their delightful french toast. I need to eat here daily.
author: Chris C.

description:
Came here during Labor Day Weekend and it wasn't as packed as it usually is. Started off with some margaritas and sangria for drinks, then our group shared a plate of Mexican Sashimi. From there, I personally had the Poc Chuc (grilled pork chop loin) because I've always wondered about the dish. Let me tell you, it was BOMB and would recommend it to anyone. It was grilled perfectly and I  was given two large loins. It was a very pleasurable experience as usual, and going to continue to hit this place up. 

Note: Our waitress mistook one of my friend's dishes, so when it came out he mentioned he didn't order that dish. She quickly took it back, and brought the correct dish along with a sangria (on the house). She was great overall and enjoyed her service.
author: Anish G.

description:
(+) Very simply, the tacos are delicious
(-) However, if you are somewhat sensitive to spice, (like me) this makes the dish challenging, or will at least leave you hot!
author: Eric H.

description: This is the best restaurant in the city, hands down. Eat here now. My lengthy, drawn out review wouldn't even serve this place justice. Plus, reading it would waste valuable time you should be spending at Don Pistos, eating.
author: Nick P.

description: Great food (huevos and guac) and Margs for brunch! Bustling place. Not as trendy as I thought, but still cool
author: Katherine L.

description:
Most definitely a place to check out in San Fran. Be sure to make a reservation - this place is always packed! Now to the nitty gritty...

The Pro's
Cool, modern space
Friendly, accommodating staff
THE HAMBURGESA! If I could give ratings on food items alone, it was be five stars all the way. The burger is so flavorful and different than any other I've had in the city... a truly special meal!

The Con's
Not a full bar - only serving wine & beer
Overall the food (besides the burger) hasn't blown me away. Good, but nothing noteworthy
author: Jessica W.

description:
Got one of the last small tables before the line started forming out the restaurant (Wednesday dinner) and when the superb tortilla soup arrived, I could understand the onslaught of diners.  The soup had a rich, deep chicken taste, with tantalizing spices, avocado, and succulent small pieces of chicken.  The server mentioned that the kitchen made Elote (grilled corn on the cob, slathered with a spicy mayonnaise and cotijo cheese) - irresistible and living up to its decadent promise!  The fish tacos (with red snapper) were well done (although I always regret not having ordered carnitas - nothing can compete with the divine pig), the same goes for the carne asada version.

The service, while friendly and efficient, had some drawbacks, not necessarily its fault, though.  All the food came almost at once!  This is not good when you are enjoying a still-full bowl of piping hot soup.  I could not give up eating the delicious soup, so the tacos and elote got cold, a real shame.

The long line of patrons waiting for tables made me rush a bit and also contemplate a reservation policy that makes no sense to me:  there were several very big tables empty (the restaurants takes reservations for "parties of six or more") while all the while lots of folks were waiting for small tables.  Does this make sense?
author: Thor T.

description: Very nice establishment, good food, nice staff. Chicken wings are great! Must try! As far as mexican food goes, this restaurant has nothing of it which is great. Non mexican music, proper english speaking waiters and everything tastes and smells good.
author: P R.

description:
Holy Heaven I love this place. 

Chips and fresh Salsa Verde, done. 
Pitcher of Acai Berry Sangria to wash it all down, another done.

I've only ever had the Camarones tacos, because I can't get past how  delicious they are. They are consistently tasty, which is important.

All the servers are friendly and attentive.

(My only tiny criticism, it can get SUPER loud, in Bauer's terminology, a BOMB)
author: Allison B.

description: Passed this place million times and finally got a chance to try it when my European colleague read about it and insisted we should go there for our team dinner.  The place was packed @ 8:30pm on a Wed night w/ the incredible smell of yummy grilled calamaris in the air.  We ordered just about everything off of their small but solid menu.  All grilled items were out-of-this-world flavorful: lobster, chicken, calamaris (had 3 orders to finally satisfy the crowd, i.e. me :).  Mexican sashimis were fresh, ceviche was ok but guac was the creamiest I've ever had.  Salsa's got a kick to it so we needed LOADs of guac to neutralize it.  Tacos need a little jazzing up, they were the only items our table didn't fight over.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Hard to find, as there is no sign, but very good.  I had the carnitas torta and my wife had an Asada taco.  Good chips and green salsa.
author: Glen R.

description: Best mexican food in town -- open late, fun atmosphere! Recommend you get the ceviche, any of the tacos, chicken tortilla soup (best ive ever had) yum yum, damn all of it is excellent!! Get ready to wait during weekends as it is full! Best times to go are later at night, and during the week late at night (past 9pm). No sign at the door, just a red light!
author: E B.

description:
Let's be honest. We all know the nightmare that is trying to find parking around Telegraph Hill. We also know that there never really is a good time to go, and that your chances of finding good parking your first time around the block is about as high as winning the million dollar lottery. That being said, Don Pisto's is worth the agonizing ordeal of finding parking. 
The flavors and textures of all the dishes we got were spot on. 
- The calamari is a must! It comes out grilled perfectly, and full of flavor. Plus, the presentation is gorgeous, and the colors on the plate really pop. 
- Mexican sashimi with salmon. I was apprehensive about ordering this dish, but my love for sashimi would not let me pass this one up, and I'm glad I didn't. The fish was fatty and fresh and had a bit of zest to it, which was nice because then it didn't end up being overly oily on the mouth. This dish was good, not the best sashimi, but the name tells you what to expect and it's definitely a must try for the curious sashimi-lover. 
-Al pastor tacos. The pork was seasoned very well. Not over-salted like at a lot of places, and the chunks of pineapple really bring out the natural sweetness and flavor of the pork. Yum! Not your usual al pastor meat if you're used to the shredded kind, but this one gives you great texture and a mouthful of deliciousness in every bite.
I really enjoyed my meal here, and I definitely will be coming back...I just pray that we can find good parking again the next time around.
author: Grace C.

description: This place is awesome! A taste of Mexico with a modern twist! Service was excellent. We had to wait a bit for the Possole, but it was worth wait! I definitely recommend Don Pistos if you're looking for something a little different give a shot! You have to try their Tuna Tacos and Green Chile Verde Posole!
author: Eddie L.

description: Came out to SF and was gunna go to Mama's but the line was really long. Walked around and ended up at this place and I'm glad I did. Staff was very accommodating and genuinely good people. The food was great as well! Alvin and Sarah, thanks for making my birthday in SF memorable. You all are good people and that's what I like about the restaurant besides the food, the people that work there that genuinely love making their customers comfortable and happy! Thanks again!
author: Silver D.

description:
Came here for breakfast for the first time during the chaotic weekend that was Outside Lands, and while I wish they would have refilled my bottomless sangria a bit quicker, I understand it was only because they were extremely busy (that sangria was delicious btw!). The french toast I ordered was OUTSTANDING, and the bite of the bacon marinated burger I had was fantastic as well.

Can't wait to eat at this place again.
author: J.J. P.

description:
There's mexican food in North Beach!? 
That was my first reaction. However, the food isn't your typical mexican food - it's street food. I went with 3 others and it seems like we ordered 1 of everything on the menu. Start with the guacamole - its AWESOME. 
We also had the chorizo mussels, summer stew and each of the kinds of tacos. The mussels were great - as was the summer stew. I didn't try the tacos but my friends liked them :)
I will definitely be back to try the tortilla soup!
author: Sara P.

description:
Don't come here hungry.

I say this for several reasons, only one of which is a knock. Overall I think the place is great, so let's get down to it.

Don Pisto's seems like this little hole in the wall place over on North Beach/Telegraph - there's no signage or anything, so you just have to keep your eye out or go with somebody who's been there before. Very minimalistic, very small.

Incidentally, so are their portions. Tiny tacos all around. If you're hungry, be prepared to order seconds.

But the other reason not to come here hungry, is because you'll be totally willing to order half the menu. Everything on it sounds awesome, and that's generally because they ARE awesome.

It's also one of the only places I've dined in where they carry Mexican Coke, you know, the kind made with real sugar and in the old fashioned glass bottles? They'll bring it to you with a wedge of lemon, and it's outstanding. Mas refresco, amigos.

The service is good, it's about as quick as you'd want it to be, but not overattentive either. It's just right.

Ultimately, it's great for a brunch or light lunch, but if you want to really pack it in, you're better served elsewhere. Either way, Don Pisto's is quality. Check it out.
author: Cristopher B.

description:
Last night I finally went to Don Pistos, the new Mexican restaurant in North Beach. I had been to El Raigon once, the Argentinian restaurant that used to be located at the same spot. I'm SO happy with the substitution, and now know that I will come back many many times!

My friend and I got there at around 8:30, and there were only a few people waiting for a table. We were able to sit at the bar right away, and met the owner, Pete, who is simply one of the most gracious man I have ever met. He was so patient and nice to my friend - who had had a little too much to drink before we got there - I couldn't be more grateful! I was sold right there!

We started our drinks at the bar, but were soon seated at a table by the window. I have always been a big fan of the ambiance - brick walls, wood straight line tables and chairs, wood counter, dim light. Now they added fun Latin music, which only makes the whole experience more endearing!

We started with the homemade chips, with tomatillo lime salsa and guacamole. We also ordered the ahi-tuna ceviche and the carne asada tacos. Everything was really simple, but super fresh and full of flavors! I think that's where the charm of the place resides! The ceviche was sort of tropical, with fresh diced mangoes and cilantro. The salsa and guacamole came in large bowls, for my pleasant surprise (LOOOVE big portions!!!). The carne asada tacos had some spice to them, but just enough to give it a nice kick. Everything was nicely complemented by their great - and somewhat spicy - sangria!

I really enjoyed the classy design of the menu, the cozy and elegant ambiance, the beautiful food presentation, the freshness and quality of the ingredients, the flavorful dishes plus the attentive and warm service. I want to come back to try their 'tortas', which are their 'Mexican sandwiches', and also for their brunch, my favorite meal. Also I would actually rate it a 4.5, and would round it up to 5 if they offered more options on their menu. I hope they do soon! :-)
author: Simone W.

description:
I took a few friends here who were totally craving mexican.  they both live in places that dont have particularly good mexican food and knew that they could get a great meal in san francisco.  we were definitely not let down.

we ordered a pitcher of margaritas, guacamole, fish tacos, and tacos al pastor.  everything was really delicious and reasonably priced.  the salsa they bring you when you first sit down is great, too.  the service was pretty good and the place was super cool inside.  definitely coming back here.
author: Lisa C.

description:
My boyfriend and I had dinner at Don Pisto's for Cinco de Mayo last week, and their stuff was damn good, and I don't even like Mexican food.  

We started the meal with margaritas and sangria.  Since Don Pisto's doesn't have a liquor license, they make their margaritas with a chardonnay liqueur instead of tequila, which is fine with me.  My boyfriend thought it was too sweet and preferred the less-sweet sangria.  

Our first appetizer was the Mexican Sashimi, a lineup of seven tuna slices covered in cilantro, lime, red pepper, and very thin jalapenos slivers--a tasty combination that suited the freshness of the tuna.  Next, we ordered six oysters on the half shell drizzled in lime juice because we love our oysters and knew they would taste good.  

For my entree, I had the Hamburguesa, basically a hamburger made with a fluffy, smokey patty with bacon and onion undertones, all covered in guacamole.  I enjoyed it but not to the extent that the boyfriend did.  For his entree, the boyfriend ordered the Manchaca Beef (braised kobe beef) With Eggs, and let me tell you, it was amazing.  I don't know how to describe it other than in pseudo-sexual language.  You know how, once in a long while, you eat something so delicious that it hits that happy spot in the pit of your stomach that releases ungodly amounts of dopamine and puts you on cloud nine for the rest of the night, and when you wake up the next day, all you want is more of it because you want to hit that spot again?  Yes?  No?  Maybe?  Ok, well, that's how good it was for me.  I don't know what they did with that beef, but I hope they keep it up.
author: Niya Y.

description: When my friends told me about Mexican in North Beach, I was a bit weary.  I expected a Taco Shop; however, I was thoroughly surprised with gourmet Chevy's, minus the dated decor.  Tacos were expensive and small, tortilla soup was pleasant, and the Al Pastor was okay.  I expected more for the price, but not overly disappointed.
author: Roman A.

description:
Who knew to look for margaritas and guacamole in North Beach?  Actually if we hadn't been looking for it I'm not sure that we would have found it. Is there no sign for this restaurant?
Ok so for the review...I thought the margaritas were good, not excellent, but good. That is the only thing about this place that was less than excellent. Our server, wish I'd gotten his name, was super personable and had great advice on what to order. The guacamole was probably the best I've ever tasted, honestly I thought it was WOW! The other two I was eating with thought the same. And the chips, which the waiter had warned as he put them on the table were HOT, having just come out of the fryer, were so yummy, just the right thickness, super crunchy and salty. YUM! We had the fish tacos, so delicious, and the Niman Ranch pork chop, which was recommend by our server. We probably would not have ordered this without the enthusiastic tip but we were all sure glad that we did. I've never seen a pork chop this large, easily big enough for the three of us to share and it was as good as he said it would be, so tender and had great flavor. It fell right off the bone. We were too full for desert but we were very satisfied and happy with our meal and experience.
If I had to come up with something negative, I would say that it was a bit loud and made talking a little difficult, but that would be the extent of anything negative. I will definitely be coming back here!
author: Patricia E.

description:
Encanta las hamburguesas! Hamburguesas son deliciosos! (I knew high school Spanish would come in handy someday).

"Marinated in bacon"...How can that not be good?! I'm a total hamburger snob and this is a great interpretation. When the burger gets to the table you're hit with the essence of bacon in the air and that first bite is so juicy you'll need extra napkins to mop up your face. The guacamole adds a nice textual touch as the bun, not a traditional burger bun mind you, rather more akin to the bread used for a torta. 

Not to be outdone are the tacos. I had the camarones for my first visit but I will definitely  be back for the others. The shrimp are cooked to succulent perfection with nice heat from the avacado salsa. Overall a great taco.

Only weird thing was when the wait staff said "We're a bit backed up on the Pacifico beer orders at the bar..." Were they having trouble with the bottle opener? Anyhow, food was great...I can wait a few extra minutes for my cerveza.
author: David H.

description:
The mussels with chorizo tasted pretty good at the time, but gave me and my friend food poisoning. Rough.

The burger was a huge disappointment - dry and overcooked. I literally don't understand why this dish is on the 7x7 100 Things to eat in SF list.

The chips and salsa were probably the best part of the meal, and that's just not enough to bring me back here. Sorry, Don Pistos.
author: Julia G.

description:
This restaurant was astounding! Four of us went here last Friday, and while it looked packed, the wait time was very short. We had steak tacos, amazing guacamole, cerviche, tuna, and game hen...all were nothing short of fantastic! The prices were reasonable, and while I didn't drink, my friend said the Sangria was amazing!

Because it's so small the acoustics aren't so great and it's hard to hear, but other than that it was fantastic!
author: Shayna R.

description:
Went here with my sister for lunch.  I got fish tacos, she got hamburger w/ guacamole? dish.

OMG best fish tacos I have had in sf!  While expensive for tacos, they were about the same price as nick's but significantly better!  Everything about them was perfection - the fish was fresh and seasoned and cooked perfectly (its sauteed or grilled, not deep fried) and the condiments on top of the fish were the perfect compliment to the fish (I don't remember exactly what it was, but probably was cilantro, onion, and some sort of pickled vegetable).  I like nick's crispy fish tacos, but I love these fish tacos!  These were smaller, but better quality.

So my sister's dish was late - very late - not exactly sure what had happened, but her food came out a solid 10 to 20 minutes later than mine!  Her hamburger guacamole dish was alright, nothing to rave about.  The waitress apologized many times for the delay, and to compensate for the mistake she gave us the entire check on the house!  Wow that is some amazing customer service! that I definitely appreciated since it sucks big time for such a long period of time to go by between delivering our meals.

The complimentary chips and salsa were yummy.

I am definitely going back for more fish tacos here!  Great diversion from all the average/poor quality and over priced "italian" food in north beach targeted for tourists.
author: Ali G.

description:
Excellent food, service and atmosphere. My only gripe is no dessert is offered bc they want to get people in and out faster said the waitress. 

We had grilled calamari, sashimi, agave shots, sangria, tacos, and the lobster. Really loved the menu and staff!!

Love this spot and will be back.
author: Laurene R.

description:
Truly good food.  Hamburguesa is a really special dish--its brimming with bacon love.  

One knock is no hard liquor so margaritas are a little different with agave nectar stuff.
author: Mike I.

description:
Authentic Mexican Street Food! Delicious. 
Hamburgesa Mmmmm Try it!
The ceviche is excellent!! Definitely deserves 5 stars.
author: Michelle W.

description:
Cool place and friendly staff, carne asada is da bomb!!
Nice place to bring a date ....
author: pouria m.

description: This is my favorite restaurant. I suggest going in on a sunday evening to avoid the crowd and enjoy two dollar beers. My favorite meal is the steamed.mussels topped with their house made chorizo. Feel free to sample multiple items on the menu because everything is very modestly priced.
author: erich s.

description:
Agree with others that the Tortilla soup is delish!! The menu isn't huge, but everything they make, they make well!! Carnitas, Carne Asada and Chicken tacos are all fabulous!!

The service here was great!! Our waitress was super attentive and even gave us advice on how much to order (by ordering one less order of tacos). Which we were all grateful for as we could barely finish what we had on our plates. 

All in all a great place, and looks like it's going to survive (compared to the Argentinian Steak place that was previously here).
author: Rana A.

description:
When it comes to mexican food in North Beach, your options can be limited.

You got your Rico's, you got your Zorro's, and then and of course you got your PISTOS!!
 
Excellent spicy little tacos, great service and the low-key vibe makes this place a standout. You know your entering an intimate and unique restaurant when there's not even a sign outside the establishment to let you know you're at the right place. And when you do enter, it feels nothing but right. The decor is pretty slick too - brick walls, artwork and shades of red everywhere painting the atmosphere.

The affordable prices also make it a good option for take-out, but taking your date here is where it's at.
author: Lee L.

description:
Fabulous, fabulous, fabulous semi-upscale mexican place.  It definitely has sort of a divey/neighborhood feel to it, but the food is first class.

One reason alone to come here are the tacos.  We had the fish and carne asada, both which are 5 star worthy!

Sundays they have $2 beers and tacos, or something along those lines, great deal! Come as you are!
author: Alex C.

description:
i had zero expectations when i arrived at don pistos (what is a mexican restaurant doing in the heart of north beach anyhow?), but i was pretty impressed by the time i left! 

a group of us came here for dinner one night (one of my friends is trying to conquer the 7x7 list and the hamburgesa is on it). it was pretty empty when we got there, but it got steadily busier and busier as we ate our meal. we all ordered the hamburgesa, and two of us also got the carnitas tacos to share. it's all meant to be eaten tapas-style, but the hamburgesa is definitely more than enough to feed one. it was pretty awesome - it's a hamburger patty with bacon and onions,  topped with guacamole. deliciousness!!!! definitely deserving of the "things you must eat before you die" label.

the tacos were quite good as well. those are on the smaller side, and definitely designed to be eaten tapas-style. they also give you chips and salsa, and the salsa is awesome! it's not your average variety - it's a very refreshing green salsa.

servers are attentive and friendly and the prices are very reasonable! the restaurant has a cozy, classy feel - it's not your average mexican joint.

definitely coming back!
author: Caroline I.

description: The food was so delicious and the wait staff super friendly! I feel like a lot of Mexican restaurants only care about the main part of the dish but at Don Pisto's the beans and rice and salsa and chips and everything was top notch!
author: Kaylinda M.

description:
This place is a gem ... such a treat to visit an authentic Mexican restaurant in a part of the city that can often feel overwhelmed by touristy Italian places.

I loved the cozy vibe and the staff was super welcoming. The tortilla soup was to die for. I'll definitely be going back!
author: Meg M.

description: Awesome tacos and service. A lot of Chicago people work here so we felt right at home although we were on vacation. Get the chorizo and mussels!
author: Josh C.

description: I get emotional just thinking about my experience here. Intimate, perfectly lit setting. Wonderful service, awesome music, and terrific food. If you want to impress someone this is the spot.
author: Joe G.

description: z is that place sucks I'm I went up over here trying to get parking for 35 minutes this place suck then they will have some private event fuck that shit
author: Daniel B.

description:
A local we befriended on our weekend trip suggested Don Pisto's and his recommendation was spot on. Reasonable prices and delicious food!

My husband and I shared the chicken tortilla soup (YUM) and the shrimp tacos. Small interior creates a warm and intimate dining atmosphere and the service was great! 

If I lived in SF, I'd definitely return to Don Pisto's.
author: A. S.

description: Just moved into SF and felt like Tacos. Waited for 45 minutes at the bar. Cozy place and busy. Had the shrimp and red snaper tacos, they were fantastic. The micheladas were spicy with real limes, absolutely fantastic.
author: Aziz S.

description: Kinda a hidden gem since there is not company signage on the building. We had lobster, pork tacos and the pork chop, mussels and a few more items and they were all great.  The dipping sauces are very good!!.  We got there about their closing time and they did not rush us.    I really think you cannot go wrong with anything!
author: Robin n.

description: So great. Tacos Al Pastor were incredible. Staff was very friendly and took good care of us. The guacamole was really good - simple, not overly seasoned. Atmosphere was really cozy and pleasant.
author: Craig E.

description:
I've been trying to go here since it opened up and all my 'hoodies say it's the best.  I came in for sunday brunch with a few friends and Don Pisto's did not disappoint.  Our server was super friendly and attentive.  I got their taco sonora (veg vesion) and it was excellent.  The chips with tomatillo salsa were great too.  And, I have to say I was impressed by the selection of non alcoholic mexican drinks.

However, the bottomless mimosas and sangria will most likely cast their evil spell one day and I will be back.  I can't wait!
author: Sameer D.

description:
Staff is fantastic and easy going!  Great place for big groups.  I have only gone for brunch, but do try the french toast and the bottomless sangria is a must!

A girlfriend and I literally stayed until 4pm on a Sunday....they close at 3PM.  The staff was nice enough not to ask us to leave and continued to serve us Sangria.  =)
author: Sonia M.

description: Expensive for what the food is. Server was slightly rude and very inaccessible. Food was good but not great, especially for the price. The pescado taco was pretty delicious though. Everything else was just good. Mussels with chorizos were okay. In my opinion, the chorizos did not go super well with the mussels and the bread were too dry and crunchy.
author: Carrie T.

description:
Carne Asada tacos were amazing. Guacamole is really good, not too oniony. Perfect portions for lunch with 2 tacos and chips/guac.

The best part?! Bottomless mimosas for brunch! The service is fantastic, usually when you get all you can eat/drink, the service is super slow, not here! If my drink got low, our server was here to top it off without even asking. Great place overall.
