author: Katrina E.

description:
Drove to the city for lunch just to try this place. Our friends told us this was a hidden gem in the city but it turns out, it was packed! We grabbed seats at the bar so we didn't wait long. Fresh fried chips and green salsa, yummy. Great service from the bartender, he gave us a little history on the place, the chef, the family. Fun to have a little insight. We ordered the tacos Fish & Shrimp. Loved them both, the fish more-so. The atmosphere was perfect for a Sunday getaway to SF, little brick building, cozy & loud. Very happy we took the trip down. 

We will be back to try the dinner menu soon!
author: Lea D.

description: The line is long(Just go get a drink on Grant st.), but totally worth it!!!!! If it is your first time, you have to try the pork chop and Margarita!! Definitely the best pork chop I ever have!!!!!!
author: L C.

description:
We're regulars at Don Pisto's.  It's our favorite restaurant in North Beach at the moment.  It's also our favorite Mexican restaurant in the city, which is a little surprising considering it's location.
The food is always good. The service is great.  The weekend brunch has bottomless Margaritas for $15.
author: Jim R.

description:
This place is a total gem.

1. It's very hidden, with no sign off of the street. That's on purpose; they're hiding from late night club-types looking for "mexican food".
2. Try the hamburgesa; it will alter your life.
author: Daniel M.

description: Amazingly good fresh real Mexican food and strong margs too. Would eat here once a week if i lived in SF.
author: Blair M.

description:
This is a review written by two people, one a yelp connoisseur and the other a mexican connoisseur (of the foodstuffs variety).

Call it a cliche, but don pistos 'exceeded our expectations'.  Far from the mundane, the chips and salsa (and guac) were right out of guanajuato.  The mussels and chorizo were an amalgamation of traditional andalucian cooking and baja californian inspiration.  The tortilla soup tasted as if the non-existant mexican grandmother of my dreams had made it.  And last, but certainly not least, the tacos des carnitas were better than guadlajara's best.

(to translate, Sabrina says that the tortilla soup was really good and spicy, the carnitas tacos were THE BEST IVE EVER EATEN, and the mussels and chorizo were novel and to die for.  Some of us aren't as smart as Garrett)

Also, as a perk we got to sit next to Tony Bennett!!  Totally awesome to see him here.  Don Pistos is definitely a scene on Sunday night, expect to wait about 30 minutes for a table, but nothing a modelo light (on special, 2 were 4.50) can't fix!  LOVE!
author: Sabrina R.

description: Don Pistos has the best carnitas tacos! They also have good micheladas! This is a must go to restaurant in SF! Delicious!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
I am addicted to the chips and salsa.
I am so glad Don Pistos opened around the corner from my workplace.
The service is great, and the food is phenomenal.
It's hard to pick a few  favorite things, as the menu does change. but for now the Hamburguesa Torta, Shrimp tacos and ceviche.....
everything I have had is really good...
Finally, quality mexican in N.B.
author: Karlee D.

description:
Hands down, the best pastor tacos I've had... and that includes some serious Los Angeles taco trucks and even (as much as it pains me to say it) Chapala in Morro Bay. http://www.yelp.com/biz/chapala-restaraunt-morro-bay. 

The tenderness and texture of the meat, the perfect blend of savory and sweet in the marinade, the delicious avocado-tomatillo sauce, the juicy bites of pineapple and the perfectly cooked, pastor-soaked tortillas make for an absolutely heavenly experience.

Our waiter was excellent and when we had a small issue with one of the dishes, he bent over backwards to make sure we weren't unhappy for even a second.  He was always there when we needed him and genuinely seemed to be enjoying his job.

The owner/chef, Pete, came out and chatted passionately about his food, making us feel like regulars even though we're from out of town.   At the end of the evening, they sent out a delicious plate of churros with a candle in it for my wife's birthday.

It's great to see places like this where the staff really cares about the food and the people they're serving it to.  I'm not the kind of guy that easily forks out $4 for a taco.... but this place is worth every penny.
author: Matt L.

description: It's Funville.  Food is outstanding -- best tacos north of the Mission.  Great staff.  Leave your inhibitions behind and go bottomless -- with the sangria.
author: Tim G.

description: I went here on a Sunday morning with 3 friends after a night of drinking. Bottomless mimosas, sangria and "margaritas" (made with agave alcohol that was somehow not tequila but still worked very well) for $18. You can mix and match too, however there is an hour and a half time limit. At first the time limit thing seemed annoying but as my hangover faded and my day drunk began i realized there was WAY more then enough time to finish as many as could be handled. The food was good but I only tried my friends because I felt too sick to eat a whole meal. Adrianne was our server, God bless that woman. The last half hour of our brunch the place was pretty packed. Our table was a loud drunken mess, laughing and saying way too many bad words...loudly. Adrianne never even told us to be quiet. She made sure our drinks kept coming then sent us on our merry way back out onto the streets of San Francisco. Next time I'm in town Don Pisto's will be where I spend my sunday morning. So much fun :)
author: Lauren G.

description: I have been to many Mexican restaurants in the City, and Don Pisto's is by far one of the best!!!  Their tacos camarones are the best!!!  The don't serve hard liquor so don't expect margaritas, but they do have agave, wine, beer.  I used them to cater my daughter's graduation party from UC, Berkeley (#gobears!), and I was so happy with the food.  My guests were amazed!  Thank you, Michelle!
author: L T.

description:
My friend held her birthday brunch at Don Pisto's and it's a great little spot. I had a great looking carne asada soft taco. I can't really review the food because I had a monster cold that took away my sense of taste for a bit (tragic!!!) but the service was AMAZING! Even though we were in the private room downstairs they kept checking on us and refilling the pitchers/chips etc. They even brought bottles of champagne in case people needed a little more for their mimosas! 

We paid $25 per person including bottomless mimosas/ sangria and everyone left super satisfied and tipsy. 

Parking hint: go uphill :)
author: Valerie A.

description:
Love this place! Delicious sangria, tacos, and brunch options. 

I have tried the Camarones tacos & the Huevos Rancheros - & recommend both. The salsa & guac both come with A LOT of cilantro so if you are not a fan make sure you ask for them without.

Recently went on a busy Sunday for brunch, they were running low on sangria so they substituted us bottomless blood orange margaritas (yum). 

Great brunch in North Beach!
author: Amanda S.

description:
Mixed feelings.

The front-of-the-house guy was super cool.

They had 32-ounce Coronas.  

The burger was marinated in bacon. Unique and delicious.

The guacamole had too much onion. Guac should be all about the avocado.

The chips tasted a little "off." They weren't as warm, oily, and fresh from the fryer as I prefer. 

The margaritas were watered down.

I'd bring someone here for the burger and a fat boy Corona, but otherwise am unenthusiastic.
author: Michael C.

description:
I probably would have enjoyed this place more had I not been hungover and able to drink the $12 bottomless mimosas.  

Yes, my friends and I are the assholes that show up in a group of 12 for Sunday brunch.  Who does that?  This probably would have been completely fine had there not already been a birthday party in the downstairs room for 40, which seemed to tie up the kitchen staff.

That being said, it was a very, very long wait for a table (an hour and a half-ish).  To their credit the bartender was friendly as was the rest of the staff, even though our crowd was cramping their walkway to the register.  Luckily the bartender got everyone started on the mimosas and set out some chips for us so we were good to go.  And they had Mexican coke, which is a huge plus in my book.  I have a deep, deep love of chips and salsa, and this place beats all others in recent memory.  Their guacamole is also perfect.

Our waitress was very friendly and personable and put up with our inevitably drunk group, and was even kind enough to just leave pitchers of mimosas on the table.  She was fairly prompt at putting in our order, but the table of 40 was ahead of us so we ended up waiting roughly an hour for food.  All in all it made brunch into an almost four hour ordeal, which I probably would have found unexcusable had I not been in good company, food and staff.  

I will have to try again when I'm ready to party down at brunch with those mimosas and have fewer people.

But for this round I had the Taco Sonora carne asada, which was really good, just not a huge portion of food (luckily I had already filled up on chips during the long wait).  The breakfast burrito looked incredible, so maybe I'll try that next round.
author: Christina T.

description:
After reading some of the reviews I was glad we stopped by for lunch rather than waiting in line for dinner. I was hoping the understated (bland) interior existed only as a muse to blow me away with some great food! Not so much.  I guess I just don't get it....
     To start we had the guacamole. Holy bland! Break out some spices peeps! It tasted like room temperature avocado soup:(
Since I didnt want "brunch" at 2 in the afternoon on a Thursday, we had about 4 or 5 choices for tacos. 
     We had the carnitas and the al pastor tacos. So I get a warm tortilla, warm meat and some hyper spicy salsa? That's what people r waiting in line for? Seriously, I'm curious. I guess I'm too much of a texture snob. I got the warm/soft. Give me some cold and crunchy.  Something to balance out the meat perhaps. Seemed very one dimensional to me. 
     I had heard great things about this joint so needless to say I was underwhelmed. Had I waited for an hour or so and gone with a big group, now I woulda just been pissed. In my opinion, a complete lack of imagination and execution. Being the minority with that perspective, I would normally give a place another chance. However, with such a limited menu I hardly see the point.  Movin on...
author: Mark N.

description:
i'm generally not a fan of overhyped sf places. i thought this would be one of them after seeing the long lines. we got lucky with the wait since i asked the host every 5 min how much longer :)

sangria: really good
pescado: good because it was a big piece of fish but it was a little bland
al pastor: superrrr delicious
mexican sashimi:  just salmon but it has a delicious sauce
mussels: SUPER DELICIOUS. would definitely order this over and over. 

warning: those peppers are dangerous. some of them are get super spicy..
author: Janet Y.

description:
It's crazy how good this place was.  

Be careful though, the outside is very nondescript - if you're not careful you may suddenly pass it.

I took 2 of my friends in public transportation.  We were out of town and my friends, knowing I'd been to SF several times and I bragged about knowing the best places in Mission to eat authentic Mexican food, took public transportation to get to this place.  When we walked in, and saw all the white people working there, and the very chic atmosphere, I wanted to sink into my jacket. I gulped, and pretended I knew what I was talking about. 

My friend instinctively ordered Horchata.  The very nice waitress told him they didn't have any.  I ordered the bottomless watermelon mimosa, which was champagne mixed with traditional Mexican watermelon "water" (agua fresca).  My friend doesn't drink, so he ordered just the watermelon "water" which wasn't on the menu but the waitress brought him anyway. 

I ordered the carnitas tacos and was prepared to wince at first taste, my friends ordered the fish tacos and I can't remember what the third one had.

I was FLOORED by the taste.  No, this was not authentic like you find in the taco stands in Mexico (we used to make them), but they were...should I say it....better.  They taste was REALLY good of the carnitas.  Nothing was quite "authentic" but it did taste Mexican and it did taste very good.  

I can't say enough about the nice staff either.

Overall, I'm waiting for my next trip to SF so I can try this place again.
author: Pedro H.

description:
Festive.  Dim.  Generous.

SERVICE is good, but slightly impersonal.  

AMBIANCE is festive and fun - looks like an old renovated bar, especially with the neon Dos Equis sign abuzz.  Whimsical pastel Chili hanging light pendants keeps the scene flirty and sexy.

Yes - the TORTILLA SOUP is large.  However - it resembles more of an unhappy marriage between Italian wedding soup and an overdose of roughly chopped tomatoes, avocado, and onions.  Not bad, but definitely lacking Latin flare.

Kudos for complimentary heaping bowl of warm THICK homefried chips and fresh seasonal salsa (tomatillo) 

Want to try: sangria, burgers

$10-20 per person
author: Jane L.

description: I absolutely loved this place when I first tried it, but then I learned of their health score which made me reeeally sad :(
author: Marwa A.

description: I came here with my boy around 11 pm on a Saturday and there was no wait! We ordered tortilla soup which was a little too salty but flavorful. We also got the rib chops which was delicious. The vibe of this place is excellent- it's really a late-night, classy sit down place. There isn't anyone walking around getting drinks at the bar. A good place to with friends or on a date when it's late!
author: Steven Y.

description: I thought the food was very good and the service was great.  Arrived right at opening and there was a line outside.  Fairly small but there is room at the bar if you are alone.   Very loud.  It was the day of the St Paddy's parade so everyone was in their early 20's and in green ready to party.  I would recommend Don Pisto's.
author: Brian C.

description: Don Pisto's has great tequila drinks and food (really yummy guac) and a very fun vibe. There's a big room downstairs for private parties. Although the menu is somewhat small, I've heard great things about many things on the menu. I chose to go with the Mary's chicken entree which was delicious - and comes with all the necessary ingredients to make your own chicken tacos. Word to the wise though: do not under any circumstance attempt to eat the green onion. For whatever reason even after I couldn't cut it with my knife I decided to add a stalk to my taco... bad decision. Did I think my teeth were razorblades? Not sure. But I couldn't bite through it and what resulted was probably the most horrendous eating experience I've ever had on a date. Whoops.
author: Gina C.

description:
Don Pistos is a great addition to the North Beach dining scene. In a sea of mediocre Italian restaurants, a solid Mexican spot is just what the neighborhood needed. And that's exactly what it is, nothing groundbreaking but a solid neighborhood joint.

The menu is small but everything on it sounded enticing. We ordered with our eyes instead of our heads (aka ordered way too  much food) and tried:

-ceviche of the day: shrimp with chunks of avocado
-carne asada tacos (we wanted carnitas but they ran out)
-pollo asado tacos
-hamburguesa: they had me at marinated in bacon and onions!

The tacos came two to an order with a side of pickled chilies/carrots and were surprisingly large. The chicken was a clear winner over the steak, probably the first time I've ever uttered that phrase.

The ceviche was also a nice portion and had a great, acidic bite. It was served with homemade chips which were really tasty but served cold...I would have preferred the chips warm. We were also offered some chips and salsa as we sat at the bar waiting for our table. Nice touch.

Now, the hamburguesa. I don't know what got in to me to order a burger at a Mexican restaurant but it was definitely the right decision! Slathered in guacamole and served on a soft bun, this is a must order for the burger lover.

Service was over the top friendly, though we asked for our food to be paced it did come pretty much all at once. I'll chalk that up to opening month issues. Also, the menu doesn't offer your typical Mexican restaurant options - no enchiladas, no tamales, no three combo platters. Don Pistos is sticking to the upscale street food theme and with food this good, I think they are really on to something. 

Bonus points for being open late (12:30am during the week, 1am on the weekends) and have a large selection of Mexican beer! No margaritas, unfortunately, but next time I'll be sampling the sublime looking sangria.
author: phil h.

description:
Who knew good mexican food exhisted in the heart of North Beach?!

(Mexican would be a loose definition of  the food. It's not traditional mexican food, it definately has a strong fresh californian gourmet influence)

#1 the sangria is AMAZING, you get this huge picture which gave us 4 girls about two glasses each.

#2 The resturant promotes sharing all the dishes, which is while all the food comes out at really random times... sharing is caring :)

#3 I have yet to eat something that didn't make me really happy. 
I personally really really like the mussels and the al pastor tacos.

#4 The wait is usually 30-40 minutes every time I have gone... it is worth the wait. Each time, my friends and I have headed to a near by bar to have a quick drink while we waited. The hostess calls your cell.
author: Veronica T.

description:
We were in San Francisco on business and decided to find a non-chain Mexican restaurant.  Given that it was May 5th, the wait was pretty long - but worth it!  The food was excellent!  We had the Carne Asada, Pescado and Carnitas tacos. All of them were served on homemade corn tortillas and a roasted jalepeno.  I couldn't say that I enjoyed any one of them more than the others as they were all great!

Oh, the margerita's were good too  :o)

There is no signage for the place - you have to look for 510 on the face of the building.  This was a great find and worth the trip.
author: John A.

description: Great food, great staff, had such a great nice sitting at the bar with my wife talking to Nick and the rest of the team..... The sangria was also excellent.
author: Tyler M.

description:
In a neighborhood dotted with mediocre Italian restaurants, Don Pistos, a casual, rustic Mexican joint, is a refreshing addition to the North Beach dining scene. 

The three of us came to Don Pistos for dinner last night and were delighted by the food and the service! Even though the menu is somewhat limited (tacos, tortas & ceviche), we managed to order way too much food because everything sounded so good! The server recommended family-style dining, so we happily obliged. 

As soon as we sat down, our waiter brought over a huge bowl of chips and green salsa, which were AMAZING!! The chips were fresh and the salsa had just the right amount of kick... so delicious! It was the perfect way to start the meal. We shared the ceviche of the day (shrimp w/ avocado), carnitas tacos (tender juicy braised pork - my favorite!!), carne asada tacos (savory and delicious grilled steak), pescado tacos (grilled fish w/ pickled red onions - good but not as good as the carnitas) and washed down the meal with acai berry sangria (not a bad way to start a Saturday night)! In addition to the great food, the service was also excellent because our waiter was friendly, attentive and totally awesome! 

Don Pistos prides itself on using fresh and quality ingredients in every dish and it really shows in their food. The only (minor) issue with this place is that they don't have a liquor license, so they only serve beer and wine for now. Nonetheless, Don Pistos gets bonus points for its late night hours - open until 12:30am daily.
author: Alice W.

description: I had the huevos rancheros, a margarita and my friend had the taco sonora (al pastor w/ pineapple) we perhaps had one of the better brunches we've had in a LONG time. Very pleasant staff - didn't have to wait too long; but the place is smaller and could get crowded. Nice spot for a private party! food is priced very reasonably (i think we paid $9 each) and left very satisfied! Enjoy!
author: Angelic S.

description: I've eaten here several times, and I've always really enjoyed my meal! On my most recent visit, I has the lobster special- it was delicious!! Brunch is also very good. This is a good place for date night or birthday dinners! Go early to put your name in if there are fewer than 6 in your party though bc the wait can get long. Well worth it though
author: Kristen D.

description:
I am as guilty as charged when it comes to judging books by their covers. This same notion is also applied when judging restaurants by their appearances. I've never been a "hole in the wall" type of lady, so exterior and interior design could be the final reigning factor when trying to figure out where to dine at. With Don Pisto's, I was sold the moment we drove by. 

Don Pisto's is discretely located in the North Beach neighborhood on Union street adjacent to a sweet little alley way. The missing restaurant signage and all cream brick facade made Don Pisto's even more mysterious and intriguing. I was unsure of what promises a signless restaurant could hold, but was convinced that the crowd of people that congregated at the front meant the place was popular. Once inside, we were encompassed by dim lighting, red brick walls and a noisy atmosphere. Somehow the chill vibe with a side of chips and salsa accompanied by a strong marg seemed perf for that night's dinner. Although the estimated wait time was about an hour ten, we decided to list our names and grab a couple of drinks at nearby bars since there were several that were walking distance from the restaurant. 

Four beers and an hour later, we finally received a call letting us know Don Pisto was ready for us. We settled for the Wild Monterey Calamari, House-made Chorizo Mussels and Carne Asada tacos all washed down with some margs and cerveza and devoured with a side of chips and spicy chile verde salsa. I was impressed with the calamari. I automatically assumed the calamari would be the typical deep fried battered rings of goodness, however much to my surprise (and my inability to read menu descriptions) the calamari was grilled and served on metal skewers. Although I am obsessed with the usual deep fried calamari rings, I absolutely loved Don's take on grilled calamari. Also, I am not the biggest fan of radish, however the radish salad that accompanied the calamari was quite delectable. 

So why three stars? Unfortunately the carne asada taco just couldn't win me over. The taco was drenched with the essence of arbol chile salsa. Now me and spice we have a civil relationship. There's a limit to how much spice I can take, perhaps one can still label me as a novice. Jalapenos, good. Arbol chiles, bad. Very bad. The first bite I took seemed promising until those small hints of heat escalated into a raging fire in my mouth. I wanted to cry, I wanted to die, I wanted to drench my tongue with loads of milk and forget that arbol chile salsa ever entered my mouth. Two bites into my taco and I threw in the towel. I could not manage the spicy no matter how hard I tried. Fortunately our server was very kind and understanding about my lack of tolerance towards absurd heat. She quickly brought out another serving of tacos with less spice, however by the time that was brought out my appetite was already lost. I tried to abate any remnants of heat by devouring everything else in front of me -- mussels, chips, chips and more chips, which ultimately resulted in me being too full to manage even one bite of the second serving of tacos. 

Despite the end of my dinner ending with such unfortunate events I was really impressed with the service at Don Pisto's. I truly appreciated how our server tended to that heat mishap and continued to provide such benevolent service.
author: Ally C.

description:
Hoping it would be better. No sign, so have to know the address or see the menu on the window. We were told it would be a 30 to 45 minute wait, but it was over an hour. Tried to cancel, but we were told "your next", but really it was after  2 or more groups got seated before us. 
They were out of the al pastor tacos. They did offer to have the cilantro and onions on the side. I can't eat cilantro. It tastes like soap to me. 
It was very noisy. Very hard to have a conversation. The carnitas tacos were pretty good, but nothing special. Being from Texas, I have had better.  The margaritas were okay. I was hoping for better since they got such high ratings. 
Don't think I'll return or recommend.
author: Steven S.

description:
I was a little skeptical when we walked through the door because I didn't see any sign labeling the place as "Don Pistos." Did I miss it? We walked in and a guy, who I later found out is a waiter, welcomed us and asked us to put our name down on "the list," (a clipboard with lined notebook paper) which we did.

We made our way to the bar, had a seat and started off with a beer (Pacifico for me and Negra Modelo for Phil). A guy sitting next to us was already eating and his ceviche looked fantastic. I turn to Phil: "We need to get that!" 

Once our table was ready, our meal consisted of:
Cevice du jour: shrimp (5 stars)
Tacos de carne asada (5 stars) -- don't be fooled there are 4 tortillas instead of 2, so you'll fill up more than what you'd expect.
Tacos de pollo asado (5 stars) -- these were a substitute for the carnitas because they were out.
Hamburguesa (5 stars) -- marinated in BACON and onions. Smothered in guacamole. I was too full to finish my portion but it was delicious.
Michelada (4 stars) -- I've had authentic micheladas and this one came pretty close; but I have to say I've had better. Something was missing (a little more spice or lime juice?). I'd never had Sol beer, maybe it was the beer selection...I have yet to decide what went wrong.
author: Alyssa G.

description:
Came here last Friday night and waited about 15 minutes for a table, but eventually found spots at the bar. It's nit picky, but whoever built the bar, built it a bit too high for most patrons to sit comfortably and eat. I am 6'1, and it was still high. Get higher chairs guys. 

On to the food. The chips and salsa was a purchase at $3. Kind of expected to be free at most Mexican restaurants. They give you green salsa, which is good tasting, but I generally prefer a tomato salsa. I had the Tortilla soup to start, and it was very good. It was a good size portion perfect for sharing (as it mentions on the menu). My main was the Pollo Asado. The chicken was fresh and organic, but had no real flavor other than the chicken flavor. Not much "asado". The dish comes with a proper red salsa, which is what should have come with the chips in the first place. Also comes with green onions. No rice or beans. For $18, a little more garnish on the plate would be appreciated

Props to the bartender Nick who was welcoming and engaging. Gave great service and was busy, but found a great balance to engage the bar eaters as well as service the rest of the restaurant. It should be noted that they only serve beer, sangria, and agave, which tastes different than tequila and is not as strong. I stuck with the beer since I personally drink tequila and do not like the taste of agave.

I am cool with trendy spots, but for the discerning Mexican food connoisseur, a little bit more would go a long way
author: Justin H.

description: I dig the look and feel of Don Pistos.  The menu is simple, but everything on it is great.  I generally go for the tacos or the hamburguesa (which has a ton of guacamole).  If I'm there for brunch, I usually order the bottomless mimosas and the huevos rancheros with chorizo.  Good date spot, or good for large groups (they have tables downstairs).
author: Bud L.

description: Man the mussels with chorizo is amazing. Personally I'm never been into shellfish but this dish had change my perception of shellfish. They are delightful! We also had the pork chop they name it in a different wording i just cant remember what it is. But it is one of the juiciest , tender, tasty pork chop I've ever had! I recommended those two dishes!
author: Rachel L.

description:
Awesome new-ish spot in North Beach.

The complimentary tortilla chips are hot and fresh, the tacos are amazing, and the hamburgesa - which I believe is Spanish for hamburger, but I couldn't be arsed to look it up - is a revelation.
The menu says it's marinated in bacon and onions.  Interesting.
Then it comes out with no cheese.  Just a hearty dollop of guacamole and a bun.  Immediate assumption is that it's going to be underwhelming.  Just tasting of beef.  Possibly dry.  Potentially forgettable.  But good lord - it's anything but.  Cooked to perfection, it's juicy and flavorful and you can taste the bacon and onions even though they're not there!  GHOST BACON AND ONIONS, PEOPLE!  GHOST BACON AND ONIONS.

The wait staff is helpful and attentive, the barkeep runs a tight ship and knows who needs to be seated next and the kitchen is open.  Gotta trust an open kitchen.

A lot of people will whine about how it's not "authentic" Mexican but they can get fucked.  I like it when my taco doesn't taste like dirt wrapped in newspaper.
author: David K.

description:
They took over the old El Raigon place and to hubby and I, it's an improvement.  

As mentioned by other Yelpers, this is the best Mexican food in the area.  If you enjoy good taqueria food in a nice setting, this is the place for you.  Yes, you pay a little more but the ambiance is nice and the service is wonderful.

We were there a little before 8pm and the place was about half full?  It's a very limited menu but it's enough to choose from.  Our waiter was very friendly and helpful.  Iced water and chips w/ salsa were brought to us very quickly.  The chips are freshly made and it's really good.  The salsa is a bit tart.  

We ordered the Sangria and were told it's $3/glass tonight (beer is $2) - both are $5 regular price.  It was pretty good, light and refreshing with a hint of clove.  I finished my pretty quickly and a waiter was quick to spot and ask if I would like another one - yes please!

For food, we ordered:
Ceviche of the day - $8 - it was shrimp w/ avocado and cilantro served w/ more tasty chips.  It's good but again, it was a bit tart - too much lemon juice.

Carnitas Tacos- $7 - platter of 2 on corn tortilla with pickled pepper and lime wedges on the side.  It was pretty good.

Tostadas of the day - $9 - some kind of beef/steak. It was good - I liked the crispy tortilla.  There were plenty meat on top.  

Side order of rice - $2 - this was delicious!  It was perfectly cooked and so tasty with good flavors of onion and garlic.

I would go back just for the chips and rice, which I ate too much of...
author: Gloria H.

description: It's true...this place is really good and worth the wait.  The burger and pork chop were excellent!  Tortilla soup was also very good, served 3 people and had a spicy kick.  Would come back to try more of the menu.
author: Brian L.

description:
I went there last night and had a great experience.  The food was delicious.  I had the sashimi appetizer and steak tacos.  They also had great margaritas.

What really set this place apart this was the staff.  The Manager, Daniel, was very hands on and checked in to see how we were doing.  And, our waitress Margeaux (I probably spelled that wrong - sorry!) was very pleasant and made great recommendations that would accommodate my friend's list of allergies.

I will definitely be going back
author: Justin G.

description:
We headed here for a late night dinner after the awesome Toad tour!

Some of the best Mexican food I have had recently.

The tomatillo salsa, the guacamole and the beans were all worth writing home about :)

The waiter was friendly and ver accommodative.

When I told him I wanted to avoid the tortilla and the rice, he graciously offered to  mix in bunch of extra veggies from another soup offering.

The result was yummy yummy yum!!


I'd go there agin in a heartbeat!
author: Vivek S.

description:
Dear Don Pisto's, we're breaking up and I'm leaving you... for your sister (Pisto's).

Three long, unforgettable years were brought to an end this past Sunday (2/23) as I witnessed DP's successfully generate their competition.  In an "effort" to drive more traffic their new sister restaurant, Pisto's (which is less than a stone's throw away), they removed the treasured al pastor, carne asada, and carnitas from the menu.  This now leaves camarones, pescado, and suadero, the bland "replacement" for the missing beef and pork, as the only taco and sonora options.  I simply can't stomach how a Mexican restaurant would remove the arguably three best options from the menu.  Furthermore, how can one not offer the Mexican flag ships, carne asada and carnitas?  Not only have you now cut the sonora and taco choices in half, you simultaneously scratched off half of the already limited menus.  I suppose this happened earlier with the street corn and the now limited hamburguesa (Wednesdays only).  Did I mention these options are available daily at Pisto's?  

Despite Don Pisto's being dead to me, there is actually a huge positive side.  Pisto's gains every amazing dish that DP's once served.  These dishes are what made DP's the top Mexican restaurant in the city.  Pisto's has essentially become what Don Pisto's was three years ago.  This is not only true for the food, but also the price point.

If you are new to Don Pisto's, skip it and pay a visit to Pisto's down the block.

Kate and Summer, I applaud you for leaving Don Pisto's and bringing all the perks, as well as the head line-cook with you.

-An old regular.
author: Kevin B.

description:
Mexican in North Beach?? What the?! Yes people, it's true.  I was skeptical when my friend said she wanted to have her birthday dinner at a mexican restaurant in North Beach instead of the good old Mission, but hey, what Bday girl wants, Bday girl gets!  When we arrived at the restaurant I instantly fell in love with their decor and interior - candle light everywhere, brick walls, and simple light fixtures.  

The menu is pretty simple - tacos, tostatdas, tortas, and soup (I ordered this for my lovely meal here - chicken tortilla!!).  The minute we sat down we received some home made chips and salsa verde - soo fresh and good!   We also ordered a side of guacamole - and let me tell you, it was a HEALTHY serving!  I've never received so much guacamole before! It wasn't too shabby either.  

The service here is great - no attitude, just service with a smile.  

Definitely check this place out if you wanna change up your eating pattern when you're in North Beach.
author: Cherlyn M.

description: If you know me, you know I live for fish and shrimp tacos. The tacos here?? The bomb!! I wake up at 3 AM craving them! Love the food, the staff rocks, the energy is amazing, and I whine when the wait for a table is too long. Outstanding! We took two of our friends here this weekend, and they really loved the food (fish tacos and the Al Pastor tacos)  and the environment. If you haven't tried it, stop waiting!!
author: Robyn W.

description: Everything here is amazing!  Diverse menu and good drinks.  Fun atmosphere.  Go there immediately
author: C W.

description:
Mangia! ¡Coma! Don Pistos has added a bit of Mexican flare to North Beach!

It was Sunday night and the leftover ham from the holidays was looking as good as it ever was for the tenth and may I add, fricken, time. If there was an excuse to ditch the fridge and try out the new Mexican place in my neighborhood, this was a good reason!

It seems that Sunday evenings for going out in North Beach are a good time for dining deals. As soon as we walked in and gave our name they told us that all their beers were $2 (usually $4) and Sangria (usually $5) was $3. I don't need much more encouragement than that to say yes to a good beer, although I noticed most people seemed to be joyfully sipping on their Sangria special.

I didn't get the chance to go there when it was El Raigon, but the warmth of the brick walls, upbeat Mexican music, and friendly waiters make it a casually fun place to kick back and relax. Their menu is relatively limited in selection, but what it lacks in variety, they make up for in quality. (Coming from leftover ham heaven I had to say no thank you to the Carnitas.) Everything we tried was delicious and came out super fast. And surprise, surprise -- affordable! All dishes were 6 to 9 bucks. Sides of rice or beans, a mere 2 bones. 

This place must go through a crate of limes a day. I loved their tangy tomatillo lime salsa served in a large bowl so you can top all your dishes with a good dollop or two and fill up on chips. (If they sold that by the bottle, I would buy it in a second!) The Tortilla Soup, made just like mom would have with huge chunks of shredded chicken and fresh vegetables, was enough for two or three people to share. We tried their tasty Mahi Mahi Tacos and the tender Braised Veal Tostada.  Both were served in twos with escabeche (pickled vegetables) that sent my taste buds dancing their way home.

I hope they add some more delicious items to the menu and put up a much needed sign outside (it must be on order!). Then I will HAVE to give them a high 5!
author: Kira R.

description: What's not to like? LOVE this place and live right near by now so will be frequenting often. Bring on the margarita pitchers & guac!
author: Claire b.

description: Mexican is not my favorite food as a rule, which makes the 5 stars here even more significant. went to a private party downstairs last weekend and the food was just ridiculous. everything was amazing, but the fish tacos were the best I've ever had, hands down. hope ya like spicy!
author: Erica W.

description:
Everything about this little place is amazing: fresh ingredients, friendly staff, good vibes, open kitchen, great music. Venue is small and cozy. Everyone in the restaurant - patrons and staff included - seem to have a good time while there. 

Simple, clean decor. Very small and fills quickly - about 6-7 bar seats if you have to wait. Make reservations, otherwise about a 45 minute wait. Although it is small, most of the people in there came in large groups, so it is do-able for large (8-10) groups. 

Order a margarita. It was one of the best and freshest I have ever had. No mixers here, they definitely use fresh squeezed lime juice and simple syrup - not too sweet. If you like Corona, order a 32 oz bottle for $9 - great deal! Food is amazingly flavorful and authentic. However, the food is very spicy, not for the heat-sensitive palate. Heat-seekers will love it!
author: Steven F.

description:
This place is great.  The environment is amazing.  The waiter was very patient with our group as we waited for other people in our party to show up. 

The owner is great. He really knows how to run a classy establishment. 

Simple menu and delicious food. I'm thinking about becoming a regular.

Go there and go there often!
author: Jason D.

description:
Excellent food, good atmosphere, owner is friendly.  Overall - highly recommended and I will be back.    

I sat at the bar by myself and the owner chatted me up while making drinks and handling kitchen duties.  I sat next to a friend of his and he gave us a free order of of the chorizo and mussels to split - which were very good, although I'm not too much of a mussel guy.

I had the ceviche which was light and fresh with a good spicy kick.  Not rubbery from marinating too long.  The acai sangria was good - ice cold and not too sweet .  For dinner I had the fish tacos were excellent - nice and messy, perhaps a knife and fork would have been better, but who's going to do that?  

Side note - tacos are 2 per order.  I asked the owner to make one of my fish and the other al pastor.  He said he wouldn't b/c they have different cook times.  While I'm sure they can manage starting a single plate at different times, I appreciated his focus on delivering the dish exactly as he has concieved it.  He also told me, he would give me  another order on the house if I was still hungry.
author: matt o.

description:
Look for the three red lights.  I strolled over to North Beach looking for this joint, but wasn't able to find it until I saw the three red lights. The dimly lit, chill ambiance, normal crowd and good bartender/hostess/waitress makes this a fun place to meet up with friends.  It's not too loud nor is it too quiet.  The simple, wood décor with candle lit tables all together make it a great date spot too.

I wish this place took ressies cause waiting to be seated kinda sucked.  But lucky for us, we passed the time finishing a couple of pitchers of their awesome Acai Sangria.

I do have to admit, I've never eaten shrimp or fish tacos, ever.  Sad?  Probably.  But I don't really care.  Each order comes with two tacos, which is just enough to fill you up.  But go ahead and splurge like we did, its well worth it.  Totally recommend the tacos but I also overheard the Hamburguesas were delicious.  I guess I'll be headed back to try them out.  Another thumbs up.
author: samit P.

description: Food was good but not memorable. My husband wanted the burger but they only make those on Wednesdays. Chips and guac were great. The tacos were pretty standard. Not sure what all the fuss is about. I'm from Southern California and tacos like this are everywhere. Maybe the five star reviewers are from other parts of the country.
author: Karale F.

description:
Came here for a Thursday dinner with a friend. We were seated right away and the waitress was helpful/nice. Pretty too (and I'm straight!). Complimentary chips and salsa were delicious. The short menu was nice for quick decision making. 

We shared the braised pork tacos (two to an order) and the chorizo & mussels. Tacos were great, though I usually like a spicier kick to my tacos. Mussels were yummy, though the chorizos kind of took away from the mussel flavor. Came in a generous portion bowl. We ordered another order of tacos - tacos are about four bites deep each - to ensure we had enough food. Topped it off with a glass of wine each - they only have beer or wine. 

Overall, food was pretty damn tasty, I felt stuffed, and the ambiance would be great for platonic friends, family, dates, anything really. Total tab came to $60 including tip for three entrees and two glasses of wine. Not bad at all. I take a star away because the food wasn't knock-my-socks-off fantastic, but everything was pretty satisfactory.
author: Alice Y.

description: Great little place! Delicious food and lovely atmosphere. I would return and recommend to friends.
author: Andrew L.

description: I went here for brunch recently and it was great! I love that you get choices for bottomless drinks though I opted to stick with just mimosas. The waitresses were attentive with their refills as well. I had the chorizo and poached eggs dish and it was absolutely delicious - not too rich or heavy, especially since I always want to leave room for drinks when doing a bottomless brunch! Very happy with my experience here.
author: Brittany L.

description:
I've walked by this place quite a few times, but would have never noticed it had I not gone with friends who live close by. There's no sign on the door, but you can't miss the red lights if you know what you're looking for. 

The food was an A+. I had short rib tacos and a hamburgesa torta, both of which rocked my world. As did their chips, which were either flour or just really amazing corn chips. 

The only major downsides for me were how loud it was (couldn't even hear across the table) and the lack of drink selection (beer and a few mixed drinks only).
author: Megan S.

description: Amazing and friendly service and a delicious burger! Will be back to try more of their menu. Yay for Don Pistos!
author: Meg L.

description:
Great ambiance.  Brick walls, low ceilings and dim lighting make you feel like you are in a speakeasy of sorts. 

2 visits now.  100% thrilled with the freshness and preparation of food the first visit.  Last night, meh.... guac bland and lacking in flavor of any sort and no fish available for the pescados tacos.  (main reason we came).  Camarones tacos very good thought.  The "wine" margaritas are tasty, but after BF and I split and entire pitcher, not even a remote buzz.  I suspect its primarily sweet and sour type mix with small amount of wine.  The flavor still screams "Margarita" though, so we weren't complaining.  Will probably order beer or straight wine next time.

Will definitely go back and give it a third shot.
author: Elle S.

description: Good food but beware of service. We had a reservation for more than 5 and we had an emergency, because we reduced the party size and were 5 minutes late we were told we would have to sit a communal table, all fine but would have loved less attitude from the Hostess. Won't go back anytime soon.
author: Holly L.

description: The tacos were awesome and the margaritas did the job too!
author: Scott And Jim H.

description: Amazing, fresh, well made top notch tacos. Guacamole and chips were good/average. The ceviche was fresh and really good. The tacos by far made the meal. We had fish and pork - both flavorful and delicious. The margaritas were also good, not too sweet, which I hate. Staff was friendly - shout out to Daniel!
author: Blaine A.

description:
Ben and Pete ROCK! 

I hosted my b-day dinner at Don Pistos with about 20 friends in toe. Pete worked with me a few weeks ahead of time and suggested reserving a private room for the night. We ordered a ton of food and everyone was really satisfied with their dishes.

Selling points: cheap, great food, yummy sangria, accommodating staff. 

All and all, a great place to host an affordable group dinner!
author: Lauren T.

description: Really good carnitas and care asada tacos. Margaritas were okay. Could upgrade the tequila. It would be awesome if they had a tequila menu with a good selection. Atmosphere is great. The staff here are awesome. Unassuming yet classy hole in the wall vibe. I'll definitely be back!
author: Cody W.

description:
Last evening I took a bit of Mexico home with me in my to-go box. Hands down one of the best new additions to the neighborhood, Don Pistos is a taste of heaven in an otherwise Mexican lacking hood. 

I could have simply eaten the salsa and chips and been at peace but the pork torta and carne asada tacos put me over the edge. Each bite took me back to my adventures in Rosarito, Cancun and Puerto Vallarta. Though I didn't have a beer to wash it all down (white wine had to do) I still will say that the flavoring, taste and overall presentation of the meal was exceptionally fantastic.
author: Stephanie J.

description: Great service, good food.  Had carne asada tacos, tortilla soup and sangria.  Good for a night out.
author: Chantel W.

description: There is a reason this place gets nearly 5 stars.  Dined today for a late lunch and others have said it well.  Delish! Bottomless drinks for $17 is a bargain, and they make sure you're never empty.  Wife had breakfast, I had lunch and both were outstanding.  Salsa was the best ever, super fresh.  Service was top notch.  Vegetarians beware, one option-- huevos rancheros.  Wife loved them. Highly recommend!
author: Randy B.

description:
Good food, amazing salsa. -1 star for extremely limited menu and no true margaritas. Cute ambiance and low key atmosphere. The plates are pretty small but all of the food is savory.

Wasn't sure but I think our waitress may have been high...whatever, I don't judge.
author: Seanté B.

description:
Great place, great food! Love it! Have been many times. But Please change the music, it is like a late night dance club, does not fit and makes it difficult to talk or listen.
Would definitely be a four or five if better and quieter music.
author: Sonia V.

description:
Finally, something other than Italian food in North Beach!  I've eaten here 3 times now and have tried almost everything on the menu.  Delicious!

My only complaint and the reason why I didn't give the restaurant 5 stars is because of my disgust for cilantro.  I understand that cilantro is a staple in Mexican cuisine, but there are many people out there who hate it and it would be nice if all of the dishes had the option to be made without it.  I tried to pick it out of the ceviche, but the flavor was already all over it.  The salsa is pure cilantro and the carne asada is made with it as well.  

That said, the mussels with chorizo are delicious and the tacos pastor and carnitas have amazing flavor.  The prices are very reasonable and they have deals on alcohol on Sunday nights.  

The owner is always there and is either working behind the bar or visiting the tables to make sure everyone is enjoying their food.  I will definitely continue to eat here.
author: stacy b.

description:
Seriously, the best carnitas i have ever had in the bay area. First time there was date night, suggested to us by someone who knew the owner. 
I was a little skeptical because I feel like many places in the same neighborhood are overpriced and overpraised, but i cannot praise those tacos enough!

We ordered the tortilla soup (one order serves two) for a starter and then both ordered the carnitas tacos. Everything was so good that i asked for a dessert menu but was super sad when they said they don't serve dessert. 

Went there a second time for a group holiday party and ate delicious ceviche while i waited for more carnitas. Sadly they never came (apparently they ran out earlier in the night) so I hope the deliciousness was not just a one time thing. Planning another trip so I can make that determination. 

oh! and the salsa and chips are handmade and worth the trip all by themselves!
author: Angelica S.

description: Being Mexican, I NEVER ate at Mexican restaurants- my mom is an amazing cook and nothing ever came close to her cooking.  Well, all of that ended when I found Don Pistos!!  From beginning to end, they are delicious!  Their chips and salsa are to die for- their chips are fresh and their salsa is just damn good- you can't stop eating it! I've had their salmon ceviche, their street corn, and tacos al pastor- ALL AMAZING!  If you haven't been here- then you must!!
author: Gaby G.

description:
Service is exceptional.  Food looks gorgeous, and the atmosphere is fantastic! BUT.....

My only complaint is that towards the end of the meal you can't taste anything other than chili - it just numbs all the flavors.   The avocado guac is also spiced (and I kinda think it should be alllllll about the avocado rather than the onion and spice...?)

Our group of 4 went for a variety of soft tacos (served 2-per-plate with generous servings) - grilled steak Carne Asada, braised pork Carnitas and the fish of the day which was snapper.  All looking beautiful, but any delicate flavoring was gone after a few mouthfuls as you could only taste chili.

Last time I came, and for the first time in my life I had to ask "which meal isn't so spicey?"  It was embarassing, I FELT LIKE MY MOTHER! - haha!!!  I like spice - but I also like tasting other flavors.

OK - enough ranting - it's a great place, and we'll probably be back again...
author: Beekay M.

description:
Brunch was good and there was no body there!

The burger was nice and juicy!! OMG DELICIOUS-O-SO!!!

AND TACOS ARE YUMMY...even tho I took bites of it from a certain other person's plate ::ahem::
author: Holden L.

description: I am so bummed to have to write this review.  Don Pisto's has been my absolute favorite taco place in the city since I moved here a year ago.  I've thrown multiple birthday dinners here ... have recommended it to all of my friends.  I've noticed the service has deteriorated significantly the past three times I've been in.  This weekend tops it ... We were there on Friday night.  Service took forever (literally 20 mins before the server stopped by for water or drink orders) and then the manager comes by to tell us that their credit machine is down when we're ready to pay the bill.  I completely understand that things happen from time-to-time, but the bummer was that they had taken our credit cards initially and charged each of our cards AFTER we'd ended up paying cash.  Total headache to have to deal with calling the credit card company and canceling the transaction.   Such a bummer!
author: Jacqueline G.

description:
yummy!
pitcher of margarita - strong
liked the salsa
the tortilla soup seemed like it was missing some kind of spice but the tacos were quite scrumptious
author: Sunni B.

description: Cool place, lots of unhipster hipsters, solid sashimi, good bartender, what's not to like?
author: Nobody M.

description: Never had mussels before in my life. My friend told me this was the place to have it first. THEY DID NOT DISAPPOINT!!! AMAZING! My brother had the pork chops and gave me a piece. Melts in your mouth! I WILL BE BACK... and quite often!
author: Anayo A.

description: This review of mine is more about the service and how we were treated at Don Pisto's and not of the food because everyone who has been here already knows how great the food is. Over the holidays I became really sick in an out of the hospital and on bed rest, so last Saturday I told my hubby that I needed to get out of town, I wanted to go to my favorite city San Francisco to go eat at one of my favorite little restaurant, Don Pistos, because of traffic my little family of four (our two kids 8&6) didn't get to the restaurant until 8:30. The line was out the door and people were standing outside. We put our name on the list and it was a 2 hour wait. My hubby knew how much it meant for me to eat there so we waited, the kids were tired, hungry and grumpy, he took them to have some gelato next door to keep them up but they hostess' at Don Pistos must of felt bad for us that we were able to get in within 40 minutes. We let the kids order bottled coke to keep them from falling asleep. I seen that they had this amazing lobster on the menu, but the server told us that they were sold out :( Bummer but now I will have an excuse to go again! I told my husband that I'd like to come again the next morning for brunch so I can get my 2nd fix of Don Pisto's. Everyone in my little family enjoyed their meals when the server came with our check she let us know that our drinks were being comped. How nice!! I love this place. We came back the next morning for brunch and I enjoyed bottomless pineapple mimosa's my hubby and I got the sonora taco my daughter got the torta and my son ate off of us. We ask for the bill and I don't know if it was the manager but a really nice young lady came over and told us that the Restaurant was treating us to our brunch. WOW!! how nice! it was such a nice gesture from Don Pistos! We all could not believe how kind they were to us. She said they appreciated our business and that we drove all the way from Fresno and they'd like to see us there again! YES of course we will be back!  We left feeling so blessed and This is my go to restaurant in SF. Hand's down my favorite place to visit. My birthday is this weekend and I am thinking of asking my hubby to take me to Don Pistos to have that lobster!
author: Kumal S.

description: Delicious tacos and fresh calamari. Small menu but very good for small bites and sharing.
author: Chelsea S.

description: Came here on a Saturday night. I love the playlist they had playing. It was loud old r&b music and we almost felt like we were in a bar. Not the best for talking at a large table but definitely a fun vibe. The chips were bottomless and served with a yummy green salsa. I got the red snapper tacos, which weren't served with anything else so might not have been enough food if I hadn't had so many chips. I also got the sangria, which was good, but nothing to write home about. I think there brunch is supposed to be better so I would like to come back and check that out. Overall, a fun restaurant but the food isn't super special for SF standards.
author: Kelly M.

description:
I loved this place! Found it thanks to yelp and saw it had great reviews. There's no sign which was something I really liked. After eating there, I realized a sign was completely unnecessary. After we sat down, we realized there were no vegetarian items on the menu, not even one. The server told us we could get some vegetarian tacos, even though they weren't on the menu. They were so damn tasty. 

Tomatillo salsa was the BEST!! So fresh and full of lime. Guacamole was exceptional and so was the Acai Sangria! Very smart restauranteur who owns this one, methinks. I will return.
author: Melinda D.

description: Great food and service for the price. Faux margaritas are really good and made with agave wine - really tasty. Tacos are excellent. Pretty loud place, though, and you kind of have to shout to have a conversation. I guess that's just part of the charm. I will be back!
author: Gene D.

description:
Went to brunch here after my friend's wedding.  

Pros: 
Tasty huevos rancheros
Solid guacamole
Nice waitress
Nice vibe/decor

Cons:
No coffee (this is brunch, right?)
salsa was somewhat bitter (some in my party loved it though, so different strokes...)
There aren't very many cooks, so if you go in a large group expect to eat at different times. I didn't start my meal until many others were already finished eating...which meant that I had to swat people away with my fork when they tried to pick at my food.
Portions were kind of small, but then again you are given plenty of thick greasy chips and guac to fill up on prior to your meal.
author: Lauren L.

description:
After having been in New Zealand for the past 12 months I was ready to have some good Mexican food. Was very pleased to find a new spot in my favorite neighborhood. 

They had just opened the week before but you never would have known it. The service was great and the food was very good as well. Recommend the ceviche as well as trying the pork and steak tacos. Yum yum. Wish I had stayed in San Francisco long enough to make a second visit.
author: Heather L.

description: VERY busy for a weeknight. Upscale American influenced Mexican food is the best way I know how to describe it. Local hangout which is hard to find in North Beach. The shrimp tacos were by far the best, the carnitas and carne asade tacos had really strong sauces/salsa that took away from the meat. Good date location. Good guacamole!
author: M S.

description:
I have realized upon joining yelp, I was very frivolous about giving away 5 star reviews. Now, after trying some of the best foods the Bay has to offer, I wish I had been a bit more frugal with my yelp stars. Don Pisto's is the kind of place I wish I could give 10 stars. 5 stars just doesn't seem to cut it here. 

My experience with Mexican food has always been pretty limited (which is bazaar..being that I am from L.A.). I have always been quite satisfied with pretty mediocre Mexican fare. That is until I found the Intriguing red lights that lured my boyfriend and I into the modest but classy restaurant known as Don Pisto's. Being that it barely opened (and was late), we seemed to be the only ones there. But the staff made us feel like we were having a late dinner at a relatives house. A glance at the simple menu, and I knew good things were in store. 

All we were looking for that night was a late night taco place. That's it. Just a place to satisfy our hungry bellies after 11pm. We had no idea we were going to find such a gem in this side of town. The fish tacos were so above my expectations of what a fish taco could look and taste like. The Carne Asada? Phenominal. Everything on their menu is prepared with such attention to detail; it just simply blows me away. Don Pisto's has set a new gold standard for what I consider good Mexican food.

Everyone, including the owner, was friendly, gracious, helpful, and charming. I couldn't have had a better, more enlightening experience. Thank you Don Pisto's! I shall be more frugal with yelp stars now... ;)
author: Keira D.

description:
This place tries to walk a fine line between fancy and casual. It's not "upscale mexican" like Mamacita, but it's definitely not just some taqueria...

All the food I had there was very good - guacamole was excellent. The drinks and chips were always refilled promptly, and we were able to split tortilla soup between four people. It was a stretch to split it that far, but i'd say 3 people could easily share the tortilla soup as an appetizer.

In fact, I'd say the only thing I take issue with is how the tacos are priced and portioned. For about $9, you get two tacos. And these are SMALL tacos. You can see in the pictures that they're not going to fill you up. In order to have a full meal there, you need to have an appetizer or two. But for $9, I find the tacos overpriced. I would have rather seen 3 tacos for $12. At 3 tacos, that would be enough food.

All in all, the food quality is good, but I'm only giving it four stars due to the awkward portioning / pricing.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Mexican in the italian neighborhood?  ABSOLUTELY.  This place is awesome - the food is cheap and delicious and the drinks are great -  they do not have a full liquor license - so beer and wine is king, but it is so delicious.

Amazing tacos, the pork chop is the best I have ever had, and the service is great.  

They do not take reservations, so...be prepared to wait, but there are many great places in NB to have a cocktail while you
author: Alison D.

description: What a great place. I went late, at about 12:15, when closing time was 12:30; and they were as welcoming and friendly as you can get.  The atmosphere is relaxed yet upbeat; cool, but not too cool.  The service was fast and friendly and helpful.  And the food was delicious.  I wanted to lick the bottom of the guacamole bowl, but I managed to resist the temptation and left with my dignity in tact.
author: Michael L.

description: Needed a place that was open late after our nightlife event at the California Science Academy, searched yelp and Don Pisto popped up and boy am I glad we went. It's a small place in north beach but it worth waiting for, the food is meant for sharing we had the ceviche, steak tacos and the lobster the food was delicious and the bill surprisingly very reasonable. Want a great date night idea do the VIP at the nightlife California science academy and dinner at Don Pisto's!
author: Lawanna N.

description:
I came for dinner on my own while in SF because I was craving good fish tacos and hadn't tried any at that point.  I yelped around and found Don Pistos in North Beach.

Overall, the food was very good.  Only minor complaints: he fish tacos could use a bit more spice and flavor, their salsa verde, which was very good and fresh, also lacked a spicy kick and the tortilla chips were a bit on the heavy side (think thick and deep fried).  The side order of mexican street corn (elotes) was excellent.  An order of the fish tacos and  corn hit the spot - I left Don Pisto's full and happy.  

Ambiance and service were great.  Casual and on the small side, but big enough to bring a group of friends.  They have drink specials on Sunday night as well.  If I lived in SF, I'd be a regular.  That being said, I'll will definitely come back on my next visit!
author: Raana A.

description: A one hour wait on a Saturday night..what did I expect in the North Beach area around 6:30pm.  Lucky me...the wait was much shorter and we were able to get some drinks while we were waiting.  Couldn't say I was crazy about the margarita but the service and food made up for it.  A bunch of us order a few items to share.  My favorite was the ceviche, sashimi and the fish tacos.  Also, I loved the fact that I learned that they do take reservations for parties of 6 or more and they have a dining room large enough to a party of 40 guests :)
author: Allison T.

description:
The food just gets better and better, but the experience of eating at Don Pisto's has gotten worse and worse.

I live a few yards from the restaurant, and it used to be THE restaurant for a weeknight dinner/date -- reasonably priced and absolutely delicious. The service was incredibly friendly, the atmosphere perfect... I can't say enough. We were there more than we were in our own kitchen.

That was then.

Now (and many congratulations to the owner for all his successes) the waits are invariably an hour plus. The restaurant is filled with people who "know the owner", and the service has definitely declined. I still order food for takeout at least once a week, but the restaurant just isn't a fun place to eat anymore. If I wanted to eat at Tacolicious, I would go!

If you're reading reviews to decide if you want to go, definitely try it -- the food is amazing and it's a perfect respite from the sea of overpriced Italian nearby. Just be ready.
author: Sara C.

description: Amazing brunch. We ordered a few things and shared bc we couldn't decide. Great and new rendition on huevos rancheros. The chorizo is to die for. Each entree was $10-12 which is a steal!
author: Karin Z.

description: We had a great brunch here! Guacamole was flavorful, the salsa they brought out was awesome and our mains were delicious. I had the huevos rancheros and my husband had the breakfast burrito, both were perfect. They also had really good looking drinks (bottomless mimosas or sangria) though we weren't drinking that day, we definitely will come back and try out their sangria next time.  Service and atmosphere were also great!
author: Rachel W.

description:
My roommate and I stopped in on their grand opening and we were greeted immediately and seated with complimentary champagne. Fresh chips and salsa were brought out. chips were great - you could really taste that they were fresh and not stale.

We shared the chicken tacos and the carnitas. Carnitas was amazing. Slow cooked and pulled apart... oh man. And for dessert... churros with chocolate! Heaven!

Definitely will make this my new spot whenever I'm in the mood for GOOD taqueria food. Ole!
author: laura f.

description: Everything's good and they will even whip up things from past menus if u ask. Pricey for what it is though.
author: Natalie W.

description: i came here again to try the diabla wings, ceviche mexicano, chorizo & mussels and their wild monterey calamari. i am a seafood person, and heard that they are the best for it. and it really is.
author: Cassandra B.

description:
Thanks to the unaccommodating and incredibly rude hostess that was working last Saturday night, I will probably never return to Don Pisto's. 
When we arrived we were told it would be 45 minutes to an 1 hour until we would be seated. We decided to stay since none of us had eaten there and we were not in a rush. We figured we would have a few pitchers of margaritas and wait it out. 
The margaritas were good, but were overpriced for what they are-- the restaurant does not have a liquor license so they are made with agave wine... which tasted fine but definitely wasn't worth $30 (the bartender also did not inform us of the switcheroo, our waiter finally did). 
After waiting an hour we asked for an update and were told we would be next. We then waited another 45 MINUTES while 2 tables sat unoccupied the whole time. Apparently the group ahead of us had left a phone number and couldn't be reached. Two hours after we arrived (and one more status update later, which was brushed aside by the hostess), she finally walked over and told us our "table is in the corner" and walked away without escorting us (she escorted every table) or even apologizing for the ridiculous wait. 
Once seated, our waiter was nice and the chicken tostadas were good, but not enough for us to justify the poor customer service.
author: Kenzie P.

description: A friend recommended Don Pisto's and I was not disappointed. The food was very fresh and tasty and we left full and happy. The chips and guac were outstanding. A couple small negatives keep this from being 5 stars...can get pretty noisy making it hard to hear conversation at your own table and more vegetarian dishes or non red meat dishes would be appreciated. Overall though, a nice place to dine.
author: Shannon P.

description: I feel awkward giving out 5 stars to Mexican food in North Beach / Telegraph... but I *love* this place.  If you want fresh authentic mexican food with lots of flavor, but you could also use some drinks and ambiance, this place is perfect.  Great margaritas, mouth-watering chips & salsa, and really fresh & tasty tacos.  Not the kind with cheese and lettuce... real tacos.  Lots of other great eats, too... check out the pics.
author: seema s.

description: Food way too spicy and dining area super loud that you can't have a conversation without yelling. Not a place for kids. If you're young, have fun. If you have your family with you, go elsewhere.
author: Lane S.

description:
This was a fantastic meal!  After walking through North Beach looking past the great Italian restaurants this stop happened upon us.  

Very authentic & inviting atomostphere with some of the best Mexican food north of the Rio Grande.  Quaint may be too tough a word as when you walk in as the bar is immediatley in front of you and small.  They do not have a liquor license but make a great sangria, chardonnay based margarita and on Sunday I couldn't beat $2 beers!

Moving onto food, their salsa is out of this world ridiculous.  Tomatillos, garlic, serano peppars which provide this amazing flavor at the right amount of heat.  We started with some oysters which were excellent but like all oysters, overpriced.  The ladies in the group had shrimp tacos which were phenomonal.  

As for me, I chose the summer stew which had a delicious ancho broth with Red Snapper, calamari & shrimp served with a side of seudo garlic toast.  Just amazing flavor, fresh & again the heat was kicked up but not over done.  Great for couples, singles, groups and the majority of the menu is tacqueria style but not your average taco joint.  

A North Beach gem nestled in between all the great Italian the area has to offer.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
This place never stops blowing my mind. I literally have to list my favorites at this point! I can't decide what my actual favorite thing to eat here is.  

Brunch:
Bottomless mimosas and sangria
Chorizo with poached eggs and potatoes
Al Pastor Taco Senora
Breafast Burritos
French Toast

Dinner:
Al Pastor tacos
Lobster
Hambergesa
Fresh Oysters
All the tacos and tostadas
The Lamb Chops are rediculously good!!

Basically if you haven't been here yet, you are wasting you life! And if you have and your stuck eating the same thing every time, branch out!!! There is a reason all the food critics, bloggers, and magazines are giving this place non-stop love. Keep up the great work guys!
author: Tobin L.

description:
Bottom line:  Dont go here they have cockroaches and dont seem to care.


Seemed like decent place at first, though since we had a large group we got stuck in the lower level basement.  Almost finished with our dinner when a huge cockroach crawled under our table.  After telling the waitress and pointing out the now-squashed cockroach, she shrugged her shoulders and blamed it on North Beach.  She continued serving food to other tables and didn't even dispose of the dead insect.  No "sorry".  Wow.  How can they pretend to care so much about their food (including serving Tuna sashimi) and not give a crap about the infested establishment in which they work?  Never going here again.
author: Brian M.

description:
Great food. Ceviche was fantastic. Fish tacos were great. Favorite part though: the tortillas and the chips. It's the little things for me - and these are important details many restaurants go cheap on. Not Don Pisto's.

Short but great menu. Very very loud.
author: Sean M.

description: Lights out in North Beach last night while at dinner with the Walters. Kudos to our waitress Shannon at Don Pisto's for bringing out the candles and serving in the dark! Enthusiastic and game chefs kept the food coming with flashlights. Quality dining adventure with outstanding agave margarita's!
author: Barbara G.

description: Upscale mexican type of thing? Yea.. it works!  The burger cooked in bacon fat was as delicious as it was unhealthy.  The tacos are great.  The margaritas are great.  Stop reading the reviews and go try it!
author: Yan L.

description:
When I asked a friend for a restaurant recommendation in North Beach, i was expecting Italian food, not a little Mexican joint. Boy, was this a nice surprise. I had the carne asada tacos and they were fantastic. They don't take reservations for parties under 6 which was a bit annoying, but I was able to grab a seat at the bar and have a beer with my friend while we waited for our buddy to show up. 

Only problem was that I felt rushed after dinner. Other than that, definitely recommend this place.
author: Noah B.

description:
Solid place to grab some mexican food in north beach. Healthy portions of meat on the tacos, tortilla soup was legit. If you come to this place and don't have the carnitas you are really missing out. 

Give it a shot if you are in the area
author: White K.

description: A large group of us were here last Saturday and several of us were sick the next day. The Health Department is investigating. BEWARE!
author: Emma C.

description:
5 stars for food and pitchers of booze, minus one star for general atmosphere, oh and the fact that we saw a rat. We were seated in a walkway, so it was a little awkward as the severs were constantly bustling by our table. And definitely a little loud being right next to the kitchen; we were literally just nodding our head when the server was listing the specials cause we couldn't hear her at all. But great pitcher of blood orange margaritas (special that night), awesome chips and generous portion of guacamole, delicious fish and shrimp tacos. Even the rice and beans were far better than expected for generic white rice and pinto beans. 

Overall great date place as it's family style, dimly lit, and in an awesome location right near all the North Beach bars.
author: Natalie H.

description:
This is a great little neighborhood mexican restaurant.  My wife and I took a cab there.  It is on a side street with little else around.  I would have loved a margarita, but they only had wine and beer.  No big loss.  I also wanted a Carne Asada Taco, but the waitress said that the owner wasn't pIleased with the carne asada that was delivered that day so he pulled it off the menu.  Huh...I like that!  A commitment to quality.  

The Waitress recommended the tortilla soup and a carnitas tortas.  Let's just say that both were fantastic.  

All in all, I'm happy that we went there, was happy with the service, the food, the ambiance, the whole package and would definitely go there again.
author: Michael L.

description: I really like this restaurant. It's a fun, lively atmosphere with good food and drinks, and I've gone back numerous times with friends (especially because the dishes are great for sharing). Don't be fooled by the limited menu - everything I've ordered so far has been a winner! I loved the tortilla soup (which they will split into separate bowls if you let them know you are sharing it with someone - it's a huge bowl, so if you are planning to order a selection of dishes I'd recommend splitting with someone), and have tried pretty much all of the tacos. Yum. Plus, they have a great sangria with acai in it to wash it all down. The only problem is that it's been VERY loud every time I've gone there, so even though the wonderful food may be calling to your taste buds, you may want to go somewhere else with parents or grandparents that might have trouble hearing over the noise.
author: Caroline T.

description:
This place is a bit of a scene for me but I can't deny that the food is good. 

Ambiance: Maybe a little loud for me, but normal for a Friday or Saturday night when everyone is out in North Beach. Expect a bit of a wait, but the owner is nice and very accommodating.

Food: Very tasty, fresh, and unique Mexican. The al pastor tacos are delicious! Think carne asada mixed with pineapple and chiles.  I would also get any raw fish or ceviche type dish they have because I am always amazed at the flavor he brings to these dishes. The tortilla soup is also very good.

Been there twice and I plan on going back!
author: Shirin M.

description:
"WHA!?!!?  WHA!?!?!  I can't hear 'ya!!!"

Yeah, that's pretty much my dinner tonight at Don Pistos with hubby.  I resorted to texting him on my cell phone to communicate with him to spare my throat from having to SHOUT!!!  LOL!!!  (Yes, this place is LOUD, though thankfully not as deafening loud as Lime SF, where as soon as I walked in the front lobby of Lime, I *had* to walk out b/c it was giving me a SPLITTING HEADACHE!!!)  But I did find myself thinking "This place would be a GREAT date place if it wasn't so loud where you couldn't hear yourself think, much less your date talking."  I got the sense it was attracting more the clubbin' crowd, since there's were a lot of young 20's ladies in their min skirts and looking like they're about to go out for a night of clubbin'.  (I could just see this last line I wrote causing a rash of  MALE customers coming in here to scope out the girls, thinking about it...)

Hubby and I had high hopes when we got this BIG bowl of gauc with our chips and the gauc was tasty... :-P~~

Here's where things are weird and disappointing... at least for hubby (and I had a taste of HIS food so I know it's not just him...)  His carnitas torta was more beans than carnitas.  (That explains the mushy texture.)  Too bad, since the carnitas flavor was decent.  But the REAL disappointment was the carne asada taco.  The arbol salsa that came with the taco was unpleasantly sour.  Unfortunately, it needed the salsa b/c the beef itself was flavorless.  For about $8-9 buck for two small tacos or a small torta, it better kick my socks off... and sadly it was disappointing.(He keeps thinking of Taqueria La Bamba in Mountain View.  That's his standard for all other taco/burrito places to follow...) 

The weird part is that this time around, I liked MY food better than hubby's food.  (Usually it's the other way around!)  My seafood stew was a HIT!!!  (Not too spicy... just enough heat to light up the mouth but sparing the sinus and throat!!!  :)  )   The calamari, shrimp and salmon (tonight's seafood) was tasty.  I liked their Mexican corn.  (The arbol salsa also makes an appearance on the corn, but I was able to scoop most of it off and just have that nice sweet flavor of corn with cilantro and lime flavoring.  :)

Price is reasonable and our waiter (Corey?) was very nice and knowledgeable!!!  :)
