I might come back on my own.  Sadly, hubby won't be back and I totally understand why, which is why the 3 stars review.  He thinks if they change their arbul salsa recently, THEN he might come back to try again.
author: Joanna R.

description: Came here for brunch before Union Street Fest for bottomless mimosas and they definitely did their job, a little too well. The brunch food is just all right and at $17 for bottomless mimosas, it's a little pricey, considering you can get $9-10 bottomless mimosas at other places (just $7 at Cafe Mystique in the Castro!). But what I love about Don Pisto's is that you can swap out your mimosas with sangria or margaritas. Definitely a great way to pass a weekend morning!
author: Steffi L.

description:
Great place.  The three red lights outside sorta make u feel like you have found a secret restaurant.  

Excellent atmosphere especially late into the evening.  They close around 12:30 on weekdays which is awesome.

1.  I had their halibut ceviche with watermelon and this was AWESOME.  It had a real good spicy kick to it.  
2.  I then had their seafood stew and this was fresh.  The calamari was tender along with the shrimp and other goodies inside it.

I def recommend people checking out the food here.  The owner, Pete, is a cool guy.  He'll come by, chop it up with you and make sure ur having a good time.
author: Milan D.

description: Not the best place for vegetarians and can get crowded pretty quickly. They treated us well with a veggie taco and a veggie platter (very similar)...but the drinks and ambiance were more satisfying for me.
author: Mayur A.

description:
margarita + guacamole + tacos = perfect meal
I love coming to this place. Although they don't take reservations, it's nice that they let you put your name and phone number down and call you when your table is ready. It's a nice opportunity to check out another local bar while you're waiting.
author: Amy K.

description:
Don Pisto's makes the best hamburger I have ever had in my life.

All the food is good, and the service is fantastic. One Saturday night, we had to wait 20 minutes more than the maitre d' had estimated. We didn't mind at all, because we were having a great time at the bar under the care of the attentive and friendly bartender. When we did sit down , the host (Dan?) sent over calamari and ceviche - it was a complete surprise (and delicious). All the food (carnitas and steak tacos, chips and guacamole, two hamburguesas for four people was more than enough) was very good and our waitress was great.

My friends were talking for days about how unbelievable the burger was.

This is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco - incredible food, energetic but not pretentious atmosphere, not outrageously expensive.

I can't wait to go back.
author: Ben E.

description:
I have been to Don Pistos a half dozen times or so. Everything on the menu that I have tried has been delicious. I am particularly fond of the carnitas torta, while my wife loves the mussels and chorizo.

While fantastic, the menu is somewhat limited in the options though, a few tacos, a couple of tortas, and an entre or two.

While usually full of people, I have never had a problem getting a seat right away.
author: Rob H.

description: Or something south of the border I stop by my local Don Peastow North Beach. Me and my girlfriend get that seven and the wait is long but there's a bar that we can wait. We don't drink anything but it's nice to sit down sometimes. Finally we get a table for two. Our server Denise comes and brings his chips and salsa, salsa Verde if I'm not mistaken. Along with two classes of non-iced water. So we dip and sip! Now, to your average chip and salsa guy one salsa is pretty good but my girlfriend is in the know and she asks the knees for that red salsa salsa row ha ha! Denise brings it out to sweet and we get then do some serious chips! My girlfriend orders five tacos and I ordered two lobsters and we are mouthwatering waiting! Good thing we had two kinds of salsa and chips to keep us satisfied and knees made sure our glasses were never dry! Unfortunately, my brothers ex-wife showed up and we had a duck out of there without being seen because we didn't want to have to pay for that apartment incident. I'm only giving this place for stars because some of the chips were too salty.
author: Samuel B.

description:
Yes this location has struggled but Don Pistos is a big hit. I am a big fan of Tacolicious but this place has better ambiance. Try the ceviche to start its incredible.

I'm taking one star away because of the sangria, It was very good but seemed to lack alcohol.
author: Chris N.

description:
Favorite new restaurant in the entire city!!!!  My fiance and I discovered this place one evening and have been going back once a week ever since and are having our rehearsal dinner here.  The owner, Pete, is SO nice and the food is incredible.  The staff is SO nice.

The other day we finally tried the chorizo and mussels and OMG they are absolutely out of this world.  Our favorite tacos are the carnitas and shrimp.  mmmmmmmmm

Definitely go to this place.  It's worth the wait for a table on a busy night.
author: shannon h.

description:
This North Beach destination was recommended by a co-worker. Housed in a former Argentinian steakhouse, this resto boasts top-notch flame grilled eats at very reasonable prices. 

The menu looks simple but each dish has its own Don Pisto flavor. We enjoyed the Al Pastor tacos (my mouth is watering just thinking of them), the Carne Asada tacos, the Hamburger. [Aside: We've enjoyed a growing number of SF burgers and must say that Don Pisto's burger is definitely a top 5 (maybe even top 3!) burger. This hunk of meat is marinated in onions and bacon fat before being tossed on the grill and it goes without saying that bacon fat makes everything better. The burger's presentation is simple with a bun and a smear of housemade guac, but each bite is flavorful and delicious.] With two drinks, we spent twenty bucks each and were both filled to the brim. 

I must admit that we did miss a few creature comforts (namely fries with the burger and DESSERT for crying out loud!), but our waiter smoothly explained that the size of the restaurant limits the size of the menu. That's fine though, because the things they do, they do very well. (4.5 stars, rounded up)
author: AdamLowell C.

description:
We see see occasions of food genius via signature dishes that quickly become a "must-eat" fan favorite.  It's    far less frequent that someone shows their mastery of the craft by rocking your face off with a well-known standard.  Like many others, my addiction to Don Pisto's started with the Hamburguesa.  I still remember being served my 1st one and asking the waiter (Corey) what happened to the tomato and the lettuce. He had a kind of confident half-smile on his face when he said "You try that and if you think it needs something let me know".  I took my 1st bite and the next thing I remembered was this feeling that I'd somehow lost 2-3 minutes.  I looked down and my burger was gone with the exception of a few crumbs and I think I might have  lost a couple of fingernails.  I'd experienced my 1st (of many to come) Don Pisto's Food Comas.   

However, I'm not here to join the bandwagon exclaiming the glory of the Hamburguesa.  That's an older review that's mysteriously disappeared (twice).  I only bring it up to make the point that you'd never think someone who could create such a gateway signature dish would also be able to blow your mind with a well-known standard like "French Toast".  Several months later, well into my addiction to Don Pisto's, I'd managed to 'regain consciousness' (after a long  night of 'community work') early enough to catch their Saturday/Sunday brunch. I took a seat at the Bar and explained my dilemma to Nick the bartender who generously offered to assist by selecting a recommendation off of the menu.  I hesitated briefly because I'm not a big fan of French Toast but, in the end, my trust for Nick's judgment and my desire to  recover from my Hamburguesa addiction won.  To make a long story short (probably too late now) it was the best damn French Toast I've ever eaten...with NO exceptions. The food was delivered in no time at all. There were 2 thick slabs of toast accompanied by 3 fat slabs of bacon (and I don't mean that crispy crap that breaks up and crumbles if you look at it hard)...the bottomless Mimosas didn't hurt either.  Every single bite of this meal was a delight and my only concern with the entire experience was whether I was going to continue down the hill to Tony Nik's or head back up the hill and take a nap. To put it simply, this dish is absolutely incredible and if you try it and sincerely don't like it, I'll pay for it since it's unbelievably economically priced at $11.00.  Although Nick has graciously assisted with my 'recovery' by suggesting different items off of the breakfast menu, I seem to have developed an addiction for their omelette...but that's something to share in another review.

*I only review meals that I've eaten at restaurants where I've actually been.  I'll always include a photo of the food I was served if allowed.*
author: Cordane C.

description:
Just love this place!

Sunday night they have a great "happy hour" (I think it's 2$ beers and half on the sangria) and the brunch also seems really good (never tried it, I guess it's time)

The tortilla soup is great and the tacos are really really tasty (you get 2 of them in each order so take that into account when you order)

The staff is extra friendly and not too pushy, they let you sit after you finish eating and don't "push" you.

One of the little gems of North Beach
author: Tom S.

description:
I recently had my birthday party here and it was a complete disaster. I had made reservations a month before the actual day to ensure everything would perfect. Everything seemed to be all set up and ready to-go until the moment we set foot in the restaurant. I had 20 people on the reservation list (which is why i made them so early) and they first had the reservation time wrong as well as the number of people wrong. The female manager who was working was extremely rude. She seemed to be put out that she had to change things around on her end and insisted I had the time wrong and didnt show up when I originally said I would. I offered to show her my email chain that I had been having for the past month but she declined. 

The preset menu they originally had insisted we use was not put out causing even more confusion. I then had to tell her it was not the correct menu, take my own parties order (good thing I worked at a restaurant before!) and tell them we all wanted. She once again acted extremely rude. They then didnt put out the correct appetizers and we had to again ask for the correct food order. 

Towards the middle to end of our dinner they seemed to pull things together and one of the workers helped to make sure we had everything we needed. He was a huge help because we were about to walk out and go to the pizza place down the street. 

We spent almost $1,000 dollars there and it would seem to me that a Manager of all people should go above and beyond to satisfy a party that large. I guess they dont need the business?? 

The food was very good, but I won't be going back there regardless. If you dont feel like reading this, just make sure to NEVER BOOK A LARGE PARTY HERE.
author: Kristen O.

description:
Small tacos much like you'd get at a well-regarded taco truck.  You know the ones.  This is not a negative to either this place or the taco trucks.
Lively atmosphere and good service.
The tuna ceviche with mango chunks was good, like a poke with fruit.
We did wait at the bar for about a 1/2 hr on a weeknight.
Busy place.  Small menu.
Not real filling a meal, but tasted good.
They give you a big bowl of chips and salsa to munch on before the food.  Dig the tomatillo.
$9 for 2 tacos?  Hmmm.  O.k. it's al pastor and it has pineapple in it, o.k. I'll pay.
author: Kev M.

description:
Warm, tasty Mexican food at a reasonable price.  For a big eater like myself, you would do well for yourself to order two of the taco dishes, or one of the entrees (rib chop, lamp shank, etc.).  The ceviche is delicious, spicy, but is not an entree.

The service was great - filled up our water many, many times...and we drink copious amounts of water - while being attentive whithout overbearing.  It was a casual, fun, dining experience.

A few improvements that could be made:
- we didn't get chips and salsa to start (did we have to order it?)
- less ice in the water, please.
- music was a bit too loud; although the selection was nice (Sublime).
author: Kevin G.

description: Mexican street food by nature does not include vegetarian food, however contrary to former reviewer, I asked for tostadas with no meat. Fantastic!! Chips & tomatillo salsa are amazing. Fun place to go. Authentic street food but restaurant still has some swank unlike a taqueria. Love it!
author: Cassandra O.

description: Stumbled on this place while walking through North Beach, and boy are we glad we did. My boyfriend had the carnitas torta and just about fell off his chair with ecstasy. I had the fish tacos and they were perfection. The chips are thick and homemade and salty and amazing. The salsa is green and chunky and spicy and awesome. The service is super friendly. If we lived in town this place would be on our weekly circuit. I guess we'll just have to hope they open an outpost in DC...
author: Kate S.

description:
I have now been here three times--twice for brunch and once for dinner--and am still unable to find anything to complain about, and I like complaining. First, they make a hamburger that has been marinated in bacon and onions. Whu? Then the bacon and onions are insinuated into the burger. Topped off with guac, on a buttery bun. Period. There's really nothing like this burger elsewhere--it's magnificent. They make a carnitas sandwich that will mess you up, too.

A substantial, quality breakfast burrito for $6. Huh? Shrimp tacos? Check. Carnitas tacos? Yes. Lamb ribs? These had a more Mediterranean flavor than Mexican, but they were delicious and don't seem out of place on the menu. A marinated jalapeno comes with each dish; these suckers are hot. I like that they're not afraid of that. Oh, and even the chips are good, and even the salsa that comes with the chips--some green tangy stuff, not too spicy--is the bomb. Service was friendly and snappy. Tried to make them screw up our order, but they were unfazed. Oh, and it's not even ridiculously expensive--I don't get it. Keep it a secret; I don't want anyone else knowing about this place.
author: Damon L.

description: I can assuredly say I will be spending future night's dining out in SF at other establishments. The food is OK+, which gave them their 2 stars. The service, waiting time, and ambiance (for the price) was unacceptable. I concur with past posters complaining about the rudeness of the staff. Where they should be happy to serve, they provide the opposite. It's crowded, loud, and the portions small. Our polite attempts at service were met with annoyance, and the management couldn't care less about legitimate complaints. I rarely have a bad time when dining out. I left DP's hungry, offended, and overall disappointed.
author: Red C.

description: this place is more tacolicious than tacolicious (or any other taco joint in this town).
author: Matt S.

description:
the boyfriend has been wanting to go to don pisto's for a long time to taste the hamburguesa. we finally decided to go test it before bringing a large group of friends and took the long walk there.

totally worth it. we didn't have to wait and got to sit at the bar since there were only two of us, awesome! the place is popular, packed, and loud with a great relaxed/fun vibe - reasonable prices too. chips were crunchy and great with the tangy tomatillo salsa. both our hamburguesas were great - the meat is so flavorful and ingredients were simple and fresh, perfect combos.

originally weren't going to get anything to drink but were tempted to taste a sangria and i've got to say its the best i've had at a bar, the bartender was cool too. can't wait to bring our friends here for an awesome afternoon!
author: Sam H.

description:
For months, living in North Beach, I've wondered what all the crowds were about outside this sign-less restaurant.  It took finally looking the address up online to find the name.  After finally going there last week, I'd say the hype is warranted.

This place has a very unique menu (especially for the location), a trendy chill environment, and some really good food.  They start by giving you chips and green salsa - excellent.  The margarita and sangria were both quite good.  We ordered the carnitas tacos and fish tacos to start.  The ingredients were fresh with unique flavors, but still a little bland - maybe needed seasoning?  I'm not sure if the shells are supposed to be "authentic" style but would have liked some variety to match the ingredients inside.  Crunchy shells would have been awesome.  The soft bland taco shells took away from the overall taste quite a bit.  At this point, I had mixed feelings about the place...then our pork chop dish came.  It was marinated in a spicy orange sauce with cucumber salad on the side.  Absolutely the BEST pork dish I've ever eaten.  Very tender, perfectly grilled, great flavor, and paired perfectly with the cucumber salad.

The place is mostly young people; didn't see anyone over 35 maybe.  It was very crowded and we waited for 30 minutes.  They do not take reservations unless you have 6 or more in your party (maybe worth rounding up more people to go).  The staff was just okay, nothing to brag about.

Overall a really interesting place to check out the next time you are in North Beach.
author: Ben Y.

description: Don Pisto's food and atmosphere is perfection.  We had a small civil ceremony at City Hall and rented out Don Pisto's for our low key reception and couldn't have been happier with the day.  The food and drinks were as delicious as ever, and the staff was so sweet and easy to work with from start to finish.  We called several other restaurants to price things out, and while Don Pisto's was reasonable, the real selling point was how easy and flexible they were to work with.  Everyone had a blast, and my husband and I were so happy to have such a lovely, delicious and festive place to celebrate our marriage with close family and friends.
author: Lacey W.

description:
Don Pistos makes good food (and  IMO a killer sangria). The owner likes to mingle with the crowd and is quite approachable. Sometimes things get crazy in there on busy nights so the service might be a tad slow but enjoy the ambiance (and hopefully the good company you brought along). 

Chips and salsa are great, ends up killing my appetite since I eat so much. I always like to go wit the Al Pastor Tacos which haven't failed me yet. They serve dishes with a roasted jalepeno (I think) and boy that can give some spicy kick. 

Portions seem to be small, but then again you aren't at a McDonalds here...it's quite normal if you have eaten a meal out of the United States (where people tend to be much healthier!). 

All in all, I'd recommend giving it a shot purely because it's got a good vibe, good food and drink (beer and wine only though), and you can go out right in North Beach. Bring a girl (or a guy) and have a good time.
author: Niket D.

description: I came here for the hamburguesa on the 7x7 list. It was sooo delicious! If you are a burger/meat lover, you will totally love this dish! I don't know how they cook it, but it's soaked/marinated with bacon (anything with bacon just taste a little better, right?). Omg it was yum!! My boyfriend and I shared that dish, along with the fish-of-the-day snapper soft tacos. That was also pretty good - with a little kick if you like it spicy. While waiting for our table, we got the chips with oh so *fresh* guacamole. Thinking about it now is making me so hungry! If you're thinking about coming here, think no more, just come!
author: Rosie W.

description: I went here for a birthday dinner, and it was one to remember. The wait was an hour, but luckily there are tons of watering holes nearby. DP's has a business relationship with a bar down the corner, Amante. You can get a few good appetizers there (from the DP chef) or you can go to Columbus cafe next door for some great happy hour deals. At DPs I got the LOBSTER, and boy it was amazing. They dont have a full liquor licence, but the margaritas are some of the best I've ever had and I have been to Mexico. I got like 4 of them that night. The ceviche was also great as so were the fish tacos. I really like the interior and the atmosphere, and the service was friendly. Its a crowded place, so skip it if you are one of those personal bubble people.
author: Sean H.

description: Excellent quick lunch. Al pastor tacos are awesome. If this place was in my neighborhood I'd be there often. Good salsa and chips as well.
author: Daniel S.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in SF.   I have not had one bad thing here.  Some of my favorite items include the hamberguesa, al pastor tacos (most flavorful al pastor ever), pork chop (amazing flavor), carne asada tacos, chicken tortilla soup and the guacamole. The food is great, the restaurant has a fun atmosphere, and the staff are real friendly.  Do yourself a favor and check it out !
author: Grant L.

description:
I'll start with the bad.  The host who sat us that night, who I was told by the waitress is the manager of the place, was extremely rude when sitting us.  We had made reservations that day for 4 people and one of our guests cancelled last minute.  When I told the host this he said we'd have to wait for another 45 minutes or so to be seated, this wasn't the issue.  I was about to ask if we could be moved up on the list because technically we had reservations and the host put his hand in my face and told me that I'd have to wait... not a good practice for a new restaurant in SF.  

I have to say the food was okay, not great and extremely over priced for what it was. if you want a similarly priced Mexican place with better service and better food, go to Mamacita in the Marina.  If you want REAL Mexican, get over to the mission, you'll save yourself about $100.
author: Jason L.

description: The fish tacos at this place are the best one I have tried in a long long time. The complementary nachos are unique and freshly made as well. Love this place
author: Priya M.

description: Went their recently with friends and we quoted a 30 minute wait.  An hour and a half later the host (who we later learned was the owner) was blatantly rude when we asked when we would be seated: "You can leave if you want to."  So we did.  We won't be back.
author: Buddy M.

description:
Great, delicious food in a super cool/quaint atmosphere.  OK, so i just used cool and quaint together, but it's true. Exposed brick, thick rustic wood beams, blaring music, great vibe, in an small-ish space that even looks right onto the kitchen.

Though their menu doesn't go on for pages and pages, the flavor is packed in right from the amazing salsa verde and chips that they bring to the table. I've tried the tacos, the Hamburgeusa torta, and recently tried some the Cast Iron Summer Stew that my friend ordered. The stew was served in a mini-cauldron of awesome: grilled corn, calamari, shrimp AND halibut. And, they served it with crostini lightly dusted with an awesome blend of salt and cayenne. 

Everything is delicious and good-sized portions for the price! This is the kind of place that will impress guests (or a date!).
author: Zoe M.

description: Unbelievably good. The sangria is something that you must get.  The restaurants atmosphere is sensational and I would most certainly recommend this place to everyone.
author: Abhi M.

description: Frou Frou food of little substance. Blah. And they put my beer in a margarita glass..WTF, over.
author: Morris D.

description: One word, DELICIOUS. This place houses the best carne asada tacos I've ever had. This is a bold statement considering my roots.... Born in El Paso, TX and raised in Phoenix, AZ. My husband and I just moved to North Beach in May and we are so incredibly happy to stubble upon it! We have been back several times since our first visit and are huge fans. Last time we went we tried their Hamburguesa, a hamburger marinated in bacon and onions and then ground up, grilled and topped with guacamole. My mouth is watering just thinking about it! We also tried their Michelada, Sol beer, lime, and tapatio over ice. This is a spicy and yet refreshing beverage! Bottom line is that every thing is amazing and that includes the chips and salsa to the margaritas that wash them down!
author: Kaycee J.

description: My mom took me here on Valentine's day. This food was really good! it was always spicy! we got the soup, tacos and some tostadas. the service is really good. the Sangria is good also, It was my first time having sangria and I liked it. I think i'll come back here alone and eat here again. it's more my age range people eating here.
author: Brian B.

description:
I first heard about this place on Thrillist and bookmarked it for later, so come last night when Cathy Y. and I found ourselves hungry at the corner of Washington Square park we headed to Don Pistos.  Because what better way to celebrate St. Patty's day than with a little south of the border flair (yeah, not so festive for this holiday, but we won't hold that against this place).  

We were initially impressed by their green salsa (ooh a little st. patty's day spice perhaps?) as evidence by our quickly empty chip bowl, and then more so impressed by their guac.  I opted for the tortilla soup and my friend got tacos.  She loved her dinner, and I loved mine but I was unfortunately too full from all the chips (and maybe the fact that i'd had a huge slice of cheesecake about an hour earlier).  All in all, fresh tasting mexican fare that left us happy/in a little bit of pain (the good kind of course).  

We dug the vibe, appreciated the water pitchers on the table, and enjoyed the acai sangria and the background music.  However, it was really crowded when we got there and the waitstaff was clearly hurried and stressed out by all the people, so it took awhile for us to get seated, even after a huge wave of patrons left.  But i'll forgive them this time, because once we were seated it was a pleasant experience.
author: Anne Marie B.

description: This place hides in the brick wall on union st. My sister brought me here after she stumbled upon it with her friends. It was packed so the wait is a little ridiculous, but it is worth it. Also, for the most part the service was good.
author: Jessica  Y.

description:
Fresh and authentic.  They pride themselves on using great ingredients, which can be hard to find in Mexican food.

I love my tomato salsa, so I was pretty bummed that they only offer tomatillo salsa.   But the chips are good enough to make up for it.  And they stopped making churros!

Great meal for a good price (it's not as cheap as some of the Mission spots, but it's just an entirely different experience).  We had dinner for two (without drinks) including tax and tip for $20.  That's rare in this city!
author: Alyssa W.

description: Really delicious salmon...tempted to give it 5 stars based on that. Fish and Carne Asada tacos were great but not mind blowing.
author: Rohan S.

description:
eh.

Context: Busy, Saturday brunch.  We were greeted by friendly staff and ended up waiting like 5 or 10 mehnutes for a table.  Once a table opened up, the bus boy (without asking) put three mehmosas on the table and bounced.  One of us didn't even want to drink.  Not sure what to mehke of it; want to rack up the bill or something?  The waiter kindly took a mehmosa off our bill after we told him what the dealio was.  It took about 10 mehnutes of mehmosa chuggin' to get our food ordered; two hambur'grease'as and a huevos rancheros plate.  Now the real waiting game begins.  Drink more, lol around, yell over the screaming bros just so the person next to you can hear what you're saying, drink more, get a free fish taco plate because of a typo from our order, wait, drink mo, mo, mo, wait, get the two boiygas at the same time, drink mo, and wait for days long (~25 minutes) for the third dish, huevos rancheros, to come come out.  The kitchen was pretty slammed, but it was kind of off-putting finishing our burgers before the eggs came out.  Mofos apologized.

Non-shitty-storytelling part of the review:

Hamburg'meh'sas ($9) - Good, toasty bun.  The meat has bacon marinated into the beef, so that's an obvious "fuck yeah," right?  Na gurl, shit was like meatloaf-consistency except greasier and not as tasty as you'd hope for.  What would be good is if they cooked the bacon crispy and then threw it into the ground beef for some texture and stuff.  The only condiment that comes on the burger is some pretty standard guacamole.  Not worth it.

Bottomless Meh'mosas ($13) - not that meh, pretty good.

Fish Tacos (Free, bitches) - Cooked well, nice crust, no/not enough salt added.  Basically, a tasteless dish.  They have a ramekin of salt on the table, so maybe they want you to salt your own food?  

Chips and Salsa (Complimentary) - Chips were good.  Add your own salt, again.  Salsa was like other people described it; gotta lotta lime.

I'd probably come back just to get sloppy off their mimosas and shit all over their bathroom (in a good way).  The food kinda blows fat dick-sack, but the staff are pretty chill.  Plan for possible, future trips to this place: go to the bakery up the street and get some 'donk good bread then come here to get your drank on.
author: Gar Y.

description: Good tacos! Came early to avoid the crowds and got right in. Menu made for sharing.
author: Kaylee L.

description:
By far one of my Top 5 places in SF!!! The food is amazing, the staff is great and the drinks are amazing! They have a great room downstairs for a private event or party. The location is great. I go back very often and we love Pete there! He always makes sure me and my girls have a great time....and we Do! 
thanks Don Pisto's!!
author: Sophia H.

description: Tacos are my favorite food. Al pastor are my favorite tacos. And Don Pisto's are the best al pastor tacos I've ever had. I live in Boston and travel to the Bay Area about once a month for work. Every trip, I drive 35 miles each way from the east bay to have these tacos. Fortunately, I've been there with others and been able to try some other dishes, but I will never not eat their tacos. Almost always a line to get in but always worth the wait.
author: Dan F.

description:
I love Don Pisto's. The food is very good (get the shrimp, carnitas, carne asada and/or al pastor tacos). I believe the ceviche is always changing - last time I went it was shrimp so I didn't get it since I had already ordered the shrimp tacos (the first time I went they had some sort of fish ceviche and it was pretty amazing). Guac is great too.

I have yet to try any of the other items but I'll definitely be back soon.

Also, they only have beer and wine. Beers are cheap though. Yay!

Cute servers ;)
author: Alli J.

description:
We were in North Beach and wanted Mexican food, but didn't want to truck down to the Mission - Yelp to the rescue.

I'm going to start with the few things I didn't like.

.......

That was quick. I was quite impressed. The menu is small, which I generally find to be a good sign. There is no prominent sign, which I generally find to be a good sign. They were very willing to create something good for the vegetarians in our group - they were quite happy. The chef/owner graciously came to discuss a custom veggie dish.

If I were going to find fault, it would be that things weren't really all that spicy - flavorful for sure, but not very spicy. I think this reflects the fact that real Mexican food is not necessarily burn-your-mouth spicy, but very flavorful and savory. The guac has much more spice than the salsa, but both are good. The presentations are great, and the prices are very reasonable.

This a great choice in the area, and certainly a step up in ambience from the grimy (albeit super tasty) taquerias in the Mission.
author: Ben K.

description:
I love Don Pistos! I typically always get the fish tacos (with whatever the fish of the day is), ceviche and the sangria. Mmmm so good! Also, their green salsa is amazing (and you get free refills haha)

The food is always perfect, and I love the ambiance. Being a North Beach groupie, I go here a lot! And Pete is one of my favorite neighborhood friends.
author: kittCAT L.

description:
I thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere of this small restaurant. It's something you won't easily catch unless you were trying to look for it.

I ordered the fish tacos. Don't let looks deceive you. They look small, but they're filling especially with the complementary chips and salsa they serve you. To be honest, I probably could snack on their chips and salsa and be satisfied. The fish in the tacos had the right amount of flavor that complemented well with the sauce it was covered with. Perfect degree of spiciness. 

Their margaritas are a real delight as well. It was a perfect balance between tasting the alcohol and having a cooling refreshment with your tacos. 

If there ever was a con to this place, I'd say that it's a bit pricey. However, if you space out the times you go, its a nice treat.
author: Jobelle R.

description:
I give 3.5 stars. Service does deserve 5. 
Good food. 
GREAT service. 
but the food was way too spicy. (that's why low stars) Give Options!! 

I could see if few dishes were spicy, but everything was over the top and without any warning. 

Steak Tacos tasted great, but after one I couldn't take the heat. The meat must be marinated, it was full of flavor and moist. 

Run down on our Meal: 
Taco's come with 2 and no sides. 
Taco's $6 or $7 (I think) 
Side of Rice $2.00 
Side of Beans $2.00 
Rice was perfect, but beans a little too watery and WHY?? 3 chili's on top of the beans??? We couldn't eat them! 
Now the Pork Torta was delicious and just the right size to be split with someone. Juicy, tender meat and fresh cheese. 
Ceviche was perfect and tasty with the homemade tortilla's 

Finding this place can be hard. No sign, but that's what makes it sort of "cool" Look for 3 Red Lights on a brick building and you're there. 
I passed it up 5 times before it was right before my eyes! 
Nice decor and lighting. A small bar to dine at too.
author: Jen T.

description: We had two cockroaches run across our table and the manager did nothing about it, in fact he was a real a$$hole about the whole thing. Never going back.
author: Jimmy P.

description: Really good food in a funky, cool place.  Try the Sonora Taco, but only order one.  the portions are very generous.
author: Carlos S.

description:
Excellent!!!  Had a Bachelorette Party there.  The service was awesome and the food was spectacular!  They were sooo accommodating and got us out in 45min for a party of 10 because we were running late to another reservation.

VEggie Friendly: Not really
author: ashley l.

description:
Why don't we have a place like this in LA?

This picky foodie family was delighted with Don Pisto's.  We went for lunch on a Saturday.  The homemade chips and tomatillo salsa were delicious.  The guacamole was creamy and amazing.  The pork and grilled pineapple tacos were fantastic, and the fish tacos were very tasty.  The kid was treated to a huge, yummy quesadilla.

We rolled out of there stuffed and impressed.  Highly recommend.
author: Jessica R.

description:
If you read the review below, you might wonder why I'd give this pace 4 stars.

I wrote my review yesterday, and this morning in my inbox, was a sincere response from Don Pisto's owner, Pete, apologizing for my experience. The fact that he not only already read my review, but responded to it right away gave me a ton of respect for this place. He even offered a dinner on the house for my friend and me, and gave me his cellphone number to set it up. That's above and beyond what is necessary, but obviously, this guy cares about customer experience.

And for that, plus their delicious tortilla soup and fresh-out-of-the-fryer tortilla chips, I give you 4 stars, Pete. Thanks for responding to my review so quickly. Thanks for offering the free meal (full disclosure: I declined the offer). Cheers.

--
Let me start by saying that their tortilla soup was fantastic. The entrees, the chips and salsa, and even the drinks are all reasons I'd consider going back here, and at the end of the day, those are the best reasons to dine out anyway, right?

My only problem was with the service. Our waiter was friendly, sure, but it took awhile just to put in our drink orders, at least another 10 minutes to get 2 sangrias, and then at least another 15 after that to place an order (our waiter wasn't the person who delivered our drinks, unfortunately). I didn't want to be rude, but after awhile, both my friend and I were trying to catch his attention every time he walked by. I'm not super picky about service, but having to ask the waiter if you can place an order is just not acceptable.

It's a new restaurant, so my guess is that maybe they're still working out the kinks, and I'd probably venture back the next time I have a craving for tortilla soup. In the meantime, I'd recommend going here when you don't have some place to be afterward.
author: Kat E.

description:
Hands down, Don Pisto's is my FAVORITE restaurant. Period. The first time I visited Don P's, I was not a local resident of SF. I was simply visiting and looking for a good place to eat a late dinner. Based on the Yelp reviews, my boyfriend and I settled for Don P's and made our way to the restaurant. The rest is history. I now live a walk away from this place, and I can honestly say that I eat there once or twice a week. 

The owner, Pete, is the BEST! He is always there and totally friendly! One night, he even brought over mini cupcakes to my boyfriend and I after our meal! The waiters are just a nice and always on top of it. I really love the Don Pisto's family. :)

Some tips: Sundays are Industry Night... $2 beers, $3 sangria. You can't beat the food, fish is amazing (and I don't even like fish), the rice is great, and the chips and salsa are so good you'll crave them until you're next visit. ENJOY! And I'll see you sunday!
author: Tanya H.

description: The gauc, poc chuc, and chips were delicious here.  I couldn't find it in me to pay $4.50 for a street taco especially when you can get it in LA for $1 holla.  The poc chuc was cooked perfectly.  I need to come back and try the burger.  Sunday nights $3 sangrias and $2 beers.  Woot.
author: Fatty A.

description:
Came upon here upon the recommendation of a friend.

North Beach is a bitch to go out in for the lack of parking... but we made like Cameron Diaz, Selma Blair, and Christina Applegate and parked on this steep hill and stumbled down the stairs on the sidewalk. If I'm not mistaken, their appartment in The Sweetest Thing was located in this neighborhood.

The place did not disappoint at all. 

The menu is small, and luckily that either means they know what they are doing and what they want to offer - or they cannot offer you much at all.

Luckily for me, it was the first one.

My Sangria didn't fare so well with me, it was like an Ocean Spray I never expected... but I still took it down easy.

Me and my friend ordered the carnitas and the fish taco. We swapped out one for one.

The fish taco was okay, the fish had a light crispy flavor - but the sauce did not impact the fish the way I wanted it to. But I died for the carnitas taco. Carnitas like it's been simmered over a slow boil and full of flavor. The sauce was good.

I was tempted to do another order, because at $7 for two, it's not bad.

But I held off, we were off to drink after all.

A great spot to come to. I'll definitely be back.
author: Kim D.

description:
I have lived in North Beach 2 years, and this place is hands down the best of north beach, possible the city.  After eating the mussels and chorizo one night here I was hooked, I literally had dreams about this dish it is so amazing!   I always take people here when they visit, and new friends I meet and its always a hit.  Its great for big groups as well which is nice in north beach.
The best things on the menu are the mussels and chorizo, al pastor tacos, and hambergesa, but you can't really go wrong no matter what you order here.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
I've tried nearly half the items on the menu here, thanks to hitting up Don Pisto's with a group of 10.  We order all 5 types of tacos (carne asada, carnitas, pescado, camarones, and al pastor).  My favs were camarones and al pastor --- and the tortillas were excellent!  

From the seafood menu, we picked the mexican sashimi and calamari.  The calamari plate with bigger than I imagined, and very good.  Overall, it was my favorite food along with the Camarones.  

I also found a good light beer here - Sol.  I don't see it served at many restaurants, but it was a good compliment to the tacos, tapas, etc.  

This place has a back room that's excellent for large groups.  The front room has a lot of 2 to 4 tops, though the seating is pretty tight.
author: Joel F.

description:
The one thing that was great about Don Pisto is the Sangria.  Other than that I found that some of the reviews just really overrated the place.  

Upon getting there we were told 30-45 minute wait (typical for a Friday night so no big deal).  75 minutes later we were seated.  I don't mind waiting as long as they can stick to the committed time.  Since they are the ones setting the expectation they should really under promise and over deliver.  Once we were seated I found the wait staff to be friendly but necessarily attentive.  

The food had good flavor but was overly salty.  The portion sizes are fine for one person (or to share several dishes with 2 people).  The wait staff recommends sharing but if you go that route with a big group you may want to order several of the same dish to make sure that everyone gets more than one bite.  As another reviewer stated, there are NO vegetarian options (luckily I am a meat eater).  

Other reviews have stated that this is a good date place.  I don't know about them but if I am on a date I actually want to be able to speak to my date.  The noise level is so loud it is nearly impossible to hear the person sitting next to you without yelling.  

Overall the place is not terrible but for my money there are better places.
author: Mo B.

description: Fantastic restaurant.  The food is amazing -- fresh takes on Mexican standards.  They have a real charcoal grill that imparts delicious smoky flavors to most items.  You can order several smaller dishes for sharing in a group, which allows you to try more options on the menu.  The lobster, carnitas, rib chop, ceviche, and tortilla soup are particularly outstanding.  Head's up that there's almost always a wait and they don't take reservations for smaller groups.  The best thing to do is go early, give your cell number to the hostess, go around to corner to Tony Nik's for a drink, and they'll call you when your table is ready.  Best restaurant in North Beach, as far as I'm concerned.
author: Paul W.

description: don pistos is well worth its 4.5 star rating. the food is so simple, yet SO consistently delicious. i adore the shrimp tacos and perfectly salted chips. it's reasonably priced. the service is friendly. the margaritas delightful. you can do easy take-out if you're so inclined. there's nothing not to love about this place.
author: Connie S.

description: From a girl who moved from San Diego, this is one of the best Mexican food spots you can find in San Fran, without feeling sick. Everything I have tried is a winner--hamburguesas, guac, BREAKFAST BURRITO, tacos, mussles, sangria and more have been fabulous. It is a great place for groups and bottomless mimosas.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Comment from Pete M. of Don Pisto's 1/31/2011    « Hide

that is why you live in san ramon and your name is neil. poor guy, i hope you have better luck next life, love you baby....

 nice...this is what the owner wrote back to us......he needs some lessons in etiquette........
author: neil z.

description: I have been hard pressed to find decent Mexican food in the bay area, but this place blew me away.  Loved the tomatillo salsa!  Could have eaten it by the spoonful!  The breakfast plates are fantastic; everything tastes so fresh!  And how about those bottomless Mimosas, Sangria, and Margaritas!  Can't wait to come back!
author: Kirby G.

description:
What a great find! This restaurant has such unique style and so much character. Not to mention... the food is delicious! I've gone several times and every meal I choose has so much flavor. The seafood is always so fresh and it's obvious that a lot of thought goes into putting it together.

Tasty sangria, yummy tacos, homemade tortillas, variety of really great ceviche, fresh seafood, chips and salsa as soon as you're seated, and really great service!!

Pete is the owner and you can tell he cares about his guests and, therefore, so does everyone else working there. 

This place has such great ambiance and is perfect to go on a date or with friends.
author: J H.

description: My daughter and I shared a terrific dinner here last Saturday night. The Poc Chuc was hands down the best pork chop I've ever had. No competition. Not to be missed. The ceviche was also superb. The Carnitas tacos were good and Diabla Prawns adequate but unremarkable. Had we to do it over again we'd have skipped the tacos and prawns and gone with the Wild Monterey Calamari which looked wonderful on other tables.We took food home. Great, fun-loving atmosphere and very good service from Nicole. Would be a terrific place to have a dinner party. Opened and filled quickly at 5:30 so get there early or wait until the first group turns over which could be quite a while.
author: Marshall P.

description: I love everything about this place! The margaritas were delicious, the tortilla soup was prob the best I've had, and the atmosphere is great. If you're looking for something quiet this is definitely not the place, but if you are looking for something lively and fun with great food and drinks come here! Great first date because if things get quiet awkward you can ppl watch and listen to everyone else talk.
author: Jasmine S.

description: Wow! Some of the most delicious food I've had! We started with their chips and salsa (tomatillo), and I we had to keep getting our bowls refilled because the salsa was that delicious. We had the mussels and chorizo, and the broth blew me away. it was absolutely amazing. My bf and I also had fish tacos and chicken tostadas. SO much flavor in every bite. the rice and beans on the side were just mediocre, and the margs weren't as strong as I needed them to be ;), but overall, this is some of the best Mexican food I have eaten. Such amazing spices and savory flavors. I am definitely coming back!
author: Sheeva G.

description: Hold up!! Awesome Mexican food in north beach!???? Oh yes it's true!.. This place has it all! I asked if I could live downstairs but they kindly say no, well at least not for now.. Anyways, my favorites are tacos al pastor and the camarones. Give this place a shot and you won't be disappointed.
author: Edith C.

description:
Fish tacos. Perfect. 
Salsa. Yup. 
Real coke in a bottle when you've been drinking too much. And the owner is legit.
author: Jt S.

description: I was kinda disappointed by this place.  It's nothing spectacular.  While the prices are reasonable, the food is mediocre - everything from the ceviche to the tacos to the little sandwiches (i'm blanking on the name of those right now).  The acai berry sangria was interesting but a little on the sweet side.  Basically I found this place to be average... although I will likely be inclined to give it another chance at some point in the future.
author: Toby C.

description: The hamburguesa I had at least ties the BEST hamburger I've ever had.  wow!  I HIGHLY recommend this place.  5-star food at a 3-star price ;)
author: Clay H.

description: Great Mexican in North Beach, unexpected in that it feels like a cool Mission joint but off of Columbus Ave. I had a great breakfast burrito for a Sunday lunch. Savory and flavorful but not too heavy. The pineapple aqua fresca mimosa was like juice and yummy. They do bottomless for $15! The restaurant was close to full at 1PM but was able to sit immediately.
author: Aki N.

description: Awesome! Kate ( bartender) did a fabulous job... Excellent service, great knowledge of the menu and took great care of us. The entire staff was super and made us feel welcome. Don't let a smaller size menu fool you... All of the dishes that we had we're well prepared, great portions , and we had a fantastic meal. Don't have any doubts about coming here for a well prepared and satisfying meal.
author: Derek B.

description:
I am sad that I am leaving North Beach just as we are finally getting a quality mexican restaurant. For the last few years, I have wished that we had a unique mexican restaurant and Don Pisots is the answer. Friendly service and everything was between $7 and $10. Great tacos and tortas.
- complimentary fresh, thick, warm and salty tortilla chips with tomatilla salsa
- guacamole: fresh and tasty
- Pescadore Taco: Halibut was the fish of the day, this was my favorite thing by far
- Carne Asadas Taco: Good, very flavorful, could have used some cabbage for some texture
- Carnitas Torta: Also very tasty, shredded juicy carnitas, queso fresco and some green sauce (maybe tomatillo salsa), mmmm, the roll was especially good
I won't be surprised if I come back a few times in the coming weeks before I leave my beloved North Beach. I highly recommend this place.
author: Rose K.

description: Amazing. Guac and chips to start were great and we are very particular about that.  We tried the tortilla soup that everyone raves about and it was good, but not my favorite.  The tacos and tostada were the beat We had a relatively new and I
author: Jim T.

description: Great food, great service, great prices. Place is great but get there early so you dont have to wait to get a table.
author: Braydan Y.

description:
I work at the Church Key bar in North Beach about a block away from Don Pistos. I have been working in the neighborhood for 2 years and have become completely spoiled by our fantastic food options. That said, Don Pistos is solidly in the running for my favorite in the entire hood. The attention to detail and innovation shines through and makes this much more than quick to-go taqueria . This is 100% the kind of place you want to go in sit down and savor every bit of your FRESH amazing food! If you go in and sit at the counter, you've got a fair chance of enjoying a beer with the owner while you wait, who is clearly a man who takes pride in his food and his restaurant. 

Hands down the beset mexican food for miles around and possibly the best new (ish) restaurant in North Beach over all. 

*tip*  Best guac in the entire city!!!!! Yeah, I'm going that far.
author: Dani O.

description: Their Pork Chops are to die for. The chips and salsa are very good, the sashimi was excellent, the service was very attentive. It's rare that I find places I absolutely gush about, but this place is very good though it can get pricy.
author: James F.

description: Sat at the best table in the house last night and had a wonderful dinner.  Great atmosphere, amazing chips guac and tacos.  Daniel, the host, is super friendly and accommodating.  Thanks Pistos! YUM!
author: Angie S.

description: I was a little skeptical at first, but by the end of the meal I became a fan of Don Pisto's. The chips and verde salsa were perfect and I couldn't stop eating them alongside my Michelada (which was also perfect). We started with the Tortilla soup which was damn good. Then on to the tostadas which were my least favorite of the night. The carnitas tacos were spot on, but the hamburgesa was great, definitely the best of the night...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Go here. Eat here. Drink here. Sleep outside of here and wait until they open to do it all over again.
author: Bryan M.

description:
Great addition to the neighborhood! Service was very good and very friendly. The menu offers a limited selection of options but everything we tried was very good. In particular, the mussels with chorizo were amazing. 

I'm definitely looking forward to going back!
author: Jeff S.

description: Came here on the night I arrived in San Francisco last week. Kind of hard to find because there is no sign, just 3 red lights outside the door. The salsa they give you is fantastic. Just the right amount of heat. I had the chicken tacos for dinner and they were one of the best I've ever had. I highly recommend this place.
author: Ashlee K.

description:
Best restaurant in North Beach.

Al Pastor. Guac. Burger. 

Check out the brunch menu...
author: Chris H.

description: At the bar, drinking amazing sangria, perfectly spicy green salsa and amazing ceviche.  Bartenders are super attentive, hostess super nice.  Just on the first 15 minutes of being here, I'm sold on coming back.
author: Monica H.

description:
First off, this place was a little hard to find. The restaurant looked like its part of a building complex. 

I read so many great reviews about don pisto's and was looking forward to eat the tacos and take advantage of the bottomless margaritas, mimosas and sangria.  I was completely unimpressed with all the drinks and most of the tacos. We had a big group and was seated in the private area with a pre-ordered set menu for $30/person.  Long story short, we had some issues about how many tacos a person should get since the menu was set. Margaritas tasted inconsistent and watered down, sangria tasted like medicine and mimosas were not cold enough. We had beef, fish, shrimp and al pastor tacos and most of them were ok. The ones that really stood out to me were the shrimp and beef tacos.  Shrimp was full of flavor and the beef was very juicy and was cooked medium so it was a little red, which I like.  I don't think I would ever want to come back here again for brunch or to pay $9 for two small tacos for a la carte. I would rather go to the mission and pay $4 for two tacos that are authentic and full of meat and flavor.
author: Irene L.

description:
Good food here. Always a good crowd. If they're busy you might have to share a table with another party.

I've been here for dinner. The tacos are good and so is the street corn. Decent prices and you won't have to wait too long. they also have good fresh guac.

I've also been here for brunch for some mimosas and a burrito. The pineapple mimosas are good and strong and I definitely felt it walking home. I was still hungry after the burrito so I probly finished 2 bowls of the free nachos and salsa. 

I'll be back here, no doubt. Come for happy hour! Enjoy!
author: JeF m.

description: Good oysters, decent tacos. Strange waitstaff strategy.
author: Eric H.

description:
came for some fish tacos (only served as pairs = $11)
felt more like a club with dark lighting and reggaeton music
the chips were quite tasty, almost pita like with a very citrusy/limey green salsa.
the tacos were ok, wet, little sloppy much rather eat Nick's if going for this style.
author: Rob C.

description: The line was out the door! The breakfast burrito was to die for and complimentary chips and salsa was enough for us to sit down. Husband had tacos and ended up ordering more after he finished his first place. Highly recommend
author: Michelle L.

description:
Here's the deal with Don Pisto's... you're going to get deeply delicious, authentic Mexican street food at ridiculously low prices.  The owner Pete has a passion for this cuisine, and it shows... both in the focus of the concise menu and its execution.  The ingredients are pristine and the flavors confident, lush and exciting.

Even the drinks are reasonably priced... though the sangria wasn't the best.  Stick to wine, beer and this amazing food and you'll leave wondering how you can be so happy and still have money in your wallet.  Bravo, Pete!
author: Josh M.

description: smaller place, parking was a nightmare but the food was well worth it. The chips and quac are amazing. The place can get loud but that just shows that everyone is having a good time. I tried the famous burger, and it was gooood. Probably shouldn't write this review while hungry, now I want Don Pisto's for lunch!
author: Heather C.

description: Get over your pretentious self.  I ordered the burger, and they would not put the guacamole on the side. (I cannot eat cilantro.  Yes, I am one of those, but I am never obnoxious about it.) I actually asked several times in disbelief: "the chef does not like to alter his recipes." Hmmmm...while I understand and respect that, it's not like it was cooked INTO the burger meat; it was added on top - a glorified condiment. And last time I checked, I didn't see any Michelon stars...
author: Leigh F.

description: Delicious food, really cute spot, good prices and good service. Get the Ceviche, you will not be sorry. Plus they have my favorite beer, Sol.
author: Nilu r.

description: I've been going for brunch for a while and *everything* has been really solid. Last night I went for dinner for the first time and the pork chop may have been the best piece of meat that I've ever had. Absolutely amazing.
author: Joel S.

description: Yum yum yum.  Cinco de mayo in the city, wandering North Beach, what do you do? Yelp "margaritas" and Don Pisto's comes up.  We arrive here around 11:30, put our name in and grab a margarita for the man, mimosa for me, not too upset about the 30-45 minute wait.  Looking around, the drinks are flowing, everyone is having a great morning, the kitchen is busy, and the food smells amazing! Less than 10 minutes later we are seated and told about the bottomless mimosas, margaritas, sangria (and you can have all 3 if ya want) for $17. Ordered guac, steak tacos and a pork "burrito". The food came out pretty quick and I have to tell you, this was some of the best mexican food I have ever had. The pork was so juicy and flavorful, the steak tacos were delicious. The homemade chips were the right amount of salt and crunch and the salsa and guacamole were addicting.  Pair that with our everflowing drinks, I died and went to food heaven.  I am pretty sure that every trip to SF in my future will include Don Pisto's brunch.
author: Rebecca S.

description: We went to Don Pisto's for Brunch.  I had the breakfast burrito, which was very tasty.  They apparently make their own chorizo which is very good as well.  The service was on point...friendly and attentive.  All servers and managers constantly helping one another out, as it should be.  I'm looking forward to returning soon.
author: Sean W.

description:
What a treat! They grace you with a plethora of chips and salsa to greet you! Both fresh and homemade. 

Their salsa is a salsa verde, so if you're craving something tomatoey you're going to have to accept the tomatillo! The guacamole is good and has a tiny bit of a bite to it, unlike many places that forget that it can be good that way. 

We started with the carnitas tacos. I normally don't get carnitas tacos, but these are melt in your mouth good! I fancy myself a carne asada connoisseur but honestly I think I'll be ordering the carnitas tacos before the carne ones. 

Only really down side to my meal was that the pacing was too fast. They kept bringing more plates and we had no place to put them on the table, so keep that in mind when ordering. Also, note that the tacos are small, but they do come two to a plate so they are great to share if you want to experience a couple of different kinds.

They lack margaritas on their menu, which is kind of a bummer for a mexican restaurant, so go with a cerveza in mind. 

I can't wait to go back!! What an unexpected gem for this neighborhood! I love it!
author: Kimberly M.

description: Tough to find, use the address, parking tough anywhere around here... Place is really quite amazing, simple menu, very good, great price for food of this quality in San Francisco...
author: Troy S.

description: Very solid Latin food - came here on a date and everything from the location to the atmosphere service and food was on-point. Recommended.
author: Rob G.

description:
Something about a place with no sign makes it a bit tastier, no?  As if they were saying, "We don't need to shout who we are, our food will do it for us."  And if not the food, then the grip of people waiting to get seated!  So account for the wait, but it will be worth it!  And your whole party needs to be there to get seated, they are pretty strict on that!

I always have my doubts when it comes to "fancy mexican/spanish" but Don Pisto's nails it.  

Be sure to try:
-Mussels with chorizo (prob my fav thing on the menu)
-Shrimp tacos

Ok, but not great:
-Al pastor (marinated pork) tacos
-Carne asada tacos

Even their chips and salsa are delicious.  A pitcher of margarita also doesn't hurt.  And if you want to do it classy they also have a white wine/oyster combo or lobster on the menu.  

With great tasting food and high energy, Don Pisto's is a definite must when in North Beach, or SF for that matter!
author: Preston Y.

description: I would give this restaurant 5 stars for dinner and 3 stars for brunch (unless you want to have a boozy brunch, then it should be 4 stars). There are plenty of dinner options that are delicious. I personally love the ceviche and mussels with choirzo. The music is always fun and the waitstaff is attentive. It's a great dinner option in North Beach, although the wait can be long. The brunch menu is fairly limited and I was underwhelmed with the food. If I had been drinking bottomless mimosas or sangria, I probably would have enjoyed it more.
author: Natalie D.

description: I crave their tortilla soup about once a week. Soooo good. The place can get crowded and parking in North Beach is always an issue, but once you've had their food you endure the hardships to get it.
author: michelle e.

description: My Buddy took a group of 10 here for a birthday party. I ate up all my food...i looked at my friend and took my fork and started eating his food...he got mad because i couldn't stop myself from eatin his dish. This place is crazy awesome! Great food and Great wait staff!
author: Chris b.

description: No sign to find it...no problem. Follow the crowds to Don Pisto's. Awesome salsa, endless mimosas, killer chorizo and a SF feel to it. DOn Pisto's is quality. Try the breakfast burrito for brunch.
author: Jonny J.

description: So we spent so much time researching restaurants for our 3 night trip to SF and out of all of the places we went (including fine dining) this was our favorite.  It's such a hip, fun, atmosphere with good libations and the food is just amazing...so unique.
author: Andy O.

description: Lobster poached in pork fat with cilantro infused butter, pintos, and homemade salsa wrapped in a freshly made tortilla. Yes. Just yes. Plus everything else was fantastic as well as the service being phenomenal.
author: Jeremy K.

description: I really enjoyed this place. My friend took me here and we enjoyed inexpensive beers (especially for sf), I had an awesome avocado burger and the chips and salsa were good. I only seem to rate places I really like, and this place was no exception. Great food, atmosphere and price. I will definitely be back.
author: Devin B.

description:
The pork chop is unbelievable.  It's perfectly marinated, making it super juicy and flavorful.  There was a pretty long wait (about an hour), and usually that's a deal breaker for me, but I swear the pork chop was worth every minute.

As for ambiance, the exposed brick and mood (i.e. very dark) lighting make it potentially a good date spot.  The limiting factor there is that it was really loud/crowded, so we all had to lean in pretty close to hear each other...which I suppose could be conducive to a successful date...

Overall, this is one of the best spots I've found since I moved to the bay a few months ago, so I will definitely be back.
author: Sheena S.

description: I spent a good deal of my New Year's Day morning trying to figure out some way to cure my throbbing hangover. My girlfriend suggested we go eat at Don Pistos in North Beach and it turned out to be an excellent choice. Being from Boston, I was blown away by the quality of the meal as I have never been to a comparable Mexican place in the Northeast. The margarita and sangria did wonders to aid my hangover and get me back in my feet. The best part of the experience was meeting the owner, Pete. He went out of his way to make us feel comfortable and even brought me a bowl of his special hangover soup. The lack of sign on the front doesn't stop the locals from coming in droves as it was literally filled with people my age. (28) I would say it was the best restaurant I visited in San Francisco and I have been constantly stuffing myself for a week now. Definitely check this place out!
author: Matt C.

description: AMAZING!!!! My favorite taco spot in the city bar none! Everything about this place rocks! I have eaten here at least 30 times and can't stop. There should be a Don Pistos on every corner, and I'm not kidding
author: Brian L.

description:
the following is my fav. food breakdown:

1. korean food. & japanese food, tied
2. chicken. i love chicken. give me CHICKEN!
3. breakfast foods.. but more importantly eggs..

I always pass by this place when i get my hair cut (every 2 weeks or so, yes my hair grows fast, and no i do not use rogaine.... yet). but i finally got to see what this whole business is about... 

it's mexican food.. AIIIIIRRRRRRBA!

-the chips and salsa are a delicious combination. the fresh fried chips with the tangy and spicy salsa was a great way to start off my brunch!

-breakfast burrito reminded me of a high school taco pocket... don't get me wrong it was tasty, but i really wished it cost as much as it did in the highs school cafeteria. -__-

-mushroom omelet was meh. I really just got mushroom and spinach and eggs.. no spices, no nothing? ehh.. i'm gonna pass next time. but portions are very generous.

-sangria.. veryyy delicious! I could easily get hammered on this quickly cause' it taste like juicy juice.

STAFF was great, very friendly and attentive.

**overall, i wish they offered a couple more options on their brunch menu but most of everything I ordered was delicious.. will definitely return for their chips/salsa and SANGRIA!
author: Alex C.

description: Make your reservation! This place is glorious. Sunday brunch at it's finest. Food is cheap, drinks get pricey, but it's totally worth it. Best sangria ever. Mimosas are good too, you can actually taste the champagne, no cheap watered down OJ in the way..The tacos sonora are scrumptious. Fresh salsa verde, flour tortillas and carnitas, yum. The guacamole is simple and just right. The french toast is like cake in breakfast form. The atmosphere is simple and unpretentious because it's all about the food. A great group dining experience post hangover. You can even peer into the kitchen to see the wonder. Enjoy!
author: Ryn S.

description: Dined w a party of 10. No one was overly impressed. I personally expected much more from the Yelp ratings reviewed prior to choosing the restaurant. Margs were good, didn't love any of the taco selections (tried them all) and the menu is definitely small for more "picky" types I wouldn't recommend. Not to mention, the chef Willie "no substitutions or changes to menu items" as told by our semi friendly waitress. I wouldn't revisit.
author: Alexandra G.

description: I 'm not sure if its fair to call Don Pisto's a classic Mexican restaurant, but none the less, this pseudo-Mexican restaurant is a winner in my book. It is reasonably priced and the food is very good. I have been here a couple times and have tried the tacos, the tortilla soup, and guacamole and all three are very good. The tortilla soup is especially good, and will most likely be what I order in the future. The chips and salsa they put on the table are also very good, the chips are definitely fresh, and there salsa verde is quite refreshing. The margarita's and sangria are also very good.It can get crowded fast, so be prepared to wait around the tiny bar.
author: Nick C.

description: Bottomless mimosas and sangria, and super delicious brunch items.  Try the Taco Senora Al Pestor on the brunch menu, you won't regret it!
author: Natalie R.

description: They have phenomenal food. Amazing chips and salsa ! I went locco on their Grilled Calamari, it was just fabulous.
author: Sulaiman B.

description:
Delicious.  I went here last night with a group of 13 for my roommate's birthday dinner.   More often than not, a large group can be a complete mess, a nightmare even.  BUT this dinner was different because of the staff at Don Pistos.  They were cordial, quick, helpful and made the evening flow nicely.  They took our orders upon arrival, kept our glasses full to the brim with their FANTASTIC sangria (no joke, best sangria I have had in SF) and they refilled our chip bowl even before it was empty.

I ordered the carnitas and these things knocked my socks off.  To top it off their salsa is wonderful and they give you ginormous bowls of it so you never have to ask for more.

Best part, it is affordable and also two blocks from my house.  I hope all of my out of town friends like Mexican.
author: j k.

description: I genuinely don't think your life is complete until you have their mussels in a chorizo broth.
author: Carley T.

description: I live in north beach. I eat here once a week. I suggest you do too. The service and food is amazing.
author: Kathleen E.

description:
This has pretty much become my favorite restaurant in North Beach. I've been going about once a week since I discovered it. Everything is fresh and friendly as many others have said and I genuinely appreciate it when the manager comes and tells us they don't have any fish because he wasn't happy with the options available that morning!

I adore the homemade Chorizo with steamed Mussels and the Tortilla Soup is just about the best soup I've ever had.
author: autumn t.

description: We picked this place randomly on a night out in SF. You wouldn't even know the place existed walking by it, I don't recall a sign in front. It looks like the entrance to an apartment building which I thought was cool. It has a downtown loft vibe that you see more in Midwest/east coast. We were seated immediately with no wait whatsoever. Our server was very friendly and explained the small but effective menu. Our waters and drink orders were brought out right away along with our chips and salsa. The chips and salsa were very delicious. Freshly fried tortilla chips salted just right with a green verde salsa that was beyond delicious with the right amount of spice. I started off with a bowl of the chicken tortilla soup. The temperature of the soup was perfect and the broth was delicious, not too salty not too bland. My entree was an order of shrimp tacos. You can tell the tortillas are freshly made in house. The tacos were loaded with fresh, non fishy shrimp and tons of garlic cilantro and that green verde sauce. Our tab was less than 40 dollars!!! It was an all around awesome experience and the next time I am visiting San Francisco I will definitely be eating here again! Los Angeles needs to get with the program and open up a gourmet Mexican place such as son pistos
author: Kris I.

description: Loved this place! Great ambiance, great Mexican food and amazing drinks. It's better to make reservations before you go.
author: Pritam K.

description:
Wait a second! I can have a yummy dinner meal in San Francisco for less than $30? Where do I sign up?

Look no further . . . legit Mexican food . . . great prices . . . attentive service. Don Pistos. 

The introductory chips and salsa (free of charge) were great. They are not afraid to salt their chips, which make them addictive and yummy. 

The menu . . . very simple! They have an assortment of tacos and tortas. I had the carnitas torta which was nothing short of grubbing status, especially for the price. The food is authentic and unpretentious. The service was almost too attentive but I will take that over being ignored. 

The space is lovely inside: brick walls, appropriately moody lighting, and standard artwork on the walls.

I would bring a date here and not feel one bit guilty about the prices. 
Great food at low prices!
author: Franklin H.

description:
I don't know how I haven't gotten back to update. At this point I've tried just about everything on the menu. It's not unusual for me to get take out here at least once a week and basically anytime someone comes to my hood this is where I take them. Don't expect to come to North Beach and eat Italian with me. 

Great green salsa, guac and chips. The hamburguesa is a the best burger in the hood (sorry Moes I still love you too) but I almost always end up getting the shrimp tacos. There's nothing better than the tortilla soup on SF's rainy cold nights. Solid chicken tostados too. Occasionally I start to think that it's time to spread my wings and learn a new hood. But anytime I start to entertain thoughts of moving I get the ceviche and don't even want to think about living more than a block away. Delicious acai sangria and Coke from Mexico - Thank you. 

As far as crowds go, I've never had to wait more than 15 minutes for a table but I've also seen it in party mode. In fact, I took an out of town guest there telling them that the place was a good option to "going out" because it would be full and party like on a Friday night. Well it wasn't exactly a party - we got the best seat in the house (the 2fer on the window) and shut the place down talking. It can be fun and young some nights but I wouldn't call the crowd obnoxious and it's not like you can't find more low key nights there if that's what you're looking for.
author: newintown k.

description: This place is excellent. Best restaurant in NB. I highly recommend the pork chop and the bacon burger as well. Avoid the tacos and lobster as they are a bit overrated. Grab a beer and guacamole to start. I recommend sharing everything. Excellent date spot. Put your name on the list ahead of time though.
author: Dave C.

description:
AMAZING!!!  A must North Beach restaurant visit when in SF.  My wife and I were traveling to SF recently and I'm so thankful to our concierge who recommended this place in North Beach (Little Italy).  We arrived late after walking from HH at the warf on a Thursday night and the place was packed.  Immediately the wave of intense flavor/smell hit me and I knew it was worth the wait.  Yes the kitchen is located directly in the center of the restaurant but its cool to see the chef Giermo do his thing.

We ordered margarittas and because they do not have a liquor liceanse they were made from agave wine. Not bad, a little sweet.  You can always tell a good mexican restaurant by their chips and salsa.  Don Pistos has amazing chips and salsa (three kinds, two of which were very fresh and good).

Okay, the good stuff.  So, you have to try the hamburguesa...I mean its marinated in bacon and onions, guacamole...who dosent think anything marinated in bacon dosent taste good?  Honestly the best tasting most flavorful hamburger I've ever tasted.  Dont you dare ask for ketchup.  I have been dreaming of one since we left.  We also split a Poc Chuc  (grilled pork rib chop, orange chili marinade, spicy cucumber salad) and it was also amazingly tasty and very large.

All in all we had a great experience and found it very reasonable for cost considering the quality of the food we ate.  

Go check it out, you wont be disappointed!
author: Jon B.

description: Five stars for hamburguesa... it is a damn good burger.  I had their tacos; not impressive at all but I don't care, five stars for the burger.  It was that good.
author: Erika C.

description: Pretty tasty tacos for brunch...but the hour wait and the noise bumps it down to a 3.
author: Kate F.

description: This was by far the best Carne Asada taco I have had in my life.  There was so much juicy, well seasoned beef in every bite, and it came with a roasted jalapeno on the side so you could add as much spice as you like.  For some reason, the beers were only $2 (we were there at 6:45 on Sunday; Happy Hour maybe?) and the chips and salsa were delicious as well.  We also got the tacos al pastor.  They were good, but I wish I would have tried those first because after the carne asada, I was dissappointed.
author: Scott G.

description: My favorite Mexican restaurant in all of San Francisco, is in North Beach. Located in a beautiful brick builiding, Don Pisto's has friendly servers, and great quality food and drinks. Their chips and salsa verde is the best, and they refill it generously. I have been to Don Pisto's about 6 times and it is always a treat. The Machaca, which is a tender beef stew with a sunny side up egg on top is to die for! The tacos are better than any in the Mission, because the flavors are inventive and the meats are of the highest quality. Also super tasty are the chicken tostadas, tortilla soup, their hamburguesa (burger), the guacamole and the margaritas. I have recommended this restaurant to several people and everyone who has tried it raves about it along with me! I wish I could eat their food every day, I would do so happily!
author: Fabiola M.

description: We've had very mixed experiences here. Sometimes outstanding, and other times fairly bland, under seasoned food. Sangria is sometimes awesome and other times watery and 95% ice.
author: G L.

description: A bit pricy for Mexican food but none the less food is great.  Went there for both Brunch and Dinner.  I had the juevos rancheros.  They make it like breakfast tostadas.  Hard crunchy tortilla topped with beans,  salsa, ranchero sauce, and a fried egg.  I just picked it up and ate it.  Best part of brunch is thier bottomless Mimosas, Margaritas, and Sangria.  you can interchange between each one if you like.  $17 a pop but well worth it if you drink 5 or more like me.
author: JEFF P.

description:
We had dinner here about three weeks ago with some friends and it was surprisingly really great! We walk in and it's superloud, the crowd was very Marina, and then we look at the menu, and it's a little more expensive than I was expecting for a taco place. But, my friends, this is no taco place. 
For appetizers, we ordered mussels and chorizo. With my first bite, my mind was immediately changed. I'd pay whatever you wanted me to for those mussels and chorizo! 
For dinner, my husband ordered the carne guisada and I ordered the shrimp tacos. Again, delicious!
The carne guisada was some of the best meat I'd ever tasted. I mean, it just melted in your mouth! The shrimp was also great. And the portions were surprisingly pretty filling.
I'm so glad our friends recommended this place, and I really can't wait to try it again.
