Only complaint, is that the place is extremely loud, something about the brick walls. So it's not good for low talkers or first dates.  Otherwise, it's A-OK in my books!
author: Lizette R.

description: Being a San Diego native, I am particular about authentic Mexican food. I've heard several complaints about there not being enough good places in SF to get good Mexi ... until NOW! Holy ay caramba - Don Pistos is amazing. Everything from the not-too-sweet margaritas, delicious guacamole, perfectly spiced salsa verde, down to the friendly and attentive service. I plan on re-visiting this place often, superb spot.
author: Vijay U.

description: Great food and reasonable prices. $2 drinks on Sundays. Yeah!  This was a great find!
author: Jim G.

description: Food is top notch here. The hamberguesa is a must order - they cook it in bacon fat. Bacon fat. That should be enough to get you to come here. Tacos are delicious, I love the al pastor and carnitas. I have also had the oysters which are great. The place is a bit pricey, but its because you are getting high quality food. Service is also very friendly.
author: Steve S.

description:
Had an amazing dinner in a great environment !  Tried 4 dishes...oysters, grilled calamari, pork-chop, and a special shredded beef and egg dish in an amazing sauce...and loved them all.  

Pete (the owner) stopped by to introduce himself...and was real friendly.
author: Nik T.

description: This place never disappoints.  This is a regular for us but I decided to make a reservation for a group when we had relatives and friends in town visiting.  We were running a little late but the host was ready and waiting for us with a nice, intimate corner table.  We know we love DP but we were a little wary of a larger party but it turned out a great choice.  Our aunt is from SD and knows mexican food; she was impressed.  She loved the guac, couldn't get enough of it.  Her friend visiting from Australia went with my recommendation of the soft tacos and was thoroughly satisfied.  Others in the party happily finished their dishes and everyone seemed happy with their dinner experience.
author: Liz K.

description: I went here when I was in San Fran for a birthday party. Some of the best tacos I have ever had. The guacamole was great too.
author: Brandon G.

description:
Good food. Appropriate portions. Good prices.

Long waits on weekends; reservations recommended. They will, however, take down your cell and give you a call while you wander around while you're waiting.

The brunch is a great deal, however there's a lot of spillover from the Marina crowd.
author: Samantha B.

description: First time here and it won't be my last. Amazing food! Good setting for a date or just some fiends to grab some really tasty food
author: Shawn O.

description:
a burger blog find from a friend directed me to this place, which could easily be missed in north beach.  so while the tourons wait in line for mama's or get hustled by street waiters to eat crappy italian food, go check out don p's.  and go on a sunday.  why?  $2 sangria and beers!  win.

but yeh lets get back to the burger here.  priorities.  the burger is marinated in bacon and onions overnight.  thats right, you heard it here.  it tastes like it too.  its not overseasoned.  its perfectly juicy.  i asked for medium rare, but it was a little on the medium side.  thats ok, don p, no harm.  its served as a torta, actually, so the bread is torta style.  there is a slather of guac on top, and on the side are radishes and a pretty hot chili.  put the chili on the burger.  also, pick up some salsa verde and soak that into the bun too.  a different style of burger, but burger perfection nonetheless.  no ketchup or mustard, no cheese, no carmelized onions...no need!

let me talk about the salsa...its goddamn perfect.  verde style with perfect chips.  i ate about 5 pounds and still put away my burger.  i cant get enough of this stuff.  i was tempted to steal some in a mexican coke bottle.

segue to mexican coke.  they have it!  and it comes with a lime.  what a brilliant idea.  someone give this place 5 stars!  oh wait, i did.
author: Robert S.

description: My boyfriend and I crave this place. Pitcher of sangria is a must and the menu has too many good things - you're safe regardless.
author: Leslie T.

description: Great place for good grub w/ bottomless pineapple mimosas...service was great! Drinks were delicious and constantly full :) Food was presented well and tasty. Salsa was spectacular...loved it!
author: Patty L.

description:
first impression:
we came at 5:27 and the hostess was a moron....she was not clever enough to be polite about it...ugh. 

but we were determined!!!! we read an article about this place so we had to give it a fair chance.
the second we got in we were welcomed with nice waitresses bringing out chip & salsa.

we got the low down on the menu...went for the sangria, margarita & lobster for two.

needless to say i was happy....lobster could have been less chewy..but my overall experience with the food in drinks is a solid 4 stars.

will be coming back!
author: Tiger Lily ..

description: Bottomless sangria and watermelon mimosa+Huevos Rancheros= Best sunday ever.
author: Kevin T.

description: California Mexican food? Not the tex mex we have in TX, but the food here is fresh and full of flavor. The carnitas (shredded pork taco) is excellent!
author: Eric K.

description:
best mexican I have ever had. 
chips and salsa : fresh cut/fried chips great spicy salsa
carnita tacos: comes with two great flavor
tortilla soup: hot, spicy ... the longer it sits there the better the flavor get
chili verde tostada: this is amazing crispy tostada, tender chicken great chili verde
hamburgesa?: its like a hamburger but better! soft buttery roll, flavorful tender meat and gauc.. don't knock it till you try it ! its sooo good.
sangeria; great flavor, really refreshing
spent $25 for my portion since its tapas and we ordered pitchers of sangeria.. a steal for how good this place is
author: kimberly l.

description: We live in North Beach, love our neighborhood, and always want to support local merchants. We were excited to try Don Pisto's earlier this evening. However, we were treated quite rudely simply by arriving five minutes too early prior to opening and asking if we could wait inside with our infant daughter as it was getting cold outside. We explained that we did not expect service until opening, just wanted to wait inside. The host acted like we were the most uncouth people who have ever walked into his restaurant and made it clear he was doing us a big favor by letting us stay. Needless to say we promptly left. Nobody should be treated like that. Sadly, we will not be supporting Don Pisto's and will encourage our neighbors to do the same.
author: Heather S.

description: This shit is dank!! Lemme tell yall best taco spot i been to over my trip in sf. It was a party in my mouth fsho. The con is that its a bit pricey for some tacos. But definitely the salsa and chips were on point too which is why I gave it 5 stars. Tacos were just off the chain in another world. Bomb!
author: El D.

description: Yummy McYummerson. This place has HUGE coronona bottles, which I've never seen before. AND delcious tacos. AND amazing, home-made tasting tortilla soup. AND a burger made in bacon fat, which is as decadent and mouth-watering as it sounds. AND pretty bomb margaritas. AND they accommodated our huge party (complete with several small children) and also took several pictures. Great service, atomsphere and food. And it's not too expensive. AND i just want to use the word AND a lot. AND!
author: Hanan H.

description: This place was good. Only thing missing is the liquor license - wine margaritas are a little strange.
author: Lorenz S.

description: Now many people have found out about Don Pisto's but the reality is that the place is worth it.  It is open late on most nights, has amazing sangria and fish tacos the owners are down-to-earth and great people.  My friend Leslie and I go there and remember the Xmas trip to Mexico we took where we walked the beach for hours to get fresh guacamole and ceviche for lunch.  This place is THAT GOOD.
author: Down Dog Y.

description: Came here while doing a little exploring of the city on my own on foot. It turned out to be a long trek but well worth it. I sat at the bar, where the full menu is offered, had a glass of wine and some food. The calamari app is a revelation (took that from "I Love You, Man") and is a must have. The bartender was very friendly and funny. It's a very small bar and he does a great job of getting everyone sitting there involved with one another. The two girls next to me did some app trading and socializing thanks to him breaking the ice. Everyone at the bar was even given a delicious house made shot on the house at one point. The Mexican Sashimi was the other app I tried; also amazing. My entree was the pollo asado which came with mini tortillas, guac, and a very flavorful salsa verde (ask for their hotter salsa to spice it up, also very tasty. The pollo had a glaze over it and fell apart very easily into pieces, which made my taco building that much easier. Very small menu, but smart because everything is made to perfection. Do yourself a favor and stop in while you're in the area.
author: Jared G.

description: Great service, great sangria, good location and the food is amazing, you need to try the Hamburguesa
author: Humberto S.

description: Tasty sangria and excellent chicken tostada's. The wait time was a drag, but expected with the limited seating.
author: E.J. H.

description: Simply delicious! The vibe, the food, the crowds... This place is a well hidden North Beach gem. I had the lamb ribs last time I was there and I literally could not stop thinking about them for days. Also try the chorizo mussels and the sangria aint too bad either.
author: Danny R.

description: We had brunch there, and the food was great. The only negative, yet important, point is that it's *very* load, you have to scream to make yourself heard, I guess it makes it hip.
author: Laurent T.

description: I really love this joint. The pork chop I ordered was extremely JUICY and MOIST!!! What can I say I'm a sucker when food is cooked to perfection. The corn was phenomenon as with their tacos. You can't go wrong with anything off the menu. I would recommend getting here early because they tend to get really busy later in the evening.
author: Q H.

description:
Came here for a Saturday brunch....haven't had good mexican food in awhile, this place is awesome!  Even the complimentary salsa and chips were good! We all ordered different entrees and loved them all. The bottomless mimosas were such a good deal, too!

They easily accommodated 15 of us for my birthday, and we had an amazing server.

Pete, the owner, made us feel at home....there was even fun music on in the background! I will definitely be back!
author: Julianne C.

description: This place has excellent everything.  We tried every single taco and the lobsta.....wow!  Also don't miss the grilled corn with queso -- a meal in itself.  Even the seemlingly simple side tortillas are devine.  Can't wait to come back sometime, but that will be a while since I'm still full from dinner last night!
author: e w.

description: This is my favorite place to eat in North Beach, potentially in the city! Simple food formula with impeccable flavors! The tacos literally melt in your mouth! Don't come here expecting a salad though... the salsa verde is as green as it gets!
author: Courtney H.

description:
I want to give this place a one star review to skew the average and keep people away. I want to tell them awful things about this place so they'll stay away and I can have it all to myself. But I can't bring myself to sabotage the review because the owner was super nice even though our large party was late for its reservation. I can't complain because beer was $2 and every single thing we had on the menu (which was, between us all, just about everything) was incredible. Super fresh fish in the ceviche, incredible spices in the tacos, excellent quality mussels, chips and guac to die for. I want to go back again and again. 

Don't put up a sign Don Pisto. Keep it under the radar. Keep the crowds away so I can come whenever I want.
author: Laura w.

description: This is my favorite spot in North Beach. The Pork Chop is the best I've ever had and I can't get enough of the Diablo Prawns. They have an awesome brunch too. Bottomless mimosas and the Chorizo and poached eggs is my go to. The downstairs is great for large parties and the service is amazing!
author: Patrick T.

description: Everything about this place is great, especially the food. Reasonably priced for amazing flavorful Mexican food in manageable portions. The only reason this isn't a 5 star rating is because of the hour minimum wait on any given night of the week, coupled with the fact they only take reservations for parties of six or more. Go for brunch and get the omelet or for dinner and get fish tacos.
author: Samantha S.

description: Man, this place is DAMN GOOD! Been there twice and can't wait to get back. The joint has a cool urban look to it, no sign or anything... nice vibe. the owner Pete is a good dude... yada yada... but the food is really tasty. First time I had shrimp ceviche and carne asada tacos... outrageous... ceviche - bursting with flavor..  tacos - just fabulous... Last night - HAMBURGUESA... I was confounded on how good it tasted... apparently it sits in some marinade consisting of grrovy things like bacon and onions and then it is grinded... can't describe how tasty it was.. seriously - you goota give this a whack... probably the best burger ever. AND the chips and salsa are out of this world...
author: Tom M.

description: Thank god for Yelp and for a fine establishment such as Don Pisto's.  Based on the amazing reviews for this place, I decided to check this out one Thursday night when I was in SF.  Dining solo that night, I figured it wouldn't be too hard to just sneak into the bar, grab some food and head out.  Well, I came in and found this place was packed!  The bar is relatively small and was quite occupied to say the least.  Nevertheless, I remained persistent and waited...and waited, and waited...for over 45 minutes before a seat cleared.  Now this was completely volitional and I was not expecting any special treatment because of my decisions.  Nevertheless, the staff was so incredibly friendly!  The manager thanked me for waiting!  The bartender (Katie), came out and bought me 2 Dos XX on the house, while I waited!  When I finally sat down, she promptly handed me a menu when I noticed a lack of vegetarian options.  No sweat, she came up with a veggie taco option for me and within 15 minutes I had incredibly tasty veggie tacos, a load of guacamole and some salsa to snack on.  This entire meal was billed at $7.47, which was absolutely fantastic.  The bartender introduced herself to me, was super personable and made me feel welcome.  Some of the best service I have ever experienced at a restaurant.  When I move to SF in a few months, I will be back to this place.  Highly recommended.
author: Kavi D.

description: We were poking around North Beach looking for a place to have lunch on a Saturday when we came across Don Pisto. My son Yelped it on the spot and reported it had many 5-star ratings. But I figured we were in North Beach so we should eat Italian. I was the lone hold-out in our party so I entered Don Pisto under duress! But I must say that the food was exceptional. It was busy so the service was a bit slow. One other thing: the place is NOISY. Loud music blasting from the speakers. We actually moved tables to avoid the noise but couldn't escape it in this small place.
author: Paula H.

description: This place was delicious! Everything our family had was absolutely spectacular. The food was super fresh and better yet tasted fresh! I hate when places claim their food is "fresh" but it taste like cardboard. Anyway, this place not only had great food but I loved the atmosphere of the restaurant. The main room was full but there was another room that was just as accommodating. I had such a great time and I will definitely be back. I can't express how amazing there food was. Oh and did I mention that they marinate their chicken for 48 hours?? No wonder why their food tastes amazing!!!!!
author: Christina V.

description:
For the vegetarians out there: Though the dinner menu does not list a single vegetarian dish (besides a side of rice or guacamole) they do offer a veggie taco if you ask (with rice, beans, cheese, lettuce, and guacamole). I think she also mentioned one other similar veggie option too. The taco was quite tasty, and the green salsa and chips were good too. While I could get an equally good taco for much less at my local taco truck in Oakland, this is a great option for those who want a nicer sit down meal with authentic Mexican flavors. The atmosphere is great and has a rustic feel with brick walls and wood tables, so it made the overall experience a very nice one. 
As for service, our waitress was a little overly eager to take our plates and move the meal along. It seemed she was trying to get rid of us even though the restaurant was pretty empty. I almost thought she was going to take my plate when I was obviously mid-bite. She didn't even fill our water glasses all the way full at th end. Not sure what that was about, but she was pretty pleasant otherwise.
author: Andrea F.

description: So loved it.  We came in just before they closed between brunch and dinner on a weekend.  They were out of fish tacos ( which was the only reason I found them). But the guac and other menu items were great!  I will time my visit next time to make sure there are fish tacos left.
author: Dianne D.

description: We came here for a friend's surprise birthday party and they had an awesome set up in a private room for about 20 of us.  It was a fixed menu of some delicious food.  We started with chips, salsa, and guacamole.  The chips were deliciously addictive and the guac was great.  The ceviche was incredibly fresh and the tortilla soup was extra spicy - just the way we like it.  We also had fish and carne asada tacos - soo good.  The fish tacos were my favorite!  The sangria was so dangerously amazing - it was very different from the sangrias that I am used to and it blew my mind.  We had a great night and our friend had a great party.  The surprise was truly on us because we never knew this amazing place existed!!
author: Arica V.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACEEEEE!!!!!

If you come to this spot (which you must) you gotta get the al pastor tacos. They are the bomb. Service is amazing and super friendly. Prices are soooo reasonable. Im obsessed with the berry sangria.

Great place for a birthday party!!! Ole!
author: J T.

description:
Never heard of Don Pistos before, but was eager to try it out when a good friend decided to have a little pre-fiesta birthday dinner with friends at Don Pistos. It's a small little Mexican place tucked away in North Beach. Even though they don't take reservations, the owner was very nice to set aside a big table for our group. Unfortunately they had a problem with the furnace downstairs that night so we couldn't sit there as planned, but they'd nicely called ahead and told us the news and still had a large table at the noisier upstairs for us.

They have a very limited menu that sells upscale Mexican street food which roughly translates as "tiny portions of fancier Mexican for not so tiny prices." Still, it was a nice change of pace from the usual burritos y tacos.  I tried to order a diet coke (no luck, only Mexican coke here), so Corona o sangria is a better beverage bet. There's very little on the menu if you're vegetarian, though I guess you can enjoy the bowls of chips and guacomole.

I ordered from the seafood part of the menu and I have to say I was worried when I saw my tablemate's ceviche arrive. It was beautiful and yummy looking. It was also small. Seriously, I was going to need to order at least three, plus some sides, for that amount of food to cut it for me. Just then the waiter arrived with a huge steaming claypot that he started to put in front of me. I said, "nope, not mine." The waiter said, "are you sure?" I replied that I was certain. Then he pointed out that I had indeed ordered a seafood dish that came in a clay pot. I'd neglected to RTFM to note the word "stew" in the title of my entree. The waiter looked worried and was super nice to me and offered to bring me something else. But my ignorance was bliss! Here I got a huge tasty stew of mixed seafood in a spicy tomato broth flecked with corn and onions. Totally different than what I expected and totally a better choice than the thimble-sized tacos. My husband who helped me finish the stew agreed that my menu selection was right on, however clueless I was when it arrived. I shot a big thumbs-up to the waiter when he came around again. All of the folks working that night were hustling around as the place was hopping, but service never felt rushed or abrupt; just helpful. A pre-fiesta fiesta mas fina!
author: Megan K.

description:
Honestly it's between three and four but I push it to four because of the excellent, hearty shared tortilla soup.  We each got tacos as well - steak and shrimp and they were solid.  But I've had some spectacular tacos in Mexico and even in LA and these don't measure up.  

Great service, good atmosphere and pricing.  It's a fine spot for a Saturday night with friends.
author: Amer S.

description: Don Pisto's is AWESOME! The ambiance is fantastic and the quality of the food is superb. The service has been wonderful each time I have gone, they make sure you feel at home while you're dining. My softball team is sponsored by Chubby Noodle (Pete/The Owner's sister restaurant in Amante) and we like to frequent Don Pisto's. Make sure to try the Hamburgesa and Pork Chop, both out of this world in terms of flavor. Do yourself a favor and stop by and enjoy an amazing dinner, you will not be dissapointed!
author: Chase S.

description: Don Pistos has become a weekly craving for me. Even though they are getting more and more busy, I never have to wait that long for a table and am happy to chill at the bar for a drink while I wait. At this point I have ordered almost everything on the menu and I have loved every bite. The carne asada tacos are my favorite and the fish tacos are always perfection. The tortilla soup is the best cure for a hangover or cold, and the fresh tomatillo salsa compliments everything on the menu. I obviously highly recommend this place if you are looking for fresh and delicious Mexican food in the North Beach area.
author: Noel M.

description: I've probably been here over a dozen times and the food is always fantastic! The hamburguesa or the chorizo and mussels are my favorite items on the menu. Make sure to try the sangria too - you'll be glad you did.
author: Danielle B.

description: $15 bottomless mimosa's, sangria, magaritas = fun times + their tacos are amazing! Some of the best I have had and I live in SoCal!!! Can not recommend this place more highly. Really nice decor and great for groups. Awesome staff.
author: Julia B.

description: Great place. Always busy so you know it's good. The lobster and oysters are the best!
author: Chris J.

description: I have to go back up to 5 stars.  I eat here too often to be coy.  This has become my go-to spot for takeout in the neighborhood.  Great food and open late.  I usually go with the al pastor or carne asada torta.  Amazingly flavorful and reasonably priced.  They include chips and an addicting green salsa (sidenote -- if you have left over salsa, the next morning you can throw it and some jack cheese in with some eggs and make a ridiculously good breakfast).  Very, very happy to have Don Pisto's in the neighborhood.
author: Zac A.

description: Superb!!! Excellent all around.  Fun Place, great food!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Had tacos and margarita  yummmmm best tacos i have ever had!!!
author: Daniel S.

description: Best Mexican in sf. Love the atmosphere. Like being in a cool spot on vacation.  I can't wait to go back!  San Francisco needs this place!
author: James H.

description: Wow!! Excellent Mexican restaurant!! I'm Mexican and I have to say that the flavor from these dishes are as authentic as it gets. We had the Mexican Sashimi one word "delicious", the Al Pastor tacos and the Poc Chuc (pork rip chop) very tasty. We were served by Michelle she was very friendly and knows exactly what to suggest.
author: Libier V.

description: My wife and I have been here several times.  It is the best value restaurant in San Francisco hands down.  The taco's are all phenomenal -- the best thing however is the pork chop (it is huge so plan to share). The atmosphere is also very cool,  old brick style building.  The service is what makes us want to go back so often.  Everyone is so nice, and so accommodating.  If I had to say one negative thing about this place it is that they don't take reservations, and it has become very popular, so you either have to go early or plan to wait.  We normally go early, however if you can't it actually is worth the wait.
author: Todd D.

description: You know a place has good food when it is unbelievably packed on a Wednesday night. We chose to go here after seeing how many reviews it got and the number of stars it received. We walked in and the place was extremely packed and bursting with life. We had to wait 30 minutes for a table for 2, so I suggest if you want to check it out, you make a reservation. We waited at the front bar and decided to try a Michelada. It's basically beer with tapatio and lime juice and a salt rim. It was super refreshing and delicious, plus it gets your palate ready for the meal. We sat down and had a super friendly waitress who was more than willing to make suggestions. We ordered the calamari, diabla shrimp, tortilla soup, and fish tacos. The calamari was spectacular. It is charcoal grilled on skewers with onions and marinaded in an orange citrus sauce and served with radish salad (which kind of tastes like a ceviche). It was delicious! I definitely suggest trying it out, because it's not like the usual fried calamari and you don't feel like a cheater when eating it :) The diabla shrimp was nice and spicy. There are 5 shrimp and they're cooked in a diabla sauce. The sauce is really tasty and I suggest trying this as well. The tortilla soup was pretty watery and bland, although after we added some salt and hot sauce it was pretty good, I don't like going to restaurants and having to change the taste of the meal. Finally the fish tacos, each taco plate comes with two tacos. The fish tacos were grilled fish topped with avocado salsa and some cabbage slaw. The fish was really good, but my only complaint was there was too much cabbage and too little flavor. I would definitely come back here to try out the other things on the menu. The atmosphere is really fun, portions are big, and the servers are friendly. The only problem is that parking is a b*tch :)
author: Neha H.

description: I love this little gem.  I love that it has such an understated facade and that the tourists don't go here.  There aren't enough places for just locals in North Beach.  But what I love best is that this is the first REAL Mexican restaurant we've had in this neighborhood.  Ever.  And the food is fresh and delicious--it is not the Mexican equivalent of the Italian restaurants in North Beach, thank goodness.  And do try the hamburger.  (Yes, I had to visit at least a half dozen times before I was willing to order a hamburger at a Mexican restaurant, but once I did, I understood what people were saying).  Good job to the owner!  I hope the business flourishes.
author: Barbara C.

description: When my friend told me we were going to North Beach for dinner and then said we were going to mexican food I was a little confused but low and behold, Don Pistos is a gem!  We started with sangria which was really good, not too sweet and very refreshing.  We had the ceviche as appetizers, both the tuna and the shrimp.  The shrimp ceviche was what you would expect at any Mexican restaurant but the tuna ceviche was AMAZING!  I had the fresh fish tacos for dinner which were very yummy.  Some of the guys we were with had the carnitas and hamburguesas tortas and said they were good good.  Unfortunately, they had run out of their homemade churros for desert which I heard are good but I will be back at Don Pistos again and try them later.  Overall, a very good spot off the main North Beach strip :)
author: Carly P.

description: Best mexican in SF. My boyfriend and I went this past Sunday. We ordered the tacos and sangria. Everything was amazing! The owner, Pete, is a really nice guy too. We will be back for sure to try their dinner menu, I suggest you do the same!
author: Johanna W.

description:
RESTAURANT REVIEW
NEW STREET FOOD EATERY HAS FINGER ON THE PULSE OF THE ECONOMY
By Carol Peterson
DON PISTO'S, 510 Union St., San Francisco 94133
415.395.0939 ***  1/2
 After spending many years in and out of Baja California, Pete Mrabe knew what he particularly liked about the food he enjoyed on the on the streets of Baja. It was fresh and made with simple ingredients. Pete, who had worked in the restaurant business for a number of years and had always had plans to open his own place, now knew what he wanted to do: Bring the street food of Mexico to North Beach. His primary thought was to have a takeout place, a sort of fast food takeout location, but when he found the empty El Ragon space on Union Street he reconsidered. The rustic brick interior, welcoming bar, and open kitchen provided the perfect mix for the restaurant Pete calls Don Pisto's.

Soon after the restaurant opened, I stopped in to take a look at the menu and was rather surprised by the relatively few items offered. There are only five groupings to choose from: Tacos, Tortas, Ceviche, Pisto's (specialties of the house) and Sides-- only 16 food choices in all at about $8 to $11 per item. There are also 9 beers, 7 wines, Sangria, and non alcoholic drinks, all quite reasonably priced. I realized that Pete had a brilliant idea here. The short menu keeps the inventory down and the food fresh. Pete told me, "I wanted to duplicate the street food that I loved in Baja. The vendors buy only the simple ingredients they will use for that day; when they are gone, they close shop and go home. This is the formula I am using in the restaurant." At Don Pisto's, Pete is the chef and when he opens in the evening, his 3 assistants put together the dishes that he has spent most of the morning creating.

Like other conscientious local restaurant folk, Pete goes to high end farms for his purchases. But what makes him different from an expensive steak house, for example, is that he buys the undesirable cuts of meat no one else wants, then cooks them for 3-4 hours, which renders them tender and tasty. And everything about Don Pisto spells "fresh." The tortilla chips are made every twenty minutes and served with an addictive cilantro, green chili and garlic sauce. The guacamole is also made every twenty minutes to guarantee its freshness.

The second time I ate at Don Pisto's, the menu had changed almost completely. This time I fell in love with the astounding Carne Asada Taco, which is mesquite grilled steak, onions, cilantro and arbol salsa, which is tomatillo, smoked chili puree, garlic and salt. The Al Pastor Taco is also a winner. It's a grilled rib chop with charred pineapple. The pineapple gives this taco a unique flavor that just keeps coming. One other taco I tried was the Camarones. As a lover of shrimp, I found this combination of sautéed shrimp, garlic, red onion, and avocado salsa the perfect combination.
When I saw the Hamburguesa brought to table after table, I thought I should taste it. This popular dish is continually on the menu. It looks like a standard hamburger but the crumbled meat has been marinated in bacon and onions, and it's garnished with a spread of guacamole on the top. The bun--as would be expected at Don Pisto's--is fresh and hot. You will never again look at a hamburger in the same way after eating this delicious variation. 

If you are a lover of Ceviche, you must try any Pete has on the menu. The Ahi Tuna Con Mango is outstanding, with a crunchy tortilla supporting tender tuna slices with Serrano chilies, mango, red onion and lime juice. 

You may have noted I have mentioned more than my usual number of food choices in this review. As the Semaphore has no budget to support food critics, I am on my own when the check comes. And the amazing thing about this new restaurant is that you can try many delicious dishes, a sangria or Mexican beer and have a very inexpensive dinner. 

I have saved until last the first question most every new arrival at Don Pisto's, including me, asks Pete, "Why don't you have a sign in front of your restaurant?"  Answering, he laughed and said, "At first, I was just too busy to order one and then people kept telling me it is cool I don't have a sign. I've been thinking of a neon TACO sign in the window but haven't made up my mind." So the contest is on. When you go into Don Pisto's, weigh in on the sign controversy. But don't worry, sign or no sign, you won't be able to miss the restaurant. Just follow the alluring aromas wafting up and down Union Street.
author: Carol P.

description: Very good tortilla soup and pork tacos.  Had to wait a bit on a Sunday night for dinner, but it was well worth the wait.  The food is very reasonably priced and the sangria was really good.
author: Rise G.

description: Hells yes to Don Pistos! Awesome fish tacos, amazing acai sangrai, and great service. Loved the ambiance, a bit dark and sexy, not your average taqueria. Can't wait to go back.
author: Kylie S.

description: I dream of Don Pistos. We come here all the time, for either brunch or dinner and the food is just perfect. Pete is the best, the food is unreal, and the place is adorable. My favorite place in the city.
author: Jeannine R.

description:
This place is as good as it gets!! (and worth the long wait too!) My boyfriend and I have been coming here for their amazing brunch and BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS!! Everything i've ordered is delish, the crowd is great, no tourists like the rest of North Beach. We went there for dinner last night for the first time and will be coming back soon! We shared a pitcher of sangria, chicken tostada and pork chop with cucumber salad. It was the perfect amount of food and SO tasty! 

So glad we found this place! This is the perfect date spot!
author: Therese B.

description: This past Friday was our 3rd time going to Don Pistos.  It just keeps getting better and better!  We love it.  Service is good, and the food is amazing.  We tried the tortilla soup this time, which we had never had, and it was SO yummy.  The Hamberguesa is unbelievable.  We also always order the rice and beans and some type of the tacos - all really great.
author: Kristen V.

description: I actually had a sit-down meal here finally, and the table service is just as awesome as the food. Tacos!
author: Darren M.

description: Great classy Mexican food at a good price. Very good date place.
author: Richard D.

description: Fantastic Mexican food! Went here tonight with good friends. Tacos were delicious - particularly the fresh fish and al pastor (short rib). Really great chips and fresh tomatillo salsa. Can't beat the $3 beer and sangria specials. We'll definitely be back!
author: Megan M.

description:
I've been here once for brunch and it was great. They make their bottomless mimosas with pineapple juice! So tasty. They do not put pitchers on the table for you to re-fill yourself, but the waitress was pretty good about coming by. The place isn't too big, so it was easy to get her attention, plus there were 10 of us for her to deal with.

To eat I got the omlette and was very impressed with the portion size and the taste/abundance of ingredients. Friends got the breakfast burrito and chorizo w/ poached eggs, which also looked like a pretty good portion size. The tacos looked like they would be too small to fill anyone up, and the hamburguesa didn't come with any potatoes.. although the table got a few complimentary bowls of chips and salsa! yay. I'd say the only downfall was the portion size for some of the dishes.
author: Caitlin B.

description:
And the Michaelada drink!  

Great for groups, but take note that it can get pretty loud, especially late at night.
author: H g.

description: This place is awesome!! The tacos are tasty, but the burger and mussels here are AMAZING!!!! First off it's kinda weird to find a mexican restaurant in north beach, especially one of the best in the city. And then the mind blowing hamburger at a mexican restaurant...TOO MUCH!!  Go try it, you'll be glad you did.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
Great!  I went in solo since I'm traveling on business.  Sat at the bar next to a very cool local married couple who knows the owner and also Nick the bartender.  Excellent, excellent meal, but I also enjoyed my time at Don Pisto's.

I asked Nick to help me order  "surprise me please".  That he did - it was AWESOME.  Nick first brought out the muscles served in this great zippy limey spicy sauce with chorizo.  Yum.  Second was an incredible pork tenderloin-esk / chop that was out of this world tender and juicy. 

I am definitely going back again on future trips - next time I may even actually order Mexican food!
author: Tim T.

description: Kobe beef stew & sangria were great!
author: Bentley T.

description: Zero vegetarian food available here. When I asked they said they had fish tacos and ceviche, hmmm...
author: Nigel H.

description: Fabulous brunch in the kind of neighborhood place I would frequent if I still lived here. Great service, food and perfect mood--and just far enough to avoid the tourists.
author: Roz D.

description:
When I think of North Beach, I don't usually think of Mexican food but after having gone to Don Pistos last night, I may just think of Mexican food....specifically Don Pistos.

I had recently read about a new Mexican establishment in North Beach and so when Andrei Z and I found ourselves at Church Key and hungry after a few beers, we decided to check it out.

Surprisingly it wasn't very busy.  That being said, it was around 10:30 and this place stays open until 12:30 (which automatically gives it extra points since so few good places stay open that late for food).  We walked in and were seated (yes, this is a sit down restaurant) by a very friendly server (and all the staff were extremely friendly) and had a look at the menu.  It's pretty limited in choices but sometimes that's better and when everything is good, it doesn't really matter!  I was tempted to order the ceviche since it's a favorite dish of mine and I had read a few reviews saying how good it was, but I wanted something a bit more hearty so I got the chicken tacos while Andrei Z ordered the pork tacos.  While we waited we were served chips and salsa. I have to say, this salsa here was pretty amazing.  It's a green salsa and pretty spicy but so full of flavor.  I wanted to bottle it up and take it home with me!  The tacos were brought out & they hit the spot.  Chunks of stewed chicken with tomatoes, onions and cilantro on two corn tortillas and with strips of jalapenos on the side....so good!  I must have drank about 30-40 ounces of water because of the spicy but it really was amazing.

Other things I was tempted by:
Tortilla Soup
Churros

I'll definitely be going back to Don Pistos to check these (and other menu items) out.
author: Melanie N.

description: Everything we ordered was amazing! I wish they had a location closer to home. Don Pistos is a must if you are in the city. The staff and service are wonderful and you leave feeling like you were served by family.
author: G R.

description:
Still love this place.  Went there on a Sunday with a few friends, waited 45 minutes at ChurchKey and next thing you know we're served great (but spicy) food again at Don Pisto's.  It was super busy on a Sunday night but it was fleet week so not too surprising.  Hamburguesa, carne asada tacos and tortilla soup were ordered at our table and each placed was enjoyed.  Also, $2 beers (not sure if this was one time or all the time).  

Very happy with Don Pisto's and will be eager to go back with in NB. 

** Also, had a friend who went here a different time for brunch/bottomless mimosas and said it was amazing.
author: Erin C.

description: I wanted to like this place, but its a tough sell. First, came on a Saturday night about eight; an hour wait. Well considering its Saturday no big deal. Come back an hour later and me and my buddy are seated at what turns out to be a communal table. Not horrible given that the restaurant was so loud that it was impossible to hear what the people next to us were talking about. On to the food, Diablo shrimp arrived, and while extremely well grilled the "Diablo sauce" totally missed the mark, unremarkable and just not good. Next came carne asada tacos, not bad, but certainly not special, have had much better at no name places in the Mission. Next came the hamburguesa. Now this was really good. Worth the wait, excellent entree that was well executed. Finally, the pollo asado arrived, good but not spectacular. So of four dishes only one was really special. Added to that the restaurant is tiny and loud, I mean really loud. Basically you are dealing with a 20 to 30 something crowd that does not seem to mind the noise and sitting on top of one another. If you are looking for a quite evening out this is not the place. Not sure I would come back, especially on a weekend night.   Why this place has so many rave reviews is a mystery (I mean any Mexican restaurant with no Mexican customers should tell you something) in the  immortal words of Public Enemy's Chuck D. "DON"T BELIEVE THE HYPE!"
author: Eric R.

description: Absolutely amazing food. No need for a sign out front because its so popular already! Im a little bit of a sangria snob from living in spain and still thought the sangria was really good, even though it only had one slice of lemon in it instead of a ton of fruit. Split  the huevos rancheros and carne asada tacos with a friend, which was perfect because there were two tacos and two pieces of huevos rancheros on each plate! Highly highly recommended!
author: Tracy H.

description: My husband & I cannot get enough of the carnitas. It's the best in the city! Actually everything at Don Pisto's is great. Brunch, lunch or dinner, you can't go wrong!
author: Michele S.

description: al pastor tacos, sangria, and mussels with chorizo!  so good.
author: Michelle P.

description: Living in North Beach, this has to be the best urban neo-fused Mexican I have found in San Francisco. A but noisy and crowded, but well worth it! Take out is easy too!
author: James M.

description: Don Pistos is a neighborhood staple for me. Great dinner, yummy brunch. Love their street tacos, especially the Al Pastor Tacos (grilled rib chop and pineapple) and bottomless watermelon mimosa's for $12 on Sunday! Lot's of light and huge open windows during the day and killer low-lit ambiance at night.
author: Karie S.

description:
I can't say more than what's already been said about this place.  Unbelievable food.  Surprisingly, not terribly expensive, and you can get out of here for like $20 or $25 per person and feel incredibly satisfied.

The al pastor tacos are absolutely delicious.  Rule of thumb: I'd recommend getting about 3 tacos per person.  Any more would be too much.
author: Wayne S.

description: What a great little spot! I had no idea this place was tucked away in North Beach. Great atmosphere, for one thing. I was here with just one other friend but it was mostly large groups. The guacamole was DELICIOUS and I enjoyed the unique sangria. We split shrimp tacos and fish tacos. Based on yelp reviews, I was very excited for the fish tacos but I thought they didn't have enough flavor/spice for my taste. The shrimp tacos on the other hand - YUMMY!!!! The portions looked small at first, but I was full by the end of the meal... especially since I could not stop myself from eating the delicious guacamole all night!
author: Priya N.

description: I had my first ever Michelada here and now I try and order it everywhere I go but no one makes it like Don Pisto's, best ever! The chips and guac were also excellent. The steak tacos not so great the shrimp was waaaayyyyy better.
author: ank S.

description: Fun atmosphere, good food - loved my fish tacos.  Still need to try their famous burgers.  It's very loud inside and filled with an under 30 crowd...not necessarily a bad thing but I'm just saying....
author: Eric C.

description: Don Pistos, that really popular brick laid restaurant with no name outside indicating that they are, in fact, Don Pistos. Haha. I walk by this place on my way home all the time and it is always busy! I finally came here on a Tuesday night when they were quite busy at 10p.m. My sister and I got seated promptly and ordered mussels, steak tacos, fish tacos and sangria. Everything was delicious! The mussels also came with chorizo and garlic bread. It was so yummy. As a bread fanatic I especially enjoyed the bread. But my favorite of the night was the fish taco. So yummy and flavorful and surprisingly it had a nice crunch to it. I will definitely come back to try the other wonderful lookin stuff they have to offer!
author: Jackie M.

description: Cozy, rustic atmosphere that exudes comfort the moment you step in the door.  Service is outstanding ... attentive but not overbearing or intrusive.  The freshly made chips send tingles through the jawline.  While the salsa is good (not great), I quite fancy the guacamole (a separate item from the menu).  I had the wild snapper tacos, the day's special.  Without any hesitation I can say they were the best fish tacos I've ever had the good pleasure to eat.  I can't wait to return to Don Pistos, where everything is served family style and a solid meal won't break your budget.  The place would be PERFECT if they refrained from playing music over the sound system.  It's the kind of place where the simple ambient sound of people enjoying good food is the best music you could imagine hearing.
author: Greg S.

description:
This place rocks.  

Michelada - yes, get one.  Tasty beverage for your yummy food

Tortilla soup - best I've had in SF

Al Pastor - just like they do it in Rosarito 

Puerto Nuevo Lobster - I grew up an hour from Puerto Nuevo, Pete nails this one

...and make sure you order something with flour tortillas, or just get some on the side, these are NOT your Mission-taqueria-style, they're proper baja-style tortillas (only ones I've found in SF)

SF needed this place, North Beach needed this place, finally someone answered
author: Paul M.

description:
Who doesn't like a good fish taco?  They just opened in the hood under 1 week ago so wanted to check it out.  There's really no other good mexican restaurants in north beach so this fills a needed gap.  

The food was excellent - the fish tacos were tasty and had a great kick to them.  The waitress later convinced me to get the churros for desert and I didn't think that I like churros and wasn't up for desert but the chocolate dipping sauce sealed the deal.  These were probably better than the tacos.

The only thing I didn't like were their specialty drinks.  The bartender convinced me to order a special drinks with beer, tomato juice and some other stuff and it wasn't good and before I tasted it they offered to give it to me on the house if I didn't like it.  Then I had the sangria which didn't stand up to sangria in most spanish restaurants.  Stick with the beer and wine.

Worth checking out and they are open till 12:30 am 7 days a week. which is awesome.
author: Adam K.

description: I hate this food! There hamburgers and cheeseburgers are the worst! And don't get me started on the spaghetti!
author: David J.

description:
What a gem!!!! hidden away in a nondescript building in the most touristyyyy part of town....We got there at 7:30pm on a Saturday and the place was packed, so we waited at the bar for the table. It took about 30 minutes for us to get one, but once seated the food was a treat.
 For appetizers we had the special of the day: Ceviche, it was delicious, it was a mix of shrimp, calamari and octopus. I added a little bit of hot sauce to make it spicy, it tasted awesome. 
For the main event we had a Hamburguesa, Yes! it is awesome, it is like a mind trick it smells like bacon, but tastes like beef....The only suggestion here would be to add some more condiments(besides palta), maybe mayonesa?
We also had Al pastor tacos, this is the one of the best tacos I have had here in SF. Pork was Yumm...
Service was also really good...our waitress was very attentive. When we asked her for the bill, she goes " Oh! did you guys have enough food" , ahhh, Yes we did!  
Overall, an awesome experience. The only reason I am not giving them an extra star is because this was my first time there and  I plan to go back...soon and if the food is as good again  I add the extra star....
author: BOSHIKA T.

description: Killer Mexican food spot in nice digs with a lively scene. Yes, this place is legit, my Mexican and Texan roots wholeheartedly approve.  We are Sunday regulars, taking advantage of $2 beers and $3 sangrias specials and ordering the steak torta, a slight off menu item that rocks. Whats not to love about refried beans and guacamole smoothered on a roasted bun with shredded steak topped with queso fresco. This is my fave sandwich of the moment. The chicken tostadas are also exemplary as was the mussels &chorizo. We enjoy sitting at the bar hanging out with nick, the bartender, cool cat who mix a good sangria and who also has an uncanny resemblance to Adam the man vs. food guy. Highly recommend
author: peter h.

description: Went twice withing a week, so that shows that I do like the place.  First time, we had 4 sets of tacos and the ceviche.  All were good, but it really wasnt ceviche, but more sashimi.  Second time, it was just for a quick bite, so we had 2 taco sets and chips with guac.  Only down side is that everything is spicy.  I am a fan of spice, but there is nothing that they offer or comes with the dish that can balance the spice.
author: Markus S.

description: Don Pistos is flavorful, local, friendly, and valued by it's simplicity. Pete is very welcoming and really has the authenticity down. The food is very consistent and every bit savory. To truly endure all Don Pistos has to offer you must try everything on the menu from the al pastor tacos to the hamachi to the winning burger. The atmosphere parallels the dining which makes it a great place to meet up with friends or loud family, like my own, who want to continue their night down Grant St.
author: Marissa K.

description: Chips are amazing. Tortilla Soup is even better, perfect date place :)
author: Michelle K.

description: You MUST try the hamburguesa torta. It's amazing. Basically a hamburger cooked in bacon topped with guac. Caution, however: it's a gut bomb. You know it, but you can't stop eating. Everything is top notch, but that's my fav.
author: Josh O.

description:
don pistos you are thee shit.

your ceviche was amazing. your tacos are fking fantastic. 

you are loved. my best friends came home from taiwan after two years abroad and requested mexican. we are norcal girls who lived in socal and hopped the border on weekends. you can not get mexican food in other countries...hell...you can't even get the good shit here. don pistos...YOU are the good shit--and we got you. 

we walked out planning our next visit. it will be soon and it will be epic. thanks for your service. keep rocking it. i will sing your praises. cheers!
author: Alex P.

description: The sangria, green salsa and tacos were all AMAZING!! Can't wait to go back! The restaurant has no sign!! So don't pass it up!
author: Kevin A.

description: With good Mexican restaurants in short supply in North Beach, I am pumped up on Don Pistos.  I randomly went in last night and was greeted by the owner and his friendly staff.  They nailed the basics - great service, great food (awesome chips & salsa, fantastic carne asada tacos) and good prices.  Even the presentation of something as simple as tacos was very well done.
author: Raja B.

description: My friend knows the owner of this place and helped wire the famous red lighting that hangs outside the restaurant. He told me last week he wanted to take me to this amazing Mexican restaurant in North Beach. I was thinking North Beach was mostly Italian so I was excited to try this new place! I was so happy we came here. The restaurant has amazing food and the owner is such a nice person. At first, I walked right past the restaurant because there was no outdoor sign for the restaurant name. The only way you can recognize the place is for the four or five bright red bulbs that hang under the outdoor awning. Inside, the place was packed for 9pm! Thankfully there was a small table in the back. The restaurant is not very big so it was crowded inside but warm and inviting as well. Our server was very nice and very fast service. We started off with warm tortilla chips and an amazing green verde salsa. I couldn't stop eating the chips and dip it was that good! For meal, my friend and I decided upon the red snapper fish tacos and homemade tortilla soup. Yummmmm! The food was delicious! It was my first time eating snapper and it did not disappoint. The soup had a little kick to it that cleared my sinuses and it was a huge bowl. (see picture). For drinks, I had to try their margarita. It is made differently than normal margaritas because instead of tequilla they use a triple distilled wine that is more potent then tequilla but tastes just like jose cuervo. It was so good but so deadly! Overall the prices were decent, the service was fast, and the owner is such a nice and friendly guy. On our way out the door, the owner gave us complimentary hot cinnamon doughnut holes to take home. They were delicious!!!! Thanks for the experience I will return again!
author: Lauren S.

description: When you walk into Don Pisto's, you can expect to be astonished.  The fish tacos, the burger (cooked in bacon fat), and the spicy chorizo mussels are my favorites.  That said, I would recommend beginning at the top of the menu and working your way through everything before they change it.
author: John M.

description: Just found out about this place and decided to try it.   Was a great meal.  Definitely try the hamburguesa.  I don't know what's in the meat, but the seasonings are awesome!  Also try the Mexican Street Corn.  It was flavored perfectly.
author: Robert D.

description: amazing tacos al pastor in the heart of north beach...who knew?  a bit crazy during the bottomles margarita brunch, but i went for a late lunch at 3 and it was great.
author: nick g.

description:
Update 2/28/10: They now serve breakfast on Saturdays and Sundays from 10:30a-3:00p. I'd rather eat breakfast here than Mama's (the restaurant!) any day. Food was outstanding: omelet, tacos, brioche french toast, tasty bacon from local North Beach butcher (Little City). I don't know how it was possible, but the guacamole somehow tasted even better than my previous visits! No coffee, but they said they are working on a Mexican coffee to serve. "Try again next weekend," ...and I will.
=========
Yeah! A Mexican restaurant (not burrito joint) in North Beach-- and a fabulous one at that. I love the concept: high quality Mexican street food. "The ingredients are organic," I heard a waiter tell the table next to us. The menu is simple.

The fresh chips and green tomatilla salsa brought to our table when we sat down were outstanding. We ordered guacamole, ceviche of the day (shrimp), carnitas tacos (tender tasty pork, the sauce was on the spicy side), and tortilla soup. All were impressive, and I can't wait to go back and taste the rest of the menu.

The owner sent over an order of the churros and chocolate dipping sauce for dessert. We were stuffed.

Service rates 5 stars. They are dog friendly and family friendly. The waiter offered our dog a bowl of water while our dog waited outside. They offered to make a batch of guacamole without the slight spice for our children (our kids actually like spice, so we didn't need them to go out of their way, but how nice to offer!). Great news for fellow North Beach families.

And when I'm out late without the kids, I will definitely stop in here for an affordable, relatively healthy, late night snack before heading home (not usually out past 12:30am these days)!
author: Melissa M.

description: AMAZING!!!! Everything from the food to the service and ambiance, and did I mention price? So reasonable for the out of this world food! I am a huge fan of the carnitas tacos...OMG! If you haven't been here yet, GO! You will not be disappointed :) Thank you Don Pistos!!!
author: Jackie J.

description: My four stars are for dining here at "off" times, whether that's a weekday lunch, early dinner, or arriving 10 minutes before it opens on a weekend. I would certainly not wait the 1-2 hours that they've quoted me at peak times, especially when people are taking their time with the bottomless mimosas on weekends. That being said, the food is very good. Ingredients are high quality, and portion size is perfect (you will not get a burrito the size of your head here). The salsa verde and homemade tortilla chips are excellent, and I could easily fill up on just those. I recommend the standard tacos over the tacos sonora--the cheesa and crema masked the deliciousness of the meats in these, and were much more filling. Carnitas gets my vote (and everyone I've dined with) for best meat. Guacamole is also outstanding. The margaritas are good, but not great, due to the agave wine substitution for tequila (they don't have a full liquor license). To sum it up, if you come at the right time, you will leave full and happy!
author: Alison S.

description: The food here, while flavorful, has gotten just way too spicy.  Seriously.  I need a gallon of water just to get by two tacos.  Food is freshly made and it tastes it once you get past all the spice.  The other thing is the loud music.  I can't even hear myself think and it makes the dining experience annoying.  Please lower the spice and lower the music.
author: Joe S.

description: We were told that they have good tacos, and that's true.  Not a lot of choices on the menu, but the tacos we all ate were very good.  Nice casual place to get some tacos in North Beach with some cool ambiance.
author: Andy L.

description: We called ahead of time and told them we had a group of six coming. They didn't write us down for a reservation and gave our table away. The hostess was rather unapologetic about it and asked if we'd rather wait an hour and a half for a table or cram into a four top. Undeterred, we took the four top. I'm not sure why they didn't offer to join the unoccupied two top with us, but we took it nonetheless. We ordered our drinks, margaritas and sangria. The margaritas were citrusy and lacking any sweetness and the sangria was devoid of fruit. Luckily, we had an apple and orange in our bags to save the day from mediocre at best drinks. When we got our food, the pork chop was good, but everything else was just adequate. All in all, I'd skip this place and find somewhere with better food, drinks, and a better attitude. The second star was for our waitress whose talents were wasted on this restaurant.
author: Stephanie K.

description: Pete is the man. Good sangria and awesome tacos. Can get a little crowded, but they have a downstairs room past the kitchen. Saw Romo hear last night too. I like the simple ambiance to this place. I never feel overwhelmed, but just nice and cozy.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: I have to admit I was a little hesitant to write a review on this hidden gem, as i don't want it to get flooded and turn into a "Lime" like place. I went here for the first time with a birthday group of fifteen, excellent service and extremely affordable. Service is nice and food is GOOOOOOOOOD. I live and breath chorizo let me tell you... hard to get it good at restaurants especially in North Beach. Part of me wants to say your stupid to not go the other part of me says don't because i don't want this to turn into a two hour waiting list....
author: Amanda C.

description: Great new Mexican restaurant in North Beach. Had the tacos (Carne Asada and Mahi) they were excellent. Very good Acai Sangria. The owner greeted us and served us - untypical for NB restaurant which is a really good sign. Best Mexican in NB, only reason I give this a 4 is that I've only eaten there once and no full bar.
author: Chris H.

description: Don Pistos! Probably the only hybrid mexican fiesta in North Beach. We were pleased with the bench style seating and the cloudy server who gave us a wonderful performance in food serving on an authentic background of mexican art. The food was better than average with a big selection of classic brunch dishes. From snapper tacos to huevos rancheros the food had style. Don`t forget to order the delicius guacomole!
author: The Breakfast-Lunch Club o.

description: Came here on Saturday night.. so crowded and was told there would be a 1.5 hours wait time. Put our name on the list and Surprise! got a call from them only 30 minutes later ! this was a major plus.  We rushed over to dinner and the place had emptied out!.. mind it was close to 8 pm.. after we sat down, the place started to fill up again.  I guess they go through a couple sittings per night.  We were really happy we didn't have to wait another hour =)  the chips/salsa they gave were pretty good.  i like that the chips were hot and freshly fried. the salsa was a tad too spicy for me.  the guac was also spicy but tasted really fresh. we shared a bunch of stuff and i could only comment on what i tried.  the fish taco was pretty large piece of fish... but lacked flavor (i added some guac and it did improve the taste a bit! ) also for two tacos, it was quite expensive.  the pork chop was pretty good !  it had great taste and was very juicy and the portion size was good for sharing.  i opted for the lobster dinner because i thought it wasn't a bad deal .. for $36 you get a whole lobster, flour tortillas, beans and rice.  the lobster must have been poached in butter because it came out kind of oily and crispy, basically had the tail and two claws.. overall 4 big pieces of lobster meat! the flour tortillas were not soft but fried already.. kind of reminded me of chinese green onion pancake.  the rice and beans were standard.. for the price, i thought it was a good deal considering it IS lobster !  overall, the restaurant atmosphere is kind of loud/bar-like atmosphere a lot of shouting going on.  service is pretty good, they refilled our waters multiple times. =) their menu is kind of limited though only 4-5 choice of tacos, a few small plates and a few entrees   the price and limited selection 3 stars but taste of food i say is 3.5 stars.
author: Margie C.

description:
Fantastic and amazing.

Highly recommended. Great drinks and first class food. 

Fun atmosphere and friendly service.
author: Nate W.

description: Ate there last night - I highly recommend the fish tacos! But get there early. It filled up by 7:30 or so (on a rainy Tuesday night, no less)
author: Allison B.

description:
I was *very* impressed with the quality & service at Don Pisto's.  I noticed this cozy little restaurant packed with people dining and decided to go check it out for myself .  While waiting for a table I sat at the bar, ordered Sangria, and was engaged by the friendly bartenders and restaurant owner, Pete.  It was nice to get the scoop on this new restaurant venture, and in doing so, discovered Pete is from a renown family of successful restaurant proprietors in San Francisco.  

It's my new favorite "locals only" restaurant- at least I hope it stays that way!  Then again, a restaurant this fantastic cant be kept a secret for too long . . .

Dress code/environment:   casual
Wait time:   20 minutes max (at bar)
Recommend:   fish tacos & hamburguesa
Why you should chose Don Pisto's for dinner:  

1. the food is flawless & reasonably priced
2. you'll dig it's cozy "urban" interior and good vibes
3. the location is ideal- very close to post-dinner bar crawling
4. the staff is warm & hospitable
author: Suzanne G.

description: This place takes tacos to the next level! Their small menu changes according to what ingredients are seasonal and fresh... like 'fish of the day' fish tacos. The tacos are all delish, but the chorizo and mussels will make you wonder why you'd ever eat anyplace else. Their bottomless homemade chips and salsa and fresh-squeezed oj mimosas are just the tip of the taco:) Forget taquerias, Don Pistos will give any gourmet reataurant a run for its money. Even if you don't love tacos, this place is a must try.
author: Ben G.

description: Nice owner and great food too match. Best tacos in north beach. Guacamole is chunky and fresh and the fresh crunchy chips are super tasty.  The veggie tacos need work though in that they were bland and needed more ingredients.
author: Daniel S.

description: It's close to home sI tried a hard and soft chicken taco - pretty good.  1 taco was enough, so I had lunch the next day.  Love finding cheap food in North Beach! Will go again.
author: Rayna A.

description: This review is long overdue and I just lagged a lot on writing it. I feel bad because this place is SUPER AWESOME!! But that's what laziness does to you I guess. Pete, the owner of the place is born and raised in SF and sure knows how to run the joint. He's really cool when you get to know him. My gf and I have been there only twice and yet everytime he sees us, he automatically offers us Drinks on him no charge! Such a nice guy. So he hooked us up our first time when we went for my gf's 21st bday and that Sangria is AMAZING! If I had to describe their Sangria with a song, then I'd dedicate Bruno Mars' - Just The Way You Are. Anyways, the tacos there are simply delicious! I do agree that the price is a bit high for just two shrimp tacos, but they were so perfectly seasoned and tasted so fresh! I am definitely going to hit this place again when I want that Sangria!
author: Elton N.

description: My favorite restaurant in North Beach! Can be a bit noisy on the weekends, but it's worth it for the delicious margaritas and always perfect tacos. Oh, and the burger--a must try!
author: Sarah J.

description:
recommendation: the burger

been here once and love this place. atmosphere is good. green salsa is good, very limey and so fresh. got the burger and mexican coke. the mexican coke comes with a lime, which i had for the first time. i didn't think mexican coke could be any more delicious, but with a lime squeezed in, it is amazing! almost life-changing how good mexican coke with lime is... anyway, i really love coca cola. the burger is awesome. so juicy, marinated overnight with bacon and unions and served on a toasted torta bun with guacamole. i can't wait to go back and try some other things... good for groups. i think we had about 7 people. we all got the burger and had a great time.
author: Geoff B.

description: Came here pretty late one night - they are randomly open really late for a sit down place, and I think kept the place open for us - and had some great al pastor tacos.  Really hit the spot after a night out, in addition to classing the night up a bit over getting take out burritos in aluminum foil.  I felt very civilized.  I'll be back for first dinner next time.
author: Rebecca S.

description: They don't have much on the menu, but what the do-they do very well.  You better be in a taco mood if you're coming to Don Pistos.  The atmosphere is great and is a great place to eat later at night as well.
author: Daniel T.

description: Love this place!  The service and food are always solid.  Some of the best tortilla soup I have had.  The lobster tacos/burritos are a must for a first timer.  Don't forget to order the guac.
author: Katherine K.

description: FINALLY! Good Mexican food in North Beach! The Alaskan Halibut fish tacos, fresh guac, and homemade chips were amazing! On Sundays they have $2 Mexican beers and $3 Acai sangria. The service was friendly and excellent. They also do take-out and are open until 12:30!
author: Sonya Y.

description:
Great place to go with friends to get Tacos, drinks, chips, etc

There tacos are some of the best I have had and the presentation is fantastic. Their fresh chips are awesome and their salsas are as well. Went here for my birthday last November and all my friends were amazed by the food

Burger is also very very tasty, bordering on amazing. 

If you are looking for fine dining, this isn't the spot. If you are looking for a great mexican style dinner, with very fresh ingredients, good atmosphere, good beer / drinks, this is an awesome place. 

One of those places where if you order right, it can be quite inexpensive or if you go all out, can become a little pricey. Either way, you won't be upset to come here. Does get pretty crowded though, so watch out.
author: Nick B.

description: I do not visit Don Pisto's often but every time I make my way up north I always stop in for some amazing brunch. The Al Pastor was to die for!!
author: Brittany H.

description: I want to keep this place to myself, but I guess the cat is out of the bag.  What can I say the guacamole is great, the fish tacos amazing, and the tortas were perfect.
author: matthew s.

description: Very pleased with both food and service. I had the tilapia with melon, which is more of an appetizer size than a full meal. It's a raw fish, marinated in lime juice. My husband chose the hamburguesa, on the waitress' recommendation, and loved it. The chips and salsa verde, complimentary, were amazing.
author: Jennifer R.

description: Don Pistos is an absolute gem!!! We loved the chips, guac, carne asada torta and al pastor tacos. everything on the menu looks amazing and we can't wait to go back. very reasonably priced as well.
author: Ami D.

description: very good upscale mexican cuisine. their tacos are delicious. i just wish they had flour tortillas as an option! there is always a wait, but its worth it! the margaritas are AMAZING
author: Romina T.

description: El pastor is amazing!! Try the Pushback wine. Red or white, it goes with anything you order!
author: Chuck M.

description: i had the hamburgesa torta and the al pastor tacos 3 nights ago.  the burger was probably one of the top 3 burgers i have had in my life.  ridiculously succulent and juicy niman ranch chuck, marinated overnight with bacons and onions.  the flavor was truly incredible.  al pastor tacos were almost perfect, but i noticed that they put a layer of oil between the two tortillas for the tacos which i dont really like.  also saw it in my fish tacos.  thats really my only complaint.
author: Olivia T.

description:
This place is amazing and fun. Great fresh food, creative menu, excellent service. I've been there three times. I have had the hamburguesa, the al pastor, tacos (both carne asada and fish), ceviche. A friendly atmosphere. Pete is a friendly owner. 

Well worth the drive across town or from points south, east and north.
author: Patrick L.

description: Had dinner here last night, we were able to take over the downstairs room for a birthday party. Under pistos tried the tortilla soup (which was in fact huge) & had a nice flavor to it. The fish tacos and shrimp tacos are both delicious here. Yummy guac with huge chunks of avocado. Also enjoyed one piece of the dessert churro/Mexican donut hole. Deelish. No hard alcohol here but they have a good beer selection and sangria, although it's quite strong so we mixed soda with it. Downstairs the restaurant was really dimly lit in the room we were in, especially toward the back but otherwise liked the place and would return. Prices were reasonable for the quality of the ingredients.
author: Abby W.

description: The only thing that stinks about this place is lack of parking and the long wait...If you can deal with these two things this place is amazing....I'm a huge fan of authentic spicy mexican food and this was the real deal.  Had pork tacos, fish tacos, beef tacos and guacamole, all excellent! Sangria was perfect to wash all of the yummy food down!
author: Jacqueline M.

description: I love Don Pisto's... the lobster (boiled in pork fat) is unbelievable!  Great wine selection and a great vibe too.
author: Richard B.

description: Hands down the best burger I have ever had in my life. I went this weekend with my boyfriend who I frequently visit in SF. We walked in, were immediately seated and given some chips and salsa. The chips were fresh and the salsa was the perfect combination of flavor and spicy.  I ordered the hamburgesa and also had a margarita. The burger, which comes packed with guacamole, was extremely tender. The bun wasnt too heavy and they also give you grilled jalepenos for your burger which might be one of the things that stood out most to me because I love jalepenos on my burger but no place else has ever served it standard with theirs! GO THERE. Its amazing food in a great atmosphere!
author: HotChocolate L.

description: I live about 3 blocks away from this place and learned about it just a few weeks ago.  I've been complaining for a while about not having a good Mexican food place near North Beach and I'm so glad that Don Pisto's is here.  I stopped by to take a look at the menu on my way home after stuffing myself with a huge bag of kettle corn at the movie theaters.  I wasn't hungry but decided to try this place out.  My boyfriend and I ordered the oysters on the half shell and their fish taco (mahi mahi was today's fisn).  OMG, the mahi mahi was the bomb.  It was juicy, tender, well seasoned and melts in your mouth.  If I wasn't so full, I could have at least 2 more of those fish tacos.   I'll definitely be back for the super fresh ingredients and friendly service.
author: s l.

description: It was okay. The al pastor and carnitas tacos were good, but nothing above the ordinary.
author: Ben T.

description: BEST restaurant!!! Live in New York and just got back from SF and ate at Don Pisto's twice in two days!!! The shrimp tacos were amazing and the salsa was awesome! Anyone who has something bad to say is out of their mind. If you are thinking about eating here absolutely go! You will not be disappointed.
author: Nicole P.

description: We dined here for my friends birthday and had a pleasant experience. The chips by itself were tasty but of course paired with the salsa was pure awesomeness. I may have eaten a whole huge bowl of chips and salsa by myself. I ordered the shrimp tacos which were delicious as well.  However, 2 of our friends who ordered bacon cheeseburgers were waiting for a long time. It was disappointing because a lot of us were nearly half way through our meal and they were still waiting. BUT the owner (I'm assuming) came out to let us know that the first batch of burgers were over-cooked and was working on a second batch for them, on the house. Very nice of him. I'd definitely return here again.
author: Maricel B.

description: really good neighbourhood restaraunt, open late. Comfy, not overpriced, clean and great staff.
author: amit s.

description: Probably the best American-style Mexican food I've ever had.  The chef's put a really unique spin on more traditional dishes.  The vibe in this place is young, trendy, and fun.  Food portions aren't huge but what you get is fantastic. The salsa is also amazing!
author: J. R.

description: Don Pisto's is a great neighborhood go-to dinner spot.  The food is awesome.  Prices are really reasonable.  The atmosphere is fun.  Best of all... they are open really late.
author: Fritz S.

description: Fast and friendly service, great Tortilla soup and really good cold oysters. Loud room full of people having fun and the room has got that cool rustic feel with exposed brick and beams. Cool vibe, dark room and loud music complement the small menu of perfectly prepared mexican food.
author: Jaime O.

description: Don Pistos scores well with me because they have great:  Guacamole/ chips, sangria and a trifeca of tacos in each variety! I frequent this place and I can't imagine a bad plate.
author: Lindsay G.

description:
I am not from SF but I came up for the weekend and was trying to find a great Mexican restaurant. I was walking through North Beach and someone said i HAD to go to Don Pisto's... I am so glad I went...the dinner was amazing! I highly recommend the Ceviche De Camarones!!! So good! 

Service was great!
Owner even came over and greeted us!

Can't wait to come back
author: carlie h.

description: Yummy!!  Great for large groups because you can just order a little bit of everything and share.  Drinks are kinda pricey, but the food is delicious!
author: Ben N.

description:
fresh salsa.  warm chips.  friendly service.  brief yet thoughtful menu.  amazing tacos.  acai sangria.  fun yet chill ambience.  in my neighborhood!

new favorite mexican place, without question.  

te quiero don pistos.  :)
author: Kristin K.

description: After seeing  the 9:30 performance of Beach Blanket Babylon, my partner and I were on the hunt for a new restaurant.  We weren't in the mood for the typical touristy  Italian restaurants, so we decided to take a chance on Don Pistos.  We were most pleased!! Actually the experience was very enjoyable.  I had "THE BEST" tortilla soup in a long time, even better then my own!  I'm not a fan of mexican fish dishes, yet the ceviche was incredible.  The fish tacos....awesome!  Even better the service was good.  Sure, it wasn't crowded and I'm sure if it was it may have been slower, but these guys don't mess around.  Keep up the good service!!  Also, it's not your typical taqueria either, Don Pistos has a nice mature dining experience!!  We are going back.....more soup..pleezzz!!!
author: David C.

description: Excellent restaurant, definitely lived up to all of the hype! The environment is fun and mellow, and the staff is both friendly and helpful. As a vegan it can be hard to order off a menu and our waiter was very accomodating and my meal was excellent.
author: Caity S.

description:
I really liked this spot - great spicy Mexican food.  I loved the Carne Asada tacos and the Sangria was AWESOME.  Probably the best Sangria I've had.  

The food was a sort of gormet though - I typically like very simple straight forward Mexican food, but I liked the twist they put on it.  It probably more authentic then what usually have anyway.  

Overall very solid spot - I hope the serve flan soon!!
author: Richard C.

description: I've been searching farther and wider for highly rated burgers and one of the hurdles is that so many of the highly rated burgers come from restaurants that are open only for dinner, damn that's such a pity.  But we work with what we got rather than 'fight City Hall' or climb the unclimbable hill.
