So I just got in under the wire because lunch ends at 3:00 which is liberal by so many rigorously enforced rules of the 'in spots' which mostly don't stay 'in' for long because of attitudes like that.  Don Pisto's is on Union apt at Grant so depending on how you get here it's a hike up a hill.  So it's very much like a South of the border Cafe wit decor based on the bones of an old brick building with great use of color and simple furniture, lighting and a tiny kitchen.  I ordered the 'hamburgeisa' and shortly out came a white oval china platter with an open face burger on a beautiful grilled or toasted sour dough roll.  The meat was swathed in a delicious house made guacamole, and the platter was co-inhabited by a lime wedge, a couple pieces of radish and a fire roasted chile pepper.  My first bite was spiritual with the crunch of the roll, the shooting juices of perfectly cooked meat and the flavor of unseen bacon.  The meat was excellent quality and cooked to perfection, and that toasted bun may be the best I've ever tasted.  They don't serve fries, rings or other standard accompaniments, but they did offer some tasty chips and housemade Salsa.  After finishing I visited the rest room downstairs and ran across a large room with several huge 'family' tables and a prep kitchen with about half a dozen cooks furiously getting ready for the crush to come that evening.  This is a very cool place for a most unusual and extremely good burger.
author: Stu S.

description: Get the shrimp ceviche!  It's light, flavorful, and authentic -- at least by Ecuador ceviche standards.  Yum, yum, yum.  My friend and I tried 4 dishes, all excellent.  For those with a low spice tolerance, definitely ask the waiter what is spicy and what is not.  Two of the 4 dishes we had were a little too spicy for me.  This included the salsa, which was delicious, but I had to stop eating after 5-6 bites.  I wished for a non-spicy salsa option, but then again, those that eat Mexican on a regular basis can probably handle the heat.
author: Beth S.

description:
Don I'm so happy you have decided to settle into the neighborhood.  Yummy.  Simple and straight forward menu.  If you know you are good at something no need to confuse the situation.  Excellent salsa.  I love love their beans.  Super tasty and you would never in a million years know they are vegetarian.  I swear it tastes like there is bacon in there!  A very nice selection and very reasonable.  The carne asada tacos are excellent.  Ceviche very good.  I want to try the hanberguesa next time.  Plus they are open late.  You really can't go wrong.  Since New Years I've been in four times.  Yes Don I like you ... a lot.
Service has always been awesome!!
author: Allison M.

description: This place has a pretty cool vibe to it.. I came here on Saturday afternoon for a late brunch, and it was pretty much what I was hoping for.  The wait was a bit long, but they're nice enough to take down your number and call you when your table's ready, so my friend and I just walked the block to Washington Square Park and enjoyed the sun.  We picked up mini cupcakes on the way and had a reverse meal, where we ate dessert first.  My friend had been raving about the guacamole here which really was good.  We got the Huevos Rancheros and the Mushroom & Serrano Chile Omelette, and neither of us could decide which we liked more.  I definitely liked the fact that Serrano Chillies were used.. mm.. it had a really good kick to it.  I didn't care much for the potatoes on the side, but the dishes themselves were really good.  I'd definitely return.  My friend actually went two Saturdays in a row because she liked it so much!
author: Rachana S.

description: Late dinner here. Excitied to have ceviche de camaron and a fish taco. A bit over priced but the service was very good as were the chips and green salsa.  Our food arrived hot and the waiters were very attentive. I would recommend to others as a introduction to mexican street food. The ambient is upscale in comparison to other mexican street style restaurants and the ingredients are fresh.
author: Erica G.

description: I went here for the first time two days ago on the recommendation of a bartender in North Beach: he was raving about it as well as others in that bar.  The space is very attractive and the prices are good, especially considering the quality and portion size.  Chips and salsa were the best!  The menu somewhat limited, but that probably lends to the freshness.  The wine list isn't on the cheap side, but what I had was exceptional and the pour was substantial.  On the street afterward I ran into a North Beach resident who also raved about Don Pistos.  I would call this place near-gourmet and will be returning soon.
author: Dave S.

description:
Hands down the best Mexican restaurant in North Beach and even the surrounding area (financial district, russian hill, nob hill etc.).

The chips and salsa are addicting. The selection of Mexican drinks (both Mexican beer and colas) are a nice plus, but no liquor license.  The place is reasonably priced (especially compared to the previous expensive steakhouse that used to occupy the property).

The tacos, tortas, ceviche and basically everything I have tried has been fantastic.  Two words: lengua tacos (although they seem to be only available occasionally).  Then again, I am a huge fan on lengua tacos in general.

There is also a suprisingly big room downstairs that you probably could rent out for an event.  I didn't even notice it till my third or fourth time there when I had to use the restroom.
author: Greg W.

description:
This is the kind of place you always hope you stumble upon...and we did.
Thanks to Yelp, we took a shot in the dark and after searching through listing upon listing decided this place sounded best and it DID NOT DISAPPOINT.

I guess food is the most important, right? And yeah...it was GREAT. I had fish tacos and my gf had the steak. Both were amazing..fresh, delicate and delicious. We ordered a side of rice based on the reviews and, though I find it strange that rice could be worth writing about...it entirely is! 

However, more important than the food is the LATE hours, the GREAT prices on beer and lastly (but most def not least) wonderful chips and salsa!!  WOW! Now we're talkin! Not to mention a refreshing playlist on the speakers...I'm sold!

The owner clearly takes a lot of pride in the food and experience here and it shows.
author: J M.

description: Above average Mexican food served in a room that has ventilation problems. Host was rude.
author: jeff k.

description: Great tuna cebiche, not traditional, but extremely tasty. Most impressed by the friendly table service for a taqueria. Doesn't try to do too much, but what it does is terrific.
author: Daniel S.

description: Simply AMAZING! I have always loved going here- delish food and wonderful service. Make sure to plan ahead for a bit of a line. Enjoy :)
author: Marie G.

description: No doubt this is my favorite Mexican spot in sf. Just my style; meaty, spicy, salty.  It's hard to pick a favorite since each item is so on point. Ceviches, Tacos, entrees, all bomb. It's not a usual menu item, but be sure to ask about the boiled chicken tostados. Defenitly one of the most delicious things I have ever eaten. I'm not exaggerating. I liked it that much. I never do Mexican in the mission anymore.  Don Pisto's, Im so hooked!
author: Tim R.

description: It's loud, cramped and dark...in other words, too hip for an old fogey like me. But I would happily brave the loud, dark cramped-ness for their pork chop. It's that good.
author: Jenny P.

description:
Best carnitas I have ever had!
Everything on the menu is good, but you can't go wrong with the carnitas.
author: Brian Y.

description: Tried it for first time last night and was really yummy tapas style dinner!  Sangria was very good too.  The Scottish Salmon sashi app was great, had the unlikely toppings of cilantro and small hot peppers but was great.  Pescado tacos were really good, better than carne asada which was still good-lots of steak!  Oysters were also good.  All the food was really good, cool vibe, good for groups...a little pricey but will def go back!
author: Jess R.

description: Excellent food, unbelievably friendly staff, fun ambiance.  Lively, dim lighting, date spot, great mix of people.
author: Georgianna G.

description: Could not help to come bask to Don Pisto's. The line was supposed to be long again but we compromised and took a table in a basement area - so the entourage was not glamorous at all... But the food... the food was amazing! The pork surprised with a consistency of its exquisite taste the second time in a row. I believe that this was the best meat I have ever had. Service people  were friendly and I truly enjoyed the casualty of the place. Just love it.
author: Marina N.

description: Excellent food and service!  The atmosphere was great, although the music was a little loud for my taste.  Warm chips and spicy salsa were great.  Would definitely go back again!
author: Sheri C.

description: Been twice now and both times were consistently great. Love the intimate atmosphere...verde salsa is the best I've ever had; ceviche and carne asada torta...delicious!!
author: Randy S.

description:
loved tortilla soup

yum sangria

god, gotta have the soup again

very generous with the chips/salsa

Thumbs up.
author: S. H.

description: The tacos are great and I know it is a Mexican Restaurant but try the burger!!
author: J B.

description: I am giving 5 stars because the whole experience was excellent. First, the waitstaff, they really know customer service and they really know food! We were given excellent timely service and she really knew the menu. Now the menu, it's not a ridiculously large menu of items but I liked that! I felt like I was in a hidden restaurant nobody knew about when we first got there but then, it was PACKED! Food was great, killer tomatillo salsa. Had the Muchaca and though I was told it was not like most Muchaca, it was really good. We also had lobster "cooked in pork fat", it was good but I guess I still really don't care much about lobster. They warned our crowd of 6 that our meals were likely to come out at different times due to the tiny kitchen, we were good with that and as it turns out, it was very little difference. Ambiance was excellent, loved the music was ultra hip and a little loud, something I like! Don't look for the sign outside, there isn't one. Smell and listen and you just might find it!
author: Micaella M.

description:
I don't care how great the food is if I have to listen to blaring techno music that is so loud I can't talk.

The food is really great, though.  The fish tacos are perfect; the fish is not over-seasoned and is cooked so it's tender and flaky and it tastes like fish!  Fresh, wonderful fish.  It also had some other stuff on it, I don't remember.  Every component component of the taco meets my ideals.

The side of beans is wonderful - only $3, and a nice addition to the meal.  You can actually taste the beans!  They taste like beans!  I love food that tastes like itself, not drenched with salt and fake chemicals.

The tortilla chips were good too, not oversalted like everywhere else.

HOWEVER, we also got the tortilla soup - it was so over-salted it was not edible.  Big disappointment!

The room is BEAUTIFUL!  It would be such a pleasant place to eat if they didn't have horrible dance-music assaulting you.  It's an old building, super clean, reminds me of New York City restaurants, with exposed brick walls.  Very classy.  What a shame about the music.
author: james b.

description: I took a group of 13 on cinci de mayo. The table was waiting for us ( albeit in. A mediocre location, but it was a busy night.) and the service was excellent. We even used 6 credit cards to pay the bill. The food was quick, tasy, and affordable. To top it all off they had a superb mariachi band. (and I typically hate mariachi bands.) I don't think of Mexican in north beach but it was superb.
author: Eric K.

description: This is some delicious, very fresh food. Menu is constantly changing so there's something new to try every time, but the staples are great; The Al Pastor tacos are now my favorite taco ever. Pisto's is hospitable, efficient, and delectable! True brilliance!!
author: Erin F.

description: I'm making a yelp account and posting my very first review just to advise people not to go here. That's how terrible my experience was at Don Pistos. Two friends and I went on Friday night expecting delicious food and service because of the reviews, but we were completely disappointed and not full at all as we walked out. It is very Americanized Mexican food and the menu is extremely limited. There were no vegetarian options on the menu for my friend either. I ordered fish tacos and two came out for $11. They were way too spicy and I say this as an Indian who is used to plenty of spice. The sauce was overpowering and I couldn't taste any of the other flavors. The chips served in the beginning were better than the tacos. Don't go here if you're expecting anything even close to authentic Mexican food.
author: Sim B.

description: I recently held a bridal shower in the downstairs room at Don Pistos and it was a huge success. Everyone loved the food (Huevos Rancheros, Brioche French Toast, Carnitas Tacos and the Hamburguesa). The Sangria was also a hit. Don Pistos was great to work with, accommodated my requests and overall made it a great experience. I highly recommend it for any event and will return time and time again (party or no party) because the food is so delicious and affordable! Well done, Don Pistos!
author: Melissa I.

description: Make reservations early and often!  Great food, cool decor, awesome night out! My favorite is the lobster burrito for 2.
author: Brandon M.

description: I used Don Pistos to cater a party I had last week.  I ordered beef and chicken tacos and they were AMAZING!   Everyone raved about them all night.  Pete was very helpful with ideas about how to set it up and even pitched in rice and beans which were also very tasty.  He also delivered it all free of charge and even made  a follow up call the next day to find out how it went.  I can't wait to eat at the restaurant soon and try out the other food!
author: Geno B.

description: Great.  Carnitas Torta was awesome.  Service was friendly and unpretentious.  Highly recommend.
author: Marcus C.

description: This place is great. The guacamole is excellent. Everything on the menu is screamin'.
author: Opie D.

description: Amazing cozy find that has limited vegetarian options in the menu HOWEVER the owner/shef created  some amazing tasting dishes.  Their unique salsa is a must try with a micheloda.  Excellent service where 30% tip didn't seen enough.
author: Ticker M.

description: I'm sad to say that this place has gone downhill. They moved their machaca onto their "specials" menu so it's not always available. The restaurant became super popular and now the wait can be over an hour and a half. The quality of the food has really suffered. The machaca is still okay, but it's forgettable. The chicken soup has become so spicy I can't eat it. I went with a group of 3 other friends, we all ordered different things, and no one was really happy. It's the end of a very short era, but the reign of Don Pisto's is over.
author: Katie M.

description: Unbelievably good.   This is my new favorite neighborhood spot.  Have been getting the carnitas tacos, which are perfect.  Last night I had the ceviche for the fist time, sublime.  But the piece de resistance was the carne asada tacos.  Some of the best, juiciest, steak I have ever eaten.  As far as North beach dining goes, Don Pisto's is a game-changer.
author: Jesse H.

description: Excellent addition to the neighborhood in a space that up until now has seen little success.  Don Pistos take on mexican street food may finally break that trend.  The menu is small, but everything we have tried so far has been delicious.  Last night we had tacos to go, two carnitas and two camerones.  Shortly after returning home there was nary a tortilla crumb left.  Fresh chips and a delicious salsa verde came on the side.  We plan on going back soon to try the hamburger torta with bacon and avocado.
author: franklin p.

description: Live next door , I finally gave in to the hype and tried it. OVERRATED ! What is with you yuppies ? Overpriced and overrated. Pure yuppie hype ! Don't waste your time or money !
author: John D.

description: This place was packed on a Tuesday night and they don't even have the name on the outside of the building. I had the Hamburguesa because that's what I have heard about the most and I was not disappointed. A very simple yet excellent burger.  I also sampled at least half the menu and was satisfied with everything I tried. The server's where very good and prompt with our service.  Kind of loud and tight but otherwise a very good experience.
author: nader d.

description: Words can not express how amazing the whole experience is. The young owner who is always there working his ass off provides such great service with a smile and if your lucky enough and come late enough, he'll sit down and have a Michelada or a Negro Modelo with you. The baja style influence comes through in the salsa. I personally am a huge fan of his tacos and seasonally changing ceviche. The tuna con mango is as simple and clean as it gets. No gimmicks with this place. What you order is what you'll receive. I used to work in the neighborhood for days and I remember when the owner was soliciting one of the bars I worked at. He would bring us what's up and coming on his menu and every tender was so surprised at the taste and the quality. North Beach is a tough place to crack for a new food business, but this gentleman surprised every local and tantalized them with his sweet tuna and tasty salsa. I encourage you to go check this place out. It has been a staple of mine for the past year and a half. Unfortunately I don't work in North Beach anymore, but I'm making an hour long treck from Upper Haight to NB on Sunday morning just to have brunch. Enjoy your tacos!
author: monika l.

description: very snappy and fresh, good value as well.  yum i'll be back
author: pochini m.

description:
I found out about Don Pistos through reading my daily Urban Daddy and couldn't wait to try it out. This restaurant went above and beyond my expectations! The food, atmoshere, drinks, and friendly service made our experience close to perfect. 

We had their yummy Sangria...very refreshing! I think they put some sort of mexican soda on top so it's slightly carbonated. The salsa and housemade chips were delicious....the salsa was super fresh and quite tasty.  We shared an order of guacomole, shrimp tacos, and fish tacos. The shrimp tacos were a bit spicy....but full of flavor! I love spicy food....so I can't complain. Not only was the food delicious but its reasonably priced. 

The service was very attentive but not overbearing...waters were always full and the server never let my Sangria glass become empty without asking if I wanted another. 

The atmoshere is cozy and casual which is perfect for the neighborhood feel. I can't wait to go back! 

It's a little off the beaten path so it's somewhat hard to find but well worth it once you do!
author: A. K.

description: What an amazing find!!!  We were visiting from San Diego and wanted yummy mexican food after a night of drinking...who doesn't, right?  There was no sign above the door, just the address, so walked in and found a super cool vibe.  Had the poached eggs with chorizo and potatoes and carnitas tacos....simple and so good!!!  Definitely will come back here again.
author: R. R.

description: The salsa was fresh, electric, unique, delicious.  It seems to be a tomatillo/lime mix that's fabulous.  The tortilla soup is not to be missed. Pitcher of maragaritas were fresh and tasty.  Their margaritas are delicious and have a ton of character.  Glad we got there early at 545 and missed the Friday evening rush.  When you order tacos, you get 2 and a radish.  If you have a big appetite, eat lots of chips, order the amazing tortilla soup, and possibly plan to get more than one round of tacos-- hopefully trading with other people at the table to try different kinds.  Shrimp tacos were also great.
author: Unoti L.

description: This place was great. I made reservations for 8 of us, after 6 arrived they seated us about 5 minutes after our reservation (great service to me). The food was fabulous, service was great, and the venue was perfect. I would highly recommend this place for atmosphere, service, and food.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Delicious, fresh food, the restaurant is always packed, very fast service, friendly and welcoming, great bartender.  A little confusing have six different servers, but probably why it's such fast service.  Great ambiance for a fun night out!
author: Lara M.

description: The restaurant isn't too hard to find if you look for the red lights above the door. Very popular spot. We didn't have to wait too long for a table and the service was great. The guacamole is almost to die for. I'm normally not a big guacamole fan, but it was absolutely delicious. I ordered the carne asada tacos and though the servings are small, still worth every penny. The carne asada was perfect, it wasn't too dry and cooked medium rare (which is how I normally like it cooked).
author: Sabrina L.

description: Pretty good and "authentic" Mexican food, but portions are way too small for the cost.  Ceviche of tombo tuna was about five man-sized bites, just not enough fish for $15 or so......most of the plate was taken up by the chips.  Tacos de carne asada equally tasty, not outrageous to die for or anything, enjoyable but overpriced.  This place is kind of good for the upscale-esque young gringo or gringa with disposable $$$ to spend, who really don't know Mexican food very well or care enough to find out.......  I mean it was a good meal and all, just not that complex or interesting enough to merit the price.  Kind of a Marina-like scene on a Saturday night, ie hardly any non-Anglos inside, mostly kind of a bland post-college crowd but cool enough decor, vibe etc.....  I hate to sound like a know-it-all, but I have spent enough time all over Mexico eating better or equally as  well for about a third of the price to rave about Don Pisto........good addition to the neighborhood though, and if the owner has found a low-cost way to make oodles of money serving good not great comida mexicana, more power to him!
author: Michael G.

description: This place is fantastic. Was in town on vacation and stopped by based on the menu. Sat at the bar with the super-friendly bartender. Had the fish tacos, husband had the burger, both were delicious. Chips and salsa are great as well. Would highly recommend, though the place is small, so make a reservation.
author: K H.

description: Excellent, excellent, excellent from the sangria to the guacamole & chips to the entree. We came in a large party for bruch and probably ordered one of everything on the menu. EVERYTHING and EVERYONE was totally pleased.  Authentic mexican food done with class. The only problem was that one of our party ordered the chorizo & poached eggs and it took so long that our entire party was finished by the time he got his food. We asked a few times for the dish but was told that the chorizo needed to be seared twice or cooked longer, not sure what was going on but figured they forgot. Even after asking, it took way too long.  So if the chef is reading this, please start this dish early in the line or have the waiters warn the guest that the dish takes longer than normal. It was still worth 5 stars!
author: P G.

description: AMAZING TACOS! AMAZING MARGARITAS! AMAZING SANGRIA! AMAZING CEVICHE! AMAZING CHIPS & SALSA! AMAZING CORN! What more can I say? You really can't go wrong here!
author: Kristine D.

description: pretty decent mexican food.  our waitress was super cool dealing with a party of like 15 (maybe more).  she kept our drinks coming and the food was good.  i will definitely be back here again.  get the tacos.  i also had the oysters...very tasty.
author: Hammer Time H.

description: Great date spot! Shared some oysters to start which paired perfectly with their sangria. Had the fish and carne asada tacos and were both pretty good. Can't wait to go back!
author: Rebecca H.

description: We came here on New Year's day to get a much needed post NYE's meal.  Don Pisto's was having their Jan 1 Pajama Party with $5 specials for everything on their brunch menu.  The ambiance was festive.  The food was delicious.  We ordered their lobster special, broiled whole in garlic, chipolte sauce, topped with a squeeze of fresh lime.  It was delicious, and our entire tab came out to $20.  I'm a fan.
author: Tiffany L.

description: There is definitely something intriguing about this place. It could be the brick walls or maybe just the simple smiles on all the patrons faces? i think it might be the three red lights that are seen all the way from Columbus street. A small menu, a small wine list, a small restaurant and it all comes together like a cork in a bottle. The noise factor was medium! a good place for a date. The chef owner was onsite and friendly. You should go!!
author: andrew w.

description: Great restaurant with delicious food at a great price. This place has a nice, casual and relaxed environment.  The bite sized churros with chocolate drizzled on them were super yummy and the carnitas tacos were my favorite!!!  Very friendly wait staff and prompt service!! And there's a parking lot in the alley across the street from this place.
author: fatin d.

description: Had a birthday dinner here of about 12 people - amazing food and great atmosphere.  We could barely move after eating so many of the great dishes, all the chips and guac, and oversized coronas.  Definitely worth experiencing for yourself.
author: K B.

description: What a find! The menu is on the small side, but absolutely wonderful. The Margareta's are made with blood oranges, lemon, and agave - so smooth. The chips, salsa, and guacamole are fantastic. We had shrimp tacos and ordered the tortilla soup - all yummy. Owner said he got his menu together when we was in Rosarita. The next time I'm in SF I will certainly go to Don Pisto's!
author: ann T.

description: all that bumping, all that shoulder-shifting bumping hassle for this food that is just fine.
author: Fzarond K.

description: Holy tacos, this place rocks. The food is amazing, the staff are super nice and helpful and clearly love the restaurant too. EVERYTHING was delicious: tortilla soup, ceviche, tacos, even the rice and beans were phenomenal. Just really fresh, tasty, reasonably-priced Mexican food. Go go go go there as soon as you possibly can. Fingers crossed that they throw in a weekend brunch  menu and bring the churros back.
author: Boomer G.

description: I lived in Mexico for a year and I think the food at Don Pistos is as authentic as it gets and ranks up there for some of the best Mexican food you can get anywhere. The young chefs know what they're doing and take Mexican cuisine to new heights.
author: Bill S.

description: The thing I miss the most after 2 years of living in North Beach is quality Mexican food. I don't consider Taqueria San Jose #3 or another one on Columbus whose name escapes me right now as "quality" -oversalted meat, bad salsa, and so on. So when a Thrillist newsletter dropped into my inbox and announced that Dos Pistos was open for business, I was very, very curious. Last night I had a hankering for some Mexican deliciousness after a couple of beers at Church Key, and remembered that Dos Pistos was a block away _and_ open until 12:30 am - perfect. Melanie N. and I walked over and were promptly seated. Oh, did I mention that it's a sit-down type of Mexican place? And with a very nice ambiance too? The waiter offered us menus that featured tacos, tortas, ceviches, and a couple of bigger items. While we deliberated over which taco to get, they brought us chips with tomatillo salsa, and the salsa was phenomenal -spicy, yet flavorful, with perfect consistency. I honestly can't think of a place with a better green salsa. I chose carnitas tacos and Melanie got chicken ones. The order arrived pretty quickly, and after the first bite I decided that this place deserved 5 stars, because everything was great, and nothing was wrong (including the price). That's pretty much the end of the story. I'm happy to have Dos Pistos in the neighborhood and I wish them well.
author: Andrei Z.

description: I had such a great experience at Don Pisto's.  The food was incredible, the atmosphere was hip, comfortable and fun.  The food alone could carry the new little restaurant, but everything from the service to the menu and price were amazing.  This just may be my new hangout.  (And the sangria was to die for.)
author: stephanie t.

description: Awesome fish and shrimp tacos. I love the lobster burrito and the classic Hamburguesa. Great lime salsa that I always end up eating way too much of. Everything they have is delicious but I would come here just to have a couple drinks as well. Fun, loud place to grab a couple beers or sangria with friends. Awesome brunch with bottomless sangria, margaritas and mimosas. I eat here on a weekly basis.
author: Mike W.

description: Brunch here is amazing, drinks are always on point, but nothing in my book compares with The Machaca (experience). Caution: only order the Machaca if you're prepared to grow ample amounts of chest hair, as the Machaca may be the manliest dish in all of San Francisco. Remember this you gleefully lick your stained fingers, and let out a deep, hearty laugh that shakes all of North Beach.
author: Alex R.

description: Went for lunch. Had the fish tacos. Very pleased. Will certainly be back. WIll certainly recommend the place to friends.
author: Molly S.

description: Super cool place. Brick walls, open space, great vibe and crowd. The chips/salsa are as good as advertised. Margarita is smooth, sweet, refreshing. Had the shrimp and al pastor tacos. Both were very good but shrimp is better. Also had the chorizo and mussels which was excellent. Owner Pete is down to earth, really cares about his food and his customers. Prices are reasonable and portions are solid. I'm from L.A. so am used to good Mexican, and this is definitely up there. Only wish the menu was a little more extensive. Very satisfied, 4.5 stars. Need to try a few more things to bump it up to 5.
author: Bolicious K.

description: I was in town for the weekend, only my second time in San Francisco, and you know the food is good if you eat at the same place two out of four nights.  My group shared the carnitas, tacos al Pastor, and lobster.  The flavors throughout all the items--including the salsa/beans/etc.--was the cleanest and freshest I've had with this type of cuisine.  Not only was the food good, but the service was great as well.  Numerous people stopped by our table--picking up food, dropping off food, filling drinks, the owner saying hello.  All of that shows me that this place will be here to stay--hopefully!  I'd like to make a return trip when I'm back out again next year.
author: Madison D.

description: Brunch is good - burger was awesome, as was the chorizo & poached eggs. Friendly staff & delicious food.
author: Colm R.

description: I live on Telegraph Hill/north beach and this is by far the best restaurant in the neighborhood! My boyfriend and I come here once a week. Amazing food, great service and very affordable. I order the Vegetarian Platter and it is amazing.   Highly recommend.
author: Jennifer C.

description: The place is quaint and full of great service! The Sangria is the best I ever had, wish i could get the recipe longing for it right now, maybe will stop by at cocktail hour and get a pitcher!  The menu is small but very tasty and the service is just great! seemed like a family business.
author: linda A.

description: My friends took me here for my bday dinner, and we had a terrific time!  The waiters were fantastic and even brought us an amazing dessert that wasn't even on the menu!  The cerviche, shrimp tacos, sangria and wine were excellent.  We will definitely come back!
author: Michelle G.

description: Came here for dinner with a date and had the fish tacos and sangria. Both were delish! The only problem was the acoustics in the room are terrible. I couldn't hear a word my date was saying the whole night. So if you want to take a first date here, be warned you might miss some key deets about him/her!
author: Lori E.

description: I recently met up with a friend at Don Pisto's for dinner one Wednesday.  The wait time was minimal and probably would've been even shorter if there hadn't been a table reserved for a large group.  The service was good - drinks were quickly refilled and the food was out before we'd finished our first acai sangria.  And I've been craving the sangria ever since.  It's refreshing and tasty and we should've just gotten a pitcher to start with.  The complimentary chips and salsa were addictive.  For dinner, I ordered the fish tacos (red snapper that day) and they were delicious.  Great neighborhood spot.
author: Sally S.

description: my favorite sit-down modern-mexican cuisine in san fran.  i've taken two  groups there with everyone walking out happy and saying they'd go back.
author: Victory V.

description: They don't take reservations for small parties, and we were willing to wait for a table, but the unwelcome atmosphere eventually drove us out. The only place to wait is a crowded area near the bar. After almost an hour, a couple of the very drunk bar customers left, and I attempted to sit in one of the vacated seats at the bar. The bartender asked me to leave because he claimed that the seats at the bar were for customers who planned to eat. Then he seated two young women who seemed to have come out of no where. These women certainly weren't in the crowded entryway full of those of us on the wait list for a table. The option of sitting at the bar to eat was never offered to us. We finally got a table, but at that point, when no server showed up, we decided to leave. The hostess asked us if there was a problem. I told her we were offended by the bartender turning us away and their "system" for seating, and her comment was, "Well I got you a table didn't I?" as if she had done us a grand favor rather than her job. It appears that this place is only for those who know the bartender or are willing to forgo hospitality.
author: Patricia H.

description: A little pricy, but the food was really delicious. Do not miss their sangria.
author: Thomas K.

description: I LOVED this place, my friend took us here after work one day and it was an AMAZING PLACE! The food here is completely AWESOME, it tastes so fresh and is good quality. The chips are delicious, along with the salsa and ceviche!! I was trying to take the salsa home  it was so good. The maragarita's here are soo good! The wait staff is so helpful and the owner is so friendly, this place is amazing and food is downright delicious. This will not be my last visit, seriously though, get a Margarita, ceviche and tacos!!! This place is great!!
author: Gustavo T.

description: Made it thru half the menu and everything is amazing. Biggest risk here is overeating.
author: L S.

description: Great place for good, quality food. Everything tastes so fresh and the service is outstanding. Let's just say...I ate a whole bowl of chips on my own and you will not judge me after you've tried them with the salsa. I plan on making this my summer home!
author: Melissa S.

description: I love this new, Mexican spot that opened in my neighborhood.  Thank god a reprieve from all the bad Italian restaurants nearby.  The tacos are delicious, but the dark horse is the hamburguesa (sp?).  This is one of the most flavorful hamburgers I have ever eaten.  Very bare bones, but an explosion of flavor I'll never forget.  I believe $2 beers on Sundays too.  It's also pretty kid friendly, but not overrun with kids and families.
author: McKenzie W.

description: The chips and fresh tomatillo salsa are delicious!  If you are a fan of guacamole then you MUST order it! The portions are small but flavorful and delicious.  I have had the shrimp tacos and fish tacos and both were delicious.  The staff are helpful and not pushy, and our waiter even called a cab for us!
author: Laura K.

description: Great food. Their approach to Mexican food is fresh, unique, and well worth the visit.  I highly recommend this establishment.  Newbies keep in mind; no outside branding of this restaurant is visible from the street.  You either know about it or you don't.
author: clay m.

description: For starters, the best chips & salsa ever!  I love the menu here, it is short, sweet, original AND affordable!  The service was amazing and the staff was super friendly.  I had a great experience all around & look forward to trying the Sunday brunch.  I am so glad that North Beach finally  has a delicious Mexican Restaurant that isn't of "bar food" quality.  Yay for Don Pistos!
author: Cryssy R.

description: Great food, great service, and great ambiance.  Will definitely visit this place again.  All I can say is that this is a fabulous addition to the neighborhood!!!!
author: c t.

description: My husband and I had a great experience with a soon-to-be officially opened Mexican Restaurant in No. Beach (Don Pistos).  The owner of this restaurant, Pete,  opened briefly one evening as we were passing by - and we enjoyed the restaurant's delish fish tacos and  terrific hospitality.  The restaurant is so warm and friendly looking and sooooooooo San Francisco.  We love the North Beach area and this restaurant is in a perfect location (not right in the hub bub, but close enough to walk off a meal afterwards).  We immediately thought of a celebration we want to have there with good friends, who like us, just love Mexican food.  We were told the restaurant would not actually be opened until about mid-December, '09 as he wants to make it just what we're all looking for in a Mexican restaurant (like the idea that it adds variety to No. Beach as there aren't many Mexican restaurants in the area).  Since our celebration is late December it will work out perfect for us - however, we'll keep checking to see its grand opening date and suggest others do as well as it's definitely worth waiting for!
author: JJ L.

description: this place is always ridiculously good -- and affordable.  by the far the best mexican food in the city -- in a high quality, home-cooked way that makes mexican food better than what people often think of.  the drinks are good too, and not too pricey.  this is the type of place you can go to all the time.  the menu might appear short, but since each item is delicious it really isn't.  and they do add things regularly.
author: Anne N.
